Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: citurnberry
Reviews.Content: I must say the staff was wonderful! Our opinion is based on staying on the Prestige level, which is a bit more than the regular rooms throughout the hotel. It's the best deal in town with the complimentary ammentities in the private area for Prestige only guests. Our server during our stay was Michelle who was fabulous! We had the experience in the Venetian several years ago, before the Palazzo was built. I prefered the Venetian's smaller more intimate lounge area than the larger, louder one of the Palazzo. Also, the decor at the Venetian was more appealing to me as well since I am not a big fan of the art deco retro style of the Palazzo. Overall, it was a very nice time spent with friends especially at the complimentary lounge with the all you can drink cocktails and appetizers!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo for business...and pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: CarmellaOhio
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 nights/5 days for business and we had a choice of the Venetian or Palazzo. I chose Palazzo simply because it is newer. It was an excellent hotel. I have been to Vegas many times and this was my first time staying here. The bella suites are large-750 square feet. I had 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. The sunken living room area was pretty and nice for relaxing or working. The only downside was the AC fan which clicked on and off throughout the night (I prefer to have the fan run constant). The pool areas were beautiful...but get there early for a good chair. The main pool area is shaded until around 12:30 when the sun finally peeks over the building. Solara restaurant at the pool was really good...great service...but also very busy. I will definitely stay here on my next pleasure trip to Vegas! The casino was great. Lots of variety in slots and tables and plenty of beverage servers around!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: I was here for six days while attending a conference. The suites are spacious and comfortable. I'm not a gambler and didn't feel as though the facility was in your face with slots and drunks.

Reviews.Title: “I almost loved it”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and her sister and her husband stayed at Palazzo for almost a week during spring break. We loved almost all of it, including the rooms, the staff, and the location. So what did we not like? Not exclusive to this property, we absolutely hate the idea of the "resort fee." Since it was March and too cold for the pool, and we didn't use the exercise room or the spa, we were paying $20 a day extra for a newspaper, internet access and a couple of small discounts. One of the offers was for a free cup of coffee, not every day but once, that was smaller than the coffee their Cafe Presse sold! Tacky at best. Their casino is on the smaller side, and the drink service on the floor was very limited. The other complaint was the price of wine, both in their shops and in their casino bars. $13.00 for a glass of wine that didn't cost that much for a bottle was a lesson I learned the first night. A bottle of wine in their gift shop, also one of questionable quality was $28.00, in other words restaurant prices. Wow! Now the good news: We loved our room, housekeeping was extremely efficient, and they came by at almost exactly the same time each day, making it very easy to plan around them. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was a nice, big suite. This was not the luxury suite, just the basic one. We had no unpleasant, unfriendly staff members, in fact they were just the opposite. I would have gladly given them the top rating if it were not for petty annoyances, something you really don't expect from a property that's positioning themselves as being a top tier resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for first time Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: NJgirl1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in Vegas for a work conference as it was located in the Sands Expo attached to the Palazzo and Venetian. Overall, I think this place was a great place to stay and experience all Vegas had to offer. The rooms were nice...not over the top beautiful but nice and very spacious. There was a plethora of restaurants to choose from and I loved walking around the shops and restaurants as the gondola passed by. We did not have a bad meal while here and I thought the service we received throughout was wonderful. Overall for the price, I think its a great place to stay if you're new to Vegas as it has so much to offer under one roof. For our work trip, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for a day or two”
Reviews.Author: pathfinderNj
Reviews.Content: I write this as a non-gambler visiting for less than two days while my husband was there on business . It's not our usual kind of place at all, but I found it surprisingly fun. The suites were among the most elegant and comfortable that we've ever experienced, and we were amazed at how good the restaurants were. Check-in and service were uniformly friendly and efficient. I like the way it connects to the Venetian because I loved the Italian ambiance in the sister hotel. My only major complaint would be the noise level. With loud piped-in music everywhere, and of course the casino noise, it seemed impossible to find a quiet corner or to eat a peaceful meal. But that just may be Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere, anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ricedish
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to the Palazzo as I was attending a conference there. What a disappointment. The staff there are just unpleasant and unfriendly. It's as if they don't really want you there at all. The rooms are large, and I had a really nice view of the Wynn. For some reason though, the Internet was a huge problem and kept dropping out every few seconds. That was incredibly frustrating. They can't stop piping Phantom of the Opera through every public space. I get it, you're showing Phantom. I liked Phantom when I entered the Palazzo and checked out hating it. Overall, the whole experience really soured me. I wish I had stayed at Bellagio or the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with Hit and Miss Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: WenSLC
Reviews.Content: There was a time when The Venetian and The Palazzo were our destinations of choice in Las Vegas. I'll start by saying they both smell really really good. They pump a signature scent into the main areas and every once in a while, I will smell something similar in "real life" and be reminded of good times had at the Palazzo and Venetian. The smell bothers some people. It's strong. But, I really like it. We generally take a taxi or limo from the airport to the Palazzo, attempting to arrive right around check-in time. The usual chaos of 3:00 p.m. check in seems absent at The Palazzo. The line is generally small and moves quickly. The customer service on check in is pleasant and professional, with the nice added touch of referring to customers by name. Upon check in, you will be offered an upgrade to the "Concierge Level" of the hotel for a small fee. I would recommend you decline the offer. It's just not worth it. The rooms are virtually the same as the rest of the hotel, and the amenities aren't that special. The snacks and cocktails are nice, but better food and drink can be found in the casino. If you plan on making many last-minute reservations for shows or restaurants, the Concierge service on that special level may come in handy, but as for the rest, I found the little treats on my pillow after turn down to be the best amenity...not worth the upgrade price. Once, you're settled in your room, you should go to the casino floor and directly to the Club Grazie booth to sign up for your Club Grazie rewards card. We have found the comps to be very good at the Palazzo and Venetian. After only two five-night visits, we were receiving, and taking full advantage of, five-night complimentary room offers on a regular basis. The lobby and gaming floor at the Palazzo are beautiful, elegant, and classy. The entrance to the excellent French restaurant Morel's sits on on one side of the lobby entrance, and the entrance to nightclub/restaurant Lavo on the other. In the center, there is a large seasonal botanical display, which has never disappointed. The gaming floor is generally quite quiet at Palazzo, with a slightly older crowd enjoying the wide variety of slot machines and table games. There are some lovely bars in the casino area, most featuring dollar poker/slot machines. Unfortunately, it is at these bars where we have encountered some atrocious customer service. My husband and I have each sat down, being the only two people at a bar, inserted our Club Grazie cards into a machine, put in $100 each, and bet maximum coins for over 15 minutes before anyone has approached us asking if we wanted a drink. When we were finally approached, my husband's initial funds were running a little low, so he had lowered his bet to just under the maximum coin bet, and he was refused a glass of wine! The bartender advised him he must be playing maximum coins to receive free drinks! He treated us like we were a couple of penny-playing teenagers trying to beat the system or something, and my husband had just lost nearly $100 waiting for him to come over and ask us, the only patrons, what we would like to drink. Oftentimes, when treated well, we will sit and play at a poker bar for hours. We are pretty avid gamblers. If the bartender is friendly and not condescending, our "free" drinks generally earn the casino a pretty substantial mark up. Not this time though, as after that exchange, neither of us were too keen to stay and play. We actually left the resort and headed elsewhere. That was the beginning of what has proven to be an eventual unfortunate downward turn with most of the service at The Palazzo. The rooms at The Palazzo are all suites, similar to those at The Venetian. They are large and comfortable. Generally, housekeeping has been good at the Palazzo, but less so during our last visit, when our room was not serviced for two out of five days. A favorite spot for casual dining is Zine Noodles and Dim Sum. The food is excellent, with a special nod to the garlic lobster and steamed dumplings. The service is on point and efficient. The steakhouse CUT has proven to be less than hoped for. The service is lacking. Reservations for 8:00, will often find you waiting in the lobby with a cocktail until at least 8:30, and being made to feel it's your fault for showing up on time. The food is average, but above-average in price. Morels has become a favorite, particularly on nice days when one can sit outside on the Strip and people watch. It's a long walk to the Venezia Tower at the Venetian to enjoy another French gem, Bouchon, but the walk is so worth it. Bouchon is consistently amazing and an overall favorite among Vegas restaurants. B and B and Delmonico Steakhouse are both very average and worth a miss if you're considering them. Unfortunately, our favorite restaurant, Bar Charlie at Charlie Trotter's closed, but we saw it coming with the economic downturn. $1,500 dinners for two are a thing of the past for almost everyone these days, definitely for us! Shopping at The Palazzo is varied and interesting. The shops do tend towards the higher end. I am especially fond of the Fresh (cosmetics, bath and beauty supplies) store, as they are always friendly and helpful. Another surprise in a casino shopping area is the Double Helix Wine Bar, where you can stop and sample a wine flight or two. Careful though, it is just next to Louboutin, which could definitely lead to reckless behavior when mixed with alcohol. I would still recommend The Palazzo to someone with money to spare looking for an elegant laid back trip to Vegas. I have to admit though, we stopped feeling we were getting value for money as we had in the past a few trips ago. Plus, we decided our goal while in Vegas was to have fun, not to act as posh as possible and be declined cocktails while playing ridiculous amounts. So, we have moved on. I do, however, have fond memories of staying at The Palazzo, and may give it another try someday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: diverbe49
Reviews.Content: We checked in last Friday, and left yesterday, so were able to spend four nights at the Palazzo. I found the accommodations to be quite nice. Checkin on a Friday night was a long wait, however. The beds were very comfortable, but the pillows were lumpy. The bath facilities were set up nicely with two sinks and a separate toilet. Both a tub and shower were available and the amenities were adequate, not poor as previous reviews mentioned. I do not think they have soft water, so lathering of shampoo could not happen! Housekeeping service was great and pleasant. I appreciated the security measures of showing the room key each time you went to the elevators. The extra living space of a sunken living room was nice to spread out and do some work, or relax in front of the tv. I would stay here again. The location is convenient, right on the strip and entertainment is easy to get to from the Palazzo. Be sure to check out the spa facilities and the workout area has everything you could want to use!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and good for those who don't want to non-stop party !”
Reviews.Author: missie22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Palazzo many times, and realised I have never written a review, so after my recent trip I thought I had better. I love the Palazzo. I love it's position on the strip, it's so easy to walk everywhere. I like the size of the casino..it's not too sprawling so you can find everything. It's really well run, clean, fantastic well kept decor, staff are fantastic and friendly and everyone from bellboy and cleaner upwards says good morning and is helpful. Check in is usually quick and painless..not so in many Vegas hotels..the lines can be huge. The rooms are fantastic and I particularly like them because you get a separate lounge area, with a lovely corner sofa, it's own separate TV to the bedroom. If you want to have an evening in, or come back a little earlier and watch TV and have a drink - the Palazzo rooms allow you to do that without having to get into bed ..I think it's a real plus. Downsides are the mini bar prices - it would be great if all Vegas hotels had an empty fridge so you would use it for your own beverages ..some do, like the Rio, but the Palazzo maxes out every opportunity for you to spend money ! We got a promotional deal this time ..for the most part it was $110 a night which is a phenomenal fee. I paid the $20 resort fee which included daily gym pass and internet - it's a good deal as the gym is amazing and internet charges can really add up. We tend to go to the Palazzo in April, my only criticism is due to the shadow that the hotel casts, the main pools don't get sun until almost lunchtime ..but you can walk the short walkway to the Venetian if you are an early morning sunner. The sunbeds are really comfy with great beds and the pool doesn't blare music at you like many of the pools. I love the Grand Lux Cafe and the access to the Venetian shops. The Palazzo is my favourite casino...not the newest, not the most modern, but very well run and offers great service all round.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury Defined”
Reviews.Author: GaryP217
Reviews.Content: This trip is my second to the Pallazo. My first trip here was in January when all the wonderful winter in Venice decorations were up. Right now the decor is focused on spring and hence a lot of wonderful flowers and butterflies. The interior of the hotel and the rooms are gorgeous. There was no expense spared in making sure this hotel caters to even the most discerning individual. The rooms are incredibly spacious and the sunken-in living rooms with a huge sectional couch our something to behold. In addition to great rooms, casino, and all around great ambiance the hotel has some wonderful concierge services. I dealt with a young lady named Lisa Oldham who have her honest opinion about some local cuisine. Also, she was very helpful answering questions about the resident clubs. (Tao and Lavo, went to Tao in January was gorgeous). Unlike most concierge at a lot of other hotels she was very personable and most importantly genuine. The level of service she provided was nothing less than exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Vegas to attend the MFest Convention”
Reviews.Author: JimGCarmel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was outstanding. Gig rooms, clean and so nice you don't want to leave the room. The pools in the back of the Hotel where beautiful and had a excellant eviroment in which to enjoy the great landscaping around the pool.The restaurant in the Canyon Ranch Spa really had some excellant dishes for Lunch and Breakfast the food was tasty and had a healthy blend of favors without adding excessive calores to the dishes. I just wish they had a Restaurant like this one where I live. Because I would be a regular visitor. Great location next to the Vention Hotel and the Wynn Hotel. Location in the heart of the Vegas Strip of Hotels. The price was very resonable for the room you got. I can't say enough good things about the Hotel. I would stay with them in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Mom's 80th Birthday stay @ the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: SB110
Reviews.Content: My Mother called me in Jan. of this year and told me that she would like to stay @ the Palazzo Hotel for her 80th Birthday since her last name was Palazzo. I said sure mom and made the reservation for a nites stay in April of 2012. I first called them directly to book the nite of Sat. 21 2012. and i was told there were NO ROOMS available. I thought wow! a hotel of that size hard to imagine. I checked their own web site and it told me different, there was a room available for our party of three. The cost of the room was 600 dollars and some change (around $630.00). I little pricey but I thought it's for mom and it's probably very elegent and lots of complimentary extras, so I paid up front and booked. When we arrived we checked in and informed our agent that it was moms b-day and showed her birth cert. with the Palazzo last name and asked Do you offer any extras for a b-day and the reply was no, however they offered to upgrade the room to another "better" floor and that was it. Since I never saw the first room I took them up on it. When the three in our party arrived to our $600 + room it was nice even had a stocked refridge and small boxes of snacks and nuts and water bottles on top. I thought , very nice comp. items, while we were enjoying the bottled water and snacks after a long journey the bellhop informed us that those items were NOT COMPLIMENTARY and that there were SENSORS located in the trays AND in the small refrigerator and if the items were moved we would be charged on our bill . To make along story short I paid over $600.00 for a room for 1 nite for a special b-day, and had to pay for a bag of peanuts and bottles of water, After complaining and stating we had not known of this they agreed to remove the charges for the ones we had consumed. I told the desk manager what kind of crap is this? at least @ Holiday Inn I get a free continental b-fast. He had no reply. I have to say I was embarrased to bring my party there, we did have fun joking about where the next sensor could be (maybe on the extra roll of T-paper so we could be billed or if I accidently missed the toilet and pissed on the floor.) Upon closing, I would like to add that there was no coffee machine in the room or nearby and that IT WAS NOT COMPLIMENTARY OR INCLUDED FOR OVER $600.00. After this honest review use your own discretion I was not satisfied in the least for my expierience, I expected MUCH more for my $600.00 1 nite stay!!!! I don't mind paying for it but, for tht kind of money I EXPECT MORE.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Lies”
Reviews.Author: travledtheworld
Reviews.Content: Made my reservation over the telephone and was told what I would receive for the price of the room. Such as breakfast, snacks, etc...When I checked in I found out it was all lies unless I wanted to pay more for an upgrade. I did not even check in my wife and I left and went to another hotel and received a better value for our money. Never trust reservations unless you confirm everything in an e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge floor worth it”
Reviews.Author: craftnut
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice experience staying in a Prestige suite with the concierge floor amenities. Continental breakfast was more than just fruit and muffins--at least a couple of hot items each day also. Pretty much a full bar for cocktail time (5-8) with a nice selection of appetizers. Pool areas very nice and since it was so crowded on Saturday, we appreciated the pool attendants help in finding a couple of lounge chairs. Do not recommend the (pricey) pina colada--pretty bad. Like most Vegas hotels, plenty of restaurants to choose from. Front desk and concierge staff were prompt in fulfilling requests.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel in Vegas - all suites”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: Everything was superb. I've never stayed in such a gorgeous suite in my life and I only had a "basic" suite. It was huge and luxurious! The tower was serviced by 36 elevators, so there was almost no wait. I didn't like the smoke in the casino but the actual hotel was clean and smoke free. We were here for the conference in Venetian. It was only 5 min walk from my room because I requested low floor. We tried 2 restaurants and 2 cafes. They were little expensive but otherwise very good. We also went to few clubs and spent little money on slot machines. Compared to other hotels I stayed in while in Vegas, this is the best one so far.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Crispysdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in April for the third year in succesion. We have been able to park our rental car less than 20 ft from the elavators that let out in a hall adjoining the room elevators. Very handy for getting luggage from the car to the room. Most hotels make you drag your luggage through the casino to get to the rooms. The rooms are huge, with a separate bedroom and sunken living room that includes a sectional couch. A flat screen TV in the huge bathroom, bedroom and living room. The desk with printer was very nice for printing boarding passes. We have stayed at the Mirage, Wynn, and Caesars in recent years and the Palazzo beats them all. Very bright, spacious casino and bar areas. We especially liked the luggage service that checks your bags on Southwest. ($10 each, but worth it at the rental car return and terminal)

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are outstanding in a first rate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ranishi
Reviews.Content: The junior suites are fantastic, plenty of room, great views, and well designed with all the comforts of home! The usual Jr. suited come with a King bed but you can get 2-Queens for $33 extra. The room is very nicely appointed and makes the stay very enjoyable. The rooms are a good walk through the casino from the front desk but are quiet. Walking through the casino then through the shops/canal you can get to the Venetian and Tao restaurant and Nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: Jamiro1998
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location. Housekeeping not so good. Dropped a pill on the floor in bathroom and was greeted by a large amount of visible dirt and dust. Room was never really cleaned properly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jhlhbh
Reviews.Content: This has been a very friendly hotel. The staff is very very helpful. I would recommend great, not just good, walking shoes though!,,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark13Stavanger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 13 nights over from Norway at Easter this year. We have previously stayed at Venetia, Bellagio and Mirage but now according to "my better half" this is the ONE. The check in was very efficient and professional, suite was superb with view of Wynns and Golf course, Bathroom is beautiful with all amenities incuding flat screen TV and weight scales, bed very good - pillows slightly too firm for us, 2 FS TVs and nice sitting area on lower level with desk and office facilities, large safe and stacked (expensive) mini bar!. HVAC very efficient and quiet. We were just behind the elevators which we were initially concerned about - noise and people etc. but in fact it was very quiet and very handy for getting down to the other levels. (stayed at Venezia and had to walk for ever to get to the elevator!) Pools are not the greatest as up to mid-day only the smaller one is in the sun but the others are OK in the afternoon. Casino is fairly typical for top hotel - slots pretty tight and table stakes high but this is to be expected. Hotel decor is beautiful and Palazzo shops very impressive. Walgreens drug store is two minutes walk from hotel which is very handy for snacks sundries etc. Location is very good for Wynns, Mirage/TI, Venetian and Fashion Show Mall. Access to self parking is very good. Only gripes were the room cleaning not the best and room was not cleaned two days running (do not disturb was not on the door!!) although when we called front desk the response was immediate!! and of course the good old resort fee ($20 per night plus tax!!) This does include WiFi though. All in all an excellent stay and we would recommend the Palazzo - pricey but worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “great classy place in vegas”
Reviews.Author: stephen g
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights, stayed at the encore last time. both hotels are similar standard, the rooms are similar size and quality. i prefer the room decor in palazzo with dark woods and rich colours. i think the encore casino area has the edge on the palazzo but only just. no coffee in the room was the only negative thing i can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: hannokitty
Reviews.Content: I thought since this hotel is so huge it wouldn't have the customer service or feel I was looking for. I was wrong. They do a very nice job of balancing the lay out of the hotel, shops and restaurants. There was a huge variety of restaurants to choose from. Casual and cheap all the way up to expensive and dressy. Loved the lounge with the live music! Very fun. Lots of great shopping and good location on the strip. Would recommend this to anyone who wants a hotel with a little bit of everything. Good hotel for someones first visit as well. Remember to always go to Walgreens for water etc. over the hotel shops. Huge price difference!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: woolfItaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husbad on march 2012, it wasn't our first time in town, but the first time at the palazzo. This hotel is connected to the venetian by the gallery of shops, it's just less kitch than the venitian, even if all las vegas hotels are kitch, is the spirit of the city. Very big hall vith marbles, rapid check in and check out. The bedroom are wonderful, very, very big, with big bathroom. We had a strip view bedroom and we were in front of the Trasure Island and also see the wynn on the right side. It was nice to see the tresure Island show sitting in the bedroom at the end of the day. We also had the in room breakfast and was very good, not a great choice, but good. There are several restaurants inside the complex palazzo-venetian, but not buffet breakfast, but you can have a buffet breakfast at the wynn or at the caesars (that is not so far, 5min walk). I raccomand this hotel especially for the big bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Minor issues”
Reviews.Author: MariMalah
Reviews.Content: Bathroom doors are not lockable, and shower was not working, had to call Front Desk to fix it. Rooms kinda expensive, for the same value we should have taken Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Skip The Already Faded So Called Five Star Resorts - Only Book The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ewing1212
Reviews.Content: After a long hiatus I finally returned to Las Vegas. The Palazzo was my only choice. I have toured the Cosmopolitan (yawn) and had to leave Aria after just two nights because of the sad small brown rooms, so going to Palazzo was like going home. The entire stay was flawless and confirms that the Venetian/Palazzo/Venezia Resort is my only lodging choice in Las Vegas. Pros: Despite arriving eight hours late, I was provided a high floor strip- view suite at no additional charge. The view of Las Vegas strip and pool area were a delight. All interactions with the staff was a world class/five star experience. From housekeeping to valet - all needs were anticipated and exceeded. Opulent room! I've read other reviews stating the rooms were showing wear and tear. This is WRONG! The suite was in pristine like-new condition. This was not a one-room opinion. I peeked into the doors of other rooms being cleaned and the ALL sparkled like new! Electric drapes - you can spend HOURS enjoying this feature. Great lighting - even the private bathroom stall had excellent and bright lighting. You will go blind to read inside your room at Aria. Plenty of natural light and sensible automation at The Palazzo. 3 LCD Televisions - a plethora of HD channels to choose from including an easy to operate DVD player. Color Printer - No other resorts offer complimentary state of the art printer/fax machines. This was especially handy in printing critical work and travel documents. Canyon Ranch - OUTSTANDING! No crowds, spotless and world class exercise equipment. Slot-machines - Both abundant and GENEROUS! A reverse ATM. Complimentary gift basket - This was a total surprise from a friend in Casino Marketing. And the cat that delivered it looked like a GQ model. Great way to start a vacation!An abundance of gourmet and other indulgent treats! Dining - Bouchon is a GEM of class and relaxation with award winning food and located mere steps away from the 10th floor sky bridge. Grand Lux at both the Venetian and Palazzo are a welcome and affordable 24 hour respite when you’re hungry after a long night of gaming. The menu is HUGE and everything was delicious. And the portions are massive and HOT. No one likes cold breakfast items. The servers also look like models but are approachable and offer wonderful suggestions. Security is top-notch. You feel SAFE! You can’t enter the Venetian suites without your room card shown to the security staff. The private pool and garden area is just a skiddle away a The Venezia Tower (available to all Venetian and Palazzo guest) and is a beautiful respite in the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas. There were also no crowds at the Venetian or Palazzo pools. Most of the pools were thoughtfully heated in December as were the spacious hot tubs. CLEAN too! And no screaming kids in sight. Bags To Go - This vendor managed service is AMAZING. I was able to check two large bags and receive my boarding pass without having the stress and hassle for only $20. This service is conveniently located in the lobby area. More time for gaming and bags arrived in Dallas without having to lug them through flight check-in. You go straight to the boarding area. The beds are PERFECTION and there are extra pillows and sheets in the closet to choose from. The robes are INCREDIBLY SOFT! Previous reviews have commented on the long walks to get to your room. This is not the case if you self park and take advantage of the direct elevator to the Venezia Suites located above the garage. And if you choose to valet park, the walk through the elegant and well appointed public areas is a real treat. It doesn't hurt that the valet staff is also VERY attractive. Vibe - Electric! No other resort except the newly renovated MGM Grand or the Belaggio comes close to the excitement, class and sophistication. If you desire high energy this is the place. If you desire a nurturing low key and pampering experience this is the place. Housekeeping - Room was cleaned every afternoon. How the staff manages to make your personal essentials "artwork" is great fun to experience. And please be generous to the housekeeping staff. The smallest suite is 700 square feet and there are 7,000 of them to clean! Cons: None. I would strongly recommend the Palazzo Tower and look forward to my next stay in June!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay except for the Smoke”
Reviews.Author: Jclassvan
Reviews.Content: First time for the family in Vegas. We were continuing our trip from Scottsdale so drove up through the desert which was really nice. I had stayed at the Venetian quite a few years ago and enjoyed the stay so decided to try the Palazzo due to the room size. I felt that to get at least 750 sq ft for $239 per night was a good deal, especially since a standard hotel room at a resort in Scottsdale set us back more than double that. We had a room overlooking the Wynn and golf course and were on the 47th floor. Very nice view. The room decor was very nice, the bathroom huge and very functional for a family of four. Things that we particularly enjoyed about the room was the size, the multi function printer/fax machine, the work desk in addition to the round table, the large sofa, and the comfortable beds. There were four of us for 5 nights int he room and we felt very comfortable and didn't feel like we were tripping over each other. Lots of space. What were the hotel issues? We were on a non-smoking floor and yet every so often we would get a blast of smoke through the air conditioning system. I am somewhat sensitive to smoke, but this was a bit more than a "Whiff". Calling guest services I got the response that they try their best, but perhaps someone is smoking in their room above or below us and there is not much they can do. (The first two days it was next to impossible to walk through the casino without an oxygen mask. And I have been told that this is one of the better casinos). The other issues that we had was housekeeping was sporadic. One day we were missed and when I called housekeeping I was asked if we wanted the room made up now (7:30 pm) or would fresh towels do? Two days later we got missed again. This time I asked for a complete service. It did take about an hour for someone to arrive. Service in the restaurants were hit and miss. Probably the best service / food that we found was the Grand Lux cafe. We did Morel's one morning for breakfast and although they were short staffed, the service was excellent and so was the food. Unfortunately at Dal Torro's the next morning that was not the case. Service was almost non-existent and we got our coffee in paper cups (not Starbucks quality cups - these things were thin). I had to ask 3 times for a 2nd cup and they still charged $4.75 per cup for coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gator G
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large which is nice. The downside is charge for fridge.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kay_mck
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Venetian but got moved into the Palazzo onto the 43rd floor after a 'chat' with the receptionist. We loved the room - it was big, comfortable and had an amazing strip of the strip and the mountains. I agree with other reviewers that I was disappointed with the amenities. I actually went and bought some better quality shampoo & conditioner after I'd used them the first day. Other than that minor quibble our 7 night stay couldn't have gone much better. I liked the quietness and style of the lobby compared to other 5* hotels in Vegas, and the walk through the casino was short to find the elevators. Security was good, food and drink great and the choice of outdoor space plentiful. I've stayed in the Bellagio and The Hotel and both my husband and I like the Palazzo better. We'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....but not fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: silly_mama2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo over Spring break (April 7 through 14) with our two kids, and our experience was mixed. Lets start with the good. Palazzo is very beautiful. It is surprisingly elegant and understated by Vegas standards. The entrance is lovely. The check-in area massive and airy, with beautiful ice sculptures and decorations. The walk toward guest suites is through the casino, but it is short and straight. Our suite on the 31st floor overlooked the strip. We could watch the pirates show at Treasure Island. The suite itself was very roomy. Nice bedroom area, with queen size beds. Comfortable living area with desk, table, couch. Three television sets, including one in the bathroom. The bathroom was very big with a tub and a shower, a double sink and a separate toilet area. The four of us were very comfortable, and did not feel squeezed in at all. The room has a great safe, under the television in the living room, which allows your PC or i-pod to charge while being stored. Now, onto not so great. Housekeeping in our suite was good because we left tips every day. But even then, we continually had towel shortage. Who would think that four people would require four towels! The towels are very rough indeed, as are the bathrobes and the sheets. The amenities in general are skimpy and low quality. At this type of resort, I would expect Kiehl products in the bathroom. Instead, we had some odd shampoo/conditioner/wash that I could not identify. The shampoo simply would not lather. Also, those basic supplies, and a shower cap with four q-tips were it. No toothpaste or brush, no shoeshine, no amenities to speak of, which seems odd for a resort of this caliber. No coffee maker in the room. And finally, the refrigerator is just a menace. It is weighted, so if you simply pick something up you get charged. A pain since you cannot put a bottle of water into the refrigerator. Finally, what disappointed most was the service. On our sixth day of the trip, we got new neighbors. There were about 10 people in the suite next to us, who drank, screamed, cursed and ran around banging doors from 9 pm to 1 am and then from 4 am to 6 am. We called the front desk twice to complain. Security came up once and told the folks next door that neighbors were complaining. This was done in embarrassingly apologetic tones. Nothing stopped, and no one came up the second time. Now, this is not an adult-only, party, Vegas, Motel 6! This is a five star resort, and behavior like that should be discouraged. Next day, we went downstairs to raise the issue with the front desk, and we were told that it is not up to the hotel to monitor its guest. No? Then is it up to whom? After telling the front desk minion that we too are entitled to the quite enjoyment of our accommodations, and that we were going to call the police, the minion very reluctantly offered us a $50 credit toward food. Seriously? Speaking of food, the restaurants at the hotel are extraordinary expensive. Breakfast at Morel runs over $100 easy. We also noticed that the restaurants that were inside Palazzo but not a part of it had much better service than the restaurants that are actually part of Palazzo. The pool-side restaurant has good pizza, but they will not take orders or deliver it to you. You have to go and stand on a take-out line waiting for it. In general, the pool areas is large, but main parts get very crowded. Waitresses ignore you, and the greeter at the entrance could not be bothered to answer a question about towels. Also, virtually the entire pool area is in the sun. There is absolutely no shade to be had unless you rent a palapa for big bucks for the entire day. So either burn or pay up! In conclusion, while we had a lovely stay and enjoyed the Palazzo, it was an experience similar to a stay in a 3.5 star resort. We hope the staff addresses some of these hiccups since overall the hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: VERONICA S
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas quite a bit for work and this trip was for pleasure with my family. Our stay gave them them the "WOW" with the quality of the room, service and atmosphere. They totally loved it as I do when I travel for business and this is my preferred hotel of choice while in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Top Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PhilsReview
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Las Vegas and each time we have either stayed at either the Venetian or Palazzo. From check in, to the room size, to bar staff, we have never found any fault with any of the Hotels in this location. Having read other reviews there always seems to be people nit picking as to whether its 4 or 5 or even 4.5 stars. For me life's too short and from my humble perspective would gladly give it 5 stars. If I have any gripe and it would be minor... Online reservations can be a pain to deal with, no proper follow up to any queries but all big companies appear to suffer from the same lack of continuity of service with this kind of thing. Always keep an eye out for special deals throughout the year, even join the 'Grazie' loyalty program to get deals not advertised on the main site, it can save you a lot of money. I'm not one for writing a lot of reviews but when comparing this hotel to the Park Plaza in London, boy could the Hotel in London learn a lot about service... Maybe send out some of their staff for training!! :- )

Reviews.Title: “Room is classy & nice experience. Is it a true 5 star? Not really”
Reviews.Author: TKinLA
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for the room design, layout & size. It was stunning! The living room area was big & wonderfully decorated, complete with L shaped comfy couch. The bed & down pillows could not be more comfortable. There were 3 tv's, so lots of choices if you were there to relax in the room. I thought the amenties in the bathroom were substandard for most 3 star+ hotels. We chose the golf course side & loved the view. It was also really quiet! We never heard anyone from other rooms or the hallyway, so must be well soundproofed. Everything was super clean & spotless. It only gets 4 stars for service & amenities that I would have expected from a true 5 star hotel. The pool area was ok but nothing special or chic. The lobby was nice, but again, nothing special. The second floor shopping was nice. Really no "extras" you would have expected. Here's where the rating stars drop to 2. If you got too close the Venetian, you were unrelentingly bombarded by people trying to get you to buy show tickets or anything else. We would definitely stay here again if we got a good deal on the rate. It was a beautiful room, great size, & slept really well, which is our top priority.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 stars, really. But great amount of space for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: TheLilyBean
Reviews.Content: This is a more serene, tastefully decorated, less kid-saturated alternative to the Venetian. Beautifully appointed, the large standard rooms, each with sunken living area, can not be beat--V/P hotels offer the most space for the money. It's nice to be able to spread out into the living room area during the stay, especially in our room, which had a great view of the pools and the Strip, all the way up to the Luxor pyramid. Very secure, with a security guard posted at the elevator bank checking room keys of all the guests. Coffee Bean coffee shop right in the hallway by the elevators for that first morning eye-opener, and Grand Lux and the zebra-striped lounge are right nearby in case you need reasonably priced emergency eats or a cocktail. The room decor is wonderful, the bed linens very nice, and our room on the 42nd floor was very quiet. Only drawback is that there's no iPod dock anywhere. Kind of behind the times, don't you think? Most 3-star and up places have them in the clock radio. We don't expect a coffee maker in a Vegas hotel room, so that was no big deal. Gym at Palazzo is a little small--with limited equipment--but we were able to walk the corridor to the Venetian gym, which was plenty large and offered more machines. Not appointed with a beautiful view, like Mandalay Bay, but gets the job done. Hallways could use a bit of vacuuming--what's up with the Q-tips?--and the "Phantom of the Opera" promos playing at top volume in the elevator get kind of old, but those are minor quibbles. The clientele is well-behaved, the common areas are very pretty, and in general, it's very pleasant to get around. The hotel location, just outside the heart of the Strip, is very nice if you like a break from the crush of people. With a well-stocked Walgreen's nearby for sundries, a beautiful mall with lots of shopping and dining options, as well as an expansive pool area, this is a fine choice if you don't feel like venturing far from your hotel. Will definitely stay here again. Venetian's looking a bit shabby, so unless we come to LV for a "with kids" holiday, we'll be Palazzo people.

Reviews.Title: “Presitge level....excellent package”
Reviews.Author: SHEAMUSToronto
Reviews.Content: We decided to go for a little extra pampering on this trip to Vegas and stayed on the Prestige level of the Palazzo. This allows for private check on the 23rd floor, breakfast in the lounge(juice, coffee,cereal, rolls, two hot items, fruit, yogurt, etc.), tea/coffee throughout the day, a good selection of hot and cold apps between 5pm - 7pm and cocktails, beer, wine from 5pm - 8pm. Normally, you do pay approximately $40-$50 pp, per day for these rooms but we got a deal by signing up for promotions specials. Given that the average cost of a mixed drink on the strip seems to be about $10, this is a pretty good deal; especially considering the breakfast and dinner offerings. Service is excellent right from the concierge, housekeeping and everyone in between. next time we will stay in a regular room because we found so many Happy hour specials at LasvegasWeekly.com that we did not use the lounge very much. An additional note: AVOID Morels in the Palazzo....just an overall bad experience you do not need with so many other great choices. PJ Clarkes and Max Brenners both in the Forum Shoppes have excellent happy hour deals. $6.00 apps and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: agiustino
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and fabulous high floor room overlooking Wynn golf course. Very quiet room. Great staff and casino. I've stayed at many hotels on the strip and this ranks as my favourite next to Bellagio. Casino blackjack dealers were top notch. We only ate at the Cafe Luxe which was great. Spent a day at the pool where lounge chairs were plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room!”
Reviews.Author: Malialyssa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for one night and was pleasantly surprised at the size. There were two beds and a living area...big enough for our family of four. I liked that there were flat screen tvs in the living space, beds, and bathroom. Great idea especially with kids who want to watch their shows...no fighting over what channel to watch. I also liked that the bathroom had a separate bath and shower. Another thing I really liked was the remote controlled curtains...very convienient. Two things that bothered me about the room was that there was a mysterious stain on the couch. Ewww! Also, although the bed was comfortable, I found that the bed sheets were rough. Overall, this is a good room to get if you have a family due to it's size and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: CCGrrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, cute piano bar, right on the edge of everything on the Strip, and the suite we got for me and 5 friends was more than worth the money with all the room and sleeping space we had. Absolutely perfect, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: gr33neyes
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights 02.04.12 – 06.04.12; having never been to America before we were completely blown away from the minute we stepped in to the hotel, there was a lovely fresh smell from the enormous real flower displays and fountains. We booked a suite and allocated the 9th floor, overlooking Treasure Island Hotel opposite. The suite was huge, lovely big comfy bed, big bathroom with toiletries and a sunken living room area with sofa, work station with phone/fax, table and chairs etc. There was a mini bar and fridge in the room – but be warned if you remove anything to even look at and return, it will be charged to your room as the base is weighted! Another charge to watch out for is the daily hotel fee – we had this removed as a compliment after we complained we were not aware of this at booking. The room was clean and housekeeping kept it clean throughout our stay. The hotel has got a good selection of shops and the casino and bars are good. As long as your gambling, the waitresses will come and take your free drinks orders and bring them to you; we found that if you tip them a dollar or two each time, they will keep coming back to you. We eat in the hotel’s Grand Lux Café twice for breakfast which was excellent for both service and quality food. The portions are so big we found we were set up for the day, only needing an evening meal! We eat out at Denny’s diner down the road from the hotel for breakfast one day during our stay – I would avoid this at all costs; a very packed diner with a fast turnaround so we felt rushed. The food was awful and very greasy. We found the concierge at the hotel extremely helpful, we had made telephone bookings for things elsewhere that we had to confirm upon arrival and the concierge made confirmation phonecalls for us at no extra charge. The hotel is linked to the Venetian next door which has more shops, bars, places to eat etc; we found this hotel too big – we got lost!! We took a trip up to the 50th floor and housekeeping whilst cleaning one of the rooms let us in for a quick peak to take some photos as the view is fantastic. If we were to return to Vegas we would certainly request a higher floor to have better views. In summary we had an excellent stay at this hotel; everyone was friendly and helpful and the whole hotel kept very clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Will Be Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: jenny E
Reviews.Content: My Daughter And I Enjoyed Our Stay Here.She Said It Was "Off The Charts".Our Room Was So Beautiful And The View Was Extraordinaire.The Staff Was Very Helpful And I Recommend The Palazzo To Everyone That Is Going To Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Use to be better”
Reviews.Author: Gina W
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, the room was a little worn. The safe did not work and had to wait for some one to come fix it. Maid service is very slow, we were out all morning (left the room by 8 and back by 1) just to find that our entire wing was not cleaned yet. The dirty dishes from the room next to us were still out there from the night before. Had to call maid service to find out when the room would be cleaned, no one showed up until after 3. Lots of dust in the room. We use to love this hotel but it's just not as good as it use to be.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary birthday weekend for my wife”
Reviews.Author: drretire
Reviews.Content: My wife chose to go to Las Vegas for her birthday so our favorite choice is the Prestige floor of the Palazzo Hotel. We were being joined by our son and daughter-in-law so this floor is ideal as a meeting place. They serve a huge continental breakfast in the morning, cocktails at the open bar from 4-8 PM (hors d'oeuvres too), and then deserts later. The suites are spectacular- 720 sq ft of absolute luxury. Anything that you can desire is waiting for you and if you can't find it, the Concierge will get it for you immediately. After 3 days of hedonism, we decided on a surprise renewal of our vows at the Elvis Chapel at 5:30 PM and when we were gone, we asked Deion, our Concierge to sneak into our suite and "set it up" with photos that we brought from home, plus champagne. (I knew but my wife had no clue). She was shocked by the Elvis Chapel surprise but that was just the beginning. When we returned to our room, 3 of us went into the suite to enjoy the continuing celebration- photos and champagne. Our daughter-in-law had to go to the bathroom so she went the other way. She let out a scream and we all came running. She walked out of the bathroom, hysterical laughing, with Deion on her arm. It seems that we got to the suite too early and Deion didn't have time to escape. The only thing that he could think of was to hide in the bathroom and hope that one of the guys showed up first to let him sneak out. Oops, that didn't happen! Poor Deion left with enormous apologies for his error in timing. We roared laughing. Then we realized that Deion may have thought that we were ticked off but that was the opposite of our reaction. I sent my son to find Deion (and a photographer) and bring them back to the room for photos of the best moment of our trip. We had a blast and it was Deion that made the moment extraordinary. So you can truly experience how good the Prestige floor of the Palazzo is for fun and frolic, here is what else we did in Vegas- Terry Fator show and Tao's Asian restaurant, Rod Stewart show and Rao's Italian restaurant, and finally Del Frisco Steak House. Every moment was fantastic yet all that we talk about is the Prestige floor at the Palazzo and Deion, our favorite concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGopher
Reviews.Content: I've stayed all over Las Vegas, and while there are hotels with better pools, restaurants, and gaming floors, the Palazzo really has the best rooms. They feel substantial. Very luxurious and spacious, with top-quality materials, fixtures and amenities. The effect is something like old-world, understated elegance. Like some reviewers have noted, the hotel doesn't do glitzy, like the Cosmopolitan, or ostentatious, like Caesar's. It was like a wonderful oasis of calm in the middle of the Strip. I am however, quite disappointed they closed my favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas, Dos Caminos, last November. If you're looking for a modicum of serenity in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip, and the quality of the room is important to you, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: PamMOWaco
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel.Stayed in a bella suite and it was wonderful.This hotel has everything you need. Beautiful pools, good shopping,and several places to eat.Service was excellent and a great staff.We plan on staying here from now on.We have stayed at probably 15 different hotels here and this one is first class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Still daydreaming”
Reviews.Author: shakeinit
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a last minute vacation to Vegas for our 15th anniversary we have never been there before so wanted to try it. I must say it was the best time we have had in years. I booked the venitian via American express travel. So as you enter the place smells so good I'm love architecture and this place was amazing. Now check in was long but also was there during this crazy convention. But finally got to desk only to find out I didn't get the room I wanted. I prefer a balcony (which in Vegas are slim to none) or a patio. The lady was super nice and offered an upgrade for a few Bucks to the palazzo so I took it. It was so big and just beautiful with a double door leading out to a patio. Was just perfect. Now this has got to be one of the biggest and most confusing hotels so take the map!!! Housekeeping sucked maybe because of the size but who cares I grabbed towels off the cart myself. And kindly asked for their lotions and soaps they smelled so good I was given a huge handful. I also pre arranged with the food manager to have a cake baked and delivered to our room with champaign while at dinner. And it was perfect also the best cake i have ever ever eaten. Plus they came and picked it up and kept it in their kitchen fridge until we wanted more. Highly recommend this hotel will stay again for sure. I like the location far enough away from the crowds and the porn card slappers lol ...We watched the siren show (treasure island across the street) from outside the front doors of the hotel. Take the gondola ride inside or out its a must. I've been to Venice on a real one and even here they go into the history of the story.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at 10:30am and our room was immediately ready. The service was excellent and the entertainment of the bar band was so good. The rooms were so spacious and comfortable. This casino is never crowded, even on Friday and Saturday nights which was great. Never had to wait for a bar stool or a slot that we wanted to play. All in all, I would go back there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: wharthog521
Reviews.Content: thought the rooms were nice. check-in was good. not quite the dazzle and younger crowd of other las vegas hotels so if you're looking for something a little younger go to the wynn, or cosmo or something along those lines. the pool was average. overall though it's a nice hotel in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Can not go wrong with this one!”
Reviews.Author: Munir_Parikh
Reviews.Content: Excellent Rooms, excellent service and great front-desk staff. We requested connected Bally Suites and they made sure that those are available while we arrive. Location is perfect and it is connected with venetian, which makes it perfect. Lots of food options and casino floor was much better. Overall fun place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Anita S
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a 1st class experience The Palazzo has it all. From the breathtaking exterior to our suite, we felt and were treated like VIPs. Gaming and food was great as well. Don't miss the opportunity to stay in the spacious Bella Suite. What a nice retreat after a day of gaming and site seeing. Oh, did I mention the amazing "Robes" waiting for us. A nice little touch after a bath or shower. The Palazzo has spoiled us, and we plan another trip this year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Pricey, What do you get for the resort fee?”
Reviews.Author: Rob9877
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in the Palazzo in Las Vegas. The hotel is decked out as you'd expect for a Las Vegas hotel - very over the top in the style of the theme the hotel is going with - in this case Italy - so marble floors and ornate(ish) deco. Checkin was ok - fairly short line which moved quick enough. Then the obligatory walk thru the casinos to get to your room. We were initially booked into the Venetian but got "upgraded" to the Palazzo towers instead. I'm not sure if the rooms are much different in the Venetian as opposed to the Palazzo but the walk just to get out of your room each day could take you 10minutes !! The signs in the hotel aren't particularly clear either - which I guess is by design in a casino where they want you to stay in !! Rooms are large which is nice - the views over the strip are ok, we were on the 41st floor which was pretty high and had a good view. Amenities, towels, housekeeping etc were as to be expected with a couple of robes in the wardrobe. What this hotel seemed to lack was any sense of treating you as a guest - I think because so many of the people in and about the hotel are transient and just in the casino's or shops the staff can't/ don't really treat you as a valued guest but more as just another punter ! I also agree with other reviewers comments over wifi and minibars - when you're in the casino there's wifi a plenty and the drinks are on tap and free! However - go to your room and it's a complete reverse - I understood that in the resort fee you got wifi included - however this isn't the case - as you're presented with a Prices page when you connect to the "In Suite WiFi" !! The minibar I'll not go into - needless to say it's one of those ones where you would have to be either crazy, drunk or both to start taking things from it!! Would I stay again??...not too sure - we've been told there's better in Vegas such as the Wynn or Bellagio. Maybe if there was a deal on that was just too good to resist we would.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury oasis in the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: MikeyEdwards
Reviews.Content: Fabulous room with great views and total privacy. Booked 60 days in advance through intercontinental (not direct) for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Casino Resort”
Reviews.Author: TSTraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon checkin, the resort staff was welcoming and efficient. Although it was only 9 a.m., my room was ready, so I was able to freshen up before heading to meetings. The suite was spacious with a nice sectional sofa, coffee table/ottoman, desk, and plenty of storage room for my clothes. The bathroon was huge with a seperate chamber for the commode and a vanity w. stool for makeup application. There's an honor bar with fridge, which you are not allowed to put anything else in. (The housekeepers removed my milk and set it on the counter to spoil.) Like many Las Vegas hotels, there's no in-room coffeemaker, so you have to schlep down the coffeeshop to get your morning coffee. If you're an early riser, the Cafe Presse at the 2nd floor elevator stop doesn't open till 7 a.m., so you have to to the Illy further away on the 1st floor or the Cafe Presse near the Blue Man Group theater. The Postrio restaurant in "San Marco Square" is very good and not ridiculously expensive. The I Heart Burgers place on the 2nd Floor serves $14 burgers w. no fries that aren't exceptional. My friend who ate there thinks his salad made him sick, but that's hard to prove. If you're attending a convention, Palazzo is much closer than the Venetian to the meeting rooms. A much less expensive bet is TI (Treasure Island) across the street, where I have stayed several times. With the walkway bridge, it's not really a longer hike than the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Pallazzo very classy”
Reviews.Author: lektor1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo 4/2-5. Have stayed at most hotels on the strip but Pallazzo is the best. All rooms are suites with 3 tvs in the room. Fax copier at desk very nice bathroom with shower and seperate tub. Very nice rsturants and shopping on property. Great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well worth the money, can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail A
Reviews.Content: Everything is great. The rooms, the service. The only problem is music in Lavo and in Tao - all rap garbage.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but quality has dropped in the last 2 years.”
Reviews.Author: Jodi S
Reviews.Content: If you are headed to vegas for your first visit you won't be let down by the size of the Palazzo rooms and the grandeur of the resort for the price. The rooms are super spacious and the access to shopping, restaurants and the casino floor is very easy although try get a room closer to the elevator shafts unless you really enjoy a good walk. The water is also very harsh in vegas so takes loads of moisturiser. Only negatives: the amount of dust in the rooms & there is no space at all in the mini bar to put anything and you cannot move anything out as it is weighted and will charge you for the item you move.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Savanny V
Reviews.Content: Room was very spacious with sunken living area with L-shaped couch. Bathroom was also big and clean. We had a great view of the strip and Palazzo pools. Staff were all very courteous and helpful. Would definitely stay there again. Casino floor was nice and did not reek of smoke. Perfect location on strip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: fraser301
Reviews.Content: We flew from Mnachester and enjoyed 4 nights at Prestige level.I thought the staff were superb really helpful especially the staff at in the Prestige lounge-nothing was too much for them.Equally the concergie staff offered excellent support.The suite was also fabulous with lots of space.I would recommend this hotel for the style and elegance it exudes.Being close to the Venetian and sharing the pool and facilities was aslo a big bonus.Definitely 5 star luxury.This will be our first destination if we return to LV again.

Reviews.Title: “The Prestige: Luxury Customer Service with a Heart”
Reviews.Author: justdarla
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at the Palazzo on the Prestige/concierge level 2-4 times a year for the last several years. During our first visit we were impressed by breakfast (cereal, hot and cold, boiled eggs, fruit, juices, etc.) the tea hour (cookies, tea, coffee, snacks) and the appetizer and drink hour in the evening (soup, vegetables, appetizers-an incredible spread). But what impressed us more was the high quality of service we received from the entire staff. The Prestige has done an excellent job hiring authentic, genuine, and caring staff. If all you want is great luxury customer service they are happy to provide that, but if you look a little deeper you'll enjoy them as people. We went for the luxury, but we kept coming back because of the people. The first person we got to know there is a woman named Maybel who served us drinks and is now a bartender and an excellent one. We sat in Maybel's section each time we went because in addition to the service she gave us, we enjoyed her as a person. She showed us care and was interested in our lives and we were interested in hers. We also got to know Jose' the bartender, Yosef, Michelle, Jane, Jaime and Jose' on the wait staff. Each one of them touched us. If you go be sure to tip them. They work hard. We were also impressed by the concierge staff who interact with us on check in and set up reservations, etc. Hector has been especially helpful to us, as has Megan, Jeswyn, and Mitch. Be sure to tip these folks, as well. I was also impressed by the manager Jason, whom we first met when he was in the lounge helping his staff clean up because they were swamped with people. He and Heidi (also a manager) took the time to help us out and to chat with us. Impressive! The lounge is a great place to write a book or to conduct business. My boyfriend was a writer and he wrote much of his book in the Palazzo. I want to thank the Palazzo Prestige staff for the care we received over the years. Go. It's worth the money! We met many people over the years who are regulars. It is a gem in the heart of the strip-not to be missed. I

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view”
Reviews.Author: sushi4soup
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Palazzo in a Luxury View Suite. We had an awesome view of the Treasure Island across the strip and of the mountains in the distance. The room was huge and clean with lots of nice amenities including a copier/fax machine. Having a separate (sunken) seating area was nice. The only thing I didn't like was that the mini bar is one of those that you can't put any personal items in (moving things creates a charge). There was also a display of honor bar items in a tray in front of the TV that couldn't be moved either. So we rented a mini fridge to put our stuff in. When housekeeping brought it they asked if I needed anything else and I said more hangers - she returned immediately with them so I could continue to unpack. So I thought the service was very good. The clientele at the Palazzo seems a little more upscale, which was nice. The downside was that there is a very limited choice in casual dining at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gtvs
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great selection of restaurants, and nice pool area. Staff is extremely courteous. We really enjoyed eating at Otto's and Sushi Sambi (liked it more than the Miami location). Our advise would be to skip the Grand Lux Cafe and don't buy slushy drinks from Del Toro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CharlieC33
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Hotel offers one of the nicest and largest rooms for a reasonable price right on the strip. When you enter your room the first thing you come to is the bathroom, on the right. You'll find a shower and a large tub. There is a makeup table, two sinks and a separate toilet area, all done wonderfully. Continue down the hall and you come to the bedroom area, open to the rest of the suite. A king size bed, large TV and plenty of room for your clothes. Step down into the living area, where you find a L shaped sofa, another large TV and a desk with printer. The suites are very clean, up to date and by comparison these are the largest rooms I've seen in Vegas. The front desk staff are perfect...friendly and efficient...the casino...well it's a casino...plenty of places to eat...and gamble if that's your thing. This is the second time I stayed here, always a great place to stay when I visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful not tacky”
Reviews.Author: MAY1972
Reviews.Content: Husband took me here for 5 nights to celebrate my 40th birthday. It was a surprise which was a huge risk as I'm not a fan of surprises but he couldn't have chose better. This hotel was beautiful and had all the grandeur you'd expect from a Vegas hotel but none of the tackiness which I think spoils many of the other hotels here. We stayed in a luxury suite which was huge and the decor and furnishings were very tasteful. The bathroom was fabulous with a deep bath that filled in minutes and a lovely powerful walk in shower. We were upgraded to a room with a view and what a view it was, with floor to ceiling windows we had a great view of the pool and could watch the Sirens show across the road at Treasure Island without leaving the room! The weather was great so we spent a few hours at the pool each day and it was really nice with deep padded cushions on the loungers and lovely soft towels supplied. We didn't gamble much but it seemed to be one of the smaller casinos. The bars, restaurants and shops in the resort were great and when combined with the Grand Shoppes at the Venetian there is certainly plenty of choice here. All in all a great stay and I would highly recommend the Palazzo. We were in nearly all the big hotels and this was by far my favourite with a nice intimate feel and a little bit removed from the crazy buzz of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: michel009
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Palazzo, check in was a breeze, our room has a wonderful view, it was facing the green golf land and the mountain, I asked the lady at check in to put me on a higher floor, and she did without hesitation, we got the 44th floor. The room itself was very spacious, the bed very comfortable, and the bathroom was amazing. In a word everything is luxurious at the Palazzo. The only thing I was hoping to find in the room was a small fridge where you could store some food and drinks and maybe a coffee maker. My check out was also painless, and I got an exceptionally great service from Krystal at the front desk, she treated us with utmost respect and she was very nice and accommodating. Thank you Krystal. Our vacation at Vegas was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 4 day weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: bokim777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had gone to Europe to celebrate our 20th anniversary in early summer but took a 4 day long weekend trip to Vegas for the actual anniversary date. We decided on the prestige package with 1st class air package at the Palazzo. We thoroughly enjoyed our entire trip. First, you go to the 23rd floor to check-in. No long lines in the lobby. You are greeted by friendly staff and with a glass of champagne during registration. The Prestige rooms were exactly the same as the other rooms in the Palazzo or Venetian (which are connected through the casinos) but the little convenient amenities were worth the little extra. Evening cocktails, appetizers, coffee and light breakfast in the morning, the cold water bottles before heading out, were really convenient. The only thing I would change is I would stay at the Venetian side next time. The lobby, the gondolas, made the Venetian side much more beautiful. All in all, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Kay199
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for part of our honeymoon. We stayed for five nights and were amazed by the hotel. The suite was fantastic, with everything we needed and more. The bathroom was spacious with a tv. I couldn't fault his hotel in anyway, we did ask for a room facing the strip and were told it would cost an additional amount. The housekeeping was fantastic! For two nights we were left a little card, detailing the weather for the next days and a box with chocolates in it. The night we arrived we ordered room service, it was delivered efficiently and tasted great.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigpoppapump82
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a 2 queen suite, with strip view on 45th floor. Amazing. The bathroom and showers were beautiful and good. But no lock on the bathroom door which I found odd. They should have tea/coffee facilities in the room!!! Concierge was miserable and asking him to book me into a restaurant was such a chore. The air freshner pumped through the aircon that mixes with the smoke becomes quite sickly.... The resort is stunning. The staff are great. Don't think I could stay anywhere else now....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: KarenD506
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked a Southwest vacation package and originally booked the hotel with the Venetian. Once we arrived, we decided to spend a little more and upgrade to the Palazzo, Prestige Luxury Suite. We stayed there for four nights and just arrived back today. With the Prestige, we had breakfast each morning with a newspaper, appetizers in the evening, unlimited nonalcoholic beverages all day, unlimited use of the spa, etc. We felt that since we had our kids with us, the upgrade would pay for itself with breakfast and drinks, and we are so glad that we upgraded. The suite had so much room, and the beds were very comfortable (Sealy). The hotel is connected to the Venetian and there are lots of high end shops. It made for a great place to go walking early in the morning, especially since the spa did not open until 6 am. My family had a wonderful time at the pool. I loved staying in the hotel because at night we did not have to go outside the hotel, which was great with the kids. The concierge was great, and we were able to rent a car with Avis (located downstairs) and go to Hoover Dam for the day. We also ate a lot at the Grand Lux Cafe, which is very similar to Cheesecake Factory. When we decide to go back to Vegas, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice update on the old Venetian suites”
Reviews.Author: jazzman7777
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Venetian many, many times I found the rooms to be dated. I noticed they started creating new wings, but when they opened the Palazzo, they really did it right. The check in is efficient and everyone is very helpful. I like that they are attached to the Venetian so you can share the Canal shops and restaurants, but the Palazzo has its own good shops and restaurants without having to hike through the casino. The only downside is I don't think they utilized the space in the rooms very well. I had a lot of empty spaces and then crammed next to my desk was a table with an obnoxious fax machine and a big tangle of cords to wade through in order to plug in your laptop and phone. Overall, I would stay there again, especially if you're at a show/convention at the venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: ALWAYSTRAVELWELL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for a bachelorette party. Compared to other hotels on the strip, I didn't think we had to walk to far to get to the room eleveators (of course through the casino). We got 2 adjoining rooms for 7 people and had plenty of space. The rooms had the 2 queen beds and then step down to a little living room with a huge L shaped couch. I've stayed at the Venetian before and it just looked/felt warn down compared to the Palazzo. The room was quiet which is impressive considering this is Vegas! Plenty of shopping and places to eat within walking distance and of course you are right on the strip, but it's a bit to the far end/next to the Wynn. The Canyon Ranch spa is attached to the property and I've heard that's very nice. We partied at the adults only pool on Saturday - you have to buy a certain amount of food/drinks for a lounge chair, but it was tons of fun and money well spent. If you're eating at the pool I highly recommend the club sandwhich. Our room was on the 22nd floor and didn't have much a view, but who needs to see anything from your hotel room, just walk out onto the strip. I'd highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Rooms are great, However, I'd think instead of putting some old, antiquated FAX machine in each room a coffee maker would serve most guests much better. Funny how these places seem to think they're providing all the ammenties possible to their guests when leave out the most basic. So, if your up early like me, enjoy your 10-15 hike for your morning brew. Oh yes, for this slight inconvenience you'll pay $250-500 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Relaxation Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Auntysam19
Reviews.Content: This Resort is amazing, they absoluty have everything to do and see. My friends and I did not make it to the strip until the last day as the Resort had to much to do and offer. We will always stay at this Resort when visiting Vegas:) The Front Desk was able to accommodate connecting rooms for us so it made our suites that much bigger-very thankful for that! Couple things that could have been better: -Did not know nor where explained how to use our fridge/mini bar. -LAVO is an extreamly hard club to get into, even when you purchase wristbands online, in advance, are a "Gold Member" or spend $300.+ at their LAVO Restaurant which is connected to the club. -Takes some time to get your bill at one of the Restaurants, I don't recall the name but we ate there 4 times and each time it was a process to get our check. -New pool area "Azure" does not have a lot of space for groups of people, there were 5 of us trying to relax and get our tan on but couldn't (at least on the day we tried to go.. In the regular pool area there are servers for alcohol but not food, everyone knows when your in Vegas and drinking all day you need to eat! On the plus side they have an amazing Spa!!! WE had all had a service the first day and went back the following days and paid $20. as a hotel guest to us the steam room, relaxation rooms, etc. Also I booked with Expedai and was given all kinds of coupons to use for the Resort. Overall this is a lovely place to relax/party/get away-we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel and spa”
Reviews.Author: Jenny K
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is very nice, I was kind of surprise that there were no bath robes in a nice hotel like this. I went to the canyon ranch spa club to see how it looks like since the resort fee covers it. I went to see how the steam room looks like, because that is the only thing that I enjoy in the spa. But, I did not have a good experience about the visit, one of the staff was very rude and asked me if I needed a locker, the minute I told her that I was just looking around.
