She immediately told me that i can't and told me that i have to pay $20 to get in there. All she has to tell me nicely that the resort fee does not cover the spa area that I was not aware. I felt looked down by her, and was upset foe the entire day on my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo, The Venetian's big brother”
Reviews.Author: Joe D
Reviews.Content: Outstanding high end property. Junior suite was spacious and well appointed. Great views, killer bathroom. Room Service prompt and great selections. The property itself, sharing a ton of public space with The Venetian is sprawling and elegant. The casino's are massive and the restaurants are some of the finest in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like a King for the weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel F
Reviews.Content: Great experience, room was amazing, staff was friendly, and excellent hotel. Felt like a king during my stay. Shaq stayed at Palazzo during my stay, so you know this place is the real deal!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay just as great as the first”
Reviews.Author: 04eagle
Reviews.Content: Every staff member from check in to departure is friendly, courteous and customer focused. We stayed four nights and a standard room is a suite with excellent amenities. Our third night stay we had neighbors insistent on partying all night and letting everyone know about it. Now I'm all for having fun, but once 4am hits, I am ready for a little sleep. It was obvious to us that we needed to move to a quieter room with our need to be up at 3am to make our early flight. The staff was extremely apologetic and assisted in helping us move to a new room and comped some charges we had on our room previously. With the Palazzo connected to the Venetian, you have all the sights, shops and amenities of both resorts. The pool, spa and fitness facilities are available to you as well! If you want an enjoyable stay or business or fun, consider this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Annual Trek to Vegas Leads to the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: 4haynasmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas each March for an annual trade show that is held at the Sands Convention Center. Both the Venetian and Palazzo are connected to this convention center, making it rather convenient to stay right there (instead of other area hotels where I would have to take a convention bus to get me back and forth). The Palazzo is the newer of the 2 hotels and it shows. We stayed at the Venetian in 2011 to save a few bucks but the wallpaper was pealing and I didn't think it was worth it for what they charge. So this year, it was back to the Palazzo which did not disappoint. We upgraded to a suite because we usually have business meetings off the convention floor. We were given a suite on the 47th floor which was beautiful, very roomy, and even had an elliptical if we felt so inclined! The first morning, I called down for room service and was told that it would be delivered in 45 minutes. An hour and a half later, totally frustrated since we needed to leave shortly, the coffee and oatmeal showed up. Although the server was apologetic, we learned a lesson and called down the night before to order breakfast so we would get it on time. We ate in several restaurants within the hotel complex, mostly good, although most are fairly pricey. Each year I make an appointment at the Canyon Ranch Spa to have my hair done. They do a great job and are very professional. If you need to look good on the show floor, you need to make this a stop the day before.

Reviews.Title: “Five star luxury hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: Diskdr
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a little extra and booked a suite at The Palazzo, Prestige Luxury Suite, which has just become part of the Holiday inn Intercontential group as is its sister hotel the ventian. The Palazzo Prestige suites access to the lounge, champange welcome and personal conceirge service - see http://www.palazzo.com/Las-Vegas-Accommodations/Prestige-Suites/Luxury-Suite/ but first, you can gain a better deal by buying Ambassador status for $200. Give that you are upgraded - which would cost $45 a night, to the next room level, in our case a view room. In hindsight we should have gone for the next suite up and the upgrade would have been to a suite with its own sitting room. We stayed 22 March to 29th - The hotel and staff are perfect. On arrival Hector booked us in and when we went to room 24 (floor) 810 we were disappointed with the view - hector took this in his stride and we were offer 42 (floor) 910 - the view was better - i wish i had asked to upgrade - but the room was nice. Being off the main prestige levels 23-26 - (floors) meant that the room turndown and newspaper was erractic. But the room was excellent - cleaning perfect, and the bed comfortable. During our stay Hector was ill and in stepped Joshua - and ensured the threatre booking were best seats for the price - the louge was great - good breakfast all be it contential, the free drinks 5pm to 8pm, set up the evening ventures to the slots perfectly. The hotel is stunning - rows of expensive shops. It is connected to The Ventian which has an in door and out door canal with gondolas (at $16 for a short trip) - better to watch. the painting and St Marks square - venice like. We walked the strip, visited all the hotels and decided we had struck lucky with the Palazzo, rating, the Belligio, Wynne and Encore as excellent too. To Hector and Joshua, and Michelle who made our visits extra special, - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “best service in vegas”
Reviews.Author: diamondseeker
Reviews.Content: we cancelled our reservation at the Encore and booked at the Palazzo because my wife enjoyed our poolside breakfast and the service provided by Kelsey. She served us again this year and is just as terrific. Belinda, the poolside server brought us 2 rounds of drinks at the Palazzo one day and then warmly greeted us, remembering our name the next day. Even the doorman said welcome back Mr. Thompson in subsequent encounters. Rooms @740 square feet are luxurious and warmer than Encore. The pool loungers have a 4inch foam topper on them. Lisa H. in guest services has always been a great help with reservations Casino is spacious and free of oppressive smoke. Best las vegas experience, hand down. Thanks to the friendly service by the team above, I'll be back in April.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlantaheel
Reviews.Content: Have been going here for several years. The suite rooms are huge. The hotel is joined with the Venetian making it a huge complex. The palazzo is the newer wing with more updated suites. The entire place has all the things you could want making leaving the premise almost pointless. The sports book is open and the food options are great. The spa at the Canyon Ranch is excellent with Separate and common areas. The gambling at the tables starts mainly at $25 but they have lessons most days to teach you how to play most of the table games. Few lower dollar tables are available. This allows for more availability at the tables, but may put some people off. Tao Beach is amazing but only open during certain warmer months. The pools are standard but have poolside gambling which is awesome on nicer days. I will be going back . Not sure if I would call this a kid friendly destination.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Kevin P
Reviews.Content: Everything about this resort is excellent. Rooms are large with plenty of seating. Food is excellent. Staff courteous. One of the best properties in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable rooms”
Reviews.Author: gazm
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years I have got into the habit of trying one of the "fancier" hotels for a few days during the week before moving to my usual haunt at the Orleans at the weekends. This time I decided to try the Palazzo after getting a really good deal on a hotels website. I expected it to be nice but that was an understatement. The basic suite was enormous at over 700 square feet and was absolutely stunning. Separate bedroom and sitting room areas with a high class bathroom thrown in made it an outstanding choice. Upgraded to a high strip view( no pressure to do this) and got a room overlooking TI and with great views all the way to the mountains in the distance. Tried the Grand Lux cafe which had an extensive menu at very reasonable prices and was hardly able to eat the whole portions served. The casino was very plush and had a decent choice of slots which were not overly tight. All in all I was very happy with this resort and would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo .... wow!”
Reviews.Author: MollyColly
Reviews.Content: What an exquisite hotel .... we had a luxury room with a view over the strip, overlooking Treasure Island, just fabulous. Considering it overlooked the strip, it was surprisingly quiet. I cant say enough about the room ...... large, comfortable, beautiful bed, luxurious bathroom, so many tvs, so clean ...... just lovely, the best accommodation of our trip across the USA and the least expensive! The staff were all polite and well spoken, cheerful and helpful, the surrounds of the hotel was just amazing, however the casino was unfortunately not forthcoming in large winnings! But fun anyway! We wandered around the hotels on the strip and can say quite confidentally that If I was ever to travel to Las Vegas again, I would stay here again in a heartbeat! PS. Make sure you allow plenty of time to get thru airport security when leaving LV as it took an hour and 15 minutes to clear security for a 7.30am flight to JFK

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mona a
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! perfect location on the strip. Connected to the Venetian. Nice and clean rooms, comfortable beds! Great casino!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: MUST STAY HERE! Room was amazing, front desk could not have been better. Was in town for a conference of more than 40,000 people - and they were able to accomodate me and my team to make our stay the best as possible. Rooms are modern, sleek and updated compared to the rooms in the Venetian. Stronglt recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Where You Could Find Your Room”
Reviews.Author: marionation1
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Venetian regularly for several years. I guess I'm a creature of habit. For the first time I accepted a friend's request to try out the Palazzo next door. I did and am I glad I did. Very nice hotel connected to the shops and the Venetian and Walgreens. I never know when I need to visit Walgreens. Could I add that Lagasee's Stadium Sports Book/Sports Bar is the best Sports Bar I have ever seen! The casino was small and did not wreak of cigarettes. It had everything you need along with nearly full tables all night which is what I look for. From the lobby it is a straight walk through the small casino to the hotel elevators. Perfect! The rooms were reasonably priced and very updated. We got a Prestige Suite which means you check in on the 23rd floor with a champagne reception, free top shelf happy hour every evening and complimentary breakfast buffet every morning. Perfect again. I'm a Priority Club member and have a Priority Club Visa, so the more I spend at the hotel the closer I am earning more free nights to come back. A win-win situation. All in all, this is a fabulous underrated resort with trying.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: meg g
Reviews.Content: I love,love, love the Palazzo. Everything about it is first rate. I used to go to the Venetian, and it is pretty nice, but the Palazzo is decadent. The shops, the food, the Canyon Ranch spa are all top of the line. I highly recommend staying here. Also, I want my bedroom and bathroom at home to look like the Palazzo suites. I even called the Palazzo about their furniture, decor, etc. No luck!!! It is always so nice to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: MelissaWP
Reviews.Content: The luxury suites offered at this hotel are absolutely spacious and beautiful! The decor is elegant, the pool is gorgeous, the restaurants are plentiful, and the staff are friendly. The HUGE bathroom (double sinks, TV, separate toilet room, make-up table, glass shower) alone makes you want to never leave. We enjoyed our dinner at Lavo Restaurant and our time at Lavo Nightclub. We ate at the Grand Luxe Cafe twice as they offer a large menu selection with available seating at any time. We utilized the awesome gym with built-in fans and TVs in the cardio equipment. One downside is that coffee is too expensive and should be offered in the room with a coffee pot to make your own. Although the Canyon Ranch Spa is amazing and beautiful with a lot to offer, I did not have a good experience with the expensive massage on my birthday as it was too rough for my liking even after asking to reduce the pressure. Overall, a beauitful and luxurious hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many other hotels on the strip, and our stay at the Palazzo was one of the best we have experienced. The rooms were nice. We were on the 49th floor with a strip view. The room was very spacious. The elevators were quick (we had a problem with long elevator waits at other hotels). The staff was awesome. We like all the varieties of restaurants from fast food to elegant dining. The casino had great slot selections and we always had fun at the tables. We like the location of the Palazzo on the strip. It is an easy walk to some of our other favorites places to hang. We will definetly be staying here next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: Grant K
Reviews.Content: Venetian / Palazzo is the standard of excellence in every way. Staff and property could not be better. Instead of traveling abroad, on a cruise we always suggest our family and friends consider visiting Venetian / Palzzo as we find the overall experience to be superior.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Hotel and Casino Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Peku K
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas 8-10 times every year, and I have stayed at nearly all the casino hotels. Venetian used to be one of my top picks, and Palazzo is the slightly newer addition to Venetian. The place is very beautiful, everything is in slightly newer condition than at the Venetian next door, the staff was super friendly, and the overall experience was wonderful. Only minor complaint I have is that it seemed to me that everything cost very much - minibar, drinks, etc., and I would say that The Palazzo is definitely not for a budget traveler. ..yet I still highly recommend the place. Location is also great and there is a big shopping mall a very short walking distance away. Peku K Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Title: “No complimentary tea and coffee”
Reviews.Author: issie69
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel!!!! The room was amazing. Amazing views so huge, lovely bathroom. Some small niggles with the phone not working, but was fixed. don't touch the mini bar unless you want to be charged. Bit hard to sleep. No fresh air and air con dried you out rather.Be careful which button you press on the tv remote as you can easily accidentally BUY a movie rental pay per view. Now for such an incredible hotel NO COMPLIMENTARY TEA AND COFFEE. PALAZZO GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER PLEASE.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Dino033
Reviews.Content: This hotel is phenomenal!!! All the decor in the lobby areas is just amazing to look at. The rooms are top notch and HUGE! You most definitely get what you pay for with this one! I can only think of one "kind of" negative thing to say and that was the smell they infuse into the hotel. It's very strong! Smells dont really bother me but if your sensitive to smell or get headaches from that kind of thing, be aware. They will offer you a strip view room if you didn't book one, and it's pretty cheap ugrade. I'd do it. If you don't, the view of the other side of the city kind of sucks. If you're never in your room, then no worries! This hotel is Amazing!! All you can say about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: julze15
Reviews.Content: the Palazzo has the complete & utter wow factor so clean so fresh so outstandingly new looking.Even though its a couple of years old now. It is attached to the Venetian & you can wander through the both without thinking it is a different hotel. It is on the expensive side & the shops are just for window shopping. The staff were polite & very helpfull. The room was beautiful, So huge the bath room had bath shower toilet dressing area & separate his & her basins. & a tv. the bed so huge so comfy so wanted to bring it home Best nights sleep. The room also had a lounge area We just loved it who needs 3 tvs in one hotel room?? but we made sure we used them. The view we got was the golf course at the Wynn & the waterfall on the course. the sunset was lovely. The pool area was completley lush a couple of hot tubs & at least 3 pools lost count. So clean so fresh. If we could find a fault was the extra $22 dollar a night charge when checking out. For that you got a free paper (if you wanted one no thanks) free internet room access & use of the spa ranch. would recomment the Palazzo

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: MafiaPrincess571
Reviews.Content: Located right next to the Venetian and only just 2 years old. Amazingly beautiful and located right in the heart of the strip. Rooms are incredible and the bathroom is wonderful. Bed is incredibly comfortable. Very luxurious. Just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: esmer
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the stay. I stayed for the Canyon Ranch Spa. The rooms were great, comfortable and clean; and so was the service at the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Clean large rooms, great location, recommended especially if you can get a good rate.”
Reviews.Author: Wonkywave
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Pallazzo and enjoyed it. It is in a very good location on the Strip. It is very clean, new, and has great air quality throughout compared to other hotels and casinos on the Strip. The rooms are very big and have a nice layout.The casino even had a non smoking section. It has many good food options and is connected to the Venecian which is a great place to wander through. Prices were a bit high, however it is to be expected with the quality of your surroundings. The pool area was also huge and impressive. I recommend requesting a Strip view. If you do you should be able to see the pirate show and fireworks at Treasure Island accross the street each evening. Overall it was a great stay for my wife, two year old, and I. I would recommend trying this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Not as spectacular as anticipated”
Reviews.Author: vacationhoundToronto
Reviews.Content: The room at the Palazzo was nice, but not outstanding. Our room on the 33rd floor was quiet, but very stuffy and dry. The service at the Palazzo was okay, but not unbelievable. I found the service in the restaurants less than okay, but the food was good and plentiful. It is a very large complex and it has everything you would need, but I would try one of the other 'nice' hotels in Vegas (Mirage, Belaggio, MGM, Wynn), before coming back to Palazzo/Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Ah! the Good Life”
Reviews.Author: BillMassParkNY
Reviews.Content: Class hotel from check-in to check-out Rooms are spacious - two levels - 'living room' n a bedroom . . a TV in each, of course and not to forget the one in the bathroom - just like at home NOT! Hotel staff was A+ as was the Casino staff - very willing and able to help with any questions. Casino floor is open - no claustrophobia here - the Venetian is a bit less open but still plenty of space to roam. A very big plus is the abiltiy to enjoy both the Palazzo and Venetian - restaurants, shops and casinos. Both of the hotels are stunning and well maintained. A bit too cool to do the pools this time but they were top shelf last time we visited. The Palazzo is certainly on our 'must' list for the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Emily B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at palazzo. The hotel was beautiful and smelled good. Loved our room and the view. Couldn't ask for better.

Reviews.Title: “One of best spots on las vegas strip.”
Reviews.Author: 1stdiva
Reviews.Content: I have stay at Palazzo several times and I just love it. It is always beautifully decorated and clean. The rooms are beautiful, large and bed is super comfortable. Love it. You should stay and try it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angiemg2121
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for my bachelorette party. This hotel was wonderful! For a group of girls staying on the strip, we always felt secure there, comfortable, and taken care of. The place was well run, the staff extremely helpful, and the room was very clean & huge. Seperate living and sleeping areas and huge bathroom, which ranks high with a group of girls. The room service was quick and amazing. And when we needed to have our bags taken out, they were there in 5 minutes. The clubs there were great and casino has lots of options as well. Everyone there was more than accomodating. After staying here, I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Luxury”
Reviews.Author: UntamedAZlady
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Las Vegas so I have no other casino hotels to which I can compare, but the rooms were comfortable and clean. The suites large with many amenities, the bathroom enormous! The shower is big enough to throw a party in and the large soaking tub is bliss. I love that there is a seperate vanity/make-up table with lighted magnifying mirror, velvet cushioned stool, etc. as well as his and her sinks. I found it a bit odd that the water (toilet) closet has a multi-line telephone for those important conference calls that just can't wait until you get off the loo, but lacks a ventillation fan. Really? The security staff is inconsistent. One guy will be at the podium near the elevators and not let you past without showing your room key and ID, the next time you walk past a different guard doesn't even look at you. I was there for a whole week and it was different every time I walked by. I would stay here again, if nothing else for the marvelous bathoom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeewinotTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay on the Strip. The front desk staff was very friendly, and helped us choose a room from among several choices. Our room was spacious, quiet, clean, and comfortable. The internet was fast, and there were 3 LCD TVs in the room. The Grand Lux Cafe served delicious food at a resonable price. Watch out for the drink prices, though. The adjacent Venetian poker room was first class. We missed having a refrigerator and microwave in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico”
Reviews.Author: plantmanW_p_bch_Fl
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star property currently at a 3 star price. On of the finest hotels in Las Vegas, but maybe not for families with small children. Room /suite is hugh, larger than most NYC 0ne bdrm appartments. Dining options between Palazzo/Venetian are some of the best in town. Center strip location is great. Casino is very nice and less smokey then many others. Enjoy and good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: cbolan
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was amazing. We stayed at Caesar's for the first part of our stay and regretted not staying at the Palazzo the entire trip once we saw how nice it was. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It's hard to leave”
Reviews.Author: mda1701
Reviews.Content: Nobody does it better than this hotel/resort from the pool to the restaurants as this being my 5th stay in the past 6 years i can say it only has become even a better place to have your Vegas fun!! The only problem is its hard to leave! You an easily spend your entire vacation on property..... Forget the Wynn forget the encore forget Caesars this one beats them hands down there is no "second best room or suite" all top self and ALL the money you spend counts toward your status that's right so go buy a 2,000 watch or any other expense be it food drink or shoes it all goes to it... So when your wife wants that nice necklace or ring or whatever you at least know your getting recognized for your pain. lol

Reviews.Title: “Prestige Service, Outstanding, Suites abd Views are Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MikeTee530
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Palazzo Prestige this week was outstanding. Good friends and customers were arriving from China to visit the USA and Las Vegas. I contacted Joshua Yoo, Prestige Concierge for help, with Joshua's recommendations I booked five Prestige Suites with Strip views, interconnecting where necessary, Joshua also booked all the details for my guest visit, airport limo transfers, Private Limo Night Tour of Vegas, all limo transfers for dinner reservations, and show reservations, and provided me a printed detailed itinerary to keep me on track. I strongly recommend the Prestige at the Palazzo and Joshua Yoo, service is outstanding, and lounge has great views, well-appointed decor, an Amazing Staff, excellent complimentary breakfast, refreshment during the day and an ample commentary cocktail hour with excellent Hors d’Oeuvres. Authentic Cantonese Chinese food was one of my key concerns, Noodle Asia located off the Casino floor was the perfect place, there were no communication issues with Noodle Asia's staff, the food was authentic, fresh and excellent value for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “One and done”
Reviews.Author: traveler2024
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of the Palazzo we were excited to give it a try. We have stayed at many hotels on and off the Strip, and we thought this hotel next to the Venetian would be top-notch. First impressions: efficient valet parking, beautiful lobby and short wait in line to check in. The check in process was a little lengthy as there was so much information given on everything from the snacks for purchase in the room (one little movement of a box of snacks will incur a charge) to the strict check out time of 11:00 am and if we go one minute past the check out time we will be charged. The nice feature on the layout of the hotel is that there is a straight line short walk from the hotel lobby to the guest room elevators, so guests do not have a long walk through the casino to get to their rooms. We had the Bella Suite and liked the size of the room and the bathroom, but upon closer inspection were disappointed at the worn furnishings. The sectional sofa was stained and had a missing button and loose elastic thread, the bureau and table were scratched up and tacky, the carpet was worn and the phones were outdated. The hotel is 5 years old but the furniture seemed like it was 10 years old or older. The staff were friendly and efficient when we requested toiletries and towels, and the quality of the toiletries was excellent. The wifi was a little tedious to get set up, and was not lightening fast but adequate. With the resort fee of $20.00 per day, we thought there would be a paper delivered to our suite daily, but no, we were told that complimentary papers were available downstairs near the coffee shop. The only papers to be found were in the convenience store across from the coffee shop and were not complimentary. All in all, we were not wowed by the Palazzo and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Luxury in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at many Vegas properties and most recently I stayed at the Wynn, which I think is outstanding...but The Palazzo was even better. From the moment you pull up, it is nothing but luxury and has a very upscale feel. When you walk in the door you are greeted with beautiful sculptures, waterfalls and the casino is beautiful. We stayed on the 26th floor in one of the nice suites and the room was absolutely beautiful. Spacious, clean, well appointed--it was like having a studio apartment. All of the lights and drapes were remote control, which was a nice touch. The bathroom was also nice with marble sinks, nice shower and separate tub. I also like when the toilet is separate--which it was. I did not feel like I was in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorite Vegas hotels!”
Reviews.Author: castro_boom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palazzo a couple of times and every time has been amazing, you get a lot of perks by being part of their players club. I love the great variety of restaurants, bars and shops. My room has always been spotless and the view lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip location, beautifully decorated all suite rooms”
Reviews.Author: susie604
Reviews.Content: First stay at this hotel, great location across from Fashion Show shopping mall. The Palazzo is part of the Venetion resort so lots to do within the hotel. St Marks square is a nice addition and Wolfgang Pucks restaurant there was a find. Outdoor pools are plentiful and beautifully landscaped. Lovely Spa! The Prestige level is an option at approximately $100 more per room per night (based on 2 people). This gets you your own check in and concierge, breakfast, happy hour drinks and appetizers each day in a private lounge with great views from level 23. Prestige levels/rooms also includes the $20 per night resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “good venue in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Luca C
Reviews.Content: I have been there several times for business and, well, this place has all that you may expect for a high class hotel in Vegas. Casino, posh restaurants, night clubs and expensive shops pretending to be classy but mostly trivial in the result. The suites are well equipped and nice the services are good - except for the security which is rude. If you go there ask for a suite facing the back, you will see the desert instead of the strip, which helps.

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly!!!!”
Reviews.Author: honeydew10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean and roomy too, however not for a young family! I was here for my friend's bachelorette party, so I had to leave my infant at home, who still is breast feeding. I understand it is my choice to breast feeding and it shouldn't be anyone's problem, but this hotel does not offer freezer selection in their fridge, nor can you rent one with it. Plus they refused to let me store my breast milk in their freezer, because it is against their code. Therefore, I had to throw away all my breast milk that I had pumped out. Plus the hotel doesn't have coffee maker or kettle for me to make hot water to clean my breast pump equipments, the only way to get hot water was from room service! The hotel also charged $20 per day for so call "resort fee" which also includes Internet, however the connection is really poor, and had to call the helpdesk many times to solve the problem. Therefore, I would not recommend this hotel if you need to store things in the freezer department or like to have a coffee or kettle in room, plus don't mind paying for the $20 resort fee for each day. But I personally would not stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean room in hotel that has alot to offer its customers”
Reviews.Author: travelinkelly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel whe he attended a business conference here. Our hotel room was very clean with many nice touches including jetted tub and tv in the bathroom, extra toiletry supplies and vanity desk with lighted mirror. The gym was very good with modern equipment and helpful staff. I had room service here and although I did expect it to be expensive - I didn't expect it to be as good as it was. The quality and taste of the food exceeded my expectations. I liked the convenience of this hotel to the shopping at fashion show mall and the strip. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: finallyavacation29
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with seperate seating area, good for relaxing without sitting on the bed. Nice views of Wynn and east side of strip. The hotel is only a few years old and is beautiful in and out. But this can be on the pricey side of vegas. Drinks and meals will be on the high end as well as the gambling. But if the price is right it's worth it at least once.

Reviews.Title: “spoiled”
Reviews.Author: solarpwdrd
Reviews.Content: I have now been ruined for regular hotel rooms in Vegas. The suite at Palazzo was so roomy and comfortable it was a pleasure to return to each evening. My husband needed to work while we were there and he had plenty of room to spread his papers out. The casino is small but who stays in one place in Vegas anyway. We ate at the Lux cafe more than once because the food was really good. Unusual for us since we are foodies that like to explore new places. As many times as we have been to Vegas I would have thought nothing could surprise me. I was surprised at how much we liked the Palazzo. The staff was the most courteous of anywhere we have stayed on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: FranknDebbie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on an anniversary trip, and picked the Palazzo as our 'base' for Las Vegas. Pros: the room/suite is really nice. A single room, so technically not a suite, but certainly very spacious, well appointed, and very quiet (an unusual thing in Las Vegas). Parking was easy and excellent, check in friendly. When we arrived, the maid who was nearby asked us if we needed extra towels, etc., and a maintenance man was there, to make sure the television in the bathroom was working - such great service, without us asking for it - amazing! Cons: there is a $20/day resort fee, for the internet, health club, and daily newspaper. We wish it was inidividually priced, since we did not use the health club, and never received the newspaper; did use the internet wi-fi connection. Wish it was simply built into the room rate. Second, there is an annoying red light fixture in the ceiling, that blinks every time someone in the room moved - turns out it is an air conditioning sensor, but my wife found it disturbed her sleep, and made the stay somewhat uncomfortable. Why do they need that light? So, in the end, a great, but not perfect, experience.

Reviews.Title: “First Time's a Charm!”
Reviews.Author: Scout1960
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our very first Vegas vacation, and we barely scratched the surface of all there is to do. We had a reservation for a luxury suite at The Venetian but were offered an upgrade to a room with a view at The Palazzo. Wow, what an upgrade! The suite overlooked the Strip, and at 33 floors high, we could watch erupting volcanoes and passing helicopters without enduring any of the noise from the road or the adjacent construction site. The casino is beautiful and not too smoky, and we even managed to take some of its money home with us. All in all, it was the perfect Vegas vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel, fun surroundings”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaKololia
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Palazzo. It is ridiculous that Trip Advisor rates the Red Rock hotel above the Palazzo. The Palazzo is much nicer than the Red Rock (we stayed at both places on our recent anniversary trip to Vegas and I wish we had booked the Palazzo for the whole trip). I played blackjack in the Casino, and had a friendly, funny dealer, which always adds to the enjoyment of the game. The Palazzo is elegant and it is located in wonderful surroundings. We enjoyed very good food and the staff was very friendly and helpful. This is my new destination of choice in Vegas. Next time I'd like to try the spa treatments, and maybe some of the yoga classes that are offered in the Canyon Ranch spa.

Reviews.Title: “Better Casino Hotels Available”
Reviews.Author: Walk_With_Stick
Reviews.Content: For a gambler, this casino hotel is not on par with several other luxury properties on the strip. The size of the casino is small but with a short inside walk you can arrive on the floor of the much larger Venetian casino. If you bet sports, the Venetian race and sports book has a nice video wall for viewing but for betting it's bad. They offer the gambler very bad odds on sports wagers, for horseplayers they do not offer overnight scratch sheets and the entire book is smoke-free. Now I understand having part of the area smoke-free but not all of it. By comparison, you can smoke almost evrywhere on the casino floor except in designated smoke-free areas. I took all my gambling activities to other casinos. Since The Palazzo is all suites, 'room size' is not an issue. The Grand Lux Cafe(Cheesecake Factory) has good food, but menu service starts at 7:00am; earlier you can only order the breakfast buffet, so if you only want toast & coffee, etc. you either pay the buffet price or don't eat until 7:00am. This is no way to run a coffee shop/restaurant. Other morning coffe shops available in Venetian but they are not a 'restaurant' facility. I'll stay at a different luxury casino hotel(i.e. Bellagio) next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for convention”
Reviews.Author: scbwino
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when attending an event at the Sands Expo center, which is no more than a 5-10 minute walk from the elevators. Rooms are large and very nice. Only negative is I arrived late and was placed in an accessable room - shower head keeo following down abd water splashed all over the bathroom floor.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, getting a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: bagladyolg
Reviews.Content: The Pallazo is a nice property and the rooms are big for Las Vegas. The room is large with a sunken living room, desk, and several large screen televisions. The bathroom was the best part......double sink, makeup table with magnifying mirror and large tub and shower stall, although the shower smelled a bit musty. I found the rooms and furnishings to be a bit shabby. I know that happens quickly in Las Vegas but it is still inexcusable in a hotel of that caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms - nice resort”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my partner on a business trip to Las Vegas and enjoyed my stay at The Palazzo. Newer than the Venetian, I found the facilities to be of higher functioning quality and cleaner. We were lucky enough to snag a Strip-view room on the 39th floor and enjoyed watching the Treasure Island volcano erupt at night. Conference staff were top-notch and the rest of our interactions with staff members were a mixed bag with some going out of their way to be of assistance (Security) while others couldn't be bothered (Grazie and Housekeeping). In fact, my only real negative experiences were with housekeeping for a variety of reasons including some cleanliness issues like not exchanging the wine/water glasses and former guest business cards and rubbish on the floor as well. I was also disappointed that they did not visit my room twice during my five night stay, even though it was available from 11-5. I also noticed that even though the hotel conserves water only changing sheets when requested, it also claims the sheets will be changed on your 3rd night regardless and they were not. None of these issues are terribly significant but I was surprised to be asked on my second day there why I had not left the room yet and if I had a late check-out -- I explained I was actually there for 3 more nights. On the actual check-out day, housekeeping attempted to enter the room at 9:30 am and luckily I had the bar lock over the door preventing their entry because they provided a quick rudimentary knock before attempting to open the door. Resort Fee Tip: The resort fee includes a complimentary newspaper and coffee daily at Cafe Presse on the second floor near the guest elevators - don't miss it! Fee also includes access to the fitness facility with a variety of cardio, assisted weights, and free weights available. Unfortunately I only found out on my last day there that I could pay $20 to attend a group fitness class which would give me access to the various water features of the spa for the remainder of the day - a bargain and a feature I would certainly have utilized. Location Tip: Check out Walgreens in between The Palazzo and The Venetian for quick convenience needs and to stock up on water and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: kelly b
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo would be getting five stars if they simply had an i-pod dock in the room. Yes, you can rent one from the audio visual department during your stay but it is $35 per day. Meaning, if you stay for the weekend, it will cost you $70 for a crappy speaker that has been played too many times. You can actually buy one across the street at the fashion show mall for a better price. We stayed at the Golden Nugget (Nov 2011) and the Encore (Dec 2011), both which came with one in the room. Knowing this, I opted not to bring my own in March 2012, as I assumed a hotel like the Palazzo would have them in their rooms as a standard. On the positive front, both of my rooms, the room service, the overall attentiveness of the staff deserves 5 stars. I would recommend this hotel to my friends & family, just advise them to bring thier own speaker if they want to listen to music while getting ready to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Live the good life and a great price”
Reviews.Author: jhaleyusa
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a beautiful property. The people are Very friendly and willing to listen to your requests and smile like they actually care about what you are saying ! The rooms are very spacious, with king bed, great linens, sunken living room, 3 flat screen tv's, huge bathroom with soaking tub and glass shower. My wife loved the seperate sit down make up area. Mini bar is fully stocked. Room service is great and reasonably priced. We found very little smoking in the hotel, and this place does not smell like smoke !! We saw very few kids. The shops here link into the Venetian shops and are fantastic if you like shopping. The rooms have a great view of Vegas and the large windows are airport terminal glass making the rooms very quiet. The room comes with remote control curtians and sheer which are pretty cool ! The sunken living room has a 8 person sectional, with a hidden pop out double bed, a 4 person pub table, and a desk compete with copier/fax/printer. Wireless internet is free and high speed. The casino dealers and bar staff were very friendly. As in anywhere on the Vegas strip, drinks were very over priced, so ask your cab driver to stop by the liquor store on the way from the airport and stock your room to save you som BIG money ! Over all the Palazzo is a winner !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classy and the smoke free area in casino a "breath of fresh air"”
Reviews.Author: pw0867
Reviews.Content: Just go to other casinos that don't have a smoke free area and you'll see what I mean. Choking, and cloying musty smoking aroma that permeates everything. The casino in the Palazzo isn't all smoke free, but man, was there a difference compared to other places. The hotel is beautiful and is connected to the Venetian, which is also spectacular. The decor of the Palazzo is tasteful, upscale, and the Venetian is a bit over the top for decor, but still beautiful. The shoppes at the palazzo and Venetian are spectacular with gondolas and small canal and ceiling painted like the sky. High end shops (ie. $$$$. Bring cash or your first born child). The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Free wifi. Nice pool and hot tubs, but even drinks for kids was $7. Gym is good. The parkade has two entrances - one for the front desk and the other for the casino is CLOSER TO THE GUEST ROOMS, SO PARK CLOSE TO THIS ONE AFTER CHECKING IN!!! It is a pain to walk through the casino everytime and this cuts down the distance. The Grand Lux cafe - a real gem and the food was excellent, and reasonably priced (even if you weren't in Vegas). It's also close to everything - you can walk

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Resort Hotel ~ Prestige Level Review”
Reviews.Author: TravelExpert007
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on staying at the Palazzo it is worth your time to look into upgrading your stay and pay the extra nightly charge to gain access to the 23rd floor i.e. Prestige Level. I did a lot of research before booking and honestly did not find that much by way of reviews for the Prestige Level. So, I wanted to let you know what you can expect! You however must decide if you think it is worth the extra money. In my opinion it is worth every penny! The lounge area is huge at about 11,000 square feet! There are lots of tables, soft and big comfortable chairs as well as lots of couches and a few large screen TVs. However what sets this place apart is the view, day or night, it is breathtaking with floor to ceiling windows of the Las Vegas Strip and the distant mountain range. This is a great spot any time of the day when you want to get away from the noise of the casino and just need a break to relax to hear yourself think! If you are in Vegas on business there is one section of the lounge where there is a large conference room area that can be reserved and closed off if you need to have a private meeting. Bathrooms are also located within the lounge on the end closest to the meeting space. The lounge also allows you access to a small business center i.e. a space with four computers and a printer provided at no extra charge. So, you can take your time checking your email or print out your boarding pass. The floor itself has complimentary Wi-Fi access throughout. The lounge has DVD Library if you are in the mood to take a movie back in your room. You can also request some fresh popcorn to enjoy with your movie. A USA Today newspaper will be hung on your door for every morning of your stay and you are allowed complimentary local and 1-800 calling as well. By upgrading to the Prestige Level this qualifies you for private champagne check in upon arrival starting at 10 am. In part of the lounge there is a bar where you can order mixed drinks. All ages are permitted in this section until 10:00 a.m. A continental breakfast is served on the floor from 7 am to 10am. You can expect being able to have water, coffee, tea, juices, soft drinks as well as your choice of a hot egg dish, warm pastries, hot oatmeal as well as toast, bagels, and various other sweet rolls and bread and several cereals. In the afternoon from 10 am to 4 pm they have tea, coffee, bottle water and soft drinks and a few snacks i.e. peanuts and M&Ms. Hot and cold Hors d'Oeuvres are provided from 5 pm to 7 pm and a finally a few cookies and snacks are put out later. The lounge closes at 9 pm. By upgrading to this level this also allows you access to the Canyon Ranch SpaClub fitness facility that is located on the third floor of the hotel. If you want to enjoy the spa itself with the different saunas, lounges and whirlpool you pay only $20 to get in and you can stay as long as you like relaxing. The 23rd floor is not key card protected. However, after you get off the elevators and before you can enter the lounge you will be asked to show your room card that identifies you as a Prestige Card holder. Don't expect to sneak in if you are not a card holder, it won't work! The concierges at these desks are very friendly, but protective of the lounge and sharp. They are also happy to help you with any restaurant reservations or show tickets you might need. Again, in my opinion this is worth the extra money, it is an elegant way to relax and enjoy the Las Vegas sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller406
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel while visiting Vegas for a family wedding. The location was great, (directly across the street from the Fashion Mall), the restaurants and clubs were amazing. Will definiftely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Suite was Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: IBHAPPY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 720 sq. ft. Bella Suite. The living room area was comfortable and roomy. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was amazing. Nice, large bathtub! Everyone on staff that we had contact with were professional, helpful & friendly. We really liked the Grand Lux Cafe. Our room had a beautiful view. Our flight arrived in the morning and we expected to have to store our bags with the front desk until check-in time. Much to our surprise, they had a room ready and we checked in before noon. This hotel is clean and right across the street from the Fashion Show Mall which is fantastic for shopping. The Walgreens next to it is very convenient as well. We were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Siena Suite at The Palazzo - Huge room, huge price!”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and very big. It has it's own exercise room with a bike. HUGE bathroom, dual sinks, big bathtub... Even drapes that open and close with a remote control. A separate living room and "family room" and an incredible view (we were on the 46th floor). My biggest complaint about the room is the lack of an inside lock on the door. I like to be able to lock the hotel room door from the inside, with a chain or... Such a nice room and hotel, no lock. Very poor I think.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: JodieLovesSun
Reviews.Content: Suites are gorgeous....over the top! Service wonderful. Amenities outstanding!! Large room...basic suite included a large living room area. Bathrooms have an oversized tub, and separate shower. My basic suite had 3 TVs!!

Reviews.Title: “Just right for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Patric
Reviews.Content: We had a suite overlooking the strip, 43-428. The rooms are very nice, roomy and comfortable when we wanted to relax. When wanted to enjoy action the staff and slots were freindly, sad but nice to say, staff was freindlier. Ate twice at the only mexican restraunt on the plaza and enjoyed it each time. Delmonico was our splurge night and they succeeded in making our night special. My wife did the spa, went in early in the day and spent a wonderful time in the spa until mid afternoon. All I can say is she was all smiles the rest of the day. Seen the Pantom last time we were in Vegas, wanted to see it again but not enough time. Sad ;..{ to see it leaving this fall.. Had a wonderful time at the pool. So we had a great mix of a time relaxing, dining, and enjoying the many activities of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rhlc
Reviews.Content: I was actually impressed by the quality of this hotel. The rooms are a little over the top (tacky decor) but this is Vegas, after all. I did, however, really appreciate some of the nice touches in design. The sunken living room was great for separation from the living space. There was a separate vanity table in the bathroom for me to set up my makeup and not clutter the sink area. TV in the bathroom was nice for listening to the news while getting ready in the am. Beds were very comfortable. Workout areas was very nice. Cons: Fridge was full of items for sale, so couldn't really utilize for own food. No coffee maker--huge downside to have go downstairs to purchase $3 cups of coffee every day. Closet was small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth7887
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Palazzo for 4 nights while in Vegas for a conference, and had a really pleasant experience overall. The hotel is lovely, plenty of restuarants/ lounges, wonderful Bella suite, and friendly staff. Front desk met all of our requests for a room on a higher floor and late check-out, and were more than welcome to answer questions and provide suggestions. Resort fee of $20 per day is actually a great value - provides access to the gym, free wifi, and a daily newspaper; as all the hotels in Vegas charge additional fees for amenities, this took care of everything and there were no surprises. Only two minor issues during our stay - 1) One night tried to order room service right before 11 pm - when they switch menus - no one picked up the phone until well-after 11 pm, so that they could offer me the limited menu, rather than the full menu. Also, were not willing to accomodate special orders. 2) Took quite some time to have my call answered at the Conceirge; then, once answered, restaurant suggestions provided were for the most expensive restaurants in the hotel, without taking into account my criteria for restaurants. Also, these restaurants - although by celebrity chefs - were not highly rated on TripAdvisor. Otherwise, a lovely overall stay, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Vegas Gem :)”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor Annette
Reviews.Content: the Palazzo Resort and Casino has it all! I have been to Vegas a number of times but the deal i just had was AMAZING! The opportunity to have Canyon Ranch food, Spa and Classes at a FRACTION of the price of going to Canyon Ranch PLUS..."VEGAS" IS..... SUCH A DEAL!!! We found a rate that was 40% off the regular price plus there were discounts off Spa services becasue it was off season or slow or something. Everyone was happy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfort”
Reviews.Author: mickey91
Reviews.Content: Like many other properties, this is a city-sized hotel. Albeit, a suite hotel. It's connected to the Venetian, so what this hotel lacks is more than made up for by the Venetian-restaurants and casino. The rooms are large, but unlike other suite hotels, there's no kitchen area. As a mater of fact, the mini bar fridge is "wired" so that if you add or move an item from it, a five star alarm will sound and the charges start mounting. Otherwise, this was a very nice property at a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Many Stays”
Reviews.Author: TravelMan53
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel (stay there 6-8 times a year on business) and checked in at 5pm. I was disappointed in how long it took them to confirm my reservation as a King bed non-smoking (about 15 minutes) but they kept trying to upgrade me and put me in a room with 2 queen beds. After calling managers, housekeeping, etc they finally got me the room we reserved. The hotel is nice and always well-kept, but the service has always been a bit lacking...

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sst4359
Reviews.Content: I will take a any opportunity to warn people from staying at the Palazzo! My last stay at this hotel I had $1,000 stolen out of my room and a bunch of small things (cameras, vouchers, etc), and I am almost positive it was one of the security guards that works there! Once I started an "investigation" the staff was so rude to us, it seemed like once we were questioning the though that it could have possibly been their security guard, they flipped! And that wasent' even the end of it! After having a thousand key that did not work, we found our door opening and closing without any keys! And to top it off, the second night I had two strange men try to barge into my room! After security was called they disappeared! After all was said and done, all I wanted from them was a refund from the night that I had my life savings stolen out of the room, but that was something that's was far from few going to happen! I got NOTHING from them, only a loss of respect! I hope that I can sway people from never staying at this hotel, for I could not fathom something like this happening to another person!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury++”
Reviews.Author: Vladap
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and I'm glad we stayed at the Palazzo. Our suite was gorgeous and the view was amazing. Great restaurants are only a few minutes' walk and the shopping to die for. The only negative was, that the hotel is a little far north on the strip or you could view it as a positive, as it is closer to the premium outlets ;)

Reviews.Title: “Plazzo Prestige Suite”
Reviews.Author: cornerdavis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Plazzo hotel on an American Express upgrade to a prestige suite. It was nice, but you would need to make sure that you were at the hotel every time that the tea or the cocktail time took place. If you are the type to hang out at the hotel then you might like this. We are not and therefore we only attended one cocktail time and we were there for three nights. I was glad that we did not pay full price for the suite because it would not have been worth it. The suites are nice, but they are not any better than other suites in Vegas and they are not as good as the suite at The Wynn. I thought the housekeeping was less than what you would expect at this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug244
Reviews.Content: The service was out of this world!! Limo drivers were very entertaining! thank you!! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Something for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: mdhill
Reviews.Content: Holding a meeting between The Venetian and The Palazzo was exceptional. The meeting department was outstanding. Our rooms in The Palazzo and the service matched. I found the security comforting and the staff well trained. I missed coffee makers in the beautiful suites, but everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great room ~ Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: OTR22
Reviews.Content: I attended a business meeting at this hotel and found it to be great. My guestroom was very comfortable, great wireless internet speed, and the bed was very clean & comfortable. All rooms are suites! Also, the gym was very good. The staff was professional and friendly, and seemed to care about the guests of the hotel. My room rate was also very reasonable for such a nice hotel. The food at all breaks and meals was good. I travel almost every week of the year on business, and I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadia o
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel in Las Vegas is a very personal task, since most of them are themed, and certainly can not please everyone. We chose the Palazzo because we love Italy and everything that refers to it. In addition, the hotel is younger than his brother, the Venetian, and most highly recommended. I must say the experience was memorable. The hotel is beautiful, with stunning details. Of course it is not Venice, but the atmosphere is lovely. At a minimum, a beautiful homage to the city. The room is large and comfortable and the bathroom is beautiful, all marble. Room service is fast and friendly, although the size of the hotel. As we went during the winter, most of the pools was closed, but they put Jacuzzis at our disposal. The price is higher than most hotels in Las Vegas, but if I return to town, I'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great room, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: RichMac84
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Friendly staff, from the concierge to the cleaners to the dealers, everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. - Gorgeous lobby, and probably the nicest Casino floor we saw. Very spacious. - Extremely clean and comfortable room. - Great view of the show at Treasure Island - Walgreens directly downstairs. Minor Negatives: - Expensive - Not a lot of cheap eats around this part of the strip. - A little far north on the strip. Most of the major attractions are south of here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Margaret K
Reviews.Content: I am sure everyone loves the beautiful rooms, excellent restaurants, etc. I especially appreciate the security afforded in the casino areas, and courteous staff! I would not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: azharleygirl
Reviews.Content: We are a frequent visitor to the Palazzo resort and just love this place. We were there to see the last Motley Crue concert at The Joint (Hard Rock Hotel) and also the Elvis- cirque de so lei show at Aria. The hotel here is great. Clean. Nice. Easy to get around. I personally like the newly renovated sports bar at the Venetian, and let me tell you- I did pretty well there on the video poker! Plus the bartenders are fabulous. The only disappointment on this trip was that Dos Caminos was GONE! : ( I loved that place. Anyways, the service here is great, it has lots of wonderful resturants and after an evening at the Hard Rock, I was so relived to come back to clean and "normalcy". Ok, so Im not 25 anymore and like a more "upscale" environment! lol Anyways, its a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the higher-end Las Vegas experience, this is a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joylama
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a slightly more modern and elegant version of its sister property, the Venetian. While the Venetian is an upscale property in its own right, the subdued Palazzo makes it feel garish by comparison. The lobby was spacious yet did not feel frantic or mobbed like some casino hotels. The front desk experience was prompt, and courteous as was the bell service. The requisite long walk through the casino was along a wide spacious aisle that did not overwhelm you or make you feel assaulted by smoke and slot machine players. Fast elevator ride to our room which was on a higher floor with access to the club level on 23. The club is a great and relaxing space with complimentary breakfast, beverages, and light dinner every day. Truly a civilized space in what can be the craziness of Las Vegas. The elevators were fine, except for the constant "Phatom of the Opera" music playing. After a few days it will drive all but the biggest Phantom fans absolutely crazy. The hallways were softly lit, but very clean. Walks to rooms on the edges of the floor could be a bit long. The room was a cleanly and elegantly furnished suite which offerec a spacious bedroom, and a step down to a living room area with a small dining table and desk in it as well as a sofa and TV. We had a nice view of the front of the property overlooking the pool deck and the Treasure Island hotel, which runs a pirate show a few times a night. The bed was very comfortable as was the climate control system for the room. The bathroom was nicely appointed and very spacious with a large glass shower, one person spa tub, and a separate room for the toilet. Small issues - the toilet room light was very dim, and the shower head had low pressure with no options for other settings. Really very minor issues. Room service was prompt, courteous and well priced. The BLT was excellent! There was no excessive noise from the hallway or adjoining rooms. A few more easily accessible plugs near the bed would have been nice to accommodate charging the cell phones and tablet devices. There is an upscale shopping area in the hotel and it connects to the Venetian's shopping area as well, so there is plenty to see and do, as well as good restaurants to eat at. There is a Walgreens in the complex, as well as a gift shop for any last minute needs. All in all, a very nice place to stay on the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Back To Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: CapeCod64
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Venetian/Palazzo many times. Every time I go back, the story is the same - great rooms (huge!), amazing staff, wonderful food, it goes on and on. I spend a lot of time in Las Vegas in a lot of different hotels and Palazzo is always the best.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault, spacious rooms, will come back.”
Reviews.Author: Zoom6562
Reviews.Content: Most of the previous reviews say what i think, The Palazzo is an excellent hotel in a superb position on the strip. The immediate impression on entering the lobby is of a quality hotel, luxurious furnishings and opulent splendour ! Reception dealt with checkin swiftly and i was soon dragging my bag through the casino to my excellent room. First time i've ever stayed in a room with 3 x TVs ! One thing i did notice was that although smoking was allowed in most areas it was never oppressive as the ventilation systems seemed to get rid of it very effectively, even in the bars. Had breakfast at the Grande Lux Cafe a few times, TOP TIP: always have the buffet ! At only $16 or so it includes all you food, coffee and juices, huge amount of choice of hot and cold food in the American buffet style i.e.lots and lots ! Best bar i found was the one next to the Cafe where 2 guys played piano requests all evening from about 7pm til late. The hotel has a fancy shopping mall like many other hotels, it links into the Venetian shops which run along the indoor "Grande Canal" but if want some regular shopping rather than the "designer" shops in the hotel then The Fashion Show Mall is right across the street and has a Macys, Dillards, Nieman Marcus, Apple Store, and plenty of smaller shops selling pretty much everything, Also opposite is the Treasure Island hotel ,or TI as it seems to be re-branding, a good bar at the front on the strip, can't remember the name but a WIld West theme. Not much more to say, there are so many restaurants (mostly quite pricey), cafes, shops, etc to keep you busy for weeks but always check the menu before you go in and do not mistake the lunch menu for the dinner menu ! Would i come back ? Yes, location, fabulous rooms and overall decor were superb,

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping has really bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: PickyJW
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend was sick so we need to boil some hot tea. There's no water boiler or coffee maker in the room so she called the housekeeping to deliver the water boiler. The lady who pick up the phone told my friend there will be a charge of $4.25. I've never heard of this kind of charges so I called the housekeeping again to make sure we want water boiler not something else. The lady over the phone sounded really annoying by us because we called TWICE. I asked why there's a charge and she said "Miss, this is consider as in-room dining if you want us to deliver hot water to your room. We are quite busy on our orders now, do you want us to deliver or not?" I really want to say NO but due to my friend was sick I have no choice but to accept this BAD BAD service and attitude. I stayed at Vdara the night before and although there's no water boiler in room as well but at least when I called the housekeeping to request it, they DID NOT charge me a dime. I was gladly to pay tips for the service but the bad attitude from Palazzo housekeeping really upset me a lot. I'm not sure if I would ever want to stay at this hotel anymore. There are so many other hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect stay - despite its huge size everyone gave a personal service”
Reviews.Author: DesandLorraine
Reviews.Content: Wow, we stayed in a Bella suite for 4 nights. We were too mean to pay for a strip view after having previously stayed at the bellagio and were so glad we didn't. Our room on the 31st floor had the most amazing view of the mountains where we watched the sunrise each day. The room itself was spacious, it is a split level studio with a living room at the window, two queen beds on the upper level and a huge bathroom. Much nicer than the bellagio, bigger, more modern and less tired. Everything was just right. The hotel itself is linked to the Venetian so there are loads of bars and restaurants ranging from fancy to quick and reasonable. The coffee shops get very busy in the morning but everything is very efficient. Overall the staff were wonderful, it's one of the nicest places we've stayed and definitely the nicest in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room”
Reviews.Author: usmc1346
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Vegas last weekend. The Palazzo is a beautiful resort. All suites with a very comfortable bed and spacious bathrooms. We asked for a strip view and were told that it would be $45.00 more per night..What the heck? We already were paying $164 per night. We got a room on the 44th floor facing the Wynn golf course...beautiful! It is not worth it to spend additional monies just for a view..walk down to the street - which we did plenty of. The restaurants on site are very pricey...try the Fashion Mall. It has tons of nice places to eat. Overall the staff was great and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Large relaxing room”
Reviews.Author: Mlebuf
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, bit pricey not all food/coffee area allow for room charges. If you are going want a few drinks nightly ask about prestige and get access to the private club room. Gym was small but nice and not busy. If new to gambling take advantage of daily lessons.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimjams1
Reviews.Content: I spent almost three weeks at this hotel in July last year during the WSOP. The hotel was fantastic with beautiful suites. The Prestige Level is great with such friendly staff, certainly worth the money. The pools there are great and you can use the pools at The Venetian too which got the sun early morning- perfect for an early morning swim. I would love to return to The Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeaStars
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay at the Palazzo. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the bathroom is quite large and well appointed with first class amenities. There are many shops and restaurants here to fill up a weekend stay withouth leaving the resort property. We had a very nice lunch at Carnevino, delicious food with attentive service. We also enjoyed a nice dinner at Bouchon, however, were turned off by the rude hostess we encountered during lunch time. Overall, it is an excellent place to stay in Vegas. The downside to our stay: We requested the sofa bed be made up upon arrival and it was not done. We were assured by the front desk that housekeeping would take care of it soon after check in but that did not happen. After waiting over an hour for this, we called housekpeeing and were told they never received the request from the front desk. However, housekeeping they did send someone right away after my call. Needless to say, we were disappointed in the front desk's lack of follow-up on such a simple request. After all this trouble, we discovered the sofa bed was quite uncomfortable. Not a huge problem since we were only there 1 night, but next time will request 2 beds instead.

Reviews.Title: “Always beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: busykymom
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Palazzo (and we stayed at the sister Venetian before that). We LOVE the rooms at this hotel. Beautiful, efficient, incredible views, automated curtains, large3 marble bath, sunken living area. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Details need work”
Reviews.Author: badbucky
Reviews.Content: $285 per night and no coffee maker, hair dryer, or health club access, and lousy wireless. Need to run the smoke gauntlet to get to the room. Marriott needs to come here. They'd make a killing catering to those of us who need to be here on the strip for business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CocoLoco69
Reviews.Content: We had booked our weekend at the Venetian, but the desk clerk offered to move us to the Palazzo, decided to give it a try. It is the same room layout as the Venetian large comfy suites. We also purchased access to the 23rd floor for breakfast, afternoon appies and drinks. That was a nice feature to do before going out for the day or evening. We had rented a car, parking there was a breeze, the parking elevators where right by the room elevators, no long walk!! Loved it. The staff were very helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but I liked the Venetian better”
Reviews.Author: jes67
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an Asian flair which is beatiful but is just not our style.We have stayed in the Venetian in the past and feel it has many more things to see and resturants were more to our liking. We did have numerous issues with poor housekeeping there and had to call the front desk for things on 2 different occasions. We were told that we would receive a complimentary 50.00 credit to our account which never happened.The spa is wonderful but have to pay a resort fee just to use the fitness room. All and all we had a wonderful time in Las Vegas but will probably not choose to stay there next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room.......but a hike to find coffee and a lump of food on the floor!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathie859
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Venetian twice so I thought I'd try their sister property. Check in was a breeze and baggage quickly sent to my room. What annoys me about both properties is the lack of a coffee maker in the room and the distance you have to cover to find a morning cup of joe. We also had a chunk of food inter the coffee table....ewe!!! The toiletries are quality and robes are provided--very nice touches. I like the variety of dining options from the reasonably priced Canyon Ranch Grill to the more expensive eateries. Checking out is easy, too, via the in room checkout on the TV. I'm surprised to say that I think the Palazzo just noses out the Venetian as far as room decor.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo was nice”
Reviews.Author: kkamalx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo over the president day holiday. The hotel is very nice with fast room service. The staff is very helpful. With that said the Suites are OK, compared to Bellagio or TheHotel. The room amenities are average. The rest rooms are not even properly filled with basic necessities, and we booked 2 rooms, both were the same. Compared to that TheHotel is so much nicer and less money, the rooms are actually much bigger with separate living room area, not just the long extension of the same room. There rest room is bigger nicer and on top there is also a half bath in the living room area. Plus the kitchenette. The only saving grace for the Palazzo is, its close to all the other big Casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Mexico08
Reviews.Content: Our suite was great!! My son got married here and it was beautiful. I highly recommend it for a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Only1Serbo
Reviews.Content: I had a convention that I attended and booked the travel at The Palazzo. My wife joined me during the weekend and we had a very nice time. The rooms were spacious and the staff was very friendly. There was also decent shopping along with some nice restaurants. The casino had plenty of table games as well as slot machines. Overall, the experience was a good one and we would stay at the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo ...Not So!”
Reviews.Author: PVGreg
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights in a fortuna suite in the palazzo. While this is by no means a bad hotel it just should not be at the top of your list in Las Vegas. The rooms was nice and large and the bed was comfortable but the general room amenities were just fair and the room lacked any charm. The bathroom was the most disappointing considering we were in a step up suite I expected at least a jetted tub and a bigger shower, but this is same bathroom that is in all the regular suite/rooms. Compared to the same level of suite at the Bellagio the bathroom at the Palazo is a big let down. Also the pool that is open until 10pm in the off season would require me to walk in my robe or bathing suit down to the casino or shopping level and walk all the way to the Venetian and the then up to the 10th floor to use the facilities, not even worth the trip as the jacuzzis were bearly heated to 90 degrees. Non smoking room that I rented for my children smelled of smoke. Won't stay here again with so many choices available with better locations on the strip. One more thing that bothered me was that they have such an elaborate service elevator system and back door access for employees that I was shocked when a janitor wheeled a trashcan into the guest elevator and rode down to the ground floor with the guests, hopefully the eye in the sky saw this and the employee was informed that this is not acceptabel in a 5 star hotel, thats why they have staff elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah134
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. In our opinion, tt's a bit more mature and accessible than its sister property, The Venetian though both have lovely spacious suites. We arrived on a Sunday and though an early check-in, our room was ready. After receiving various perks/promotions, we opted to head to our suite carrying our own bags without waiting for bellman to deliver, to start the fun sooner . Suite inviting, clean, plenty of drawer and closet space for us, comfortable bed, living area. Remote controlled window coverings. Quick unpack and we're off. Plenty of restaurants/lounges/bars within hotel. We sought out a Mexican restaurant formerly located just off the casino floor, but learned it closed a couple months ago. Bummer. So we went over to The Grand Lux to grab a bite. Food good, drinks generous. Recommend Emeril Lagasse's Table 10 on the second level. They even have Happy Hour and a HH menu with good food selections. Also try Zine for a rather nice zen experience. We would always wind up, after returning from our many outings, in the lobby bar for a couple champagne cocktails. Service met and exceeded our expectations: Desk clerks, housekeeping, gift shop clerks, food service, security, and let's not forget the 'Grazie' crew, were fantastic! Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible Policies”
Reviews.Author: Barbara N
Reviews.Content: The room was great but pricey. You pay $20 a day for the spa and have to wait to get a machine. The worst part was when I went to the pool on a 69F sunny day they would not let me sit in a chair that was in the sun claiming that the pools were seasonal and closed. Instead you were forced to sit in a shaded area around the main pool that was chilly. Very poor policy for a $250 room a night

Reviews.Title: “Prestige Suite Made a Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tankminder
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great 4-day guy's weekend celebrating our 50th birthdays in Las Vegas style. We had booked a standard Venetian suite and were offered the upgrade to Palazzo prestige level on check-in and the deal convinced us. While the price seemed a bit steep at first (about $110/day more) it includes a nicer suite on one of 8 concierge floors in the newer, better furnished Palazzo. The suite was beautiful with plenty of room, a fantastic strip view, 3 flat screen TVs, and the pull out sleeper meant we all had our own place to crash. The Prestige upgrade price waives resort fees and includes access to the Canyon Ranch spa and gym, paper delivery and best of all, access to the Prestige lounge. The lounge does a decent continental breakfast every day and includes several hours of open bar and apps in the afternoon and evening - a great happy hour stop. Prestige also includes a good collection of discount tickets and two-for-one drinks in Casino bars. All well worth the upgrade. Meanwhile the location on the strip was great for walking, and Palazzo casino was definitely less busy on a very crowded president's day weekend. The only thing that drove us crazy was the Phantom of the Opera music in the elevator every day - but if that's our worst complaint, I guess that's not bad. Beautiful Place, great stay, great time.

Reviews.Title: “Superbowl weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kasandra T
