Reviews.Content: Our original reservation was at the Venetian, have stayed there many times. They offered us an upgrade at a minimal fee. Which I decided to take. It was a gorgeous ROOM. So big and lush. The best bed I've slept in at a Hotel.Opulent and gorgeous. House keeping was quick and left us extra towels. Room service was hot and fresh. The Casino the decor was beautiful. We had an amazing trip. Never to be forgotten. Centrally located, perfect for girls weekend, a romantic get away .. or a work venue. It was a little on the pricier side of the Vegas offerings. But so worth it !!

Reviews.Title: “Complete lack of customer service”
Reviews.Author: Kay M
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at approximately 4:30 PM. We checked in and were given keys that did not work. After 3 more sets that did not work and 5 hours later, we still could not get into our room. With the 4th set, the girl behind the counter said the manager was going to go to our room with us to make sure this set worked. But, he was too busy and said just to offer us a $50 credit - really!!! Of course set #4 did not work either. By this time we were the crazy people in the lobby INSISTING that they lock be changed. They finally did and we got keys that worked about 11:30 that night. The lobby is smoke filled and service leaves much to be desired. We will not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dobaer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. I've stayed here for many conferences over the past 18 months and have had a consistent experience each time. For what I need, I have not been disappointed. My needs are pretty simple: a clean and quiet room that is conveniently located near the convention center. I've learned my way around the casino and shops and can easily find my way out of the complex and onto the strip for morning exercise. There are conveniently located shops, restaurants, and abundant coffee shops throughout the casino and shopping areas. The Walgreens near the entrance of the Palazzo is convenient and a good place to find toothpaste, chapstick, and other essentials. You can find it out the TAO exit from the shops and down the escalator. Be aware of the $10/day resort fee. It does include access to the fitness center and free WiFi access in the suites, so it isn't such a bad deal. I believe it also includes a newspaper each day, but I didn't take advantage of that.

Reviews.Title: “Fanstaic Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: cchase89
Reviews.Content: Love the Palazzo. Rooms are huge and nicely updated, all suites. Everything you can need or want is on the property. Excellent choice of restaurants and seemingly unlimited shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Max_Traveler_some
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their "standard" suite for one night since we drove by Vegas to see a show and leave. This was the best hotel room we've ever stayed in. Overlooked the many pools we wish we could have enjoyed. The only down side was that the elevators were on the other side of the smoky casino. You have to walk through the gauntlet. Still, I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Just longer.

Reviews.Title: “Really Lovely”
Reviews.Author: kswim
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice one-night stay here as a Southwest Air Vacation pick. The room we had was a Bella Suite and was just gorgeous and very spacious. I have stayed at several other properties on the strip and this is definitely one I would want to do over. We also had the opportunity to see Phantom of the Opera while there and it is amazing. I have seen this show a total of four times over the years, all Broadway touring companies, and there is just nothing like this Vegas production! The sets alone are spectacular and then you add in a wonderfully talented cast with beautiful voices and dance talent and it just doesn't get any better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ViennaLover
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas many times, and stayed at practically all the hotels, including the Venetian, I enjoyed my stay at the Palazzo. This hotel is part of the Venetian complex although it is a separate hotel. I did not partake in the spa or the pool so I cannot comment on this. Pluses: Lovely room. It is modern and huge. The staff is very attentive. I had problems with the inroom WiFi during my stay and the IT came right up to my room quickly to fix the problem. There is plenty of food choices and shopping. Minues: I am not crazy about the casino. It is a bit dull in style and honestly too smokey. Overall, would stay at this hotel again. Enjoy and good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Gotta go Prestige!”
Reviews.Author: 2011Bruins
Reviews.Content: Went for my brother's 30th birthday... nothing crazy here, so we wanted to some comfy perks. The Prestige level is what we had in mind and it met every expectation. The open bar and heavy finger foods were perfect and ended up more than paying for the extra $$$ for the upgrade. Location was great for the strip and walking distance to other hotels/casinos. Room: We did the Prestige Luxury and was upgraded to the 2-bed Bella, strip-view. There's plenty of room and there were 4 of us. Bathroom: plenty of room... seperate tub/shower with a closed off toilet area... could've used a fan though with 4 guys (sorry). Beds: awesome double-sized comfort... no problems here. AC: worked fantastic... went in August, so this was essential. Cleanliness: the room sis show some wear/tear in areas... might have been more of an issue had I gone with my wife, but again for 4 guys, the place was to nice almost. Misc: easy access to casino floor and pool area... Prestige lounge was money. Would defintely do this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mychelle71
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this hotel. Service was superb and it has very easy access to surrounding attractions. Casino is big and roomy and it leads straight to the shops and Grand Canal with the singing gondola rides. The morning we checked out, the concierge gladly held our bags the entire day until our flight out that evening so that we could shop and enjoy the city. The room was huge and very comfortable with two double beds and a sunken living room. All four of us could get ready in the very spacious bathroom with a huge wall long mirror plus a separate vanity and seat. Even the blow dryer was awesome. The beds were also very comfortable. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & luxurious”
Reviews.Author: matdell
Reviews.Content: Have been in the Palazzo before but never stayed there. Spent 4 days there in February 2012 and it was pretty spectacular from beginning to end. It feels much fresher than the Venetian next door, and for those that find some of the Vegas gaming floors over-crowded, the Palazzo is refreshing - smells clean and fresh despite the smoking throughout the casino. The rooms are super luxurious and spotlessly clean. The whole experience was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly a Intercontental”
Reviews.Author: Kazoo_Bruce
Reviews.Content: I am glad that the Venitian and the Plazzo have joind the Intercontental Hotel Group affiated hotels. They truly meet what most frequent traveliers in the Priority Club program would exspect. The website does not do these suites justice. They are huge, with full size cornergroup couch, two work areas. The two queen beds are not crowded. The bathroom is truly breathtaking. The views are best looking west. During the day the trump tower sticks out like the gold thumb, but at night the windows refect the city lights and it nearly dissiperas fromo view. Almost by magic. The staff is what you would exspect and even better at a Intercontinental property. Addressed me by name at all encounters (my name is not the easist to prnounce). The only slight on the proprty is that it is all show, just like Vegas. The amenities are first class, even electic draps in the rooms. But the little stuff that you find at a Intercontential were missing. Fine sheets, soft towels, and a working iron. There is no coffee in the rooms, but there is a coffee shop next to the elevator lobby on the casino floor. THe line is a bit long on a late sunday morning. We found all the bars and restaurants at the property to be nicely upscale. We also found that most of the patrons were also better than average. More often than not, the dress in the casino and the clubs was nicer then the jeans/t-shirt that are found in older properties. Saturday night there most were dressed to the 7-9. T

Reviews.Title: “First time in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dougk2005
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a very beautiful hotel right on the strip with all the other big hotels/resorts. We stayed on the “Prestige” floors, so we had special check privileges, access to a private lounge with a light breakfast and a happy hour every evening. The suite was large and very nice. There was no refrigerator or coffee maker in the suite, which I thought was a little odd for resort hotel. The sunken living room sounded like a fun idea, but it was impractical and I got very tired and going up and down those stairs. The room also could have been cleaner as there were crumbs of food on the couches. The internet worked well and was included with our room rate. It was too cold to swim, but the many pool areas all looked very nice and gym was large and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doubled123456
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we have stayed in Vegas. We upgraded to the Prestige level where complimentary drinks and Hors d'oeuvres are served. The rooms are fabulous with lots of space and a large king size bed. The bathroom as mentioned by previous reviewers is amazing. Cleaning staff keep your room clean with no problems. The location on the strip is convenient to walk and visit other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “The best room of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Moose707
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The room was amazing, I especially loved the bathroom with the vanity mirror and plush seat, what better way to apply makeup for a night out?! We didn't pay extra for a view of the strip but that didn't matter, we had a view of the Wynn and it's grounds, including the golf course, which was very nice. The staff were friendly and accommodating. My only gripe is that if you want a fridge you have to pay $25 a day. So it would've been an extra $50 which is very steep considering the price of the room and the resort fee they charge. Which is why I give it 4 stars not 5. We had milk that needed to be kept cold so filled up one of the basins with ice and put it in there. We got complimentary passes to Lavo, but they wouldn't let us in because my boyfriend was carrying a camera bag. Not a huge bag, but still they wouldn't let us in. This was the night after we checked out so we couldn't go to the room to leave it there and come back. So we didn't get to go to the club. Stupid rule. Aside from that, we really enjoyed our stay at the Palazzo, a truly beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Taras P
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest properties I've stayed in...its clear how they got their 5 diamond rating. Suite was great with an really nice view of the strip. Meeting and conference spaces were great too. They offered really good snacks and refreshment. Overall level of service, from the dedicated check in for our group thru check out and luggage storage was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Best week " Ever " !!”
Reviews.Author: mrjrb01
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2nd Feb 2012 for 1 week.Our 1st time in Vegas !! Wow,what a week.Hotel was fantastic/clean/beautifully designed..,check in easy..room was bella suite,very nice/plenty of room.Room service was fantastic,but pricey( $4 del charge/18% gratuity/then tax/then personal tip to waiter) and thats before you pay for the food deliverd,but thats Vegas,dont order if you dont want to pay.!! Flew the Grand Caynon on my birthday,5th..with Sundance Helicopters,what a trip,its a must do..Overall we had a fantastic time,really pleased with the hotel, DO NOT understand the moaners who write the hotel is looking tierd etc..they really do need to get a life !! Shop around for food and drink deals "there s plenty of them" and you wont go wrong!! Ask for a view of the strip when checking in,we were on the 34th floor with a view to die for..Beware of drinks in hotels bars/resta,very expensive! Circ and aqua were amazing,again a MUST do..AND USE the luggage check in desk when going home,$10 each,they check your bags in at the hotel and print your boarding card and you say good bye to your cases till you get back to your home airport..!! "FANTASTIC" All you do is arrive at airport and go straight to security,NO queing..no bags, worth 10 bucks of anyones money...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DBHouston
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm not giving five stars is due to check-in. We arrived about 20 minutes after check-in and were told there were no king-size bed rooms readily available so we'd have to either pay for an upgraded suite or wait but the clerk could not provide an exact timeframe or anything. Since we had plans later that day and wanted to rest up I refused to just sit and wait for possibly a couple of hours! I asked to speak w/a manager and suddenly after the clerk went to the back a couple of minutes and returned a clean room magically appeared. I found it strange we weren't just given the room to begin with. Upon getting this issue resolved we were very impressed w/our suite. We previously stayed at the Venetian and the rooms are basically identical w/a few more little upgrades here and there. The bed was very comfortable, you couldn't hear any exterior or neighboring noise so insulation was excellent and the bathroom was gorgeous! We ate at a few of the restaurants, Dal Toro, Grand Lux & I Luv Burgers and enjoyed them all. We had a great stay and would definitely stay here again if the price is right. There are always some type of promos available so be on the look out for those before booking.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice hotel, but If I didn't get super deal, this wouldn't be my choice.”
Reviews.Author: hsr2000
Reviews.Content: There are so many great hotels on the strip and I don't think this hotel would be our first choice in our next trip to Las Vegas. Unless we find super deal offer on this hotel, we would not choose this hotel again. Room: We stay at the Deluxe room (it's Studio room) with 700+ sqft space. We heard someone staying right next room to us fighting with high pitch noise on our way to our room. We were worry that we may have to request different room. But the wall was thick enough, when we went into our room and shut the door, you can't hear anything. Thank goodness! The room was very spacious and it has 3 TVs in the room including the bathroom. Bit over kill for studio room. TV in the bathroom was installed at the top coner of the sink. However the bathtub where you rest your head was in the same direction as the TV wall was. so I couldn't enjoy watching TV while relaxing in the hot tub. If you tried to catch some news while you are at the sink, you had to raise your head to watch the screen, so you'll have stiff neck after few minintes watching TV. Bathroom: The shower lacks shelf space, so there was no place to put wash towels. It could also use some secure metal handle bar in the shower incase anyone need to hold on to the slippy floor (especially older person or kids). It's safety issue, I think. Cleaness of the room: It's Ok. NOthing outstanding. We were at the room end of the hall and housekeeping always put hugh laundry carrying hand truck and we always had to move it out of the way before we enter the room or exit the room. They should have some record which room was occupy and least park those nasty stuff in front of the empty room. Just not high class for 5 star hotel. Shopping: Not so good. It doesn't have high-end shopping like Forum or Aria. If you are high-end shopper, you've better go form or citycenter. Food: What can I say about this!!! Hmmmm I will leave sepate review on these restaurants. Morels French Steakhouse & Bistro - $$$$ over price, bad service, bad food Zine Noodles Dim Sum - $$$ Price is depend on what you order and price isn't too bad for Las Vegas Strip located restaurants. But, food was just so so. Service was excellent! TAO Nightclub - $$$$ food in general is high priced. Some were tasty and some are not. It seems hit or miss. Service was excellent. Café Presse - Getting a cup of coffee, yogurt and coffee cake, they demand tips to be added on the credit card. To the point that you are embrassed if you don't add the tip. I am not against leaving the tips even if I get bad service. But I am sorry, I don't want to be forced to put tips on cup of coffee and yogurt that I serice myself. Tips for working on cash register to take my money? Note: If you want to eat while you stay at Palazzo, you can walk over to Wynn and get better service and great tasting food. Price isn't cheap, but at least, you feel you get to eat good and receive excellent service. We went to Wynn and eat there rest of our trip. All excellent @ Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: mbt55
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Palazzo can be whatever you want it to be. On this trip, we were there to relax and our suite was perfect for that. We looked thru the huge plate glass window out over the valley with the mountains in the background and it was beautiful, especially at night. The size of the suite is perfect with comfortable furniture on both levels. The bathroom is very large and was also very clean as was the hotel. As we were only there to relax, we didn't take part in the gambling this time, but we have in the past and it's an enjoyable experience. As far as we are concerned, this is the best place to stay for any reason - relaxing, gambling, clubbing, shopping, and overall enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular everything”
Reviews.Author: scareybabe
Reviews.Content: This is a five star hotel and it really shows, we just got back from a weeks stay and it was fantastic, the room was a really good size with a comfy bed (not that you get time to sleep in vegas!) The hotel was decorated for chinese new year and the decorations were jaw dropping, the large dragon was staggering. The whole complex which runs seamlessly into the Venetian seems to go on for miles in all directions, with good shops and restaurants for all tastes and budgets. The only major downside is if your are going for a number of nights like we did they tie up a lot of credit on your credit card, which you can't use on the casino floor, in our case we stayed for a week and they tied up over $800, obviously trying to get you to spend in their restaurants. They also charge a $20 a night resort fee. Even with the little negative niggles we will still return as soon as we can get time off!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: annc123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from one night at the Palazzo, and it was AWESOME! The entire hotel is beautiful, probably one of the best I've ever stayed in. We loved the sitting area (so much more comfortable than watching TV in bed) and the bathroom was very cool. I booked the room through an bidding site, and got a great rate so it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: GRF1987
Reviews.Content: Stunning Vegas hotel, great shopping and dining and a great casino, rooms are excellent. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vegas and loved the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: meesterbond
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip to Vegas and having not stayed at Palazzo before we thought we would give it a go as we had loved visiting the property on last trip. We had such a wonderful stay at the Encore only 2 years before so it had a lot to live up to. When I checked-in they didnt have any smoking rooms in Palazzo but had availability in the Venetian. I was told they would try to get me a room in the Palazzo from the next day (7 nights in total). I wasnt very happy with this as I had specfically booked via their own website in order to try to minimise the risk of this happening. We made the walk from Palazzo reception to the Venetian guest suites (luggage would be brought over later). The rooms at the Venetian were very similar to the Palazzo and we ended up staying the one night. See my other review for Venetian We went to the Palazzo reception the next day at 10am and as promised they had a smoking room available and were in the process of cleaning it. We were apologised to and told they had upgraded us to a strip view room. We went off shopping and our luggage was brought over to our new rooms whilst we were away. I really like the layout of the rooms at Palazzo (compared to Encore). The sitting area is far more usable and the rooms look very large. The actual quality of the room cleaning and the furniture was better at the Encore. I also enjoyed having the wi-fi available throughout the property as my wife and I would message/talk to each other and to family back home over the internet (to keep our international roaming charges down). Room - Very nice, looks very modern and very spacious with seperate sitting area. The bed was very comfortable and the remote control for the drapes was cool (a trend among better hotels). In total there were three flat screen TV's and there was quite a few choices of HD channels (42" in the bedroom, 32" in the sitting area and a small one in the bathroom). Bathroom was nice with two sinks and seperate glass enclosed shower (could do with more water pressure). There was also a seperate vanity unit with hair dryer. View - We had a wonderful view of the strip and the Treasure Island hotel from our window and looking down we could see the pools. At night the view came alive and I spent a lot time looking out of the window. Casino - Really enjoyed spending time in the casino as it was very spacious and the cocktail service was usually quite good (seemed to get better after 5pm). Restaurants Bouchon (Venetian) for breakfast and it was nice but it was bit of an anti-climax. I will try Morels next time. Grand Lux Cafe - for breakfast. We ordered from the menu (not buffet) and were very impressed with the speed and quality of the food. The red velvet pancakes were out of this world!! Sushisamba - My wife really enjoyed the sushi and we liked some of the different roll combinations Tao (Venetian) - This was the most dissapointing meal of our whole trip, PF changs makes better chinese food and sushisamba has better sushi rolls. I'm not sure I would come back to this restaurant as there are better asian choices in the Wynn (Okado and Wing Lei are fantastic) Nightlife - We went to Tao nightclub for the evening and it was very nice and the music was great, dance floor gets very busy (we had a great time re-living our youth) Location - If you look for signs to the Sands bridge this will get you over to the Wynn and then another bridge for Fashion Show Mall. Walgreens is very conveniently located at the outside of the Palazzo for all your pharmacy/drink/snacks/gifts. Ambience - Out of the two properties I prefered the ambience of the Palazzo, a little quieter and just seemed a bit plusher

Reviews.Title: “pretty good for a conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl502
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while he attended a conference. The room was nice, comfortable and big, but I can't say I'd choose it again if we actually had to pay for it. We were lucky enough for this to be a company paid room to attend the conference so I can't complain. The reasons I would not stay again would only be for these reasons... No coffeemaker in room. Really? If you stay here, bring a cheap heating element and bring your own hot beverage or you will have to dress, go to the elevator, go to the coffee shop, and pay for a 4 dollar cup of coffee. Or pay for a 20 dollar pot to be delivered. I'm not cheap, but this is ridiculous. This is common in LV hotels, (they say it is a fire law, but apparently, this is just not true) so if you get a good price, just be prepared if this is important to you. It is to us. Incidentally, I discovered, too late, that Walgreens had a hot water pot for less than it actually cost me to drink a cup of coffee for the 5 mornings we were there. Added tip - Walgreens. Right on the corner for oodles of food choices, things you forgot, and even souvenirs. I stocked up on breakfasty things . The hotel is an addon to the Venetian to make more rooms. I had no real problems with the hotel, it just seemed stock and impersonal. But again, it is Vegas. Pricey if we had paid the advertised rates. I'd have shopped it if we were vacationing.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo is Perfectamundo!”
Reviews.Author: JamesJasper
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a Delta Vacations package that afforded accommodations at The Palazzo in Vegas. I was skeptical, never having been to Vegas, but "The Hangover #1," which we watched with my sister-in-law at Christmas 2011 convinced me to go see the sights of Vegas. I must admit, we were blown away with the elegance of the Palazzo. It has all of the fresh, bright appeal of the more expensive Bellagio, the Wynn and the Encore, but bigger rooms (suites!) and a very affordable club level that treats you like you're royalty. The Palazzo charged a $100/day/room up charge for the club level, but the value is worth it! We enjoyed luxurious breakfasts, which meant that we could dispense with lunch . . . and simply wander and enjoy the sights all day, or linger and gamble in the luxurious casino, or walk the mall that truly makes you feel like you're in Venice (with the seemingly real-life fresco sky of an open air market). In addition, the shops at the Palazzo are all high-end, so just browsing the mall is enjoyable. We enjoyed evening cocktail receptions every night with a buffet of heavy hors devours which were as delicious as any 4 or 5 - star restaurant. They even had several of the Venetian restaurant chefs sautéing tasty Italian pasta. In addition, the views from the club lounge are among the best along the strip! The best part of the Palazzo, in our opinion, is the rooms. They are suites that include a living room space, bedroom space, and large, luxurious bathroom, with shower, soaking tub, and private water closet. We felt like nobility, relaxing every evening after a day among the wild and crazy sights of the strip. Our favorite shows were Le Reve (DO NOT MISS THIS SHOW, IT IS AMAZING) and the Beatles' expose, Love! We also enjoyed the old-fashioned, but still-sensual "Jubilee," although the hotel, which houses the theatre, needs a complete makeover (on the inside). We plan to return to Vegas again, perhaps this fall, and will stay at the Palazzo again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to go back”
Reviews.Author: LazyShore
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up out front I was impressed. Check in was easy, the staff, bellman and housekeeping are very professional. We stayed on the 40th floor in a Bella View Suite. As everyone else has stated, the suites are amazing. Very large, a TV in the bathroom and a seperate water closet for the toilet. A word of advice--ask for a humidifier for your room. Vegas is very dry and the humidifier was such a help. As we were three women staying in this suite we were a bit demanding on housekeeping but they delivered everything we asked for in a timely manner. (extra towels, glassware & toileties.) I must say room service was horrible. I wish there were coffee makers in the room and that refridgerators did not cost $25/day. Room service--took an hour to get a pot of coffee, two bagels and two glasses of orange juice. Yes we were there over super bowl weekend and it was busy but that wasn't the worst of it. When the delivery girl dropped off our tray I noticed as she closed our door she had not brought any cream and I had even ordered extra cream. Instead of yelling down the hall I called downstairs and was told they would send her right back up. Another hour went by and still no cream. Now the pot of coffee was cold and it was 10am by now.I was very angry and of course they removed the $50 room service charge for those 5 items but did not credit me the $3 extra I had added to the bill when signing it. But that is my fault for not realizing they add 18% to the bill automatically. I did do a bit of gambling (table games) at the Palazzo and also at the Venitian. The hotels are connected by a beautiful walkway and very nice shops. Make sure to find the little cupcake stand at the entrance to the Ventian--yummy and not too expensive! There is a grand lux cafe in both hotels but the one in the Venitian stays open later so you can grab a bite to eat after a night of gambling. Our suite overlooked Treasure Island and it was magnificent. The show starts about 6pm and happens every 45 minutes or so. Just beautiful views!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, not always good service”
Reviews.Author: Tomas B
Reviews.Content: Rooms at Palazzo, Venetian resort are bigger than majority of rooms U have seen before (standard room means suite there...). However, service provided can be a bit chaotic - it happened I had to call several times before getting helped with my room phone, package delivered etc. I can say as I have been staying in this place about 14 times already... On the other hand, rooms are really nicely equipped, I appreciate working station with printer, fax, copy machine in price, nice TV sets, DVD player and bed... Concierge access (now called Prestige at Palazzo) upgrade is worth considering if there is two of you using the room, planning to use Internet, visit Concierge for breakfast buffet and couple of drinks and snacks in the early evening... It is definitely worth considering if you have 160-300 to spent a night...

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Mimi9095
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Jan 27 - Jan 29 after having booked this hotel using a top secret hotel deal through Travelocity. Got a great rate for the weekend using this method by searching for five star properties...was pretty sure it would be either the Palazzo or the Venetian which are sister properties. The deal with booking it this way is you have to pay in advance, the reservation cannot be changed or cancelled and you don't know what property you get until after you have prepaid. They still charge the resort fee of $20 for each night which is payable when you check-out. Not a big fan of the resort fee...basically covers internet access which was handy for getting our boarding passes which you can print right in your room and covers access to the fitness center (not the spa), and supposedly a newspaper which we never saw. I have to say the best part of our stay at the Palazzo was TAO nightclub. There is a separate line for hotel guests which allowed us to by-pass a huge line of people waiting to get in. The club has plenty of private sitting areas that can be reserved for your group. Great music and lots of dancing. This is definitely the place to be. Check-in: We arrived early in the morning about 10:30 a.m. and I fully expected that we would have to wait for our room to be ready and have the hotel store our luggage. I was pleasantly surprised that our room was available at that time and we didn't have to wait. The line was short, we waited only a couple of minutes for the next available clerk. However, when we asked if there were any upgrades available the clerk gave a little attitude by saying that nothing was available and something about the fact that they have over 7000 hotel rooms and all are nice. I would have liked to upgrade to the prestige level but weren't even given the opportunity. We were given a couple vouchers Room: These are huge rooms and nicely laid out. Our room was on the 34th floor with a view overlooking the Wynn, golf course, pools and mountains. Room was in excellent condition, clean and very spacious. We had a very comfy king bed, with the sunken living area. The bathroom was very spacious with double sinks, a separate make-up/vanity area, separate shower and big soaking tub, and toilet in it's only little room. We called housekeeping to get extra towels and toiletries and they were delivered within minutes. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and attentive and showed up early the next day to clean the room so we didn't have to wait all day like I've read in other reviews. We didn't touch anything in the fully stocked refrigerator or on the bar but there is plenty to choose from if you desire, just expensive. Wish there was a little room in there to store your own items or a separate refrigerator. Used the in room safe which is spacious enough to hold a laptop and even has an electrical socket so you can plug your devices in to charge while in the safe. There are three televisions in the room, one in the living area, one above the bed area and one in the bathroom. I also really liked having our own copier/printer/fax machine in our room. The draperies/shades for the window are nice because they are remote control operated so you don't have to go over to adjust them. Check-out: We did call to ask for a late check-out because we could have gone directly from the hotel to the airport but was told that was not possible. Went down to check-out which was fairly quick and had the hotel store our luggage. With the exception of the clerk at check-in, all the staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. We spent our remaining time walking through the hotel which is very beautiful into the grand canal shops at the Venetian which is a definite must see. I did go to the Canyon Ranch Spa while at the hotel which is definitely worth it. Great place to take a break from all the walking on the Strip and the smoke of the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Business/Pleasure Trip”
Reviews.Author: DDB0726
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a great place to stay. The rooms are outstanding. I stayed in a Strip View room looking out at Treasure Island. You could watch the show from our window. The location of this hotel is perfect if you are wanting a place to stay that is close to the convention center but also close to great shopping and food. This was a business and pleasure trip. I was there for a convention but it was also my wedding anniversary. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cathie1771
Reviews.Content: If you like luxury this is the place for you, not one thing anyone could complain about, except maybe that the beds are too comfy and the room is too large and the washroom is too big and the property is too clean.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for Next New Years Eve.”
Reviews.Author: Coco57Noah
Reviews.Content: Definitly going back. We were there for New Years eve..The room with a view could not have been better..The staff addresses you by your name. Only bad thing is the WiFi in your suite you must pay 12.95 for 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LuxFirstTravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the various reviews on the Palazzo, I was a bit concerned about staying here, but all my worries vanished once we got there. Parking was easy, check-in was a breeze and the room was in excellent condition. We got the view we wanted (strip view). Access to the Prestige Lounge is worth the upgrade if you take advantage of the amenities there. The food was decent, but the complimentary cocktail hour needs an upgrade on the wines served. The fitness center was a bit small and too many treadmills were out of order. We had dinner at Dal Toro's for an excellent maine lobster and pasta dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: Fun53_11
Reviews.Content: Get room, super service, highly recommendable. Was there on a business and my borther and his friend spend the time there. Was giving a large suite at regular price. Very friendly housekeepers and they were very professional. Check-in didn't take long.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Nathan S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel with wonderful staff and the best amenities. We were in town for a conference and enjoyed this hotel, thoroughly. We enjoyed eating at the Lux Cafe each day. The pool and spa was awesome and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, and great services....”
Reviews.Author: designmind69
Reviews.Content: My family stayed Dec 23 ~ Dec 27, 2011. The room was spacious and queen size bed (2 of them) was very comfortable. The shower was good and even there was a small LCD TV in restroom. The curtain was remotely controlled and the room has very decent veiws. Definitely 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great every time!”
Reviews.Author: RP8133
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas every year for our National Sales meeting and stay at either the Venetian or Palazzo. This year we were at Palazzo and the room was wonderful as always. Huge suite with a sunken living room with giant sectional couch. Table and chairs, desk area for work, TV in living room and in bedroom area. HUGE marble bathroom with separate vanity area. The cleanliness of the room is top notch and we had twice daily housekeeping that was exceptional including nightly turndown service. We were upgraded to the Prestige Club which was really nice. There is a lounge area where you can have breakfast and a happy hour from 5-8 with appetizers. Front desk service was great and I would always enthusiastically recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: After a half century or more of visiting Las Vegas and staying in many different venues......I believe I found my home. I wouldn't have selected the Palazzo from among the endless selections available, except that when I was looking on the Intercontinental Hotels website, I noticed that the Palazzo is now affiliated with the ICH group. So I thought I could use my Ambassador Status to grab an upgrade, and besides that they were offering a "Suites Deal".....a special on some of their better rooms. I phoned the hotel's reservations line to inquire about various aspects of this deal......and from that point I was hooked. Every aspect of this hotel experience was quite remarkable. I had two separate occasions to phone the reservations line.....and on each occasion I was made to feel like a rich uncle. The agents were extremely warm, engaging and helpful and didn't try to hurry through the call......each was a pleasant encounter. The same was true of the reception, the concierge operation, maid service etc. Obviously the staff at this hotel are carefully selected and very well trained. In such a large property, with so many rooms and employees it is noteworthy that there is such a consistency of customer service excellence. We were upgraded to a grand room facing the strip, right across the street from the Treasure Island casino. Parking is also free of charge and very convenient to elevators leading directly into the lobby/reception area. In the future, we'll be using the Palazzo as our residence whenever we are in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location ...”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan 27 - Feb 1, 2012. Bella suite 700 sq.ft, 2 nice queen-size beds, 4 pillows each & clean linens/duvet, with big lcd tv. Two stairs lead down to room extension with 2nd big lcd tv, clean L-shaped sofa & coffee table, dining table & chairs, office desk with printer, and a safe. There is a $20 mandated daily resort fee that includes access to wifi internet, spa & pools etc. Internet is a bit choppy & slow at times. The room was very clean, quiet, with a great view of golf course, pools, and mountains. Large bathroom with 2 sinks, amenities, separate shower and bath. All the service people are pleasant and helpful. The hotel location is excellent, attached to Venetian, across from Mirage/TI, one block from Fashion mall. Both locations have many excellent restaurants in varying price ranges and popular chefs. The Palazzo poker room has tournaments, the Venetian poker has plenty of cash games. Try the Asian restaurant next to Venetian poker room, fast and delicious; also, the Grand Lux cafe is great and has a short-rib-bacon-burger, yummmm! Palazzo & Venetian are a bit pricey, but my bro & I found a great rate online.

Reviews.Title: “good location and large suites”
Reviews.Author: patvh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two major advantages : its central strip location and its large suites which give a comfy feeling. The suites have a safe where you can store and charge your lap top or ipad. I did pay extra for prestige lounge access (100$) which is a bit expensive for just one person. Prestige comes with free breakfast, free evening drinks and appetizers, the resort fee is waived. The Palazzo is interconnected with the Venetian, there is a large selection of good restaurants. My personal favourites are Morel's (next to the reception) and Bouchon (on the 10th floor of the Venetian). Both restaurants have a good bar where you can sample some food (or take a full meal) and where you can drink some excellent wines and beers (I like their Belgian beer selection). The Palazzo is certainly my favorite hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Comfort”
Reviews.Author: amv52
Reviews.Content: For those who want to make Vegas a sightseeing trip and need to rest well and comfortably at night, the The Palazzo Suites are the top.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LangersInLondon
Reviews.Content: Everything in Vegas is larger than life but I was taken aback by the size of our room! The bathroom was bigger than my London home! Everything was finished to a very high standard and the entire place just oozed luxury. The staff were excellent, nothing was too much trouble from booking restaurants to bringing us a bottle opener, they were so helpful and friendly. Not sure you can really go too far wrong with hotel rooms in Vegas but there was just something about this one that I really fell in love with – would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo's Morrell's is the best classic French restaurant in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: william S
Reviews.Content: Morrell's maybe one of the two best classic French restaurants in Vegas. The food was creative yet mainstream classic french. Fruit and candied walnut salad, all the cheeses, bacon studded escargot, short ribs to die for, aged steaks w/ all the sauces. The service was impeccable but could use larger ice water glasses and colder water for our U.S. palates. No jacket needed. Manager should do a better job at promoting as it deserves a more featured place on the net.

Reviews.Title: “Resort fees”
Reviews.Author: sydney69England
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms are some of the biggest in Vegas (but for some reason don't give slippers). They do charge a "resort fee" which always gets up my nose. For $20 you get free internet (but only if you have a laptop which I didn't), Free local phone calls (not much use to me in the UK!!), a free coffee (but they didn't give me the "voucher" at check in). It's just another way to drag a few more bucks out of the customer, just add it to the room rate and people like me wouldn't complain!!!! I noticed that hotels like Ceasars Palace and Paris don't charge resort fees so there's no reason for anyone else to either (in my opinion that is). Still a great hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hmseminole
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas for business twice a year. We have stayed at the Bellagio, MGM, Treasure Island, The Golden Nugget, Trump (extremely poor), Encore (Great Hotel) and the Palazzo. I would rate the Palazzo and Encore as the best 2 hotels in Vegas. The service is outstanding and the Casino shows little sign of smoke. The 720 sq. foot suites were beautifully appointed and the beds were very comfortable. The location is perfect for shopping, the strip, and great restaurants. For meals, try the breakfast buffet at the Grand Luxe Cafe with no waiting and only $16.50 with coffee and juice. For the best burger ever, eat at Carnevino pub, but expect to pay $12 and up for beer. For coffee, go to the Cafe Presse in the shops as the coffee in the hotel were not very good. We rented a car on this trip, and the self parking was easy to get in and out of the hotel without waiting in hotel lines. If was easy to get to the interstate and many points of interest also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, good location, don't use the sofa bed!”
Reviews.Author: frog_brains
Reviews.Content: Myself, my boss, and his father, were down in Vegas for about a week in january to attend a convention. Being 3 full grown male adults and needing 3 beds in the same room is a hard thing to find in las Vegas, most places will force you to get a second room or to share a bed which isn't happening. The Pallazzo being an all suite hotel does have rooms with pull out sofa "bed" to accomodate us (more on the sofa "bed" later) The room was really nice and clean, but had limited storage space for clothes, and $20 for 24hrs of internet service! really Really weird about the bathroom was that the toilet was in it's own little closet, which I've never seen before. All the Restaurants in Both the Palazzo and the Venetian are top shelf, and I will review those seperately. So back to the sofa "bed" when we made the reservations they specifically knew that we wanted the 3rd bed to be in use. When we checked in not only was the bed not pulled out and made, there wasn't even any bedding in the room for it, a call down to housekeeping fixed that, sort of, the bedding was brought up and left. No effort to make the extra bed or even offer to make it was done. This actually turned out to be a blessing because the mattress on that "bed" was the worst i've ever slept on. The bright side was that the sofa cushions were on the sofa part were very comfortable. If you're ever in the situation that you need to sleep some extra people in a room don't even consider pulling out the "bed" just ask for the bedding and sleep on the sofa

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suites”
Reviews.Author: pme701
Reviews.Content: The suites of Palazzo are very much like those in Venetian though slightly more modern and updated. Even the smallest suite has 3 TVs. Palazzo does charge an extra $40 a night for a view, but it is nice to open the drapes with the remote and look out at the mountains without ever leaving the bed! I am so happy to see this hotel has dispensed with bed spreads or coverlets, (they always gross me out) in favor of duvets that are changed with each visitor. Desk staff was efficient and very nice, even while explaining additional fees tacked on the room. On top of taxes there is an extra $20 per day “resort fee”. I’m not sure why they don’t just bury this in the room fee, as I find add-ons rather annoying. The fee does allow you to access WiFi and I did find the connection to be quite fast. The property is tall rather than spread out, so you won’t be walking for blocks just to get to your room. The casino is small and very navigable and the machines really seemed to pay out well! Restaurant selection is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Vegas fan but Palazzo nice”
Reviews.Author: AutobahnRacer
Reviews.Content: Never liked Vegas but The Palazzo was really nice! Wish I could get a cup of coffee for less than 5 bucks or a beer for less than $10 nearby but I guess they need to make some cash to keep open the shopping mall it is surrounded by, that no one buys anything at.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ellzebeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in January, and couldn't be happier. Check in was smooth. We got up to our room, didn't care too much for the view, called downstairs and asked if we could be moved to a room with a nicer view, and they were more than happy to assist. In just a few short minutes, we were moved up to a higher floor with a golf course view. The rooms are nice and spacious, never did we feel like we were cramped or stepping over ourselves or our belongings. The service was always courteous and the staff happy to help. The rooms are nicely equipped (bath robes, 3 tvs, great little vanity area, nice big bathroom, big open sitting area)...can't really ask for too much more from a hotel stay. As large as the hotel is, it was always clean in every area. We walked all through it and never came across an area that appeared to be in need of attention. The casino is not really the place to be, rather empty, but otherwise no complaints. There are a few good places to eat, the hotel is connected to the Venetian, and right next to the Wynn. If I were to return to Vegas, I'd stay here again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “An experience”
Reviews.Author: MFLetou
Reviews.Content: It has been almost a year since my visit to The Palazzo, and I just realized I never wrote a review. Recently I've been feeling an urge to go back, which isn't in the cards right now so a review is the next best thing. First of all, this is an incredible physical property. It is NOT a true luxury hotel, but it is a very, very nice hotel that most will find enjoyable. The rooms are luxurious, and worthy of a 4+ star rating, the service does not. The rooms themselves are larged. Mine was in good condition, with fresh furniture and no order. I had paid extra for a Strip view and was disappointed...the property is simply not oriented properly for much of a view. We found the room to be quieter than most and didn't hear any neighbors during our entire stay. The casino is a slighly nicer version of The Venetians. I wish that the "smoke free corridors" were more segregated and better enforced--I have to believe there is a market for a real smoke free casino in Vegas, it would be an interesting experiment. There are a multitude of dining options--I reviewed several. A major advantage of staying here is easy and indoor access to the Venetian--with its landmark Grand Canal Shops and dining options. Parking is quite easy and plentiful. This aspect was well designed for such a huge property. The Palazzo's location on the strip is a little bit north of the action, but just across a pedestrian bridge from the Wynn Resorts and across the street from the always buzzing Mirage. My only significant complaint is the staff--unfriendly, no warmth, and no particular desire to please. Also, my room was not ready at the appointed check in time, with no apology and no voucher for something to make up for the fact that I was stuck for an entire extra hour with no room to go to. Hard to believe in a hotel this size. It is the service which holds this property back. However, I would certainly return in a heartbeat--the benefits far away the service. My only real complaint is that the staff

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Jenny201110
Reviews.Content: Palazzo is connecting to Venetian, cross Las Vegas Blvd to Mirage and Treasure Island, and next to Wynn by a bridge across Sands Ave. Their room is larger than other hotels with a very large and beautiful bathroom. It is very comfortable to stay at Palazzo. Although the hotel is only 2 years old, missing buttons are found on the couch, which is not like a 5 stars hotel imaging. There is no coffee maker in the room. The pool is out door, but heated. The second level of Palazzo is all luxurious boutiques. There are 58 restaurants & lounges between Palazzo and Venetian. Morels French Steakhouse & Bistro has excellent food; lunch is more affordable. Zeffirino Ristorante makes you feel that you are eating dinner in Venice. You can rent a car from Avis at Palazzo, but the price is 2-3 times higher than the price of the car rental in the airport. In addition, you may need to have a car wash before you return your car if you drive to parks or canyons. There is $50 car wash charge if your car has dirt out side. Palazzo has an airport shuttle service with $7 each way.

Reviews.Title: “best rooms on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Traveller13Calgary
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, but forget the view of the strip we much preferred the back of the hotel view which overlooks the Wynn golf course and mountains. The rooms, like the rest of the hotel are very clean and the bathroom was huge complete with double sink, seperate shower and tub. The drapes and blinds are controlled via remote, very cool when you first wake up and want to let in that Vegas sunshine. The maids were very prompt in cleaning the room and one tip I always suggest to people is leave a daily tip for the housekeeping staff on the bed when you go out for the day. Makes more sense than leaving a tip at the end of your stay if staying multiple days

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: -Travel-Nut-86-
Reviews.Content: I love the palazzo, rooms are clean, large, and reasonably priced. Great location on the strip. Stayed here a few times, most recently in august for my birthday and had a blast. The beds are comfy and I love their spacious bathrooms! I'll definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: janeonlongisland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, we went next door and went 'ice skating" at the Venetian. Restaurants seemed a little pricey but probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pam0702
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel after 7:00 in the evening. The non-smoking Bella Suite I had reserved was not available but I was offered a smoking suite or an accessible suite for the night. I chose the accessible suite which faced the strip and was told that they could move us the next day. I called the next day and was told they would happily move us but that if I wanted a room that overlooked the strip it would be an additional $45 per night. We decided to keep the room and the view. Only problem with the accessible suite was that the shower curtain was rather short and water would splash out into the bathroom floor and there was no bathtub. Loved walking around the hotel and the Venitian which was connected. Great shopping but could use more low price dinning options. Location near the Fashion Mall was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Best on Strip /High Table mins”
Reviews.Author: travler357
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms great view of strip many upgrades if you gamble free food in hotel and club access .Hate that hey raise table mins at night. Never had any issues only place I stay on strip .Free shuttle to and from airport . Never any issues with check in staff always nice.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly D
Reviews.Content: I've been attending trade shows in Vegas for many years - and stayed at most of the hotels - but the Palazzo (and it's sister property the Venetian) has to be the best hotel! The rooms are spacious, the choices in dining are outstanding, and the people are so nice. The value for your money is very good - I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS FROM START TO FINISH!!!!”
Reviews.Author: courtney s
Reviews.Content: We booked over the internet by putting in a bid for a 5star hotel on the strip...we used priceline. We took a chance and then couldn't stop praising our luck at ending up at such an outstanding hotel! We had one of the best times of our combined lived and have shared our experience with everyone we have spoken with since our return to New Zealand. The restaurants, LAVA and Sushi Samba rank as some of the most impressive experiences ever. We would have stayed for days if we had the time. We originally booked for one night but after watching the sunrise from our suite on the 1st morning, we picked up the phone and extended our stay. We were treated like royalty and felt like it, too!!! ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Biliana L
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Palazzo. The room was amazing, overlooking Treasure Island, we watched the show every night from our suite. Everything was very clean and the staff was friendly. Overall a very nice hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way baby!”
Reviews.Author: lexi1980
Reviews.Content: HUGE room. Excellent front desk service. Amazing view. Most comfie bed. And the bathroom... jets in the shower. Need I say more? Do it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in Las Vegas blvd. Is right next to The Venetian and you cant even tell when you walk from one hotel to another one. The rooms are all suites and very nice views, I could see the treasure Island show right from my window. A lot of space and amenities; stores, casino, restaurants, shows, you name it.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out monster”
Reviews.Author: ozplod66
Reviews.Content: I checked in here for 1 night after 3 nights staying at the Wynn Encore next door. I wanted to try something different in Vegas from the Wynn but wish I hadnt. The Encore is a delightful 5 star hotel, the Palazzo is a tired, smokey motel at best. My room had cracked mirrors, no less than nine light bulbs not working, cigarette burns on the carpet, cracked shower screen and generally looked very tired and beaten up. It was clean and spacious but devoid of any style or quality. The hotel is huge. Front of house staff appear swamped by guest numbers but were generally polite and efficient. The public areas are vast, smokey and generally quite tacky...yeah its Vegas I know but try the Wynn for OTT decor that also seems classy. Didnt eat or gamble here. I found the location better than the Wynn only because it is nearer the mid strip around the Bellagio. The hotel needs a make over and at the very least a lot of maintenance. In a town as competitive as Vegas for accommodation the Palazzo is in danger of being a massive loser.

Reviews.Title: “Love Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Twintime1
Reviews.Content: I really love Palazzo. The bathrooms are amazing!!! I got a good night sleep both occasions I have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, Nice but showing wear.”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Palazzo. The last time was probably 2-3 years ago. We decided to do a sister’s visit and stayed here. The rooms are still nice, but starting to show a little wear and tear. The hotel was decorated for Xmas and was quite beautiful. ROOMS: The rooms are like mini apartments with sunken living rooms with a large sectional, floor to ceiling windows, 3 televisions and plenty of space to move around. Our view was of the adjourning hotel’s golf course which was beautiful. The bathroom is huge and all 3 of us were able to get ready at the same time. The bathroom also has a separate area, with a door, for the toilet. The beds were comfy and roomy. There was only one center nightstand between the two beds. Two nightstands would be great, especially when there are more than two people in a room. The minibar was well stocked, but pricey. FOOD: The Grand Lux is now a restaurant with very average, over-priced food. Nothing that any of us ate was worth mentioning. We did go over to the Venetian and they have a food court area that had very reasonable breakfast selections. Defnitely worth a stop. Our main focus this trip was to see the shows though. I will review those in a separate post: Le Reve, Menopause the Musical, Hitsville and Rita Rudner. CONS: The hotel is showing it's wear from my previous visit 2 years ago, scuffed woodwork and wallpaper. Poor housecleaning - I dropped something on the floor by the bed and found a mini bottle of water by the nightstand that was covered by the spread - we never had a water bottle. Cushions on sectional wearing down...just little things, but not paying enough attention to details. When my husband and I visit Las Vegas, we like to stay in different hotels, but since my sisters had not been to the Palazzo, we decided to chose here. They loved it, but if I was returning, I would select a different hotel. This is not a bad choice by any means, but for the price, we want something that is maintained a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms but service hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: pandg1
Reviews.Content: We originally book The Venetian but got offered an upgrade to The Palazzo on arrival. The room was absolutely amazing. Very plush, modern/traditional, upscale and HUGE. We had a room on the 37th floor overlooking part of the strip (Strip view is facing Treasure Island). The bathroom is fantastic and gigantic. The service was very average for a top end hotel. The concierge was very rushed (maybe short of staff) and didn't have much time time for us. The reception staff on check out wasn't paying any attention, yawning and tried to tell me that I hadn't given her the correct money to pay the bill. She then realized I had, but with no apology. Overall, If we got a good deal, we'd stay here again(only for the room). However, if it would have to be a very good deal otherwise we'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Five Diamond??”
Reviews.Author: fififlies
Reviews.Content: It's attention to the little things that make for a 5-Star/Diamond property. Among the things not up to 5-star standard (and this may sound picky)--bath towels small and dingy, same with robe; shower water pressure not great, but we were on the 38th floor which could explain it; sound transmission from next room--could hear voices, thumping; food smells from ????; electronic mini bar, fridge with no room for personal items; not adequate hangers for 2 day and we packed light!; dim lighting--probably part of the "green" initiative; uncomfortable desk chair if you had to do work. Decor a little tired, section fabric worn, dings on wood furniture, window shade crooked. Resort fee of $22,50/day but included free internet, access to fitness center, 2 cups coffee, daily newspaper (which you had to pick up on 2nd floor). Liked the safe which was a pull-out drawer, easy to access. Great view overlooking Treasure Island with pirate ship battles--fun to watch!

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancy l
Reviews.Content: I am currently a guest at the Palazzo and I have to say that this is NOT a five star hotel. We paid extra to stay on the "prestige" level and that was a total waste of money. I have to say that although I have stayed at this hotel on previous occasions, it has gone way down hill. I realize that this is Las Vegas and one should not expect a Ritz Carlton atmosphere, but what we have encountered at the Palazzo is more along the lines of a low level brand hotel. The one saving grace that this hotel has is the room size. Their rooms are very spacious and clean; however their costumer service and amenities were far below any 5 star standards that one should expect. The restaurants in the Palazzo are not very good either. The Venetian has a better selection for food choices. Tao is a popular choice for most guests....especially in the summer. For a quick bite, I would suggest the food court or Grand Luxe. Overall, I feel as though when you stay at a hotel that offers a "prestige level" and are expected to pay an additional $100+++ for it, then they should make an effort to make their guests feel as though they are in a 5 star environment. I am very disappointed with this hotel and will not be staying here anytime in the near future. It is truly a shame because they use to be a top notch property.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: KatieTravels89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long girls weekend. I was a little skeptical at first, but the place is like a palace. Everything was clean (I could eat off the floors), staff was incredibly friendly, and the room was huge! We got there any recieved a free upgrade without even asking. The only complaint I have is the individuals in the pool area were a bit pushy. There was a private area that people would come around and try to talk you into buying your way in. Once you get in you have to pay for a place to sit, for drinks, etc. Outside of that, it was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: lailadog
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Palazzo in celebration of our anniversary. I've traveled to Vegas for over 30 years and this was the largest Vegas hotel room I've stayed in. The hotel itself is beautiful and well maintained. We decided to stay in a prestige suite and I will say it was worth it. If you know that you will take advantage of the daily breakfast and happy hour, it is a good investment. The prestige concierge arranged for a romantic dinner at a skytop restaurant overlooking the strip and roses and champagne delivery to our room. Nice touch! We stayed on the 23rd floor overlooking Treasure island, however, due to the time of year, the pirate attraction was under construction. The hotel's location is on the further end of the strip so if you are not willing to walk, be sure to make transportation arrangements. I enjoyed our stay and we're looking forward to staying at the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShazaamIam
Reviews.Content: Room was very large & clean. Bathroom was spotless. We also had issues with several burned out lightbulbs and a bedside lamp that wouldn't turn off without unplugging it. Reported it on our 1st day of stay. We were there only 3 days--nothing fixed. The broken bedside table lamp was annoying, but nothing major. For as nice of a hotel as it is, it surprised me things weren't fixed immediately, but there was a convention going on and I guess they were very busy. Had we stayed longer, I would have complained again. We did not choose to upgrade our room--$45/night for a view of the Strip; over $100/night for the Concierge Level. One annoyance--you have to walk (a long way) thru the Casino itself to get to the room elevators. We are not smokers and the smell of smoke in the Casino was very strong. They have posted signs that they have a no-smoking section, but it wasn't on the path to the room elevators. I know it's Vegas--I expected a smoky smell in the Casinos--but didn't want to have my luggage smelling of smoke! (Note: We walked into many hotel casinos during our stay; some were smoky; some were not--The Flamingo was NOT.) Overall, it is a very nice hotel, clean and roomy. Our complaints were minor. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Giant rooms”
Reviews.Author: GinnyBeeking
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I ever been. The rooms are beautifull and not to mention very big! There's a TV in the bathroom, living room area and in front of your bed. Cleaning is done very well and all together it just looks amazing. Only downside was that I had a view at the wall :(. But it was for business so not a lot of time to look out the window anyways. One downside is the room service. The food was not good. It was too cold and too greasy. Considering the great restaurants they have in the hotel, I don't understand this. This hotel is great for both business and family. It is very big, but hey that's everywhere in Vegas. The casino looks really nice as well and the restaurants are wonderfull. The location in also great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: RickBeaulieu
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip and I stayed 5 days. The Palazzo Resort is the sister hotel of the Venetian, which I stayed in last year. Both have similar, if not identical rooms. If you are attending an industry show or exhibition at the Sands (connected to the hotels under one roof), stay at the Palazzo ... its a shorter walk. I took the concierge upgrade and I recommend it. It includes wifi, turndown service, access to the spa and fitness center, breakfast, Hor D'voures and open bar from 5 to 8. Lots of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for location and room size...”
Reviews.Author: BlondeNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend recently and I would stay here agin for sure which is why I gave it 5 stars. The location is fantastic, LAVO is in the building along with some great shopping and TAO in the neighboring attached Venetian which are all great reasons to stay. The room was a great size and we loved the sunken living room. We also loved the remote control curtains so we didn't have to get out of bed to open them in the morning to let in some sunlight. My non-5 star categories are: I would give Housekeeping: 2 to 3 stars, we kept having to call for extra towels, then the next day they would still leave only 2 towels for the 3 of us and we had to call again, they left dirty wine glasses and we had to call for clean ones, constantly calling but they always came quick with whatever we needed) Room service: food was excellent but ALWAYS took a full hour at least (even on the non-weekend mornings). Bed: was not as plush as I would have liked and the bedding was less luxurious then I expect in a LV hotel (cosmo, palms, bellagio...even MGM has better bedding in my opinion). All that said I would still 100% spend the money to stay here again it is a great hotel, prime location and huge rooms. Call for room service earlier then you need to and enjoy your stay! (at DEF hit LAVO Saturday Champagne Brunch it goes until May I think it's an AMAZING TIME!!)

Reviews.Title: “Best Las Vegas has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: ming059
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 25th Anniversary. First time in Vegas in 16 years, so it had changed a lot! Chose the Palazzo for the suites (spectacular stip view, sunken living room, king bed, huge bathroom) and the Prestige club (private intimate champagne check in, continental breakfast, daytime beverages, and complimentary premium cocktail/hor d'heures reception between 5 - 8 every day) and the inclusive nature (Palazzo, stores, canal, Venetian is a delightful shopping (even a Walgreens, and event area). You never really need to leave the hotel complex!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but lacking in maintenance”
Reviews.Author: HonoluluMuffin
Reviews.Content: The room on the 40nth floor was very nice and spacious. However we had issues with light bulbs and lamps. Housekeeping service lacked as well. No shampoo or conditioner and amenity box (cotton pads, q-tips). Upon inquiring, it was an oversight by housekeeping. As for the light bulb in the bathroom, we called and had it fixed but it went out again a few days later and so did the bulb in the closet. The bedside lamp was difficult to turn off, had the maid show me, but she had problems too. I ended up having to unplug the darn lamp to get some sleep. Other than those minor details, we had an enjoyable time. But I would not stay here again at those prices. There are other hotels better maintained on the Strip at comparable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barbiezeega
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at The Palazzo Resort for 4 night / 5 days. The experience was excellent. The rooms are furnished very nicely and we were on the concierge level. The concierge level is worth every penny because it includes a continental breakfast and happy hour. Both continental breakfast and happy hour served really nice food choices. The service was excellent too. At Happy Hour they serve premium wines and awesome snacks! The hotel decor is really well appointed and the staff was helpful at all times. The spa was a bit run down; needs a fresh coat of paint and the overall facility was just OK. However, my massage (ASHIATSU -DEEP BAREFOOT massage) was outstanding as was my facial (80 minute "Up Lifting")! One of the best! The location of The Palazzo is really excellent too. You can walk just about everywhere and if you taxi it's easy and not too expensive. We saw Zumanity which was absolutely amazing. We played golf at Bali Hai and we did the roller coaster at New York, New York and ate the best dinner of our lives at Michael s. (Michael s is in an older casino and a taxi ride of about 15 minutes) Well worth the taxi ride! Incredible food and incredible service. Food prepared table side and could not have been any better! We had a great trip and The Palazzo was a big part of making it very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Brett S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at many hotels in Vegas and this is the best so far...Paid the extra and got an upgrade to an incredible room/suite. Well worth it...it looked a little like the suite from 'The Hangover'. Staff were fantastic and the casino facilities are 2nd to none. Hotel is almost right accross the road from the Belaggio the the fountains so couldn't be more central. Multiple casino's / shopping and venitian style canals included!

Reviews.Title: “The Hangover for Brea alumni”
Reviews.Author: haroldgreen
Reviews.Content: My friends and I did a reunion here. We hadnt seen each other for 20 years. We had a blast, we had a huge room with a piano on the 26th floor. I dont think we could have had a better time. And remember, what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas!!!! Big ups!!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL BIRTHDAY WEEKEND!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blueyes1093
Reviews.Content: This was my forth trip to Vegas but was the best! From the time we stepped into the lobby of the Palazzo it took our breath away. We got there earlier than check in time but they knew we had early arrival. Our room was ready!!! The room was a classic suite that overlooked the Wynn Golf course. We were able to enjoy some spectacular sun rises. Room was clean quiet and comfortable. My husband and I needed this weekend away. I was worth every penny!!!! If I were going to Vegas again and had my choice of anyplace to stay it would be the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: kayk_Tn
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas when My husband was home on Leave from Afghanistan. We loved the hotel the room size everything. The rooms were very large and plush. The hotel is in a great location. We were able to do a lot just with in walking distance or with out even leaving the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre service, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: Staff morale must be low because everybody from the front desk to the restaraunt staff did not seem to like their jobs. Room was nice enough, but was missing some of the basics, such as trash cans in the bathrooms and a working scale. Cleaning crew could work a bit harder too. A quick meal was hard to find too, had to go next door to Dennys to get an easy breakfast. There were some nice things; room was big, parking was easy and location great. I'd probably not stay here again, I prefer Bellagio or Wynn for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the reception”
Reviews.Author: Alex P
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a stunning hotel in terms of location, environment in the gambling hall, bars available and quality of the restaurants (Cut, SushiSamba and B&B ristorante I highly recommend). Traveling in a party of 8, we had booked the rooms in Oct 2011, arriving in Jan 2012. We had requested connecting rooms on the same floor and this was confirmed as being arranged (despite connecting rooms requests normally being best endeavors). However, upon arriving at the hotel and checking in, we were told that the rooms were all on separate floors, some with different elevator bays, etc. This was unacceptable, especially when the excuse given was "CES is around.." or "these things happen". Furthermore, one of the rooms had to check in twice (the following day again) due to issues with the reservation (although all 4 rooms were booked together) and risked having to move rooms! Like I say, the hotel itself is great, but the service at the front desk and the issues which shouldn't be happening when paying such high rates was unacceptable and forces me to look at other hotels when returning to Las Vegas. Alex

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo - nice but not as good as The Wynn”
Reviews.Author: Impactdancer
Reviews.Content: 7th trip to Vegas and the Palazzo is nice but doesn't quite do it for me. I think I have probably been won over by The Wynn and The Encore and may not find anything that comes close to the ambiance of these 2 superb hotels. The Palazzo is very big, it looks big and it feels big. We chose the prestige suites, which is excellent value for money. This is one area that The Palazzo excelled at. Although the cost seems significantly higher than a standard suite, it includes continental breakfast (which was very good), canapes and light snacks early evening and a free bar 5-8pm. If you take advantage of all of these included items, (and remember every drink is usually $10), the extra cost of prestige is well worth it. It also includes free internet access. We were there over New Year and quite a few people were taking full advantage of the free bar. Bearing in mind it was New Year, and allowing for the number people in the hotel and the number of drunk people wandering around, I have to say i was still a little disappointed in the system for checking who was going up to the rooms. A point for management to look at is how they control the number of people getting access to rooms on one card; we counted 13 at one point. Were they all sleeping in one room? The rooms are spacious, room service was excellent and the cleaners were very good, especially as they were constantly cleaning up after New Year party animals. We ate at Wolfgang Puck's Cut - superb, best steak ever and Aquaknox is also very good. Summary - The Palazzo is good for large groups, but if you want opulence, ambiance and that totally relaxed feeling go for The Wynn (The Wynn over The Encore any day).

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mqnstr
Reviews.Content: Great location with the easy access to the Venetian. Really nice huge rooms. Very friendly staff special thanks to Conny and Justin on reception desk for working through our bill adjustments. would recommend based on comments made when we compared our room with friends staying at other Hotels .ie MGM , Treasure Island .Could improve mini bar incorrect charges.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: Frostie181
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Christmas Day and stayed until New Year. Room was fabulous, we upgraded to a strip view so that we had a good view of the fireworks on New Year's Eve and it was definitely worth it. Staff were courteous and friendly and the room was really clean (though not sure all the fittings are standing the test of time). Had heard that the showers weren't great but the one in our room was fantastic. Great choice of restaurants at the Palazzo/Venetian as well. We ate at Postrio, Dal Toro and Delmonico. Have stayed in a number of different hotels in Vegas and this is definitely the favourite!

Reviews.Title: “Only a super-sweet deal would get me back”
Reviews.Author: Vinovixen
Reviews.Content: There are so many great hotels on the strip, I'm not sure why this one would be your first choice. Stayed here for the first time last summer for a girls' weekend getaway. We booked a Bella suite. The light switch cut my friend's hand when she walked in the room; we opened a drawer to the dresser and it felt off; the artwork on the wall had some sort of food or slobber stains on the glass. Who knows how long it had been there. When the staff came to clean the room, they didn't replace our dirty glassware unless we asked. Other than that, the room was spacious and comfortable. If it wasn't for the lack of attention to detail, I probably would have given four stars. Now, let's talk about the pool.
