Who builds a hotel in a position that blocks sun to the pool until like 1 p.m.? I come to Vegas 3-4 times per year. And I come to eat, drink, see shows and hang out at the pool. On the second day, we just walked over to the Venetian and used their pool so we could have sunshine before the afternoon. Also, I find it fascinating that a hotel can charge like $400 per night for a room and then not have poolside food service. If we wanted something to eat, we had to get up and walk over to a window (like a drive-in) and order -- then stand outside and wait for our number to be called. How deli. When I was younger, I stayed whenever I could get a good deal. Lately, I've been staying at the Wynn or Mandarin. If you want to have great service, attention to detail and a get quality poolside experience, stay at the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo will be Home away from Home.....”
Reviews.Author: Ric C
Reviews.Content: First time at the Palazzo/Venetian after 15 prior visits to Vegas. Joined Grazie and now almost Gold points for the next visit. Staff was efficient and courteous from start to finish. Arrived after 8p.m and had to settle for 2 Qns, rather than King, but upgraded to Strip View. B&B, Valentino's & Delmonico Steak House were superb with excellent service and outstanding food from Mario Batali, Joe Bastianich and Emeril Lagasse. Room service was efficient usually with 45 minutes. Saw Phantom ( shortened version from the Original I saw on Broadway, as I am from NY/CT) and it was very good. Slots seem very tightly wound.( $1 machines). With the Venetian next door it makes it seem like you are staying at a larger complex with many Resort options. (Thought about Bellagio but went for the Suite rather than room.) 4 night stay. This Sicilian Italian from the North East will return. Yes, its more money than the $50 dollar Vegas room, but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve Celebration”
Reviews.Author: bakerswoodfox
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo was a wonderful place to celebrate the 2012! We had a perfect room 24738 it overlooked the Treasure Island Hotel & we had a wonderful view of the fireworks at midnight! Service in the room was great and so was the cleanliness of the room! The shower pressure in the main spout was in need of help however! This suite was a Prestige suite which comes with breakfast & access to the Prestige Club. It would have been nice to have the Palazzo inform us that in order to participate in the NYE celebration at the Prestige Club it had to be booked ahead when we booked the room.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay in Vegas so far!”
Reviews.Author: ninamelie07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a luxury suite with a view last week. The view was fantastic! The suite has floor to ceiling windows so you wake up to fantastic views of mountains in the back of the Treasure Island hotel... and beautiful Vegas lights at night. The room was the most comfortable, tons of space, 3 flat screen TVs and sufficient storage. Palazzo has lots of restaurants and if you don't care much about fine dining you can always eat at Grand Lux Cafe which is a smaller version of Cheesecake Factory. The average check without drinks was about $30 for two of us. They offer lunch and breakfast specials for under $10/person. There are at least 10 places between Palazzo and the Venetian where you can get quick bites and coffee. Palazzo's resort fees include access to the fitness center which is one of the best I've ever seen in a hotel. Try Canyon Ranch cafe at the gym for health breakfast and lunch (little too pricey but great). Housekeeping did a wonderful job cleaning the room but we made an effort to get to know our housekeeper and tipped her on couple occasions. Be ready to call for service when you want your room cleaned. We called every day before we left our room and the room was cleaned when we came back. All of the special requests were answered right away (extra hangers, towels etc.). You have ability to check your room charges on TV screen and we did it every day. Once during our stay we were charged for a water from the electronic snack bar which we did not use. The charges were removed right away after we called. Being able to swim in the outdoor pool was a nice surprise. The largest pool is open and heated. There is also a 24-person jacuzzi which was very relaxing after miles and miles of walking. Outdoor day temperature during our stay was 62-64 degrees. You can’t enter hotel elevators without showing your room key. I felt very safe in this hotel. We had a problem with a couple arguing in their room next door at night. We called security and it was taken care of immediately. Palazzo is so far my favorite Vegas hotel and we stayed in 7 others on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: inthelooper
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully chic hotel with tons of bars and restaurants in and around the hotel. It's all suites so we felt like high rollers. Also, it is attached to the Venetian and across from Treasure Island so location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, but probably better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: stewartdavies1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Prestige rooms - on balance worth it, due to the cocktail evenings which went on for 3 hours, although the club allows children, so I was a bit manic. + ves - hugely impressive complex. Spacious gaming rooms, great shows. Adjacent Venetian Hotel is equally impressive, access to night clubs, great spa. Plenty of choice for restaurants and food court. - ves - just a little expensive. Bottom end of the strip. Breakfast was poor. Only soft drinks in the day at the club, and evening canapés were pretty poor. Overall, no real complaints

Reviews.Title: “pretty much perfection”
Reviews.Author: bob l
Reviews.Content: stayed here many of times, they were comped so i of course i had to give high praise. Only one flaw that one night i returned around 2am, there were 'hired help' wondering around the casino floor looking for business. i think they should do something more to prevent such scene. i have seem many times in different hotels (Rio, Paris...) these 'hired help' wondering around casino VIP check in and tried to lure business. though the rooms were comped, but the casino definitely got the $ back for them. oh well, it was well worth it, i would give it to them rather than any other sleezy harrahs hotels......oops, did i say that...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JC A
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Las Vegas is the Palazzo. I was there in January when the hotel was still beautifully decorated for Christmas. The hotel rooms are wonderful with the best amenities. The rooms are a great value with the most comfortable beds & nicest baths. The casino is great too. My friends and I all had some luck in the casino. Great mix of table games and slots with great drinks and a pleasant gaming atmosphere. There was a bar with entertainment that was also very good. Great restaurants from fine dining to the sports bar where you can enjoy food and a game with friends in a very comfortable setting. Great hotel if you enjoy the best of everything. I've seen Phantom in the past. Best show in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Palazzo/Venetian 4 times and love it. I just took my girlfriend for the first time and she was amazed. Beautiful suites with great amenities. Very nice casino and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lilylulu95
Reviews.Content: Okay this are truly suites 600 Sq. ft. or something ridiculous - I especially love the drapes - I love those details that are a step above the normal. There is nothing about this room you're not going to love. Staff was very friendly. This was a working trip so I did not really get to enjoy the pool area - but took a look and it's very nice. Lavo's is great for a quick dinner and a cocktail and if you're travelling solo - you can eat at the bar. Vegas is an annual trip for me - so for me - this IS the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Happy New Year at The Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie154984
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Palazzo was from Dec. 29 to Jan. 5. The layout of the hotels, Venetian and Palazzo, is amazing with stunning detail. We were fortunate to have a suite overlooking the Strip and the view was great. Fireworks on New Year's Eve, over TI, were spectacular and we were able to sip champagne and view directly from our window. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom with all the amenities, double sink, marble floors, spacious, who could ask for more? The sunken living room again showing attention to design/detail. A beautiful room in all aspects. Great casinos in both Venetian and Palazzo. Lots of people having fun including us. Mario Battali's 3 restaurants are all amazing. Wonderful meals and a must try. All of them!!! Kudos to all staff at The Venetian/Palazzo. We had a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Palazzo, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: wldtravelr
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Palazzo a few weeks ago. This is always my hotel of choice on the strip bc it feels a bit more intimate than the other resorts, I like the pool area (although it was too cold on this visit), I like the spa facilities, I love the canyon ranch cafe, and we like the other restaurants in the palazzo and venetian. I had one bad experience at check in (thus the 4 stars instad of 5) where they didn't show our spa credit on our reservation package and it frustrated me that it took us speaking to a manager to get it resolved. Careful when you are booking packages b/c they don't have this information at check in. However, I had a great experience with security when I had to break up a ridiculous party next door that was so loud I thought I was still at Tao. Security handled it great and ended up either kicking out the people or moving them to another room. My migraine appreciated their help and we had a peaceful two night stay. I didn't notice any smoke smell in our room as I have at other hotels. We had a nice time playing craps, poker, etc. in the casion and they certainly made a lot of money off us that weekend! Overall, a great stay and I would certainly plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: iskico10
Reviews.Content: Ambience and staff were amazing over New Year's weekend. Only dislike were frequent cooking smells wafting into my 42nd floor room. Everything else was 5-star. Grand Lux (try Huevos Rancheros) and Canyon Ranch Spa for breakfasts, Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf for coffee. The Canal Shoppes in connected Venetian and shopes in Palazzo were fun to look at. (Kudoes to some helpful gals at Palazzo's Victoria's Secret.) Take a gondola ride, short but worth it. Restaurants all serve 5-star food with 5-star service.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: jmeunier15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo in January. The suite was fantastic! Absolute luxury all the way around. The rest of the hotel is just as beautiful and the variety of stores and restaurants makes it worth it to stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NoSleepTillBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo between Christmas and New Year's. Great as always (other than the stupid "resort fee" for a bunch of stuff that I never use). I thought all of the rooms had sunken living rooms, but our room this time was just flat. Enjoyed the openness and relative smoke free casino. Drink service at the tables was really slow. Received a few coupons at the front desk for restaurants on the property, but they weren't too exciting (see other reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pandora3011
Reviews.Content: Loved everything!! People are so friendly and the room was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “ana amazing hotel with service to back it up”
Reviews.Author: barrogers
Reviews.Content: from start to finish we each had an amazing time at the palazzo hotel. despite a rocky patch at the start with a mixup on the booking we all checked in and started the experience.  ok so ill try break it down for you to see if the options we took may suit you also. we had four rooms in total for our party of seven. 3 of the rooms we had as and i use this term very loosely 'standard' luxury suites. these are basically tier  1 of the room options available. we where presented with the option of upgrading to a strip view for a fee of 45 per night, which we each took. two of the rooms had a better view. from these you could see both the treasure island water display and also the mirage.(room numbers where 48710/49710). i would definitely recommend this view if you can get it as it was spectacular. the view from the other room would be more partial strip as all you could see was treasure island but still this was amazing. the final room on our reservation was for the  upgraded option of the prestige luxury where by guest have their own check in on the 23rd floor and basically a concierge style executive level with some extras. for example there was an open bar from 5-8 each evening which is very generous and h'our dourves to beat the band. the only thing i would say is if you are traveling as a group either all upgrade or none as really  you want to spend your time with the group so taking up the free drinks offer on your own is not going to happen.  as for the rooms, well where to start. if i could move in tomorrow i would have. from the very spacious bathrooms with his and hers sinks, vanity table for the ladies bath and shower separate and of course toilet. a very big king bed then followed leading to the slightly lowered L shaped couch in a very comfy sitting area. little things like a remote to open the blinds and and unmatched service from all housekeeping and room service staff made this room truly amazing. on the days we wanted a lie in simply throw the do not disturb on the door. this obviously is common but then when you get up make one call and inside the hour the room was back to brand new. on check out we where looked after with the same expertise and a limo was arranged at the door to drop to our terminals at the airport.  i have always said i given the very high standards set by hotels in vegas and with the new up and comers on the strip that we would not stay in the same place twice.Dam you Palazzo for makng a liar out of me....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: galinash
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Palazzo during the Christmas! It was our first time in Las Vegas and definetely not the last one! The room was gorgeous, the staff was extremely helpful starting with Lena at the front desk and ending with very professional Concierge desk people. Thank you, guys!

Reviews.Title: “Always a treat”
Reviews.Author: cca123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palazzo several times both for work and for fun. On my most recent visit over xmas, I was once again impressed with the consistent and friendly service that is provided by the staff. Everyone you encounter is friendly and nice-- almost without exception, I have found this to be the case at this hotel. My friends and I were staying at the Prestige level which has access to the lounge on the 23rd floor. I think the breakfast is better than the afternoon snacks with a good selection of hot and cold, and healthy choices so you don't end up just eating a plate full of chocolate croissants. The afternoon happy hour is a great way to kick off the evening, and the staff that works at the prestige level is always really fun and friendly. One good tip for the winter: if you're feeling very dry from the desert and the recirculated air, ask for a humidifier in your room. It helps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: LauraandPaul
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel room! We loved our time at the Palazzo. We have stayed in Las Vegas a few times before and always wanted to try a different hotel. The Palazzo is the first hotel where we want to stay again. The room was so large and luxurious with an amazing view. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking experience”
Reviews.Author: MT1666
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great! Good views out of any room. The pool area is small and seating is limited. No sun until the afternoon. The room is a good value but the other services make up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Prestige means what it says”
Reviews.Author: MemoSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prestige level of the Palazzo between Christmas and New Years, a busy time in Las Vegas. From the exclusive check in on the concierge level to theservice with a smile as any reasonable request was attended to, the service is first rate. The staff is empowered to make your stay pleasant and productive. Instead of the hubbub in the casino and its environs, the Prestige level was an oasis in the desert. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “very nice room, lots of space!”
Reviews.Author: monpetitcadeaux
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal thru snique away so we spent 3 nights here. The room size is very comfortable, I loved the bathroom with separate tub and shower as well as toilet area, is all very elegant. Due to our flight we arrived late and it was nice to have the Grand Lux Cafe open 24 hrs right there in the Casino floor, very convenient! Also we (husband and I) had a spa day at the Canyon Ranch Spa (3rd floor?) it was a great experience. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NYE 2011 5 nights on the Strip - Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Needsagoodsleep
Reviews.Content: We decided to cross NYE in Vegas off out bucket list and booked 5 nights at the Palazzo. We were very impressed with the service we received and our gorgeous king suite, overlooking the strip gave us a fantastic view of the crowds and fireworks on NYE. The bathroom was amazing!! The only issue we had was, while we stayed on the 40th floor, we noticed that they had a service room (laundry?) that was situated right off the elevators for the floor and it smelled of sewage or something very stale. Bad planning on their part to have that smell greet their guests immediately after they arrive on their floor. Once you got passed the room, there was no odor at all, which was a blessing!! We loved the fact that the casino had no smoking corridors, so you weren't bombarded with smoke as you walked through the casino. The casino wasn't crowded as well, which we definitely liked!! The Christmas decorations were gorgeous outside of the hotel, one of the most outstanding on the strip and the inside was beautiful as well. All in all we had a wonderful stay, staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean!! Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Sebastiaan1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo in September 2011. The stay was really nice, we`re glad we`ve been to Vegas but won`t be going back, the city as such was a disappointment. The Palazzo though was a very nice facility, great suites, nice Casino, beautifull poolarea and good restaurants. Can`t flaw it really, just the prices are high and clublevel is pointless in our opinion, just as the breakfast is very poor ( no proper breakfast at all, no proper coffee in a facility which embraces Italy? Italians would die instantly without a proper coffee in the morning...)

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, average service and average food”
Reviews.Author: Ilya42
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for 4 nights over the Christmas. We arrive to Las Vegas late (11:20 pm), the check-in was quick and efficient. We have decided against paying for an upgraded suite but got an upgrade i.e. a room with a strip view. The "standard" room is very good and is bigger than some condos, certainly five stars. The service and food less so, it took almost 45 for dentail kit to be delivered. As it is common in Las Vegas hotels are huge so if you expecting five start service you will likely be disappointed. We used valet parking, recommended, however on a busy day it can take as long as 20 minutes to get a car and you must present the ticket in person i.e. cannot ask for the car over the phone. As this is our second stay in all suite hotel, previous one being at Wynn, we prefer Wynn for better valet service and better food especially for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: mgottlieb26
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Vegas for three nights the week between Christmas and New Years and found a good deal at the Palazzo for our first trip to Sin City. Maybe I was just in awe by the size of everything at the hotel (and that's coming from a New Yorker!) but the suite that we stayed in ($129/night, plus a $17 resort fee per night which isn't made very obvious on their website) was huge! 3 flat screen tvs (surprisingly not HD, which was kind of weird), separate living room, bathtub and one super comfy king sized bed. The hotel itself is massive and connected to the Venetian. I think it's relatively new and seems a lot cleaner than some of the other ones we walked through. We went to some good restaurants and stores there and loved that there was a Walgreens downstairs for all our snacking/hydration needs. My only complaint is that the service was pretty so-so. A minute after we got to our room, housekeeping knocked on the door asking when we were checking out. On our last morning, which followed a late night out, someone woke us up from a dead sleep when they knocked on our door at 9am to see if we were still checked in. Two times in one stay?! How do hotels not know who is checking in or out on a given day? My last complaint is that I had to wait on hold for about 10 minutes to reach someone at the front desk to ask about airport transportation. The woman I spoke with was really snippy (when I asked where we find the airport shuttle, she answered "uh, outside the hotel where there's a sign that says airport shuttle?" Really?!? Like I would wait on hold for that long if I had seen this sign?) and gave me incorrect information about the time that the shuttles run. Aside from those issues, we had an amazing stay at the Palazzo. I would definitely stay there again - the location can't be beat, there's a million things to do at the hotel and the rooms are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “perfectly posh”
Reviews.Author: kristinmarie78
Reviews.Content: after doing budget vegas many times in my early 20s, i decided to upgrade a bit in my early 30s! our suite was gorgeous, more than we needed. loved the mexican restaurant near the elevator bank (ate there twice), and the breakfast restaurant by the pool was EXCELLENT (food AND staff). pool area is clean and gorgeous, servers were always nearby and available. poolside blackjack was an absolute blast. zure, the luxury pool, was quite the saturday morning experience - live music, dancing, cabanas...great way to spend a saturday afternoon! the hotel is walking distance to everything. free shuttle to airport. courteous staff (front desk called me madame...that was a first). :) will definitely stay there again, nothing i didn't like!

Reviews.Title: “On the strip”
Reviews.Author: p_barclay
Reviews.Content: We were advised to stay here as it being one of the best hotels on the strip. It was a very nice hotel, but the same could be said of many hotels in Las Vegas. We had a suite room quite high over looking the Wynn hotel's golf course and the mountains south of the strip. Very nicely appointed room loads of space as you would expect they even had a TV in the bathroom!!! The pool area's were very load and always packed in like sardines!!! The garage had ample space and room to park the rental.

Reviews.Title: “NYE 2011, 2 nights at The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: sibi4
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Palazzo. Nothing to say about the large, opulent and lavish lobby, halls etc since I cared about the room most. It was a 2 queen bed suite on the 43hrd floor, not facing the Strip (mountain view, but I could still see a bit of Paris and PH). Usually large room, like at the Venetian, with all the comforts but still lacking some amenities I have found in other upscale hotels: no slippers, bathroom amenities of good quality but not luxury brands, soft bathrobe/towels/bed linens but yet not the softest I have found. Room cleaniness was good but not spotless, some pieces of furniture showed some wear marks. I asked for a late check out, and this was denied because of the holiday/new year's weekend. I asked for some batteries for the bathroom scale as it wasn't working and the batteries inside looked very old and rusty: I called twice but nobody ever came to replace them. It's not that I actually needed to use the scale, it was my way to test how the Palazzo's customer care/room service fared, and they failed.

Reviews.Title: “could not have asked for more...”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas on a whim for a much needed break. The Palazzo exceeded our expectations and I have no complaints. We ordered room service for breakfast and both times our food was hot and delicious. Our suite was perfect. I cannot imagine staying at any other hotel. The casino was nice and not crowded at all. I honestly never wanted to leave the hotel. It was calm and quiet and exactly what we needed. We did visit other hotels ( Luxor, MGM, Ballys, Excalibur) and the atmosphere was completely different.....a little scary in fact.

Reviews.Title: “winter break”
Reviews.Author: margaret f
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights late November in a king suite. What a beautiful hotel,everything clean,good security,amazing shops and great restaurants. Pools open one heated others freezing good hangover cure,easy access to Venetian. Stayed 6 times vegas this the best defo recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FAIL TO THE MAX”
Reviews.Author: AARON L
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very nice but costumer service is HORRIBLE. They are very quick to get your money but when it comes to them treating with some respect EPIC FAIL. The Hotel is pretty much brand new but over PRICED I would reccomend Ceasar's Palace you'll get your money's worth there. I won't be staying at this wack hotel agin just because of the customer service. That is ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Home for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: RoyPalmer
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is a special place, and it has a myriad of hotels so to stand out the hotel needs to be very special. The Palazzo was chosen for me by the Conference people and I am pleased they did this. Found everything to be pretty much spot on. Room was very spacious and had all the mod cons. Was made aware that just looking at the minibar actually charged something to your room so was careful there. Food was great and very reasonable in price. Service was excellent at all points. It is a big place to get around - you could be there for days and not take in all the offerings. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent holiday experience!”
Reviews.Author: missri1986
Reviews.Content: My husband made a last-minute decision to close our office and take his (87 year old) mother to Las Vegas for Christmas. His mother was born in Venice, Italy, so the Venetian was #1 on our go-to list; however, when we learned of the Palazzo (and that the rooms were newer), we chose to stay there. My only gripe is with the thread content of the linens (please don't laugh) and that the bedding should have been more luxurious in a five-diamond hotel--THAT'S IT! Nothing to complain about. Every amenity and request covered from a humidifier for our suite (VERY, VERY dry) to a wheelchair for Mom. For once-in-a-lifetime dining experience, try "Carnevino". EXCEPTIONAL to say the least. Also, dine at TAO and Zefferino. Pricey meals, but well worth it. Also, be prepared to WALK, WALK, WALK.

Reviews.Title: “Lady from Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Mrudula K
Reviews.Content: Took my business partner and his wife to Vegas for 3 nights. They loved their room and food. Had great time. Beautiful Christmas decor & beautiful Venetian. I always stay at Venetian but this time they were sold out and had to stay at the Palazzo. Both casinos are great and some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Missacl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and bathrooms. We made it afforable by staying with friends in a double. The bathroom was huge. Magnificant view of the stip. Floor 23. The mini bar is very expensive, but there's a walgreens on the first floor, get your drinks goodies there!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: Aggies
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10 AM on Christmas Day and stayed 4 nights. There was no wait for check-in. Our rooms were ready and we got right in. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Palazzo, but the rooms are starting to show their age...wall paper coming off the walls in the corner, stains on the marble countertops, etc. The room was clean, but the beds are NOT comfortable. They need better mattresses. I don't know what it is about rooms in Las Vegas, but they are always DUSTY. Our room was extremely quiet. THANK YOU FOR THAT. Other places we've stayed we've always heard doors slamming, people talking in the hallway, etc...but not at the Palazzo. It was decorated beautifully for Christmas. Ice skating rink outside (fake ice), beautiful Christmas tree, Christmas entertainment everywhere. They were giving out free warm cider (it was delish), so it was very festive. They did NOT raise their prices for this week the way most other resorts did. The casino was crowded, but not too bad. Table limits were the normal, minimum of $10. The Grand Lux was our "go to" restaurant. Their prices are steep, but the food is very good and tons of it....you could easily order one salad and one entree and split it between 2 people. One thing, right about check-out time, their TV check-out was "unavailable". Hummm. Overload? Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Palazzo. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND ANYBODY GO TO LAS VEGAS DURING CHRISTMAS WEEK. It is extremely CROWDED with foreigners. RUDE foreigners. EVERYTHING is mobbed. You can hardly walk anywhere, you cannot DRIVE anywhere, they bring their kids and there are WAY TOO MANY kids in the casinos.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the Palazzo or the Venetian”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: I continue to believe that the Palazzo or the Venetian is the best place to stay on the strip. This time we stayed at the Palazzo. I love the all suite concept and our suite was wonderful and luxurious. High thread count sheets, fluffy robes, large bathroom with separate makeup space, soaking tub, etc. The Palazzo feels a little quieter than the Venetian and that is definitely a plus. However, all of the amenities are shared and convenient. For $20 you can purchase a day pass to the spa which includes the steam room, sauna, hot tub, igloo room, etc. This is a wonderful deal. After a workout in a gym with every amenity, I was able to head to the spa take a shower and relax in style. I splurged one day and also had a massage, definitely one of the best ever. The restaurants in the hotel are a step above normal fine dining. They are expensive, but a culinary experience. We ate at Postrio and Table 10. Both were outstanding. The location on the strip is unbeatable. Everything is in easy walking distance. However, there is so much to do in the hotel complex, I pretty much had to tear myself away and get outside! Nightclubs, piano bars, restaurants, shows, it's all right there. The service is very good. The hotel is mammoth. The service is not personal, but it’s good. We requested extra towels and they were delivered quickly. Our room was spotlessly clean and kept that way. The staff is polite, efficient, kind and extremely busy. If you are expecting an personalized experience, this may not be the best choice. However, if you want an incredible place to stay, in an incredible location, with very good service, this is your place .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but lacks special touch”
Reviews.Author: dubaiman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in a Prestige Sienna Suite, Suite was very good, prestige lounge is bit of a let down, it seems its done, because they have to, but not done with any real purpose. Also Spa is very misleading, is nothing to do with hotel, so even when staying in a prestige Sienna Suite you dont get automatic entrance to the Spa, in fact you have to pay $20 dollars each for every visit, and must say probably worst Spa I ever have visited, not because lack of treatments, there are plenty, but the Service within the Spa, is terrible. But they think they are the best! which say's it all really!! as with all the outlets in Vegas hotels, they are nothing to do with hotel, so service in those outlets (restaurants) etc can be very hit and miss. Because hotel is so large, you can ask 5 members of staff same question and get 5 different answers, but that is the norm in Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Resort in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BigPl8Man
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Christmas holiday period. Rooms are new, clean, huge, and quiet. Easily the best deal in Vegas, as long as you don't pay more than $150 a night. We paid less than that during this period. Pros: cleanest, quiet room on strip. Very nice casino area and pool. Cons: Restaurants are all very high-end. You'll have to walk for fast food (if that's your thing).

Reviews.Title: “Vegas luxurious style!!!”
Reviews.Author: SharranMasand
Reviews.Content: It's adjoining the Venetian , we took the club floors very comfortable I think the hotel only has suites ...outs was like - 1000sqft room it wreaked of partying .....rooms are nice but need attention as far cleanliness is concerned ...the executive club is super and great service they serve glenlivet 12yrs which is better than no single malt ...:) TAO the lounge is in the hotel and is crowded specially over weekend ...location a lil away from the center of strip but a great Vegas experience nonetheless!!! Casino is packed and offers training session in most of the popular games once a day There grazie card is very useful And convenient Shopping center is lovely and has great shopping variety also the fashion show mall is opp the hotel and very near by

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: MantyGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Venetian about 5 years ago...and most recently at the Four Seasons in April 2011...we loved the Four Seasons but it was too far away from mid-strip, so decided to try the Palazzo this time around. The rooms are identical to the Venetian rooms from 5 years ago. And I do mean identical. Maybe that's why I was less than enthused with the Palazzo. And for being built in 2007, the rooms are really showing a lot of wear. Yes, the smallest rooms are 720 sq. feet which is huge for Vegas, but they just don't enthuse me. Dated and starting to look worn down. Housekeeping was good, very clean linens, which is a must for me. But as others have said, I really don't need to see dirty linens sitting in the hallways for days at a time. We paid the $17/day resort fee but never once received a newspaper, which was supposedly part of the fee. (not a major deal, but just shows they miss the small things). Casino was ho-hum....no energy, not a good vibe...not a fun place to lose your money. Palazzo Shops and Venetian Grand Canal ok...but you see the same shops at every other Casino. And nothing has changed in many years. We did enjoy Morels for breakfast...you can't pass up the hand-made Bloody Mary's! And we really enjoyed Puck's Postrio Restaurant in the Venetian shops. Overall, while the central location was good, I'm not sure I will be back to the Palazzo. Dated rooms and bags of linen in the hallways were a major turnoff this time. I really missed the atmosphere of the Four Seasons, even if it wasn't as conviently located. I may try Wynn or Encore next time, or return to the Four Seasons which is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LyndenWilliam
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has a great number of hotel properties making a selection of where to stay a real challange. In Jan 2011 we stayed at the Venetian so this trip we selected the sister property the Palazzo. The rooms are similar in size and decore, but the Palzzo seems to be a slight upgrade in quality. Either property is a excellent choice for a visit. The rooms are large (750 sq ft) and have a sunken living room. The window coverings are opened/closed using a remote which allows you to control them from the comfort of your bed! If you go, it is worth joing the Grazie club. By charging meals to your room, points can accumulate quickly and depending on your casino play could result in comp points that can be used to reduce your bill. The Venetian/Palazzo complex is large and a reasonable copy of various parts of Venice Italy, including gondola rides. There are several shows (Jersey Boys, Blue Man Group, Phantom...), two large casinos, a multitude of places to eat from elegant dinning to fast food, many interesting shopping areas, buskers in St Mark's square, a waterfall and much more. You may find there is no need to venture out of the complex to have a great time. A recent added feature is the inclusion of these properties into the Priority Points program (associated with Holiday Inn). From 'check in' to 'check out' we found the entire staff were helpful and friendly. We can highly recommend both properties and are sure you will be pleased with either and likely have a wonderful experience as we did on both occasions. The choice of where to eat also presents a challenge as there are so many good possibilities. Wolfgang Puck's Postrio Bar and Grill on St Mark's Square (see review) was our favorite on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Oh it was Grand”
Reviews.Author: dallasrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. I would say this was the nicest place I ever stayed. The suite had 3 tvs and one of them was in the bathroom. It was possible to watch tv while standing in the beautiful glass shower. I did it just to say "I did". The Hotel Palazzo is attached to the Venetian. Between the two it was a gorgeous winter wonder land. I am not a real Vegas fan but if you have to go this makes up for it. So I would highly recommend staying here. We went to one show while we were here "Jersey Boys" It was an interesting tale of Frankie Valli and the 4 Seasons. Loved the music in the show but the language for the acting parts was rather course. Oh the other nice thing about staying here is that it is more family friendlyarea. No one out side the building trying to hand you porn calling cards and the cards are not littering the street.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: Trowler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palazzo Hotel over the Christmas (2011) weekend and were very pleased. All the rooms are suites and have all the midern ammenities. The refrigerator is fully stocked and removing things will charge to your bill automatically and made it immpossible to use to keep other personal items cold like drinking water. The internet is available in the room via both ethernet and wireless but cost 12.95 per day. There are a ton of shops and resteraunts (no buffett). The Palazzo is part of the Venetian Hotel on the 1st/lobby floor so there is easy access to two fantastic casinos. I will definately be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, great location”
Reviews.Author: Angie R
Reviews.Content: Initally booked a room at the venetian and was upgrade to the Palazzo with a view overlooking the strip. Beautiful big rooms. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dubby37
Reviews.Content: Outstanding large rooms, requested high floor in the back of the hotel, got on 39th floor, great view, no obstruction (room 39-737). Holte very clean, king bed, probably the best I had in a long time. Services and restaurent offering at Palazzo-Venetian is large, food for everyone. Highly recommend this hotel! Our trip was in December, so we did not use the pool facilities, but looks also outstanding. Had a wedding dinner at Tao and its nightclub, a place you must see for nightlife and dinner, food was great. Only downside, we sometime had cooking food smell in the room, did advise the reception but did not know wher it was coming from.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Aaron V
Reviews.Content: Great 5 day stay. Upgraded room at check-in and was well worth it. Great to have coffee shop right next to elevators. Thoroughly enjoyed the room and the casino staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: backpackerPNW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during Christmas time 2011. The sunken living room is beautiful and luxurous bathroom. We will definitely stay again at Palazzo or Venetian. This two hotels are the nicest on the strip. We visited Bellagio, but honestly, it is a bit too crowd there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sophia_CN
Reviews.Content: The room was similar style with Venetian, full facility and wonderful. Staffs were very helpful in the hotel. We were there in Sep this year. And hopefully we'll go there again, in Halloween, or Christmas, or New Year. There must be full of fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: BusLeis45458
Reviews.Content: Pluses: beautiful and spacious rooms, great casino with outstanding dining choices Minuses: slow and expensive room service

Reviews.Title: “Best Quality Value”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: The best hotel for understated elegance and class. Everything you need and then some. Great rooms, excellent food and tremendous shopping all in one place. Of course we go out to other venues, but the place to come back to and stay is this hotel if you like old school elegance without the stuffiness. Staff is courteous and prompt, rooms are large and clean, the entire experience is excellent. If you are looking for something other than this kind of experience there are other choices, but for my money (other than maybe Wynn/Encore) this is the only place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Time At Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: JHDawg
Reviews.Content: Our 4th trip to the Palazzo and another great trip. The Palazzo is truly a 5 star resort ! We try to visit around the Christmas season because the beauty of the Christmas decorations ,music and outside nightly shows are remarkable. As always, Jose, Michael and Marybel in the Prestige level were extraordinary. Although families are welcomed at the Prestige level, children seem somewhat out of place because it is a more adult oriented theme.

Reviews.Title: “Get A Slot Card For Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Michele B
Reviews.Content: I go to the Palazzo at least twice ayear. When I go, I get my room free. If you wonder how someone gets their room for free, GET A SLOT CARD!!!!!!!!!! then you will get some offers from the hotel. I never pay for a room and if you play alot, they will give you money to play with. I love the Palazzo because everyone there is really nice. The rooms are beautiful. The bed is soooo comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “First class experience, First class accommodations”
Reviews.Author: VegasVet53
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palazzo on three separate occasions. Each visit led to new experiences and different room choices. A room right above the pool was great in the summer, a suite with plenty of space (1100sq ft) was perfect for an extended visit. The front desk staff has always been courteous and helpful, even upgrading us when our choice for a room was not available when we checked-in. The housekeeping has been beyond criticism. With their security personnel, we always feel safe and comfortable. I look forward to repeat visits in the future. In fact, we are celebrating New Year's Eve in Vegas, at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Prestige - Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: P_Vegas
Reviews.Content: We are big fans of the Palazzo but.....I cannot recommend upgrading to the Prestige. For the cost of the "Prestige" is not worth the money spent. The suite is exactly the same, there is no exceptional floor that you are on - it is essentially the same as if you upgraded to the suite. You receive a nicer door card I suppose. Great hotel as always!! Just don't do the prestige upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: papamark
Reviews.Content: Booked connecting rooms, Bella queen suites. Spacious, clean, great room service! Each room has two TV's, ;living room area with couch, desk and table. WiFi available or hook up, with printer/fax machine. In room safe easily holds two laptop pc's along with your other valuables. Used room service two times and everything was at room in less than 30 minutes. Overall a great time. Bathrooms have shower and separate bath, twin sinks and small cosmetic area with lighted mirror. Lots of towels, soaps, ironing board and iron, hair dryer, robes, sewing kit. Everything the experienced traveler needs is there or a simple call to the front desk and it was provided.,Only problems were with billing, resort fee includes internet, but then additional fee of $12.95 was added to bill, had to go to desk at check out to have fee removed. So check your bill daily on in room service fee summary. In my opinion do not spend the extra money on the view suites. We were sold the "view" suites for extra money because it overlooked Treasure Island's "Pirate show". The exhibit when we were there was being renovated and under construction. So really there was no view. I inquired at the front desk and expressed my disappointment and was told that we could move to another room. We were already unpacked and I didn't want to move. Was told they would give me the original booking rate and that they were not responsible for what other properties were doing with their shows. I never claimed they were responsible for what Treasure Island was doing, but it was Palazzo's booking person who "sold" me on the view. The view consisted of Treasure Island with no show and Trump hotel. Nothing spectacular. I would stay again, I just would not waste the money on the view rooms because they don't have very good views of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a drunken weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Freddyboi
Reviews.Content: We come here literally every year for one of my homies birthday. Rooms are always nice and accommodates us nicely. After all, we are only in the room for 4 hours trying to get power naps before the craziness starts all over again, but the time in the room is always a pleasant one. Room service was quick, housekeeping brought things in a timely manner and we never had an issue. Id definitely be staying here again, but I think it's time for a change, since so many new hotels are around with more attractive parties.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: minnesotatravelmom
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at the Palazzo with a couple of girlfriends to celebrate my birthday. The trip could not have been more perfect! The room (Bella Suite) was spacious and comfortable with luxury finishes everywhere. The pools were conveniently located on the 3rd floor so you did not need to walk through the casino area in a swimsuit! The casino, unlike those in every other property in Vegas, was not build like a maze to keep you in. It has 2 wide, main corridors going through it making it easy to get in and out, from front desk to elevators was an easy and quick walk that did not require a map or a guide. I have always stayed at the Mirage in the past, but I will not be straying from the Palazzo in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Vegas-style Hotel with Easy Access”
Reviews.Author: Suntory65
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bella Suite from Sunday to Thursday before Christmas 2011. Hotel/Casino/Lobby - The hotel/casino is very luxurious with beautiful decor. Over the Christmas break, they had free hot apple cider at the lobby which was a great touch. The casino tables are usually pretty empty with minimum bets at $25 in the evenings. The casino is typically busier at the Venetian next door. The lobby is small according to Vegas standards which is a plus since you don't have to walk too far from the entrance or parking area to your room. Room - The Bella suite is spacious and the beds are very comfortable. Some of the furniture and walls in the bathroom are starting to show their age with scratch marks. They charge $17 a day for resort fees which include in room WIFI, access to the Canyon Ranch Spa/Gym for 2 per day, and morning papers at Cafe Presse. There is a printer/fax/copier in each Bella suite, however, we had 2 suites with joining doors and both of the printers did not have ink in them. Overall - The best thing about this hotel is its location and easy access in/out of the hotel. The small casino and lobby is great if you like to avoid the crowd. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable although in-room furniture is older when compared to hotels like Wynn or Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience by Vegas Vets!”
Reviews.Author: 5RingsRanch
Reviews.Content: I will try to be very detailed in my review, please excuse the length. My wife and I just returned from Las Vegas for a quick 4 night get-away before Christmas, sans children. We have been to Vegas 20+ times, and have always been loyal Ceasar's/Harrah's customers and have stayed in virtually every resort on the strip. Because it was just us this time and we were celebrating a belated 10 year anniversary, I decided to book the Palazzo. We booked a very affordable SWA package in a standard Luxury Suite, hoping to sweet talk our way to an upgrade upon arrival. We were impressed immediately upon arrival. The lobby was decorated beautifully for Christmas and there were even staff dressed as Elves giving out hot cider in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the doorman to the check-in counter. It was really quiet it seemed for a Saturday afternoon arrival, but we traveled during a dead period on purpose (Dec. 17-21). There were no lines at check-in, or at the airport for that mattter...it was very nice. Anyway, back to the hotel. We approached the check-in desk and were helped immediately by a very polite young woman. She went to work on getting us checked in and then asked us if we would like to hear about upgrades. I had planned for this, so I said that I was always interested. Apparenlty she had read my comments on my reservation and knew we were Diamond players from Ceasar's and were also celebrating a big anniversary. I didn't think they really read those! Well, I had done my research and kind of knew what to expect, what the room upgrades were, suites, prestige levels, etc. She came back and offered me a Fortuna suite upgrade for $75/night or a Sienna suite for $150/night. I got the entire package for $1005, including airfare, so I had some room to spend a little extra if I wanted. I stalled a little, made an offer and got her to upgrade me to a Fortuna suite for $50...but they were booked. Long story short, I ended up getting a HUGE sienna suite for the same price! It was a giant room, huge bathroom, half bath in hallway entry, great views, etc. We even had an exercise room with an eliptical machine in it. I bet this suite was 1500 sq feet. Now I don't know why I got this deal...maybe the young lady was in a good mood, maybe she was wooing us from Ceasar's or simply being nice for our anniversary...whatever the reason I was totally satisfied. The only bad thing was the room was TOO big if you can believe that! I was pleased with the entire check-in/room experience and was pleased with housekeeping - no issues. The restaurants were plentiful and had something for everyone - expensive to affordable. I really liked 24hr Grand Lux cafe in the casino. Lots to choose from and very good. No buffett, but plenty of choices. The Venetian is close by for additional restaurants and the food court if you like. The Casion was small by Vegas standards, but nice...somewhat older, more sophisticated crowd. I had no problems finding a table or a slot machine I wanted to play. Table limits were generally $15+, but I did see a few $10 tables at various times. Tons of choices in slots, from pennies to high limits. Staff was friendly and helpful - no problem getting a drink whether I was betting $25 a hand or sitting with my wife as she banged away on a penny machine. Security was everywhere, even though I didn't see or feel a need. I felt very safe, as did my wife. The Venetian Casion was a close by and was a livlier, younger crowd. Table limits were lower, but there were more typical young vegas yay-hoos there. We enjoyed playing the Palazzo and the Venetian. The Pool was actually open and it was heated to a very nice temperature for swimming. There were even people swimming and laying out. The jacuzzi/hot tubs were big and steaming hot. I was impressed that you could swim in a heated pool in December - that is rare in Vegas. The pool is not huge, but was very classy. I can imagine pool season at the Palazzo is a site to behold (and the security guard confirmed my suspicion)! Location was fine for what we wanted on this trip. It is an easy walk to Venetian, Wynn, the Fashion Show Mall, Ceasar's, Mirage, etc. The Bellagio was a pretty good hike and City Center was a long hike. We had planned to eat at the Cosmo Buffett Wicked Spoon, but didn't feel like walking so far. If you want to hang out at the MGM or Mandalay, then don't stay at Palazzo. I felt the Palazzo was located in the classiest part of the strip and was satisfied witht he location for our needs. All in all, we had a great time...ate good, lived like kings, won some, lost some but would definitely recommend the Palazzo. Some reviews on here gave me reason for concern prior to our trip, but I found them to be incorrect. I am sure every property has ups and downs, but our experience was simply awesome. I am a convert and will return to the Palazzo for our next trip, but will probably just go with a normal Luxury suite...they are plenty big.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dibbyfromtheblock
Reviews.Content: Truly great service, gorgeous rooms, and wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “4 Days In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 Days in a wonderful Luxury Suite (Basic Room). It's very spacious, and will comfortably fit 4, if needed. Bed was fantastic! We requested a refrigerator and it was brought up within 5 minutes of our call. Bathroom is also very large! The casino/hotel property seems enormous from the outside, but we timed our walk from our room (45th floor) to the Strip and it was under 5 minutes. Room Service was fast and had very large portions. Dealers are very interactive. Luckily, we played with a bunch of skill players, so we were able to talk and still have a great Blackjack game. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gotaway with getaway”
Reviews.Author: JeanfromBNA
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went to Las Vegas to get a good feel for it: I hadn't been since 1995, and he had never been. The Palazzo was recommended by Stacy Standifer, a Tennessean columnist, and it was a great choice for the great rates that we paid. Rooms are huge and very comfortable. Housekeeping was acceptable. I wished that they had premium toiletries; instead it wa an Asian off-brand that was unmemorable. Our room was on the 27th floor. Elevators were quick and you were soon in the middle of all of the action, unless you stepped off on the floor for the canyon ranch spa. Spent almost all day in the spa enjoying the baths and relaxation rooms before and after an 80 minute massage. Wonderful. Look for and ask for service discounts. They are happy to help you out. Loved our day at CR. It was Thanksgiving, so we just wandered the shops, watched many families pose for pictures by the waterfall, and relaxed, Ate an early (6:30PM) dinner at TAO. Great food, Incredible parfait for chocoholics, Good service, one-of-a-kind ambiance, . The real scenery starts walking in after 9PM. Casino was friendly, dealers were polite and efficient, and things were kept neat and clean. Some of the slots are smoke free, which I liked, but this was not always observed. Would be nice if there were more. We enjoyed the Palazzo and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel great rooms”
Reviews.Author: mcaa1
Reviews.Content: Lovely twin room with really comfy beds and a comfy sofa Area. Tastefully decorated and the choice of clean bedlinnen every day. Cleaning done regularly and well (about 12.30pm) The Palazzo itself is small by Vegas standards and that makes it easy to get about and the Casino is lovely. Easy to access the Venetian shops and Restaurants. Definately would stay again if 2 of us (girls trip) as room really suits) We had a lovely Strip View

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness/House Keeping an Issue”
Reviews.Author: Michael1952_26
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the suite itself and the majority of staff was exceptional. The room service and restaurants were quite nice. The house keeping situation was something else. Simply not acceptable. We checked into a suite with half filled and empty toiletries in the shower, no towels and empty water bottle scattered around. This was ridiculous in a property that bills itself up market. Would we stay there again? ONLY if we thoroughly checked out the suite before we opened our suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Cedar Condo”
Reviews.Author: Cedarcondo
Reviews.Content: Ive Stayed at most hotels on the strip and Pallazzo gives you a great room, in a comfortable yet high end atmosphere. It's not too big, not to small, just right in layout, number of restaurants available, shopping and of course gambling. The all suite room is a value at whatever price level. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: mannym99
Reviews.Content: Great location, outstanding oversized suites. Didn't order room service which was overpriced as you'd expect at this type of hotel. Very friendly and accommodating staff who go out of their way to take care of their guests. I loved it! It's well worth the premium dollar you'll likely pay to stay here. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bkmummy
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great location. Kids love it so much they just want to stay indoors all the time. Just love this place. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lauren502
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a great Las Vegas hotel. The casino is nice and it is full of shopping and restaurants. I love the canals and the sky painted ceiling in the shopping area. The rooms are massive, complete with a sectional sofa and all. We did have a few burnt out light bulbs which isn't a huge deal, but a hotel of this class should maintain those kinds of things. The pool area is amazing! There are people to help find you seats on busy days and boy does it get busy on the weekends. The weekdays were much calmer and a lot more enjoyable. You have access to the pools at the Venetian as well. The property is massive so expect to do a lot of walking.

Reviews.Title: “The Sweetest Suite”
Reviews.Author: daddy1020
Reviews.Content: If you ever want your Vegas experience to be one be an even better one, and you want to stay at one of the best suites, then make your reservation at the Palazzo. These rooms are very spacious and are so beautilly furnished. The bathroom alone is bigger than my house...almost. The bed is really nice and the sitting room is very comfortable and inviting. I didn't want to leave. After a long fun day, gambling, shopping, site-seeing, and eating, I looked forward to relaxing in my suite at the Palazzo. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but they missed the simple things”
Reviews.Author: semi-pro-traveller
Reviews.Content: Things I really liked: - Free Parking and easy access to hotel / casino from garage - Short and direct path from lobby to guest rooms - Clean - Friendly and helpful staff Things I did not like: - Did not recognize my status with Intercontinental (Platinum Ambassador) - No coffee makers in room (have to go down to casino area and buy it at Coffee Bean (annoying!) - No news papers that are easy to find (have to hunt them down at shops - annoying!) - No amenities in room - had to ask for them Overall, i was a nice hotel. But, it really put me off that they skimp on the little things. I will definitely look elsewhere for next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: ASPEN91NY87
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a weekend at the Palazzo with bug bites on my stomach. I went to a dermatologist and the doctor confirmed. It is unfortunate because the Palazzo is a fantastic hotel. I would highly recommend it if it had not been for the bites. I am now on antibiotics and a steroid lotion because of the reaction I am having. Bed bug sniffing dogs are coming to my house to see if I brought them back in my suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ant1126
Reviews.Content: we had a room overlooking the golf course and the Wynn. A fantastic week.

Reviews.Title: “Classy,beautiful and exceptional hotel resort in every way!”
Reviews.Author: markersh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband to celebrate my birthday thanks to a 3 day comp! What a lovely hotel stay! Room on 37th floor overlooked the Wynn... View of mountains,golf course was beautiful. The room was immaculate and luxurious. Staff from checkin to housekeeping was professional, efficient and friendly. Location was great.... Easy to walk from palazzo to Venetian without going outside and the other hotels were easy to walk to! Shopping and restaurants were great! Loved the grand lux cafe for late night and breakfast food! Even gambling wasn't bad...actually won $500 on slots there although table limits were too high for me! Overall if you want a wonderful experience... The palazzo is the place

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! You don't need $20 dollar trick here”
Reviews.Author: AliciaJeremy
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel! I debated about using the $20 dollar trick and decided against it. I just asked for an upgrade and we got it for free. We were 18 floors up with a view of the strip and pirate show. This was definitely the nicest hotel I have ever stayed it...just perfect! I used hotwire and paid only $133 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A R
Reviews.Content: The staff members are always helpful and friendly. It is such a relaxing atmosphere where you can gamble a little if you so choose, have dinner or a snack, listen to music, have a drink, or just hang out. The suites are so comfortable, clean and spacious. It is also, in my opinion, in a great location in proximity to other good hotels. We've stayed here twice and would definitely go back to The Palazzo. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great trip!!”
Reviews.Author: triptakerextreme
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and enjoyed every one! The winter in Venice was exceptional! Great casino and wonderful selection of foods and restaurants. Friendly staff, very courteous. The suites are comfortable and roomy as well. Just what is expected for a luxury stay/vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property. Poor maintenance and service.”
Reviews.Author: Prepwade
Reviews.Content: For a hotel catering to high rollers there is a definite lack of service. All around you hear people complaining of having to wait for this or that. This is the third time I have stayed here and third time I have been disappointed by the cleanliness. There is always dirt in the corners and unclean items especially in the showers. Once we checked in and found a ball of hair sitting on the drain cover. This time a couple chunks of old soap that we're from previous guests. We stayed three days and left it just to see if it got cleaned... It didn't. There was also a bag of dirty linens that was left outside our door for about 36 hours and room service carts that stayed out for a full day in the hall. The Venetian and palazzo offer great, RELATIVELY smoke free casinos, good shopping and a nice atmosphere and I would stay here again but management needs to work on housekeeping and service to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to impress, but misses in some ways.”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghFrank
Reviews.Content: First, I stayed there with a friend who was comped for the room, so I have no right to complain. So i hope this comes across as a review, than a criticism. The beautiful materials, wonderful view, fast elevators, 3 flat screen TVs did not make up for the fact that there wasn't a coffee pot in the room. Additionally, you can't view the TV from the wonderful soaking tub in the bathroom. Just seems like everything is designed to pad the bill a little. I guess the clientele they are going for would rather pay $10 to have coffee delivered versus brewing it yourself. So if you are looking for 5star at 5star prices, this is a great choice. If you are looking for a great place with fun casino for a more moderate cost, then try the Golden Nugget or similar property.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, weak on staff training”
Reviews.Author: DenverDsigner
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with great amenities. Unfortunately, the staff training and service needs upgrading. One example is the sofa bed in our suite. We asked for linens and service so the bed would be ready for one of our party when we arrived. That was not the case. After a couple of calls to housekeeping, a bellman arrived and opened the sofa. Period. We told him we were perfectly capable of performing that task, but we had expected it to be ready and had no bed linens for it. He came back with a couple of pillows and a cheap blanket with a cigarette burn hole in it. The other two beds had very nice comforters with duvet covers. We pointed this out to him and explained as best we could, since his English was limited, that the sofa bed needed the same covers as the other two. He returned with a comforter without the duvet cover. At that point, we decided to cut our losses and take the comforter along with the linens and make the bed ourselves and as presentable as possible for our party who had not yet arrived. Although the city was not busy at all according to Las Vegas standards, room service was always late, and in the case of the last day, some if the food was cold. Upon checkout, since the car was at the Venetian (more about that in another review) we were told by the bellman who took our bags that the bags would be at the concierge desk at the Venetian since the car couldn't be brought over to the Palazzo. When we arrived at the Venetian, no big surprise, the bags were not there. After attempts by the staff to communicate back and forth, which took another 40 minutes, we ended up getting the car and driving back to the Palazzo, where our bags were waiting downstairs. I would also suggest direct access to the exercise facility through the hotel without having to pay at Canyon Ranch Spa. All in all, a great facility with a serious need for better staff training, coordination, and communication.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: wahooskipper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo during our trip out for the Rock and Roll Marathon. We were thrilled with our experience there. Room was a tremendous value with the package we booked. We stayed on the 39th floor overlooking Treasure Island. If the pirate show wasn't under rehab it would have been phenemonal. As it was, looking over the strip to the mountains was pretty spectacular. We spent little time in the casino. I will say that the smoke here was not near as bad as most other casinos we visited. Higher ceilings and better ventilation probably help. Also, there is a constant, wonderful aroma to the Palazzo. Wish I knew what that was but it seems like they pipe it in. Restaurants can be a little pricey but we had wonderful breakfasts at the Grand Lux and ate a couple of nice meals in St Mark's Square. We took the obligatory gondola ride and enjoyed that too. Lots of window shopping but the stores were a bit over our head for the most part. The housekeeping staff did a terrific job. In fact, all of the staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpful. The location of the Palazzo was terrific for our needs. It is a little further north than center strip but it was an easy walk across the street to the Wynn and also pretty easy to get to Cesar's and the Mirage. The monorail is behind Harrah's, next door, and that was a pretty convenient way to get north to the Stratosphere and south to the MGM, Mandalay Bay, etc. Most notable, the Palazzo/Venetian was probably the most well decorated resort on the strip in terms of the Christmas celebration. Lots of activities going on in and around the resort. Christmas decor inside and out was spectacular. Many opportunities for great pictures and it really got us into the spirit of the season. I'm not sure if we will be compelled to visit Vegas again, but if we did I think it would be hard to top the Palazzo/Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but....”
Reviews.Author: Shanda464
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo Prestige Suites. It was my big 40 birthday celebration. The suite was nice it was spacious but the attention to detail lacked with holes in the bedding, the bathroom molding was falling off the sink and the marble in the bedroom was ruined I am guessing by a previous guest or cleaning. I did like the amenties on the 23rd floor of breakfast and evening drinks we took advantage of that each day. I guess I was just not impressed with the attention to detail on some items. We were never told at check in that there was a special check in place for us in a Suite with champagne and our room had an awful view but we opted to check in early so I am guessing we got what they had. We did visit Cut and Aqaunox and both were fantastic food and service. I would go back but hope they will make it a little more special this time that is what I expect when you book a suite. One last note the bar in the Palazzo casino dont bother to go there we did and they never waited on us and we were the only other couple in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: pat o
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas many times per year. I have been to many of the new hotels on the strip. This is my first stay at Palazzo The rooms are phenomenal and all suites. They have a sunken living room with a "L" shaped couch and its own flat screen TV. The beds are very comfortable and the pillow choices are great. The heat and AC has several fan speeds so you can choose how you like room. The bathrooms are nice with separate shower and tub. The only weakness is the shower water pressure and the fact that they charge for internet. Outside room, liked casino and found $15 blackjack table at night in prime time. Happy with lower limits. Hotel is attached to mall with good shopping and eating. I would go back next week if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to hold a conference or stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jncd2000
Reviews.Content: Having held 5 different conferences at many hotels in Vegas and evaluating at least 5 hotels for these conferences, I strongly believe that the Palazzo is an unbeatable property. It comes by this due to its strong attention to detail, winning staff and impeccable facilities. The food and banquet is second to none, while the staff that books the facility is superb. They get to know you personally and assist you unlike many facilities. As for the rooms, none can compare or even come close. While the Encore is pleasant, it just doesn't have the amenities that the Palazzo has and the sprawling set up is difficult to navigate. The Palazzo easily becomes a home away from home. While I am not a fan of Vegas hotels in general, it is easy to be a fan of the Palazzo and its dedicated staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good To be Back”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: It has been a couple of years since I last stayed at the Palazzo and it was good to be back. I have recently stayed at a few of the newer resorts but they couldn't match the quality of the room/suites. Great Location and service is fantastic. Room service is a little slow but my suggestion is to skip the urge and enjoy one of the MANY dinning choices within the resort. Tao continues to be my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Doris C
Reviews.Content: I recently chose to stay at the Palazzo for business and I'm glad that I did as it was a great stay and a great experience. I unfortunately was only able to spend one night there but when I arrived the check-in staff was very efficient, friendly and helpful. I was upgraded and the room was fantastic. I would definitely recommomend this hotel and would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice but not worth the price in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: DuffGrover
Reviews.Content: First off let me say I loved the hotel, it was gorgeous, the amenities were top notch and I did have a great time. Having said that I would've had just as good a time at many other properties in Vegas at a lower price. Normally the Palazzo would be out of my price range but middle of the slow season (just before American thanksgiving) it was down to an affordable luxury. I do not know the exact final rate as my friend covered the room cost but I believe it was around $150/night inclusive of taxes and the dreaded resort fee. Some of the luxuries included a great view of the Wynn and the Wynn's golf course, a beautiful bathroom with tub, seperate shower and a private wc, marble everywhere, flat panel tv's wherever you may be sitting, and a remote control for your curtains (I loved this made me feel like a big shot). There was some downsides mainly the room was not perfect and I know in a hotel this should be expected but for the price I didn't expect to be able obvious stains on the dressing chairs located at the end of the bed, you could tell the maid had run through the room and missed the same spots time and time again in the corners, just the little things. The things you could accept at a lower price. This was my 4th time in Las Vegas and this hotel was most definitely the best location I have stayed at to date (others are the Luxor, Stratusphere, and Terrible's(offstrip)) It is however a little to the slow end of the strip but the views were great (42nd floor). Everyone we came across from front desk to security, to service staff were excellent, and this is what I would expect at a higher end hotel and was pleased with the knowledge and eagerness to help. I doubt I would stay at the Palazzo again I would maybe however stay at the Venetian (same complex) as I believe it costs a little less and I did spend more of my time wandering through the amenities on their side of the complex (poker room, grand canal shops). It is also just that much closer to the 'big corner' and again it is not that I was unhappy with my stay I just felt it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Kiddo enjoyed 1st Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: D C
Reviews.Content: I took my 13 year daughter to Las Vegas this past weekend to see a Cirque du Soleil show at the Mandalay Bay. We really enjoyed our stay at The Palazzo. The staff was friendly and helpful. Check-in/out was quick (less than 10 min.) Upon arrival, Amy upgraded our room from a king to two queen beds with a view of the Strip. The ladies at the concierge desk were helpful in calling the airline to obtain my departure info and printed our boarding passes, We were allowed to check out an hour later (noon) without a charge and they offered to store our bags while we did some extra sightseeing. Oscar retrieved our bags and carried them to the shuttle, he was very friendly. My daughter was able to purchase Christmas gifts for friends and family at Walgreens and I was able to get (affordable) coffee, juice, and fruit for snacks. Overall it was a great experience for her . We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Praise for The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: LVMaui
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas every Thanksgiving and this trip was one of the best. The Palazzo was an outstanding hotel. This was our first time at The Palazzo, we have stayed in many other Vegas hotels, and we will return next year to the property. We were upgraded to a bigger room -without asking, had a beautiful view of the pool, and enjoyed St. Mark's Square at the Venetian. Room service staff was pleasant, it is the first time in a very long time that the food did not get cold, and was excellent. We also ate at Otto Enoteca Pizzeria, Postrio Bar and Grill and Trattoria Reggiano, in St. Mark's Square and EVERY meal was beyond our expectations. There was also a coffee shop at the lobby level where we got breakfast and beverages each morning, very convenient. Valet parking is free, as is self-parking. I have never seen hotel employees cleaning the common areas like I did at The Palazzo. They even had someone cleaning the outdoor steps everyday. We could have spent the whole time in the Palazzo/Venetian, with so many great restaurants, shops and decorations. The location was very central to the entire mid-strip, you could spend a week within a 2 block radius seeing everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: Pookie627
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to Vegas since 1985 and this was our first time at this property. We had the best time. The room on the 43 floor had a remarkable view of the Venetian and was gorgeous and comfortable. We went to La Reve and The Phantom while there. Both shows were fabulous. I have seen Phantom on Broadway two years ago. This one was quite good, not as good as broadway though. The restaurants on the property were all very good. My favorite was the Laguna, a champagne bar. Go see Cary, Shawn or Javito, they are the best bartenders! We went there every night for champagne cocktails. Love this resort and will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Rick H
Reviews.Content: Loved every minute of our stay from check-in to check-out

Reviews.Title: “Still among the best in LV”
Reviews.Author: Vegasclint
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights, and I believe the Palazzo is the best overall place to stay in LV. Great suites, enjoyable casino, and good location to everything. Huge mall is right across the street. For those of you who get up early, they have 24 hour coffee store at the elevators, which is unusual, and there are a variety of food options. We always enjoy the Grand Lux Cafe. Not saying this is an inexpensive option, but if you want a nice place, with shopping and all the amenities, you will not go wrong with Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in room XXXXX and my room didn't get made up today”
Reviews.Author: Lisa D
Reviews.Content: Dear Customer Service, I left my room this morning - around 9 am and did not return until almost 10 pm. I had NOT left a Do Not Disturb sign on my door, but when I returned in the evening, I discovered that my room had not been made up or serviced that day. I have stayed in many many hotels over the last 30+ years AND THIS HAS NEVER HAPPENED BEFORE. I was given towels by housekeeping as I couldn't have the housekeeper actually clean the room because I had to make an overseas conference call.
