I voiced my disappointment at this level of service (after also not being allowed to get into my room upon check-in until past 5:15 pm on my date of arrival - which I think is really late) and was offered a refund on the resort fee for my 4 day stay, which I accepted. However, the front desk said that the resort fee charged to my room was approximately $20+ per day, and I had called the front desk on my date of arrival and verified that I was going to use the internet connection at the posted rate of $12.95 per day and not use the resort services associated with the higher $20+ fee. So my $80 credit is actually only about $52 + tax. Anyway, I am disappointed with this situation and am posting this letter on Yelp and TripAdvisor right now.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: JakiMaria
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Encore, NYNY, MGM, Flamingo and TI so comparing seems fair. The only resort that compares to the Palazzo is Encore and if not for the location of Encore they would be equal. The Palazzo location is great. Very close to many other hotels and shopping malls. The rooms are great and the service and staff are good. The gaming floor is good too. If you are looking for luxury and great service book the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonioAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I took lots of pictures but they're the same as what other's have posted. This was our first stay here and I can't imagine staying anywhere else in the future. It is as perfect as every review before me says. We stayed in 32-916 and the view was nice. ONLY COMPLAINT: I wish the staff would learn more about the place where they worked. The first day I had to ask THREE different employees how to get to the "food court". The second day I had to ask FOUR different employees how to get to the walkway to the mall across the street. The third day I asked where I could get breakfast since it was 7:00 a.m. - AGAIN, NOBODY KNEW! UGH.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas as the Palazzo is great”
Reviews.Author: Barry L
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Palazzo. I had not been to the new part of the Venetian but am glad I did. Rooms are modern, the view superb. What made it great was the Christma theme. A skating rink, amazing color changing trees. And hot chocolate at check in. I can't tell you enough about how amazing the displays were. They spared no expense.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Debe5069
Reviews.Content: A wonderful get away! The resort is beautiful, the rooms are luxurious, the casino is intimate and the dining is unsurpassed. We were on the 38th floor with a view of the strip and the mountains. The room size is dramatic compared to other hotels on the Strip. A private sitting area with dining table, sofas, desk and flat screen made for a private, relaxing area. The alcove with the king bed was inviting and very comfortable. The room had 3 TVs and a very large bathroom/dressing area. The Grand Luxe Cafe for breakfast or lunch is the place to go if you want to stay at the resort. Or make the short trek to the Venetian for additional restaurants. Mario Batali's Carnevinos was a strong 10 as were Wolfgang Puck's Postrio and Mario Batali's Otto.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!! Best place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gidgetsemporium
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous hotels in Las Vegas, but the Palazzo is by far my favorite! The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and tastefully decorated. The staff anticipates the needs of their guests and go out of their way to be helpful. The location is great, and the added security gave me peace of mind (they check for key cards as guests enter the elevator areas to make sure only registered guests can access elevators to rooms). They offer some non-smoking areas in the casino, but that is a lost cause anywhere in Vegas. I will say they do a better job with this issue than most overall. The Canal shops are lovely. Most are high end, expensive stores, but there are some affordable places to shop if you look around.

Reviews.Title: “Very plush!”
Reviews.Author: Roper97414
Reviews.Content: Really nice place. Loved the casino, it was full but not over crowded and had no smoking areas. The rooms were second to none. Hotel staff was awesome! So much to do right inside the hotel(restaurants, spa, shopping, blue man group, shows, live entertainment and fabulous decorating). Will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suite, great experience”
Reviews.Author: writegirl7
Reviews.Content: Was attending Autodesk University last week as since we were with the group we got an excellent rate on a suite - I must say I was quite impressed. There was ample room and a posh interior - much more space than I could ever use solo, but if you're rooming with others this would be a great option. There's a clear sleeping area and visiting/lounging area. The bathroom is almost as big as my first one bedroom apartment, but a lot nicer. I was only there two nights, but the staff was helpful and friendly. At the bottom of the tower is Bouchon Bakery, which was great as I could pick up some coffee and munchies before heading to the convention center. I've stayed at a number of places on the strip - the Palazzo is definitely one of the nicer venues and (given a killer rate) I'd for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience”
Reviews.Author: diandphantom
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Palazzo. We were on the 29th floor overlooking the Strip and had amazing views of the strip and beyond. The room was very spacious with 2 queen size beds and a large lounge room with a large lounge, writing desk and table. The bathroom was huge with a TV and even had a phone in the toilet. Access to the Prestige Lounge was great with excellent service provided all who worked there. We went to the "Blue Man" Show which was amazing and would recommend to all. An excellent experience

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 40 Year Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: rbren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our best friends visited the Palazzo November 25-27, 2011 for our anniversaries. Everything about this hotel is perfect. If and when you visit Las Vegas, make certain you go to Delmonico Steak House which is located in the Venetian Hotel and Casino. This restaurant is pricey, but worth every penny. Overall, this was one of our best trips to Las Vegas and we feel it is because of the beautiful hotel and fantastic service we received. We will definitely be back and would highly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “I stay no where else on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: USMuseFan
Reviews.Content: To say I love this place is an understatement. The rooms are pure luxury. LOVE the bathrooms, beds are comfy, great views, fantastic hotel and casino. I have nothing negative to say about it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AC312
Reviews.Content: I had a great two day stay at the Palazzo this summer during my first time in Las Vegas. Lobby is clean and modern, but not as impressive as other hotels. There was a long line for check-in (arrived during memorial day weekend), but the staff was extremely nice despite the crowds. The standard rooms are huge since they are suite style with king size beds. The room was very clean, and we enjoyed the fact that the TV in the living area had a DVD player. View was towards the airport, but can't complain since we booked on Hotwire. Another huge plus is that the Palazzo and Venetian share pools - thus, you get access ~9 pools if you stay at either hotel! The pools get busy during the day, and we had to walk around for 15 minutes before we found two open chairs. Great set of shops and restaurants with the plus (again) that it shares the same complex with the Venetian, so it is very easy to go between the two hotels. This is my first choice of hotel in Vegas next time I go - I think it would be hard to get the same size room and amentities at any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: NY-LA-SF
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas many, many times for work and play and would happily stay here again. Comfortable room, pleasant easy check in and good restaurants everywhere you look. Although we were disappointed with Wolfgang Puck's steakhouse. A lot of fanfare for very mediocre food -- and I'm usually very happy with his properties. In any case, not the hotel's fault. Recently I heard Palazzo is now an SPG/Starwood property, so I can use/earn Starwood points. Makes a travel geek like me very happy. There aren;t many places to do that on the strip. We only hit the pool for a an hour or so. It seemed like direct sunlight was at a premium, but it was also March, so maybe there are more sunny spots mid-summer. Go. Stay. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “just Vegas-y enough!”
Reviews.Author: trigger18
Reviews.Content: Just a quick one night jaunt from LA with my wife and 2 grown boys. Picked Palazzo because, having stayed before, knew the rooms were enormous, with great amenities. It's also more fun than Wynn, which can be a little staid (if that's possible in Vegas!), with plenty to gawk at right on premises. Squeezed a lot into one night/day, but one standout, that few seem to know about, is the Canyon Ranch Cafe on the pool level of the hotel. A civilized breakfast respite, removed from hubbub of the casino, etc. Delicious food and uber-healthy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: supersport1
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for my wife's birthday and the Eagles concert. We'd never stayed in the Palazzo or Venetian before but had visited on other occasions. Our thinking was that the Venetian and Palazzo were priced the same but with Palazzo was newer so that's what we went with. The room was very nice and spacious, with granite countertops in the bathroom and a very comfortable bed. We had a wonderful view looking out over the top of Treasure Island, with pools and fountains below. The Trump hotel and view of the mountains in the distance were great to look at. There are two Grand Luxe restaurants, one in the Venetian and one in the Palazzo, they're both very good and reasonably priced. The Venetian one stays open later, which we frequented.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: Berbec09
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in November, and were offered an upgrade to a Sienna suite which we took. It was definitely the right decision. The room was just amazing. Entering through the double doors, and into the marble foyer we were impressed straight away. The room had "one and a half bathrooms" - the main had a jacuzzi, two person shower (although you could easily fit about five) and his and her's vanity's. The lounge room had a big screen TV and a very comfortable couch as well as a little dining table with a view through our floor to ceiling windows over the Nevada mountainside. High speed WiFi was included as part of the daily resort fee as was use of the inroom printer/fax. Room service was moderately priced but the food was amazing. The Venetian/Palazzo resort was awesome. The shopping, canals and St Marks Square was somewhere you could just sit for hours. The location was fantastic, opposite Treasure Island and a decent walk to the Mirage, New York New York, Paris, Bellagio etc. In terms of shopping, Fashion Show Mall is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel and has a wide variety of shops to chose from. For the budget conscious, Las Vegas Premium Outlets North is only about a 10 min cab ride away and is also a fantastic place to spend a day. We had to buy a new suitcase for everything we bought that day!! Would definitely recommend staying here :o)

Reviews.Title: “Love love love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlifromLA
Reviews.Content: We went for our 23rd anniversary, but I have stayed at Palazzo for Girls Weekend for a few years. It is luxurious and you can get great discount prices. You feel pampered and it really is a wonderful Vegas experience. The location is great for walking to shopping, free shows and other hotels. The view was awesome, the staff is always so helpful and nice. Even the soap in the rooms are great. And guys, get this, 3 TVs in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, festive atmosphere...great sports book”
Reviews.Author: Elaine B
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I recently visited Las Vegas Nov 21st - 25th to celebrate his birthday and to enjoy Thanksgiving dinner at Table 10 (for the third consecutive year). Upon arrival, we enjoyed apple cider during check-in which was part of the many Winter in Venice festivities at the hotel. Our trip was great from the time we entered the luxury suite until check out. We have to say it was a wonderful feeling every time we entered the spacious suite. It is a five star luxury resort from the suites, to the restaurants, to the casino to the sports book. Hubby feels the sports book has the best viewing screens in Vegas. We are looking forward to returning early next year. Also, we like the hotel because of its location. Service received at the hotel made us feel very special. Enjoyable, enjoyable hotel experience !!! John and Elaine B., Carrollton, TX

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: djm36
Reviews.Content: Although the Palazzo was the most expensive room we stayed at in Las Vegas, it was the nicest. Loved the spacious and luxurious room! The bathroom and amenities were amazing. The spa was fantastic - the best I have ever been in. If you don't want to have a massage or service, do pay the $20 and spend some relaxing time using the spa facilities - steam room, sauna, rain showers, aromatherapy room, whirlpool, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: 757Christina2011
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I recently visited Las Vegas from Nov 18th- 23rd 2011 to celebrated my 30th Birthday. Our trip was great!!! Upon arrival The Venetian upgraded us to a suite at the Palazzo for half the price 45$ extra per night (which is their newer part of the hotel). The suite was on the 44th floor the view was spectacular! Worth every penny! It was huge! We saw the Phantom of the Opera and Cirque du Soliel show, Mystere both were great. For dinner we went to Lavo (Italian), Tao (Asian\Thai), and La Brassiere (French) and all meals and service were fantastic! We will definitely go and stay there again! Hotel was clean and luxurious, the staff was very pleasant and accomodating and the security was good too (guards at every elevator checking for room keys). Didn't have very much luck at the casinos though, as they call it, "Las Wages!" Lol We were thoroughly pleased with everything Vegas had to offer especially the shopping! If you're planning to stay here I would stongly recommend it, just be careful not to touch anything in the mini bar or fridge unless you want to pay for it otherwise you will be charged for it! One of the bottles of water had shifted and fell over and we were charged for it initially but they removed it off the final bill when we explained the situation. All in all a great experience!!! CP Woodbridge, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: OrcasIslandDream
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel a lot, but although it was billed as a 5-star it wasn't quite there, hence the 3 stars, if they were billed as a 4 star then I would have given a 4.5. To be fair we didn't pay 5 star prices, but for Vegas it was at the upper end. Here are some of the good, bad and ugly. The Good: Attitude of employees. I would say that almost everyone we encountered met us with a smile and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. When we checked in we were upgraded to a 2 bed suite and although we didn't know it until we entered the room we had also been upgraded to a strip view. What a nice surprise. The Bad: We were charged for cookies from the mini-bar which we didn't even touch, although a quick call and they were removed. The Ugly:There were nicks in the doors, peeling wallpaper in the WC, a scale that didn't work. There were often room service carts in the hallways. These are some of the items that kept it from being 5 star in my mind. We did have a good stay and would consider this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rxc7
Reviews.Content: We has a great time at the Palazzo. The suites are beautiful and very comfortable. The ambience was very festive at Thanksgiving. Christmas decorations were up and in full swing and there were Christmas stories and movies on the club level. The Spa is wonderful for a good workout or relaxation. Also, has a really cute diner located close to the entrance. The Phantom of the Opera is always perfect. The Jersey Boys were ok, too much talking, not enough music. I don't know about others, but if I like a musical group, I just want to listen to their music. I am not much interested in their personal lives. Overall, great location, beautiful shopping malls and excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, facility and location.”
Reviews.Author: Klmidaho
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at Cosmopolitan, Mirage, and Bellagio. This is a great facility an the best location...across from the mall, easy walk to shopping at Caesars and great shopping on site and in the Venetian. The rooms are first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherylthomson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo for five nights. Booked a "prestige" suite giving the benefit of private check in area with sparkling wine, continental buffet breakfast, all day tea coffees and soft drinks and open bar between 5 to 8 pm with canapes etc. Only really used this lounge for the breakfast so not sure it was worth it for us but it would definitely be good if you made use of what was on offer every day. We were very pleased with the hotel, it was bright, clean, modern and comfortable. The suite rooms were great with a sunken sitting area, and three tv's, not sure why we would need three though. The beds and bedding were extremely comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Room”
Reviews.Author: Bev-SanJose
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving Weekend at the Palazzo and truly enjoyed our stay. The room had a great view and was extremely comfortable and very clean. Love the luxury bathroom, linens, etc. Upgraded to Prestige level and it is well worth the extra money to have access to a quiet breakfast area at no additional cost as well as late afternoon cocktails and snacks! We will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay at the Palazzo Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LivetoTravelNicely
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo Las Vegas during the first week of November. This is a beautiful property, and I want to start out by saying that I would definitely stay here again. However, there were a few small mistakes that I just feel prevent me from rating this hotel as a five star stay. Upon entering our Bella Suite on the 10th non-smoking floor, we immediately noticed a faint smell of cigarette smoke. We also noticed that there was no hair dryer in the room. So that we wouldn't be charged for either, I went back down to the front desk to report. The front desk was very helpful. She immediately made remarks on our account, and then offered to have an ionizer placed in our room (to clean the air) and to replace the hair dryer. I wasn't expecting either, but I thought it was a great customer service etiquette. She told us not to go back into our room for 3 hours because the ionizer would be running and they didn't want guests in with the ionizer. We were headed out the strip anyway, so this wasn't a big deal. We returned to the room 4 hours later and the ionizer was in there running. We thought they probably had gotten it in there late, so we left again for another 2 hours. By this point we were ready to go to bed, so we went back to the room....ionizer was still there. I just went in an unplugged the thing. The room smelled much better. Well, for the entire stay, no one ever came back and retrieved the machine. We just placed it in the corner near the door in plain view. It actually became an experiment to see if the housekeeping staff would take it! We never got the hair dryer, which again wasn't that big of a deal because we brought our own. For a five star hotel, I expect to receive the service promised the first time without reasking....so I'm downing this to 4 stars. The room was excellent...couch and beds were all very nice. I really liked the mattresses. There were few and far between outlets to recharge your electronics. The bathroom was gorgeous. I'm sure some people really like the TV in the bathroom, but I think it was more for show than anything else. I would have rather had a mini-fridge that I could store things in than a bathroom TV. If we ever return to Vegas, I will definitely stay at the Palazzo or the Venetian (the sister property that is actually connected at the Casino and Mall levels---identical rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suites & comfortable beds to sleep off the buzz”
Reviews.Author: jayn71
Reviews.Content: Really fun place to stay in Vegas... I stayed in the Bella Suite with a friend. Two super comfortable beds, a gorgeous living space & bath. Lovely panoramic views. You have quick access to the best of everything here, especially with the Wynn right next door. The boutiques and restaurants are amazing. Friendly dealers in the casino, which is very nice, though, I preferred the casino at Wynn which was airy and romantic & seemed to cater to a more elegant clientele. All in all, though, this is a great property with clubs, lounges, boutique shopping, and excellent restaurants. The staff is friendly & efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Martekch
Reviews.Content: Hotel is enormous! Prestige rooms are massive and posh! I love the bathroom! The only down side is finding a space at the pool, palazzo has sun from 1pm, otherwise need to walk to venitian pool which is packed. It was so hot in September that it didn't really make massive problem because it was quite nice to be in shade for a while before the massive hot sun comes out! I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Bad to Say”
Reviews.Author: DT808
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large suites, nice casino ambiance with tall ceilings, great coffee shop (grand lux cafe), large bathroooms, comfortable beds, polite and attentive hotel staff.. In short, nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ...”
Reviews.Author: dmg24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning, the rooms are very grand and perfectly cleaned. The location is excellent, I did not like the casino but it is minutes from the Wynn (friendlier staff and better drinks service!). My only dislike about the hotel is that it was very impersonal, but that is not a complaint as such - it is a huge hotel, not somewhere you would go if you expect all the staff to know your name. I would happily stay here again. I think everything else has been said many times over!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jenfer2125
Reviews.Content: Nothing in this resort is short of awesome. Our room was beyond beautiful (strip view - bonus!). Everything was clean and the staff was always friendly and very helpful. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Spectacular in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lesley30040
Reviews.Content: Winter in Venice from Nov. 21 to Jan. 8th (The Palazzo and The Venetian are owned by the same company so both hotels offer very similar experiences.) Amazing opportunity to fully experience the holidays without shoveling the snow or worrying about traffic. Within the hotel, there are enough activities to get the complete Vegas experience without setting foot on The Strip. A casino, shopping, food-courts, restaurants, lounges, rooms, gondola rides, shows, and Holiday events make the hotel a complete experience. The rooms are all suites and well worth a little extra cash. As the only 5-diamond resort on The Strip, you can expect to find high quality beds and linens with TVs all around and huge showers and tubs with excellent pressure. Attention is paid to every detail including phones in the bathroom and large size, quality shampoos and conditioners. The service is top of the line and instant. I never once waited in a line or had a difficult time parking. The location is at the heart of everything that The Strip has to offer and the each has amazing views. The architecture is authentic Italian and you're left with an overall Venetian experience. Available to guests: Ice skating from 11-11 Santa Story Readings & Photos from 5:30-6:30pm Classic Holiday Movies - 6:30 to 8:30 Cookies and milk served from 7-9pm In-suite elf tuck-in with milk and cookies Special, butler drawn holiday bath Nightly Holiday Spectacular & Tree Lighting Ceremony Always available: Gondola rides (Amazing experience for 1/8 of the actual price in Italy) Blue Man Group Phantom Celebrity chefs and fine dining As a Prestige guest: Access to the 12,000-square-foot lounge offering deluxe continental breakfast, hot and cold hors-d-oeuvres, afternoon cocktail hours, daily newspaper delivery and complimentary business center services.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bankssb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Monday to Friday, on our first trip to Vegas. We picked the Palazzo following family/friend recommendations and were not disappointed. The Palazzo and Venetian are both beautiful (although the rooms in the Palazzo are a little newer and nicer). The two hotels are next door to each other and connected, they're basically the same place (the Venetian is just a bit older). Of all the hotels we looked round whilst in Vegas, we thought Palazzo/Venetian were the best. The location is perfect, easy access to both ends of the strip and close to bus stops for both directions. We ate at The Cut, Bouchon and Postrio During our stay - all were lovely. we would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “courteus too a fault”
Reviews.Author: nadsil
Reviews.Content: been to vegas many times. first stay at the Palazzo, service quality was excellent. staff was very courteous. room was spacious and clean. excellent variety of slots and table games. only negative was dinner at Emeril's Table 10. served raw chicken wings as an appetizer, which I understand can happen, but no one apologized. That was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Me Luv”
Reviews.Author: Jamdawn
Reviews.Content: I am a well traveled Vegas person who has stayed at just about every property here. This was my first Palazzo visit.This property is very upscale.Rooms are very posh and spacious. Bathrooms are very beautiful and sexy with marble tile,dual sinks and mirrors.Powder area with lighted mirror and bench for the ladies.You must request the suite with the step down livingroom with the view.This room has a TV for the guys for sports and one for the lady in the bed.And if it gets to loud, she can close the french doors of the bathroom and turn on the one in there and take a bubble bath.Two couches,coffee table,fax machine,dining table,writing desk with stationary.A must see.Get away from the kids and FALL IN LOVE ALL OVER AGAIN HERE!!!!!!!!! Don't touch mini bar.Everything has a sensor.(Dinner)Order to go from cafe' near elevator or Wolf Gang Puck in MGM.(Half chicken with Tuscan Potatoes)located in back accross from cirque theater. .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: NtombiKingston
Reviews.Content: Lovely spacious rooms. The location is perfect and so convenient to get around from. The staff were professional and friendly making the stay extra special. Should I return to Las Vegas, the Palazzo would definitely be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask for Better!”
Reviews.Author: jngrooms
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Vegas for our honeymoon and won big (with the hotel, at least)! We booked our hotel through Priceline's name your own price feature, and were very pleased to get the Palazzo and an AMAZING price. This is by far one of the nicest hotels that I've stayed in in Vegas. The rooms are spacious, the views are excellent, the staff was courteous and overly helpful. The pools were nice. One nice feature about the pool deck is that it connects to the Venetian's pool deck, giving you nearly 10 pools to choose from. The restaurants are great (as you would expect in Vegas). I definitely will be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bus_Travel_TX
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas many ties each year for travel. I have started to make Palazzo my home in Las Vegas. The rooms are large and clean, the hotel casino open and welcoming, and the shops world class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JXLAustin
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Palazzo. Staff are friendly and professional and the room was clean and beautifully furnished. Check-in was quick and the walk from the front desk to the room was a straight walk through the casino. The location is perfect and even easy access to the large fashion mall across the street. The Jersey Boys show was great. I've stayed at this property before and plan to stay again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Going down hill?”
Reviews.Author: bigbasin
Reviews.Content: 1. No doormen to help with bags or doors as I exited taxi 2. Krystal at the Front Desk was polite and professional 3. Bathroom marble counter was broken with a poor attempt at a fix. There were multiple stains on the counter. 4. Garbage on the floor of the hotel room near the steps that step down to the livingroom. I think the steps were also repaired, again, not professionally. 5. In suite dining guide was missing multiple pages. 6. Dining options guide was out of date and incomplete 7. No hair dryer in the bathroom. 8. Room service waitperson was polite. 9. Room service food was not a good value for price paid. Grilled sandwich was luke warm. 10. I will never eat at Cafe Luxe again. A short time after eating breakfast Saturday morning, I became ill, which lasted for several hours, forcing me to cancel a planned roadtrip to the desert. I reported Cafe Luxe to the Southern Nevada Health Department because my experience was so poor.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tbo65
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after looking at several hotels with AAA travel agent. Room eas spacious. Bed was very firm. Only dissapointment was one restraunt int the mall between palazzo and bellagio. Fiirst restraunt was more attitude than service. Left and went to i luv burgers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJ_SYD
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a wonderful time at the Palazzo. The hotel is just beautiful with amazing rooms and facilities. All suite hotel - huge marble bathrooms and luxurious bedroom and living area. The location makes it easy to get around the main Vegas attractions as well as the shops at the Fashion Show Mall and at the Forum at Ceasars. The pool area was fantastic, there were a number of smaller pools and hot tubs with their own so it didn't feel like there were hundreds of others there. The casino seemed less smokey and crowded than some of the others we visited during our stay. My only complaint was that on our day of departure we had stored 6 bags with the luggage porters and when we got a taxi they had left one of or bags behind which we didn't notice until we arrived at the airport. This resulted in a mad dash back to the hotel (and a $50 round trip in extra taxi fares & tip) in order to collect the missing bag. The response from the bell captain when trying to get my missing bag was nonchalant at best. Unfortunately this made for a rather disappointing end to an otherwise impeccable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: naluli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Palazzo/Venetian a number of times and thoroughly enjoy it. The entire experience, from check in, to check out has always been outstanding. The restaurants are excellent and the property is clean and extremely comfortable. The only draw back is their slots are TIGHT!!! Oh well, I guess you can't have it both ways? All said and done, we do enjoy the Palazzo and Venetian very much and highly recommend both resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service from all areas.....”
Reviews.Author: chuabe88
Reviews.Content: I usually do not write reviews unless requested. But this hotel got me so mad that i decided to share my experience. Let me start with the positives of this hotel. The room was big, spacious and modern. The hotel is relatively new hence its interior is nice and bright. However, that's where it ends. The floor of the bathroom was wet (with water puddles) when we checked in. We brushed it off thinking that its an oversight by the housekeeping. But just as we were about to lie in bed to sleep after a long day, we realised that 2 of the pillow covers were dirty and stained. The duvet was also stained and dirty. As it was already very late, we only complained to the front desk the next morning. They were apologetic and got the houskeeping to clean up the room immediately. Guess what. When we returned to our hotel room in the evening, one of the pillow case still had a stain. However, we were too lazy to make another complaint so we just make do with the rest of the clean pillows. The day before we check out, I dropped my camera in a taxi. I was devastated as all our holiday pictures were inside.The moment we realised that i lost my camera (which is <15mins after being dropped off at Palazzo entrance), we quickly went back to the valet asking for help. Being tourists, my husband and I do not recognise any of the cab companies and definitely do not remember the vehicle no. The valet said they can't do anything and just provide us with 3 taxi companies nos asking us to contact them directly for lost and found. I was panicking as the photos meant a lot to me, so i went to the concierge to see if they can assist in any way. The concierge just shrugged and said that there are more than 40 taxi companies in vegas and it would be impossible to contact every one. I was desperate to get my camera back so i asked if he can provide the nos. He then gave me the Vegas Taxi Authority no. and asked me to call them myself to see if they can help. I called the Taxi Authority and got the list of around 12 taxi companies (thought there were 40?) and started calling all of them myself from the hotel room. After calling all with no results, i decided to call the Taxi Authority again. They suggest that i ask the hotel to check their security camera at the entrance to see if they can see the taxi no. I quickly went down to the hotel security and asked if that can be done. The security just shake his head and say that they can't do it. They will not check the security camera for us no matter what. We then called MGM hotel (cos that's where we took the cab from), told them the whole story and they asked us to go down to the MGM hotel security in person. Once there, the security got us to stand in front of one of the security camera so that they can capture our images and start searching the security camera. Within 2 hours, they called us at Palazzo with the cab company and vehicle no.! We were ecstatic! We called the cab company and the rest is history. The whole irony is that we were staying at Palazzo not MGM. But MGM willingly check the security camera for us w/o hesitation, whereas Palazzo, the hotel we were staying in, totally refused to help (in all aspects!!). This experience left such a bad taste that my husband and I vowed never to stay in the Palazzo again. Definitely not the service standards we had expected for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but in the heart of the strip and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: adventix
Reviews.Content: We came here to have some fun and relaxation. The hotel is beautiful and in the middle of the strip. Rooms (suits) are luxuries and big. Personally I prefer “modern” design but this “old fashion” design was still beautiful. Be careful not to move anything in the minibar – the moment you pick up something you are billed for it (weight sensor); so if you don’t want it (and don’t want a headache arguing with the reception) don’t touch the minibar. The Palazzo is one of the only hotels that don’t have a buffet restaurant in it but it still have plenty of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class!”
Reviews.Author: Calvin007
Reviews.Content: Previously stayed in this hotel and always return! It's by far my most favourite. Why? Large rooms, checked in at 1030 a.m. and room available. Upgraded easily for great deal. Front desk staff superb. A nice direct walk from the check in to the elevators (not the long and winding road experienced at some other hotels I've stayed in). Room was huge, very clean as always, the cleaning staff came and went without me ever seeing them! A nice quiet retreat away from the hustle of the city itself. Rarely saw anyone walking the halls - amazing considering the size of the hotel. Close to the shopping mall! Yeehaa!, but a nice walk up the strip to some of the other hotels. Will definately return. One of my favourite places to stay in vegas. Main beef - the taxi driver from the airport that tried to charge $45.00 for a one-way trip! The return trip was $18 (plus tip). Passenger beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Spacious Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cwberg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo for four nights. Over the years we have stayed at most of the large hotels/casinos on the strip, but this is my favorite. The room is enormous, and with the exception of no refrigerator or coffee pot (even in a suite at the Mirage, you won't find them anywhere in Vegas) it has all the amenities you need, and more. The bathroom is huge, has lots of counter space and a separate area for dressing/make up. The bed was extremely comfortable, and then a few steps down to sectional sofa, work space (including copier) and table and chairs. There are two large t.v.'s in the room. Both my husband and I had our own space. The sound-proofing was amazing; I couldn't hear anything outside or out in the hall. The Palazzo Shoppes are a short elevator ride downstairs, and they connect to the shops at the Venetian Hotel. I spent one entire day never leaving the hotel, just wandering shops and restaurants. The Canyon Ranch spa was fabulous, although if you're looking to just enjoy the spa (no treatments) I would go with a same-sex friend. There are more single-sex things to do than couples, so I convinced my husband to go with me but that was a mistake. The small gym is also great. You have access to the larger one at Venetian, but the small one had everything I needed. There is also a cafe next to the gym with GREAT food (reasonable!) and they make a killer egg-white omelette. Had it three times while we were there. The hotel is also across the street from the mall. Most of the shopping at Palazzo is extremely high-end, while interesting it was more window shopping for me. There is also a 1/2 price booth at the mall across the street, where tickets to shows and discounted restaurant tix are available. We saw the Jersey Boys while there - fantastic show!! And ate at Emeril's Table 10 beforehand (easy walk to Jersey Boys theatre downstairs) and it was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Hallowee'n in Las vegas”
Reviews.Author: CapitanVictoria
Reviews.Content: This 5 star hotel was more than we expected......excellent service from the chambermaid to the pool boys, room very quiet absolutely no noise from neighbours or in the halls. The bella suite was exceptional. Two concerns were 1) mistaken room charges (quickly removed when desk notified).2) Also difficult o contact different departments via phone..the operator was the best way to contact the spa or ticket sales. Recommend the prestige package, it covers your resort fee and breakfast from 0700 - 1000 and drinks and appy's from 1700 - 2000

Reviews.Title: “Good location, loads of ostentatious vegas style glam”
Reviews.Author: saucyb
Reviews.Content: Small group shared a Bella Suite, which was a spacious and well appointed option, including a sofa /table area and a very glam, spacious bathroom. Housekeeping service was good. Plenty of the usual shopping/eats options. Gambling isn't cheap here, if you want bargain tables it's a walk to the low budget venues.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: QuietTrave11er
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a resort experience in Vegas and are willing pay that little bit extra then dollar for dollar the Palazzo is the best value in town. Your competition is the Wynn etc and the rooms are just excellent and so spacious. The location is great and the services at the hotel are excellent. Yes you need to walk through the casino floor to get to your room but isn't that the norm now in Vegas at the high end places. One side note, the place is busy at check out (11am) so don't bother with the bell boys or you will wait for ever and just take your own luggage down and use the express check out.

Reviews.Title: “Gets our vote for BEST hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wingateron1942
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at Caesar's Palace and the Venetian but chose Palazzo Resort because on this trip (Nov. 3-4-5, 2011) we were going for the Garth Brooks show at the Wynn and the Palazzo is adjacent to the Wynn Hotel. Since it is owned by the same folks that own the Venetian we assumed it would be nice, but the hotel and accommodations were even more elegant than we expected. Our large suite overlooked the strip and simply could not have been any nicer. Three TV's, hugh bathroom and tub, was very quiet, excellent room service, had no long line at check-in and the front desk folks were extremely polite and helpful. This hotel will now definitely be our home-away-from-home when we travel to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Stunning”
Reviews.Author: awilliams5
Reviews.Content: This hotel as simply beautiful. Checking in was quick and easy. The staff is extremely knowledgeable so don't be afraid to ask for assistance of any sort. I stayed in the one of their suites which were magnificent. The bedroom and bathroom were tidied everyday with the option to have sheets changed. The bathroom comes equipped with double sinks, a large tub, glass shower, tv and vanity. The sunken living room has enough room for you and 10 other guests to enjoy. Room also came with printer for the last minute boarding passes. The Palazzo's location is pretty prime. Lavo nightclub is located inside the hotel; Wynn and Venetian are just on each side and for those items you may have forgotten or need more of, there's a Walgreens within feet or the entrance. (FYI Walgreen's in Vegas do sell liquor, wine and beer if you're willing to pay the price.) Overall an amazing hotel and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and twice the pools”
Reviews.Author: GodLovesYou
Reviews.Content: The Palazza is a "sister" hotel, contemporary/modern version of the Venetian, which we had stayed at several years ago. We had a great stay in Sept 2011 at the Palazzo and would stay there again. Good points: - Even though check-in is at 3:00 pm, the front desk receptionist found an available room for us at 10:00 am, so we didn't have to wait. It was a Monday - Good location - Located next to the Venetian and the Wynn and Encore hotels. - Walked to the Venetian's Thomas Keller's Bouchon French Bistro for dinner which had a large assortment of fresh oysters on ice. Yummy 4-5 dinner rolls came out stuck together in a line and plopped on the paper on the table. Warm pistachios as a free appetizer. The French onion shoup was rich, thick, sherry flavor, and nice amount of onions - very filling. I also got the quiche of the day appetizer for $13.50 which was a very large slice of quiche (very tasty) and a salad (came with it) and it was enough for dinner. - Across the street from the "Fashion Show" mall which had a Starbucks which was nice for for breakfast. Grab a coffee and pastry or egg sandwich and bring back to the hotel room to eat at the small dining room table with several chairs. The cupcake shop was not open for breakfast. There was a coffee shop that was open, but it was a little less expensive to walk to Starbucks. - Room was a modern, contemporary version of the Venetian suite, but done in pleasant shades of brown and creme as opposed to the red, green and ornate gold of the Venetian. Same big bathroom with large shower, tub, two person sink, toilet area with a door, and the vanity table, padded stool (hairdryer in the drawer). Step-down, sunken living room with a large L-shape couch (almost enough room for both of us to nap on it), desk, mini-bar, and round dining room table with three or four chairs. We had a nice view of the Wynn hotel next door and their pool. - Palazza pool area had about 5 pools and small, square hot tubs. Azure, night club was closed on Tuesday. If you walk to the left, go through the gate, you can walk directly to the Venetian pools and use them too. We stayed there to listen to the loud, pounding music coming from the Tao beach club. It was quiet on the Palazza side and plenty of chairs on Monday and Tuesday. We could charge our drinks back to the Palazzo while enjoying the pools at the Venetian. - We had breakfast at the Canyon Ranch cafe (pool level), and it was very healthy, delicious and came with a side of fresh fruit. - At the Palazzo, we had lunch at the restaurant next to the pool area and it was good and convenient. The Palazzo had the the "Jersey Boys" theater while the Venetian had the "Blue Man" and Phantom of the Opera theaters. Could use improvement: - Compared the Bellagio and Venetian front desk/lobby areas, the Palazzo wasn't as impressive. They did have a large frosted, nude woman statues in a circle. Behind the front desk, there were fake, tropical plants. I thought they looked tacky and was at first worried what the rest of the hotel was going to look like. When I got to the suite and saw it was exactly like the Venetian but more modern looking, I relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: PugsRule
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights last week for my husband's birthday. We stayed in a regular room (Luxury Suite) and it was fantastic. It was very nice - sunken living room, comfortable king bed, spacious bath, and three TVs. We were able to check in at 10:30 am, which was a wonderful surprise. Because it was my husband's birthday, we were given a high floor (43rd) and a nice view. We didn't upgrade to the strip view, but the view we ended up with was a partial strip with mountains in the background. We loved the entire area of the Palazzo/Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: Emi1234
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from our 3 day trip to Vegas, The Palazzo was everything we thought vegas hotels should be like, 3 TV's huge bathtub and great room service. The Palazzo is located right in the mix of things on the strip, the other big hotels were short cab ride away, to see shows and restaurants, we saw 'O' at the Bellagio and loved it! However we did spent most of our time wandering through the Venetian and the Palazzo. I would stick to the more middle of the range restaurants, the top ones are not worth the money you pay for the average food. We did love Canaletto. Great simple Italian food, what you would expect for an Italian themed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, AWESOME complex...”
Reviews.Author: davidmad1
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel, and it shows. The rooms are luxuriously appointed. Although the decor is not so much to my liking, the rooms are very nice, the views are awesome and everything one could want is in the room. One of the things that I found really neat about this Palazzo room was that it has a sunken living area. The room, for the most part earned 4 stars, but what REALLY earns the 5 stars here is the magnificent Palazzo/Venetian complex. The complex is huge with lots of restaurants to choose from, 2 really nice casinos, and fantastic entertainment options and a wonderful spa area. One really never needs to leave this complex, and of course that's how they like it. If you select this place for a room, you will not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mere0019
Reviews.Content: Wow! My husband and I were blown away by everything at this hotel. We've stayed at several other hotels on the strip but this was our first time at the Palazzo. We tried to check in early at 1pm which we were able to do. The check in employee gave us a free room upgrade without us even requesting one so we were upgraded to a Bella Suite on the 38th floor. Beautiful view of the mountains pirate show down below at TI. The room was outstanding and the bathroom was a woman's dream! Every employee we interacted with was courteous and polite. The slots constantly payed out for us and the casino was big enough for everyone to spread out. We got a great rate through an email deal at a busy time (the weekend of 11/11/11) so they didn't need to give us a free upgrade on top of our already discounted rate. We'll stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Amenities, and Location”
Reviews.Author: PoodleRank
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo for two nights as part of a weekend getaway with friends. I stayed in a standard suite room with a king bed, which by any measure is a big room, especially when there's only one person staying in the room. As described by other people, the room consists of a sleeping area and a sunken living room & workspace. The living room area can easily seat 4 - 6 people in comfort. I've stayed at the Palazzo several times over the years, and the rooms and the furniture all appear to be cleaned and maintained well ... clearly no longer brand new, but no major problems either. The "cool" feature is the remote controlled window shades. The bathroom is great. It's a large room, with separate soaking tub and shower stall, a private toilet room, and double sinks. And of course, the required flat screen TV for hotels of this type. (Who watches TV in the bathroom anyway??). Beyond the room, the hotel is a giant self-contained Las Vegas resort. The casino is large, with pretty steep table minimums (I never saw anything less than $15 blackjack tables). There's also decent shopping in the Palazzo as well as the adjoining Canal Shoppes at the Venetian. There's also a Walgreens on the corner, so you don't have to pay $6 for a bottle of water in the lobby gift shop! And there's a bunch of good restaurants and bars (try the champagne cocktails at the Laguna Champagne bar). Frankly, you don't need to leave the hotel, if you don't want to ... and that's a nice option. But if you want to get out and explore, the Mirage and Treasure Island are across the street. The Fashion Show mall, the Wynn, and Caesar's Palace are also all in easy walking distance. Finally, if the $15 table minimums are too high at the Palazzo or the Venetian, you can walk next door to Casino Royale, which is admittedly a dive, but has $5 tables. I always have fun there late into the night. Another good feature ... if you are renting a car, the garage elevator is right next to the hotel elevators ... so you don't have to walk all the way through the casino to get to your room. That's much more convenient than most Vegas hotel parking lots. As for service, check in and check out were uneventful, but not extraordinary. It met my expectations for a mega Vegas hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Hotel and Casino Resort”
Reviews.Author: Golfwunder_11
Reviews.Content: Palazzo was highly recommended to us by a former work colleague who went there for her husband's 60th birthday. I have travelled around the world on business and did not disapoint. Rooms were well maintained, and used the gym facilities, and the photocopier, internet. The hotel is central to everything, shopping, and shows that we wanted to see (Beatles LOVE, Jersey Boys, O). The grand luxe cafe downstairs was convenient, close, and wide selection of menu items. Would recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: darged
Reviews.Content: Well , I feel very lucky to have been able to experience all that the the Palazzo has to offer. Everywhere you look the attention to detail stands out. The hotel is not only beautiful but has a comfortable warmth as well. Our suite was truly beyond our expectations, we are not used to that level of luxury. Staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful always. A great place to stay, dont hesitate if you have the chance, you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort - overprized, customer service sucks”
Reviews.Author: yatrikheidi
Reviews.Content: let me be clear: the hotel is absolutely beautiful. the pools were fabulous, we had a great time just roaming around, but boy does customer service suck! our climate control unit wasn't working, so every night it got extremely hot and there was nothing we would do to change it! we called the front desk and they pretty much let us know that it was our fault for not being able to figure out how to work the thermostate. lovely! that's exactly what i did NOT expect in a 5-star property! and what is up with the slamming doors? i have never noticed it at any other hotel in the world, but the palazzo room doors keep slamming at all hours of the day - forget about taking a nap or a good night's sleep! on the flip side: the beds are super comfy!!!! the casino floor was okay but i much prefered the mirage across the street for its ambiance and vibe. i will not return as i did not feel appreciated there as a guest. the restaurants at the palazzo/venetian are first class though...i really enjoyed my meal at valentino and dos caminos.

Reviews.Title: “Had the wonderful opportunity of staying again at the Palazzo and for the first time at the Encoren Encore”
Reviews.Author: motmemo
Reviews.Content: Had the wonderful opportunity of staying again at the Palazzo and then for the first time at the Encore Wynn this past October. If I had to choose the best of the two it would be the Palazzo. Got there very late on a Thursday evening with virtually no one waiting in line. The desk clerk welcomed me back and gave me my room card. Got up to the room and the card didn't work. I called the front desk from the phone at the elevator and they sent security up to let me in which took at most 5minutes. I picked up a new card when I came down later that evening and had no further trouble with it. The room is starting to show a little wear. There are some stains on the granite and dings to the furniture. Nothing was dirty and the room was made up each day with fresh toiletries provided. The bed is very comfortable. Got to watch the TI show from the window at night. Ate at a couple of their restaurants: Dos Caminos- which was okay not great and the Grand Lux which was very nice had an excellent variety to choose from and reasonable prices. Also had room service one evening which arrived a little early(dinner partner still in shower) but everything was hot and enjoyable. It was very crowded in Las Vegas when I was there, more so then the other times this year I have been. I love the high ceilings in the casino it makes the overall appearance very grand and inviting. I think it also helps with the ventilation as smoke didn't seem to be as big as an issue as in other casinos I visited. They have all the newest slot machines and their tables always seemed to be full in the evening. Didn't get to see any show this time around but have seen the Phantom there(very good) and the Blue Man Group( got old after 10min). Prefer the Palazzo over the Venetian as the rooms are newer and seems more elegant on the Palazzo side. I have stayed at the Palazzo 7 times since it opened and never once regretted that decision. I have always found the staff to be warm and receptive to any problems I might have experienced. I hope this information has helped you.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit!”
Reviews.Author: Jill E
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have been to The Palazzo for a work function. I was just as impressed as the first time by these amazing rooms. The front desk was efficient and courteous. The room has everything you could ask for plus some. (Except for a coffee maker) The location is ideal and the restaurants were fabulous. I can't wait to bring my family back so we can enjoy together.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: LMackay
Reviews.Content: I visited Las Vegas for the first time in September and stayed in the Venetian, a Palazzo sister property. It was a beautiful room and a great vacation. I booked a return visit for December 2011 soon after getting home, but went with the Palazzo Prestige Level as a surprise for my wife. As usual, I was unable to keep the secret, and told her about the booking a few days later. Weeks went by, and the Palazzo called to tell me they would not honor the reservation. I can only assume that someone more important wanted the room. Not being the type to scream, yell, and demand free stuff, I politely listened to what they would offer instead and hung up. This booking was through Intercontinental's Priority Club. It seems clear that the Palazzo's priority is not guest services. Deeply disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: taylormi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo October 17 -21 for conference at same hotel. My room was kept clean and tidy. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. We ate at the Grand Lux one night, excellent. The only less than wonderful experience was getting a coffee at the coffee shop below the guest elevators...can't remember the name, maybe Coffee Bean. They were very busy which I can understand and would have been fine with if I had received what I ordered. All in all a great hotel experience. It's probably one of my new favorites. I liked it more than The Hotel at Mandalay Bay and The Signature at MGM which are both great hotels. I didn't do much outside of the hotel or gamble much but the hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “bad and just kept getting worse”
Reviews.Author: adam s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was part of the package we got. We had paid for a room with a view( we got the back of some building), Our sheets weren't changed even when we asked for them. We paid to stay in a good place on the strip, the service just didnt live up to it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Luxe Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: RoxiesMommy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Venetian on past trips to Vegas, we knew the accommodations and layout would not be too different. The Palazzo offers a substantial edge in elegance and luxe amenities over the Venetian and the restaurants, shops and public spaces are especially superior. The Lagasse Stadium in the Sports Book is especially impressive, as is LAVO with a view of the LV Strip and gorgeous interiors. Bravo, Palazzo! We are definitely staying here again - and again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Gizelledos
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I loved our stay at the Palazzo Hotel. Check in was easy breezy and so was check out. The large room had a great view of the Strip and was quiet. Our only wish was that a coffee pot could be added to the room. Giselle and Tom from Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Incarnate”
Reviews.Author: HerrMV
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Resort addition to the Venetian complex has all the grandeur and imposing architecture of its big brother. The complex (combined with the Venetian) is filled with exotic shops of every kind, countless gourmet restaurants and other big name Las Vegas style shows and attractions. The Palazzo is a resort that will not only impress you with its opulence, but can also leave you wondering what just happened to your wallet. We upgraded our room to a suite. What was explained to us as just a minor room upgrade fee nearly doubled as charge upon charge, tax upon tax, was levied on our bill. There is a charge for nearly everything and the prices can cripple those on a moderate budget. Learn from my error and question every little detail before accepting what may seem to be a simple offer. I do admit that our room was one of the more impressive hotel rooms I have ever stayed in, but I would expect it to be so, as it was a suite in a resort. Despite the total lavishness the air conditioning was annoyingly loud and the walls too thin. (Our noisy neighbors woke us up, both nights, very early in the morning.) The walls did not keep out the noise and the vault-heavy door did not prevent sound from entering the room from the hall. The young ladies that assisted us with our check-in were pleasant and efficient, but the young lady who checked us out of the hotel was cold and snobby and gave me the impression that I was beneath her. Do not bother with Palazzo’s basic Club “Grazie” unless you spend a lot of time at the slot machines or gaming tables. It is worthless just about everywhere else and you’ll get tired of being told, “We are not affiliated the Palazzo Resort” by the local restaurants. The casino is relatively small for such a large resort and the minimum table bets of $15 or $25 kept me away. Curiously, they do have $0.01 slot machines. All in all I would have to say that if you have money to spend on a weekend getaway or this is your choice for an annual big spending vacation you won’t be disappointed. Just to walk into the Palazzo makes one feel rich.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LangleyCharles
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning and were very pleasantly surprised to find our room already ready for us. (Hotels usually expect guests to arrive afternoon or early evening). The Reception was busy but soon delt with the queue and we very quickly had the room keys and had maps and information given in a most efficient, kind and helpful way. Indeed any request we made was met in a courteous, happy manner. We visit from the UK each year and can easily say this was the best hotel with great security checks before lifts. (simply by showing room key). We stayed on 47th floor and had super views over Las Vegas, the strip and in the evening the lights. We will be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: CCBianco
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility but no matter how fancy the decor it will never be a 5 star hotel until they improve customer service. Inept, rude and just not worth it. Stay somewhere else. Too many choices in Vegas to stay at a place like this.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best Of Everything”
Reviews.Author: travelingbart
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several of the resorts in Las Vegas but my personal choice is the Palazzo. It is a first class establishment in every way. Much of the grandeur of the strip ends up being "plastic" in the end but the Palazzo is true class in every way. They have even found a way to eliminate the overpowering stench of cigarette smoke that permeates most every other resort on the strip. The rooms are very much like The Venetian, which is also a great property if you can't stay at The Palazzo, but they are even nicer. The rooms are elegant rather than over the top tacky like you find in so much of Vegas. It is a vacation in itself with it's seemingly endless shops, great casino, pools, etc, etc. It even connects to the massive Venetian property allowing you to stroll for hours regardless of the weather. We found the staff to be very helpful especially with reservations. Call and make yours rather than booking on line and you just may find a much better deal as we did during our last stay. Hope your trip to Vegas is a real blast!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LauraPhillips
Reviews.Content: Great service, very friendly staff. The hotel was amazing, beautiful clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value Pretty good service”
Reviews.Author: bmwminirc10
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very pleasant. From the shops, to the decor the rooms all 5 stars. One day it was nice so we sat by the pool and service was non existent. Granted it was november but it was 80 degrees they should expect a croud espeacially on holoween weekend. To get a drink took 25 min waiting by the bar and the pool was not cleaned up. Other than the pool its 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Location”
Reviews.Author: ashandbrent2009
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is one of the better hotels on the Las Vegas Strip. We never upgraded our room to a "strip" view but we still had a fabulous view of the strip from a back angle. The room are HUGE (600+ sq. ft) the bathroom is like an entire separate world from the rest of the room. We ordered room service it was delivered quickly and it was SO good. The hotel casino is non smoking, which is fabulous! I would stay at the Palazzo again!

Reviews.Title: “"Must stay at The Palazzo"”
Reviews.Author: Joe A
Reviews.Content: I visit vegas atleast once a year - and this was my first stay at The Palazzo - i typically stay at Ceasars or Bellagio. However, going forward - i will only be staying at The Palazzo. The rooms are simply AWESOME! I had the smallest suite - and it was huge. The bathroom alone fits a family! Since i was visiting for a convention, my family didn't attend with me. Next time i will bring them just so they can enjoy this hotel. My only pet-peeve was the cocktail service at the casino table. It was horrible! Each time - it took over a half hour just for a cocktail waitress to ask us if we wanted anything to drink. then another half hour to get your drink. Now - i'm spending money in the casino - i like to have a drink in my hand at all times :) However, there were plenty of people complaining as well. And this was during the whole weekend - not just one day. Other than that - this hotel is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “prestige palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Luke R
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights in October and had a good stay the prestige thing is ok and you do benefit from free food and drinks between 5>9pm but the lounge area is a bit dull the suite was nice, maybe a bit tired but still very nice the wifi was free but a bit slow at times nice pools - the biggest pool lives in the shade until 2pm when we were there good hotel, good value for the money - I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: DebandShel
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Palazzo...beautifully appointed rooms...clean as a whistle...gorgeous bathroom! Great service...polite and professional...great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LORRAINE W
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Hotel was an amazing experience. The Staff, Service and Facilities were fabulous. My husband and I really didnt need to go out of the resort everything we needed was there. The room was absolutely beautiful it exceeded our expectations immensley. We are already planning our trip back there next year. If you want to spoil that someone special then i would highly recommend this beautiful place. Very satisfied Australians

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Wapatula87
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a great hotel. Our room was on the 30th floor, and we faced the Wynn's golf course and the mountains. It was very quiet. Rooms were spacious (we had the smallest suite) and luxiourious. 3 TV's! The only complaint is we tried to get some room service at around 5PM and we were on hold forever and never got an answer. Ended up running down to the hotel for a quick snack.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Fall Break”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with a phone call a few days before our arrival by the VIP desk asking when we'd arrive and to inform us of the upgrade we would receive. I really liked this touch and it was a great fore bearer of what was to come. From the moment we arrived the service at The Palazzo Hotel was exceptional and surprisingly personal for being such a giant hotel. I must commend Intercontinental for partnering with The Palazzo. I was a bit worried about some reviews here, but I have to guess these people are way too attentive to every detail. Yes there was a water stain on the marble, but after a hotel is open for a few years this sort of stuff is going to happen. The maid service was excellent so I don't fault this at all. We were never bothered unless we asked for it and every day we came back our room was immaculate with everything in order and all the extra towels we could want without even asking for them. The rooms are enormous. These are larger than any other similarly priced suite just about anywhere. Having a large bathroom was excellent for when we both wanted to get ready at the same time in the evening. The hotel was exceptional and if it was on it's own I could not list any fault. However, this is part of a large resort and with so many players there are some faults. The restaurants on site are really hit or miss. Cut was outstanding. Like most high end restaurants they called to confirm our reservation, but unlike any restaurant before they asked if either of us were allergic to anything. This was very welcome and ensured that my girlfriend didn't eat anything she couldn't. The service here did not cease to amaze and if you stay at the Palazzo you must eat at Cut. Other restaurants were pretty average and one meal at Tao was slightly below average. If they weren't >$50 a person I wouldn't complain, but at nearly $200 for a simple Asian meal I really expect excellent service. If you're looking for an amazing hotel stay, look no further. But you might want to walk around for other food options.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but if your keys dont work, forget about it”
Reviews.Author: GMFifthAvenue
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - rooms are huge and very comfortable. Staff is great and friendly but my keys did not work and no one ever brought me new keys after speaking to two employees about it. I know it's a big hotel and it takes time to bring someone something but leaving me in the hall does not work. Thank god for security.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Stay here if you can.”
Reviews.Author: travelingallthetime1
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. This was the second time that I have stayed here and would definitely recommend it. The service throughout the hotel is friendly and professional. The suites are beautiful and very comfortable, particularly the bed. Since I am from the East Coast and an early riser, I would like to see the spa open earlier in the morning. The spa opens at 6 am. It would have been much better if it opened at 5, that way I could finish my work out and not have to rush in the mornings. That is my only complaint; otherwise everything about this property is right on the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Lux”
Reviews.Author: cparalph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo while attending a conference. The hotel is very lovely and luxurious. The room was very large and nicely appointed. It would have been be a lot more fun had my wife been able to come along. Because I was on business I did not use a lot of the amenities but Carnivare and Sushi Samba are really good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brbiam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in Vegas, including the Venetian (several years ago) and this was the best hotel of them all! Will not hesitate to return. Room was great, view (paid for an upgrade) was a Strip view and while it was not quite as spectacular a view as I had hoped for, it was great! Quick checking, fast checkout on a madhouse Sunday afternoon. Lovely suite and relatively fast room service! Only one glitch - asked for a non-smoking room but when we walked in, it reeked of cigar smoke. I called the front desk and had a new room within 5 minutes! Spa was incredible and so was the shopping!

Reviews.Title: “The Lap of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: mandas1
Reviews.Content: I've been out to the Venetian & the Palazzo several times in the last couple of years but have never taken the time to write a review. After my fourth trip to either the Palazzo or the Venetian (their rooms are exactly the same, but the Palazzo is a few years newer) I just had to sit down and share my consistently outstanding experiences here. There are often long lines to check in (when you have 7100 rooms, there are a lot of people in and out) but, they move quickly and the front desk staff is friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. They give good directions to the guest elevators (in such a HUGE complex, it is very easy to get lost) so you can find your room. Keep your key envelope with you so you can remember your room numbers ... you might end up with something like 41-836! No "room 103" at this hotel! The suites are gorgeous, a large bedroom area and a sunken living room with (hopefully for you) a great view of the Wynn golf course, or the extensive pool areas, or if you're really lucky -- overlooking Las Vegas Blvd and a view of the Treasure Island pirate show and the Mirage Volcano show across the street. The bathrooms are HUUUUGE with a separate shower, bathtub, two sinks and a separate/private room for the toilet. I love the makeup stand with mirrors so you can sit and put on your makeup for the day. I've been very impressed every time I see housekeeping staff on the floor, they always inquire about my suite and if I'm having a good stay. The elevators are typically quick, and they do have express elevator banks for low, mid-tower and high floors so you're not stopping on every floor along the way. Be careful of the mini-bar, it's pressure sensitive and if you take out a snack, it will be put on your bill immediately. The only down side is that they allow smoking in the casino. Maybe some day there will be non-smoking casinos ... one can only hope. I've been to the Venetian and Palazzo for several different reasons: two conventions, one business trip and one personal trip. Every experience was outstanding. I could not have asked for anything more. Our conventions (with 7000+ attendees) were executed flawlessly. The banquet staffs greeted us by name as we were going through buffet lines (yes, we were wearing conference badges ... but they NOTICED and USED our names!) They do have an extensive pool area, the Canyon Ranch Spa and a huge fitness center, none of which I have had time to use while I've been there. I usually go for a run out on Las Vegas Blvd. in the mornings before it gets busy instead of paying the $17+ "resort fee" which includes access to the fitness center and wi-fi in the room. If you're going to use the gym or the wi-fi, it's worth signing up for the resort fee. Access to the gym is $40/day a la carte and wi-fi is $12.95/day. They have some INCREDIBLE restaurants in the hotel complex, many with celebrity chefs such as Emeril Lagasse (Delmonico's steaks, Table 10 or Lagasse Sports Book), Mario Batali, Thomas Keller, Wolfgang Puck. Or more casual fare. The Canal Shoppes offer some high end shopping ... you can easily spend your winnings right there! I wish there was a Starbucks in the complex, but there are only Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf cafe's instead. But, walk across the street, there is a Starbucks right on the corner across from the Palazzo entrance. I love the change of the seasons in their decor near the fountain and the staff is always warm and welcoming. Elegance, indulgence, sophistication. Three words that sum up the Venetian & Palazzo hotels. Join GRAZIE ... it's free and you get discounts and premium seats for Jersey Boys, Phantom of the Opera and Blue Man Group. If you're a Priority Club member, you can collect points from the InterContinental Alliance partnership.

Reviews.Title: “IT REALLY DOES EXCEED YOUR EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: COLLEEN D
Reviews.Content: From the minute you pull into the driveway you are cared for. Property is beautiful and well maintained. Staff friendly, efficient and offering to provide personalized service. Location is convenient to all Vegas has to offer. This property is the best buy for your $ of the upscale Vegas strip hotels. The regular suites are wonderful, absolutely immaculate and comfortable with best linens, soaps etc. Their larger suites are exquisite! The restaurants are all very good and you can find something to fit into your dining budget on site. This is ALWAYS our first choice in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Still Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrLeeHarvey
Reviews.Content: Suites are huge, with deluxe bathrooms. Plenty of elevators means no waiting. This hotel exceeds my expectations. Sushi Samba on the second floor is a hidden gem. Don't miss it! The Apothecary on the second floor is a great place to schedule a manly shave. David is a Master Barber with 31 years experience. He is the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating 21st b-day for my sister”
Reviews.Author: travel-from-NY-79
Reviews.Content: We actually traveled July of 2011. It was the best summer vacation we had traveled in a while. We were celebrating my sisters 21st birthday!! we had an awesome time. We were in the concierge level with private access to pools and reception and food at all times. We being the just the middle class people, we thought to spend money like the high class people and boy were we spoiled. You get the point. It was very good and the people treated us like hollywood stars.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelholic2332
Reviews.Content: I went on this trip with family in October and we had a BLAST!!! This hotel was beautiful and had PLENTY of amenities. Our room was FABULOUS and we had a direct mountain view.. we could see the sunrise daily. The coffee shop was excellent.. I NEVER went to Starbucks. The hotel took care of all of my needs. The casino was grand and the Wynn/ Encore were right next door. Stay in atleast a Bella Suite and eat at the the Grand Lux Cafe... Will ALWAYS stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Big, luxurious spaces, without the price.”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneM7
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The suites are fabulous - big spaces nicely decorated, with fabulous washrooms. But if you are looking for personalized service, go elsewhere. The place is huge and service impersonal. That is what you give up for the price. Great location though. Next time we'll try something smaller, like the new Mandarin Rental.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service beautiful suite”
Reviews.Author: NHamptonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Bellagio previously and this does feel like a bit of a cheap Bellagio rip off in the public areas, however that is my only critism. I was welcomed at check in with a big friendly smile and given my room key. The room was massive with a separate table for dinner, sofas and bed. The bathroom was also massive with a beautiful bath and separate shower. Walgreens underneath was useful for water etc - i was amused by the water menu in the room service brochure detailing various bottles of water which in the UK would cost pennies. Room service was prompt and food was high quality. Bed was really comfy and best aircon i had while staying in Las Vegas (ie the room actually went cool) big fan and will definately return

Reviews.Title: “Palace in the dessert”
Reviews.Author: Therandomnickname
Reviews.Content: Great choice to stay while in Vegas. The rooms are exactly like the one's shown on the website picture. Confortable, big and quiet.
