We stayed at a junior suite, It had very confortable beds and a great sitting lounge with awesome view of the strip.The staff is friendly and helpfull. Great location, many restaurants, with some that open 24 hours. I visited many casinos on this stay in Vegas, and was surprised that the one at Palazzo/Venetian is always full with life and great ambiance (no matter if it's midnight, 2am or 7am) The spa is highly recommended. Great location on the strip. It is located in front Treasure Island, and walking distance to Ceasar's Palace. I went with my family to a convention held at this hotel, was helfull that the room was equiped with photocopy/fax/scanner machine. Will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the palazzo”
Reviews.Author: rosed3
Reviews.Content: very nice rooms a bit pricey but worth it. in the middle of the strip, close to everything. wonderful shops and restaurants !!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip for conference!!!”
Reviews.Author: CWS_GM_13637
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding stay. I stayed here last year too and chose it again because it was so great. Neither stay dissappointed. The rooms are fabulous. A little wear and tear on the furniture, but other than that outstanding. Room service was just fair, but thats room service anywhere I guess. Food gets a little chilled during delivery and for being such an enormous place, I'm not surprised. You can get sooooo lost in this hotel. Was here for a conference so not much time to enjoy the amenities, but I truly love this place. Thanks for a great stay and service Palazzo staff!!! Way to go!!! I didn't hear one negative comment from my colleagues! (And there 6,100 people here!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TommyZ1
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Palazzo could not have been better! Great location and it had everything I needed. Great staff, great service-it had it all. Great room and very clean. This was my first time as a guest of The Palazzo and I plan on coming back very soon. Best hotel and casino experience I have had.

Reviews.Title: “Convention attendee”
Reviews.Author: mkshis_11
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention at the Palazzo and staying at the hotel was very convenient! 99% of the service was excellent, the food was good and it was CLEAN! The only problem I had was that my do not disturb sign was not honored on the third day of my stay. The refreshments had been replaced and a new bath mat had been placed on the tub, nothing else. It just left me feeling very unsettled. If you are not going to honor the do not disturb sign, clean the whole room, not just a few very minor parts of it. If you entered the room by mistake, just leave me a note or a message.

Reviews.Title: “This is a real Palace!”
Reviews.Author: Chevy10_10
Reviews.Content: Awesome suites, very nice service and the perfect location. You will feel like a king in this resort. The bed is wonderful, the bathroom is big and enjoyable and the grand lux cafe is yummy. This hotel is one of your best bets in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Cbjackson
Reviews.Content: We had a conference their at the palazzo and loved it! The social areas were nice and shopping was amazing!!! Everyone was so friendly and helpful! Our room was nice and roomy! I was a bit dissapointed because the cleanliness could have been better. But overall it was a great room and I truly encourage you to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE rooms, happy staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: sawracki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo in August of this year and were blown away at the size of the rooms! Not only did we have a ton of space, but the views and the location were exactly what we were hoping for. The staff was attentive, the rooms are very clean and nice and I will definitely be coming back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Still Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie D
Reviews.Content: Wow! Palazzo still knows how to do it all! Great service and fabulous rooms. Have stayed here the last three years and it is still the best. Great location with a fabulous mall with anything you would want or need. There is even a Walgreens! Hotel still smells new and fresh. The room was clean and well maintained. They do their best to give you what you want- a great upgrade if available! I am a very discriminating traveler- only the best will do and the Palazzo is it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room. Similar to the Venetian but different decor.”
Reviews.Author: ante55
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Venetian several times. First time in the Palozzo. Just as nice. Liked the lounge chairs placed right in the shallow end of the pool and the guys passing out cold cucumber slices and popsicles. The bar staff seemed a little overwhelmed both days I went to the pool, but it was a 85 degrees and slammed. But they still made me my favorite frozen mojito in fairly short order. The pool bar is bigger and nicer at the Venetian. They have a shaded area with sports on tv there and and about three times as many stools. Got a complimentary upgrade just by asking -just a better view and higher floor. Possibly because we were registered as 'Grazie' members. Sign up on the hotel site and become Grazie members before you arrive. It's the player's card site. You check in at a special desk. I have also stayed at the Venezia tower in the Venetian. Very nice, but a bit of a hike from other parts of the hotel complex. You have access to a small private pool and are very near Bouchon (the restaurant) for breakfast. We had a late check out for our 7 p.m. flight , so we headed down to the pool for the afternoon our last day. There is no private shower area at the Palozzo pool, but Palozzo guests have access to the Venetian pool, which does. Or for $20 you can get a day pass to the Canyon Ranch Spa and use their facilities. Had planned to eat at Cut steakhouse in the hotel, but when we showed up for our 7:30 reservation on a Friday night, it was just too raucous. Really a loud scene. Suited for a younger diner. (We are in our fifties.) The concierge booked us a table at Charlie Palmer's, which we loved. I had a fabulous doggie bag from Charlie Palmer's Steakhouse (in the Four Seasons). Bought a gorgeous loaf of bread from the Bouchon Bakery in the Venetian and made scrumptious steak sandwiches poolside the next day. The bellman fixed me up a little cooler bag when he came up to get our bags to put into storage. Would never hesitate to stay at either the Palozzo or Venetian again. It's true they have no fridge or coffeemaker. I just fill up a plastic dry cleaning bag that they provide and put my doggie bags in there. Bring a few big zip lock bags in your luggage or a soft sided cooler that will pack easily. Room service is great. Or jump on the elevator and right outside is a Starbuck's type place. There is always a line there in the early morning, so just keep going a door or two down to Cafe Presse. I sometimes sent my early bird husband down to the Bouchon Bakery at the Venetian to pick up the really good ham and cheese croissant for me and the chocolate almond croissant for him. They always sell out of the ham and cheese early. It has about 20 paper thin slices of a French ham with a lovely cheese. Really good fresh squeezed juice there too. Also, don't miss the lobster club sandwich at Postria-in the Venetian, too. My husband's was bummed out that his favorite Vegas sports book at the Venetian was being remodeled during our stay. He didn't care for the Lagasse's Stadium-a restaurant/sports book at the Palozzo. Very nice, but just not his cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy digs that outshine most on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: totallye
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three night stay here in September in a standard suite with an upper floor view of the strip and pool area way below. The room is top-notch with plush furnishings, high thread-count bedding, flat screen TVs in each room, three in total... yes, the bath too! Robes, high-end Tuscan bath products and a deep soaking tub help you feel like a pampered high-roller. This hotel feels different than other Strip lodging. It can best be compared to the Encore in room size, amenities and attentive staff. Personally, I enjoy staying in this new breed of Las Vegas luxury suites as they offer comfort and style and appealing common areas that some of the older properties lack. The casino floor is lighter, brighter, and airy compared to others and that too, adds to the elegant feel of the property. The Palazzo itself is home to a wide variety of exceptional restaurants that range from affordable to outrageously expensive, but it's Vegas so you can dream big! Additionally, it is located walking distance from the Venetian and Wynn/Encore properties which also are home to some of the world's top chef's dining options. In a town that is so over the top, it is in some ways remarkable that a standard hotel room can be so impressive. The best part, we had no problem finding a good deal online that included show tickets and a variety of restaurant and spa discounts which made this not only an exceptionally deluxe luxury experience, but affordable as well.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites!”
Reviews.Author: 144bdg
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of trying new hotels every time I go back to Vegas, but for some reason, I keep ending up back at the Palazzo! The size of the room is great, and is usually comparable to a much smaller room elsewhere on the strip. Large flat screen TV by the bed, and another in a separate sitting area. Not to mention one in the bathroom! Overall, really enjoy staying here - the rooms, service, spa, all top notch. Just make sure you sign up for their email newsletters so you get notified of their deals. They frequently have some good ones!

Reviews.Title: “Conference in vegas”
Reviews.Author: COfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. They did a nice job w the conference. Escalators were scary because they got so full. Hotel was clean. Staff was nice. Overall it was a food time.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo - Great rooms, classy elegance”
Reviews.Author: dw732
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Palazzo having stayed at WynnLV, Encore, Bellagio, Mirage, MGM, Caesars, Mandalay Bay, Rio. I found the Palazzo to be every bit the classy, elegant, high end luxe that one would expect from one of the top hotels in Vegas. I would definitely put it right up there with WynnLV, Encore, and Bellagio. The greatest asset would clearly be the rooms as their all -suite spaciousness, furniture (sunken sitting area), bathrooms and amenities make these the best rooms in which I have stayed in LV - just edging out WynnLVs I would say. Of course the restaurants are world class- Luxe is great for your normal expansive BLD menu. We also ate at Cut for dinner which was awesome. Jersey Boys was very enjoyable also. Public areas very clean and manicured. So you can't really go wrong staying here. On negative that is personal preference, I don't care for the high ceiling, convention-hall-like casinos like the one at the Palazzo and similar to Mandaly Bay, MGM, Caesars, PH - much preferring the softer and more comfortable feeling of Wynn, Bellagio. I mostly walked over to the Venetian casino(not a short walk) to gamble because of this. One gets the feeling of being more in a sprawling complex at Venetian/Palazzo versus some others. But still a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cng8r
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Prestige level of Palazzo recently for conference. It was a fantastic experience. Check in for the Prestige rooms are on the 23rd floor; we arrived early in the day and our room was ready, easy and fast check in with no problems. Though more expensive to stay at the Prestige level, felt it was worth it: Multiple concierges to help with dinner and show reservations; Free continental breakfast; and best of all, hot food and open bar from 5-8 each day. We had a strip view room- was very large and comfortable. The casino is relatively smoke-free, not to crowded, friendly dealers, and with plenty of lower limit tables. There are also many great restaurants to choose from between Palazzo and Venetian. Overall great experience and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: Paulhiom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate my girlfriends 30th birthday for 6 nights 17-23 Oct. Check in was very speedy and the check in clerk very pleasant. I had already mentioned when booking that we were celebrating a birthday so the check in clerk upgraded us to a strip view free of charge usual cost $45.00 extra per night no $20.00 trick needed although I did tip the clerk. We were on the 43rd floor with a view over TI and the Mirage with a view to the mountains beyond. The room itself was very well appointed and very spacious with a real luxury feel to it, a separate living area and work area along with a big bathroom and wireless internet courtesy of the resort fee. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spotlessly cleaned every day. I’ve read some negative comments with regards to poor housekeeping and damaged furniture I did not encounter any of these. The room doesn’t come with a coffee maker but to be honest I didn’t really miss having one there is a coffee shop at the bottom of the elevators which was sufficient for my needs. My only negative about the rooms and its very small is that the towels weren’t quite big enough and the robes were not very well fitting. The hotel itself is amazing it’s well lit and airy and without the smoky atmosphere I found in some of the others. The Casino is large with a good variety of slot machines and table games. There is a good selection of restaurants to suit all pockets, although we only ate at the Grand Lux Cafe preferring to go out and sample the offerings of the other hotels. The food at the Grand Lux was very good with huge portions. The pools all looked really good although we didn’t have time to try them out. The location is good within easy walking distance to centre strip and handy for the Wynn & Fashion Show Mall there is also a Wallgreens right outside for drinks and snacks etc. Check out was as quick and hassle free as check in had been. Our resort fee was also comped which was a nice touch. The desk clerk also printed our boarding passes for us. All in all this is a great hotel with a real feel of luxury about it, I’d definitely stay here again next time I’m in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Bum_Geezer
Reviews.Content: My business conference was in Las Vegas so my husband decided to travel with me. We stayed in the Palazzo. Check-in was fast for late on Saturday afternoon. We had to trek through the casino to get to the elevators but it wasn't too bad. Our room faced east so we could see the mountains and the sunrise. My conference was in the Venetian so it took a couple of trial runs to figure out how to get to the meeting rooms the quickest way (which wasn't through the casino). Our room was great. We had a work desk (complete with printer) and a safe for the computer equipment when we were out. We had 3 TV's (never turned on the one in the bathroom) but only one got local channels. There were tons of choices for dining but you had to be adventerous in order to find those that were not outrageously expensive. We are not big gamblers so we can't comment on the table games. We didn't see a lot of people winning on the slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Travelinlady018
Reviews.Content: Just visited the Palazzo and stayed in a Bella Suite. The rooms are huge with a sunken "den" with desk with a printer. Robes in closet and curtains that open and close remotely! The bathroom is also tremendous. It was convenient to the Canyon Ranch Spa...which was FANTASTIC as well! All of the restaurants we tried were very good. The Lux Cafe gives you a good assortment of food. The hotel does give you "coupons" to try their vendors and they are all worth it. This hotel has the A Dueling Piano Show and plenty of shops between it and the Venetian Hotel. It is on the far end of the strip but is a good location. The staff was all helpful and friendly. I wouldn't call this resort "affordable" b/c we did not get any deals, but like to stay in these types of hotels. They did offer deals just not the long weekend I was there. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas many times and stayed at The Palazzo because of a business conference. But the room rate was OUTRAGOUS. With that said, if you don't mind paying extra for internet, have no need for a refrigerator, microwave or coffee maker and like getting nickel and dimed to death, this may be the place for you. The suite was nice, but for this kind of change I can think of 3 to 4 hotels that I would rather stay at. When I went down to the front desk for an additonal key 2 days into my stay, I was asked how my stay was so far. I said "Fair". There was no follow-up with why only fair? Obviously, fair is there benchmark of acceptability. Think twice before you book. Overated and under served.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Stoobler-Houll
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister, and I stayed at the Palazzo for a long weekend. We really enjoyed the hotel, and it was a great value for a "luxury property" in Vegas when including a third person in the reservation. The front desk staff was extremely pleasant at check-in, and the concierge provided valuable advice about transportation and meals. The security stationed at the bank of elevators helped us to feel safe in our rooms; random people could not take the elevators up to the lodging levels -- you had to produce a room key to get upstairs. The room was spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job -- our room was clean and when we called for early housekeeping, the staff arrived promptly. The hotel staff also honored my request for a "quiet room;" we barely heard a peep during the night. This may not be my favorite hotel in Las Vegas, but I definitely would stay at the Palazzo again. It was a really good value at a great location on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: gmill1
Reviews.Content: Spent an October weekend at The Palazzo and came away very impressed. The suite was spacious and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. There are, however, some things to keep in mind. The table minimums were a little to steep for my tolerance so it was like staying at a hotel without a casino. Also, The Palazzo is is a little isolated on the north end of the strip. That being said, this was a Hotwire blind booking at a really good price. Given the choice, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CesarCanada
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and pleasant staff. We were in the Prestige section, which I would recommend as it's really worth it: champagne on arrival, open bar + finger food in the evening (5 to 8), delicious breakfast in the morning. The rooms have great views, the beds are comfortable and the place is quiet so you sleep well. The pool is very active. Joan Rivers was resting in one of the poolside cabanas this Friday. It's a fun place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Suites, high end shopping & restaurants are standard here”
Reviews.Author: celesteram
Reviews.Content: After a nice stay at the Venetian back in March, we decided to try the Palazzo this time. We very much enjoy walking through the canal shops and the casinos at both the Venetian & the Palazzo. Some of our favorite Vegas restaurants & retailers are just an elevator ride away from our room when we stay in this complex. The rooms and public areas are very very clean. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Our standard room was a suite that had a king bed, a large bathroom, and a sunken living area with a wonderful sectional sofa, mini-bar, and desk, as well as entertainment center. Our view was not great this time. We were on the 8th floor, room 833, and we were looking at the roof of the Sands Convention & Expo Center. Maybe better luck next time. It is my understanding that the Palazzo is one of the largest LEED certified buildings in the country, if not the world? So here are some things you need to be aware of regarding the accommodations, good or bad: the water pressure in the shower is not outstanding (conservation is key in the desert), the lights tend to be dim on full power (only an issue for us in the bathroom), and the AC shuts off in the middle of the night, and can get too warm especially with down bedding. I understand why all of this is necessary and I applaud the effort. In the end, it probably wouldn't make or break our decision to stay there again, but it's good to know ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “No Coffee!?!?!”
Reviews.Author: ccs4756
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is very nice, but I MUST deduct a point for its lack of complimentary coffee. I had three flat panel TVs in my suite, but no coffee maker. Usually, when a hotel doesn't provide a coffee maker, there will be coffee in the lobby: nope, not here. I'm making a fuss about this, because I hope it's a trend that does not catch on. It seems like the hotel equivalent of our airlines charging for carry-on luggage. Additionally, in my opinion, if you're debating between the Palazzo and Four Seasons, go with the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tgross
Reviews.Content: Not only are the rooms spacious, the service is fantastic. I have found my new home in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Average but good”
Reviews.Author: Xavier C
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived at the Palazzo, We Stayed at the Cosmopolitan which was Fantastic, The Facilities at the Cosmo had possibly everything you want for a good time Fantastic Pools, Imaginable rooms, Vibrant Casino, Popular Nightclub, Friendly service and Unbelievable Location. but when we got to the Palazzo, it was good set out, nice atmosphere and friendly staff, But our Bella Suite was facing the Carpark and Sands Expo, Our remote control for the Sheers didn't work, our couch smelt liked Smoke (We were on a non Smoking floor) and we got no robes (shocking!). When we went to the Pool, it was rubbish the layout when you compare the pool to the Cosmo, Cosmo is better. If i was traveling with a family, Cosmopolitan would be the first choice over the Palazzo. also A/C made loud noises.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: cstokely
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Palazzo that others haven't already said? Well, I feel the need to share our great experience anyway. It started as soon as we arrived. Valet parking was free, speedy and very courteous (with the exact same experience when we left), check-in was just as fast and courteous (making sure we were familiar with all the features of the hotel and room, with an offer to help us make any arrangements we needed), and the room is SPECTACULAR (see the photos). Room features: king bed, living area, workstation with internet, desk and fax machine, 3 flat screen TV's with cable and movie service (one in bed area, one in living and one in bath), separate tub and shower with toiletries, a great view and quietness! NOTE: Do not play with the honor bar unless you want to get charged. It is electroinic and charges you automatically when something is removed! The casino was really clean and NOT crowded. There is no smoking in the walkways and certain areas, which is really nice. Mimimums are higher than the downtown casinos, but the staff was always polite and helpful. Restaurants and bars are very expensive but were good (not great). It was very easy to find our way around, and security is posted at the elevators to the rooms (which kept partygoers from roaming the hotel). This is the only place we will stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE!”
Reviews.Author: Jeropero
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Palazzo at 11 am..I didnt think they would have my room ready,,but to my surprise it was ready..I stayed in one of the Siena Suites..PURE LUXURY! 1280 sq ft suite with 1.5 baths,,3 tv's a huge and comfortable king bed..I also loved the large garden jetted bath tub..I felt like I was a wall street broker,,but It was nice having a Walgreens infront of the Venetian..The Palazzo is connected to the Venetian,,so many restaurants and shows,,you never have to go outside.The Republican Presidentual Debate was at the Venetian ,,CNN was everywhere,,made my stay even more interesting....The nite club LAVO was jumping but not open every night...It was very hard getting around in the Palazzo,,,try to remember where the lobby is when you come down to the casino fl,,that should help but its still pretty hard following the signs..If you are big on getting a nice view,,,ask before you check in..My view was of the back of the Wynn,,no strip view..5 stars all the way! Only one minor complaint,,they have these items to purchase in your room that are on sensors..They charged me for one and I didn't even touch anything..They removed the purchase from my bill with no problem..They also hold $150.00 a day on your credit card for room charges...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: we quite enjoyed our stay there and were treated excellent by everyone. They have, by far, the best reqrds program with their Grazie card. Fun games, good crowd, awesome beds!

Reviews.Title: “In the top 2 of my favs--this and the Encore are neck & neck!”
Reviews.Author: teenaj11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous, clean, fabulous food & shopping, great casino. The other high ranking hotel that we've stayed at is the Encore. We've stayed at the Luxor, The Hotel @ Mandalay Bay, Encore, Excalibur, MGM, and this property is so nice compared to the others. The Encore is a bit more luxurious though. Our suite at the Palazzo was about 1200 sq feet. View was okay (didn't get a full strip view) but the amenities made up for it. The room service (we ordered in several meals) is wonderful. Large menu to choose from. The suite we stayed in was clean & spacious, comfortable bed, wonderful shower with multiple heads. Large bathrooms (2 of them!) with three tv's in the suite. Satellite functioned a little slowly with the tv remote but not a big deal. Casino in Palazzo is great--not huge but good table games & slot options are good. Drinks are made well here-not watered down. Grazie desk is great--they treat you quite well is you play in their casino! Beautiful decor throughout. Again, we've been to Vegas many times and this hotel ranks high on our list. The Encore provides higher quality towels and robes---which probably doesn't matter to men too much but I totally appreciate things like that. Encore did cost us a lot more for a smaller quite (600 sq feet) so for the money the Palazzo is a better deal. But if money isn't an issue and you want pure opulence then go with the Encore. If space & a more varied crowd appeal to you then go with Palazzo. A regular Encore suite is not ideal for bachelor or bachelorette parties whereas the large Palazzo suites are perfect for them. The service at both hotels is wonderful. Upgrading at the Palazzo to a larger suite was a great move. The breakfast buffet at the Grand Lux in the Palazzo is great--simple & tasty. Where as the Encore/Wynn buffet serves a much larger selection of foods from around the world---broader pallets would lean this way. The Palazzo suite bathroom (could fit up to 4 people getting ready if needed) has multi shower heads that are phenomenal!! TV above mirror, deep tub and stand alone shower. Small seperate vanity area with mirror is so great for doing makeup. The Encore bathroom was smaller (great for 2 people) but still very nice with a TV as well--much nicer thead count for the towels here. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would stay here again for a fun trip, a group trip, a party kind of trip. If I was going for the "luxury or romantic" type of trip for an anniversary or Valentine's Day I would go back to Encore.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful room......but”
Reviews.Author: labdaddy2001
Reviews.Content: Probably a great place to go for a vacation. I had a very nice, comfortable room with a good view. The shops are beautiful and it connects directly to the Venetian Resort. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and all were excellent However, I was there on business travel attending a conference. I am not a gambler. As a business traveler, I am used to having an in room coffee maker. No dice, only available for a fee. The first night that I checked in, I noticed there was no shampoo in the room and called down to the desk to get some sent up......and could not believe the hassle that I was given to get it....initially, they didn't want to give it to me (????) and acted as if I was trying to steal it. Also, on 2 of my 4 day stay, the housekeepers didn't arrive to make up the room. Turn down service was not provided and there is an optional "resort fee". Finally, I asked if I could have a late checkout and was informed that I had to be out of the room at 11 AM. So, I headed to the airport to keep working on my laptop.......where I sat for 5 hours. One of my co-workers was told that they would charge her for a half a day stay if she left at noon (but they didn't). Another left her room at 1:30 and was not penalized at all. It seems their check out policies vary by who one talks to.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jiffydog75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Palazzo when we went to see Elton John last weekend. We had a fabulous experience. We paid a little more for the Prestige Level, but, it is the only way to go. Each morning, there is breakfast available on the 23rd floor with everything from the usual eggs, bacon, and so on, to lots of fresh fruit and danish. From 5:00-8:00 p.m., there are hot hors d'oeuvres and an open bar. The rooms are huge and everything is modern and clean. The pool was a great experience, also. Lots of chairs and great food and drinks available. It is a great hotel when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Experience at Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: MadB63
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love staying at the Palazzo. We go to Vegas several times a year and would not stay anyplace else but the Palazzo. Everything was GREAT!! They have many new slot machines to choose from, my favorite is the Hangover machine. The new machines are very addicting, they are very interactive. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Madeline Keller

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Corie V
Reviews.Content: I'm not the typical Vegas "who cares what the room is like, you only sleep there" person. I hate gross hotel rooms and uncomfortable beds. I have stayed at Caesars, Mandaley, MGM, New York,NY, Venetian and now Palazzo. You really get the most room for your money at the Palazzo, much more space (with a giant living room and sectional couch) than the other hotels listed with the exception of the Venetian (same rooms), but I prefer the decor at the Palazzo over the Venetian. Our room was very quiet (we listened to police sirens ALL NIGHT at NY/NY...Do NOT! stay there without ear plugs). I loved the remote controlled window shade with separate black out curtain. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. The tub is a garden tub, not a jet tub, but I use the shower and not the tub anyway. The B&B Ristorante, and Delmonico are fabulous at the Venetian's Restaurant Row. The bathroom has lights on dimmer switches (great for hangovers and early morning wake ups or middle of the night bathroom trips). The room also has a MASTER light switch at the door so you can flip all the lights off with one switch rather than running around switching lamps off. GENIUS. I have never seen this in a hotel before and I want to wire my dream house with a master switch now! For the price range the Palazzo is a really good deal, the rooms are much bigger than at the Bellagio. The Wynn/Encore is spectacular but it costs around $100 more per night. I left my camera in the room and housekeeping turned it in to lost and found, and they arranged to ship it home to me. Wonderful save of my trip memories and good to know that housekeeping is so honest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Stan H
Reviews.Content: Room was a little (very little) run down. But other than that. What can you say? All suites, everyone was very welcoming. Place is top notch, for the average convention traveler. The pit boss at the craps table was a grump.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip At Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: louismfried
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palazzo from October 6- October 10. Had a great time. The room was excellent; it was their standard king luxury suite with a view of the Wynn golf course and the mountains. It was located at the end of the hall so it was very quiet. Check in was quick and efficient. The room was in excellent condition and the bed was incredibly comfortable. If your want the linens changed everyday you have to put a card on the bed; otherwise they just re-make the bed using the same linens. This is better than the procedure at Encore where you have to call housekeeping everyday if you want the linens changed. Spent alot of time smoking ciogars and drinking grey goose at the Laguna Champagne lounge and had a very relaxing time. The atmosphere at Laguna was great. Ate at Grand Lux Cafe and Morels steakhouse and enjoyed the meals there. Went to Lavo a couple of nights and had a few drinks at the bar and enjoyed myself. Didnt do much gambling as Im not a gambler. Spent a Sunday afternoon at Lagasses Stadium watching the NFL games and loved it. Just make reservations way in advance; I made mine two months in advance because I know how hectic Lagasses is on a NFL Sunday. Relaxed at the pool one afternoon and enjoyed it. Ive been to Encore my last two trips but wanted to come back to Palazzo where I stayed on New Years Eve. I prefer the overall ambiance of Palazzo to Encore and I just find it suits my style. Maybe its the European flavour. I really appreciate the Illy espresso bar and the great shops at Palazzo. Overall an excellent vacation and I cannot say one bad thing about the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel. Beautiful, spacious rooms, classy people.”
Reviews.Author: mccullor739
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palazzo my last 4 trips to Vegas. Best rooms on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Terrible front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Sharon d
Reviews.Content: Although I booked this hotel more than a month in advance, when we arrived we were told there were no suites available in the Palazzo tower. We were offered a suite in the Venezia for the first night instead, and a promise to be moved the next day. When we objected we were told our new suite is an upgrade from our reservation as it is "pool side" and with a terrace, and were assured that it was quiet. Those were all bold LIES. when we walked into the room we immediately saw it was old and dusty and had unbearable noise. When we asked to move to a different room we were persuaded to stay the night and were once again promised that the next morning we will be moved to our original reserved room. We had a terrible night with hardly any sleep and when morning came we called the front desk expecting to get to our new room. But once again your staff failed us and we had to spend half a day begging and waiting. This was my first trip to Las Vegas. I was planning on a 5 "diamond" resort where I would enjoy this great city and the facilities of a 5 star hotel. Instead I wasted almost 36 hours on negotiations and aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip - Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: downbythebay100
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, clean, friendly and polite staff. Only complaint would be they do not vacuum each day in your room. Beds are super comfy and quiet...people tend to slam doors at 3 a.m., not the hotels fault just rude guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Diane M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. We stayed for our 25th anniversary. The rooms are spacious and clean with great amenities. Wonderful views. We were able to watch the show at treasure island from our room! Great staff. The pool was beautiful with 2 hot tubs. The location was great- close walk to everything.The only negative was the pool was closed for a private function when I wanted to swim with no alternative on the sign- just a sorry for the inconvenience. Ate at the Lavo restaurant. They are known for their pasta- Food was awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great but not five star”
Reviews.Author: babywine
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but without basic amenities such as complimentary water and a kettle to make tea/coffee, how can this hotel rate itself five star? Casino hotel or not, others nearby such as Caesars Palaxe do provide the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence and Prestige”
Reviews.Author: bubbles058
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveller to Las Vegas I wanted to familarise myself with "Las Vegas" and in paticular "The Palazzo".I spent hours studying the reviews but found myself more confused.So I decided to upgrade to the "Prestige level" at "The Palazzo"and hope for the best.The Limo from the airport I felt was a great investment after a 10 hour flight and being unfamilar with Las Vegas. Checked in and out on the 23rd floor by the conceige they were friendly, fast, efficient and correct.We had a suite on 25th floor clean,enormous rooms 3 tvs with amazing beds,seperate lounge and fabulous views. Plus a bonus of a "prestige" lounge with strip views.Again friendly, fast and efficent staff particularly Mary and Jane thank you.Casino was I felt the best in Vegas bright,airy and full of girls who want to give you free drinks while gambling.The pools are amazing no problem with sunbeds or shade. Goods place to eat was Grand Lux and the sunday buffet at the Bellagio fantastic worth the money. Location I felt is at the quieter end of the strip.Walgreens is attached to the hotel to buy essentials.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: NoahNoCal
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. I vacation/business to the strip 4 to 5 times a year and my stay at the Palazzo was the THE absolute greatest time yet. I was in town for the Elton John show and I stayed in the Sienna suite on the 45th floor with a gorgeous view over the strip and Las Vegas. The staff from the front desk to housekeeping to the restaurants and shoppes were the best, friendly and very accommodating. Top notch! No other words descibe my stay at the Palazzo but amazing! I will be staying here again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but not overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: ccctravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference. Overall everything was nice and certainly convenient to Sands convention center. My room while large and well appointed seemed a bit worn. I think this is a nice hotel but nothing really amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: pakaxx
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Brilliant location and plenty of shops restaurants and things to do without even leaving the property and all indoors out of the heat. The rooms are really lovely and the view amazing. We got a great price but it is very variable depending on when you go so if you are flexible go for the specials

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby”
Reviews.Author: TJTravellers
Reviews.Content: Great hotel great location. Nice Casino lots of variety. Check in and out was quick efficient and correct. The hotel let us stay an extra night at a decent rate. We had a room on the 39th floor with a fabulous view of the strip. If you want to save nmoney on restaurants you can go to the food court in the Venetian shops area and eat at the Deli or the Tratoria for great Italian food at a resonable price. The Fashion mall is just across the street with loads of shopping at whatever price point. Would I stay there again? In a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bed and Bath, Worn-Down Furniture”
Reviews.Author: MissLeara
Reviews.Content: The good: perfect bedding and an excellent bathroom in an expansive suite. The not-so-good: the pimp-like upholstery in the living area is sagging, stained and worn, and the wood is chipped and pocked. Good restaurants, wonderful shops.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dale L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Palazzo for 4 nights and could not have had a more pleasant experience. We mentioned at time of check-in that we were there for a special occasion (birthday) and, without hesitation, were upgraded to a suite on the 47th floor with a great view of the strip. There is a resturant for every taste and the LeGasse Sports Bar is a "must-do" whether or not you like to watch sports. This is not the cheapest hotel on the Strip, but the location and quality of the entire experience make it well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: marla1956
Reviews.Content: I went for a quick get-a-way trip with girlfriends & we had an amazing time. The rooms were spacious.....2 queen beds,large bathroom, step down sitting area with 3 flat screen T.V's in the room. Great location if yo like to shop. Walking distance to the Fashion Mall,Caesar's Palace Shops, & high end shops at the Wynn. Great restaurants in the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for luxury hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kaeagan
Reviews.Content: Rooms are incredible and the cost to stay here is just slightly more than Mirage, MGM Grand, TI, etc. Team members at the hotel are very friendly. No complaints other than high cost of tables and restaurants, which is to be expected at five star resort and casino. I like the location, right across street from TI and Wynn. There is a Walgreens right outside the lobby which is very handy for cheaper water, sodas and even booze.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julioamaro
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas just to relax and enjoy with my wife. The Palazzo was the right choice, very very beatiful, lovely room, nice people, excelent return for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been a 4 except.....”
Reviews.Author: ujustdoit
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms with amazing views however furniture coated with dust and forget room service. First they do not answer and then when you get through via the front desk coffee takes a minimum of FORTY FIVE MINUTES. ?????? Call the night before to book your morning coffee!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel not so hot Casino”
Reviews.Author: rf1426
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo the first week of September. The room was very nice but seemed to have been abused like chipping on the dresser, etc. but for $150.00 per night with a living room, no complaints. I thought the pool area was a bit crowded for the size of the hotel and the casino was by far the worst casino to gamble. No wait service at all. Not a waitress in sight. If I didn't gamble, I would stay again however for you gamblers stay clear as you won't get any "free" drinks or plain water it seems. Isn't that what Las Vegas is about?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Born-on-Rt66
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Palazzo. I was pleasantly surprised by the size and amenities of the guest room. I loved the separate vanity and make up mirror in the bathroom as well as the separate living area. I made a call when the bathroom TV and makeup mirror didn't work and they were fixed quickly and efficiently. Make sure you save up if you plan to eat on property. The food is very expensive although you can get a bargain on the room rates. I would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, enjoyed every minute, except the rain!”
Reviews.Author: londoner540
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Palazzo and again had a great holiday, sunbathed by the small pools, on the way to the Venetian. Especially enjoy the sunbeds in the water to cool off. Had 2 bad weather days, but they were forecast, so went down the Strip and did some more shopping. Our room, on the 43rd floor, was clean and housekeeping was always early and done by the time we returned from the pool. The King size bed was super comfortable. We saw the 'Phantom' show again, an excellent production and the 'Phantom' was outstanding. Looking forward to going again!

Reviews.Title: “Quality has gone down Immensely”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo has always been my favorite Resort in Las Vegas. But our most recent trip was terrible. We stayed 3 nights, September 18-21. We booked a non-smoking King Room, but upon checkin was advised that there were none available, only Queen Size rooms. We accepted the room as it had a strip view. Upon entering the room, there were no amenities in the bathroom. We called down to have some sent up. While unpacking, we noticed garbage under the dresser and found trash in the dresser drawers. We once again called down and had the room cleaned. It was after the second cleaning we found even more trash under the nightstand. The robes in the closet were absolutley filthy. We put them out for replacement. Housekeeping took them away but nver gave us new ones. On our second day, we returned to the room after it was supposed to be cleaned. The trash was still under the nightstand and housekeeping had cleaned the toilet with something that left hair (that wasn't ours) and dirt around the toilet seat. We were totally grossed out. We discussed it with the front desk, who took notes of al our concerns, stating they would forward it to the proper personnel. Because they were updating their computer system at the time, they weren't able to address anything. They credited us back our resort fees. But as a Four Diamond Resort, we thought it was severely lacking. It's a shame as we have staed there in the past and really like it, but there are better places. I hope this visit was the exception.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with an identity crisis”
Reviews.Author: dphallett
Reviews.Content: we spent a week at this resort 1st week in september,as a family we had a great time.the rooms are spacious,housekeeping good,prompt check in everyting great but..... this hotel has an identity crisis it does not know if its a 5 star resort or a party hotel for drunk maurading twentysomethings with too much money and unable to take their alcohol.the pools at the palazzo/venitian are great but spoilt by the tao pool with loud hip hop music all day,forget relaxing by the pool u feel like ur in the middle of a club.the restaurants are wonderful the lobby amazing but was spoilt by groups of kids roaming about drunk carrying bottles of brandy.this review is starting to sound like we did not have agood time,but we really enjoyed our time here,just the few niggles ive mentioned.would we stay here again... maybe

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Group!”
Reviews.Author: roaminrose
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a Bachelorette Party in Las Vegas. We stayed at The Palazzo and the Bella Suite was perfect for us. The suite has two queen beds, and one L-couch. The L-couch can fit one person sleeping on one side and then has a pull out twin bed as well. We were on the 45th floor. The room has a huge window for the wall and the view was great, looking out over the golf course at the Wynn and at the mountains around Las Vegas. The bathroom was huge, with two sinks, another plus for a Bachelorette Party. The pools were nice and there were lots of restaurants that were appealing. I would definitely stay at The Palazzo again with a group.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Amazing”
Reviews.Author: gallrick
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the Palazzo, and we were so pleased to do that. we had two suites on the 45th Floor, it was amazing looking down on Treasure Island and the Fashion Show Mall. The swimming pools were lovely quiet and relaxing for the few hours we had spare. The Cleaner was very good as my Husband had filled my birthday card up with confetti hearts which obviously went all over the floor. She did a great job. It was great being able to just wander into the Venetian and around the shops. The Service was excellent, the rooms were huge, all toiletries and hairdryer supplied. We had interconnecting rooms which was great as we were travelling with my 73 years young mother in law who was on a high from arriving to going home.

Reviews.Title: “Good, fine, but I can't help but compare it to the Encore...”
Reviews.Author: gettinoutthere
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 checked in late on Tuesday October 4th. We had originally booked 2 Bella Suites in the Venetian. No lines, and it didn't take too long to deal with the details. A big conference was in town so they were full - two of us had to stay in the Palazzo which was apparently a $100/night upgrade but it was the same room type. As the other reviews suggest, this place is huge. It took us quite a while to find our way from the Venetian main lobby, through the Venetian casino, through the Palazzo atrium, through the Palazzo casino, then to the guest elevators. Even when you know where you're going, it's a long walk back and forth - heads up. This is pretty much the same thing if you're one level up and walking through the canal shoppes between the 2 hotels. Our (Palazzo) room was nice - more of a modern decor than the Venetian, but still pretty luxurious and over the top. The beds were comfy and we slept well. There wasn't a lot of noise from the hallways at night to prevent us from sleeping, which was nice. I'm not sure if that was a good fluke or is indicative of the type of guests that typically book this hotel - I didn't see a lot of really young partiers, I would say it was generally a more mature crowd (late 20's and up). There were a few details about the room that made me wonder how well this place is holding up or will hold up in the future. The bathroom counter and the top of the room partition is marble, which have both seen better days in terms of water stains/marks. The lighted makeup mirror didn't work, there was a dirty sock from a previous guest that was under the mattress pad/protector, the coffee table in the living room area was very sticky. I know these can be fixed but I believe that months and years of sub-par cleaning and maintenance add up quickly in a hotel. Requests for extra glasses and a few extra items were dealt with quickly by staff. Overall, the rooms were nicely done, well-appointed and comfortable. We had a look at the Venetian room, and it was similar - same layout, but more over the top in terms of slightly gaudy decor. The casino was pretty good - I played quite a few slots as well as some roulette. It was smoky but not any more than any of the other casinos, and it was as bright as a large room underground can realistically be. I had a massage and checked out the spa facilities one day. They were 'ok'. My massage was also 'ok'. The halls between the treatment rooms and the common areas are pretty bad - dimly lit, in dark carpet and walls (it could have been a hospital, very sterile). The 'salt grotto' is a nice attempt, but it reminds me of one of those stretch limos with the starry lights on the ceiling that switch colours. Really dated. The whirlpool has a few 'dark' areas in it that I'm concerned about in terms of mildew, and the chlorine smell from it stuck to me for a couple of days, despite trying to scrub it off in numerous showers. The sauna is similar to the grotto - changing lights, mosaic tiles that are dated in terms of colours with patches of them that have seen better days. I called the Encore the next morning and headed over there for another massage and spa experience - it was like night and day, absolutely no comparison. Overall - the Palazzo (and by extension the Venetian) were nice. However, the whole complex was a bit too big for my liking, the spa was disappointing, and it was a bit over the top in terms of crazy decor when it should have been over the top in a classic kind of way. I don't know how to explain it, but I guess that I expected more given the level of effort that has gone into this place in terms of making this place distinctive and a destination in its own right. I have stayed at the Encore and I found myself comparing the Palazzo/Venetian to the Wynn/Encore throughout my stay and found that the Wynn/Encore came out on top in pretty much every aspect. They can be similar in price (depending on what you book) so given that they are right next to each other, I would go next door the next time I'm there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SuiteG7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Palazzo for 2 nights and LOVED it. The suites are huge, location is amazing and the staff were very courteous and helpful. I can't fault a single thing from our stay. We saw 2 shows (Blue Man Group and Phantom) and both were incredible. If you join the Gratzie club (for free) you get a 2 for 1 voucher to see Blue Man Group and this saved us $100 which was great too! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: justme2Georgia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo shortly after opening and did not have a good experience. A convention I was attending was here so I gave it another try. Much better experience this time. Check in was fine this time - like a normal large hotel experience which was very different than my first time. Security to the rooms was good - they still have security 24 hours at the elevator. Some upscale LV (rated 5 star) hotels have gone to only nights. So that was a nice surprise. Plenty of restaurant choices. Only experienced one problem during a seven night stay with housekeeping. I had an interview one day so I put the do not disturb sign on the door for one hour from 1 p.m. to 2 p.m. I had been gone at the conference in the morning and went back after the interview. When I returned in the evening no one had serviced the room. I called housekeeping to check and they said it was because of the do not disturb sign. I find that surprising when it was only out for one hour and normally I would expect an upscale hotel to notify me by voice mail or paper slipped under the door asking if I preferred another time. Otherwise the stay was pleasant, room great, and an excellent size safe for storing multiple PC's. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “bright lights city 2”
Reviews.Author: fmjjb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palazzo after rave reviews from friends and reading positive online reviews. We booked a hotel at the new city centre for the first 4 nights of our stay and then moved on to the Palazzo for the remaining 3 nights. The lobby, casino and interconnecting shopping mall (from the Venetian) were all very stylish but we found the rooms (bella suites) to be slightly tired with chipped furniture, slightly worn couches, blemished marble in the bathrooms and mini bar fridge has sticky spills from previous guests that was not cleaned for the duration of our stay. Loved the Fashion Show Mall across the road that had everything from Macy's to Bloomingdales. Have previously stayed at the Bellagio in 2008 and would recommend it in preference to Palazzo for proximity to strip centre and for general opulence

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Bachelorette Party!”
Reviews.Author: Vac8sun
Reviews.Content: My 5 girlfriends and I were planning a Vegas Bachelorette party. I picked the Venetian after some searching and when I called the Reservations desk and told them what I was looking for they highly recommended we stay at the Palazzo. I am so glad they made that recommendation. The Palazzo was beautiful and we had a great time. The rooms were spacious (though we spent little time in them) and the bathroom was HUGE (comfortably accomodating 3 women and all our stuff. We realized once we stayed there we easily could have fit all 6 of us in one suite because the Palazzo has pull out beds in the couch. But we were happy to have the extra space. The price on the rooms were very reasonable as well. We did not upgrade to the Prestige, although the staff strongly recommended it. We were perfectly fine without it, although I cannot say we would not have enjoyed the amenities that were offered. We ate all meals at restaurants associated with the Palazzo/Venetian and had great meals at each one. (about $50 pp) We also spent Saturday night at Lavo for dinner and Lavo night club for dancing. The night club is on the smaller side, but was still enjoyable. The bar staff was great. We did a little bit of gambling and won $50/$9/$4 each, 2 didn't gamble and 1 lost an undisclosed amount.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxibaby2
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a fabulous hotel. The front desk staff were wonderful and gave us a free room upgrade with a view over the strip so the kids could watch the Pirate show at Treasure Island and the volcano show at the Mirage. The room was big and the sofa/chill out area great. We have 3 kids and we had ample room. The bathroom is one of the best I've seen in a hotel. The pools (all 7 of them if you include the Venetian) were lovely as were the spas. If shopping is your thing they have ample high end shops and restaurants to match. Location wise it's almost across the street from Vegas's best shopping mall as well as being within 20 mins walk to the Bellagio, so pretty central. All in all this hotel was beautiful and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for Vegas... If Vegas is your thing that is...”
Reviews.Author: AntoineLondonSW11
Reviews.Content: Part of the Venetian Hotel complex and owned by the Sands Casino Group (who recently built the Marina Bay Sands in Singapore), I booked the Palazzo through Expedia, mostly because of the very good rate they offered (£420 for three nights for a twin room with two queen-size beds). Stepping into the hotel was like entering Grand Central Station at peak hour! But that is the norm in Vegas, as I discovered later, except if you go to the Mandarin Oriental which is apparently the only human-size hotel without a casino attached... but not the same rates of course... I won't write an essay about the hotel, as Vegas is really not the sort of destination I would recommend. But if you feel like going, The Palazzo is not a bad choice, from a value-for-money point of view. The room was extremely spacious and very clean. The hotel's common areas were also immaculate, and the property has got tons of restaurants and cafes to try out, so you could literally spend your entire time in ther... if you don't die of claustrophobia after an hour that is... If you like gambling the casino at The Palazzo seemed like a popular venue, but if you don't play, like me, crossing the casino area with its foul smell of cold tobacco and rose flower deodoriser will be a chore every time... But this is not just proper to the Palazzo... Every single big hotel in town will feel the same... Like most places in Vegas, the hotel was a clash of two worlds: super rich frolicking at the overly crowded pool with barely legal teenagers, a club that was playing loud rap music with gorgeous girls trying to find the rhythm and the fun in it, bad drinks at the bar but gorgeous food at the Grand Lux Cafe and Le Bouchon restaurants... Something maybe worth experiencing once in a lifetime but two nights would be enough: one afternoon to visit all the hotels and casinos, a show in the evening (Cirque du Soleil "O" was great, Celine Dion could have been fab but she is only back in December 2011) and the Grand Canyon the next day and that's you done for life... And to have a good restful sleep, The Palazzo is a good solid choice... One final admin point: all hotels in Vegas add a resort fee to your booking (covering pool and gym access, as well as wifi), but I don't remember reading this on expedia when I booked. I managed to get away without paying the fee (70USD a day...), after complaining that my bookings on expedia had been paid for in its entirety and should have included these extra fees. Worth also double checking your final bill: mine had a few extra expenses which i never signed for... A common mistake in hotels that size...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Kari M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came a to Vegas a day early for his work conference. I researched places to stay and chose the Palazzo - what a great choice! This hotel is wonderful. Very clean and excellent accomodations in a great location on the strip. We rented a car and had no trouble navigating to the parking garage to the hotel (sometimes I think this is a problem in Vegas). My only small gripe (which is kind of a catch 22) is that when we checked in the attendant asked my husband if we wanted to upgrade to a larger suite for $100 more. He declined and then, after going through all of the reservation information, the attendant told him that he upgraded him anyway for free. So... on the one hand - that's great! But on the other hand, I guess they would have taken our $100 and upgraded us. The bigger suite was very nice and we were very appreciative for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: TessRobbo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our honeymoon at the Palazzo and had an amazing time. We upgraded our room at check-in to a Sienna Suite and were so glad we did. Our suite was huge with a entrance hall, large lounge, bedroom, bathroom with jacuzzi and whirlpool bath and two separate toilets. We had 3 tv's in the suite and (my personal favourite) remote control curtains and blinds. The hotel is lovely with great restaurants and public areas. Great location in the middle of the strip and easy to get around. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Orla S
Reviews.Content: We were recently married at the Venetian. Our party (total of 15 people) all stayed at the Palazzo. The rooms are beautiful, there are lots of restaurant offerings, and the setting is fantastic.Would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Customer Service; Hotel Room Was So-So”
Reviews.Author: GreenerSolutions
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo (attached to the Venetian) for a conference last week. The room was okay; it's definitely showing wear and tear. The dresser that's in front of the bed had a door hinge broken; the dresser definitely look very worn and beat up. The dimmer switch in the bathroom did not work. However, the customer service was excellent, especially room service. We told the manager of the issues the room had. I hope they fix them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent italian experience in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mattychatty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a quick getaway from the kids and enjoyed 5 wonderful days in Vegas in the Palazzo. We enjoyed the warm atmoshere (Italian that is....not the outside temperatures) and enjoyed the relaxation of walking within the hotel when killing time and finding casual dining. The hotel had everything we were looking for, large spacious rooms (all they offer are suites at comparable prices), very clean hotel and lobbies, quiet casino for casual gambling, good food, beautiful architecture, near the end of the strip (northe end) but by far on the cleaner and quieter side. We walked all the way to MGM for several shows and enjoyed the sites but noticed a huge difference in street cleanliness and general behaviour of solicitors. No buffet's but definately a lot of food options and within a very short walking distance of buffet's if desired....

Reviews.Title: “People make the difference here!”
Reviews.Author: atlbh_concierge
Reviews.Content: As any great hotelier knows there are many beautiful upscale properties in the world, but it is the staff that truly sets one apart from the other. Upon entering this stunning property I was warmly greeted by a young lady who walked me to reception and although I was early I was checked in and given a brief overview of the hotel and amenities by a polite, professional young lady. My bags were quickly brought to my room and I must mention the young man who took them before check in was another great asset- using my name with a smile and the first to welcome me to the Palazzo. The room was very spacious and luxurious- see photos. During my stay I encountered Blanca who brought me room service and went out of her way to ask if there is anything else I may need. Also, you will notice security at every level which is quite comforting especially as a single female traveler. The piece de restistance for me however was the spa. I took advantage of the flyer in the room and booked a 30 minute treatment as a few days of Vegas will quickly take its toll- and it was the best part of my entire trip!!! I was lucky enough to get Marcella as my therapist who must have removed 10 years of stress from my shoulders I didn't even realize I had been carrying. This young lady is truly gifted with her healing hands and keen ability to read people- either born with it or years of service but truly a remarkable person. I highly recommend the Canyon Ranch Spa whether you stay at the Palazzo or anywhere in Vegas- and ask for Marcella!! You won't be disappointed:) Thank you Palazzo for a wonderful week of pampering and spoiling

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: S_Jones12
Reviews.Content: Overall I love the Palazzo. I've stayed at the Venetian as well before, but I would pay extra to stay at the Palazzo again. The rooms are fairly equal between the two properties, but I found amenities closer from Palazzo. The pool service there was fantastic and far exceeded my other stays at places like Aria, The Signature and MGM. The Palazzo/Venetian has a great selection of shows and fantastic restaurants to choose from. If you're going to Vegas to relax... this area of the strip is fantastic and there is so much to do between the Palazzo and the Venetian that I find I don't have to leave the property much to have an enjoyable vacation. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Luxurious Rooms, Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: rrand
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Palazzo are beautiful, they are large and it is evident that they have not skimped (large mouldings, great carpets, marble "base boards" in the bathrooms , motorized drapes/blinds, good decor). If you are looking for a great room this is the place. If you are looking for an overall great environment, this is NOT the place. This is a smoking establishment, so unless you are a smoker (I am not) the place is rather stinky - I know that it is a supposed myth that oxygen is pumped into hotels that have a casino to keep patrons awake, so I can only attribute my difficulties with sleep to poor air quality due to smoke/ventilation (was at the Trump a few months earlier and loved the air quality and the sleep - the room amenities were better as well there, but the rooms were not as luxurious). The beds and bedding are wonderful and I had no complaints on that front. Water takes time to heat up on the upper floors (we were on 46), so don't expect hot water in the morning - not even lukewarm. Room noise was minimal, no problems with noise from outside filtering in, but for some reason noise from adjacent room showers was very loud (hey I like to shower as soon as I get back to my room regardless of the hour...I felt sorry for my neighbours, but they returned the favour at 7 am). The whole mini fridge being weighted was absolutely ridiculous. Thankfully I knew about this before I got there, called down to confirm and ask if an exception could be made so that we could store water and were told that the purpose of the fridge was not for the convenience/use of the room guests (really? I was paying enough for the room to hope that I would be able to store some water bottles to combat the 40 degree (celsius) weather - the hotel sees it clearly as another cash grab over and above the "resort fee" - water was $6 from the fridge and you would have to be a lunatic to buy it. Walgreens is just outside if you don't mind the walk. We were sent up a second "mini" ice bucket instead...pathetic!). I DID NOT even bother to open the fridge (the phone call took care of that), but when it came time to check out, surprise surprise, over $25 in refreshment charges. No arguments with removing the charges when I called to dispute, so I would check the bill carefully. I was expecting the resort fee, so no surprises with the almost $19 (including taxes)/day that was applied. While this is a "luxury" hotel, given it's size there is no way that it's staff can provide "luxury" service (stay at the Four Seasons if that is important to you - they are exceptional). Wait times for everything including lengthy delays in answering phones, less than helpful service, housekeeping was at the door EARLY every morning (8:30 am including day of checkout which was a real surprise), so put your do not disturb sign out if you mind being woken up. Housekeeping did do a really good job though. I actually liked the location, on the strip but not right in the middle of lunacy, the parking garage always had spots available where it was convenient. Casino was busy, but not a mad zoo. A general mix of people, but on the whole I would say a slightly older crowd. Gym was well equipped but crowded even early. I don't think I will be staying here again, but it all depends on what you want in a hotel. Personally I think there are better options out there and I am beginning to realize that while I enjoy the craziness away from my "home" hotel, I like coming back to a place that is a little less crazy and whole lot cleaner air-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor”
Reviews.Author: iam2mai
Reviews.Content: This hotel was elegant, well kept and beautifully decorated. The beds were comfortable and housekeeping was diligent in cleaning the rooms each day. We were on the 44th floor and had an awesome view of the strip. The bathroom was large and elegant. The hotel itself and lovely and I can't wait to go back. This was our third trip there. Great restaurant variety and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury room with a view”
Reviews.Author: rubenfrijns
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a standard room at the Venetian but could get an upgrade to a 'Luxury View Suite 1 King bed' for a bit more. The room was big enough with a big and clean bathroom with a seperate shower and bath, tv, dual sinks and seperate toilet. The king bed was great, not too soft to sleep on with a big tv in front of it, alarm clock and radio. The second part was 'living room' with a big L shaped couch, tv, desk with a fax and printer, and a big window with strip view. The AC was quiet so it could stay on during the night. Can only say that this was one of the best rooms i've ever had

Reviews.Title: “nothing special & VERY overpriced”
Reviews.Author: amber j
Reviews.Content: A couple of my friends and I stayed at the palazzo for $500/night from sept 23rd to 25th - ridiculously overpriced! They should've included free drinks & free seats by azure pool for that price - our bill was about $300 just for sitting by the pool. We bought big bottles of fiji water to drink by the pool and they made us throw them away before entering the pool. Our phone didn't work the entire time we were at the hotel and the casino was very smokey. For $500/night we should've had a view of the strip and not bare mountains and ugly hotel rooftops. The souvenir shirts at the store in the lobby were overpriced (over $50) and my friend bought visine for $16 - absolutely ridiculous! The TV didn't have any of the regular networks and drinks at the pool were $17. They didnt provide any mouthwash, toothpaste, qtips, etc that much lower priced hotels offer. My friend wanted to check out at 6pm and they charged us $100 for that - even though she's a regular customer there. They didn't even accept all the points she's accrued from gambling there in the past or during that trip. They also charged $12/day for using their wireless network. I'm never staying there again. DEFINITELY NOT IMPRESSED!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but don't eat at Zefferino's!”
Reviews.Author: adrianausa
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great shops and lots of things to do. The rooms are very nice and clean. We ate at Carnevino the first night and loved every minute there; great food and service. On our second night we decided to try Zefferino's and that was a big mistake. Our waiter Nick was non attentive and acted like he was doing us a favor by taking our order. The food took 45 minutes to arrive and Nick didn't come once to our table to apologize or to even ask how we were doing. The food was mediocre at best. The New York steak (Controfiletto alla Brace) was overcooked in some places and undercooked in others and the seafood in the Aragosta Diavolo was overcooked. Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Mazalo
Reviews.Content: What a hotel!!! We stayed at the Palazzo for 2 nights and had a blast! What a hotel! Check in was very quick and we reserved 2 connecting suites. One suite was not ready so they upgraded us to pool and strip view. Totaly worth the wait (which was 30 mins). The suites were mind blowing! the beds were so compfy!!! The hotel is very very pricy so we didn't eat at the hotel which was ok because we got to see and expirience other hotels. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: KraftyKelly
Reviews.Content: We travel to Las Vegas every year and have stayed at numerous hotels (have not yet stayed at comprable Wynn, Aria or Bellagio).. We prefer the Palazzo and Venetian for the luxury these htoels offer and the large suites. You will never get a "bad" room at these hotels. You may not always get the view you want or the proximity to the elevators you wish but the rooms are always superior. They are large, comfortable and luxurious. I love these hotels for the comfort and relaxation they offer. You can unwind and feel far from the strip. I love the living room which offers the time you need to put your feet up and have your morning coffee and late night beverage. The Pools are awesome! The Grand Lux Restaurants in both are fantastic and offer a varied menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location. Pool staff is rude and drink prices are crazy”
Reviews.Author: Penny A
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms are awesome. Rooms are very large and comfortable. The front desk staff and housekeeping were pleasant. The staff working around the pool are not friendly and make you feel like you are imposing on them if you order a drink. I know many drink prices are high in the hotel pool area, but $8 for a can of beer and $10 for a vodka/lemonade, seem like too much. There is a Walgreens outside of the hotel that is reasonably priced and convenient for any toiletries, snacks or liquor.

Reviews.Title: “Quality without the bussle of the Venetian side”
Reviews.Author: P4620
Reviews.Content: I was there for work for 5 days. The room was great. Large comfortable bed, very clean, nice parlor area and two TVs. I love their bathrooms. Big, clean with nice amenities. Plenty of lighting, outlets and a desk area with a working FAX, Printer, Scanner, Copier, which was really helpfull to me. They even refilled the paper without me asking. Staff was helpfull in general but cleaning staff was great to work with, we spoke once and she came when I would be in meetings. Always felt safe, their security was visable and helpful. I had ZERO luck with their slots, very tight. I tried repeatedly :)

Reviews.Title: “Palazoo is the Bomb!”
Reviews.Author: Joni2983
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Palazzo on a get away girls weekend. We loved this hotel! The service was fantastic! At the time of check-in the bell hop brought our bags to the room and even filled our ice bucket for us. The rooms are beautiful! We have stayed in Vegas several times (Mandalay Bay & Wynn) and liked this hotel the best. We only left the hotel once to go to City Center. We ate at TAO and it was amazing. The sea scallops literally melted in my mouth. We went to TAO nightclub and had a blast! We visted the Canyon Ranch Spa and got our hair and makeup done for our club night. They did an amazing job on both of us! I enjoyed the Spa so much, I went back the next day to get my make-up done again. The only small complaint we had was one day we put the do not disturb sign on our room because we didn't want the maid cleaning. Housekeeping still came in and cleaned the room and ignored the do not disturb sign. Other than that, the service was 5 star and we will def. stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Some staff needTo be less rude. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Canadawj
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo We are in our late 20's and travel A lot. I travel for a living.  Check-in: Very quick. Arrived at 2:00pm. They ushered us to the counter on the left so we had no waiting.  Room: very large. Nicely decorated. Have a huge bathroom With water closet, shower, soaker tub, double sinks and make up area. Also has a small tv. Nice beds and good space for clothes. Has a sunken living room with L shaped couch, work area And table. Has automatic blinds with remote control. 1 large tv in bedroom. 1 smaller in living room. One small complaint we had is that we are staying in a 5* hotel yet the toilet paper was 1 ply. We've stayed at 10 different hotels on the strip and they've all had nicer toilet paper. Not a huge deal. We were fine And it's not a reason to not stay here. Just our opinion.  Casino: nice and smaller.  We ate at the Grand Luxe. Good prices. Service all 3 times was pretty bad. But food was good and nice portions.  Check out. Nice - we did it On the TV Valet: fast and very friendly and helpful.  Security. Was nice that they check for room keys before entering the elevator. I heard others that we insulted. We weren't. We thought it was nice. Also you must stop before driving into the valet or parking area. Once they checked our trunk. The other 15 times they just asked where we were going. A bit annoying but again not a reason to not stay here.  Pool- we liked how they had lounge chairs in 1'3'' of water. Towel guys were very friendly and helpful. A few pools to choose from. The sun only really hits the pool for a few hours. After 4:30 it's behind TI and before it's blocked by the hotel. Very comfy lounge chairs. Nice padding.  The main issue we had was with a cocktail Waitress being extreamly rude to us when she asked the people right next to us at the same machine for drinks. We Said we'd have one. She looked at us and said no I'm not serving you guys. We were confused and we hadnt even had 1 drink yet. Very inappropriate. The rest were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: chocolate85
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is amazing! We stayed in a suite on the 40th floor that had a spa bath, powder room, separate lounge room and exercise area. All of the staff were very welcoming. The facilities are great - over 60 restaurants in the one hotel. The pool area was also very nice. Attention to detail in the decoration/presentation is out of this world. We visited many hotels whilst in Vegas and this one definitely stood out. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo: Well Worth a Stay!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanNomadinLA
