Reviews.Content: We have stayed numerous times at both properties, The Palazzo and The Venetian. While both offer all-suite rooms which are among the best on the Strip, the Venetian, in the past year, has really begun to show its age, whereas The Palazzo still has some time before it reaches that point. (Case in point: twice in rooms in the Venetian, buttons were missing off the couches. The furniture was chipped and stained. We found carpet stains. The bathroom door wouldn't stay open.) We have celebrated our anniversary at the Palazzo and have also been there on another occasion with our children. Impeccable and great deals both times. Odd to say but we love the smell of the place. They use a delightful, fresh perfumed scent that lingers in all public places and the rooms. The Palazzo is closer to the massage areas of Canyon Ranch spa, so it makes it easier to take advantage of them. The restaurants and shopping in both properties (they are connected) are phenomenal and we find a lot to do with the children: Blue Man Group, Madame Tussaud's, shopping in San Marco Square, hanging out at the pool. One thing is for sure: we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Venetian's Understated Sister”
Reviews.Author: Rav22
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is the newer but not as flashy sister property to the Venetian. As my friend said, "This isn't as flashy as the Venetian". I didn't mind, and like other reviews, it's more classy. The room was nice, with a view of the pool area, Wynn, and Trump. The only downside of the room was it had a handicapped bathroom rather than the typically bathtub and separate show. Service was good. We received comp tickets for Phantom, which we used. Else, the nicest part was getting complimentary late check out until 4:00 PM (originally asked for an hour... but the hotel left me a message to extend it to 4:00), which I would have paid for.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I want to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Annie055
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas several times a year and this is the only place I want to stay! The rooms you want to stay in for months instead of just a few days! It has a bedroom and step down living room with floor to ceiling windows! It gives you a beautiful view of the mountains in the distance which is peaceful to look at first thing in the morning. The beds are luxurious and the linen is perfect. The marbled bathroom offers a lovely vanity and separate large shower and tub. The amenities are always generous. The staff treats you over-the-top good and makes you regret leaving! The location is 100% perfect! You have upscale shopping which joins with the Venetian Hotel but also more reasonable shopping around the "canal". The gondolas are fun to watch and ok to ride (unless you've done the real thing! LOL) for the experience. Also across the street is the Fashion Mall which is mega big with about any store you can think of! Get a map inside because its easy to get lost! Also its worth going through the Wynn to stroll the small selection on shops but also see the beautiful waterfall. The casino itself is nice and since it joins the Venetian you have a good selection of where to play. I haven't found it too smoky like another reviewer and that's a concern of ours due to health problems. And I must add that The Palazzo offers some of the finest dining on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GettinErDun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2011, and all my expectations were met. First off we got a great rate through Hotwire and never had any problems. The hotel itself was very impressive. I loved the high ceilings, and grandness of it. The whole place has a very open and airy feel, and is super clean. Check in was fast. You have to walk across the casino floor to your room, but its a straight shot the the elevators. The rooms are all suites and were really nice. I loved the bathroom, my wife adored the makeup table and the bed was soft and comfy. We had a view of the pool and strip on the 19th floor. I had wanted a higher floor, but it worked out great, making the elevator trip even faster! Room was cleaned well everyday, and they even changed the sheets twice during our 4 nights without asking (perhaps it was the tip?). The casino layout is great in my opinion, no confusing maze, everything is so accessable. I am not a smoker, and I didn't find it overwhelming at all on the gaming floor. Great shops and restuarants are within an arms reach of the room elevators. The staff overall was very friendly and courteous I found. Service at the piano bar while playing video poker was second to none! I would reccommned this place to anyone really, don have anything negative to say. On the map it appears to be "far" up the strip, but I could walk down to Caesars in 10 mins once outside, and did so several times. I posted some photos but the hotel website is dead on accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything (except for the room).”
Reviews.Author: MonicaMonica
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Palazzo. It's the newer tower on the Venetian property. I liked how everything was connected to the Venetian, but I also liked how they added more shops and restaurants to the Palazzo side. It's a beautiful hotel- the lobby and atrium are clean and new. I just didn't like the rooms. Yes, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was big, but the furniture wasn't wearing well. For it being a newer hotel, there were lots of little things that were broken or looked bad. One of the mirrors was broken, the outlets were loose in the walls and the velvet furniture just felt dirty. The drapes are on a remote control and they closed sporadically on their own. With all of the hotel options in Las Vegas, I probably wouldn't stay here again. I'd definitely come to the Palazzo/Venetian for the shopping and the restaurants. I loved the Palazzo, except for our room!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomodations, smoke filled casino”
Reviews.Author: SusanGP_10
Reviews.Content: I will never understand the many inviting signs that state "We have smoke free corridors". What do they think happens to the smoke streaming from the many smoking players sitting adjacent to the carpeted walkway? Other than my disappointment in not being able to avoid the smoke filled atmosphere, I agree with the previous reveiwers. The room was luxurious and immaculate, as was the pool area. Great views, wonderfully accomodating staff. I also enjoyed the location. Treasure Island, the Winn, Barneys and Walgreens are just next door. Don't miss the canals @ the Venetian, they can take you to a world away! The Fashion Show Mall is just across the strip offering discount tickets and Maggianos Italian restaurant. If you've never been, Maggianos offers family style for parties of 4 or more, the food is quality, great salads, excellent service and many gluten free selections from chefs specially trained and knowlegable. We also found the water in the hotel is carefully filtered and very safe for drinking. By the way, the Palazzo offers a topless pool with a club like atmosphere as well as countless comfortable lounge chairs in sun and shaded areas.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: jane1977
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Venetian which is part of the palazzo and joins to it, we upgraded to a suite in the palazzo tower 46 floor for our wedding night wow it was a huge room with electric blinds in the living room and bedroom with lovely views, we had a jacuzzi bath in the larger of our 2 bathrooms. The palazzo itself is classy and stunning

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jasper298
Reviews.Content: Luxurious rooms with very nice bathrooms. Automated drapes and full office capabilities.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas, a great spot”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMare
Reviews.Content: Came for Jersey Boys. Was not disappointed in either show or hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo 09/19-09/21 2011. The front desk personnel were extremely friendly and accomodating. We were able to get into our room prior to noon. Bell staff and valet staff also very professional and friendly. The Palazzo pool is the best in Vegas....you can sun bathe with a lounge chair in the water....so refreshing on a hot day. Staff come around with complimentary popsicles, orange or cucumber slices and water. The suites and public areas are extremely clean. The staff are eager to please. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The casino was extremely cold in many areas...so bring a sweater or jacket if you plan on playing the slots or tables. The cocktail servers were friendly and prompt for the most part. One night service was quite slow but overall very good. We always enjoy several meals at the Grand Lux Cafe. Huge portions and reasonably priced. The servers don't mind visiting and joking with you...no snobbiness at all. Overall we would highly recommend Palazzo for a Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything!”
Reviews.Author: juiceman80
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for great customer service,a great room and great shows this is the place for you. The staff here greets you by name. The food is reasonably priced for the amount that you get. They have some of everything. I have stayed up and down the strip and by far they are in the top two. The location of the hotel is in the heart of the strip. In the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “The place I've learned what 'excellent' means :)”
Reviews.Author: splashIstanbul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been invited to be a part of the Presidents' Club organization of his company because of his success in 2010 to Las Vegas for 5 nights and The Palazzo was the hotel the company has chosen for our accomodation. I have been to 5 star hotels many times before, but this hotel was not a 5 star,not a 7 star, maybe deserved 15 or 20 stars.The best hotel ever with incredibly large suit rooms,with perfect service and with perfect food in the many restaurants within it.You can also use all the facilities of the Venetian Hotel which is the sister hotel of the Palazzo. The good news is you pay the same price for the luxurious suites as you pay for a standard room @ Times Square New York @ a 4 star hotel. P.S. Lavo night club is very good too :)

Reviews.Title: “palazzo is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: pkagoob
Reviews.Content: wonderful place to spend your vegas vacation! stayed at many other hotels on the strip and will go back to palazzo from now on! not snobby! not loud! beautiful large rooms! very roomy casino and shops! perfect for those who enjoy elegance and class! great service and friendly staff! not expense for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: h0rsetrader
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great...we cannot complain about anything. we spend 5 nights here and enjoyed it all. upon checking in we prompted was given our room keys, directions, etc. we found our room easily enough and found it to be great from all aspects. the room was very clean, ample towels with soaps, lotions, etc. in the bathroom. a set of weigh scales if you have interest in getting on them..3 nice televisions and the bed was very comfortable..maid service was very good and they took care of all our needs. my wife especially likes the soap and lotions that was available. we were on the 25th floor and it was very quiet there. No negatives for us...truly a 5 star in my mind....nothing more I can really say as it was all good.

Reviews.Title: “2 hotels in one!”
Reviews.Author: travelerlpl
Reviews.Content: Ahhhh, the Palazzo and Venetian connected with upscale shopping and restaurants! I didn't even leave the hotel for the 3 days I was there. (Mainly because the weather was triple digits outside!!) The hotel hosted a conference for about 7,000 people and it was very organized! The reception desk upon arrival moved very quickly, customer service very accommodating also. I stayed in a suite on the strip side so was able to view the Treasure Island show nightly with fireworks! Although keep in mind, this is an hourly show, so you may hear a few booms! Didn't seem to bother me at all. Loved the remote drapes to open up to a fantastic strip view of the mountains and lights everywhere! The suite had 3 TV's, yes one in the bathroom also! (Also a phone in the bathroom!) There was a filled fridge, but don't move anything around..you'll be charged! So really couldnt use it for personal items. No coffee makers in room and a regular cup of coffee cost at $4.00 at the coffee shops. There is a Walgreens next door for some snacks and better prices! Beds were not comfortable for me. I had 2 queens, so first night I felt like the mattress did not have much support. Moved to the other bed, and it wasn't much better, but doable. The pools were awesome! You can use either hotel pools (about 7 of them). They all had cabanas with a/c and tv (for a price of course!) Definitely a place to people watch! Restaurants were pricey..there are some coupons available..ask at the concierge. There is also a food court that offers a wide choice of food. Zefferino restaurant was one restaurant that was not accommodating when I had to wait for lunch for 45 minutes. When I asked to speak to the manager, none available, but spoke to someone in the office who said that the manager does not offer anything if something goes wrong. I asked for them to at least take a soda off my bill and they wouldn't. So I talked to the hotel manager at the Palazzo and he took the whole meal off of my bill....that is customer service!!

Reviews.Title: “Low Rates Frequently Found”
Reviews.Author: mrmull
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at the Palazzo in the past few months and find it to be a very good option as the room rates on the internet are sometimes a real value. Our last stay got us a weekday room for $219/night--taxes and the resort fee brought it up to $245 but it is hard to avoid those extra charges on the Las Vegas strip. The suite-style rooms (actually one big room with the seating area and the bed divided by steps) is spacious and well-appointed. We had a view of the outdoor pirates show across the street at Treasure Island. On other stays we have been located on the opposite side of the hotel with a view of the Wynn golf course. The bathrooms are large with a nice tub and separate shower. Towels are beginning to get a little thread-bare but the room was very clean and comfortable. We like the location because it is a short walk to the fashion mall across the street and to the Wynn and Encore hotels. We sometimes stay in the south tower at the Wynn but the room rates are normally twice as much as Palazzo unless you catch a good deal on the internet. There are many good restaurants in Palazzo and the adjoining Venetian, which is also a bonus. The only weird aspect of the Palazzo is that the switches on the bedside table lamps frequently do not work--this has happened to us several times. If you stay there and turn on the lamp, check to make sure it is plugged in. Some of the lamps are permanently turned on and previous guests have unplugged them when they go to sleep at night. Other lamps do not turn on at all. The lamps are nice looking but not very functional. Otherwise, it's a nice place to stay. Don't miss the shops, restaurants and DoubleHelix wine bar on the second floor of the hotel above the casino--a quiet haven from the din of the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vegas Hotel of Choice....still”
Reviews.Author: NJLT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are regular visitors to Las Vegas from the UK. We have previously stayed in The Luxor, Monte Carlo, MGM Grand, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, Venetian and the Palazzo. This year we decided to return to the Palazzo for 6 nights after already spending 7 nights at the Cosmopolitan. Having stayed before, we knew what to expect and were not disappointed. The hotel itself is much quieter than most strip hotels hence leading to a more relaxing stay that can be found elsewhere. The pool area is extensive, with plenty of sunbeds, including many in the pool, and lots of shady areas so you can escape from the midday sun. You can also walk though to the Venetian pool area although this was a little busier. Staff are very polite and will help you find sunbeds upon request. There is a complimentary service of fruit slices, ice pops and chilled water during the day which is a nice touch considering there is a charge for everything else in Vegas. Rooms are very spacious, with spilt level bedroom and living areas and large bathroom with shower, bath and double vanity unit. Beds are very comfortable. Our only disappointment was the $17 + tax resort fee. We were waived this last year as we were international guests and would not want the local newspaper or phone calls but were told it was mandatory this year. It does also include free wifi and use of the fitness centre but is still expensive for what you get. It should just be included as part of the room rate to avoid such complaints. Overall it was a relaxing stay, away from the hustle and bustle of the mid strip area and remains our hotel of choice in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo...You Sexy Hotel you!”
Reviews.Author: Bojarelli
Reviews.Content: Spent a majority of our bachelor/bachelorette weekend here. Gals in one room, Homies in the other. Hallways were WIDE - plenty of room for cartwheels. *LOL* The rooms: AMAZING. I want those remote drapes installed in my house now - I'm not kidding. TVs everywhere: 1 in-front of the beds, 1 in the living area, 1 in the bathroom. Beds were absolutely comfy. Clean, clean, clean. Water may have taken a little long to get warm in the shower - had to let it run for a while prior to stepping in but once it's going, it's all goodie. Didn't get a chance to use the tub - too busy partying. The bathroom areas could've used some privacy LOCKS - just in-case. The fridge could have gone without being already stocked with high-priced items we could've gotten down the street. Seriously - why bother providing the fridge if we can't actually use it for our stuff? I'm just sayin'. Makes no sense. Instead of us being turned-on by a fully-stocked fridge, we were disappointed there wasn't any room for our stuff. Perhaps only fill it halfway? I dunno. OK... so we used the pool in this hotel. Definitely went to TAO and spent over 5 hours partying throughout the day there. WOW - the pricey cabanas huh? Sheesh! Yeah, we got one anyway. You were lucky we were drunk. But I guess it's what you've bet the cabanas on aye? Smarties. Great vibe. Great hosts. Great feeling of security from your people - they were NOT overbearing and allowed us to enjoy ourselves instead of 'glaring' over our good time like most bouncers do. Refreshing. We actually enjoyed being in the busy crowd partying with all the shimmery neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: rohel m
Reviews.Content: Palazzo has one of the best rooms and largest rooms on the Vegas strip and also spectacular views of the strip from the room. However, their customer service is so poor and with so many new choices on the strip, that one is inclined to take their business elsewhere next time. I stayed in the Prestige Club Floor at the Palazzo for two nights on a trip with my father who had never been to Vegas. In order for my father to have the opulent vegas experience, I had booked at the Palazzo which is the only hotel on the strip that has a Club Floor and a Club lounge for guests. My father uses a medical device that needs a power converter. We have one at home but I wanted to see if the hotel could provide a power converter so we didn't need to carry ours in our luggage. I had specifically emailed the Club Floor manager to see if they can provide me with one otherwise I would bring my own. I was assured via email that the hotel would be able to provide one. Once I showed up to the hotel, I was informed that the Manager misspoke and the entire hotel did not have a power converter. The next two days, instead of enjoying vegas, I had to run around to hardware stores and medical stores trying to locate the power converter. Even after repeated complaints that reached all the way to the General Manager of the hotel, I was not offered even a hotel car to take me to the medical supply store so I could purchase the device. I have stayed in many luxury hotels in Vegas and around the world but never have I experienced such blatant disregard for the medical needs of a hotel guest who was promised something in writing and then left to fend for himself when the hotel could not deliver. After paying $350 a night for a Prestige Club room, it was shocking to receive such terrible service right down from the concierge desk, the Prestige Club Management, facilities manager and all the way up to the General Manager in charge. It seemed poor customer service was prevalent in this hotel in all levels. Even though the hotel had many great restaurants and a nice casino, we made it a point that all 6 meals we had in vegas and all the gambling we did were in MGM, Wynn and Harrah's owned properties. Sheldon Adelson, you just lost a valuable customer in the midst of an economic recession.

Reviews.Title: “you CANNOT go wrong staying here!”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is gild and glamour and gasp! Luxury and extravagance on a large scale. And the Palazzo is everything – and more – that a first-time Las Vegas experience should be. Without question, our suite was one of the most spacious hotel suites I have ever stayed in, so luxuriously decorated it is an experience by itself. Three LCD tv’s: in the sunken living room, the bedroom area, and the bathroom. Fully equipped mini-office. Jaw-dropping view: the glitter and lights of the Strip at night, a quiet sunset against mountains tinged with dusk. Location? Right on the Strip, with all other hotels, casinos and attractions a short walk away. But if you are into designer brand shops, famous-chef restaurants, or just vicariously soaking in the lifestyle of the impossibly rich, then you need not even leave the hotel shops and mall. Everything meant to be seen is right there. And the service was exceptional. From the competent and highly efficient Guest Relations staff, to the Concierge, to housekeeping: if it can be provided, they will find a way to meet your needs and requests. A final useful service: right at hotel entrance is the “Bags To Go” service; your luggage are checked in for your next domestic flight right at the hotel for a nominal fee. So the comfort and convenience of checking in your bags at the hotel, and just ride the shuttle or cab to the airport. No fuss, no struggle with luggage weigh-in and check-in. Regardless of your needs, expectations or requirements: you CANNOT go wrong with the Palazzo. They were built TO PLEASE. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxury resort but house keeping is so so”
Reviews.Author: wt88
Reviews.Content: This is a very luxury resort. Just like the website describe, all suites with bedroom and living room area. The suite has a very big marble bathroom. The room was very luxurious, and the mini bar is fully stocked. But the mini bar is monitor by weight sensor. If you remove an item just to see what it is, you will get charged. You can’t put any personal items in the mini bar. With all the luxury décor, the house keeping is not up to par for a 5 start resort. In our room behind the curtain, there was a children flip flop, the top of the marble ledge between the living room and the bedroom is sticky. It felt like someone spill drinks and didn’t clean it up. In the bathroom, there was a piece of plastic wrapper on the floor, and there was a piece of gum on the marble ledge of the bathtub. We found the gum when we sat on it, how disgusting. We stayed at many hotels from 1 star to 5 star, but never been to one with gum on the tub. The water pressure was weak for the shower, too. The pool deck was very large and beautifully landscaped. The pools for the Palazzo and the Venetian are connected. You can walk to the pools at both hotels on the pool deck. There is a security guard at the elevator banks and you have to show your room card in order to enter the elevator banks. But you don’t need to slide the card to activate the elevator. The Palazzo is connected to the Venetian by the Grand Canal shops.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo - Dirty place and they don't care”
Reviews.Author: wmrrock
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4 days at the Palazzo. We switched rooms 3 times within the first 24 hours. 1st room - Shower was busted and water dribbled out of the shower head. The a/c did not work properly and the door to the room did not close properly. Front desk moved us to room #2. We were in this room for 4 hours. We found grapes smushed into the carpeting and protein stains on the couch cushions. We immediately asked for a "CLEAN" room. Room #3 - I guess they think that a bigger room is better. It was clean, although light bulbs in the ceiling were out and the aerator in the bathroom sink was missing causing water to go everywhere. Shower pressure sucks. In room 3 we found some jewelry from the previous guest. The person at the front desk was surprised when I brought it down. I told him that this was the 3rd room where we found something and that housekeeping is doing a terrible job. For my troubles, the comped me $50. We were on the 48th floor and yet ever morning our room smelled from bacon. It was almost as if there was a vent from the kitchen directly to our room. The casino floor and pool were also very dirty. When I mentioned these things to the staff I received various responses from "we know" to "its a big hotel and we have had many layoffs and we are doing our best". The best response or the worst response - depending on your point of view was " Most of our guests are coming from Long Island or New Jersey and they don't really notice a little dirt here or there" Positives - Canyon Ranch Spa - very clean because it is a separate entity within the hotel. The staff will tell you that they get complaints daily about how dirty the hotel is. The Dueling Piano Bar off the casino floor. Although it is also very dirty and smokey, the place rocks. Jersey Boys - A Must see. There are better places to go Vegas where you will be treated better. Stay away from the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vegas stay!”
Reviews.Author: jbs5665
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for a convention - but the Palazzo makes you feel like you're their personal guest. Great rooms, superb in suite dining and luxurious suites. Everyone makes you feel welcome - unlike some other Vegas hotels where you feel like you're intruding. The Palazzo is definitely a place to go back to - time after time! Definitely check out the Azure pool - so fun! Fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and spacious, but attitude issues”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCanuck77
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel overall. It seems, however, in Vegas there are many. The rooms are very large and the staff were mostly pretty pleasant and professional. My main complaint is a couple of incidents where I felt I wasn't treated with the courtesy I expect at a top end hotel. The first time was when I was walking back to the elevator that goes up to the guest suites. The security guard shouted at me as I walked by him. "SIR, SHOW ME YOUR ROOM CARD!" Wow, it felt like I was a criminal or something. So I showed it to him and apologized, saying that they didn't check it last time. I then asked him, out of pure curiosity and with no attitude whatsoever, why they seem so strict about it sometimes and other times people just walk right through to the elevator. To me it seems this system doesn't really provide much security, but inconveniences guests. His response was very confrontational saying "you can try to get past me... you can try." I know he's a security guard and not a guest relations guy, but the hotel should realize that at 4am he is the face of the hotel and should be provided some soft skills training. On another occasion I called the front desk for a late checkout request and wakeup call and the gentleman on the phone was very short with me, so much so that I would call it unprofessional. Again, not what I expect when I go "5 star." The casino dealers aren't nearly as friendly as many of the other casinos we played in. When you tip them, they hardly acknowledge it, and they don't smile a lot. To be fair, some were great, but overall it seemed like they are jaded union workers or something. The pool area was very nice. The suites are big and nice. We tipped at check in and got upgraded to a strip view and given comped phantom tickets (cool show, but glad i didn't pay). I will probably try another hotel next time. The Venetian seemed to have a bit more character and classic 5 star feel. There are so many choices, I don't see why I'd stick with Palazzo, unless I got a really great deal next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: alilace
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing! There service was great, there is a casino below, night club, and great restaurant for breakfast. You also get free range over the Ventian's pool, which were perfect during the 100 degree weather. TAO is one of the best spots to beat the heat and its a night club too. The rooms were huge and perfect for partying or lounging before going out. You can't beat this place for the price and the Wynn has an amazing night club right nextdoor. I will stay there again the next time I visit Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: steveb1953
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palazzo for three nights to celebrate our anniversery. We arrived via shuttle from the airport; the doorman cheerfully opened the door and with a big smile said "Welcome to Palazzo." Check in was a breeze, we waited for maybe 1 minute. Our check-in clerk was very efficient and was careful to explain the policies of the hotel. Our room clean and well maitained. We had plenty of storage and more than enough TV's--all big screen HD. My wife and I were impressed with the security; we had to show our room keys to get to the elevators. On more than one occasion we noticed a group of loud young men who had partied much too hard (drunk) and causing abit of a disturbance; the hotel/casino security personel quickly and efficiently asked these young men to take their party somewhere else and most of the other patrons didn't even notice. The casino had a "smoke free" corridor. The details of the artwork on the walls, the floral arrangements showed a leval of care I don't see too often. The glass doors at the main entrance were always clean. The tile floor was always polished. The carpet in the casino was always clean and showed no wear. All in all, the Palazzo was a joy to stay at. I would heartily recommend it to anyone. The Palazzo is not the least expensive place on the strip, but it is not the most expensive either. I considered the money we spent to have been well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THETRAVELER524
Reviews.Content: Although we go to Las Vegas twice a year - it was thru Trip Advisor reviews that I got the tip. The review said to "tip" the front desk when you check in, and they will be very helpful. There were 2 things I am always concerned about. High, On Strip and near an elevator. When we checked in, my husband did what the review said - he handed the front desk person our credit card, and underneath was a $20 bill. He asked for as high as she could get us - and near the elevator. Sure enough, she said she would be glad to - and put us on the 37th floor, on the strip, and right around the corner from the elevator. The view was very beautiful and romantic. Made our triip even better. Good tip from Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, pools just down the elevator, small/tight casino, service excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ksully1103
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo was a BEAUTIFUL hotel-our rooms were gorgeous, the staff was extremely pleasant and professional. We ordered room service a couple times and it took a while to get there and was expensive but definitely worth the wait! Only con about that was there was nothing open late that was could find for a late night snack except a store for chips. One thing to note-the pool did not get sun until at least 1pm so don't worry about rushing to get down there to grab a seat. The Venetian pools had sun all day so if you are a sun person go over there, it's a short walk-we Loce laying out but waited until 1 because it was hot enough then! The palazzo was a great location and even though the casino kind of stunk, sun not out until 1 I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy E
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Palazzo. We usually stay at the Venetian and was recommended by the Venetian staff to stay at the Palazzo. The hotel did not disappoint. The Palazzo is a beautiful stunning hotel. The staff there really knows how to treat their guests and from the easy breezy check-in, to the exceptional staff at Canyon Ranch, our time there was one of the most relaxing vacations we ever experienced. The suites are perfect for relaxing after a day spent exploring the Vegas Strip. We saw Jersey Boys and the performance was exceptional. We always dine at Table 10, and time and time again, the food and staff there is exceptional. I would highly recommend staying at the Palazzo on your next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: canadagal
Reviews.Content: This is my third time at the Palazzo and the best stay so far. I was offered a discounted stay on their Concierge Level called Prestige and decided to try that for the first time. Arrived at the hotel about 11:00 a.m. and went straight up to the 23rd floor for check-in. Not to my surprise I was told my room was not yet ready so I decided to check my emails and get some work done in their lounge while sipping on the complimentary champagne. I hadn't finished that glass of bubbly before I received a call that my room was ready. The room was just as I remembered it and was no different on the Prestige Level although they did give me a strip view which was nice. The room was clean and serviced well each day by housekeeping. Service in the lounge was excellent with the waitress checking on your drinks and refilling as soon as she sees you are getting near the bottom and they do pour a stiff Manhattan. No watered down drinks here and no limit that I could see. The food offerings were adequate, fresh and palatable but nothing extravagent and certainly nothing on par to the Club Level at the Ritz Carlton. They also have 4 computers and printer in their business centre located off the lounge that is also complimentary. All in all, I had a wonderful stay and would not hesitate to recommend the Palazzo to others. I would only stay on the Prestige Level again if I could snag another discounted rate( under $250.00) and /or my husband accompanied me as it certainly is not worth the $450.00 plus price tag they were selling it at on their website during my stay for a solo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avalon1025
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Belagio, Wynn and Aria and this was my first stay at Palazzo. I was very impressed with the hotel, staff and amenities. I would have to say this hotel is in the top two or three of the hotels I would frequent now in Las Vegas. Great rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Loved everything about it.”
Reviews.Author: shoegall199
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 8 friends for a hen party, we had adjoining rooms as requested which was fab as we kept the doors open and it was like we had a super big suite. The rooms were very large and modern and very clean. There is nothing I could fault with this hotel, the rooms the service and the pool areas. Would most certainly go back and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great experiece @ Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: j v
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed @ Palazzo Friday night and we loved it. The room is huge, 3 tv's and a great bed. Very quiet, although the bed had a slight squeek ;). We had a golf course view which was not the strip, but still very nice. We ate at the sushi place (can't remember the name). It was good, but not great. Small portions, large price! We spent a good portion of the day at Canyon Ranch & the Palazzo pools. Loved both! Will definately return to Palazzo. We got a $239 rate thru aa.com which was half of all the other rates we were quoted for Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sandra W
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Palazzo was everything plus that we could have imagined. The suite was clean, comfortable and the furnishings were beautiful and in excellent condition. The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever experienced in our hotel stays. We have traveled in the States as well as Europe and this was the most comfortable facility we have experienced. The staff was efficient and friendly. A beautiful experience in an exciting city!!

Reviews.Title: “Feel Like A High Roller”
Reviews.Author: darkstar89
Reviews.Content: The suite rooms are very spacious, even with two queen beds the room seems it goes on forever. The interior is chic and the flat screens in both rooms makes you feel you are getting special treatment. We did have a problem at check in, the room we were assigned to still didn't smelled like smoke so we were given another room. We still had some issues waiting for the second room to be cleared out as there was some clothes left in it, the safe was locked and some of the fixtures were still need of a little repair. We were compensated for the inconvenience as one of the hotel managers knocked a little of the last night of stay. The pool experience is great as the Palazzo shares all the pools with the Venetian, so there are 11 pools that you can go into as well as the premium pools. The casino floor as well as the eateries in the Venetian are easily accessible-don't forget the main reason they want you there is to get you to gamble and hopefully lose your money.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: negayle2011
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed with the rooms. If you need to have a view, ask.

Reviews.Title: “A near palace”
Reviews.Author: top-trippers
Reviews.Content: Check-in and wait for concierge services could be slow due to demand. As with most of the larger hotels in Vegas, there is a long walk from reception through the casino, to bedrooms. These were minor downsides in what was a fantastic 4 night stay. We didn’t bother upgrading from the standard luxury suite (more than adequate for the time that we intended to spend in it) but we did ask for a quiet room on a higher floor (we got the 45th). It was large, modern, well-maintained and the bathroom had lots of nice toiletries. Our only gripe is that we would have liked coffee making equipment especially as room service could be a little slow. Loads of choice for breakfast in the Grand Luxe. We had lunch in the Dal Toro, Riva and Canyon Ranch Grill. Food quality in all the hotel restaurants was good but service was a bit mixed (for example on two occasions we had trouble charging meals to our room account until we involved the restaurant manager ). We were disappointed that there was no water in the Grand Canal due to maintenance work - unfortunate timing. Although we were really happy with the hotel. next time we would probably stay at the Bellagio as this is more central and we spent most of our time around that location. We had dinner one night at the Paris Eiffel Tower restaurant -good food and service and some tables have fabulous views overlooking the Bellagio fountains (we booked well in advance). We really enjoyed our dinner at Bellagio’s Le Cirque - fantastic food and service and intimate ambience. But our clear favourite was Joel Robuchon - outstanding even by Michelin star standards. We took two trips to the Grand Canyon with Maverick which offered very different experiences so I would definitely recommend doing both if you have the time and the money. I we had to choose between the two our favourite was the Indian Territory tour to the West Rim - not just because we were allocated front seats but also because Matt (our pilot) couldn’t have done more to try and make this a really personal and memorable experience. A good mix of low flying, Canyon landing and time to Skywalk. On the Canyon Dream tour, the jet journey to the South Rim didn’t offer any spectacular views. The heli part of the tour was shorter than at the West Rim but more dramatic. Maverick tell you that they have the best helicopters and that you will have good views in the back seats as these are raised so you can see over the top of the people in front. This is not true. The pilot allocates specific seats based on weight and the lightest couple will go in the front. We had fantastic views from the front seats; you are OK in the back if you have a window seat; but on our second trip I had a middle seat in the back and could not see over the tall gentleman sitting in front of me. This was also part of the reason that we were disappointed with the personal video of the trip which we bought – the internal camera was focused on one side of the helicopter (I didn’t feature at all and there were only a couple of glimpses of my husband). The food could be better – take some water and extra snacks if you are fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great food and great location on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: gsoccer035
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Palazzo a few times. The last time was in August 2011. We were amazed at the room the first time we stayed in Vegas. The Palazzo has impressed us each time since the first stay. The restaurants are great too. Overall the Palazzo is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian^2”
Reviews.Author: Demoknite
Reviews.Content: This is what the Venetian used to be or wants to be. I have stayed at the Venetian, and the room was absolutely identical to the Venetian, except it was more modern, clean, and not as well worn as its sister property. I stayed during the middle of the week which meant the halls were super quiet and no doors slamming at all hours of the night. The super popular Grand Luxe Cafe is also on the Palazzo side which means no or very short lines. There are trendy shops and eateries on the mezzanine. The fact that this property is not as advertised or well known as the Venetian means you get the same thing but less crowded and most of the time at a cheaper price. The gaming is a bit boring, but you can go to any property you want on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: harry c
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights for business and pleasure. We did extensive research and the Palazzo was an excellent value, especially for an all-suite resort. The staff was very friendly; we enjoyed the workout area, the pool, and the spacious room. The central location made it easy to visit City Center and enjoy three Cirque shows. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf”
Reviews.Author: Chris10573
Reviews.Content: I previously booked a 4 night stay at The Palazzo Resort. I could have stayed at any MGM property for free for being comped but this was a last minute decision to join some friends whom were staying at the palazzo. So I paid 149.00 per night plus tax for four nights. At check in they offered me an upgrade for a total of 112.00 more per night which includes all taxes. Was I glad I took it. OUr room was on the 47 th floor, had double door entry with bathroom in the foyer when you walk in. A huge dining room and living room with floor to ceiling windows. with comfortable seating area, another huge bedroom with king size bed attached to an enormous bathroom with big jacuzzi in the middle with shower with body jets, the bathroom was the size of my living room back home, the bath room also had its own flat screen tv. From the bathroom you walk into the next room, which was your own mini gym, it had your own elliptical machine in it and that comes back out to the front entrance. big walk in closet space, very clean and well worth the total nightly price of 269.00 per night with all taxes included. the view was amazing , every night we could see the volcano at the mirage and the TI Pirate show. The Square footage for the suite was 1500. I think that Palazzo does the right thing in offering the upgrade at a great price. I was happy, and they made some extra money. Win, Win situation. I have to say that the Palazzo is top notch in everything they do. We ate in sushi samba which was very good and not over priced, I will definitely return to the palazzo, they treated me right. Isn't that what its all about?

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms and excellent view-”
Reviews.Author: Alby F
Reviews.Content: The suites and the ammenities were very nice. Also, the view was fantastic too, my room was facing the strip right in front of the Treasure Island hotel and to the right, the Wynn hotel. What I like the most about this hotel is the accessibility to anything you may need. Restaurants, shops, night clubs, etc. Additionally, it is located almost in front of the Fashion show Mall. Just make sure to get the "Prestige Luxury Suite", the rooms are excellent and they come equipped with everything you need, internet, bar, printer, separate shower and tub.

Reviews.Title: “My Old Hotel of Choice”
Reviews.Author: Frank L
Reviews.Content: I'm going to give the Palazzo a solid 5 and here's why: 3 TVs! and one of them is in the bathroom! Comfortable beds! Super quiet! And now for the cons: The Fiancee expects more from the toiletries. Come on, Vdara has Aveda. Palazzo is like one of the bougie hotel (along with Belaggio, Wynn, Encore, Aria, Cosmo, Mandarin Oriental, and Venetian). It was New Years, so service was slow. We order a humidifier everytime we stay in Vegas....After all, Vegas is no fun with a bloody nose (just trust me on this). It took about a half-hour to get the humidifier. But, it was New Years, they were probably totally swamped. Other than that, Palazzo is great. And so was your Monopoly Board Walk Slot game that paid out $1000 at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: sloan3271
Reviews.Content: The room was SO spacious...I feel like I could have moved in forever!!!! Loved the easy access to the pool and spa area. I would definately recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “You Never Have To Leave”
Reviews.Author: topcat102290
Reviews.Content: Except to view the fountain at the Bellagio there is no reason to leave the Palazzo/Venetian. We spent New Years Eve there and the fireworks were literally outside our window.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Danielle R
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous Hotel! Stayed 2 nights last November and had a wonderful experience. I have stayed in numerous other hotels in Vegas and this one is the best yet! Ask for a high room with a view....amazing!

Reviews.Title: “5 star poker stay”
Reviews.Author: kingofpoker
Reviews.Content: the room was beautiful. 3 flat screen tvs, sunken living room, nice view of the strip. only downsides, no fridge, had to call for housekeeping. whole property is gorgeous. for poker players like me, connects to venetian where there is always action. next door to wynn with well reviewed poker room, cheap tournaments across the street at TI. full of high end restaurants and nightclubs. i thought phantom was boring, but jersey boys now playing also.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: davidHullUk
Reviews.Content: stayed 7 nights at the palazzo from 22nd of august the room was lovely and large loved the split level as we had an 8yr old i wouldnt take any notice of the bad reviews we had no problems the room was cleaned every day b 4 12 front desk staff plesant we rang housekeeping for extra blankets and got them the pools are all of good size and yes some are in the shade but in the heat we had we were glad the shops are wonderful and you can walk through to the venetian st marks square has lots of restaurants the postrio was fantastic went twice we stayed on the prestige level it was worth the extra money we had b/fast you can go all day for soft drinks tea/coffee and then 5 till 9 for cocktails and snacks we would stay at this hotel again as we had a wonderful time

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo trip”
Reviews.Author: Hokiefury
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Venetian and Palazzo numerous times for business and pleasure. We now always use the Prestige Lounge which is their club level service. You get a very nice quick private check in, decent quiet breakfast and great cocktail reception in the evening. I am often doing business and the Prestige Lounge is a nice place for my wife to retreat to during the day when she can tear herself away from the slots. Overall a very nice hotel with great restaurants and a fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “super for convention and family enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Palazzo for 3 nights on a business trip and I also brought my family. The rooms we had were so spacious. They were suite-like and had a split bedroom/sitting room area. The rooms were very clean and the furniture was plush. My room was on the 45th floor facing the strip and we were able to enjoy the free Treasure Island show all night long. My 2 year old loved the show too since the windows go all the way down to the floor and he was able to see outside without endangering himself and without my having to worry. My parents were on the 10th floor and their room was just as nice, if not nicer. So luxurious. And the bathrooms were just awesome. I wanted to move in. The tub was perfect for my baby and the counter tops were high enough to keep things safe from the baby. The service was prompt when it came to room service, housecleaning service and extra needs. The casino was clean and smelled nice - no cigarrette smells anywhere. Best restaurants at every turn. Never needed to leave the hotel, it had everything and more. Oh, the convention service was top notch too!

Reviews.Title: “Best In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MsOrewa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Las Vegas and staying at The Palazzo. After a week in Vegas and exploring the endless hotels we decided that we had chosen the best one. It was outstanding in every way. It is adjoined to The Venetian , which is city in itself. The central location was also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suny5
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the Palazzo for 4 nights - hotel was excellent. We had a standard room which was spacious and more akin to a suite with split levels for the bed and sitting area. Very clean, nicely decorated and bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was large and luxurious. Enjoyed the swimming pool - had food and drinks at the main pool. Food was nice, a bit on the expensive side but just what you expect poolside, nice cocktails, buckets of beer etc. Enjoyed the casino which was a bit more compact and less busy than the Venetian. Lots of shops and restaurants in the attached mall and into the Venetian - Walmart was very convenient for snacks and beverages. Overall had a lovely stay and despite my reluctance to stay in a casino hotel the Palazzo won me over.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: docboy711
Reviews.Content: Best hotel on strip! Got early check in upgraded! VIP passes from the concierge, get a rental car and use free parking at hotels on strip! Be "friendly" to front desk to try to get an upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GLT_HK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Palazzo for a few nights. Location was very convenient for shopping and the room was very spacious. Range of restaurants and facilities in the hotel and connecting Venetian more or less met all our needs. Very high overall standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Luxury Type Traveler!!!”
Reviews.Author: archie6913
Reviews.Content: I love the Wynn and the Encore but the Palazzo is just as nice. The service was fantastic and the location is great. I love gambling at the Palazzo as the pit bosses were very nice and courteous. The standard rooms are amazing compared to any other hotel in Las Vegas. They are all beautiful suites!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - one of the better ones on the strip”
Reviews.Author: leonarse
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a very nice all-suite hotel on the strip. The lobby is large and beautiful. It is toward the center of the strip, so it made it easier to get around (close to places we wanted to go). Check-in and check-out was smooth and efficient. The room is large (2 room suite - Bedroom & living room) - very good if you entertain guests while there. The king-sized bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very large and clean. One disappointment was the refrigerator - there was one in there, but there was no room to store any items - it is full with drinks/snacks from the hotel - watch out, since they are on a weight sensor your room will be charged if moved! The restaurants that we went to at the Palazzo (LAVO and Lagasse's Stadium) were ok - not great - there are better restaurants at the Venetian and on the strip. The Grand Lux Cafe is located in the casino, and it has good food and a reasonably priced breakfast buffet. A plus is that Wal-greens is connected to the hotel, so you can go there to pick up beverages, snacks, etc. The gym (in the Canyon Ranch Spa) is very nice and is included if you pay the "resort fee". The concierge was not very helpful for show tickets but there is a discounted ticket venue nearby on the strip. He was helpful when I needed to print out boarding passes and mail post cards. Overall, The Palazzo is a great hotel. Join the Grazie Club to get room deals/discounts.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Alisha H
Reviews.Content: I was invited to stay at the Palazzo. When I booked the trip, they were very nice. The hotel suite was amazing, bigger than my apartment. They even had 3 flat screen tv's. It was a really good suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great position on the strip casino nice and bright”
Reviews.Author: peteabh
Reviews.Content: Better than it's sister hotel, the Venetian - view of strip superb, rooms large and contain all you need for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “The great suite sets it apart”
Reviews.Author: ljdf
Reviews.Content: Lots of things done right, fast check in, fast elevators, clean casino, great selection of restaurants on site, great location near the center of the strip, nice staff, efficient housekeeping. I would give a big thumbs up to the current in house show, Jersey Boys, a fabulous production. The real difference between this hotel and others is the room. Luxury equal to a Ritz Carelton but with a very spacious room. The intelligent layout makes it feel even bigger. Could stay a long time and not get the 'hotel room blues'. I have stayed in many Vegas hotels. I will keep coming back to this one. Yes it is more expensive but IMO well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: alicia b
Reviews.Content: Visited the Palazzo over Labor Day and it was beyond gorgeous. The room was clean and felt very elegant. The hotel itself is very big and has lots of shops. I would give it 5-stars, but two things were a little disappointing. One is that for the price we pay, we didn't even have a microwave or a coffee pot in the room. The next thing is that they get you with a "resort" fee, which I have no idea what it covers. Other than that, the room itself was very nice. We stayed there two nights after staying one night elsewhere. My family and I would love to stay there if we ever take another trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: skimmilk09
Reviews.Content: We were at the Palazzo in July for just a couple of days, it was BEAUTIFUL. The resort is VERY clean and nice, but SUPER expensive once you get there. We were there with our 2 boys and I'm not sure what I expected, but it was not kid friendly. Especially the pool, we thought they could go there to have fun not really. We weren't allowed to bring dive toys in, we weren't allowed to make a lot of noise, all in all, we weren't allowed to do much but swim. We got a great deal on Hotels.com, but it was worth it for me to stay in a nice hotel. Overall, I will stay there again, but probably won't take my kids with us next time.

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Mardi777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Palazzo and the suites are super nice, big and very nice. we have space every where in the suite. service was really good. the installations offer high end services and places to enjoy. I had been in different hotels in Las Vegas but so far, I would recommend No1 the palazzo, the hotel is new and it doesnt smell like others in the boulevard. Didnt have the opportunity to go to the pool just because ummm we pass on. to many people going there sounds like not good idea for us. the bathroom was pretty good for us. Best.

Reviews.Title: “Still a beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: creighc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the past, but not for 2-3 years. Last time I stayed I thought there were some service issues i.e maids, room service, cleanliness. However, those seem to have been fixed and my stay was flawless. The rooms are large and beautifully decorated. The pool areas are nice and include the larger Venetian pools. All of the restaurants are high quality. Sushi Samba is one of my favs. I found staff to be friendly and helpful. I still have a personal preference for Encore (Wynn), but you really can't go wrong staying at the Palazzo/Venetian properties.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: superjerryw
Reviews.Content: This is a truly fabulous hotel that I feel is better than the other high end hotels in Vegas. There are no regular rooms in the Palazzo. The minimum accommodations are all two room suites. You have a bedroom area and a sunken living room each of which has its own big screen TV. The bathroom is huge with two sinks and a separate stall shower. For really lazy people you even have a remote control to operate the drapes. The pool area is very nice and there is a passage that connects to the pool area of the Venetian hotel next door which you can use as well. Since this is a luxury hotel most things are rather pricey. There is no food court and there is no buffet. If you can afford it, this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS SUITES & RESTAURANTS WITH A 5 STAR POOL”
Reviews.Author: rberger669
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights from Sept. 5th (Labor Day) through Sept. 8th. Check in before noon was a breeze. 31st Floor with a beautifully appointed suite containing all the amenities. Room was cleaned before 11:00 am each day. The smaller casino was a welcomed attraction compared to the much larger, crowded casinos. Wonderful restaurants in Palazzo and Venetian cornered by The Wynn and Encore. Would definitely return. Housekeeping and Check-In staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Leslie0511
Reviews.Content: The best Hotel stay I've ever had. My room was flawless. Loved the mini bar and the size of the bathroom. It was easy to get around. Not too big like some Vegas hotel where you get lost and there are 10 different elevators. The restaurants were top notch. Will definately return Pool area was very fun. We didn't pay for the exclusive pool area because the music was so loud you could enjoy it from any of the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaneforgov
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palazzo with my wife and 2 children (22 and 20 yrs. old) to celebrate my daughter’s college graduation. The rooms are a cut above many hotels I’ve stayed at in Vegas and the hotel staff did a nice job of accommodating our needs. Since we flew from the east coast like a lot of other travelers check in was very busy at 11AM/12 noon. The staff took people waiting in line to another check-in location and expedited the process. While one of our rooms wasn’t immediately ready we were able to check into the other room and enjoy the hotel while we waited. Like most hotels in Vegas the restaurants are overpriced so it’s nice that the adjoining Venetian offers a food-court type option for quick meals. The food is very good and the service throughout the hotel was excellent. The one drawback we found at the Palazzo is the distance to the Venetian and many of its facilities. It was about a 1 mile walk from our room to the main desk at the Venetian. Like everything in Vegas it’s very spread out. Overall we had a great stay. The hotel is elegant, the service very good, the pool was crowded but comfortable and location on the strip is perfect. I hope we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property! Even Better Location!”
Reviews.Author: taralynn86
Reviews.Content: We had another great stay at the Palazzo! Check in was fast and efficient. The rooms are huge. The bathrooms are spacious and elegant. The only thing the hotel lacks is the service. I would say it’s more four stars than five stars. My biggest complaint is that for the price you pay they don’t even have turn down service. However you can’t beat the location. You could easily spend the weekend here and never step foot outside. The pool was fabulous. The Palazzo has great shopping, bars, restaurants, and entertainment. If you are looking for a more upscale restaurant I highly recommend LAVO. If you are going more casual you can’t go wrong with the Grand Luxe café! I don’t understand why people complain about the smell. As soon as you step foot in the lobby you get a whiff of the great fragrance, but as soon as you leave the reception area you don’t smell it anymore.

Reviews.Title: “great stat at The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: austintxgirl04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palazoo Sept 8-10, 2011. We took advantage of the Prestige option and it was worth every penny. The complimentary breakfast and evening happy hour were fabulous. The customer service could not have been better either. We had a great stay and even came out winners at the Casino! We've stayed at other hotels on the strip but we'll be hard-pressed not to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Learning the Royal Ambassador ropes”
Reviews.Author: tivogirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Palazzo a few times in the last two or years and have always had a pleasant experience. He is a Royal Ambassador with Intercontinental, so when we heard a few months ago that Palazzo was joining the alliance, we were excited to see how a Vegas resort would merge those benefits into their service. We used a free night certificate and booked a weekend trip. It was apparent they were still learning the Royal Ambassador ropes, but everything was handled fine in the end. When we attempted to turn in the certificate, they were a bit confused about what it was. Apparently the computer system simply lists those nights as comped. (We probably could have kept the cert to use another time, but did not.) We had lounge access with our auto-upgraded room, but there was also a separate RA lounge in the lobby with private check-in. The RA lounge was usually empty, with plenty of seating, great service (24-hour butler to mix drinks), finger foods (sandwiches, nuts, sliced cheeses), water and tea available at all times. The Prestige lounge on the 23rd floor, on the other hand, was crowded and noisy. It's HUGE and provided the more common lounge services like breakfast (with hot foods), happy hour and various light snacks at different times of the day. Our suite was essentially the same room we've had in the past (both at Palazzo and Venetian), though we had lounge access and were quite close to the elevator. Lovely view of the strip (could watch the pirate show at TI, though not hear it) and the pool area from the 26th floor. It seems they are still learning the RA ropes, but we won't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zee714
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a beautiful hotel which connects with The Venetian Hotel. The accomodations are luxurious and comfortable. The staff and service is very good. The Palazzo is located on the main strip and is convenient to all the sight seeing in Las Vegas. The Palazzo has a variety of restaurants for whatever mood you are in - from high prized fancy celebrity chef run restaurants to casual fare. The designer shops are beautiful and expensive. Overall I would give the Palazzo a very good rating for location and accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, no complaints. We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: Hotel met any needs we requested. I would rate it a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Suite Rooms and Hotel Complex Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Huglum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late Aug and was impressed by a number of things with the hotel including the Suites and room amenities. The hotel is good value for money and has an excellent choice of Restaurants, Bars and clubs across the joint complex of the Venetian & Palazzo. The Hotel was very, very busy at the time of my stay and at times the level and standard of service were not what they should be such as cleaning materials and equipment being left in room etc.; The Hotel pool was also closed one day of our stay with a sign saying no lifeguard available which was inconvenient due to it being 40c plus at the time. Apart for some minor aspects I was overall impressed with the hotel and the vast amount of facilities within the resort complex. I would stay here again as a good location with excellent rooms and superb facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: BruceM1979
Reviews.Content: Visited Palazzo resort for 2 weeks on our annual vacation and although the Hotel is nice and well presented ,I felt that it was serously over priced. This is the 4th time I have been in Vegas and have stayed in 'cheaper' hotels in my previous stays but to be honest the rooms in these places were equally as good. I am in no way saying that the palazzo is a bad hotel but I expected it to be better for the price. Next time we go back unless the Palazzo drops there rates , I will be looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Haven!!!”
Reviews.Author: AngiePang
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this magnificent hotel as part of my daughter's 21st birthday trip to the USA from South Australia and we LOVED it!!! The suite was amazing, the Strip view was breathtaking, the service was impeccable... what's not to like? Everything was perfect and everyone was so accommodating. The standard of the food throughout the hotel was wonderful. It was so nice to come back to our suite after the craziness and buzz of Las Vegas.... Thank God we chose the Palazzo!! We highly recommend staying there and when we return to Vegas, we won't hesitate booking The Palazzo again. Can't wait!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Strip, NICE suites”
Reviews.Author: Danventure
Reviews.Content: I booked a room via Hotwire.com for $129/night after selecting the categories "5-star" and "North Strip", and seeing that 95% of reviewers recommended the hotel. Of course, with Hotwire you save money by choosing what you want in a hotel and not knowing the hotel name until you book it, but this was a gamble that ended up paying off. The Palazzo is an elegant hotel located right in the nice part of the Strip next to the Venetian and across from the Wynn. Check in did not take long at all, and we were informed that we could upgrade to a higher floor in the "Prestige level" for an extra $100/night. This includes the resort fee and breakfast until 10AM each morning and cocktails/beer later in the day with some snacks. After seeing the crappy view from the original 8th floor room we got for $129, we decided to upgrade to the Prestige level and got a nice room on the 26th floor with view of the pools below and Treasure Island fireworks show at night. The Palazzo suites are really NICE! Huge rooms, sunken living room area where the TV and couches are (so watch out at night when you're stumbling around so you don't trip on the steps!) And to my amazement, it was really quiet at night! You can't hear the airplanes or noise from other rooms, though there is a little hall noise every now and then (like most hotels anywhere in the world). PROS: -Nice suites, quiet, get the Prestige level if you can. -Casino is fantastic, not too smoky. $10-15 table limits ensure you win more money (but bring enough bankroll to weather the downturns in luck!) -Excellent, friendly, helpful staff. CONS: -Food once again proved to be a disappointment for me in Vegas. Where the heck are the good restaurants??? The pizza was ok, but the penne rustica with shrimp i ordered from room service tasted worse than Olive Garden but cost $36! I have yet to enjoy a quality meal in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful all Suite Hotel, Lots of space to move around in.”
Reviews.Author: PeeDee2
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Palazzo. The Suite was spacious and beautiful (with the exception of the very dated velvet like sofa sectional and chair) the bed was really comfy. The Suite and the hotel was very clean. Everyone was very helpful and nice. I had just went to Vegas in July but was given an offer at the Palazzo that I couldn't refuse (comped room / show tickets / plus spending money). The hotel itself was beautiful we went around the property visited the shops and just had a ball. Ate at the Grand Lux cafe and the Bleu cheeseburger was among the best I have ever had. The slots were alright just a little tight but my husband did really well at the black jack tables. I go to Las Vegas every year and would definitely stay at the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just not for us.”
Reviews.Author: Busigrrl21
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the VM World 2011 conference at Sands Expo and decided to stay near the convention at Palazzo. We checked out TI, Mirage and Wynn...but just couldn't beat the proximity to Sands Expo. We arrived 2 days early and left a day later than the convention to have a little "us" time, wish it could have been longer. We checked in Aug 26, around 2pm. There was no line at the registration desk and the clerk was very friendly. We had requested a King Suite (just the basic) for 8 days and it was already available for check-in. Our room was 38-709, facing the Wynn Golf Course. You do have to have your room key ready each time you head to the elevators on the first and second floor for the guards, I loved that aspect! The elevators are very quick, even when your heading downstairs, our waits were pretty short each time we were at the elevator, which was fantastic. I really liked that the elevator bays are split by floor groupings, I think that really helps cut down on your wait time. Our room was in pretty good shape, you could tell it had seen better days. One thing we loved was the safe, it's a full sized drawer in the cabinet under the TV. We were able to put so much in the safe, we had multiple laptops, cell phones, tablet computers (can you tell he's a techie?), plus the normal money, jewelry and etc that you might put into the safe. I was even able to put my purse (flattened and pretty empty) in there with it full and the drawer still close. What a nice change from the tiny safes in the wall that are at most hotels. The bed was very comfortable, it comes with only 3 pillows, and frankly it's like there's no pillow at all. We ended up requesting 2 additional pillows from the housekeeper (on day 2, with a $5 tip) and she gave us an additional three pillows, and one randomly showed up later in our stay. We really appreciated her help with that (we tipped her $5 each day, she was exceptional). The sunken living room was a lifesaver since we were in town so long, it was great to stretch out on with the TV (and they have better TV here than we've had at any other hotel). The desk area was great, they had a power strip as well, which was so handy for all of our charging cords of the various devices. There was a scanner/copier in the room, we did use it once and it worked like a charm. I do wish it were a wireless printer, that would be the ultimate! There was a 5 piece dining set also in the sunken living room, it was a good spot for a pizza box and then when we were packing, but other than that, we didn't use it much. The ledge that divides the room ended up being a big catch all for our bags and purchases, perfect height and just handy. We enjoyed the larger closet, I just wish they'd give more hangers, especially when you're there for so long. I might have been able to request more, but I didn't really think about it. Luckily I had some additional hangers from the garment bag that worked out, as well as the hangers for the robes. We used the iron and ironing board quite a bit, both worked perfectly. They did offer laundry services (even same day), but we did not use. The bathroom was very nice, double sinks are always appreciated. The separate vanity area was nice, but the make-up mirror light did not work. The hair dryer was in the drawer and worked like a charm. No jets in the tub (bummer), so it was not used. The shower was a good size and leaking from the bottom of the door wasn't too bad, the bath rug was able to handle it. Throughout the room, we really liked the different lighting that was available. Plus there were a ton of mirrors, so there was always one handy. But the lighting choices were great, the lamp on the right side of the bed did not work after the first night, but it was never a problem. We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe quite a bit (well me, almost every day), and we enjoyed the Palazzo location more than the Venetian location. Palazzo was a bit quieter, while Venetian was very loud and it was difficult to hear all 4 people at the table. Great food all the time, this had to be one of the most consistent restaurants in Vegas I've ever been to. I'd highly recommend to anyone looking for a good breakfast spot. We also dined at Lavo for our anniversary dinner, I made reservations for 5pm on Thurs (not needed, but still made them on open table, handy!). Dinner was fantastic, hubby had a steak and I had cheese ravioli, we shared a meatball (to die for!). With two rounds of drinks from the bar (a mix of wine and top shelf), our bill came to $180. If we're in the area again, we'd go back. Gambling was fine, we broke even. The casino floor was busy in the evenings, but during the morning time, you wouldn't have any trouble getting in on the game you wanted to play. The shopping area of the Grand Canal Shoppes was lovely, a window-shoppers paradise! There is a food court with many economical choices, we dined there a few times. Once you figure your way around, you can get anywhere in a decent amount of time. Again, don't forget your room card at the elevators, even from the shopping level. I was also able to spend an afternoon at the Fashion Show Mall, it was so nice to be able to walk to! Just across two pedestrian bridges, it was so handy! They have great shopping there, it's usually not too crowded, so I highly recommend to anyone who might be looking for the shops that aren't available in their area. After all that being said, here was the downside for us. This is at the north-end of the Strip, a good location to many hotels, restaurants and clubs. Also, we were there over a weekend (which is rare for us). Due to these two things, this is not our favorite location. We're not there to party, we're there on vacation and relax. While our room was very relaxing, at night, the casino level is very busy and very fast. We just didn't feel comfortable here. Too many partiers, too many people carrying their booze back from Walgreens on the corner (though very handy, and reasonably priced!), just too much everything. Plus, we paid a very steep nightly charge, and that just bugged me. Our rate was $219 per night, and while I know a lot of people probably paid more that week, that was just too much for a 7 night stay. If I could move this hotel down to the south end of the Strip, it would be the ultimate and give TheHotel a run for its money. But since it's at the north end of the Strip, I doubt we'll ever stay here again (unless for another convention, it's proximity to Sands Expo was bar-none). Hope you found this helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WasatchTraveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, large spacious rooms, and awesome shows (Jersey Boys is a must see).

Reviews.Title: “We liked it but had some issues”
Reviews.Author: Gogosrr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely but not 5 star. The towels need to be updated. They were worn, especially at the pool. Still the room was spacious and very clean. I also thought the concierge could be more friendly and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience at the Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is an amazing hotel. It has everything you could think of. The restaurants are outstanding. The rooms are all suites, and very nicely done. The pools are beautiful, and there are so many to choose from. Service was excellent for everything. My wife visited Canyon Ranch Spa and had a very nice experience. Casino was smoke free, and very easy to find your way around. It is a beautiful resort hotel. The Palazzo is my favorite hotel to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo - had some problems”
Reviews.Author: getty2go
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palazzo multiple times but this time there were minor problems. Might be due to the economy. The room keys did not work and we had to wait until maintenance came to give us new keys. We originally had 3 keys and maintenance only brought us 2 keys. For the other key we were told we had to go to Guest Services, which is an inconvenience due to the long lines. I asked for a blanket since I slept on the pull out couch. The blanket was full of little holes from either moths or burns. It was very thin. Ordered breakfast and the potatoes were not fully cooked, called and requested another order which was brought to the room and the replacement order was not done either. Found out we could not charge room service or any other items to our room even when a credit card was left at checkin. This must be a new policy. In Palazzo's defense, I did not complain for these items - if I would have maybe Palazzo would have waived the $19.00 a night resort fee. Since I had limited time on the trip, I did not want to spend it in long lines bringing these items to their attention. Pros: The pool area was great. Employees brought around cold cucumbers and cold wash cloths. The room was fine, no problems except for the blanket. The view was great. Houskeeping was very good.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to impress your wife - (detailed review)”
Reviews.Author: bquiet
