Reviews.Content: Palazzo Las Vegas, NV – (on the strip) Sept 4, 2011 – Sept 7, 2011 (US Labor Day weekend) Normal Luxury Suite [ My Scale: failure – below average – average – above average – the best ] (about me – a mid 40s, a 270 lb, 6ft Texan – I have traveled all over the US, to Australia many times, and a few key spots in Europe) }Bottom Line – [above average] – This is a nice mega resort (Palazzo/Shops w Canals/Venetian) focused on the rich/luxury client. It is certainly nice to look at and the rooms are nice 2 room suites. The people are nice, but don’t expect great-great service unless you pay for it. (it is Vegas after all – it is expensive – and nothing is free) }First Impression from the outside – [above average] – I have been to Vegas several times, so I am familiar with the strip, off strip, & downtown. It changes every time I go back. The outside of the Palazzo/Venetian is very nice – made to look like Italy. It looks like a quality place. }First Impressions of the lobby – [above average] – It is nicely decorated and large. It is known for its decorations. }First Impressions of the room – [above average] – Luxury Suite (this is the basic king room) I picked this hotel to impress my wife on her first trip to Las Vegas. The room is large (2rm suite). You walk in past the large bathroom, to the bed area. Then there is another stepped down area with a large L couch, desk, and a table with 4 chairs. It is nice. It is just like the pictures on their web site. The drapes and sheer are automatic – via a remote control. Items in the room – safe, 2 main TVs and a TV in the bathroom, ice down the hall, iron and ironing board, wifi Some items are NOT there – refrig (there is one for the mini bar, but if you even move an item (to make space) it will charge you – so no refrig, AND no coffee maker. }Room – The Bathroom – [above average] - It is what you would expect from this level of hotel. Nice. Just like the photos. And it has 2 lighting options. One full-on set of lights for day (one switch), and a very nice fully dimmable (down to candle level) on a few other light fixtures for night. (this makes a nice night light) It also has a nice place to sit with a high magnification lighted mirror – my wife loved this for putting on makeup. There was a hair dryer. }Room – The Bed – [average] – a nice king. Firm, but not bad. Slept fine. Wife slept fine. The lights on the side of the bed are a bit tricky to reach. (there is one switch for the main bedroom lights and then if you really look, another push button for the lights over each night stand) }Noise – [average] – like most mega hotels, you will hear your neighbors door open/close AND any noise in the hallway as people walk by. And if you neighbor is watching TV loudly or having a gathering – you will hear it. Also, there was a click, click, click,…. from the AC unit after it ran. This went on for a while – woke me up once. But it only did this the first night. }Heat/Cool – [above average] – It has a full digital thermometer. Allows you to set the temp, heat/cool, and the fan speed (hi/med/low) – (and it wanted – fan only). And it does not blow air direct on the bed (which is a nice design). So no drafts on your face while you sleep. }Service – Housekeeping – [average] – they did a good job and did not miss anything. Never intruded. I would call when we left the room (as we got a late start most days) }Service – Front desk and Concierge – [average] – We did check-in at the front desk. It is large and rather impersonal desk, but the girl helping us was nice. Calling the front desk from the room is rather hit or miss. They have any automated system to route your request, but half the time if just went dead, and the other half it would play music on hold without any explanation –and then finally connect me to a person (who may or may not be able to help me directly). We tried the concierge desk twice. Once at check-in to see about phantom ticket (DON’T bother – they just sell them at full price – check the discount codes online –and go the Phantom box office and ask for the discounts). And once again, on the way out to ask about mailing some post cards –and the location/directions to the nearest post office. She told us the front desk does sell the international post card stamps. (but this has been an issue for us in the past – mail not getting out of a hotel – so we tend to go to a post office) They gave us a google map search print-out. (not really any help with directions from the hotel – just the print out) }Service – Food – [NA] – We did not order room service, and there is NOT any type of included/free food. (I would not expect any in Vegas) }Service – overall attitude from mgmt through to the staff – [average] – If you are not a big spender, don’t expect anything above the average service. Everyone was nice, but cash rules in Vegas. }Little Extras – [average] – ) There is a fax machine in the room. ) There are 2 robes to use while visiting in the room. (we did not use them) ) Free self park }Other Notes – ) You must walk through the Casino to reach the room elevators from the front desk, and it is smoky. (just like most other Casino/Hotels in Vegas) The Palazzo has signs saying it is a “smoke free corridor” – but don’t believe it. (most casinos are smoky, but this one seems a bit more than the others) After you check in, you can come down from the rooms to level 2 – to avoid the casino if you are going to the shops/canals. But if you want to reach the garage or front desk – smoke will be an issue. ) GET ON THE GRAZIE e-mail list – this has the best room deals (if you are not a comp’ed gambler) ) DON’T bother using the concierge for show tickets – they just sell them at full price – check the discount codes online –and go the show box office and ask for the discounts. }Would I stay there again? – Yes }Would I recommend this place to a friend? – Yes

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ninibean
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this hotel. We have never stayed at a high end hotel before. The suite was spacious and lovely. Loved the 3 flatscreen TV's, especially the one in the bath area. The only annoyance, was the numerous card keys (8 in all) we had to request for our room which only one ended up working. Otherwise, our stay was most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is going down hill:(”
Reviews.Author: Jazzytravelingabroad
Reviews.Content: Mary at invited guest check in was rude, and Mary her manager, wasn't much nicer! That started our stay off on a bad note. We love the Palazzo and stay there frequently. But I'm afraid their customer service is sliding down hill. The standard rooms are still nicer and bigger than the other 5 star casinos, but we don't want to deal with unprofessional employees. Maybe we will check out The Mandarin next time. Just wish they had a casino!

Reviews.Title: “Good but had flaws”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaChild
Reviews.Content: When we got there check in was fine. But when we got to our room we realised that they had given us the wrong room. We went back down to reception and they apologised and gave us an even better room. The staff was very polite and very helpful. They only problem we kept having was our room keys would not work. But overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. The room was beautiful and spacious, on the 28th floor with a view of the Wynn and golf course. Got the one king bed option. Separate sunken living area. Separate shower and tub. The shower had multiple shower heads. Nice color scheme. The hotel was very convenient and connected to the Venetian and Wynn/Encore. Guests could use the pool area of the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: bobindenver1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo for a short business trip and wish I could have stayed all week. The room was huge with a king sized bed, sunked living room with sectional sofa, table and chairs and two large flat screen tvs. The bath had two sinks, large jetted tub and stone shower. This room would have easily accomodated three people. The decor was modern and the room was very clean. The hotel itself has beautiful public spaces and connects with the Venitian which has all the great restaurants and shops. I would definitely love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and property”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Venetian last time and decided to give the Palazzo a try. Everything about the hotel is top notch. It is on a much smaller scale than the sister property, the Venetian, and that is a good thing. You were given more individual attention and didn't have to wait long to check in. The rooms were beautiful with lovely, spacious bathrooms. Even wifi is included, although you have to pay a steep resort fee to get it. The only real 'complaint' I had was that VMWare was going on at the same time we were there and that had 19,000 people staying at the property. This made it difficult to get around the hotel and the elevators were constantly busy. Also, our room was facing the pool and there was a huge pool party with very loud music until 11:00pm that made it difficult to sleep. We were already tired from a long east coast flight and with the time change, we were ready to get some rest. Other than that, I was very happy with hotel and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room”
Reviews.Author: lvamy
Reviews.Content: We are locals, and this is the 2nd time we spent the night at the Palazzo for our anniversary. The rooms are amazing, our view overlooking the Venetian pools and of the Mirage's volcano, and down the strip was beautiful. Unfortunately with had so much planned didn't get to spend much time in the room. The bed and pillows were sooo comfortable. The bathroom is huge, separate shower and tub, nice vanity area, with its own tv. There were also 2 other tvs in the room. All this for a total price of $144, a great deal. We food and bar hopped and enjoyed apps and drinks at 5 restaurants. What a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: nthrich
Reviews.Content: I attend many conference in Las Vegas and the Palazzo is always my favorite place to stay. The rooms are incredible and the shops and restaurant choices are some of the best in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A REAL INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: dravizza
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the PRESTIGE SERVICE and I just LOVED IT. This has been one of my real best experience into a hotel. Staff is nice, friendly and really tries to anticipate your needs. Didn't have much time to try too many restaurants and/or seeing a show, but will do for sure next time. A TRULY AMAZING experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Best Beds and friendly staff (except pool Bar)”
Reviews.Author: Unionyes68
Reviews.Content: Went for wifes 45th B-Day. Have stayed here a couple times before ,always Great. Stayed on Club level....not enough staff working club lounge. All was perfect except pool Bar tender was a complete SNOB. Each stay has been fantastic and will be back. Very Clean BTW!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience for years”
Reviews.Author: ExoB
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience for a very long time. I stayed 5 nights in the hotel, visiting Vegas for a conference. I had a voucher that was supposed to cover the stay including taxes and breakfast. Already at the check in I was told that the breakfast was not included. They neither had a one king size bed options left so I had to settle for two queens. The room itself, a "luxery suite" according the voucher, was nice but like mentioned in the earlier posts, not really clean; glass stains on various places, dust in the corners, a bent frame in a small drink table, etc. The whole thing culminated during the last night. I woke up at around 3 am, feeling something crawling on my face. I wiped the bug off and crushed it, then called to the front desk. According to the room manager the remains of it did not seem to be those of a bed bug. A security guy was called and took the basic info for a possible expense claim, just in case. But there was pretty much nothing to be done in the hotel as I was about to leave. The whole luggage was pest controlled once I got home, just in case. I checked out at around 5 am in order to catch an early flight, only to find out that the front desk was not able to print out receipt that was emailed to me later. From that l eventually learned that they had charged something called a "mandatory resort fee" for each night! According to the billing contact person I had agreed to be charged this while signing the check in papers. I have no way making sure of this this out as of course there was no copy that would have been handed to me. Nor was anything mentioned about this while doing the check in at the front desk. I cannot understand why a hotel in which per nightly cost in my suite was way beyond 300 dollars needs to promote this kind of scamming with the fees. If they cannot afford to run hotel without rising the charges at least they should respect the client enough to be honest about it. In these circumstances (room hassle, cleaning + bug, fee scam) I cannot much recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jfulginiti
Reviews.Content: This "all suites" hotel was incredible. The room was gigantic - bathroom, bedroom, and a HUGE sunken living room. The bed was the most comforatble hotel bed I have ever slept on. The two enormous windows overlooked the pool and Treasure Island. The bathroom was almost as big as my first apartment! Everything about this place screams luxury. The only thing I did not like was that there is a charge for internet use. Didn't bother me too much because I was on business and work picked up the tab, but if I was on vacation I would be annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: starrf1re
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights, sunday to Saturday. Had a fantastic time. We were upgraded to a Fortuna Suite as my partner is a Royal Ambassador with IHG group. This was great as it meant we skipped queues at check in and got to use the VIP lounge. Our Fortuna Suite was huge and just beautiful. Loved the large bathroom with separate toilet. Loved having the little area to sit and do my make up. Loved having 2 sinks. Nice big shower. Housekeeping were very good. The other great thing about being a RA is that the minibar was free so great use was made of the Moet! The hotel itself is really lovely and links through to Venetian. Honestly I think you could come to the Palazzo or the Venetian and never have to leave. There is shopping, entertainment, restaurants, gambling, bars, you name it. We ate at Morels one night which was fabulous and I would highly recommend. The service was great. Had breakfast one day at the Grand Lux cafe, loved the atmosphere, wish I had checked out the buffet but all I wanted was bacon and eggs. Lovely friendly waitress which is always a pleasure in the mornings. (we ate a light breakfast at the VIP lounge - pastries - for the rest of our stay) Did the gondola trip - enjoyable but doesnt really last long! Ate dinner in the square at the venetian one night at Postrio, good, but not outstanding. Had a few small wins on the slots so of course that made me happy that it was not a complete losing trip! :) Overall I didnt think the casino was too smokey at all, it has much higher ceilings than some casinos which I think helps. Loved the pool area. Bit too hot for me though so didnt spend anywhere near enough time there. Thankfully it was not too noisy, was glad it wasnt a party pool. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The very Best!”
Reviews.Author: Jan P
Reviews.Content: Had to comment on our trip to Vegas in August 2011. We booked thru Expedia.ca online. I phoned to confirm our reservations the night before : everything was fine. Upon our arrival we were informed that the suite we had thought we reserved was not available. There is no guarantee thru expedia(did not read the fine print carefully). However we were offered a luxury suite upgrade to 1280 square feet at a price increase of $200.00 a day. We offered to pay $100 extra a day with the fridge fee of $25 a day included in the $100.00. The hotel representative who was looking after us was amazing and so professional. She checked with her Manager and we were able to get the larger suite for a much lower price! Upon arriving at our suite we were blown away by the spacious rooms and the upper end finishes. What a beautiful place. Service was excellent. Staff always freindly and courteous. I felt like royalty we were treated so well! We will be back to Las Vegas and hope to stay at The Palazzo again. What a wonderful experience I would recommend this hotel to everyone!! Thank you to all staff at The Palazzo you deserve a big pat on the back:)))

Reviews.Title: “Join their club and save your "sandwich"!”
Reviews.Author: bossafin
Reviews.Content: Join the "Grazia Club" before you make your reservations. You don't have to gamble, but you will get better rates, better rooms, and perks that most people don't receive. It is good for the Venetian, too, but I personally like the Palazzo better because it is more manageable in size. Got lost all the time at Venetian! I never even picked up my card, as I don't gamble. But I got the great room cheaper than any online site, and discounts on food and drinks, etc. The rooms are huge suites, with fabulous bathrooms. Got a room on the 39th floor with an incredible view. Don't waste your time trying to "bribe" the front desk. Just go to the website and sign up for their players' club (you should do this at ANY Las Vegas hotel, btw, for better rooms and upgrades).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxurious suites, we didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Haellostinside
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel (at a good discount due to a "secret hotel" deal) and it was absolutely fantastic. We just had a basic suite but were not dissapointed as the rooms were huge and included a small office area and lounge and a total of 3 TVs. The suite looked amazing and came with more than everything we could have needed, I cannot think of a single thing wrong with it. Although not much of a gambler myself, the casino was enjoyable (they had the best video poker machines I saw) and the staff seemed friendly and helpful. Make sure you tip your drinks server whenever you get a free drink in the casino, it is true they will come back to you quicker! Staying at the Palazzo was also really good because it links internally to the Venetian, opening up access to a good selection of restaurants and shops. The canals and the ceiling artwork in the Venetian are also a must-see whilst in Las Vegas. Overall I was extremely impressed with the hotel and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “concierge vs. non-concierge”
Reviews.Author: SophiagoestoItaly
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas with my friends at least once a year - and have been doing it for over 15 years. Several years ago, we had our first concierge experience at the Venetian, and loved it. Since then, we have returned to both the Venetian and Palazzo, concierge and non-concierge packages. We have a noticed a distinct reduction in the service and atmosphere in the concierge lounges, and an increase in the number of people allowed in. Last year at the Palazzo was the worst: the first evening, we stood in a line-up for 25 minutes to get a glass of wine, by which time all the food was picked over, and all the tables claimed. There were large groups of people who looked like they just arrived from the pool wearing swimsuits, tank tops, and flip-flops, despite the sign clearly asking for proper attire. Breakfasts were worse: families treated the lounge like an all-you-can-eat buffet, with kids sitting on the floor and food spread out on the coffee tables. The noise level, and overworked staff who could not keep up with the trash and dirty dishes, made for a totally unpleasant experience. Worse, I wrote a long letter to the head of the concierge lounge expressing our concerns in a respectful manner and making suggestions for improving the experience, but never received a reply. This year, we chose to return to the Palazzo, but not the concierge level. The room was great as always, and we chose to buy our food and beverages off-site. We may try the concierge experience again once we hear that it has been returned to a level which befits the price and the promise.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Angie T
Reviews.Content: Where else can you go and feel at home without having to do a thing?? The PALAZZO is the answer. Everyone is like "Family". The "Suites" (not just a room) are ones to die for. The beds are a great treat. Not to mention the bathroom - spacious shower and tub and tv and phone -all rolled into one! Lets not forget the big soft towels and turn down bed service. For great food and lots of it--"Grand Lux" is the place to eat. Onto the Casino -the best slots ever. They have the best staff at the Grazie desk--don't forget to sign up for a card for points. Your next stay could be a FREE one!! If your a shopper (or not) visit the " Grand Canal Shoppes" and "Shoppes at The Palazzo" -great way to walk off all that food you'll be eating. Oh yes-if your a sun person--the "POOL'S" are a must-or just take a walk outside to see how beautiful the grounds are. Yes-like Heaven on Earth-a place to stay-you think your in Italy -but your not! My home away from home--I'll be BACK!!! See my "Sister's" and my "P & V" Family next year. GRAZIE--Angie B. Todd-Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: tomBCN
Reviews.Content: This so called luxury hotel really has beautiful suites but the service is very very bad. It started with our arrival: Al my reservations were incorrect: I booked a sienna suite but they reserved me a standard suite, all my dinner- and spa-reservations were wrong. After a long discusion they told me they would arrange my sienna suite. I had to wait for 3 hours before my suite was ready and it had a bad view (instead of the strip-view I reserved). They didn't even try to make up for all these inconveniences!!! Service staid bad throughout the entire holiday. In the spa the staff was so unfriendly they almost made my wife cry!!! When checking out the bill was incorrect, they corrected the bill while I was there but charged the difference on my credit-card the moment I was gone!!! I highly suggest you to book any other hotel if you want a pleasant stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Katnden
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Las Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed at the Palazzo and saw Phantom of the Opera to start the trip we were placed in a beautiful suite overlooking the golf course (facing East) …FANTASTIC. The room was spacious and comfortable. The room service was a value for the hotel. When we went to see Phantom the seats were not close, my fault for not ordering early. , But the seats were good the set was more that expected and gave the feeling of actually being in the bowels of the city. VOICES were very good. Over all a very Happy Anniversary, would have been better if we won, but that’s gambling. Also we went Wednesday to Friday (8/23) and the strip was crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Hotel was Fantastic/Excellent Except for The Ambassador Jessica”
Reviews.Author: Yolinda C
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay with the Palazzo Hotel was EXCELLENT from the time of check-in until the very last day. Check out was disappointing though because the person wearing the red jacket with black hair in ponytails (supposedly was the Ambassador of the Hotel) was very RUDE to me as a customer! Her name is Jessica. What is an Hotel Ambassador and what role does this person play? To me, an Ambassador is someone who represents the Hotel with the most outstanding perception that anyone can give, who projects positive feelings out, and says... I represent this Hotel as the Ambassador and I'm proud of it. I must say that this didn't happen with "Jessica" as I have found out her name to be. I wanted to make a GREAT comment about the hotel checkout process, she was standing right next to me, as I was in line. I tapped her on the shoulder with a finger to get her attention. She turned around and told me, snapping at me, "Don't you ever touch me again!". In my mind, I said.... WOW, Lady, what's up with you, did you get off the wrong side of the bed this morning, or did you not get any "yum yum" last night. Regardless her situation, her behaviour was totally uncalled for. That upset me so very much that as I was finally checking out, I told the person behind the counter my experience, I was in tears because of it. She referred me to manager who came up and I explained the situation. She said that there will be a followup on this. Don't get me wrong, everything about the Palazzo was excellent, just the last day experience with checkout and Ambassador employee Jessica!!!! Bottom line - Jessica is in the wrong position for the type of behaviour and attitude that she provided to me. She doesn't deserve to be that... An Ambassador of the Palazzo Hotel. She doesn't have any GREAT customer service skills. Hopefully the next time I return back to Vegas and hopefully the Palazzo, I do not find her here again.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Prestige!”
Reviews.Author: MTVandendooren
Reviews.Content: My friend and I made the decision to stay at Palazzo, and chose to upgrade, and do their "Prestige" option. This means that you have private champagne check-in on the 23rd floor, have access to a lounge that has breakfast, afternoon snacks, hors d'oeuvres in the evening, and evening drinks as well as private concierge. LOVED IT! Our room (Bella Prestige) was beautiful and large - 2 flat screeens, and a separate sunken living room. We thoroughly enjoyed not having to search out somewhere to have breakfast every morning, and to have somewhere to hang out, and have some snacks/drinks every evening before dinner reservations. The hotel was very nice, but the room (Bella Prestige) was excellent! Now, I have to highlight that going "Prestige" is not cheap - so, not suited to the 'bargain' Vegas traveller. But! If you want to have great customer service, and have some extra money, it's totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay will be my last -- too many great hotels to bother with this one.”
Reviews.Author: epicureangirl
Reviews.Content: After a very good initial experience last year, during a business trip at this hotel, I decided to rebook for a family vacation. I checked in at the correct check-in time, but could not be given a room because none were ready that were non-smoking. I was told it would be about an hour. With bags in tow, plus kids, and watching guest after guest being checked in, I seriously had to wonder what was going on. Was I really to believe every guest checking in wanted a smoking room? Bottom line, I had to go up twice (after already having waited the hour), until I had to politely insist/beg that they make something happen for me room-wise. It's as if they have no contact with the people cleaning the rooms, and continue checking guests in without any system to take care of the people waiting. I asked if they would kindly give me one of the coupons for one of their restaurants (they usually give them to you when you check in, or have them in your room) so we could kill the time there while the room is cleaned. But NO, apparently their computer system only prints them out on check in, so they could not make a (seemingly) simple request like that happen. If the people on the front-lines are not empowered to provide a good customer service experience, and are just cashiers, you might as well close your doors for business. There are plenty of hotels in Vegas that show grace under pressure and provide a good customer experience, even during peak times. I still give it one star for having large comfortable rooms with great sheets. The space is really ideal for a family, but perhaps (is it possible) that the Venetian has their act a bit more together? For some context, I have also stayed for business & pleasure at Wynn, Trump, Venetian, and Caesars, staying more than 20 nights a year at fine Vegas hotels. I will be crossing this one off my list -- Addio, Club Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Palazzo prestige level, and will return”
Reviews.Author: mommaneedsatrip
Reviews.Content: Check in for prestige level is on the 23rd floor. Upon arrival we went up to the regular check in, and were given a 'key card' to get past the security at the elevators. Also, security ALWAYS checked for a room card to get to the elevator banks while we were there. We went up to the prestige check in, and were greeted with a glass of champagne each. Check in was fast, and he suggested restaurants for us to visit and answered all our questions. Our room was on the 24th floor, no 'view' of any major streets but very VERY quiet up there. The pictures on here are quite accurate. The bed was very comfortable, and I am not one to sleep well on vacation generally. But slept well here. The service at the prestige level was extraordinary. My husband and I are very big on 'customer service', and not disappointed at all on that level. We sat down one evening to enjoy the prestige lounge snacks/cocktails. And one of the bartenders walked around taking orders and promptly bringing drinks. The cocktail service on the casino floor was lacking, but at prestige lounge we'd have a new drink before the previous drink was 2/3 gone. With the convenience factor of amenities (lounge), comfort/space of the rooms, and customer service, no resort fee at this level (& complimentary wifi), we will definately be returning and paying the extra $100/day for this level again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NVSamara
Reviews.Content: We loved The Palazzo. I have stayed at The Venetian several times and what I liked about the Palazzo is that it's more intimate as the lobby and casino areas are smaller but still very nice. The rooms are the same as the Venetian however the Palazzo does not have the Rialto rooms like at the Venetian. The pool area and cabanas were fantastic. I was impressed with the padded bench chairs. The restaurants are fantastic. Dos Caminos Mexican was my favorite restaurant. The Prestige service is well worth it. You avoid check-in in the main lobby and go directly to the 23rd floor. The breakfast was sufficient, service was great and the FULL bar from 5pm-8pm was worth the extra fees in itself. The most thing I like about my stay was the quality of people. It's not your typical Las Vegas crowd who like to party and get drunk (though there was a few but generally the people were "classy"). I would definitely come back to stay here or the Venetian again. Best room value for the price. People say, "Oh I don't want to spend money on a room because I won't be in there long - only to sleep." Well that's a bunch of crap because the stay does make a difference when you are in a nice room and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost what we expected”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonc3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo for a quick weekend getaway. We arrived around noon on a Friday, and although the room we requested wasn't available, we were upgraded, for not considerably more, to a huge suite on the 46th floor, which was available. Check-in was very easy, and the staff was friendly and accomodating. The room was big, that's for sure, but looked just a bit worn. We noticed some small things you wouldn't expect at a 5-star resort - tile grout getting a little dark, towels not very soft, couch a little worn, bed spread beginning to frazzle just a little, etc. Overall, for the price, it was very nice and quite accommodating. We spent time poolside, which was great. Not really the "scene" like at Hard Rock or Mandalay, but perfect for a couple of 40-somethings like us. The spa was great as well. For $20, well worth it to simply go and use the facilities and relax for a short period of time. The casino was open, bright, and well-ventilated, and the dealers were well trained and friendly. We really enjoyed the nightclub and breakfast at one of the restaurants as well. Overall, we had a wonderful time. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a 4-star resort experience. If you expect top shelf, and are very picky, this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: angelasmiles
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at the Palazzo and everything was above our expectations! It's absulutely beautiful and the staff was amazing. The rooms are clean and exptremly roomy. My family was very surprised, as they have never been to Vegas. Just the hotel alone made them want to return to the Palazzo where every room is a suite!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo and will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: anoop n
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and loved staying at the Palazzo. Since we were a Family of 4 with 2 girls aged 14 and 11, we decided to get the Suite (2 Queen Beds and a Pullout Sofa). They were running a special for $109/Night and we are so glad we got to stay at this hotel. We were extremely satisfied with the room and the amenities at the Hotel. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: FtWorthSusan
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Palazzo are so spacious. Large bedroom with flatscreen tv and marble stairs down to sunken living room with large L shaped sofa, desk with fax machine and flat screen tv and big bathroom with large tub, separate glass shower, 2 sinks and tv Our package for $129 per night incuded continental breakfast delivered to our room each morning and also some discounts for the spa and some restaurants at the resort. The free drink service is great in the casino and they have a small area of nonsmoking gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Not as grand as expected”
Reviews.Author: Benj22
Reviews.Content: Our first visit and a little disappointed on the lack of casino glitz. Getting service to the room was very slow as well as contacting front desk -- the phone would ring an average of 5 minutes on hold no matter the time of day or night. The room said 71 degrees, but felt warmer than what we keep our home at 78 degrees. Maintenance was very slow to come to room. Had to call 3 times, waiting 1 and 1/2 hours the first time, 30 minutes the second time, etc. Staff personality very nice, but just slow service concerning the room. We had a double queen suite and was very comfortable size, although the beds were okay, they certainly were not "heavenly". Linens good though. Very mediocre and basic toiletries. No exhaust fan in the enclosed toilet area or in the shower area. Nice to have separate tvs in bed area, living area, and bathroom. Nice motorized drapery system. Keep in mind that double queen suites are at end of the hall. The casino was very blaugh in decor, but with high ceilings, the smoke was less noticeable. Sometimes we were lucky to find $10 game tables, sometimes $15. The norm was $25. The plus is there is a short connecting indoor walk between Palazzo and Venetian casinos, so you have two casinos to play in and charges and "Grazie" points can be applied to your account in both casinos. Both casinos have huge amount of penny slots, but with max bet being as high as 2 or 3 dollars a pull on most of them. The big plus of the whole experience was the Grand Lux Cafe, available in both the Palazzo and the Venetian. We ate every meal there because everything we tried there was so yummy good and the prices were reasonable, especially with the huge portions that are served. Everything was served hot and fresh. My husband loved the ribs (huge full slab). I loved the Asian Chicken Salad, the fried Shrimp, and we both loved the Salisbury Steak -- must have been almost a pound of meat each, the fresh bread, the homemade lemonade, the crusty apple pie, -- yum yummy stuff. Our average dinner bill was $42 without alcohol, not including tip. The Jersey Boys show was absolutely fabulous and so entertaining. Beware however that the very large and loud speakers are located on each end of stage, so front orchestra seats close to stage on each side will absolutely leave you deaf when you leave. We had inner aisle seats halfway back in front orchestra and were very pleased, row Q seats 14 and 15. Also because of the raised stage, I think best seats would be about 10 to 12 rows back in center as well as inner seats of front orchestras. If you sign up for Grazie points, be sure to charge all services in the hotels to your room. It may be the only way that you may get a free breakfast. The old days of playing all night and asking the pit boss for breakfast are not available here. We may go back, but the Wynn is classier.

Reviews.Title: “Great North Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: trucker64
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Palazzo. Was given an upgraded room with a fabulous view. Perfect location for this trip as most of our activities were focused on the north end of the strip. Love the large suites and the wonderful bathroom. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, but not great!!”
Reviews.Author: atg98503
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo August 2011 for three nights. Tipped $20.00 at check-in and was upgraded to a higher floor. Told the frond desk person that we we're celebrating a birthday. No champagne sent to the room, no food credit, no spa passes so I was disappointed because I've stayed at many other hotels, and were given something special, but not the Palazoo. The rooms were nice, but I like the encore rooms better, and the suites at the mirage are alot nicer. The slots were horrible when I played, so when over to the Wynn and there's seemed to pay out pretty good. Location of the Palazoo is good, and there's a Walgreen really close. Ate dinner at Lagassi Stadium, and Table 10 both were good. The pool area is also really nice, I can't comment on the spa because I didn't have time to use the facilities. Overall it's a good place to stay, but there are better on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Mammoth Rooms”
Reviews.Author: girltalk
Reviews.Content: I'm still in shock over the size of the rooms. They are incredibly big especially for the price. The room was tastefully appointed and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and even the maids will greet you when you walk past in the hallway. It's worth upgrading to the Prestige package because this gives you access to the club lounge with free breakfast and afternoon hors d’oeuvres and drinks, along with free wi-fi and pool access. I will definitely consider this hotel again when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Manuel1985
Reviews.Content: we had the best time staying at this Hotel, the service was very good and the room so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Third time here; The room are gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: artbcpa
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is an exquisite all-suite hotel across from Treasure Island and just down the block from the Wynn and Encore. It is part of the Venetian complex. The room are huge - let me repeat - huge...and that is just the standard ones. You really don't need to upgrade unless you are being comped or you have money to burn. For a large hotel, they handle check-in extremely efficiently, the parking garage, not so much. Often they have minis-hows at their lobby fountain and the Venetain-Palazzo complex is home to many good shows. Currently Jersey Boys and the Blue Man Group are performing. Once you stay at either the Venetian or Palazzo, you will begin receiving specials, discounts, and other incentives. They are real and worth it. Other than staying at a hotel totally devoid of gambling, (yes there are a couple), the Palazzo is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Berta1214
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is very nice. The rooms are HUGE. Upon check in they TRIED to split us and our friends up. Told us we'd be staying at the Venetian. After a short discussion, we all ended up staying together as planned. The hotel itself is very nice. The cafes are adequate and reasonably priced. The location is not the greatest. Its a bit of a walk to the middle of the strip. I feel a better located hotel would have been Aria or Belagio. Our room was very clean and HUGE as already mentioned. No complaints but not wowed either. You could save money and stay somewhere just as nice for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay, still enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room had great strip view, upper floor. My 16 YO daughter finds tons to do at the Palazzo/Venetian complex (pools, gelatto, shopping, Phantom) and we feel safe to let her explore in the area. Cleaning staff is always friendly and room services is quick to accomodate requests. Pay the money and stay at this property (if you can). Location is unbeatable, as so are all the amenities and choices of places to eat (meals, desserts etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it !”
Reviews.Author: TexasTeri
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Vegas with friends and chose to stay at The Palazzo. I have stayed in many Vegas hotels, so I had an idea of where this one was located and picked it due to the great location ! The location was great, however, for the amount of money we spent, I feel there are much better options in Vegas ! Upon arrival I presented my reservation voucher as I had paid for the hotel in advance. When I booked the Bella Suite, I paid extra to be on the Prestige level so we could get the free breakfast and cocktail hour. Unfortunately, it wasn't noted on my voucher and the front desk manager named Johnathan refused to honor it. He rudely stated that he couldn't afford to do that. Really? I paid several hundred dollars for a 3 night stay in a multi million dollar hotel and he couldn't justify it. Wow. The atmosphere is very stuffy......not a fun place at all. Not many food choices in the hotel at all and the shopping was very pricey and a limited selection !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vegas Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: ready2getaway2011
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Palazzo from Aug 10-15, 2011. Friendly, helpful service and spectacular, luxurious surroundings. Our gorgeous/spacious room was on the 12th floor with a strip view overlooking the main pool...we didn't experience the noise/music level as mentioned in a previous review. We ate three times at the Grand Luxe Cafe....excellent service, huge portions and reasonable prices. We travelled with two other couples and never had a problem finding 6 chairs all together by the pool. Attentive, friendly pool staff brought around cucumber and orange slices and cool towels. A fantastic stay in Vegas...we would return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: PeachesShire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo because we wanted to stay in a suite in Las Vegas. After reading some of the reviews I was quite concerned about staying there but once we arrived and saw our wonderful suite, all the worries disappeared!! I have stayed in many hotels around the world and enjoy small, chic, boutique hotels but also large, lavish, chain hotels just as much. One thing I will say is that such a huge hotel does lose the 'personal touch' that smaller hotels have to offer and you do feel like you are just another guest on the giant conveyor belt of lesuire and tourism HOWEVER, we were warmly wlecomed as soon as we got out of our taxi, escorted to the front desk and immediately checked in by a friendly staff member. I liked the fact you had to show your hotel key before you got into the lifts - shows they are bothered about security. Our room was on the 44th floor which had a spectacular view of the golf course at the Wynn and the mountains towards the Grand Canyon. I was not bothered at all that we did not have a view of the strip...in fact my partner and I both said we preferred the view we had! The suite was superb. We loved everything about it! The view, the bed, the large sofa, the 3TV's - in the living room, bedroom and in the bathroom. The bathroom was just as fabulous with bath, separate shower, two 'his and hers' basins and a toilet cubicle. It was very modern and up to date. I particularly liked the remote control for the blinds and curtains!! The service in the hotel was very good. We ordered breakfast one morning and it arrived very quickly and the food was delicious...I loved the sausages! We didn't really use the mini bar but it had a good selection. The hotel is perfectly located on the strip and we felt we were in the middle of all the action. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Bar Service”
Reviews.Author: Keilani50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were meeting our friends from East Coast in Vegas. We were thrilled to stay at Palazzo, since we normally stay at the Venetian. We are at the bar right by the guest suite elevator sitting there to have a drink and play poker machine. The bartender, Will was very rude. So many guests are waiting to order drinks, he was just standing at the bar talking to other bartenders, who are not facing the guests. He was looking at guests not even helping since he was too busy gossiping with other colleagues. The guests were so upset and left. When I ordered my drinks, while I was playing $1 poker machine, he made a big deal making my martini with Grey goose. And he was very rude to me. A minute later, my girlfriend had the same experience with him. We have never went back to the bar there during our stay. Next day, I was at the bar close to the registration there, everyone was so nice and receptive to all guests, even though they were very busy. I spoke to one of the guests at the bar, and the gentleman from New York told me the same thing about Will. We spent so much money to stay there, and we were treated the way we did, I am very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: djanni11
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge and went prestige level. This is definetely worth the extra money. I wouldn't bother upgrading to a strip view as this isn't worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel with all its trimmings! Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: aus66
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the lovely friendly staff and our luggage was swiftly whisked to our rooms. The rooms are very impressive, massive, clean quiet and simply were amazing. Even the bathrooms had style and ample room. Great amenities. All rooms of this hotel are suites and about 70 sq. The view of our room overlooked the famous strip and night lights of other hotels. I cant fault anything!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal stay!”
Reviews.Author: missmelissa500
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel, 5 star service, 5 star class! Georgous hotel, amazing staff! Staying in the Palazzo towers, absolutely amazing! 100% of staff members greeted us, from the servers at the cafes, to the maidstaff. There is no need to leave this hotel :-) We were beyond amazed with our 1 week stay, and will be back soon! Thank you so much for the fabulous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trvlcrazy9
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a getaway celebrating my husband's 40th and our friend's 50th birthdays. I would probably give the hotel 4 1/2 stars, but that isn't an option so I rounded up. We have stayed at the MGM, Paris, Mirage, Caesars and Bellagio in the past. But the Palazzo is now our new favorite even with a few flaws. After reading reviews on here we decided to upgrade to the Prestige Level. It was definitely worth the $100 upgrade! The easy check in without a wait, the champagne welcome drink, the afternoon snacks, evening reception and breakfast was all worth it! The evening appetizers during the cocktail hour weren't that great. But the free drinks (not just wine or beer) were worth it. It was fun to try new cocktails. The room is gorgeous. I loved the bathroom amenities (which may have been upgraded with the Prestige level). But our bathroom was starting to come apart. Some decorative molding was missing but the nails were still showing and the vanity mirror was chipped in a few places. Another flaw was the bed was not as comfortable as I expected for a hotel of this caliber. I've definitely slept in better. The pool was my favorite place and this is VERY important to me when going to Vegas. I was treated as I would have been at the Four Seasons. Nice chair cushions and the attendants would come by with sliced oranges, cucumbers, otter pops, frozen towels, etc. Loved it! Not many kids, very quiet. And we enjoyed the lounge chairs in the water as well. However, the pool side restaurant Solara by Wolfgang Puck was not good. We ordered a turkey sandwich which was pre-made and so dry and so underwelming and a pizza (no drinks) for $34. Definitely a waste! The next day we ate lunch at the Grand Luxe inside the Palazzo and we had 2 entrees which were delicious for only $25. Much better! We also ate at Lavo which had excellent service but the food was only ok. I think they have a great marketing plan to get in you the door. But the food was overrated. All in all, the Palazzo is great value for your money and we'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: Anabell O
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here in May 2010 for a whole week. Great service, nice casino, and just gorgeous! it was my birthday present!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room but not for me”
Reviews.Author: spotcalifornia
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice but tv in the bathroom didn't work and toilet would not flush. Casino felt like an Atlantic City casino-kinda cheesy. The pool doesn't get sun until afternoon. We will go back to the Wynn or Encore. We watched the Palazzo being built and wanted to give it a try. We were disappointed and will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: Traveler10_23_1956
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. This is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are so elegant and very comfortable for a reasonable price normally.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Fantastic Service; An Escape from typical Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nycadman
Reviews.Content: Can't speak highly enough about this property. We opted for the Prestige Suite package which included concierge service, limo to and from airport, bottle of champagne and fruit in room, free breakfast and cocktails/dinner at the prestige lounge on the 23rd floor, plus so much more. Upgrade cost from standard room more than paid off. Over 750 sq feet of room, with a beautiful bathroom and sunken living room. View of strip and pools from our suite. Pools were great, although bit crowded on weekend. But the chilled towels, popsicles and more made up for it. A hint. The last day we went to the Venezia Tower pool over at the Venetian. Quiet, secluded, gorgeous. Right off of Bouchon restaurant. Def go there if you want to get away from the scene. Highly recommended. A+.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Palazzo, But room Comps have Changed Drastically”
Reviews.Author: Nadocindy
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love the Palazzo casino and hotel. It sould be our number one choice. however they have treated their loyal customers poorly in their hotel room comps and so we now stay at the Wynn, which is equally as nice. If you enjoy a nice big hotel, with clean suites, and the feeling of secure hallways, and a casino below, this is a very nice hotel. However, even though we and many others played in their casino both often and spent a lot of money, they have virtually done away with comping their rooms (except for whales). Again, this is their decision but because of the way it was handled, this is also why many people have stopped staying there and have chosen to take their business elsewhere. If you are only staying for the room/suites and do not mind paying for your stay, it is a very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: Richie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our West Coast USA road-trip vacation. We were originally looking at mid-range hotels in Vegas, but found a good deal and decided to upgrade to The Palazzo: we are so glad we did. The suites are enormous with luxurious furnishings, heavenly bathrooms, huge beds and stunning views. The resort itself is huge with extensive facilities, all of which are high quality and classy. Great location on the strip, friendly staff and very good value for money. We will definitely return to The Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pool is disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Milskii09
Reviews.Content: We went for my buddies bachelor party and had 3 suites. The rooms were great, big and nice and pretty affordable. The main pool on the other hand was disgusting. The entire edge of the pool had a brownish/ white foam the entire time. Even after the staff skimmed the pool it, would just reappear. Other than that great hotel. Definitly recommend the V Bar the borders both hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, beautiful pools, casino NOT smokey.”
Reviews.Author: AngelaNM
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed here in April of 2010 but wasn't able to choose that date on the pull down menu. Stayed in the bella suite with three of my girlfriends. We shared the price of the room but it was still expensive. The room was spacious and well appointed. I liked there was a pleasant scent that greeted you as you walked through the front Loby and the casino. The best part was the pool area. The pool deck of the Palazzo connects with the pools deck of the Venician. There were over 10 pools to choose from. The atomosphere was relaxing and the clientelle was a bit older. We are all 40 so this suited us well. I am not a huge Vegas fan so the whole thing seems over priced to me but if you have the money to spend. This is a very upperclass hotel with a nice spa and beautiful surroundings. The resort fee is a rip off to me as it covers the gym and wi-fi access. We never used the gym and I wasn't able to log on using their wi-fi connection. I asked for this fee to be removed and they did accommodate me. Couldn't sleep due to some all night parying going on next door. It is Vegas though. Most people don't sleep through the night there I am assuming.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about The Palazzo is that everything in the hotel is in close walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: Pump150
Reviews.Content: This place isn't a maze like most hotels in Vegas. You're not making five turns before you find the elevator up to your rooms. The same thing goes for heading out to the pool and finding an easy place to eat after a rough night. The hotel rooms are big suites with a step down living room area. Very nice. At $300 a night during a summer weekend trip, you'd expect great service and that's what you get. There are four pools that we found and finding a chair wasn't a problem. The hotel is a quick 10 min walk across the street to a nice mall if your in need of a shopping fix Maybe it's because of the recession, but everywhere we went we noticed the customer service was really great out here. I think we've found a new favorite place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: RavensFootball
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. That sums it up. A very nice place to stay with my wife as we would stay at The Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “The Suites are luxorius and huge”
Reviews.Author: jeanne m
Reviews.Content: Not many times do I go to a room and pay regular prices and get such a beautiful suite. The hotel treats you with dignity even though you are not a big gambler. I would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist81
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Palazzo and it was just a great experience. Part of our 2 week USA trip, this hotel was among the cheapest we booked but by far the best ! The "basic" rooms are huge suites, very modern and spotless clean ! The complex is huge, you an easily walk 15 minutes to get to dinner, but the deco, the setting and all the shops on the way are worth it. Food in the different restaurants was exceptional, and cheap for this quality ! Those who complain about the prices should compare with similar food in Europe (would cost more than double). We did the Vegas Sandwich and got a room on the 43rd floor, wow....amazing view over the strip, the TI Hotel accross, enjoyed their show from above many times ! Great guest service, always very friendly operators on the phone. We used concierge to book helicopter tour and other tours, easy and professional. Helicopter at night, 100 per person, is a must ! Room service and in room breakfast were on time, warm, and very goood. The gym is located in the venetian (long walk, but you want to work out;) and big for a hotel gym, even has a climbing wall ! Valet service is good to. CONS: the AC is just to cold, outside you melt, inside you freeze, it would still be cold enough if it were a few degrees warmer...so, specially the ladies, do not be afraid to bring a jacket or other warmer clothes for dining. We were there from wednesday to saturday, the hotel is "calm" till friday afternoon...then there are just to many people, specially drunk and noisy kids (i am only 30 myself, but they are just so annoying when drunk), so if you can, avoid weekends. All in all a fantastic experience, thank you Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: OKCRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure. Rooms are very spacious. Mine had an amazing view of the Strip and the mountains behind TI. Front desk staff was outstanding - they were very helpfuly, kind and accommodating. Check-in went very smoothly and quickly. Hotel location is outstanding as well. If you are arrving/departing between 6 am and 6 pm, highly recommend using a shuttle rather than a cab. The shuttle was only $6 (plus tip) and a cab is anywhere from $20 to $35 (depending on the route your cab driver uses). The shuttle was very qucik.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SandWorm
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Palazzo for her birthday and the hotel was beautiful. Walking in to the lobby you can immediately sense that you were entering a "high class feel" of a hotel, but without the luxurious expense that usually accompanies it. The rooms are very reasonably priced - exceeding value for the price. As others have previously posted, the hotel always smells fresh as they seem to circulate a flower-scented fragrance through the air vents. The one downside, though, is that the casino is extremely small. Fortunately, though, the Venetian is right next door and you never have to leave the hotel to enter it as it is connected. The casino at the Venetian is not as nice (older), but there are more slot machines and tables for your enjoyment. For entertainment, I surprised my wife with tickets to Phantom - amazing!!! I had seen Phantom of the Opera back in the early 90's at the Ahmanson Theater in Los Angeles. Both versions were great, except the Las Vegas one had more explosions and effects (plus it was approx. 1 hr or so shorter). I also took my wife to Cut (steakhouse restaurant - the steak was amazing, although every side item was a la carte (and expensive). I hope to return soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, just not Sweet Surrender!”
Reviews.Author: gaypar20
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great. I had read reviews before I left, so I did not touch the candy, water, etc., that they charge for in the rooms. The rooms were spacious and lovely. After reading about the $750 cupcake at Sweet surrender, I just had to see it. I did not pay attention to the clerks (possiblely store managers) name. I entered the store (only my Mom and I in the store) politely asked about the $750 cupcake, the clerk was put out that I even asked, pointed to a picture on the wall, then promptly turned around and continued what she was doing. She did not offer any other info. Nor did she offer me any other cupcake, or what the cost was of any of the cupcakes in the store. I was willing to pay $20 for a cupcake, (which is way too much). After her rudeness, I decided not to purchase anything or even look around in the store. I was actually shocked by her behavior and never mentioned anything to the front desk or anyone else for that matter. We ate in the Grand Lux cafe.....Polynesian Salad was fabulous, and a small cheese pizza that was also great (homemade crust...delicious).

Reviews.Title: “Second time was the charm... I really loved it and recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo last summer and really was not impressed. However on a second visit my opinion really changed. This time, I loved it and I would stay there again –and strongly recommend it to others. ROOM: We had booked the “Luxury Suite” (the cheapest room) and over the phone I was told it would be $30 a night to get a view of the Strip. Instead of paying upfront, I asked nicely at check in, and we got a free upgrade to a “Luxury Suite” on a high floor with an incredible view. On the weekend there was lots of noise from the pool (blaring club music) but otherwise it was very quiet (except when some window washers passed by outside the window and banged on it loudly for quite a few minutes). The bed was extremely comfortable and the extra space (couch, desk, table, etc.) makes a big difference from a normal sized hotel room. You really have room to spread out and feel at home. The bathroom is also very big and this time, I found it less ‘dark’ – although, it is still quite dim – even when I brought a mirror to the window, I still didn’t think there was much light. POOL: From the window of our room I could see if the pool was busy or not, and in the mornings on weekdays it was pretty empty. However, I found that it was incredibly hot outside by the pool (granted it was August) and there is absolutely no shade unless you get a cabana. There are no pool umbrellas, etc. At certain times of day there is some shade from the shadow of the building, but that passes and then you basically feel like you are being cooked by the sun. Unbearably hot. I guess their goal is to get you inside to the casino… but still, the lack of shade was just painful. The pool chairs are all pushed close together in long rows (imagine being in a theatre but its lounge chairs instead of regular seats) so there is no privacy – you are basically right on top of the people next to you, unless you get a cabana. Also, smoking seems to be permitted at the pool. For me this was a bad thing. RESTAURANTS: The food at SOLARO by Wolfgang Puck by the pool was shockingly good. However the seats and tables were quite dirty, which was a turnoff until the food arrived and we forgot all about the dirty tables and chairs. We also had dinner at Postrio Bar & Grill, Tao, Noodle Asia, and Zeffirino - all delicious - and a friend was thrilled to find that Canyon Ranch Café and Grill accommodated his crazy diet restrictions. SPA: I had a pedicure and massage at Canyon Ranch Spa. The spa is very nice, but not over-the-top craziness nice. The lounge areas were great – the only place in the hotel outside your room where you can just sit and read a book in A/C for a few hours. The prices were not outrageous (all things considered) and I was able to use a discount coupon that was provided to us upon check-in. LOCATION: The location of the Palazzo is amazing for shopping. It’s right across from the Fashion Show Mall. You don’t need to go outside to get to all the great Palazzo shops and Grand Canal shops. Even in the heat it’s not so bad to walk to the Forum Shops at Caesar’s. Although I did love staying at the Encore, in comparison it is quite far away from the rest of the strip, and in the blazing heat, having to walk a few extra blocks is unbearable. On the sidewalk between the Palazzo and the Venetian (you cannot access it from inside the hotels) is a Walgreens drugstore (food, drinks, tons of cheap souvenirs, and the usual pharmacy/drug store stuff), to stock up on bottles of water, snacks, etc. The worst thing about this hotel is the endless loop of Phantom of the Opera songs playing at high volume in the elevators. Overall I was very impressed on this second visit and I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Five-Star Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Futuremauian
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Palazzo (& Venetian) for 4 days last week. Our comped suite was as always, spectacular! Special thanks to Kent at check-in for locating us right above the main pool, as requested. The view was great, and he was exceptionally professional. I've visited more than 80 countries around the world and have never stayed anywhere (including neighboring 5-star hotels), that rival this resort for over-the-top accomodations. In many cities, several luxury hotel rooms could fit inside the smallest one here. (I can recall a hotel room in Hong Kong that was smaller than my bathroom at the Palazzo.) There are numerous swimming pools, hot spas, cabanas, cafes, shops, etc., located on the fourth floor deck between the two buildings. There are also two hip, exclusive pools, with cover charges on the weekends. Tao Beach, near the Venetian, and Azure, by the Palazzo. In addition, both hotels have shopping malls, numerous restaurants operated by famous chefs, as well as all other amenities you expect at a luxury resort. Wherever you are on this property you can count on being treated with respect by the employees. Minor complaints: Put coffee-makers in the rooms, and umbrellas around the pools. I didn't have any luck at the tables or machines here, but I guess that's the idea! Even so, It was a great getaway vacation. I strongly recommend a stay here, even as a one-time splurge! Best of luck, too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: dvar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for a weekend on the Prestige level. We usually stay @ the Bellagio, but decided to try the Prestige level to mixed results. Overall, the hotel is very nice, rooms are very spacious. The Prestige level did not live up to our expectations - it just was not even close to on the same level as a Ritz Carlton club level. It was packed during the food presentations/ cocktail hour and just seemed too much like a factory during those times, would have preferred more frequent offerings as with other club levels at which I've stayed. That said, staff at the lounge was really wonderful. Also, we used the Canyon Ranch spa and fitness center. The fitness center was packed and not up tonCanyon Ranch hype, the spa was nice, but slso crowded and did nit seem vas luxe as that at either the Bellagio or the Wynn. The location of the hotel was also nice as were the restaurants, but somehow it was lacking some of the personality of the Bellagio and I don' think we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the strip, nice rooms, stingy on comps!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellinDan
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino are top notch, nice amenities, friendly staff, delicious food, entertaining shows, huge rooms (suites actually...all rooms are suites)...everything you want from a casino on the strip. Not cheap, but not overly expensive. The only negative thing I have to say about the casino/hotel is their stinginess on comps. How much money do I have to lose in the casino before there is some kind of comp? It was even confirmed by a dealer at a table. I'm not a big fish but I do drop a lot of money when gambling. If you're looking for a nice Vegas experience, te Palazzo is great. If you're looking for a good rewards program as well, you can get the Vegas experience and the rewards from another place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great as always”
Reviews.Author: bigfatposterman
Reviews.Content: stayed at the palazzo for 5 nights in august. have stayed her before and frequent vegas 1-2x per yr from east coast. Have stayed at about 12 or so different hotels in vegas. palazzo and venetian are great. they are big enough with enough things to do that you dont have to leave if you dont want to numerous lounges, bars, clubs, tooooo many choices on places to eat from top of the line to places to just grab quick sandwich. the shopping area is great as well from high end books and art to the gap if you need a quick shirt. the lay out of the hotel is big and winding but easy to manuver. it is also very central on the strip across from mirage, takes up about a block of the strip, easy to get to wynn etc etc. several pools from both hotels pool at palazzo is great i went to left side (after entering) pool smaller and get sun earlier in the day waitresses were fast with drinks and food available. also adult only pools azure and tao beach both good pool parties. this hotel is great for any ages younger party crowd and older crowd. it is so big there is room for all! gaming floor at palazzo is open and never feels crowded. spa was top notch and relaxing. food here unreal pick anywhere you will be happy, lavo and tao, morels all great..

Reviews.Title: “OMG.....I Love Vegas and this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ilovejimmychoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and we had originally booked the Venetian, however upon checkin they asked if we wanted to up grade to the Palazzo overlooking the strip. Glad we did as the room was fantastic. Took a taxi from the airport and was at the front doors in no time. Was greated by door staff who were very friendly and helpful. When you walk into reception it is very oppulant and there are several checkin desks. Checkin was a breeze and we only had about a 5 minute wait. As we upgrded to the Palazzo part of the resort, they was quite a long walk to the hotel lifts. You walk through the Venetian casino, then through a part of the shopping complex which leads into the Palazzo casino. The room was amazing!!! Split on 2 levels, the top level housing the beds, Built in wardrobe, dresser and the lower level housing the huge sofa, coffee table and writing desk. There were 2 huge, very comfy beds to choose from, each with their own full length stools at the foot of the bed. There is a very large dresser with plenty of storage space and a substantial built in wardrobe with plenty of hangers. Windows are full length and we had a great view overlooking the strip. Husband used to enjoy watching the pirate show while I was getting ready. The bathroom was a good size, with 2 sinks, 2 mirros, vanity table, shower cubicle and oversized bath. Toilet was in a seprate room within the bathroom. There were 3 televisions in the room, one opposite the bed, one in the sitting/lounge area and one in the bathroom. Maid service was spot on and the the room was extremely clean, all toiletries were replensihed daily. Everything you need is in the hotel, iron, ironing board, hairdryer etc etc. What I thought was a good idea is that unless everyone in your party has a room card you can not enter the lifts as security would not allow you past to the lift points. The whole of the resort, incuding casino was extremely clean. The mall within the hotel is FANTASTIC, especially as it had my favourite shoe store in there!!!! All in all, we had a great holiday and have totally fallen in love with Vegas. Would definatly stay at this hotel again. We stayed in August 2009 and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster Strikes”
Reviews.Author: wwman
Reviews.Content: When my family checked in, we found out that our 2 connecting reserved rooms had been given away. They placed us in a big suite for one night and said tomorrow morning before 10AM we would be switched to conncting rooms. We did not unpack since we thought we were moving the next morning. The next morning came and went with no call. Finally at 5:30 PM they transferred us. We unpacked at last; however one of the two new rooms had a very bad odor emanating from the bathroom. Engineering came up at about 5:45PM and disinfected the bathroom. We were now late for the Terry Fator show, and we left about 7:30 for the show. We missed the beginning of the show. We got back to the room at 12;30AM. It still stunk. The housekeeping manager came and dumped a bottle of chemicals down the shower drain. It still didn't work. They offered to move us up to the 47th floor, but our kids were now asleep. We also decided not to move because we were tired and it takes a lot of time to pack and unpack. We did not come here to play musical rooms. So we simply closed the bathroom door and put up with the stench. . Meamwhile I injured my arm when the elevator did not stop level with the floor. I then saw this happen several more times with their elevators. On the good side, the casino staff were very nice as were the the bellman. The hallways were always dirty. The beds were very hard. I would never consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas' most spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Deb_Buderim
Reviews.Content: this hotel is phenomenal!. the rooms, casino everything is 5 star all the way. we could not believe the quality of the hotel rooms , massive even by vegas standards, all the staff provided excellent service and always with a smile,this went all the way from the porter and doorman to the restuarant managers. Pallazzo is great place to base yourself at the new end of the strip with shopping , casinos ,restuarants and shows all close by. will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CaspianJVC
Reviews.Content: This place is with out a doubt very flash. The rooms are huge with everything you would need. The only thing stopping me from giving 5 stars is that they do not replace the bath gell or shampoo. For the money you pay this is the least they can do. Also the resort fee is a bit on the steep side at $17 / night. You don't really get anything for this other than a paper you have to go and pick up as well as internet access which i might add is very fast. I think $5 - $10 wuld be enough.

Reviews.Title: “Could easily put up a fight to be into the top 5 hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FierceTraveler
Reviews.Content: As I mentioned in my other reviews, I travel to Vegas extensively and always try to stay at a different hotel to evaluate the quality and the service of all of them. This past two months I stay at NyNy Las Vegas, Caesars Palace and Aria, and in a couple of weeks I will be at the Wynn for a week. Let me start by saying that I was pleasantly surprise about the Palazzo, not being a big fan of theme hotels any more. The parking lot is underground which is not the nicest thing, but its compensated with the fact that you don´t need to walk much to be at the casino (which is a big plus in Vegas) When you enter this property, you feel very welcomed. The smell is great. Check in was extremely fast, less than 4 minutes (ask for a high floor at the counter and got a 39th room without paying upgrades or tipping) Elevators are at the center of the hotel (another nice touch) The casino itself is not very big, but you have the Venetian next door, plus a shopping mall and a bunch of high end restaurants. Rooms are extremely well appointed, not as big as the Venetian but very modern and elegant decor. We had 2 queens, a large living room, a desk and a big bathrooms, 3 plasma screen in total. (closet a little small for the room size) Bathroom: 2 sink, a separate tub and shower and a vanity table and chair. Pool area is nicely landscaped and you can go into the Venetian pool (another plus) one of the pools is topless Restaurants are very goog, but if you want to have a great meal, it will be expensive as everywhere else in Vegas. The only downside is that there is not a buffet on the premises, which is unthinkable in sincity, but you are steps away from the Wynn (probably the best buffet on the Strip) There is a huge mall across the street (Fashion Show) and you are in a nice location that is developing fast, also very convenient to the Convention Center. So overall, I would definitely stay here away without thinking about it. There is a group of hotels: Wynn, Aria, Cosmopolitan, Mandarin Oriental, Caesars, Bellagio and I would add Palazzo as the top hotels in Vegas, it is just a matter of personal taste since all of them are premiere accomodations. I would recommend any of them if you get a good deal on the rate. Once you visit them all, you will decided what is best for your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonster71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo for three nights. We did get an offer in the mail for three free nights, free show and 150 in casino credit. We couldn't pass up such a great offer. The room was very luxurious. I didn't think I'd enjoy such a fancy room as much as I did since you really don't spend much time in your room in Vegas, but it was still a great bonus. Quiet and the blackout curtains were a great benefit as we did nap during the day. It's really convenient to be able to walk right into the Venetian as we gambled and ate at both Palazzo and Venetian while we were there. Something you get at a more expensive hotel is great service and better selections of drinks/beer at their bars. We were able to get beers from many of the Craft Breweries like Dogfish Head, Stones and others at their bars. Even on the casino floor for the "free" drinks you could get a big selection. Our first night we arrived late and we asked on the casino floor where to go to get players cards and instead of directing us, the person just went and got our cards and brought them back to us. The hotel grounds were very clean. The casino is open and spacious. The Phantom show which was free with our deal was great! The tickets weren't in the nose bleed section either. We were very close to the front. We ate at Delmonico which is in Venetian. This was our second time there and it was excellend once again. We hope to get more offers to Palazzo as now that we've stayed there, we don't want to stay anywhere else! We have stayed at Las Vegas Hilton, Caesars, Bally's, Golden Nugget, Terribles, Monte Carlo, Flamingo and Tropicana. If you like a little luxury with your Las Vegas experience, this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Amenities perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: JerseyMomOttawa
Reviews.Content: My husband had to attend a conference for business. Our ten year old daughter and I came along a few days before the conference as a mini vacation and we stayed in the Prestige Suites. This offers a private check in and exclusive lounge and amenities which were very welcoming and lets you avoid the overwhelming casino scene. The extras provided made for a nice family experience. Our Prestige suite was a huge room with two queen beds and a living room area so we didn't feel crowded in. The lounge offered a continental breakfast, refreshments in the afternoon, and complimentary cocktails and hors d'oeuvres after 5pm. Breakfast was very generous and offered a large variety of items including hot egg and ham filled croissants. Afternoon refreshments included iced tea, lemonade and small treats...we kept popping up throughout the day to stay hydrated. In the late afternoon, the cocktails and appetizers were so nice, we opted out of dinner at the Bellagio one night.
