There are many pools at the Palazzo, one especially for the "21+" off to the side, which leaves the large main pool a comfortable environment for families. A large selection of complimentary DVDs were offered, which we took advantage of one night when we wanted to stay in. The concierge even made fresh popcorn for us. From the comfort of our room, we were able to watch the pirate show and fireworks at Treasure Island...terrific since it was incredibly hot during our stay. We also discovered that if you go up one floor from the casino, you can access the guest elevators through the shopping mall level without having to walk through the smoky casino...great when you have a young child along who is not used to smoke. There are three types of family shows on the property and a host of restaurants, including one run by the Cheesecake factory. Zefferinos was also a very family friendly restaurant. The food was delicious and good value. We didn't feel like we needed to leave the Palazzo property. At the end of our stay, my husband had to transfer to another hotel where the conference was held. He was sorry to go and more so when he discovered the other hotel was a huge step down in quality from the Palazzo. Las Vegas is not normally our first choice for a family holiday, but the Palazzo proved to be an oasis for my family. It is a very elegant facility without being snooty. The prestige lounge was an added feature that helped us shield our daughter from much of the undesirable elements of Vegas. The staff really help to make our stay welcoming and personal. It made our stay more of a family resort experience and well worth the extra penny. This mom was grateful for a stress-free family vacation with the best of Vegas thrown in. We will certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, good room”
Reviews.Author: katyconnor
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Vegas for a Bachellorette party with several girlfriends and we stayed at the Palazzo. The Palazzo is a pretty standard 4 star vegas hotel. The rooms were nice and fairly large. We got a suite for a discounted price because we booked well in advance and that was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “One step short of perfect...and that's pretty good”
Reviews.Author: motohigh
Reviews.Content: I came close to giving Palazzo a top rating. It deserves a 4.8 rather than just a 4...but Trip Advisor does not give that flexibility. The imperfections at Palazzo are, admittedly, nitpicking, but they did bother me during my stay. By example, $17 per day for a resort fee that includes only a few benefits, one of which is free daily newspaper. But rather than deliver to your doorknob, you have to go down to a shop on the 2nd floor to get it, and if they are busy you have to wait your turn in line. The fitness center's locker rooms (on the Venetian side) are not fully enclosed, run a bit drafty, and the water was not quite hot enough. Altogether, a bad combination. Beyond that, fabulous rooms, great elevators, excellent food options. The casino is a bit sterile and, like many Strip casinos now, their Blackjack dealers will hit a soft 17. Were they just not making enough money off us gamblers already?

Reviews.Title: “Didn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: xmas05
Reviews.Content: Stayed in two suites at the palazzo for five days in July. We are a family of six. We had a great vacation and lived the suites. We had a great experience dining at the Grand Lux cafe and found it to be great value for excellent quality food. There are several pools which we loved and used everyday. Poolside service was a little slow considering the price of drinks. Kudos and special mention of Giuseppe at the front desk who offered excellent customer service. I will say that I have had better luck at almost every other casino I've ever been too

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, great shops!”
Reviews.Author: kavbt1983
Reviews.Content: 6 girls were all staying together for a bachelorette party on my outing at the Palazzo. The room was VERY nice and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was HUGE and had a separate shower and tub. My only complaint was that we came back from the pool at 2pm and our room still hadn't been cleaned. Nice place though!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas 3 nights for R&R. The pool is shady until noon, there are several pools, 2 of which you can sit in with a lounge chair. They pass out frozen pops, orange wedges and cucumbers during the day there to deal with the heat--over 100 degrees. Not much shade can be found. There are numerous restaurants on the property, you never have to leave. Parking was easy. Lux cafe has a breakfast buffet for $17 (not a mega buffet, but very adequate--good quality). Great buffet at Wynn just across the bridge. Ate at Spa cafe for breakfast--healthy meals and salads reasonable. Asked for a room near the elevator which I got. The rooms are huge, roll out draw type safe, fax machine in the room, great work space, 3 TVs!Resort fee is $17, includes internet. Lovely furniture and heavenly bed. MAde for a great relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will return but some shortcomings!”
Reviews.Author: fffour
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Venetian and Palazzo many times; the Palazzo is by far my favorite and I will return! We picked the Prestige package - as a family of four with small kids, this is a great option - beginning with the checkout - no waiting in the sometimes long lines, simply take the elevator up to the Concierge lounge and check in there! Both visits we arrived before 10 AM, were granted early check in and got great rooms overlooking the strip and the Pirates / Sirens show! Sadly, this most recent visit was a little lacking! When we arrived into the room, it was not as clean as we have come to expect - the ottoman was covered in fingerprints and there were numerous dusty surfaces. We found a childs shirt in one draw and some trash in another. The cupboard did not always close and one drawer was broken! But still the rooms are very spacious, bathrooms are beautiful and I would chose nothing else! This visit we did find general cleaning slow and below standard - this however ended when one day - having been out the room from 8AM and arriving back from the pool at 4 PM the room was just beginning to be worked on - a quick complaint ensured a very clean room and each morning we called down for an early clean! The cleaning staff seemed grumpy and overwhelmed; one got very upset when we simply asked for another towel (we had just two in the room) The Prestige package is a great option for an extra $100 a day: each morning there is a breakfast option - nothing fancy, but great with kids - various types of coffee drinks, water, fresh fruit juice, fresh fruit, cereal, pastries and cooked items. Lunchtime you can just grab candy (a feast for the kids) lemonade , waters and sodas....when you think how much you will spend on breakfast and waters alone this is worth it! The evening sees an open bar -with good top shelf drinks, champagne, wine , cocktails, There are basic hot and good snacks but some folks were clearly expecting a full dinner - which is not what was advertised. This time the place was packed and a staff member we recognized from the past told us that there were always three staff members in the evening and this had not changed to reflect that fact that word has got out and this package is more popular! As a result food ran out quickly (though we saw several greedy folks stuffing their purses with celery and carrots no less!) and drinks took a while to arrive - more staff are clearly needed! The property is beautiful, smells great and the food choices are amazing - Morels is a great choice for brunch (try the Bloody Mary's) ; First has excellent choices with a cool upbeat vibe....think Sublime playing as everyone sings along, with simple yet tasty food!! Carnevino was excellent (beware to ask carefully for kids options though as we were charged $36 for basic pasta!!!) Pools are beautiful and plentiful....shallow water for kids, seats in pools for adults! So much to do, in such a great setting...I will be back but hopefully they have the right staff by then!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom checked into the Palazzo on Thursday about 2 hours before the recommended check in time! We were upgraded from a Bella suit in the venetian to a suit of the same category for free! The woman at the front desk just gave us an upgrade. She was really nice and we got into our room quickly and easily. The room was larger than my moms first apartment and the bathroom was bigger than our kitchen. The room was very clean and we had the BEST view imaginable! We looked out on the strip and could see the mirage volcano and the ti pirate show! It was such a great room and we had a great time. They have tons of dinning option as and everyone is so nice! On the down side the hotel was a little confusing, but hey it's Vegas all the hotels are! Alain to get to the concierge we were on hold for about 3 or 4 mins but that's to be expected in a hotel with 7,000 rooms. The rooms are completely sound proof and we couldn't hear any hallway noise. We had a view of the pools so we could just check to see when it was the least crowded! ( before 10 and after 5) it was great! Me and my mom loved it and we would recommend it to anyone! Great hotel and we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Sandwich is a LIE”
Reviews.Author: troublemakerrr
Reviews.Content: Those of you who have reviewed this hotel and have promised fabulous upgrades from tipping the front desk staff are LIARS. My bf suggested the idea after reading on this website that if you put money (usually $20) between your ID and your credit card and hand it to the front desk staff, you will be given free upgrades. Usually either in the form of an upgraded suite or free tickets to Madame Tussauds or spa tickets. Upon trying the "vegas sandwich", the front desk clerk (a Caucasian girl with dark hair named Amy) pocketed my money (in a very shady way so she has obviously ripped off people before), and gave me a room on the 40th floor. She also gave me coupons that every single guest at the Palazzo would receive anyway. I asked for spa tickets or Madame Tussauds tickets and she said that they did not have any. When we got to our room, it was FILTHY. It had not been cleaned at all!! The bed was dirty and unmade, the bathroom had dirty towels on the floor, there was garage still in the suite. Upon called the front desk to complain, they gave me a strip view room on the 39th floor. I asked later on to see if the 40th floor room was a strip view room and it was NOT. Moral of story, DO NOT TRY THE VEGAS SANDWICH. IT IS A COMPLETE SHAM. Aside from getting ripped off by the front desk clerk Amy, the stay was enjoyable. I loved the pool, the hotel, and my suite. All the hotel staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT refer your friends and family”
Reviews.Author: PGore
Reviews.Content: This property is one of the newest hotels on the block, and to be honest lacks the spirit and ambiance of some other hotels, like its sister proprty -- the Venetian. My wife and I stayed here 2 times and until recently referred 3 families, benefiting the hotel from the sale of 6 suites in one year. Apparently, the fact that you referred a person gives you nothing according to the hotel's Marketing Department. For sure, not a thank-you card, or a discount at the SPA on your next stay. In fact, when I was attempting to make a new reservation, the hotel would not even provide me with an existing coupon offer, asking for the full price. Shame on you, Palazzo. I will no longer support this business, and my advise to you fellow-Venetian and Palazzo guests is to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: elliottsa
Reviews.Content: Having spent the best part of two weeks travelling we decided to go all out for the Vegas experience and elected to stay at the Palazzo based on reviews on this wonderful website. Okay, so it's not the cheapest option but then you do get chocolate on your pillows for turn down service and a great view of the strip. The rooms were spacious, clean, luxurious and quiet. The bed in particular was amazing - we had sampled a few dodgy ones on our travels! Loved the motorised curtains in the morning! If you stay here I would recommend the Prestige Luxury rooms. The 'Prestige' system is more expensive but definitely worth it. You dedicated private check in and champagne reception on the 23rd floor at the 'Prestige Lounge'. Free canapés and free drinks from 5pm - 8pm every day! The lounge has a great view of the strip and in particular the Treasure Island pirate show. Free breakfast from 6.30 - 10.00am - simple but enough to keep you going until dinner later that evening. It was not overly crowded but was popular; great for people watching! About $214.75c per night when signing up for 'Grazzie' - we did this on the phone and was worth bargaining then down to this price. If you intend to have a flutter on the casino floor remember to sign up for the 'Grazzie' card to get slot credits on the amount you put in - a good system. The desk is located on the Venetian casino floor. We are already planning to return to this fabulous hotel for Christmas! If you are looking for luxury and good value then the Palazzo with 'Prestige' is your best option. A warning to British travellers - hotel pre authorisation eats away at your credit or pre pay card; anything from $150 - $500! Try to have a pre pay dollar card like Caxton FX to pay the balance and an empty credit card to secure the pre authorisation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great service”
Reviews.Author: OzyFreddles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. A great hotel, extremely large luxurious room, good restaurants. However - did not seem to value me as an Ambassador member, perhaps the hotel is too large and you just become part of the vast wave of people flowing through!

Reviews.Title: “Five star rooms, three star service”
Reviews.Author: theamericannomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the 47th floor. And even though we only had a regular room (no upgrades), it was spacious, trendy and very comfortable. My husband and I both agreed that we felt like we could live there. (By the way, the super huge bathroom was an experience unto itself.) The room was also incredibly quiet--we heard nothing outside our room. The hotel staff was mostly friendly until someone was smoking in their room on our floor. When we called to inform the staff, they were rude and very unhelpful. The woman on the phone screamed at my husband. (We're not really sure why--we thought we were doing them a favor, since it is very difficult to rid a room of the smell of cigarette smoke.) The pool was nice, but crowded. There are no umbrellas, so shade is very difficult to find. Smoking is allowed at the pool, which I didn't like. Overall, the rooms are great and, in spite of the lackluster service, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning rooms, great service, awesome property!”
Reviews.Author: mike257
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my 4th trip to Vegas in 2011, I have stayed almost everywhere on the strip. The Palazzo ranks up there with my favourites. Upon checkin we were upgraded to a Sienna Suite free of charge, it was a stunning room. Amazing, full living room, separate bedroom, workout room, bathroom of over 150sq ft, jacuzzi tub. Impossible to fault them on this! Beautiful. The casino was a lovely break from the crazy action elsewhere, even when busy it was not as smokey due to good ventilation and nice high ceilings. The usual assortment of slots, table games range from $15+. Pools were awesome as well, it was nice to see it connected to the Venetian. The Palazzo has 4 pools of its own, and the Venetians deck next door is also large and only about a 4 min walk from the Palazzo pool. While not the best pool on the strip its still very pretty, and I enjoyed my hours in the hot sun on one of the loungers plunked in the pool. Nothing in my mind sticks out as annoying or obtrusive in any way. One of the most convenient things we had was the parking garage location. It was literally a 30 second walk from the room elevators to our car, this is not the case at so many other properties. Also nice is the Grand Luxe Cafe at both Venetian and Palazzo, its by the Cheesecake Factory people, generous portions, and truly delicious. My favourite hotels in Las Vegas are still Encore and Wynn, but this is easily tied with them! Don't hesitate to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Rooms. Terrible Comps”
Reviews.Author: fatubus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 40th birthday party for a relative and I must say that the room is really nice. I ended up paying roughly $250/night to stay here. I gambled quite a bit and when I asked about comps, they removed one charge for the resort fee (total BS fee if you ask me). Besides this, Cut is a great restaurant if you want to spend the money for a great steak. If you like to shop, there are plenty of places to shop. One thing that I was not keen on was having to show my room key every time I went to my room. Maybe the first time for security purposes, but every time? Anyway the rooms get a 5 and everything else a 1 to average my 3.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality at the top end”
Reviews.Author: happenstance3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to take advantage of the sleeper sofa in the living room, the easy access to top nightclubs, and the affordable rates. We also comparison-shopped the Aria, Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, and Wynn. The Palazzo turned out to have the largest rooms and the easiest means of accommodating six guys in two rooms without breaking the bank. We got two adjoining Bella (2 queens) Suites and some amenities. Everyone had their own bed, though the fold-out sleeper sofa is not a queen-size and you'd be hard-pressed to sleep two in it. We didn't choose the Prestige level because it just didn't look like good value. We had no problems at check-in, or with extra keys. While Sushisamba and Morels were disappointing, the hotel VIP passes to Lavo worked smoothly and we had a great time there. The resident DJ was great. The chairs in the sports book are comfy, and the staff friendly, especially toward first-time bettors who are still learning. Strip-view rooms meant that we were looking at Treasure Island and the Mirage. I don't know if it would be worth it to pay extra for that view, or for a high floor. Yes, the walks are long from point A to point B. It's a large hotel, as are the rest of the properties on the Strip. The casino was mercifully small in comparison to the Wynn or others. We also visited friends in rooms at TI and PH, and the drop-off in room quality is precipitous. We're glad we paid a little extra. We're also glad we paid to stay at a happening location rather than the lifeless Vdara or Trump. Negatives: 1. Housekeeping never replaced our little toiletry bottles, and they ran low. That feels like nickel-and-dime-ing for a five-star hotel. 2. The pool is nice, but you had to get there early to get seats. Often rows of seats would be "reserved" with nothing more than towels, their owners nowhere in sight. That wasn't so great. The Palazzo poools were definitely nicer than the Venetian pool, which had a thin layer of grease on the surface on a weekend. There are about five pools to choose from, each with a different "scene." Overall, we would stay here again. Good value, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nyJt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Palazzo a few times over the years ans I think they really try to keep the property up. Some reviewers state its starting to show its wear, but I don't find that at all. The carpeting in hallways and in room were in perfect shape. Yes some of the drawers, etc. had little dings on it but that is to be expected from any hotel, since many people are rough and not caring for thier surroundings. The rooms them self were clean, large, nice and quiet. On the outside of my room in hallways there would be sometimes loud people etc. and once my door was shut I heard nothing or very little. I heaqrd nothing from units next to me. Once again I think the rooms are very very good and would rate them alone a 5 out of 5. There are no coffee makers, as many hotels in vegas! Bathroom, water pressure, toiletries were all very nice. Bed very nice, pillows nice Good selection of tv channels hotel very large and very busy casino very busy, but the palazzo is much slower pace than the venitian which is a short walk to get to food choices very nice but very expensive in most part. location is nice but still to me nothing beats the harrhas location for hotel bopping (a short distance away, probally 10 minute walk) I would have no problem staying there again its wonderful, although sometimes a little to large for me. I am getting a little tired of casino hotel having young nightlife, clubs. To me it takes away fromt he old vegas feel, less people gaming more people clubbing. They next drwback to that is all the younger clientelle (some of them) making lots of noise, screaming and carrying on. The outfits on some oft he girls is wow also, hard to tell between call girls and regular ladies (seriously) All in all I think next time I will stay at a smaller hotel or even maybe on eoff the strip, but once again the palazzo is awesome and I was treated well, and when requesting anything the service was prompt and fiendly!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: JHDawg
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palazzo 3 times now and each trip it gets better. We were treated exteremely well. The Presitge level was great. Jose the at Presitge was especially wonderful . Our room was extraordinary and beautiful. The pool situation was very nice as families tended to gather at the larger pool and couples at the smaller ones. Drink service in the casino was very timely. Our spa day at the Canyon Ranch Spa was memorable. The only negative is the room door situation. Sometimes if your neighbors are not aware ,the door can slam due to heavy spring loaded closer. The Doors keep this from a 5 star report

Reviews.Title: “Stay at The Cosmopolitan!”
Reviews.Author: Mijaye2000
Reviews.Content: We got a decent rate at The Palazzo and chose this property. The rooms are decent, but as a couple looking to have fun, we ended up going to the Cosmopolitan a lot. Our friends stayed there too and I liked the contemporary rooms and younger crowd there. In general, I prefer boutique hotels and I know that is hard to find in Vegas. The Palazzo is too big for my taste. The walk to the casinos and dining is far. The pool is nice, but it gets overly crowded so go early for prime seating. The scene at Tao Beach is better than the pool at the Palazzo. Overall, it's a nice hotel, but not recommended for people under 40.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LUXURY”
Reviews.Author: Palongi
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel with top customer service and all the luxuries you could want. We stayed in the Bella suite on the 42nd floor and had an amazing view. The suite had 3 tv's and was fabulously decorated. The Palazzo also offers you all the luxuries of the Venetian as well so you are really getting two resorts for the price of one! Amazing pools and wonderful selection of restaurants! Oh and the beds were super comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Your wife will love it ... and you will too!”
Reviews.Author: DodgerDan
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveler to las Vegas, I usually stay at the Mirage simply because every stay there to date has been awesome. So why change - right? We'll, my wife was hedging a bit this past Spring and was about to put the kybosh(sp?) on Vegas destination. Our friend who my wife & I hold in high reguard recommended we give The Palazzo a try so we did. Now, my wife is not a gambler AT ALL but she loves luxurious accomodations, great spas and phenominal service, which is exactly what she got this trip. Also, The Palazzo had no shortage of great restaurants. The Venetian, which IMO, is an "older" Palazzo, is attached to the Palazzo by indoor hallways and offers additional gambling, shops and restaurants. Nice. It is pricey and unless you have some serious comps accrued from your gambling activity, a base room (which is VERY nice/spacious) is gonna run every bit of $130/night plus fees. I found the additional cost worth it for a "wife-approved" vacation. She seems very receptive to a return in the near future and the accomodations and customer service at The Palazzo have a lot to do wth it.

Reviews.Title: “sucked”
Reviews.Author: jennyjackass
Reviews.Content: Large hotel, large room, overall experience it sucked. The size of the pool for the size of the hotel is ridiculous. Very small very shallow pools 2 I think, they advertise 6 pools, thats BS. It was shoulder to shoulder in the pools (if you can call them that) no chairs to sit. The pool service or lack there of was crappy. When they did come with water the server stood there waiting for a tip. NOT COOL. Food was not that great. The lux cafe made us sick, spent the last day of out trip in our room with tummy issues - don't eat there. Even for breakfast, the eggs were really slimy. Have stayed at the Bellagio (LOVED IT) and the MGM (very good hotel), so I can say that I can make a comparison. I wouldn't stay here there are much better hotels on the strip two of which I just mentioned. Check in was a gong show, stood in line forever, once we got the the counter the guy was rude, was talking to another employee about the girl in the dress behind me, instead of serving us considering that is what he is paid to do. We paid for an upgrade to a suite, he said $100 per night charge, when we checked out, they charged us $190 per night! They would not reduce the bill even though we were quoted at $100 extra per night. Location is very good, close to the Wynn (which we will stay there the next time - gorgeous) and across the street from the fashion mall. Cabs this time were horrible. Got swindled twice, they took us on the freeway instead of the city streets which ended up costing $29.00 when we should of paid $15 maybe. Just beware of the cabbies, they drive like maniacs and will rip you off because they think you don't know better. stick to the city streets and you'll be fine. we saw mystere at Treasure Island, loved the show. Just don't go to the Beatles love - you'll be disappointed. we only stayed here because of the deal online. would not stay here again or recommend it to others. even the casino was tight, won nothing, however at treasure island we did win $5000 jackpot - there is still hope out there yet! Sorry no photos my camera is not working. will post once its fixed.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: ag777
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Venetian many times, but this was our first time in a Palazzo room and we were very pleased with it and the property as a whole - although there was a glitch with bell services when we arrived. Usually at a 5 star resort, when you step out of your car/taxi/limo the bellman is right there to get your bags. This was not the case, and not being able to see the bell desk (it must have been hidden by a collection of carts) we ended up hauling our luggage to check in, where we demanded bell services and promptly got them. At invited guest check in I noticed this included IHG Priority Club Elite members. The V/P takes their alliance with IHG very seriously, since my Priority Club Platinum card was what got me an upgrade, not the Grazie Gold card or the fact the I was comped. Anyway, loved the room and won't add much to what others have said to describe it. One detail I liked was the real lever-type corkscrew provided with the wine glasses. I was facing the Strip and overlooking the pools, but since I was on the 28th floor the thump thump of the pool party music was barely detectable. Room service was good, and incredibly fast. This, along with the Venetian, is a top notch destination and apart from the opening (small) issue it lives up to the 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly wonderful girl's weekend.”
Reviews.Author: vegaskay
Reviews.Content: First the not so great: Checked in Saturday for girl's weekend. Room not ready, said they would call shortly. After 1 1/2 hours went back to front desk, they said they had tried to call (cell phone showed this to be untrue). Room with 2 "queen" beds-beds were unusually short. Separate sitting area with large couch but it was a little scruffy looking. The good-good rate, great variety of things to do (loved "Jersey Boys"), and discount coupons for several bars and restaurants. Went to Morels for drinks and great cheese plate. Sun. am rolled out of bed and spent the day at Canyon Ranch. We would definitely do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: brucebana
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in las vegas, it has the perfect balance of huge rooms, nice restaurants, great pool, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Cool All-Suites Hotel - Has Everything”
Reviews.Author: missjae15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for the Fourth of July weekend (Sun-Mon.) It was great, as the rooms were lower than anywhere you'd find them for a suite - $150! They have about 10 pools, which include the Venetian pools that are connected. The Lagasse Stadium restaurant had good food, however, the service was terrible. It was obvious they weren't busy, but the servers were very slow (about 1/2 hour to bring us condiments.) Check-in was quick and friendly, even for a holiday weekend. Suite was clean and spacious with a nice view, if you're on the 32nd floor. Felt luxurious for a room you were hardly in, since you're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Kashay
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at the Palazzo and Venetian multiple times during trips to Vegas. I am never disappointed. They are clean, spacious and well designed. I get the Bella Suite with two beds and a seating area. They are identical in both hotels. The casinos are not as exciting with the new hotels opening up, but still good. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Las Vegas resort”
Reviews.Author: mjlv
Reviews.Content: Don't expect any kind of special treatment when you check in. Our room wasn't ready and the desk clerk was quite flippant about the inconvenience. We waited until 5:00PM to get into our room when check in is 3:00PM. We were not offered a late check out time to compensate for the late check in or any other type of compensation (free drink while we wait, etc.). The property is beautiful and our room was quite nice. The beauty of the room was ruined by the lack of soundproofing - we heard other room doors slam constantly. We did not get to enjoy some amenities (shopping, pool) due to lack of time. I did not bother with the spa because it is Canyon Ranch which is overpriced and below average in my opinion. We went to two restaurants that were excellent - the Mexican restaurant for dinner and Grand Luxe for a late breakfast. We also went to the beautiful piano bar which was a lot of fun but the entertainment did not even compare to other local dueling piano acts (Napoleans Lounge at Paris and NY NY). The gaming at this property is terrible - very old machines and set very tight. Play elsewhere if you plan to try slots.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at The Venetian, they have their acts together.”
Reviews.Author: Furman55
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Priority Club member and I have to say my recent stay at The Palazzo was a joke. I arranged for my travel companion to check in early ahead of me, and it was a game of phone tag to find someone who knew how to get that set up. Next I pre-paid to have some refreshments in the room upon my arrival, and that was never done. When I spoke to the hotels so called "Elite Guest" check in, it took 20 minutes of grandstanding just to get that charge reversed for something I never received...and then upon check out, it still wasn't fixed. The hotel does have some nice features - big rooms, multiple pools with great layout, elevators are easy to access and the casino is better size than most. However, I would recommend The Venetian. Thy just seem to have it figured out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service...”
Reviews.Author: ilovevegas77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo July 28th through Aug 1st. The rooms were spacious and beautiful. The casino is easier to navigate than the Venetian next door. I ate at several of the restaurants and found them to be FABULOUS!! The service was impeccable!! Heading to the elevator there was a man/hotel employee busy vaccuming the hallway near the elevator bank. He stopped vaccuming, greeted us and went into the elevator bank ahead of us to push the down button for us. There were so many instances like this at the Palazzo during this trip. Every time you leave or enter the building there is someone there smiling to hold the door open for you. We called down for towels and blankets on 2 occasions and the service was prompt. Once my room key stopped working and they brought up a new one within minutes. We had the same maid every single day. She was funny and warm. We were like old friends by the end of our trip. Honestly I am surprised by how wonderful this stay was. I usually stay at the Venetian (Palazzo's sister property) but I have to say I loved the Palazzo even more. I highly recommend the Palazzo

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, recommend the non smoking room”
Reviews.Author: baddsisterr
Reviews.Content: We had initially selected a "smoking optional" room, and during the walk to our room we could not breathe by the time we got to it. The room had been cleaned, however there were two cocktail glasses left in the room as if people were in there just before we checked in! It stank like smoke, so we complained. They immediately gave us a non smoking room, overlooking the strip with a view of Treasure Island Hotel. The spa was worth the money, the massage was expensive but included the use of the spa facilities. All in all, worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: hawaiimama
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel for his birthday trip. We booked a luxury suite with our airplane thru Allegiant. Because it was his 50th birthday I called and upgraded to the Prestige level prior to arrival. It cost $100 a night more and was very much worth it. The room is self was the same but the extra amenities are fantastic!!!!!! Check -in was simple and easy. You have your own check-in desk for the prestige level on the 23rd floor with champagne. We arrived around 2:30, our room was not quite ready but they took our phone number to call when it was available. We enjoyed cool drinks in the prestige lounge(complimentary) and went to the Shoppes at the Palazzo to walk around. Waited around an hour and received our call our room was ready. Our room was on the 25th floor. Very spacious, divided sitting area with L-shaped couch, desk, table and chairs, flat screen tv, king bed, dresser, large closet. The bathroom was beautiful marble with a vanity you could sit at for hair and makeup. Large tub, 3 head shower, and separate toilet. Large, luxurious toiletry items. The remote controlled sheers and drapes in the room were a big plus!! Our view was of the TI and part of the Mirage. Not expansive as there was a tower to our left but a strip view non the less. We could see 5 of the pools at the Palazzo/Venitian as well. Staff was very helpful and kind, particularly the staff in the Prestige lounge. You really should upgrade to the Prestige level. My husband works out every day and eats breakfast, combined with the included internet and after noon snacks and drinks made this a real bonus. Included are, breakfast, afternoon candy and drinks like sodas, tea, lemonade, coffee, happy hour hot foods, open bar and friendly service. You get daily newspapers, internet, use of gym and no resort fees added. More than the extra you will pay is included. The Hotel is beautiful, and the shopping is wonderful. You are connected to the Venitian and all the wonderful shops there as well. On a side note, I had a nasty fall one evening and the hotel was very helpful with having a wheelchair ready for me when we arrived back by cab, and at no charge either. This was wonderful birthday stay. We loved the Palazzo!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply...AWESOME. Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lipschick
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend the Palazzo highly enough, having stayed in Vegas many times, at hotels such as Luxor, Caesars, Ballys, Harrahs, Mirage, MGM and Mandalay Bay...Palazzo is head and shoulders above the rest. It is simple incomparable. Rooms are massive, huge double bed in mine, massive couches, three TVs (one in bathroom, one in bedroom one in living room), desk, printer / fax / photocopier, massive wardrobe, stunning view. It really was awesome. Definitely will be staying here again. Seen some posts that say the poolis small?!? It isn't there are actually 4 different pools, so perhaps they only saw one of them and didn't realise there were 3 more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. But take some duct tape!”
Reviews.Author: Luckybeckyblue
Reviews.Content: We loved the Palazzo! Here are some of the best things: The room was very spacious. Living area had L-shaped sofa that could easily seat 4-6 people. There is a table with 3 chairs plus a desk complete with fax machine. Bedroom area was also very large. Note that some rooms are different: our travelling companions were on a different wing of the same floor, and paid the same price. Their bedroom was a good 5 or 6 feet narrower than ours. We had very large bedside tables, each with a large lamp with room to spare, plus a chair next to the bed. Our companions had tiny little tables, no lamps, and no chair. We were in the back wing, with a view of the mountains, golf course, and Wynn. We had a limited view of a section of the Strip. You can pay extra for a view room, but how much time are you going to spend looking out your window? Another big plus was the excellent sound insulation. We rarely heard a door slamming or voices in the hallway, but never heard a single peep from rooms above, below, or on either side of us. One of my favorite features was the location of the parking garage. We've stayed at several hotels in Vegas, and if you've ever been there, you know you have to walk a mile to get from your room to anywhere. Well, here at the Palazzo, you can park in the underground garage, and be mere steps from the elevator to your room. TIP: don't bother trying to park on the 1st level where everybody else goes. Drive down the ramp to the third level. There are two sets of elevators, one marked "front desk" and the other marked "casino." Park as near as you can to the casino elevators. (We never had a problem getting a close space.) Take the elevator to the casino or shops level (either level works), turn around the corner, and just a few feet away are the elevators to your room. Yay! It is so nice to park close and have short walk/elevator ride to your room, after you've been walking miles and miles in the Vegas heat. So why do you need duct tape? In the center of the ceiling is a little red light that flashes at irregular intervals. We didn't notice this until the middle of the night on our first night... we went to bed at 2am, and at 3am I was wakened by this red light going off and on. At first I thought it might be some sort of fire alarm. I was using earplugs and when I saw that red light flashing, my first thought was that I might have not heard a warning siren. It bugged me all night. The next day, I asked our companions if they had such a light in their room. It turns out, a previous occupant had covered the light with duct tape, and they slept like babies. I called the desk and asked if something could be done. They said the light is a motion detector which helps reduce energy use in unoccupied rooms, and there was nothing that could be done about it. I went to CVS, bought some electrical tape to cover the light, and slept peacefully for the rest of our stay. We did not use the pool, but it looked nice. There seemed to be a series of small pools, rather than one large one, and lots and lots of comfortable lounge chairs. Pretty fountains and landscaping.It's nice that the elevator stops right near the entrance to the pool, so you don't have to go traipsing through the casino dripping wet in your swimsuit on the way to your room. For gambling: Casino Royale a short walk away has better video poker pay tables, and Harrah's has lower minimum bets on table games. Palazzo casino is beautiful, but you'll pay for those gorgeous amenities. Have fun and good luck in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Prestige at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Konadream
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Prestige suites at the Palazzo for our 25th anniversary at the end of July. The suites have their own check-in which was very quick. The suite was very nice with plenty of room and the bathroom is quite large. The only problem when we got to our room is that none of the lights worked. After calling the desk, we were told to turn on the Master Switch and the problem was solved. (don't know why they didn't just tell us at check-in) Every evening from 5-7 in the lounge are hot/cold hor d'oeuvres and an open bar! In the morning we enjoyed a continental breakfast with fresh fruit, pastries, and a few hot items. We had booked a package that included tickets to Jersey Boys, which was a great show. The suite (with the open bar and breakfast) was reasonable at about $245/night. (not including the show tickets) My only disappointment was that I had told the agent when I booked the room that it was our 25th anniversary and there was no acknowledgment from the check-in staff, concierge, or anyone. (even after I mentioned it) I wasn't expecting anything big but a small token would have gone a long way. (a flower or chocolate with a note) This was a splurge for us and overall it was worth it because the amenities and service were great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chelso83
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. In a great location on the strip. Theres a shopping mall accross the road, a walgreens down below. Staff were friendly. We stayed in a Fortuna suite, which was really big and had nice views of the pools and the strip. The casino was nice also, not as smelly as some of the others we visited. We ordered room service on our last night and it was delicious and didnt cost the world! Overall our Palazzo experience was perfect. The only negative i can think of is the free wifi in the room was annoying because it hardly ever worked, but its no big deal really.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms ,Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PilotReviews
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas a number of times and this is defiantly the best hotel I have stayed in. We stayed in the standard suite that would compare to the honeymoon suite in many hotels. The room was clean, roomy, and fixtures and furnishings and bed quality was of excellent quality. I was surprised at some of the negative reviews on here. We didn't even upgrade for a strip view of the Wynn golf course and with sunrise over the mountains an added bonus. We stayed on the 41st floor as recommended to get the highest floor possible and just asked and reception and they obliged. The only negative about the room is we were given a room with a a joining door that did carry the sound through from the room next door, not too much but a little, but maybe we should have asked. The Hotel itself is excellent, you can walk to the Paris within 10-15 mins and to Belagio within 15-20 mins. Taxi fair from and to anywhere in Vegas seems to be $10-15. Checkin and Checkout were excellent, all staff were great ad always address you y your name when they can find that information. The Casino is great it was quieter than the more touristy Venitien but had the same level of games available. Within 2-5 mins from your room you can be in the venetian cannal shopping center. Hotel was extreamly clean and modern, valet parking, bag store was quick and convenient, and plenty of choice of restaurants available. Read y reviews on Bouchon, and Morrells both very good. The only con was perhaps the pool, i cant say for sure but we think it was very chlorinated, and gave both my partner and I eye issues. However we didn't come to Vegas to sit by a pool and if we had we would have chosen a hotel for its pool such as the Mandalay Bay. As for price it was part of a package, with Virgin Holidays, however was defiantly good value if you take off the approximate price of flights at £400 or 5 nights . Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A fine luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Osprey1
Reviews.Content: Room was good sized, but I still prefer The Hotel at Mandalay Bay as my personal best room- having the true suite setup is nice.- Palazzo is an open plan. It's a shame Venetian didn't build a better pool, but I wasn't impressed. The Prestige, concierge, level was nice- it included food and snacks during the day. The breakfast was a little Holiday Inn Express but classed up as the day went on.

Reviews.Title: “In May I had a bad experience staying here, but it was great again in July!”
Reviews.Author: Moochiebpaul
Reviews.Content: Couldn't write a review for May given time review constraints placed by Tripadvisor . . . but what a let down when I stayed there then!!! I booked a king room and got one, but the air conditioner didn't work. I told the front desk I was going out for the night and they told me they would fix it or change my room to another king room, but they did neither! When I got back early in the morning the person I dealt with was outright rood and basically told me I was getting a room with a double bed and that was that. I wasn't even offered an upgrade, a free meal . . . nothing!!! I understand they were fully booked and can appreciate they were out of the room type on my reservation, but to tell me they would give me at least the same type of room and then not is not the kind of service I would have expected from this hotel. I stayed there again in July and I will say it was up to the same great standards as I always experienced in previous stays other than in May 2011. As such, I think I simply dealt with a jerk in May who is not representative of the quality service this hotel usually gives.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cld5858
Reviews.Content: Hotel and all the employees we encountered were great.....Check in was easy and quick on a mid-afternoon Sunday. Love the breakfast buffet at the Grand Lux and breakfast at the Bochon next store is special. Only complaint is the room and furnishings were a bit tired....should be replaced and refurbished. Always use your rewards card when gambling at this hotel. You get really nice deals.

Reviews.Title: “Better choices available”
Reviews.Author: auggiemctavish
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Venetian several times, I wanted to check out the Palazzo (checked out real quick). The lobby is beautiful, the room spacious, the pool small and nice but thats where it ended. I was not feeling well so I decided to sleep on the couch. I had to call housekeeping for an extra sheet and blanket. Guess they never got the message, I used a ratty blanket from the bed. We had a small credit for room service so we decided to splurge. We asked for a chocolate croissant and plain bagel as part of our four "pastry" selection. The plain bage came toasted, the chocolate croissant plain. They charged ten bucks for the bagel, I guess they considered this extra. Should I have said something when I checkout out? Yes but I didn't, guess I learned my lesson. I suppose if they had asked how my stay was I would have mentioned it, but they never asked. The rooms could use a touch up. I suppose its all based on expectations. I wanted to get credit for IHG priority points. I think they are ashamed of that link up.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe our expectations were too high.”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyOhio
Reviews.Content: It really was a nice stay. The layout and size of the room was perfect. It was the little things that made it not quite 5 stars. The marble was stained or dirty and the holes in the linen that made it seem not quite up to expectations. When we checked in the attendent didn't ask if I should be included on the room reservatiion. Which was quite inconvenient. We had to ask twice for this to happen. I was not able to charge anything to our room until my husband was able to make the request in person. The bathroom was beautiful! We never heard a sound from neighboring rooms. The A/C worked really well. Location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: cliff24_10
Reviews.Content: A beautiful suite overlooking Treasure Island, hotel pools and the strip but high enough to avoid noise. Highly recommend you stay here, although choice of gambling machines poorer than at MGM. Asked for room away from elevators - good move. Take care with refreshment centre - move anything and you're charged a crazy rate for the item even if you don't actually use it. Immaculately clean, pools superb during the week; noisy at weekend. Cabannas too close to other sunbeds, so didn't use one. They looked better than MGM and had fine cooling water spray. Too expensive for what they are.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, rooms are outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Flyinlow427vette
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here for a business meeting. The room was on the 42nd floor and offered outstanding views of the strip. As is typical with the casino rooms, luxury abounds. Everything in the room reflected quality, and I was pleasantly surprised that nothing smelled like smoke as I have experienced in other Vegas hotels. The ventillation here is excellent, as even in the casino I was not overwhelmed by smoke. Since the Palazzo is connected to the Venetian, I have to suggest that you stay in the Palazzo as it is much newer and nicer. There is a lot of shopping right in the casino area without needing to go outside. The conference area is great, as they obviously have a lot of experience hosting large business meetings. Even the catering was good, which is quite a compliment for hotel food. The rooms are not the quietest, as you can hear noise from the hallway and other rooms. I have come to accept this as the standard when staying in a city that never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. I still miss some lower class hotel amenities.”
Reviews.Author: iwilltryit
Reviews.Content: Got a really great deal on a stay here that included a rental car through a online travel site. The hotel is beautiful. I loved the room. Remote controlled window shades, 3 flat screen TV's, a bathroom scale, a closet that the light comes on when opened and an enclosed room for the commode. I still miss the lower class hotel amenities. No coffee in the room. You either get room service or go downstairs and pay $3.50 a cup. No heater in the bathroom. Was chilly stepping out of the shower. You can't use the refrigerator for your own beverages. It is prestocked with charged to your room items. A $17 dollar a day resort fee. Still not sure if I understand this fee. It includes a free paper...we did not want a paper. Includes the use of the gym...we did not use the gym. Includes wi-fi in the room...tried to use this and it worked so slowly (we were trying to check in for our return flight) that we ended up going downstairs and paying $5.77 to do so on the pay computers. The $5.77 included $1 a page fee to print boarding passes. We stayed at a Best Western and the paper, gym use, coffee and use of the computer were all included plus we had a free continental breakfast. Alas, it is Las Vegas and I guess you need to pay extra for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Girls Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: pacificislands
Reviews.Content: Convenient shopping, live shows, gourmet food and spa - what more can a girl want? The hotel was luxurious, lots to do without having to stray far from the hotel. We spent hours at the Canyon Ranch Spa! You can get discounts at several of the hotel's restaurants by purchasing a voucher at the Fashion Mall's half price ticket booth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Shopping”
Reviews.Author: alibeth
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Las Vegas except for my husband. We had 3 teenagers and didn't really want to gamble and really just came to see Las Vegas. The Palazzo was a great hotel to stay to do that, a little quieter, mellower and smaller than the other hotels. We were given connecting rooms with one king and two queens including a sofa bed in each. The shopping kept us occupied for a couple of days and also walked across the street to the Forum, which was a little hot to get to in the middle of summer. The rooms were amazingly big and luxurious. The restaurants in the hotel are great as well. We ordered room service for breakfast every morning and sometimes dinner. We used the Canyon Spa for massage and manicure/pedicure which was great. Check-in was good but their key system wasn't working. We used express check-out. We had a long wait in the heat at valet at check-out as everyone has to be out by 11Am. Was a great hotel for 3 days and if I ever go back to Las Vegas I know exactly where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and great price”
Reviews.Author: nosandstlouis
Reviews.Content: very good suite for a good price. about 750 sqft for $350 a night. strip view. very nice pools. went on a vacation with a 15 yr old boy and 10 yr girl. They loved it. will definitely go back. We visited a lot of other hotels and none of the others except for Ceasar's Palace had the charm. Customer service was excellent although the concierge messed up our gondola ride ticket reservation and we had to run between the ride and the concierge before they found our reservation. Most of the other hotel lobbies were very crowded and reminded me of airports but this hotel always had that pleasant feel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not the 5 Star it claims to be!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryBunny
Reviews.Content: My 2 year old son and my husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in mid July. We had stayed a week prior at the Trump International. Coming from the Trump - we were very disapointed with most aspects of the Palazzo. When we arrived, we were greeted by a rude female valet attendant. My husband politely told her that he needed to return our car to the car rental company as soon as we had checked in and asked her if it was worth him using the valet. She rudely told him that she coudn't guarantee that our car would be here when we returned. When he asked her if it would be better for him to self park, she said that she didn't care what we did, without giving us any guidance. So that was the beginning of our stay at the Palazzo. When we checked in, the representative at the front desk told me that they did not have a non-smoking room available for us. I told him that it was important that we have non-smoking room as this was what we had reserved and I have a young child. After a long time and few sighs from the attendant (like I was putting him out in some way), he finally found a room for us. When we arrived in our room, it was okay. Quite dirty and run-down. Lipstick marks on the glasses and black hairs all of over the bathroom floor and in the bathtub. You could tell that nothing had been replaced or updated since their opening several years back. I don't think that I would have found this place to be too bad if I hadn't just stayed at the Trump -- a real 5 star hotel. When I arrived in the room, I noticed that there was no fridge. So I opened the mini-bar and removed some of the soda bottles so that I could keep my son's milk cold. When the bell-man arrived with our luggage, he told me that I needed to put the bottles back as they all have a 20 second delay on them. If they are removed from the fridge for longer than 20 seconds, each item is billed to your room. I called the front desk to find that $180 was charged to our room. I was able to explain what happened and they kindly removed the charges. However, it did cost me $75 to have a fridge brought to our room for the duration of our stay. At the Palazzo, the resort fee is supposed to pay for the high speed internet, newspapers and the gym. Well - the Internet is ridiculously slow. Terrible actually. As for the newspapers - you have to go and get your own newspaper from the store in the Shops on the second level. When we stay in a hotel, it's nice to read the paper while enjoying coffee in a bathrobe in your room - without having to go down the elevator to get it . Oh yeah - about the coffee. None of the rooms have coffeemakers. Five star resort, hey? Even a Motel 6 has coffee makers in the room. When housekeeping came in, the only thing they did was make the bed. None of the wine glasses that we used were washed or replaced and they never replaced the towels. We never had facecloths during our whole stay. I assumed that all of the rooms would have refigerators because they call their rooms, "suites". We really liked the pool areas and spent a lot of time there. Every pool, however, had a white scum along the surface and edges. It turned me off a bit but we used the pool anyway. My son and I both had rashes before the week was done. If I can say one positive about the Palazzo - it would be the gym. the Palazzo offers two great fitness facilities. We took advantage of them. Probably the best gyms that we have seen at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite hotel, service a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: Texan2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo 3 days just before the Labor Day weekend. Last year, we had stayed at The Venetian and loved it. This time, we opted for the Palazzo (which is internally connected). The Palazzo is an all-suite hotel just like The Venetian, but we found that the suites here had newer and better furniture as compared to The Venetian. Some of the highlights of the room: - Curtains were remote-controlled. - There was a nice sectional couch in the small living room area. - Light below the TV gave a good look to the room. - Spacious suite - Furniture makes you feel like you are in a palatial suite (theme of the hotel) The bathroom was similar to the one at The Venetian. The rooms were very upscale. The lobby was pretty too, but not as good as when we had visited last year. We ate mostly at the Grand Lux Cafe on the Palazzo side of the casino. There's another one on the Venetian side. This restaurant has the same founder as the Cheesecake Factory (another restaurant that we love). The menu and decor bear resemblance. We loved the food there and it was also very reasonably priced. Another good thing is that it is open till 2 AM. On the day we arrived, we had checked in at 11 PM and were very hungry due to flight delays. We were very glad that this restaurant was open. Now about the not so good experience regarding the service. When we checked in, we had left our bags with the porter. After getting to our room, we left in about 20 minutes to have dinner. Bags had not arrived by then (no problem). When we got back, bags were not there since they need someone to answer the door to leave the bags inside (again that is fine). We called the front desk and asked them to send our bags. They told us they couldn't put our bags in our room because we weren't there and that they'll send them now. Half an hour passed. No sign of bags. We called again for our bags and after a long wait on the phone and being transferred multiple times, we were told again that our bags were not checked in because we were not in the room.... Me: Ok send them now. Another wait for another half an hour... no sign of bags. A third phone call (and we were very sleepy at that time) and we were told there was NO REQUEST MADE FOR HAVING THE BAGS SENT!! Huh!! I asked them to send them and make sure they enter it in their system. Finally, after 15 mins, the bags arrived. We were almost half asleep... Total wait time: almost an hour and a half! Service for the quality of the hotel left a lot to be desired. The front desk doesn't have much idea about anything. We had asked them on the day of our arrival about which restaurant will be open at that time and they gave us two names (both of which were closed). The server at one of those told us about the Grand Lux Cafe. Overall, a nice hotel, but could do with better service.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Staying at the Palazzo and still Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalM
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo has turned me into a snob ever since I first stayed there. After my first stay, I told myself and my friends that, in the future, I would not be staying at any hotels that weren't 5 stars in Vegas :) The second stay was still fabulous. I just love how they designed the suites!

Reviews.Title: “Prestige worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Gardner19
Reviews.Content: The prestige access was definately worth it for our trip to the Palazzo. We stayed at the Venetian last August but the Palazzo prestige class room was so much better. You get the same big room as a regular booking but perhaps a higher level floor. Very important, when you get to the Palazzo go directly to the 23rd floor for your personal check in ( no waiting in a 40 minute line like everyone else!). There they will give you your choice of a glass of champagne and/or a cold bottle of water. When we checked in it was mid after noon and we went to the prestige lounge where they had help yourself coke, sprite, iced tea, lemonaid and an assortment of 8 different candies (ie m and m's plain and with peanuts, chocolate covered pretzels, all flavours of jelly beans, skittles etc). You could fill a plastic cup full of candy and take it with you on your walk of the strip or sit down in the big beautiful chairs and enjoy the view. From 7pm to 9pm they have yummy desserts out for you to have as much as you like ( ie big cookies, brownies, squares). Earlier in the evening they have hot (ie calamari, quesadilla, burritos) cold appetizers (ie fruit, veggies, nuts, crudities, dips) as well as freshly made hot soup, and fresh bread. From 5 to 8 they have free drinks, the service was excellent and they will make you whatever you like (lots of fun creations and crushed ice were around). The breakast was great too. Hot oatmeal, assortment of cold cereals, apples, oranges, pineapples, melons, cheese, pastries, yogurt, eggs, cheddar quiche, omlettes, sausage, crepes, hot cinnamon rolls, bagels, toast, fresh coffee, choice of tea and choice of two juices. There was always lots of free bottled water so on my way to the Canyon Ranch fitness club ( which is included with the prestige access) I always picked up a couple of bottles. There were also coffee cups to go so you could take an extra coffee with you at the end of breakfast. We thought this was all an excellent value because for example one morning while at the Veneitan in August we ordered room service for breakfast one morning of oatmeal and coffee for two - and it was $40! We got that and so much more for breakfast everyday at the Prestige Palazzo. We hardly ate outside of the Prestige on our trip. It was a wonderful environment, from couples to family and friends sitting on the comfy/elegant couches and chairs enjoying time together. Oh, you also get your newspaper delivered directly to your door each morning, no need to get it from the newstand downstairs like is required at the Venetian. Enjoy your time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: TammyLee123
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, had booked a smoking room and when we checked in we were told there was nona available for that night so they would move us in the am to a smoking room, they even moved all our luggage for us to the new room as we were attending a conference that day! the restaurants are to die for! Del Toro was amazing! Ordered Room service one night, it was a little expensive but worth it as they are huge portions! All around great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, good for families.”
Reviews.Author: sbw9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for the second year in a row last week. My husband and I and our two teenage daughters had a Bella Prestige room. We love this hotel! The Bella is a spacious room with two Queen beds and a living room area with a desk and an L shaped couch that pulls out. Plenty of room for one of the girls to sleep in the living room area when they didn't want to share a bed. Prestige is the concierge level and gives you access to a full floor lounge with beautiful views of the Strip and the surrounding mountains. It also gives you access to a great free breakfast, free open bar from 5-8 pm, and other great amenities like free access to the Canyon Ranch Spa's fitness center and free internet. The service at all levels is wonderful. The hotel is connected to the Venetian, and combined there are probably 30 different restaurants to choose from without even leaving the building. Blue Man Group, Jersey Boys and Phantom are all available there too. If you are looking for a family friendly hotel with room for a family to survive a week together in one room. I would highly recommend the Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and view”
Reviews.Author: houston1949
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palazzo during July. The rooms are fantastic and the view was incredible. Our room looked out over an adjoining golf course with the mountains in the distance. Every evening the view was absolutely beautiful. The "rooms" are actually mini-suites and not a typical room. We had room service which was prompt. The cold items were appropriately cold and the hot foods were delivered hot. All of our encounters from the front desk to room service to the casinos were great. If you have the time go to the spa. I had the best massage that I have ever experienced. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel attached to the Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Cliftonduo925
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Valentine's Day weekend. It is a gorgeous hotel but very pricey. The suites are generous with space and well equipped. Unfortunately a smell was wafting from the sewer system in front of the Venetian and Palazzo so it the smell didn't match the surrounding. We ate at Lavo and enjoyed the food. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a beautiful hotel with a great location but do not care about price.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun”
Reviews.Author: onlinequeen
Reviews.Content: We were at the Palazzo for 4 nights over the 4th of July holiday. Though there wasn't much to see as far as fireworks locally, the lights and excitement made up for it. The Palazzo is a beautiful hotel and the staff is first rate. Upon check-in we were offered a great deal to upgrade to a larger suite, but turned it down to save a little money. I'm glad we did since our standard room was huge. We had a sunk-in living room area with a wall to wall picture window so we could checkout the Vegas skyline. There were 3 TVs on the wall, one in the bedroom area, one in the livingroom area, and a smaller one in the gigantic marble bathroom. The Casino is nice, not too loud, and not loaded with smoke. All the restaurants are very good, but not cheap. You should head to the mall area that connects to the Venetian for additional restaurant choices. The pools are very nice! We rented a pool-side cabana for a day and ended up in the one next the Kelsey Grammer! Don’t forget to get your Grazie card as soon as you arrive, it will save you a lot on money on rental cars, shows, restaurants, etc. My only complaint was that we had to schlep our suitcases through the casino from the registration area to get to the elevators to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby.... but don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: vashti14
Reviews.Content: Please BELIEVE the negative reviews when you read them. The rooms are full of dilapidated furniture, stained carpet, food trays left in the hallway, and the slowest hotel service I've seen for quite some time. The tragedy for me is that I spent numerous hours before booking my trip reviewing travelor comments from the Message Boards. I kept mimimizing the negatives and trying to accentuate/pay attention to the positives only to sadly discover that what I read was true. This hotel may have been "the place" to stay several years ago, but that was several years ago and things have changed. Yes, the rooms are large suites, and yes they have sunken rooms, but when your furniture has stains on it, is broken/chipped, and the sofa is made up of crushed velvet material (mine happens to be red), that dates back to the era of Gunsmoke in the saloon, you know that you are in trouble. When I requested a change of rooms, it took two (2) hours for them to deliver the room key. Customer service (?!)-not. And DO NOT believe the tips from travelers on how to get the best room, I gave the front desk person a substantial amount (more than $20) using the so-called "sandwich" technique---and still was given rooms of very low quality and cleanliness. One of the members traveling with me reported the next day that his room looked as if someone had conducted a wild orgy party in the room. BELIEVE the comments about the heavy doors slamming. The doors appear to get stuck and then require an extra push to close. It's a little startling particularly if you head off down the hallway not realizing your door is wide open. I'm betting the 5-STAR comments are from people who stayed in the bagy of rooms 31-50... at least I would hope so.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Choice on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: mintcar22
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo was indeed a 5 star hotel. The room looked exactly like it does on the website. It boasts the largest room on the strip at 750 sq ft. At a great rate of $149 for summer weeknights, you really shouldn't stay anywhere else. We arrived early at 11am and they happily allowed us to check in. It is nice and quiet, easy to navigate, great security by the 16 elevators. It connects to the Venetian and the best part is there is a Walgreens on the bottom floor! We ate at Grand Lux Cafe, I love burgers, and First Bar and Grill and Shake and Burger (for breakfast in the food court). See my reviews on each restaurant separately. If you like pastries, which I usually don't but my husband loves, there is this chocolate twist pastry in the cafe on the 2nd floor near the elevators. It is like a long rectangular shaped pastry, not sure exactly what it looked like. It's very overpiced but it was the most moist, delicious chocolate pastry I've ever had in my entire life. I ate half and the next day it was still moist and delicious (which is uncommon of any pastry!) We also went to the Canyon ranch spa and cafe. In conclusion, if you can get a good rate, you can live like a king or a queen for 1/2 the price!

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: Truly 5 star accommodations! It is hard to find a better room in Las Vegas (tasteful elegant decoration, 700 sqrf room, great views, UNBELIEVABLE bathrooms). Likes: Room, lobby, passage to Venetian Canals, access to Venetian pools, location (in the middle of Las Vegas strip. Dislikes: Maid service didn;t have an understand of "Turn Down Service" (they thought it meant more towels). Pool was too crowded, and had shade in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “What a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RitaGurgaon
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most luxurious hotel and offers great value for the price you pay. It is a city in itself. The gondola ridea nd the fabulous ambience leave you astounded. There is variety in the food, inclusing quality restaurants as well as food courts. The blue man show is a must see. The suites are spacious and elegant. And covenient. Systems are electronic, including drawing up the drapes. shopping arcade is an added attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip staying here, managed to get a great rate too. Close to all on the strip, very nice clean spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star, but still nice!”
Reviews.Author: PurdueGirl1127
Reviews.Content: First let me say that the Palazzo is not a Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton, but it is a nice place to stay in Vegas. The Room: Huge and great view (42nd floor with the view of The Wynn Pools). The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is terrific! This is Vegas so the room has some wear and tear issues, but everything works and is clean. The TV in the bathroom is difficult to see from the tub, but the tub is large enough that one can shift and still be comfortable. The sunken living room and business center area was very enjoyable. The Food: Room Service was passable, but not great. We ordered it two times and the order was never correct. They really should offer a free dessert or something extra when they mess up...it would go a long way to make the customer's experience better. The food at Carnivinos was exceptional. The quality of the food and the service was terrific...highly recommend the aged steak and the desserts! Solaro at the pool had good food. You can go to the carry out window and take it to eat by the pool. This is pricey, but convenient...my husband loved the breakfast...he ate waffles three days in a row! The Pool: If you want a good chair get there before 10. The main pool is shaded by the hotel until about noon. This is nice because the heat is very tolerable in the shade. If you want sun sooner go to the Venetian pool. If you want to stay at the Palazzo and get sun the soonest go to the opposite side of the pool from the hotel and get a chair to the left of the lifeguard chair. The Spa & Gym: The Hot Rock Massage was the best I have ever had. My husband is still talking about how terrific it was. When you get a spa service you have complimentary access for the day to all that the club has to offer (free exercise classes, use of the sauna, steam room, and the various shower experiences)..this is a must is you stay here! You can also get water and fruit all day...great if you do an early morning service then want to be at the pool and run in to get a little snack. If you don't get a spa service you can buy a pass ($20) and get access. The Gym is complimentary..there are two. I worked out every day and tried both of them. Take the extra 2 minutes and walk to the Venetian gym. It is by far the better of the two gyms. Keep checking on the prices of your room after you book. If you call and ask The Palazzo will adjust the price down if they offer your room at a better price. You must do this before you go...they will not do it once you check in...have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms - Great location”
Reviews.Author: agpklp
Reviews.Content: The rooms are all suites with a step down living area. They are updated and just very very nice! The location is great, the restaurants on site are amazing. The Palazzo is attached to the Venetian so between the two there really is no need to ever leave. I am sure that is their goal. This is a big and busy hotel so expect service to reflect that but they do a good job. Check-in can be a nightmare. Casino has everything one would want and reflects a more refined crowd than some other Vegas spots. My wife loved the pool areas. There are several. Great place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: AggiePride2001
Reviews.Content: I'm in Heaven. What is there to complaint about? I asked the front desk person for a quiet room away from elevators. OMG you can hear a pin drop. I asked for a view and i got one of the mountains, no need for Bellagio fountains/Pirate Ship. If you want to see the Pirate Ship/Fountains just walk right across the street. The Valet parking took only 5-10 minutes. Just a few hiccups with my blinds, etc. If the price is right I will always stay at the Palazzo. Thanks for a making this chica's week just right! A well deserved reward for serving overseas!! I've been here for about 2 days now. I see security at their posts but I've never had my card checked by them. Oh and by the way, their is a Coffee Bean shop right by the elevators. It's great if you want to cool off with an Iced Smoothie. Some of the food prices are a little high, but what do you expect for The Palazzo, you're not staying at The Excalibur. However, there are many things to eat if you're on a budget. I have a rental car and normally eat my lunch/dinner on the outside and breakfast at the hotel. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay & Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ponder72
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palazzo resort for my sister in law's 40th birthday. From the moment we were picked up at the airport in the hotel limo we encountered nothing but outstanding customer service. Our rooms were not quite ready when we arrived but they took care of our bags and took our phone number to contact us once our room was ready. Upon entering our room we were not pleased with the cleanliness of the bathroom and it was quickly taken care of. Outside of those two issues we had no more complaints. For those with prestige level rooms that was nightly reception available. The food at the Grand Luxe Lounge was wonderful, affordable and they gave you very large portions. We even splurged and rented a Cabana at the Azure pool area and once again my expectations were surpassed. Rooms were nice and spacious and were well worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: Went with a friend for a few fun days. The hotel is very nice, easy access to casino and pool. Not a lot of walking as in some other resorts. The casino was fair. I prefer Caesar's, but that's really a personal choice. The rooms were beautifully decorated and felt very luxurious. The Grand Lux Cafe was wonderful. Every meal we had there was delicious, so we ate there several times! The drapes are automatic, there is a fairly large sitting area with a tv, a tv near the beds, and one in the bathroom. Marble all around in the bathroom. Comfy beds. Would defitintely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Krissykoala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas between 4-8 times each year, and the Palazzo is our favorite hotel. The Bellagio is a close second and if you get a view with the fountains, it is tied for first with Palazzo in our book. The Palazzo makes things easy- the parking structure is smart, the air inside of the casino is fresh, and you can easily find things here. The shops are never busy, and the restaurants in the hotel are incredible. We had dinner at CUT last Friday, and I think it was the best meal I'd ever eaten! Table Ten is also on our must eat list each trip we make to the Palazzo. Rooms at the Palazzo are large, new, and modern. We love having three televisions in the room. The pool is also wonderful. Because we frequent Vegas and like to gamble, we do not have to pay for rooms, but from what I've heard, Palazzo room rates are reasonable. On a negative note, the Palazzo has cut back on a few minor things probably to save money due to the bad economy. They changed their brand of soaps and toiletries from a high end brand to a plain one.
