Turn down service is no longer standard, and they no longer give you little business cards in the parking structure reminding you where you parked. Other than that, we had a nice experience on our most recent trip. In the last ten years, we have stayed at Caesar's, Bellagio, Luxor, MGM, Monte Carlo, Excalibur, Mirage, Paris, Rio, Bally's, NY NY, Flamingo, Wynn, and of course, the Palazzo. The Palazzo and Bellagio are our favorites. Bring your own pillows because the pillows break your neck...just an afterthought.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Bu3teeg
Reviews.Content: This is in mu opinion one of the best in LV. The suites are fairly large to cater for a family with two kids, aside from its amazing shopping mall that connects it with its bro hotel Venecia. If you are renting a car or would like to rent a car, then you have Avis desk right there next to the valet pickup point. This was so adequate since I was coming from LA with my car, and dropped it off where i'm staying at. Plus situated in the heart of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not staying here again”
Reviews.Author: GISGoddess
Reviews.Content: I checked in after 10pm. There was broken glass in the entry way that I stepped on and had glass in my foot. There were feces on the inside of the bathroom door. The buttons on the corded phone did not work and the leg fell off of the desk. When I mentioned it at the front desk the gal did not charge me the $20 resort fee and said that is the limit of how she could accommodate me. A couple days later I filled out a customer satisfaction survey to tell them about my stay. A few days after filling out the survey I received an email from a Coordinator | Guest Relations that said they were " ..pleased to hear you are in a better condition." and hoped that I would stay at their resort again. There was no offer to reimburse me the money I spent on 12 hours in the hotel or compensate me for the poor condition of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest suite in Las Vegas! Great hotel with classy atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinTexans
Reviews.Content: Our family flew into Las Vegas to start off our summer vacation and stayed at the Palazzo for two nights. We staying in a Bella Suite and it was fantastic! The decor was very classy and everything was clean and beautiful. We have two middle school children and they loved it. There were three TVs in the suite, two super comfortable beds, a sunken living room with a large sectional couch, desk, dining table and entertainment center. The bath was luxurious as well and quite large. What I didn't like was having to walk through a smoky casino to get to our room, but that is Vegas I guess. We don't drink, smoke or gamble so we were just passing through. The staff was superior. Whatever we needed was supplied quickly. This is a sister property to the Venitian so the pools and other amenities are accessible at both properties. I suggest trying Hotwire as I received a very good deal for this 5 star property. If we ever went back to Las Vegas I would stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in Every Way !!!!”
Reviews.Author: smythe62
Reviews.Content: Check in 5 minutes. Front desk staff always great and smiles all around. Room was very clean and everything in working order. End of hall room very quite. Casino was busy, but not too crazy. Drink service in all casino areas was plentiful and fast. Sometimes they checked room keys and sometimes not... to access elevators. Depends on whom was working the shift. Will be back for another stay soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Toscana3
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Palazzo. Rooms were very spacious. Very minor issues with stains/ broken fixtures/ bathroom water spots that makes this a "very good" vs. an "excellent" property. However, we had a fantastic time! Nice rooms. Housekeeping was consistent. Restaurants and casino were excellent. Canyon Ranch spa was a fun experience. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “most romantic and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: briancarolynh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed twice to celebrate anniversaries....we had great service on every level. we stayed at concierge level and enjoyed it so much, makes you feel welcome and you can meet some people who are a bit calmer vs. the hard core party people. The rooms are heavenly, clean, opulent and spacious. We don't really drink or gamble, so we were the bathrobes, sit at the table and enjoy the view. We thought the food from room service was incredible and we ordered at least 4 times each stay. The pools are awesome and you can find a quiet area if you want, we did.....the concierge staff booked us to see Blue Man group and Jersey Boys.......Both were good, Jersey Boys left us crying with joy by the end of the show...... We ate at Canaletto for our 20th wedding anniversary, Kelly Mendez, entertainment director arranged for us to have a private room which was candlelight and we never felt so special. We are from back east and we tip well as we appreciate all the hard work that goes into running such a fine hotel. We say thank you and smile and express our gratitude which is sincere and have had nothing but praises for this Hotel. I am writting this review as I was shocked to read only a few bad ones on this site. I was concerned when I read some guests were upset with a smoky room and one even said she was offered smoking or non-smoking. Well, that's got to be a false review, because I called and they assured me they have NO smoking rooms at all...... We are booked for our 22nd wedding anniversary this September and we will stay again at the prestige level which is worth every last cent. The food is excellent, fresh and healthy and they all go out of their way to accommodate anything you want. Again, we don't gamble or drink, we come for the romantic environment and the way your are treated. If you cannot be happy with the Venetian/Palazzo I would say you have a bad attitude. I dare you to find better service anywhere. My second best hotel in the world so far has been the Hotel Intercontinental in Boston. We are absolutely ruined to stay anywhere else for romance than the Palazzo. The only thing that ever was not great was we got a couple massage at the Canyon Ranch Spa and the massage therapist talked through the whole thing which kept us from completely relaxing, but that is just one individual who was not professional. She was pleasant and I didn't have the heart to ask to stop talking...... The greatest thing about the Hotel for us was the comfort of the King sized beds, the slippers and robes.......can't wait to be there again soon......... Girl from Boston and Hubby!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: hanniegirl
Reviews.Content: Came here for a few days with my husband and fifteen year old son. The hotel was beautiful, everyone was friendly, and the restaurants were great. I was concerned that the atmosphere might be too rowdy for my underage teen, but I was pleasantly surprised. The pools did not have screaming music and the bathing suits were modest enough (after seeing what was worn on the street the night before I was a little worried about what to expect at the pool the next day!). I know Vegas is an adult vacation spot, but it would have been nice if there had been an area for my son to play poker, blackjack, etc., without the gambling. Another BIG plus for me was the convenient Wal-Greens right next door - we got all our bottled drinks there for typical prices ($4 for Coke/water is ridiculous!).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: designfanatic
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that this was a great hotel and casino especially for the price. We stayed in a luxury strip view with king bed for $189. The room was huge with sunken living room with large sectional sofa, tv and dining table. The upper level which is the size of most standard hotel rooms, had a king bed with a dresser and another tv. The bathroom with seperate room with toilet, seperate shower and tub, and yes another tv, as well as a vanity table with a great blow dryer and all the attachments. So girls no need to worry about the inferior dryers from most hotels here! The bed was comfortable, the room clean...room service was fast and friendly. Check in was not busy as I had anticipated and they have an express checkout so no need to wait in line to check out. The casino is one of the better in my opinion, the restaurant in the casino area was great. No complaints such as doors slamming etc....lets face it, that really depends who is staying on your floor and after all it is vegas. The only down side was my "strip view" really did not look at much except the pools but did not have the glamour of all the lights that I have had at the Wynn. Other than that I would definitely go back until it gets a bit older when all great hotels (ie the Mirage and TI) there have a shelf life before they get old and smelly and dated

Reviews.Title: “Awesome we will be back”
Reviews.Author: KGBBatonRouge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Palazzo Resort June 25, 2011 through July 1, 2011. This is a beautiful resort, and they go the extra mile. I was attending a week long business conference at the Las Vegas convention center and the suite rooms at The Palazzo really give you a lot more than your average hotel room. My husband and 15 month old son accompanied me on this trip and the fact that our room had a living room with a sofa and dining room table really made this much easier to entertain our son and give him more room to play. The resort brought us a refrigerator and baby crib at no additional cost to accommodate the needs of my son. The staff was always very friendly and polite and handled any request right away. The room was cleaned and replenished everyday and we never had to ask for anything extra. The price of this resort is very reasonable and you get so much more than your average hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away. No service, but plenty of attitude”
Reviews.Author: Raygood
Reviews.Content: Billed as a luxury resort, but clearly it's best days are now well behind it. The service is nearly nonexistent from obvious cuts in staff. Our room while large has not been well maintained. Stains and dirt everywhere, even the carpeting is frayed. I do not believe they have had any type of refresh or maintenance done since they opened. Call for service - welcome to being placed on hold for 10-15 minutes. They will tell you, especially the business center that they are short staffed, which is painfully obviously true. It is clear that their parent is giving attention to their Asian properties and not here. Even the soaps and shampoo's in the rooms come complete with Chinese names - and here I thought they were going with a European/Italian theme. Finally, the staff attitude in general was poor. You would think given the high unemployment in the area they would be happy to be employed. That is not the case. They are indifferent to "who cares".

Reviews.Title: “Not a Gamble”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc1958
Reviews.Content: Spent a recent long weekend at the Palazzo Hotel with family. Check in and check out was efficient, they offered some packages that we took advantage of. The Suites were well furnished and large enough to keep family comfortable. There were a large variety of places to eat which was great as my mother-in-law finds it difficult to get around due to hip issue. So you could spend the entire weekend on the property. I want to thank Brian Dragovich, Manager of Guest services for helping us deal with a luggage issue. Only real negative was the gym which had about half of the treadmills not in working order so had to use the larger and better equipped gym at the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on "The Strip"”
Reviews.Author: SteRos
Reviews.Content: A large (too large?) hotel on The Strip in Las Vegas. Big, well equipped and modern rooms, great beds, large bath rooms, great view (35th floor), quite and clean. Numberous restaurants, casino and shopping. Great service! A perfect hotel, but maybe "to large" (7500 rooms). Several swiimming pools, but very crowdy! To get a sunbed we had to be early!

Reviews.Title: “Slamming Hotel Doors- Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Oren123
Reviews.Content: I echo all the positive points of this hotel so I will point out its main flaw: I stayed in a room around the Palazzo Floor 39-730 and I just do not understand how no one has been complaining about the SLAMMING hotel room doors at all hours. I know that this is traditionally a complaint but this was ridiculous as all surrounding hotel room entry doors would slam so hard everytime a neighbor went in or out that you would be awoken from any kind of sleep all night long. These heavy doors close very slowly and at the last momment just slam shut with such force as I am wondering how the walls are not cracking. I am sure this is a safety issue to make sure hotel doors close but the force is just unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnific room, good location”
Reviews.Author: l1eve
Reviews.Content: We loved our room! Huge suite (Siena) on the 46th floor with Strip view. The hotel looked well maintained and clean. When going to the rooms, you'll have to walk through the casino. Not so nice with your suitcases. The casino at the Palazzo does not seem so hectic as it can look like in other hotels. The Palazzo and Venetian are well connected to each other, plenty of restaurants to go to. Reception was friendly and fast. We would definately recommend this hotel because of its facilities, cleanness, and location on the Strip. Restaurants on site (Morels) is overpriced, we're sure there are more and nicer restaurants located nearby/inhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but with an attitude”
Reviews.Author: Delia53
Reviews.Content: We attended a convention at the Palazzo this week. Checkin was a nightmare because of two conventions arriving the same day. Our room, which had been requested for early checkin, was not ready until 5 p.m. - two hours after the posted 3 p.m. checkin. We requested some form of apology, such as resort credit for the Canyon Ranch exercise room. That was refused. The suites have no coffee pot in the room, which is standard in all but Motel 6's, but even Motel 6 provides free coffee in the lobby for guests. Our room was beautiful and had a wonderful view of the strip, but we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: TheBiggestBoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June in a fortuna suite. Very hard to fault this place in all honesty. It's over the top opulence is actually rather beautiful and the room and service was exactly as expected. Enjoyed the whole stay including the Casino which we found to be very friendly, especially a pit boss called jeff who has been mentioned on here before, very nice chap! It's a huge, huge hotel so don't expect personal service. That doesn't really bother us, we prefer not to be pampered, but we had no issues when we did require assistance. Like I said, very hard to fault, although, we did prefer the encore but hard to actually articulate why. My top tip would be this; there is a Denny's right outside the venetian and we used this for breakfast every day. Cheap and fab. All in all, bottom line is this. If you are reading these reviews with a view to coming here, you will struggle to find any better. It's over the top, clean, opulent, huge, great rooms and is really everything you would expect from a Vegas hotel. I would turn her witjout hesitation, and I can't say any fairer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: azeddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo from June 12th - 18th. I was originally booked at the Venetian and did the $20 trick with the receptionist telling her I simply wanted a quiet comfortable room. I had read of complaints about the noise on rooms from the pool side of the hotel. The receptionist gave me a great room at the Palazzo 41-732 on the strip side of the hotel with a great view of the strip. The room was huge measuring twice as large as some of the rooms I have had on previous visits to Las Vegas. There is a sunken living room with a wonderfully comfortable couch and a TV in the living room, a TV in the bedroom, and a TV in the bathroom. The service from the staff was very good I was always greeted with a smile by staff in the halls Housekeeping always did an excellent job cleaning the room. Canyon Ranch Spa is an excellent place to give yourself some TLC and the Canyon Ranch Cafe was delightful. This is a high-end resort and the costs do reflect so this trip was more expensive than my normal solo visit to Las Vegas, but the level of service reflects the cost. If I was out to impress my wife/girlfriend/significant other the Palazzo is a great place to go. However, I do have to admit on future solo trips to Vegas, which I do once a year, I will stay at a mid-range resort simply because I do not have a need for this level of service when I am on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust their price! Ripoffs”
Reviews.Author: travelingterri42
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to book a special birthday night at the Prestige Level in the Palazzo. After reading a bad review, I called to confirm that the price I had was for all four members of my family. After arriving, I was told it would be another $100 plus tax for my two teenage daughters. I told them about the call and even with the time and date, they said my call could only be honored if it was recorded. Surprise it wasn't! I booked the room through their site with 4 people entered and confirmed and was still treated this way. We had to pay because it was my daughter's birthday and we didn't want to ruin the day for her. We were also told it was too late to cancel. I travel all over the world and am very careful about hidden fees. This is the worst case I have ever experienced. DO NOT TRUST THEM!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Kari1975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Palazzo from June 4th -June 11th. Everything about our stay was lovely. My husband had been to The Venetian three weeks prior with the guys and was worried that I would find the pools a bit to noisy. He had to attend a convention and knew that I would require a relaxing pool side retreat rather than the young party crowd. I love the Bellagio and once I find something I like will usually stick with it but my husband wanted me to try something new. He contacted Anthony (I believe he looks after feedback at the hotel) and asked him about the pool situation. By the time Anthony replied we had already took a chance and booked Palazzo, the newer tower attached to the Venetian. Anthony upgraded us to a room that was on a higher floor with a great view of the strip. Very nice of him. Our room also had a great view of the pool and the best part was when you got off elevator you didn't have to walk a mile to get to our room. Muchly appreciated. Pool at this hotel was amazing. There was also a party pool with DJ if that is something you are interested in. There are I believe 7 pools and they have done a good job of separating the party crowd from the relaxing main pool. Had I been with friends I would have checked out Azure (the pool party area). Oh and the hotel did a great job of setting up the access to the pool. The elevator takes you straight there and you only need to walk down a short hall rather than a long walk from room to pool. Location of this hotel was also wonderful. Close to convention centre & the Fashion Show Mall. It is also attached to The Venetian so you have all of their amenities and access to The Venetian Pools if you wish to walk over and check them out. I recommend checking out Lavo. This is a fabulous restaurant right by the front lobby.The only complaint I had was with the concierge. We asked them a couple of questions on separate occasions and they were not very helpful and didn't even have suggestions. At the Bellagio I found the concierge went out on a limb to make sure you were taken care of. Wasn't the case at The Palazzo. I wanted directions on how to get to the outlets and maybe the concierge looked down on this. She acted like she didn't have the time of day to give out such info. Really ticked me off. When I pay this much money to stay in a hotel I expect to get good service. This was however my only complaint. The shops are on the second floor. I didn't figure this out first day and was missing the luxurious five star feel. Main floor connection to The Venetian felt to me more like a shopping mall but if you access via 2nd floor shops you get the luxury atmosphere. Oh and if you desire the party atmosphere of the newly legal 21 year olds..,this hotel is not for you. This hotel is a classy hotel. I didn't see many young intoxicated folks here. None actually which made me happy. I enjoyed checking out the other hotels that had the party scene but loved that I could come back to The Palazzo and relax. If you do want to check out a great club, take a cab down to The Marquee at Cosmopolitan. It is recommended that you phone ahead and get on the access list. The Wynn next door has a lovely little pizzeria that served lovely breakfasts beside their waterfall. Just a short walk and a nice quiet place to eat in the shade. Would I recommend The Palazzo..,YES! You will love it :) We will be back VERY SOON! Oh and we did see a couple of celebrities at the pool which was kind of cool! :)

Reviews.Title: “I love the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_at_work
Reviews.Content: I love the Palazzo. Full stop. I stayed there in 2009 (for a bachelorette party) and loved it. Full stop. My boyfriend surprised me with a long weekend there in April (well done, boyfriend :), and I loved it in April as much as I had loved it in 2009. Full stop. Every room in the Palazzo is actually a suite, and every suite positively gleams. The views are fantastic, and the hotel itself has great restaurants (e.g., SUSHISAMBA and I Love Burgers). Dangerously indulgent "shopping opportunities." Writing this review makes me want to go to Vegas---and stay at the Palazzo--again. Still, for the sake of full disclosure--the hotel seems to be getting too busy to handle itself. For example, my boyfriend received a fax from "The Office" during our stay, and no one downstairs would deliver it to us. Originally, they said that they would not deliver it for "security reasons," which made some sense, but, when I went downstairs to get it, the woman at the desk admitted that they are just too short-staffed to make such deliveries. (Which would explain why she had no problem giving a fax addressed to my boyfriend to me.) For that matter, even though we arrived an hour after check-in time, our room was not ready yet, and no one could give us a sense of when it would be ready that day. (Luckily, we only had to wait for two hours, and they would have given us a room in the Venetian, had we been in a rush.) So, the moral of this story: I love the Palazzo. I loved it the first time, and I loved it the second time. (Hence the 5 stars.) Just don't say I didn't warn you, on the busyness front.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: MissApples
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Venetian before, we decided to give the Palazzo a try for our girl's trip. It was all class. The service was impeccable, the suite to die for and it was in all ways, a really lovely place to stay. The casino floor of the Palazzo is less manic than other casinos and we enjoyed the ease of finding our way around. If I had to criticise anything, I would say that I found the pool options too shallow for any real swimming, but they were perfectly fine is getting some sun is your main thing. The facilities were all top notch and this was topped off by the concierge service which was really great at assisting us with any of our needs. Would highly recommend the Palazzo, in fact, we're planning on heading back there this August!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Gorgeous. Felt like a Celebrity!”
Reviews.Author: krstn425
Reviews.Content: I came to Las Vegas with two friends for my Bachelorette party and we stayed here. We luckily were staying in a penthouse suite! It was incredible!! Even if we didn't have the fancy fancy room, the hotel itself was gorgeous! The pool area and lobby were stunning! It is in a great location, but could be a little far to walk to some casinos. Everything about this place was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Look, but not 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: PocketClam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here during a recent convention that I was a part of. This was our first experience with Las Vegas and most likely our last. It was definitely something to experience if you have never been, but not a place I can see spending a long vacation at. One thing that you need to get used to is that it is a very busy and fast paced town and you will do a great deal of walking. The sites in the city where great to see and we had a lot of fun walking the strip. As for the Palazzo Hotel, it was not the service I expected from what is rated as a 5-star Las Vegas casino resort hotel. From the check-in we experienced a very disinterested and unhelpful associate. When I had questioned the room we were given as not being the king bed selection I thought I selected, she did not want to help or provide any type of solution to this. When asked if there was a way she could note my account to alert me if a room with a king bed became available she stated that I could check back with the front desk if I wanted, but she was not going to do anything regarding my request. She was very dry and not personable at all. Once we received our room we went straight to the elevators and just wanted to take a quick nap as we had been traveling over 8-hours to get to Vegas with getting to our airport and a 6-hour flight from the East Coast. When we arrived to our room we were shocked to find it completely in disarray. Please note there is no exaggeration in what I am about to say here as to the condition of the room. We walked in and found the beds to be striped of linens and all of them and the pillows were scattered across the room and floor. There were towels all over to room and what we think was food or dirt in clumps around the floor of the room. There is a marble partition between the bed area and sitting area where we found strange stains, empty glasses of liquor and a pair of rubber gloves (not sure what the gloves were for, nor do I think I want to know). As we walked further into the room we found more glasses on the floor, in the bathroom, on the window sill and on the table we found the remnants of drugs, presumably cocaine, in lines and power form on the table. I immediately called the front desk as my wife began to find more drugs (small pills all over the couch and floor). Upon reaching the front desk I explained our situation and my complete shock that they would send a guest to a room like this. I fully explained the condition of the room, including the fact that there were drugs in the room . The front desk person simply asked if I wanted housekeeping to come up and clean the room. Really? After explaining what condition the room is you think any normal person wants to wait for housekeeping? NO!!! I explained I wanted another room ASAP and we were leaving this room and would head directly to a room they provided on the phone. We went to the new room and had to wait 20-minutes for the security guard to come and let us in. At this point we are beyond exhausted and just wanted to get into a clean room. Even after explaining the issue to the front desk and the security guard the only acknowledgement we received was a plate of (4) chocolate covered strawberries in our room the next night. Seriously? Not even a complementary room charge for one day or a dinner certificate to one of the restaurants, or tickets to a show? Strawberries? I know this is Vegas and I am sure they see things like this all the time, however we do not and I guess I expect more from those in customer service fields and a 5 star resort. I can understand an unmade room, but this room was a disaster and what if we came in with children and one got a hold of the drug residue or pills on the floor? Other than this experience on the first day the rest of the stay was fine. The hotel is very nice and HUGE! Almost too big. The casino areas were nicely laid out and the restaurants we ate in were very good. We did find the employees in the clothing shops to be a bit obnoxious and pushy, which turned us off from spending any money in these stores. We just made note of what we liked and bought it on-line when we went home. The convention halls where very nice and there was a great deal of space. The rooms where clean and the staff that assisted the event were terrific. There was one older woman who was waitressing during one of the luncheons, I wish I could remember her name, who was fabulous. She was great to talk to and was very upbeat and friendly. The pool was surprisingly small for a resort so large. We tried a few times to go in the pool, but each time it was shoulder to shoulder people and there was no chance of getting a chair in the pool area unless you arrived at 5am. Additionally the bathrooms in the pool area were too small for the number of guests in the area. The men’s room could only hold two gentlemen with one urinal and one toilet. This became an issue in the evening at the Toa Beach Club as this was the only bathroom on the patio beach club floor. Imagine a few hundred people all drinking, eating and only a few toilets to share. It became ridiculous. A little tip if you take the airport shuttle (very convenient by the way). The Shuttle will drop you off right at the front door to the hotel for $6.00 a person and runs every hour. This is the best deal as a cab is around $30.00. Keep in mind that the buss picks up in the same area you get dropped off, first level outside to the right of the doors. DON’T ASK THE BELL HOPS! They send us down to the lower level, which was for busses and limousines and a bus driver advised that we needed to go back up to level one. Funny how the employees of the hotel can’t even get the location of the shuttles correct for their guests. We were lucky to meet the shuttle right when we came back outside, otherwise we would have had to take a $30.00 cab back to the airport to meet our flight. Overall the hotel was clean and nice for a Vegas resort, but I was not overly impressed with a few of the amenities as noted and a few of the employees who just seemed obnoxious or disinterested in their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: airsupplygirl
Reviews.Content: We were at the Palazzo last weekend and I think we were spoiled with the acommodations (we booked the Suite Life Package with the Fortuna View Suite) well worth it the extra money because you get over $150.00 back with the promotions included in the package. Until now my favorite place was The Signature at the MGM, we have stayed there because of the perfect location for the Grand Arena concerts but this time we book a tour with the Pink Jeeps and we wanted to relax in the room. No dissapointment here with the beautiful room I think the Fortuna Suites are over 900sqft of luxury and confort with the best views (strip, pools and city). My boyfriend did well at their Poker Room located at the Venetian resort -connected to the Palazzo- .Long story short an amazing weekend at this beatiful resort. By the way parking is a breeze if you use their valet service (free service just tip appreciated by the attendants), it makes the trip so smooth. Book your package you'll be happy you did it.

Reviews.Title: “This resort made you feel like you were on vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Tpbou
Reviews.Content: We have visited Las Vegas at least twice a year for the past 7 years. We have stayed at the Aria, Luxor, Cosmopolitan, Trump International. The Palazzo has been the best. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are huge, and the seven pools top it off. This will definitely be our choice on our next return.

Reviews.Title: “nice room”
Reviews.Author: beagle1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo over the 4th of July weekend and it was great. There were a lot of parking stalls near the casino elevator, the check in staff was extremely professional and helpful and there were two or three different elevators that took you a different set of floors so it made getting to your room a lot more efficient. One thing, there's a $17 mandatory $17 resort fee that's paid to the hotel, which only gets you free in-room wireless access, a daily newspaper and use of the various exercise machines in the fitness rooms (the exercise classes were not included in the resort fee); all of which we did not use. Back to the room, which was very roomy, quiet, had a sunken sitting area for watching tv, and a comfortable bed. The casino had a good selection of slot machines and the cocktail servers came around frequently so drinks were always available. Would surely stay here again, if the prices were right as we had a great stay at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Quality accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Rog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo while attending a conference in the adjacent Sands Conference Center. The rooms are very spacious and furnished in what I would call mass-produced luxury. The bathrooms are quite fancy. Everything and was clean and well kept. Considering that the Palazzo and Venetian have thousands of rooms, the entire operation from check-in to check-out is very efficiently and courteously handled. The Palazzo and Venetian complex is a fun place to explore. The second floor is a high-end mall with a faux Venetian canal complete with gondola's. There is a St. Mark's Square that has small (free) performances every hour. There are many ways to spend all your winnings in the multitude of shops, restaurants and clubs. A couple of noteworthy values: there is a food court on the second floor on the Venetian side has a variety of eateries at reasonable prices - and many serve breakfast; and there is a CVS pharmacy/discount store accessible from outside the complex between the Venetian and the Palazzo (just under the walkway crossing over the Strip) which is a good place for necessities and some simple souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: bill919
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean with no complaints. We had a room with a view of the city, the strip and the many swimming pools. Room service was very prompt, and the entire staff was very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this to anyone going to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Prestige level amenities worth the extra $”
Reviews.Author: 3farmboys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group for our annual girls trip. The hotel and staff were very accomidating from the reservations and throughout our stay. We chose the Prestige package, which was perfect for us. It starts with a limo picking you up at the airport. Champagne check in, luggage storage, Prestige lounge had complimentary snacks/drinks majority of the day. Breakfast was also provided in the lounge, which was very tasty. This, along with appetizers in the evenings and happy hour every night saved us a bunch of money on food/drinks. It was nice to stop by the lounge and pick up free water/sodas before we hit the pool in the morning. Rooms were clean. Furniture showed some wear (broken handles) and one of the beds was horribly uncomfortable (good thing the couch was very comfy!). I would say that the need to step it up on the clean up of room service, those trays sat out in the hallway for days! Also, resupplying the toiletries in the bathroom daily should be a given. The pool was fantastic (love the loungers in there) even though it is mostly in the shade until noon. The cabanas are outrageously priced (maybe that is the reason they were all empty on a hot summer day, Palazzo staff??). They started at $500 a day when we were there. The Wolfgang Puck restaurant out by the pool was delicious! Overall, I think it was a great deal for all of the amenities that we were given. Would do it again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for family in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cpbea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property with an infant and adjoining with grandparents over the 4th of July weekend. The best thing about the place is how large it is and all the different places you can walk to without leaving your hotel. Combined with the Venetian there must have been at least 30 options to eat and probably 20 bars. This is very good for people pushing kids around in the stroller or if the weather is not good for walking around. The checkin was smooth, the atmosphere was nice and we liked the vareity of people to watch as we stayed here. Sure there were some drunks but this was a summer holiday weekend in Vegas... We got standard suites which were more than enough. Sound transfer between rooms was minimal and the AC was not too loud. This is always important for me. It was 5 star except in the service and cleanliness but I don't mind for the price I paid. This is no Wynn or Four Seasons but its very much better than most Strip hotels I've been to and is located near everything. I would stay here again if the rates are decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: Zalcz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just two nights with a friend. We hadn't booked in advance and just walked in. The front desk staff was very nice but had a bit of a hard time giving us the exact cost for the room. The room...wow. It was probably one of the best rooms I've stayed in and I can honestly not think of anything that was amiss. Simply perfect. The hotel in itself is gignourmous and an experience in itself. I could've easily spent the better part of a day trying to find my way around...without even gambling. Only cloud in the sky was that when I checked out, the cost for the room (incl. tax/resort fee) wasn't anywhere near what we were told when checking-in, in total around $100 more. Unfortunately I had to rush to the airport so I decided to cut my losses. Maybe they'd had an excellent explanation but we will never now. Lesson learned (not a new one but a reminder): Get everything in writing. Always. In the end though, this truly is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find better”
Reviews.Author: maryann_farrugia
Reviews.Content: First time staying at The Palazzo as I usually stay at The Venetian. Have to say I prefer The Palazzo as the rooms seem newer and overall the hotel, casino and restaurants are much quieter. We definately be staying here in my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top Vegas Hotels”
Reviews.Author: travelver611sg
Reviews.Content: For the same weekend, we were originally booked with the Trump with a cheaper rate, but realized that the Trump hotel was a lot further away from the Strip than we realized. The cheap rate we found for Palazzo was too hard to pass up and considering it was for Friday and Saturday night, we eventually booked it. Check in was quick and we were given a free upgrade to a high floor (43rd to be exact) luxury strip view room. The check in agent also gave us additional complimentary line and admission passes to Lavo. A free t-shirt was given to each us for joining their free loyalty program. The room was spectacular featuring a large bathroom, a “bedroom”, and a sunken living room. It is large enough to fit at least 5-6 people comfortably. We requested an extra set of pillows and bed sheets at 1 am and it was bought to our room within 5 min and the sheets were already heated. I have read some issues regarding housekeeping, but we had a different experienced. We left our room for about an hour around 11 am and the room was already made by the time we returned. By the number of carts in the hallway, it seemed like there were a housekeeper to 3-4 rooms There are lots of pools at the resort. I thought it was a nice to have attendants help look for chairs. If there were no chairs at the Palazzo pools, guest also had access to pools at Venetian and Venezia. We left Lavo around 2:30 am and we enjoyed having Grand Lux Café open till 3 am. The Venetian/Palazzo does a good job trying to keep their customers within their resort. They have basically everything from casual dining to fine dining to shopping to clubs/bars. The resort offers two large shopping areas and two large casinos. There are also a large number of quality shows in the two hotels. There is a Walgreens in front of Palazzo if you left anything at home. I have stayed at many different hotels, and Palazzo has been the best one so far.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Franbrasilia
Reviews.Content: The suite is huge and very clean. The bed is very comfortable, the staff was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before paying for a package upfront.”
Reviews.Author: KittyKatzONLINE
Reviews.Content: I purchased a 3 night package on The Prestige level with limo service for the airport and a fruit basket with champagne. at a cost of nearly $1400.00 Our suite was in poor repair. I called down requesting an early check out after one night because the room was so dumpy but told that with a package you can not receive credit for early check out. Needless to say, we stayed. Handles on the furniture loose swinging around, one was even missing! The closet was messy from the guest who checked out before us and no bathrobes. The toiletries were not replenished daily, I had to seek them out. We had one bar of soap for a shower, tub and 2 sinks that had to be shuffled around! The makeup mirror was broken and replaced after The Prestige level staff took charge for me. Trying to get the champagne delivered was impossible to find a department who knew how to deliver it since it was included with the package. You would think that it would be in the room when we arrived. The fruit basket was delivered within the first hour but not the champagne. The server said that is a different dept. A Prestige Level host hand delivered a bottle to me after even they could not get it delivered! A big bag of dirty laundry and an old plate of food was left right outside our door for 2 days. 24 hours and we checked out, it was still there! Not very classy! The staff otherwise is great and I recommend the Prestige Level. Well worth the extra money. Nice place if housekeeping was better. OH, the ice is hard to find, it is behind a door that looks like a hotel suite door. Instead of a number it says ICE.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...”
Reviews.Author: BBMT
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite--loved our afternoons trying out the various pools from both hotels. Loved the Grand Lux for dinner and breakfast. The ride in the elevator 45 floors was new to us... My complaint is with housekeeping. We were gone by early morning and back at 3pm and the room still was not cleaned. When I called, they said it was because we were up so many floors and would send someone right up--which they did. The second time was ridiculous. But on the day we checked out...a man was there at 9:30 to suddenly change light bulbs and housekeeping was knocking at the door at the same time. But truly, the overall experience with the hotel, pools and Jersey Boys was great. I researched the hotels in Vegas thru this sight, and reviews helped so much. It was nice to not have to go far after the late show for Jersey Boys--we could just roam the hotel. Here's a tip if you are a coffee drinker. There is no coffee maker in the room. My husband and I had great mornings getting coffee and playing a few games of slots. But don't stand in line at the coffee shop right off the elevators---go to the Grand Lux coffee shop---instead of waiting in line 30 minutes. We also enjoyed the restaurant by the pool as well. Just prepare to pay far more than you would ever ever imagine in Vegas, for everything. Take a break from the strip and go to the Fremont light show--and red rocks. After a long winter, the sun and fun were just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly impressive - but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: VA-Aussie-travellers
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Palazzo late June and had two adjoining suites (a bella suite a luxury suite). One has a king and one has two queens. My wife and I stayed at the Venetian a few years ago for a wedding anniversary - and loved it (although found many of the same issues I will mention below). The location is absolutely first rate and the quality of the venetian / Palazzo rooms, lobby, shops, etc. Is also beyond compare. However, we have been very disappointed in the service - and it felt to us that once we were there - that is when the good service ended. Don't get me wrong, the service wasn't bad as such but they certainly didn't make us feel like they cared or wanted to do anything for us - not what you would expect for such a high class hotel. The Palazzo is the most un-family friendly place you can imagine despite us working out some arrangements in advance - they let us down in this regard. Our room was only ready at 5pm (we had to wait some hours), but when we asked for a late check-out, we were told we had to pay. We felt overall that they charged us for anything and everything they possibly could - the fee for the adjoining suites (despite the fact it just means that the door between the suites is unlocked) is over the top - and was applied to both room accounts. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: dontwakemeupk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night after the Electric Daisy Carnival. It took 20 min to check in. The room was big but half of the furniture was outdated and broken. The pool was VERY dirty and there were not enough chairs for all of the people in it. At the end I didn't know there was going to be a "resort fee", which made it even more disappointing. Service was also bad- you had to wait to call any service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kpim
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It's the best hotel on that part of the strip. It's close to cheap gambling (at Bill's Gamblin Hall & Saloon), it has great clubs (Lavo & Tao Beach), and it CAN be reasonably priced if you go on a weekday. The hotel rooms are really big, we got the Bella Suite which had 2 doubles, a couch & a pullout couch. We had 6 people in the room and all slept comfortably. The service was good compared to other Vegas hotels I've stayed in. I would definitely stay there again. If you are into pool parties & have a large group get a daybed ($500 minimum) at Tao Beach. It's a really cool place, good music, good food, delicious drinks.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: hoohoolian
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in at least 10 different hotels on the Strip in the last 6 years and I have stayed at the Palazzo twice. Palazzo rooms are the best on the strip in comparison to other “top” properties I have stayed at such as MGM, Mandalay, Palazzo, Wynn, Aria and Cosmo. I stayed over Super Bowl and had a party in the room. The layout is certainly better designed for this purpose than the rooms at Encore. The beds are incredible and the décor is beautiful. The beds may be bad for business, because you may just want to stay in bed the whole time! There have been only 4 small problems I can recall when I been at Palazzo. The Super Bowl when I stayed there, the room was never properly registered in my name, which caused some confusion when I made in-house calls to the excellent concierges and such. Once, a security guard attacked my car because I didn’t come to a complete stop next to him (no other guard has ever made me come close to a “complete stop” in thousands of visits to this hotel). I’m not much of a fan of the casino staff; they don’t seem to care if you live or die; a floor man made a controversial call at the craps table one time and quickly swept the evidence away. When I questioned him, he said, “You’re in the wrong casino, buddy.” Finally, and forever, Venetian/Palazzo pumps a hideous perfume into the hotel. I know many people love it, but it is way overdone, grandma, and it stinks. Especially during wine events! Despite those few incidents, this is easily my favorite hotel here in Las Vegas. This is the most family-friendly hotel on the strip. There are no nude shows or lewdness (not counting when Paris Hilton is visiting Tao) and I don’t recall any of the shows having noticeable, serious cussing (maybe Jersey Boys had some 1950-type of swearing!) Lagasse's Stadium is by far the best sports book with luxury seating and great private rooms– even gaming rooms including a craps table and Blackjack tables surrounded by TVs! You can’t name another sports book where there is better food, it’s Emeril! The fine dining is also excellent, despite losing a great restaurant called “Woo.” Check out my reviews of the restaurants on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: tjnels
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo while at a business convention. Our business paid for the room (in full) 3 months before our stay. However, when we arrived at 9pm, we were told that our room had been filled. They offered an "upgrade", which we agreed to. We went to the room and found a large room, with a murphy bed and 2 sofa sleepers. No bedding, no pillows. I then called the desk and asked if this was our upgrade-- having to make our own beds and sleeping on a roll out mattress. They assured me that it was and told me that this room was much nicer than the one we reserved. So, we called for bedding, made our beds, and tried to sleep. The next morning I went to the front desk, who then told me that we had been given the wrong room. They moved us to our original room. The room was clean- and actually had beds! Now, we were in luxury. (I forgot to mention that we were given a 50 dollar room credit for our trouble).... We ordered 2 sandwiches and 8 chicken wings from room service, which ended up costing 70 dollars....(18% fee in addition to tax and food cost.) So, our 50 dollar credit cost 20 dollars to use! During the remainder of our 4 night stay, our room was cleaned 2 times. On the days it was cleaned,it was not cleaned until 4pm and there were dirty glasses left in the room. There was no coffee maker in the room. The internet connection was poor. The air conditioner worked very poorly and our room was hot throughout our stay. We never found any information about the hotel amenitiies. But the worst of all, was that there was a refrigerator in our room that was full of the hotel's beverages. We purchased our own beverages (we thought 5 dollars for a 12 oz soda, 7 dollars for a beer, and 39 dollars for a bottle of champagne was too much) and placed them in the frig. Housekeeping replaced the hotel's beverages in the refrigerator and we were charged for the price of every beverage that was placed back in the frigerator along with a restocking fee. This amounted to 168 dollars - all charged to our room and we hadn't opened a single beverage of theirs! We did complain and they removed the charge. There was no notice that warned against removal of their beverages. The pool was crowded and not enough chairs for everyone. The hotel was clean and decorated nicely. However, the service was terrible, and the employees were less than nice. It has a great location, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay....”
Reviews.Author: airport_brat
Reviews.Content: Nice room - was there for a convention. Loved the deep bathtub and spacious room. Service at the front desk was nice. The workout room and staff were great also. Would love to have had a coffee maker in the room - even a one cup machine, so that you didn't have to trek down to the coffee shop at 6 in the morning. I would have happily paid for any coffee I used in the room. I was there for a convention and not to go to the casino, so take this review with a grain of salt. A tired old midwestern conventioner would like less of the party scene and more amenities such as a small coffee maker and a daily newspaper in the morning, though. Do not forget toothpaste - $8.50 in the gift shop. It was my own fault, I realize. Overall positive experience but pricey and lacking a few basics.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rajiv91
Reviews.Content: I had the privilege of staying at the Palazzo Resort Hotel in Las Vegas last November. This hotel is joined together with sister hotel Venetian, which boasts of a mini Grand Canal within the hotel. The ambience inside the hotel is completely Italian, and the lobby was dazzling with bright chandeliers. The check in process was vey long, it took nearly 25 minutes before my turn came to collect the room card. Once in the room, you will be dazzled by the posh interior furnishings and remote controlled curtains. What surprised me most was that you should not remove any items from the mini bar fridge unless you really intend to consume them, as there is a sensor below every can/bottle and if that item is lifted for more than 5 seconds, it gets automatically charged, even if you put it back after that. The dining options are endless, and so are playing at poker machines, it boasts of one of the largest casino resorts in Las Vegas. The views from the room are also superb, at night you can see the water fountains of the Bellagio, the flying lights of Circus Circus and the desert lights of the Nevada desert. This hotel is strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AthensGator
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo 4 nights for a convention onsite. The rooms were large and comfortable if a bit gaudy, even for Vegas. The room was comfortable and did not have any major issues. The printer did not work and was unable to print a boarding pass but discovered I could use my iphone as an electronic boarding pass instead. Upon check-in noticed that one of the bulbs in the bathroom was out but the next day housekeeping has corrected the situation without my asking. Great stay with no problems, the furnishings are just a little over the top. If my meeting was not at this hotel would stay at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Lovely Fortuna Suite”
Reviews.Author: rockingfranch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and first class all the way. Our suite was called "Fortuna" and was HUGE and luxurious. I've never been in a hotel room that nice. Very swanky! The canal shops that connect the Palazzo and the Venetian are very pricy upscale designer shops but it's fun to window shop and a pleasant environment to stroll through. Beautiful. Food is very expensive. There is a food court but you have to search for it, and the prices are still quite high. We found that to be the case all over that area of the strip. We walked across to Treasure Island and the Mirage and they seemed trashy compared to Palazzo. The Wynn is right next door and the lobby/shops there were luxurious also. We walked to the Bellagio to see the botanical exhibit and that was very nice and elegant also. Across the street from Palazzo is a nice shopping mall that is relatively easy to get to. There is a food court there also. Bring your comfortable walking shoes! There is a tix4 2nite ticket booth in that mall (Fashion Show Mall) where you can buy discount tickets to shows and attractions. Highly recommend that. We got our Phantom tickets there and were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Up to par”
Reviews.Author: Mr120
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind, this was my first time in Vegas, so forgive me if some customs in Vegas are weird to me...having said that... We checked in, without any issues. I asked about any available upgrades, meaning, do you have any free upgrades available (pending availability, as is the case with most other hotels). I was offered a list of what I could upgrade too, along with the fees. I guess nothing is free in Vegas, but oh well. The room itself was clean, and had a great view (behind the strip, facing the Wynn). I had a few issues with the room, the most appalling of which was moths. Yes, the room had a moth problem. Moths don't come out during the day, but when we came back at night, there were at least 20-30 moths hanging around the window and inside the lamp. Creeped me out big time. When I told the front desk about it the next day, he offered to move me, but I asked them to first see if they could take of it - and then call me either way. I never got any such call, and dealt with this issue for a few more days. (they did offer to take off the resort fee upon check-out, but I would have gladly paid the fee for a moth-free room). The casino is nice, but doesn't appear to be huge. This is because everything is in one bug rectangular room. Some others, like MGM, snake it around the hotel so it seems a lot bigger. The drink girls outfits are probably some of the better ones in Vegas (think super short and see-through). The girls themselves could probably use a little work, and could come around more often (hey, just being honest). The Palazzo connects directly to the Venetian, and this part was done really well. You can get tired really quickly wandering around the place! All in all, the hotel is really nice, up to 5 star standards. Love the newness of it as well. I'd stay here again - however I might want to stay elsewhere as well, as I hear many other places are pretty amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Prestige at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: dokken
Reviews.Content: Back to Vegas (from Australia) for the 2nd time - this time during summer. Last time we stayed at ARIA Sky Suites and were very impressed, however, this time we thought we'd try a different hotel. The Palazzo Hotel has an all Suite section called Prestige and looked pretty good on-line so off we went. Unlike the ARIA Sky Suites (our last time in Vegas), there is no complimentary airport transport included, however the hotel does have a $6 shuttle that is fine. The suite comes with all the usual amenities - stocked mini bar, 3 x flat screen TV's, electric curtains, sound system, Wi-Fi etc etc. We had a "Luxury Suite" on the 24th floor (I think it goes up to 36) which was a nice size and had a sunken lounge area and an OK strip view (we could see the Mirage Volcano show from the room). Our booking came with access to the Club Lounge for complimentary breakfast which was fine (2 x hot items + continental buffet) and way better than what the ARIA provided in their Club Lounge. The Palazzo Club Lounge is a "proper" lounge with a lot of space and nice strip views from the 23rd floor. The Club Lounge also priovides drinks + snacks almost all day and then drinks + hors d’oeuvres (different every night) from 5pm till 7pm. The entrance to the Club Lounge also doubles as the Prestige check-in desk and Prestige Concierge. A note here about Prestige check-in - you still have to enter the hotel via the "normal" entry, then go through the casino, then up to the 23rd floor to the exclusive Prestige check-in. Maybe it's me, but I don't like the experience of having to drag all your bags etc through a packed casino to get the check-in (do they really think you're going to drop all your stuff and do some gambling on the way in or out?). During our 3 nite stay we had a couple of small issues and some questions - all were handled quickly + efficiently by the hotel staff. As an "exclusive" area of the Palazzo hotel they do have security who checks you have a key in order to get to the elevators to the Prestige floors. However, it didn't seem to stop people coming + going with heaps of drinks and several guys without shirts (maybe all they are concerned about is that you have a key) - this isn't really a complaint, it's Vegas, so it's always party time, just don't expect everyone to be dressed in suits and gowns in this "exclusive" area. The Palazzo is attached to The Venetian and between them there are heaps of shops and easy access to the Strip. It's also just become and ICH Hotel affilliate, so if you're in Priority Club or an Intercontinental Ambassador then you get all the benifits. As usual for Vegas, in-house there's stacks of restaurants /celebrity chefs, pools, pool partys, bars, shops, in-house shows, niteclubs and more ways to part with your money than you can imagine. There also is the only decent (Euro style) coffee that I've found in Vegas in a small cafe just near the elevators - it's "proper" coffee with a barista, not the dishwater you usually find in the USA (sorry any Americans reading this). Checking in + out was handled quickly (no lines at the Prestige area). Overall, it's a great hotel and pretty good value for money at that end of the hotel market in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: jane0126
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel to stay in Las Vegas. The rooms are very spacious and bautifully designed you'd feel like your at home. They have a living area and dining area too. The bathroom is big with a shower, a tub with a separate toilet area. Overall my stay was very pleasant and did not regret it one bit.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo - Perfect in every way that matters”
Reviews.Author: Lori_Ann25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo this past Sunday - Thursday. We booked through the hotel, and decided on the Prestige Luxury View Suite. Rates went down twice between the time we booked and our stay, and we had no problem having our rates adjusted. We came to Vegas looking to have the amenities of a resort, with access to a wide variety of urban options. The Palazzo fit the bill perfectly. We were able to completely let go and relax and really enjoy each other's company. Room: beautiful, huge and luxurious. The furnishings were great, and I really loved the design elements. The bathroom was perfect for two people, with room to spare. The bed was comfortable, with great linens. Our view was of Treasure Island. Not amazing, but a view suite was the same as a non view suite, and as first timers, a view was a view. Prestige: great value. When you book the Prestige package, they waive the resort fee. Which means, it's really only an extra $80 a night. For which, you get breakfast (continental breakfast, two fancy options, GREAT coffee); drinks and snacks during the day; cocktails, hors d'oeuvres and desserts from 5-8. For us, it was nice to get up, have a late breakfast, grab a coffee to go, come back mid-afternoon for some water etc before heading down to the pool, then showing up for cocktails before we got ready for a late dinner. They were also nice enough to pour us nightcaps "to go" for the room when we got back late at night (early morning?). It was a mid-week stay, so it was never really crowded. I could see how it might get a little rowdy on a Friday/Saturday. Service: Prestige Lounge - amazing. The waitresses (Jane and Michelle - holla!) were friendly, sweet and just really great. Housekeeping...spotty but nothing outrageous. Just the one not awesome thing about our stay. The same champagne flute that was provided to us at check in stayed on the table until we left on Thursday. Pool: great, lots of space during the week. Loungers in the pool great for reading and relaxing. Canyon Ranch Spa: Aquavana spa great, good service. They have mid-week specials that are totally worth it. When booking the trip, I wasn't sure if I'd "get" Vegas. We're not big gamblers, and just really wanted to relax. The Palazzo provided that and more. I can't wait to get back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: eap4you
Reviews.Content: I am sorry I didnt read the reviews, the house keeping is the worst on the strip. I had to request my room to be clean every day of my stay. The other big problem is the amount of women of the evening in the lobby. Every day i saw at least 3 or 4 getting put out of of the hotel. Dont pay any attention to the marketing this is not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: LiVil
Reviews.Content: Stay was just "Okay" just not as good as other hotels on the strip I have stayed at so far. There were some good points about this hotel but I just wasn’t impressed. Went there to celebrate my sister’s 50th and my son’s 21st Birthday. I had booked a Bella Suite as there was 4 of us going. We went for June 18th and came home on June 23rd. I called ahead to arrange for a balloon bouquet, a bottle of red wine, and a bucket of beer and then asked for something like Smirnoff Ice as well. I was told they don’t have anything like that available but could give me sparking cidar. Well when we arrived everything was in place and it looked great. Then we went to pour a sparking cidar and it was sparking apple juice (yuck!). We called and they replaced it with 3 Smirnoff Ice which they suddenly could get and obviously didn’t look that I had ordered 4 cidar not 3 but that is fine. Then the cork was so old on the red wine it crumbled as we tried to get it open. I have to say Jeswyn from the concierge who came and brought us the Smirnoff was great and tried to help us out she had a hard time as well. Finally sat down to toast our birthdays and noticed a nasty red wines stain on the cushions on the couch and what looked like a cigarette burn hole on the other side of the couch. Check-in – was ok, we upgraded to the Prestige which was worth the extra little bit. Champagne to greet you. Was told the Prestige is separate from the palazzo they could not provide me with any complimentary passes to anything. I had mentioned that we had some with package and they printed them off but were not going to offer this up if I didn’t ask. I thought that as I had mentioned we had 2 birthdays and had room done up for the birthdays would have gotten something for them but nothing. Mirage had upgraded us to a 2 bedroom penthouse suite the last time we stayed there because we didn’t get adjoining rooms so I guess I was expecting similar. Room – couch stained, bathroom was okay not as big as other hotels we have stayed in. The beds were terrible we all had sore backs/shoulders after sleeping in these. Room size is decent, nice size sitting area. Also, no iPod dock just a CD player which meant no music except laptop or radio for tunes for the room. Prestige upgrade – this was well worth it. Breakfast, coffee/tea bottled water all day, cocktail hour all included. We even had a day that we were all tired and went back up to the room and stopped in at the concierge and picked up a couple of DVDs to watch and they provided us with popcorn to take back to the room to watch with the DVDs. Pool – we rented a cabana and when we got there again no iPod dock so there was not music. We asked if they had one and it was $35 to rent for the day. We had got it and had listened to about 4 songs when the music from Azure the adults only pool started and we couldn’t hear our music because Azure’s was so loud. It was good music coming from Azure but we obviously didn’t need the iPod dock. Mentioned it to the cabana server we had and he said yeah I guess I should have thought of that. Cabana was nice, food and beverages were expensive compared to The Hotel/Mandalay and the Mirage. Kicked out at 5pm from the cabanas were told you could sit in front of them but not in them, again not used to having it all day. Went back up to our room took the iPod dock as we had it for the day and then got a phone call asking where it was we said we had it up in our room and they said they were sending someone up to get it. When we mentioned about only listening to 4 songs he said he would email his manager to see if they would remove it from the bill. When we check out they hadn’t removed it but the gentleman that checked us out removed it for us. We didn’t rent a cabana any other day as we were only going to be half days at the pool and not worth it. They do offer cabanas for ½ price for ½ a day though. Just sat around the other pools for the rest of the times we went to the pool ended up with just ordering a bucket of beer as 2 Bloody Marys were $24 I guess, as I wanted this to be an outstanding weekend for my 2 Birthday guests I was just disappointed, as I am not used to having to fight with a hotel to get everything corrected or done properly. I would recommend Mandalay Bay, The Hotel, Luxor and the Mirage over this hotel based on check-in, room, service, staff etc. over this hotel. I have been working my way done the strip at hotels so can’t comment on any hotels after the Venetian heading towards Freemont street.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Meinfarr
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where all these negative reviews are coming from! Competition? Maybe? I have never had a better stay at any hotel...EVER. Staff was friendly, and gracious! I had booked via a priceline bid for 3 nights and won for a price of 105 per night. I had read about the 20 dollar sandwich tip and I tried it at checkin time. I was rewarded with a Fortuna Suite for the same price on the 44th floor with a tremendous view of the mountains, Treasure Island, Rio, Palms, and the many pools below on the strip! The suite was beautiful, almost 1000sq ft. Remote controlled drapes and sheers. 3 tvs including one in the luxurious bath! There were not enough towels for my liking. So I requested the maid bring extras for our stay...(with gratuity) and had double towels allotment for the remainder of the stay! Plenty of food choices in the many resturaunts on site. Great Breakfast especially. Loved the location for accessibility, right on the N edge of all the great properties and a very easy walking distance. The decor is the definition of opulence! Such a beautiful property. Maybe the other people giving this hotel such bad remarks are just snobs or feel entitled. I couldn’t have been treated better. I was even given a $150 credit on my bill at checkout based on game play + and extra slot credit of $105. Ill be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: paulettedc
Reviews.Content: A group of us recently stayed at the Palazzo and wished the service could have matched the look of the hotel. We had to stop by the front desk nearly twice a day to get new keys as our lock repeatedly stopped working. I also had to wait 2.5 hours and get on the phone 5 times to get an extra comforter. Then I was told by the staff, who were nice, that the comforter costs $400 dollars so that is why they do not normally provide them. Give me a break, this is a multi-million dollar establishment, and you are being stingy on the bedding? Oddly enough another staff member brought a second comforter, after the mgmt told me they would have to search for one. Give me a break. They will also not make your bed if there is a spec of clothing on the bed. My friend had laid out a bathing suit on the bed and therefore they were unable to make the bed, again give me a break. 2 star hotels have more efficient service than this. The restaurant Morel's was overpriced for the experience, when ordering a $53 filet med-rare, the filet came out blue, as in very rare. The server said that they often under cook the med-rare, so she usually orders them med-rare 'plus', um for $53 when I order med-rare that's how it should come, period,also thanks for the server mentioning that in advance...fondue also overpriced and sub-par. Oh and forget about the drink service at the hotel pool and in the casino. The servers at the casino would let you know to order two drinks at a time saying it would take 5-10 minutes two return, then return with the drinks about 25 minutes later. At the main pool near tao beach, the server tells my friend to give her the $20 bucks in advance of the drink so that she could bring the change right away, okay that's fine. However the server doesn't return for 25 minutes, this is NOT an exaggeration. We did notice the server would only return with drinks when her tray was full, ridiculous, don't take a drink order then wait until you get enough orders to go to the bar and get the drinks. Oh and the most tacky point of the night, the awful dancer in Lavo on Friday night, she was just embarrassing to watch. Was there any good? Yes the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are stunning. The variety of restaurants is awesome as are the shops. Postrio was great, as was our server there, and we went to Dos Caminos twice. The bartenders at Laguna and Fusion were great and quick, making tasty drinks, and being very personable.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue - will be back”
Reviews.Author: Arfur51
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Had a minor problem with housekeeping not servicing our room one day, and on one occasion the service in the pool side restaurant wasnt up to scratch. Also were surprised thgat people were permitted to smoke and drink in the pools - especially some large honcho with a big Brazilian cigar (I guess he was a big casino player and thus allowed some latitude!). Despite these minor points we will be back and recommend the place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo - Worst cusomer service not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: TAREVIEW02
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for 5 nights in June. We were goingt to be there for 5 nights and decided to split our stay at two hotels. We stayed the first 3 nights at Vdarra and last two nights at Palazzo. After staying at Palazzo we realized how good Vdarra was. At Palazzo, the first day we went we upgraded to a view room with 2 queen beds for $45 a night. When we went into our room the room seemed ok, but when we started to unpack we noticed that in two of the drawers on the right had side of the dresser, someone had left their dirty underwear, we immediately informed the front desk and housekeeping. They did not pick up the dirty underwears from two drawers till 7:00pm the next day. Our toiled was not flushing either, they sent someone to fix it, he left in a minute saying it was fixed and guess what - it was not fixed. We had to call front desk again. The next day we left our room around 1:00pm and came back at 5:30pm. Our room was not clean, so we called the front desk and asked them to send someone to clean the room, they said is a towel or something misssing - they did not believe us that the room was not cleaned and the beds were not made. Took a long time to convince the associate manager. This all happed around 5:50. Someone finally came to clean the room at 7:15. If you want to enjoy your vacation - stay away from Palazzo, and they did not offer us anything for the problems we had. NOT EVEN A PEENY. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise - we loved Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TheBusfields60
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip to coincide with a big birthday for my husband. We wanted to do something on our 'tick list'. Las Vegas was something we thought we ought to do, rather than had a desperate desire for. We were wrong - we LOVED Vegas. It was everything we thought it would not be, classy, clean - spotlessly clean, suitable for all, we loved the weather it was warm and sunny but not dry and dusty. We loved the shows, the lights and the people. Yes, there are areas which are not so great but you get that everywhere. On the choice of hotel, because it was for a special occasion we opted to go up a level and chose the Palazzo which is the sister hotel to the Venetian mostly because it promised all rooms as suites with luxury and space. We were bowled over, the room was all and more than we expected. We chose to have a room at the back so we overlooked the Wynn pool area and golf course - absolutely fine for us. The bathroom was massive, luxurious and carried everything you could ever need. The bed was so good it was the first time ever we returned home and found our own bed lacking!!! The lounge area was beautifully equipped with sofas, tables, dining area and a desk with fax machine. The whole hotel is extremely well maintained. The casino area was large and ok but our main purpose on this trip was not to gamble but to explore, although we did dip our toes in for an hour or so most days at the end of the day after dinner. We did a couple of extras and would really recommend the sunset helicopter trip - amazing!!! We left Vegas late afternoon and flew over the hoover Dam and landed in the canyon itself. Here we were given our picnic and champagne and spent 20 minutes chatting to the pilot and 4 other travellers. We then flew back as the sun was setting - this has to been seen to be believed - fantastic. We also ate in the revolving restaurant on my husbands birthday - very good food, shame about some of the staff who were rude. Also we ate later in order the secure the window table we had requested months earlier(!) - and found ourselves the last in a section of the restaurant although still well within the opening hours by at least an hour. A kindly member of staff switched the aircon to freezing so we were unable to enjoy our coffees and the view and ended up moving away back to the bar - shame on you whoever you were you were the only disappointment in Vegas hospitality. Other highlights are just walking about, enjoy the shopping, the lovely restaurant for lunch in Neiman Marcus, the free shows and most of all the wonderful fountains at the Bellagio and don't miss a visit to Town Square, a short taxi ride away where all the locals go on their days off. We will definitely return to this quirky friendly town.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: stitch808
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Palazzo last month, and enjoyed it tremendously - bellissimo! The room, and especially the bathroom, was sizable and inviting. For a major and large hotel, it was quite easy to navigate around the casino and parts of the hotel. Thoroughly loved swimming in the pools, mainly the most central one which proved to be the most popular. Thumbs up to all who are considering this establishment. BTW, check out their specials - there are some spendido values on their website!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations with exceptional views”
Reviews.Author: fquinter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Palazzo four nights and it was most impressive. Two years ago I stayed in the adjacent "The Venetian," and the Palazzo is much easier to find your room. The Venetian was completely confusing directions to get to the right elevator, but The Palazzo is a simple up and down in the elevator. The rooms are the same with a step down area which serves as living room with a flat screen television and desk. The bedroom portion also has a TV, as does the bathroom. I have included photos of the room and view. I appreciated the security toward the evening hours which requires you to show your room key to access the elevator. The casino separates check-in from the tower to get to the room. The exercise facility is tops. There are two rooms in which you can exercise and they are staffed. I may be mistaken but I believe they are 24 hour access. There is a spa but I did not take advantage of the treatments. The bed, linens, towels, soaps, etc. are quality in every way. I would not hesitate to make a reservation here if returning to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fifth year in a row to stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ComputerMaverick
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for business or casual. The hotel staff, rooms, amenities, and location are outstanding. This was our fifth visit in a row over the past five years and it was as great as the very first visit and stay! The rooms are massive and well furnished and appointed.
