This is truly one of the great hotels in Vegas! I highly recommend the Palazzo for your next stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, had a great time”
Reviews.Author: pantone77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo for two nights and had a great stay. The room was large and comfortable (huge living room area, two HDTVs not including the one in the bathroom, the bathroom was spacious, etc.), and service was friendly all-around. The resort fee of $19/night covers a free newspaper, access to the fitness facility (top notch), as well as internet access (which was fast). I just cannot put into words how beautiful it is. Next time we're going to stay at the Venetian though because the rooms are exactly the same, it's equally as beautiful, but it's a little closer to some of the hotels we tend to gamble at (e.g., Harrahs). The Palazzo is closer to Wynn/Encore while the Venetian is closer to Harrahs and the monorail. Tip - You can use the Canyon Ranch Spa facility for $20 (all day pass) which is a steal. You have full access to the locker rooms which are gorgeous...lockers, showers with full amenities, and a host of spa rooms (experimental showers, sauna, steam room, igloo room, hot tub, etc.). They play the most relaxing music in this area and there are also chairs/couches if you want to watch TV or take a nap. Words cannot describe how cool the experience is...this is not your typical gym locker room, it's beyond anything I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: Phidelt71
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Palazzo for three nights and don't want to go home! Upon arrival we were given the opportunity to upgrade to the Fortuna Suite for an additional $50 per night. It was the best decision we could have made. The room was spacious and beautiful. The bed was nice but the pillows were a bit soft. We had a Strip view that was average. We ate at SushiSamb and Morels. Both were great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it... again!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaCourtReporter
Reviews.Content: This trip was to celebrate our anniversay! Again, we chose to get the upgrade with the Prestige package. With the Prestige package, every day you get a full breakfast, afternoon snacks and happy hour including hors deuvers. You can get coffee and bottles of water any time. The Prestige staff was very friendly and attentive... especially Mary, one of the attendants, who took time to give us all kinds of tips about the local vicinity and attractions. One evening, we ate at Table 10, where the food and service were amazing. We took in a Blue Man show afterwards, which was truly entertaining! Everything about the Palazzo was perfect from its location, the large room size, the friendly housekeeping staff, the efficient front desk, the pampering Prestige package, the numerous and beautiful Shoppes, the gaming, all the way to check out. We will definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: pdnirc
Reviews.Content: Took my family there for he last night, nothing to say all perfect from service to quality of everything. simply great

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous as Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Eduba101
Reviews.Content: Like all in Vegas, was great. The only neg point is lack of breakfast. No a single good place to get a decent breakfast. Finally we discover room service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Huge”
Reviews.Author: OhioMeisje
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business and found the rooms to be large and well appointed. My only disappointment was just how large this hotel was and how far I had to walk to the conference rooms. Everything seems to be big in Las Vegas so it wouldn't have been much different at another hotel. The food was great although the prices seemed high. In general, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “its okay”
Reviews.Author: lifeintechnicolor
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo has big rooms, but not necessarily the comfiest beds or the best decor, but its good overall. Service is just alright especially in the casino (which is on the small side compared to other hotels). It is a good place to stay if you are with alot of people, because of the space you get in the rooms..but otherwise doesn't necessarily feel worth the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: nygirl1214
Reviews.Content: Our cheer gym had U.S.Finals located at the Sands Expo Center which is connected to the hotel.We had about 50 families stay at the Palazzo and we absolutely had a fantastic time! The rooms were spacious and clean! Our group rate was reasonable for a resort! You not only have the amenities of The Palazzo but you are also able to use the Venetian as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location, and restaurants, but poor service last time we went”
Reviews.Author: TheRanj
Reviews.Content: We've been here twice in the last two years (6/2009 and 7/2010)...the first time we went we were shocked at how large the suites were...we got upgraded to a higher floor suite (it was my birthday the first time we went), and went to the new pool 'Azure' one day and had one of the best times of our lives. Some great restaurants as well (LAVO/Dos Caminoes) ...we also went to Tao Beach one day which was also great. However, the last time we went, we did have some issues with our room, and one day housekeeping left our door open when they left...we know it was them and not us because the housekeeper left their 'employee' card key in the door...not sure how long it was open for but luckily no one went in. We did complain and talked to hotel management who gave us a credit but could have turned out a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel without a perk usually found at motel six”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Maria
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a long weekend here and the room was very plush and well appointed. It had a small refrigerator stocked fully with mini-bar items that were automatically charged to your bill if they were moved a half an inch. However the one thing that was sorely missed was a coffee maker. So you can't sit in bed with a cup of coffee and leisurely watch TV unless you go down and fetch some or order from room service and wait for them to show up. The rooms are all suites and there is plenty of room to stretch out and enjoy the space. The bathroom is very plush also. However we did not understand the master switch by the door that shuts off most but no all the lights in the suite. So we stumbled around in the dark for a while until we figured that thing out.

Reviews.Title: “Top class. Fantastic suites”
Reviews.Author: corkboy2009
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay. Stayed on 43rd floor. Magnificent views over Vegas. Hotel staff friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GoArmyTx
Reviews.Content: The hotel and casino were great. The staff was all about customer service. The room was spacious, clean, and had everything we needed and more.

Reviews.Title: “Getting tired”
Reviews.Author: Chwarae422
Reviews.Content: Rooms are getting very beaten up, hence the better $$ rates available. Ate at CUT, delicious, and Postrio was also very good (both Wolfgang Puck) but everywhere else was ho-hum, and pricey. The Canyon Ranch Spa was fabulous, the treatments and staff were excellent. Great food at the Canyon Ranch grill, and wonderful service. Pool staff was helpful and generally there was plenty of room despite a huge conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with great friends!”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirl89
Reviews.Content: My husband arranged a surprise 40th birthday trip to the Palazzo with me and six of my best girlfriends. Our room was fantastic with a view looking out over the strip, Treasure Island and the Mirage! Window shades were controlled by remote, so we didn't even have to get out of bed in the morning to raise the curtains (nice touch!) The bathroom was decked out with double sinks, a separate shower and tub and a separate room for the toilet. Nice toiletries in the bathroom, plush robes and soft towels. The Palazzo is huge and is connected to the Venetian through the mall. We didn't leave the property for 4 days, there is so much to do there. The casinos are typical, the restaurants are nice, and the clubs were fun! We had a great breakfast at Morels French Bistro and a fantastic dinner at Carnevino!! I highly recommend it. We also had drinks and apps at Dos Caminos, also very good. Spent time during the day at the pools. They get very crowded, sometimes hard to find a chair in the afternoon. Loud, clubtype music coming from Azure, the luxury part of the pool that cost extra money. Sounded fun, but we didn't venture inside. Went to Tao one night, nothing special. Good music, but there are many floors and we ended up on the pool deck outside. At the door, they direct you up the stairs until one of the bouncers lets you through a door. Would have liked to be in the inside club, but it might have been better outside since it was much cooler in the open air. All in all, we had a fabulous time at the Palazzo! I have stayed at the Venetian, the Bellagio and the MGM, and would definitely pick this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at siena suite at concierge”
Reviews.Author: alex5213
Reviews.Content: I have a great stay at sienna suite at the concierge level, i stay for 7 day with great service at the concierge level, free drinks at the evening, computers equiped with internet access and laser printers in b%n and color, the suite have a queen sofa bed in the living room with TV, the bathroom are very large with another TV. The hotel location is great with a lot of choices to eat and drink at night.

Reviews.Title: “One of the WORST stays ever!!”
Reviews.Author: law1
Reviews.Content: This hotel only gets two stars because it IS in a great location on the Strip, and you do have a large airy casino downstairs, with reasonable restaurant choices. THAT'S IT. Prior to our comped stay, we received a phone call that our comps were no longer valid, as the hotel had changed its policy regarding who received free rooms. Not acceptable. We had already booked nonrefundable airfare, so came anyway, vowing to never return. Well, we haven't been back since, and won't come back, based on the poor service and downhill state of the rooms. First, if you leave your cell number with the front desk, waiting for them to call you when your room is ready, you will wait forever. You will be sleeping in your car, because they will NOT call. So, keep checking throughout the day to see if your room is ready. Now, about those rooms. If you have never stayed in a large 700 square foot room, you will initially be overwhelmed. Until you give the room a closer look. FIlthy, ill kempt rooms. Broken down beds and banged up furniture, stained carpet. Do NOT touch the light switches, telephone or TV remote unless you have a LOT of LYSOL wipes. Nothing has been cleaned since the day they opened. We used to enjoy the rooms when they were new, but there is no excuse for the hotel owners to not invest one dime in upgrading and remodelling. The housekeeping staff can only be described as lazy, because either you will never get basic service, or they will literally sweep through the room in five minutes. You can call and call housekeeping, they promise to come up to the room, and no one ever shows up, so eventually you will give up. However, if you don't spend any time in the room, it is adequate, and you'll like the mid-Strip location. Try Noodles Asia restaurant in the Venetian, it is great!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Strip - Definitely will return”
Reviews.Author: kenfiguray
Reviews.Content: The room was fabulous! All rooms are mini-suites. Huge bathroom with all that you could need. The staff were all friendly and courteous. Room service is definitely something to be experienced. The comfort is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “PICTURE PERFECT AT THE PALAZZO”
Reviews.Author: Sentinel19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from a six night (5/29/11-6/4/11) stay ($129/nt) at the Palazzo. We have stayed at the Venetian before, but this was our first stay at the Palazzo. We checked in about 4 pm, there were many front desk reps and the process was smooth and easy. We were given a room on the 48th floor with an incredible view. The room was exceptionally clean and well maintained, everything worked perfectly. The only issue we had (hardly worth mentioning) was a drawer pull that fell off one of the drawers. We set it on top of the desk and it was fixed the next morning (we did not ask) after housekeeping serviced our room. Housekeeping services were excellent. On our second day we asked for some additional towels (only had 2 bath towels) and when we returned to our room not only did we get the additional towels but more bath products than the two of us could possible use. The nightly turndown service/room refresh was great and the little box of chocolates on the night stand was a nice touch. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was pleasant and professional. We were having such a nice time that on Friday morning, after we were already packed and almost ready to leave for the airport, we decided to see if we could extend our say for an additional night. I called the front desk (friendly, pleasant , professional) and was told that they would love to have us for an additional night and said he would call back in a few minutes as he might be able to offer a discounted rate. Within 10 minutes he called and offered a $40 discount on the previously quoted rate for the weekend night. Overall, we were completely satisfied with the Palazzo. The Palazzo is a beautiful property and the location is perfect. Easy walk to so many of the Strip hotels. After returning home, I received an email offer from the Venetian/Palazzo ($109/night!) and have already booked a return trip for August 2011. Sign up on the Venetian/Palazzo web site for their email offers and for the Grazie players card. You do not have to be a big gambler to get some great offers.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hotels On the Strip”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many of the hotels along the strip and have gone through phases where one or another is my favorite. At the moment if I can get the right deal I'l choose the Palazzo. The rooms are way above average for Vegas. The hotel connects with the Venetian so between the 2 properties there are numerous excellent restaurants. The location is good an walking distance to the Mirage and Caesars as well as the Wynn properties so there is variety if you need it. The Palazzo like any Vegas hotel can be insane one night and dead the next. If you can get a decent rate the rooms here are a notch better than most and worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Large Comfortable Room But Noisy Adjacent Roof”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We found our room at the Palazzo to be large and comfortable. Our room did not look out on the Strip, but faced a roof that had very noisy equipment that made it difficult for me to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “spoilt my trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: charles033
Reviews.Content: I visited Las Vegas over New Years and spent ten days there. Was checked into The Palazzo Hotel and had a reservation made directly with the them. I had booked a suite without a view but that was OK as the rooms are quite spacious like their sister Hotel The Venetian. On arrival the receptionist told us of a special they were having on larger and more spacious suites. It was being offered at a real discounted price. We were astonished that the rate was so low. We looked at the suites being offered and although they were in need of refurbishing were so large and spacious we decided to take them up on it. We worked out the cost of our stay and this was confirmed by the front desk agent.He asked us to sign a form that would enable us to use our credit cards throughout the hotel which we did without reading the fine print but he seemed so sincere and hospitable. Upon checking out we were presented with a bill with a huge difference in price as an upgrade it said.. This form was a scam in order to charge us for an upgrade which was supposed to be the cost of our stay. Try to speak to anyone at this stage was impossible, the front desk manager was so rude and impolite. We got no place as they had tricked us by signing this form. Beware of this scam at this hotel. I am a seasoned traveller and have never encountered this type of blatant scam. It spoilt our stay in Veags as it left us feeling cheated which in fact we were. Dont sign anything at the front desk before carefully examining the document and be very weary of deals being offered, it was in fact quite a dishonest thing for them to have done. Vegas a fab place and I was surprised that we got this really shabby treatment in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Ochie10
Reviews.Content: Font Desk check in staff are running scams by offering free upgrades on original bookings and then charging for them. Be careful to what seems like a wonderful offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: JTOsborne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo with a group of friends for three nights in June. It is a very nicely designed property, with a very good level of customer service. The rooms were very spacious, the pool was great and there were some excellent dining options (especially 'I love burgers'). The hotel is in a good location and as a big time sports fan, Lagasse's Stadium was a highlight of the trip and by far the best sports bar/sports book I have ever been to. However, I don't think this is a spot for everyone. If you're in Vegas to party hard, you might want to consider another location. The casino was very nice and classy, but a little too calm for my taste. But if you're looking for something a little more low key with less drunks wondering around, then this may be a good spot for you. Overall, a very nice hotel, with good service and food options in a great location, but not really a party hotel and a little too calm, which isn't a bad thing for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really well designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCFamily5
Reviews.Content: have stayed in most of the "5-star" Veags hotels, and they are all nice, but it's the Palazzo that I'll be back to. Easy, easy self parking with an elevator that drops you close to the lobby, speedy and polite check-in, and a short walk to the tower elevators. Spacious room, nice but not overdone, maybe a little over the top, and maybe not my style, but clean and well appointed. Comfortable bed and nice sunken seating area. Bathroom was huge and nicely laid out, amenities were so-so. Easy elevator down to a coffee shop for breakfast and a sundry shop for essentials. Whoever laid this complex out had ease of use in mind, definitely the easiest place in LV to appreciate. Compared to my last stay, at Vdaro (really really perfect suite but really really bad location and facilities), the convenience of the Palazzo trumps the others.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews - but positive overall”
Reviews.Author: RB8227
Reviews.Content: We visited the Palazzo June 1st - 4th. It was myself (28 yr old male), my wife, and her parents - in their late 50's. We checked in at about 3:30pm on Wednesday and there was no line. No issues here - we had the standard suite - with view. One thing to note - the views from the Palazzo are great, but the Palazzo is a little further down on the strip and set a bit further back on Las Vegas Blvd, so you kinda get views of the sides/backs of the casino's (assuming you're view is looking out in the direction of the venetian). In my opinion, the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Flamingo, etc. are dead center strip nowadays. So the majority of the lights and scenery from our room was a bit further down the strip, but it was still a very nice view - if you get floors 40 or higher (we were 43), you should be ok - otherwise your view may be blocked by the venetian. Also I'd request the 900 wing. The windows are big, but they're not floor-to-ceiling windows which are much nicer. The room was nice although one of our TV's didn't work - but we didn't complain - there was also a light-bulb that didn't work, but that was ok too - we weren't picky. The shower is nice but semi-small, and the tub is also nice but not really big enough for 2 people - and we're not big people...it's not a Garden oval tub - it's just a normal rectangle. The pool was quite nice - there's two hot tubs and two-three pools - a nice bar, etc. - but it wasn't packed which was fine with us. No loud music either. The casino was nice, but smaller than most - although it's got everything you need. We got a pretty good deal - about 150/night - so for the price, we can't complain...but I'll probably stay a bit closer to the Bellagio next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Unnecessary charges”
Reviews.Author: somdanie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a stay at the Palazzo for 7 days for a conference. One of the days, we have decided to order some food and bring it back to the room since we're sick of the over price restaurants in here. After looking through my bag, I noticed that there were no utensils in there. I then call to front desk to have them bring up a pair of utensils. Not knowing that there is a charge, yes, a charge of 5 dollars to "borrow" their utensils. 5 dollars you asked? Yes, 5 freaking dollars. Now, thinking of a 5 star hotel/resort, you pay big bucks to stay here and also have to pay for a damn utensil? This is by far one of the worse experience I've had at a 5 star. Even Holiday Inn doesn't ask you to pay for their utensils... I am done with this place...

Reviews.Title: “DOES NOT RECOGNIZE PLATINUM AMBASSADOR”
Reviews.Author: flfrequenttraveler
Reviews.Content: Before placing a reservation I asked if they followed Platinum Ambassador benefits and they said yes. During check in I asked what Platinum Ambassador benefits were available they said none. Then calling their guest services and talking to people that did not have a clue what was going on I was told they did not participate. Then after calling Priority Club they said that the hotel did participate, and they called the hotel, with no results. So, to make a long story short after the Palazzo joined Priority club they don't live up to what they are suppose to do. The hotel also after I checked out added a resort fee to a prepaid room. On a different note if your planning to join the Ambassador club don't. This is the 4th hotel that I have stayed in after joining and every time I had to repeatedly ask for the promised benefits and never received all of them

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Luxurious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth0523
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palazzo twice in the last few years and really think it's the best Vegas has to offer. Four of us girls stay in the Bella suite and it's more than enough room. Since the "living" area and bathroom/bedroom area are are on separate levels, it makes the room feel much more spacious. While the Palazzo prices may seem higher compared to other hotels on the strip, be sure to look at the price per square foot. I stayed at the MGM the last time I was in Vegas and maybe saved $15 per night, but the MGM didn't have double sinks and didn't have nearly as much room. The Palazzo beds are comfortable, love the blackout shades and feel that customer service is great all around. Also, it's nice to be connected with the Venetian- lots more options for food/things to do. Here is a photo of the Bella suite. I think it's perfectly accurate: http://www.palazzo.com/pal_bella_suite.aspx I have eaten dinner at Lavo twice and loved it both times. Be sure to order their specialty drinks in pitchers-- blueberry, sage and lemon mojito... yum! I'd highly recommend Palazzo and would stay there again. Next time I go to Vegas, I might stay at the Cosmopolitan just to try something new though! One negative- the bass from Tao Beach is VERY loud all day and you can hear it if you are in the pool right outside. If you want to relax by the pool, this might bother you.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here”
Reviews.Author: europetraveler7
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort. Very beautiful and the rooms were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “They know how to skin the cat - nickles and dimes only in dollars"”
Reviews.Author: wealloveabargain
Reviews.Content: As the traveling public gets wiser, and uses services such as Trip Advisor, hotels should be warned that their deceptive or unfair practices will be disclosed to all and they will suffer accordingly. The cost to them in lost revenue from reservations, NOT MADE, will exceedd their "ill gotten" gains. It is their hotel and they are entitled to charge whatever they want (read, whatever the traffic will bear) but they should disclose clearly beforehand what is involved. I have been to Las Vegas numerous times (no, I am not an inveterate gambler - I truly love the shows -more about this later), and have stayed at: The Bellagio, The Wynn, MGM Grand, Encore and now the Palazzo. All five star hotels, but I would rate the Palazzo at the bottom of this list and it is NOT because of their rooms which are truly very nice, nor their service which is typical, nor the wait to check out which I understand is also typical, but because of their ridiculous charges - some not quite fairly revealed in advance. The hotel did tell me that there would be an additional charge for a third person in the room - this though they describe it as a suite (note: there is no separate room and no privacy in this area). Has anyone ever heard of them reducing the "room rate" when it is occupied by only one person? What a ripoff and an excuse to "gouge" additional money from the customer (it will never happen to me again), but at least they openly disclosed this. The one that really hurts is the "Resort Fee" which not only is not openly in front of you but I still am not sure what they charged for. The newspaper which I never received? The pool which I did not go into? A towel? Just raise the standard room rate and let the customer make their own decision.What do they think I am staying at their hotel for - it is because it is a resort with typical resort features. We checked out the "M" hotel. Yes, it is about ten miles out of town, but it is right alongside I 15, (as the hotels on the strip are not far off) and the trip is less then ten minutes away, while driving from one strip hotel to another can easily exceed this (and usually does) because of intense traffic - all the time. Given that you can park your car for free at the strip hotels (they want you to come into the casino and they are layed out that you cannot get to your car {or your room} without walking through the casino) there is very little downside from staying a bit away from the hub bub, noise, etc. of the strip. On the positive side there is the substantially reduced charges at off strip hotels such as "M", and it is truly beautiful - you are not giving up anything. I believe that some of the venues in Citi Center (Cosmopollitan, Vidara, etc) are much better values and plush and beautiful as well. Gambling is gambling and not very different regardless of the venue, though I think you do get a better deal downtown Vegas than in the hotels - they want your business more and do not take you for granted, like the "big boys" do. The other gambling "Meccas" all have the same games, the same slots (bigger payoffs - "loser slots" in downtown Vegas - and better rewards promotions), but no gambling area has the shows that Vegas has. Not just the live entertainers, but the Cirque shows, water shows etc. You can usually shop them in advance and get a "deal". I resent Broadway, and oftentimes regret spending in excess of $100.00 for a less than mediocre production. I have seen "Love" (in Vegas) a few times and it is still wonderful (it seems to change somewhat from year to year) and worth every penny. Likewise the water shows "O" and Le Reve do not leave you wondering why you went, and while some prefer one to the other (I think I like "O" slightly more, but both were tremendous) you cannot go wrong with any of the Cirque or similar productions. Go, go, go - this is what truly makes Las Vegas different. .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: DriveRideOrFly
Reviews.Content: Our luxury suite, located on the 48th floor, was spacious and beautifully decorated. The pools were popular -- almost too popular -- and the poolside attendants were quick to take drink orders. We dined at three restaurants in the Palazzo: Dal Toro Ristorante, Morels French Steakhouse & Bistro, and Table 10 by Emeril Lagasse. We recommend only the latter two establishments. A fifty minute deep tissue massage at the Canyon Ranch SpaClub was a nice escape from the craziness of the strip. (We gave Sleep Quality an "Average" score because all four bed pillows were quite firm.)

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzytravelingabroad
Reviews.Content: I love the Palazzo! We come to Vegas often and I have been bugging my boyfriend to stay here. Usually we just stay at the least expensive five star, which ever Expedia has on sale basically. Palazzo far out ways a lot of the other five star hotels, the basic rooms are huge, customer service still exists, and the casino seems less smoky! Mary Rose checked us in and she was so nice, it's nice to see someone who you can tell is happy to be working here. Not to bash The Wynn but their customer service is lost and their rooms are so loud, thinnest walls ever. I will always pick Palazzo over Wynn any day, even if it is hugely on sale! Thanks Mary Rose for making our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Valorentz
Reviews.Content: Everything is better than we expected. Hotel staff friendly. Room is unbelievable. We're totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: cmstudebaker
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked at the Venetian, but when we arrived to check in at around 1:00 p.m., we were told that we could upgrade for $20 a night to the Palazzo and get into a room immediately as opposed to waiting an additional 2 hours for a room at the Venetian. We chose to upgrade and were happy we did so. Having not seen the rooms at the Venetian, I can't say how the rooms compared, but the Palazzo suite was gorgeous! The pool area is shared by both resorts and was also wonderful! Pool chairs were hard to come by, but there were staff members specifically assigned to assist guests in finding pool chairs, and chairs that were not occupied for a half hour were cleared by the staff and given to new people. Be sure to tip the staff though, as I am sure that they don't make a lot of money hourly. The chairs were very comfortable and my only complaint would be that smoking is allowed at the pool. The remote control drapes were great, especially when you wanted to sleep in late. They did an excellent job of blocking out the sunlight! The beds were extremely soft and comfortable and I slept great all three nights I was there. The bathroom was beautiful and huge, had a vanity area in it and a separate small room for the toilet. There was a stand-up shower and bath tub. Valet was a little slow, as the resort was quite busy because of the holiday weekend (Memorial day). At times, the elevators could be slow. Security was strict about checking that everyone who passed had at least one person in their party with a room key, and the same was done for entry to the pool area. I checked out very early in the morning and there was no wait at all. We didn't touch the mini bar, as we were told that everything was weight activated and you would be charged for any item that was touched, and there were no charges on my bill that should not have been there. I would highly recommend this to anyone. It isn't cheap, but is well worth the price if you want a luxury hotel. For the best food and value for the money, eat at the Grand Lux! Their menu selection is huge. We ate almost every meal there and never had the same thing twice unless we wanted it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Cyrgon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo during Memorial Day Weekend for three nights in a Bella Suite. The good: * Very big and clean suite. Bathroom was huge. * With the Palazzo and Venetian you really have two resorts combined into one. Walking from one to the other almost feels like you are in the same resort. It's huge. * Lots of restaurants and bars (good coupons in the suite for 2-for-1 drink deals). * Both casinos are nice and clean. Black Jack tables start at $15. * Venetian has the biggest Poker Room in Vegas I think. Many games going and it's easy to switch tables if you want to. Quality of players vary (I played 1-2 NL Hold'em), but surprisingly I didn't see a lot of drunk players and very little alcohol consumption at my tables and the nearby tables. * The pool area is very nice, clean and big. Note that the Palazzo pool doesn't get sun until about noon, although you need to get your seats earlier than 11am. Venetian side gets sun from the early morning, and is more lively than the Palazzo pool. * The staff was friendly and helpful when we needed something. The not so good: * BEDS in the suite! I know you don't sleep a lot in Vegas, but when I get my 4 hours or so I want a comfortable bed, and the two Sealy Posturpedic beds in my Bella suite were pretty bad. They were sagging in the middle. Some of the worst beds I've slept in. Maybe it was just my suite and perhaps the King beds are better. It's really the only I have to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNAmber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls trip and thought it was very nice, The rooms were very spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The beds were very comfortable and bathrooms were plenty big enough for 4 girls to get ready in. The only thing that kind of bothered me was that housekeeping tried to clean our room every morning at around 8:30 am. We were basically there to party, so it seemed way too early to clean. As far as sleeping in, the blackout curtains were great and it was really nice to have the remote to open them right next to you. The concierge was wonderful with setting us up with VIP entrance to all of the clubs in the Palazzo & Venetian including the pool. I would recommend this hotel for a group of girls, the rooms are great and you get everything comped! A very good time! *Tip: The hotel shades the pool so you don't get much sun

Reviews.Title: “Nothing personal about the treatment of clients”
Reviews.Author: MaureenSussex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 11 nights in May.... Check in was quick, mentioned it was our Ruby anniversary and was there an upgrade, at a cost of over 100.00 dollars a night we were told, No upgrade there then, then Donald told us they were full and there wasn't any upgrades, then I mentioned the concierge upgrade at over 100.00 dollars a night, all of a sudden he magically pulled out an upgraded room for us, I thought you were full, I said, 'did I say that' he said, so he was dishonest then. Then he said we had to pay 20 dollars a night for Resort charges, I explained that we were on a Virgin package holiday and we'd already paid the fee upfront, this he didn't believe and after much arguing we eventually checked in our room. It must have been the worst room in the hotel. A view of a wall, with noise coming from extractor fans outside. We complained every day about it until eventually we spoke to a real nice person named Brian on reception who took pity on us and told us that was not a nice place to be, he moved us to the front of the hotel with great views. We informed the Birgin Rep that the hotel were going to charge us Resort fees. They informed the hotel these fees were already previously paid, I asked Donald at Reception if he thought it was legal to make charges to patrons for services they would not be using, he just shrugged his shoulders...Resort Fees: Free use of the gym: Do I look like I spend all day in a gym? I asked Donald (I'm a senior) Free Wi fi. I don't have a lap top with me Free entry to the Spa. For what? You don't get anything free after that Free newspaper. No thanks Free local calls. To who? Virgin informed me they had waivered the fees and I could use the facilities, when I checked this with the hotel they said I had to pay for Wi fi..... Which I thought was included in the fee. CONFUSED.com Pools: no shade, I asked about umbrellas but they said people would fight over them, so I mentioned that if the hotel is supposed to depict Italy then they should be more authentic, what a rubbish answer! The large pool at the Piazzo is warmer than the large pool at the Venetion. Although the Venetion has the sun there early. They close most of the other pools even though the place was crowded. The ambience of the hotel is good and I like the Casino except for a rather rude older lady on the Roulette, when we watched the roulette for a couple of minutes before we played she commented 'are you going to play or are you just going to stand around and look pretty' not the kind of retorts one would expect as a guest in a five star hotel, it put us right off, needless to say we walked away. Vegas on the other hand is very clean and friendly. Hotel is near good shopping Mall, good buffet at the Mirage and if you have transport an even better buffet at the Hotel M. When we arrived home my husband checked his bank statement and it has shown - yes you guessed it, Resort Fees.... Even though when we checked out we paid our phone charges and the resort fees showed nil. They still charged us for phone AND the resort fees. How dishonest is that! So we had to pay double.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge!”
Reviews.Author: Oskievol
Reviews.Content: Opulent suite with plenty of space for lounging; fabulous pool with sun & shade options; Canyon Ranch Spa was a luxurious treat - go for a low-end service and use the facilities all day!; did most if our dining on property: Grand Luxe Cafe, Delminicos, El Camino (?), Solara, illy, room service, etc.; table limits were a bit high for our speed, but the slots kept us entertained well enough. Beautiful hotel; glad we made this choice this time!

Reviews.Title: “May Trip To Vegas”
Reviews.Author: andycrna
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a resort. I was a guest at the Palazzo for three days. This was our first visit to the Palazzo and we were not disappointed. The room was perfect in every way, it had a sunken den, a grand bed, a beautiful bathroom and shower, and a view you would normally pay a small fortune for. I visited the gym, the spa, and the numerous pools during this holiday. I would like the report they were all FIVE STAR. From check in to check out, from housekeeper to front desk they were all friendly and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Not super-luxurious, but great stay”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night. The hotel was quite good. Everythign about it is excellent. It is basically like the Venetian, but newer. I had room service, which was outstanding. The steak was restaurant quality, and the service was excellent. She set up the table whereever I wanted it. For steak, the room service was the same cost as in a steak house with the convenience of never leaving your room. The bed was great, as was the room. Overall, it's a great place. You're not in a super-luxurious palce, like the Bellagio or Wynn, but it is excellent, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “down hill”
Reviews.Author: JackWNJ
Reviews.Content: had a group of folks for 5 nights / 5 rooms Service has really taken a turn for the worst. Use to be great place Dinning takes forever (breakfast or lunch) Contacting anyone (front desk , package center ect) impossible waits you really grow to hate the ads while on hold. Room prices are staritn to retun to pre recession levels but the service remains in serious depression too many option in this town to return here

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel- still prefer the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: simmie17
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Wynn Tower (and twice the Bellagio) so was curious about the Palazzo as have been there many times and liked the ambiance. When they tied in with Intercontinental ( and I have an Ambassador level there) I decided to try the Palazzo when i had to attend a conference in LV. At the Wynn and Bellagio I always found if my room price went down after booking, it was honored. The Palazzo did too, but was not happy about it. I tried the Prestige level. They charged me $100 though I was alone. The breakfast and dinner choices were very good, as was the open bar. What amazed me was some of the people who were using the Lounge- very loud, boisterous, etc. I know this is LV, but I thought the lounge would be more refined. The Palazzo did not have the same vibe as the Wynn at all. I think it is because the rooms are so much bigger, and at least 4 (and probably more) stay in a single room. The hotel was packed. I also did not care for the pool. You could not get a seat in the afternoon, and the pool staff, other than at the bar or people helping with towels, were awful. I had turndown 2 of the 3 nights. The room amenities were not as nice as the Wynn's. Service was overall pretty good- esp the concierges- but I was treated shabbily at a bar inside the casino. Spa was ok. I had one treatment and it was overpriced. Spa was also packed. Again, prefer the Wynn's or Bellagio spa. Not sure if I would stay again-maybe if got a good rate and in nonsummer months.

Reviews.Title: “Best I have ever staid at!”
Reviews.Author: Lisamarie1988
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times and this was byfar the best room I have ever had from the hotels I have staid at. It was very clean and classy. Not too much happening but not too much. The rooms were all suits and they were huge!!! I was very impressed with the rooms. It also had great food!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome suite room”
Reviews.Author: nainkang
Reviews.Content: There are a huge couch and you can enjoy the awesome view. 3 television in the room include in bathroom and it has a lot of channels. Also the hotel is located on the strip so that you can enjoy night life too:) This is the best hotel I've never had.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous GRAND Hotel, Spacious lovely rooms A1+++++”
Reviews.Author: ldavi13
Reviews.Content: Would go back here for sure, loved this hotel! The rooms (and bathrooms) were just lovely. Free wifi in the rooms was great too. Staff were helpful and hotel was very quiet & clean. Great location on the strip, right in the middle so close to everything! The ONLY thing which was a bit annoying was that due to the censored mini bar, there was no room in the fridge to put a bottle of water :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worst!”
Reviews.Author: Mariah101c
Reviews.Content: We had no electricity in our room and guest services are not sending any help for hours!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas at it's Best!”
Reviews.Author: AnneCez
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Palazzo Hotel with my two older children, who are in their early 20's. The Prestige Belle Suite was incredibly roomy with a birds eye view of the strip. The down comforters and pillows and beautiful spacious bathroom was heaven. Housekeeping was impeccable and courteous. The kids loved the amazing high tech gym with the rock climbing wall and for me the Spa was to die for! The Pools were just perfect, though you did have to find a chairs early in order to have constant sunshine all day long. My kids found a Pool Party at Tao's, a hot spot in the Venetian, which was a short stroll away. We relaxed in the comfortable lounge chairs and were catered to by the pool staff beyond belief. The Casino was not smokey and had an upscale crowd and a short walk brought you directly to the Venetian and it's magnificent Italian themed plaza. We loved it there and would go back in a heartbeat! Bravo to the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “My go-to hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vanweezy
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Palazzo every time I travel to Vegas (2-3 times a year). The first time I went, I joined their players club (Club Grazie), and I've been getting promotional coupons from them ever since. As a result, I've stayed in a comped room 75% of the time I go there. Their rewards program is great! I like to gamble in their casino because it never feels overcrowded and the atmosphere is a little classier than other hotels in Vegas. My only complaint is that they don't have anyone monitoring the supposedly smoke-free corridor in the casino, because there are always people smoking there and no one telling them to stop. As for the rooms, they are top notch. I've stayed in a Luxury Suite, a Bella Suite, and a Siena Suite. You can't go wrong in any of them. We recently bought a package deal to get a cheaper flight, and it included a suite at the Wynn. We already had a suite at the Palazzo, but we went over to the Wynn to see how their rooms compared. We supposedly had an "upgraded" suite, but it wasn't even as good as the base suite at the Palazzo. It was smaller and not laid out as well. The pools at the Palazzo are very nice, but they do tend to get crowded. We asked a staff member for assistance, though, and he quickly found and laid out two additional loungers for us. That was much appreciated. The Palazzo will continue to get our business!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service for a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kchoi411
Reviews.Content: Checked in, was ok until we got to the room, hair all over the counter, a shaver cap left on the sink, floors were disgusting, fingerprints all over the living area tables, etc. For what I paid per night, I am expecting more, especially for a 5 star hotel. I called they offered to change rooms, so i agreed, so I asked specifically if I needed to go back down to get new key cards, they told me no and they can take care of it there, I can just go up to the room and it should work, but when I dragged all our suitcases to the other room, the keycards did not work, so frustrated and angry, went all the back down to the checkin and argued, etc... all they offered was an apology and a $25 resort credit. WTF! I am never staying at Palazzo again!

Reviews.Title: “One more day please...”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaOntheGoMom
Reviews.Content: I planned a short getaway with my husband to Las Vegas and since it was just the two of us we decided to #1 Splurge alittle and #2 Use Priceline for our room since we normally travel with our girls. We picked a five star hotel on Priceline, entered our price and we ended up with a successful bid. How much did we save? After taxes and the mandatory resort fee ...about 40% based on what the hotel had listed on their website for the day we wanted to stay so you can imagine our excitement to get such a nice place. We drove up to Las Vegas on Saturday morning from Orange County and arrived at 11:30am and decided to check in even though my husband was slightly worried that we would have to check in until 3pm. Our room was ready, check In was efficient and off we were to our room on the 15th floor. Now the elevators are certainly fast in this hotel, but just an FYI the halls do not have the best lighting so my husband almost ended in a room that has the ice machine. Our room? not too bad for what we paid and we had a nice view of the Wynn Golf course, would I have preferred a view of Treasure Island to see the Siren show? OF COURSE but I'm not going to take away from the room which offered plenty of space and I can't believe what I'm going to say....which is, that I wished the girls were with us to spend the night in the room. I'm sure they would've loved the three TV's in the room with one of them being in the bathroom. I liked the fact that the toilet was closed off from the rest of the bathroom. The beds were comfortable and boy did I love those pillows. The room had a nice sitting area which anyone could have easily used to sleep in since the sofa was comfortable and roomy. What's the best part of the room? The drapes that keep the pesky sun out in the morning because how many times have you been in a room in Las Vegas and that sun just shines straight into your face? Now I read some of the reviews posted by other travelers and I'm not going to write a review that is going to take the hotel apart for minor things like a slight cigarette burn on the sofa cushion which was odd considering we were in a non-smoking room because the overall experience was pleasant and my room wasn't dirty. Why nip on minor details? I'm not going to live here, i just want a comfortable bed and clean room! I mean , how often do you hear pleasant and Vegas in the same sentence? Not often, but it just felt relaxing to walk into to the hotel to a open and airy hotel registration desk and not having to go through a casino full of smoke just to get my room. The location, close yet far from the craziness of Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice upscale hotel, great value, decent service”
Reviews.Author: formerguide
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend with my wife, her first trip to Vegas. Had a standard luxury suite, they were kind enough to give us a view of the strip, stayed on the 38th floor. Room was terrific, suitably furnished, had 3 LCD TVs, FAX, big for a standard. Quite clean, only downside is pretty loud, not much dampening between the rooms, which, in Vegas, is what it is... Service was professional, but detached at the hotel. No real complaints, just not as polished or ingratiating as one might expect. On that note... Service at the 2 restaurants we ate at in the Palazzo was poor. At Table 10 (Emerils place) both servers we had were somewhere between distracted and surly. Food there was expectedly good, though nothing out of the ordinary for a nice place. Menj was rather basic though... Even worse, at the Italian place (can't recall the name, but the upscale 2 story) our waiter was obnoxious and patronizing. He also double-billed our friends, upturn tried to excuse it as if he was doing them a favor by giving them "special" portions. Dreadful, which is a shame as the food was quite good. On the opposite end of the service spectrum, to a fault, every shop employee we encounters was excellent, on par or above any we have encountered anywhere. Special accolades to Jessica at Jimmy Choos and everyone at Piaget. Also, my wife had excellent assistance at Christian Loubaton and Chloes. Dan

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nanstevens
Reviews.Content: Went there expecting a 5* hotel worth the money. I'd give it 4* even though the first impression, front door situation, was frustrating, disappointing, and very unpleasant. Other *5 hotels we've gone to have been very friendly and went out of their way to please. We found none of that. The room was very lovely although the windows were so dirty it was hard to see out of them and they had to fix the vanity light. There was no coffee machine so we had to go down and pay $10 a day for our coffee. The refrigerator was so full of their drinks for sale that we could hardly use it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, nice casino”
Reviews.Author: kerwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 8 - 11, 2011. At the same time there was a convention of tech geeks, something about the Cloud, and I think the negative reviews I'm reading are from that group. I say that because on the elevators almost all of those folks (wearing badges) were getting on/off the elevators at the lowest floors. In Vegas the lowest floors are the cheapest rooms, no views, etc. The hotel was running an $89 a night special at the time and my guess is that these people were taking advantage of that. We booked a bella suite but were upgraded to a 900 plus sq foot prestige suite on the 22nd floor. Fantastic room that included free internet and free fitness room. The fitness room was clean, had all the machines, towels, tv on each machine. My husband liked the bigger fitness room at the Venetian, which we also had free use of. Contrary to the other reviews for this same time period, we especially noticed the excellent attitude of all the young people who served us starting with check in. Hint: Try tipping, you cheap B's! We ate at First, which we enjoyed very much, and at the French Bistro place, too expensive for what you get but nothing wrong with the food, and had good service both places even though they were busy with the conference crowd.. We weren't lucky gambling this trip but we liked the casino because it was far more compact and less noisy than most of the big hotel casinos. We didn't see a single moth inside or outside, no bugs at all - I'm sure that reviewer was on a very low floor.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel, with top notch staff”
Reviews.Author: Northshoresoi1
Reviews.Content: Used Reward points to book a 2 night stay at the Palazzo. From check in to check out, a memorable stay. Treated as VIP, due to Rewards status. 43rd floor room, overlooking the strip, with abundant space. This is the new Vegas-highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!! BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! WORST TRAVEL EXPERIENCE IN MY LIFE!!!”
Reviews.Author: trishleizel
Reviews.Content: Palazzo may seem like a really great place to stay based on past reviews and the hotel star ratings being one of the best, however do not let that fool you! A group of us had checked in and all seem to have went well until we came across dozens of moths living in our suite. When I mention moths, they are not your normal sized moths, they were large moths with thick bodies! Almost the size of your thumb! We complained and complained t ohave them rid them yet more and more kept coming in. It probably took us to contact guest services about 10 times in order for them to take us serious and have someone come catch the moths themselves. They "claimed" that it was an epidemic in Vegas during that time of year that was going on with all hotels on the strip, however i've been to Vegas many times during the same time of year and have never come across any situation like this. We also had friends stay on other floors in the same hotel and none had any problems like ours. We then asked to have our money returned but they declined and offered a $100 refund which did not compensate for everything we went through for all 3 nights. We wasted our valuable time killing moths and complaining and the best they did was compensate for one night. Even with that they were being very rude and unprofessional to us. The hotel managers were also extremely rude. For the price we paid, we could have slept on the streets or stayed at a hotel for $50/night and have better sleep/service. We might as well have chosen to go camping going through what we all did. The most horrible experience anyone could ever imagined. None of this is exagerrated and it was literally what you could have seen in a movie. We believe that there was a moth nest inside the suite but they denied all complaints even with no proof. In total we killed about 50 large moths in 3 nights. DISGUSTING, HORRIBLE, and BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE! Words cannot express what my group and I had experienced staying here at the Palazzo. I will never stay in this hotel again even if this is my last resort! We lost a lot of sleep and time in Vegas worrying about moths and the hotel did not seem to care at all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want luxury anything! Damn mess!”
Reviews.Author: lababy88
Reviews.Content: service is a joke on every level, the rooms are dark and dirty, room keys didn't work five different times, and like many other reviews stated, they love to charge your credit cards double and triple, then claim it's an oversight. of course, that's only if you check your credit card statement following a stay there. we had enough of the palazzo's horrible service so we checked out a few days early and stayed, a block or so down the road, at a four star hotel because the rest were full. finally, we were treated really well and had clean, comfortable rooms and outstanding service, at half the price too! if you want luxury, stay at the four season's!

Reviews.Title: “Top's In So Many Aspects”
Reviews.Author: pan513
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I just returned from a business trip and we found the staff at the Palazzo to be "at the top of their game". From the pool area to the staff at the Prestiage area; all had you feeling you were most "important". One area I would caution; we were offered the upgrade to the "Prestiage Level"; while it helped with making reservations, checking out and service; it simply is not worth the extra cost. The "open bar" in the afternoon's has very limted selections as it relates to drinks and limited "foods". You will find this true with the "breakfast" offered from 7 a.m. to 10a.m. Wait staff support is very limited during this time and needs to be reviewed by management. Resturants within the complex are second to none. We made to trip to each, at least once during our stay. "CUT" being our favorite; if you like red meat you have found the RIGHT place, staffing was 10 out of 10. We will be back......with a few adjustments.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo one of the top choices in all of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gjborca
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo relates to the Venetian like the Encore relates to the Wynn. It's the affiliated, yet newer and more plush hotel to the original. Great shops, food, casino and staff. The rooms are phenomenal - all suites. The atmosophere is energetic and high end. Last night we had cause to visit a couple of "older" casinos in the area and the drab atmosphere matched the drab guests at the older places. Stay at the Palazzo if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: LLeone1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for an event sponsored by my company. The rooms were very clean and spacious, and had a full living room area. Bathroom was large and even had a tv built into the mirror. Would never have a need for it, but it was fun to play with. We had a pretty mediocre view of the roof of a few other buildings, but overall not too bad. At check in we were given the option for an upgrade, we declined because we would hardly be in the room. The curtains and blinds were operated by remote control, so we never even had to get up. Bed was comfortable, and so was the couch when I had to escape from a snoring husband. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time- but best for the money?”
Reviews.Author: Iris042
Reviews.Content: Stayed with four girlfriends in March. We got connecting rooms. We had a lovely stay and the suite was huge. Really hated the ordeal of the elevators however. So slow! And we had to wait for a very long time to catch one. Makes it hard if you are coming and going several times a day. We all enjoyed the Canyon Ranch spa a great deal and loved the Canyon Ranch cafe too. This was only my second trip to Vegas. I have to say I think the MGM Grand, with smaller guest rooms, has just as nice of a spa and is also quite nice. And quite a bit cheaper which can make a difference given how expensive every meal is. The staff was quite accommodating about getting us checked in early and notifying us when the room was ready as well as splitting up our bill with no billing errors at the end of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Extravagant and expensive- one of the better hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference at the Venetian next door. Check in and check out took about 20-30 minutes which was a bit disappointing. The suite on the 8th floor was extremely huge with 2 queen beds, a living room area and a huge bathroom. 3 TVs in the room seemed a bit over the top!! The beds were comfortable and the maid service was excellent with cleaning the room apart from my 2nd day, when they knocked on my door even though it had 'Do not disturb' sign and asked me whether i was checking out- needed to remind them i was staying for a few more days. Free insuite wifi was a nice touch. 2 large pools onsite but didnt really use them. All bars were fine and food was reasonable not spectacular. Overall can recommend if you want to stay at the more upmarket end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Prestige: Missed it by THAT much”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Weston
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a Prestige Suite. A Prestige Suite allows access to a floor of the hotel on which you enjoy complimentary breakfasts, afternoon tea, and evening hors d'oevuvrs, desserts, and an open bar serving premium liquor. The cost is an extra $100 for two people. The Prestige floor is quite wonderful. If you choose to do so, you could spend your entire vacation eating and drinking on the floor without spending money elsewhere (the bar only serves "free" drinks from 5 to 8 pm, but non-alcoholic beverages and "pay as you go" alcoholic drinks are served all day, and both the breakfast and evening offerings easily satisfy as full meals). The floor is very tastefully appointed, offers a wonderful view, and service is beyond excellent. We were there during the royal wedding, which was fitting, because on the floor we felt like royalty. The rooms, unfortunately, are not quite 5 star. Our complaints were, I will state right off, relatively minor, but when you are paying approximately $300 a night for a room, you expect better than: 1) a piece of molding, probably about 100 by 50 cms, that had come off the wall, left by housekeeping on the double sink counter; 2) a picture with shattered glass immediately by the entrance; 3) a sofa on which the seat and back cushions clashed terribly (had we been at a more contemporary hotel, I might have forgiven the look as an attempt at a stylish modern effect, but in the conservatively furnished room we could only believe that the hotel is recycling bits of furniture; and 4) mattresses and pillows which were, if not uncomforable, considerably less comfortable than our bedding at home (which made arriving back home from holiday less unpleasant). We both enjoyed the Prestige floor very much and would, therefore, stay again if room rates were no more than we paid. Should I have to pay more for a room than we paid, I would hear the Wynn or Vdarra beckoning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel025
Reviews.Content: Hi, just got back from a four night stay at the Palazzo, went with my husband. The stay was really good. One small hiccup during check in as we checked in late in the night. We stayed on the 36th floor with awesome views. The room was great. Internet was slow at sometime but overall not bad. We used Venetian Tao beach pool and palazzo pool, both were good. I liked the fact that there were 3-4 pools in the hotel. Great restaurant at the venetian and Palazzo. Very neat. There is no big difference between this and the Venetian i think. Loved the location of the hotel, it was little away from the local casino shops in the middle of the strip and still not too far. I would come back to stay at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the glitz and glamour”
Reviews.Author: Trish8182
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that yes, the property is beautiful... it's a stunning hotel.. however, if you, like us, expect 5 star service at a 5 star hotel then this is NOT the place for you and I strongly advise you book somewhere else, like the Wynn the next door... The terrible rating really is to do with the service of the majority of staff there... Whilst in Vegas for my 30th birthday, I unfortunately lost mine and my husbands passports and a significant amount of cash in a taxi. We had gotten in the taxi at the Palazzo's valet... despite the numerous security cameras in the valet area, security claimed that they were unable to even get us the name of the taxi company let alone the taxi plate to assist us in recovering our property.... Only one member of security personnel assisted me and unfortunately I cant remember his name to thank him personally. Over our 3 day ordeal the response was "can't help you".... disgusting!!! It took my husband 5 ATTEMPTS to get an internationl line from our room... unacceptable when you are in a crisis! To make matters worse, we have since discovered that an employee of the taxi company's lost and found in Vegas contacted the hotel after our departure as our room keys were amongst the things dropped in the taxi. Someone had handed in our passports and all the cash and she was trying to track us down. Do you thing ANYBODY from the Palazzo tried to contact us to let us know our property had been located? How difficult is it to send an email?!!! We had left all our forwarding details for this precise reason! The lady at the taxi company contacted the Australian embassy who sent us an email to advise she had been trying to contact us... All I can say is SHAME ON YOU PALAZZO! My husband and I have been underwelmed by your customer service and rest assured we have shared our experience with EVERYONE we have spoken with...no family member or friend of ours will ever stay in your establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foldzy123
Reviews.Content: Five couples travelled for a four day stay in Vegas. Hotel was excellent. We arrived Sunday morning at 10:30 and all the rooms were available for early check in. Beautiful pool. Gorgeous rooms, excellent restaurants.......located towards the top of the strip.......but very peaceful setting. It was unanimous, all five couples enjoyed the resort atmosphere. Girls at the pool bar looked after our every need.....well almost. Southwest Airlines....on the other hand....will never get another penny from me.....the crazy bulk seating method without preassigned seats is a disaster. Two thumbs up for Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but definitely needs some tweaks.”
Reviews.Author: opieluvCA
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Palazzo and we were there three nights. We had a room with two queen beds on the 40th floor overlooking the pool and Treasure Island. The good: Easy to reach from the freeway, great location, lots of things to do within walking distance, nicely appointed rooms, lots of space, security checks for room keys 24 hours a day before letting you proceed to the elevators, Grand Luxe Cafe very yummy, and really soft sheets! The not so good: Clogged drains (same problem on last trip) so you are standing in a few inches of water while you shower, toilet closet door does not stay open and slams shut (a problem if you are claustrophobic) and it is really dark in there, overpriced snacks ($9 for M&Ms?) and pool employees that let all of their friends from other hotels come and hang out and talk about their "relationships" and personal lives while you paid $200 per night or more for the privilege of sitting next to them as you try to relax.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Hotel on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Hanson111
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 5 different hotels on The Strip in Vegas including the Venetian and Palazzo. Palazzo has become my favourite after staying at The Venetian previously. I stayed 3 nights at the Palazzo with friends and then had one night on my own so I switched to another hotel down the strip that was more affordable for one person. The second hotel did not even compare. The rooms at the Palazzo are large and very nice. They are a little bit newer than the Venetian since the tower is newer, which is one of the reasons I prefer the Palazzo to the Venetian now. The rooms were very clean and the cleaning staff did a great job each day I was there. I would have liked a radio with an iPod hook up in the room though. The hotel is very nice and open. The high ceilings and wide walkways in the casino make it easy to walk around and also help with the smoke. I didn't notice the cigarette and cigar smoke nearly as much as I do in other casinos that are more tightly compacted. The restaurants were very good and Tao Nightclub is always a good time in the connected Venetian. The location is perfect for what my friends and I were there for. We like to gamble and walk around during the day and hit the clubs at night. We find the best clubs are at the Venetian, Wynn, Encore, and Caesar's, which are all within walking distance. If we had stayed further down the strip in the area of Planet Hollywood and south, we would have taken a cab out at night. The one negative I can say about the hotel is that Grazie seemed to have cut out all comps. The first couple trips I had to Venetian/Palazzo were comped rooms, but I guess I'm no longer eligible for them anymore. That's a bit of a let down. I've also heard people complain about the Resort Fees but these are now the norm in Vegas. Every hotel has resort fees and the other hotels I've stayed at are actually higher ($20 as opposed to $17 at Palazzo). Overall it was a great experience and I've already booked another trip to the Palazzo in July. We are also thinking of coming again in October. I can't wait for either trip.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious suites, minor gripe no coffemaker”
Reviews.Author: Randi442
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a package at the Palazzo that included tickets to Phantom of the Opera. The room was beautiful, clean and luxurious. We had no complaints about the toiletries supplied in the bathroom, and the service was excellent. Our only gripe was that my coffee-addicted husband had to get up and get dressed to go to the coffee bar in the lobby, only to find that they only take cash or credit cards, neither of which he brought with him (they won't let you charge to your room). The real highlight was a disaster averted - my hubby left my laptop computer on one of the benches where you wait to have your car brought up from valet parking - the valet found it and held it for us, and was careful to make my husband show ID before they would give it to him. He gave him all the cash he had with him as a tip and they protested that wasn't really necessary. Thank god for exceptional service, it's all too rare these days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: retropj
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights in their basic suite, but on the 47th floor with a nice view. Suites had plenty of room with a living area, two flat screen tv's plus one in the bathroom. They were clean and the maid service was responsive when we had additional requests for towels, hangers, etc. My wife appreciated the make up table in the bathroom. The only negative was doors are very noisy when the close. When people left their room early in the morning or late at night it awoke us. Check in and check out was quick and professional with only one or two people ahead of us despite the fact there was a convention that brought over 100,000 to the city. There is a good selection of restaurants in the Palazzo/Venetian. Postrio and Delmonico were great! No complaints about the casino games and service. I mostly played poker over at Venetian and it was only a short 5 minute walk from Palazzo. Canyon Ranch spa has good facilities and professional staff. In the past we have mostly stayed at Caesars Palace, in the Augustus Tower, and have mostly enjoyed it, but we were very happy with our choice to give Palazzo a try.

Reviews.Title: “Most disgustingly dirty room I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Loves5StarTravel
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Palazzo April 15-18, 2011. The checkin line was a bit long, their slot machines are the tightest I've ever played and the restaurants were subpar (except SushiSamba which was great). None of this is of particular interest to my review, though, because of how filthy the room was we were first given. Granted, after showing the hotel manager pictures of just how bad it was he moved us to a different room (it was better, but not to the standard of a 5 star hotel), and gave us a $100 dining credit. To the room details: there were stains everywhere: the walls, the sofa (large pink/red stains), the desk (white gooey looking stain I refuse to think too much about), the tables, the tub, the shower, the glasses, the light fixture; the were several long black hairs sitting on one of the beds (the housekeeping supervisor tried to tell us that they had to of come from us, but we quickly pointed out that neither of us has long black hair); the in room copy/fax/printer has huge burn marks on it; the baseboards and walls were scuffed and dirty like no others I had ever seen. Instead of listing these in any further detail, I'm going to post some photos and let you decide if you want to pay to go stay at this supposedly 5 star hotel. One more thing, we ordered room service one day and after waiting an hour we called to check the status and were told, "Jose is on his way up to your room right now." Then, 15 minutes later they called the room to tell us they were out of bagels and wanted to know if we wanted something else. At this point in our stay my buddy lost it, and I can't say I blame him. Why did they lie to us about something so stupid? How could it take 1.25 hours to figure out they were out of bagels? Granted, when we spoke to a room service supervisor they offered to comp the meal, but we were too hungry to wait any longer so we ate elsewhere. At this point the hotel manager decided to take 50% off of our first night's rate. The kind offer, however, did NOT satisfy us to the point that we will ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location, had a fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: Switzercat
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip to Vegas. We researched a lot of hotels on the strip and decided on the Palazzo. We wanted to be close to a lot of shows, be at a 5 star resort, have a nice sized suite, etc. Took the shuttle from the airport, as suggested on the Palazzo website. Arrived at the hotel last Saturday and checked in at 11am. We thought it might be an issue that we arrived hours before check in, but it was no problem. We stayed for 4 nights. Hotel room was great- big, nice bathroom, nice view from the 43rd floor, etc. Doors closing at the other rooms and people talking could be heard, but we were at the end of the hall, so it wasn't too bad. Mini-bar was missing items, so we called to let the front desk know, so it wasn't a problem. Our room was nice and clean all week, but there were always loads of room service trays and dishes in the hall. That was the only complaint I have about cleanliness at the hotel. The pools are fantastic! We loved the indoor shopping areas. Beautiful! We purchased most of our show tickets from Tix4Tonite, which is located across the street from the Palazzo, as well as elsewhere along the strip. We saw Phantom (amazing, super cheap, and located at the Venetian), Cirque Mystere, Love (bought those tickets from the actual box office, since it is a super popular show), the Beatles Tribute band, and Absynthe at Caesar's (crazy show geared towards the 20's and 30 year olds). Bellagio fountain lights at night were nice. Volcano and pirate shows at TI and the Mirage were cheesy... but free, so what do you expect ? :) We ate some meals at the hotel, but the best (and only)buffet we went to was at the Wynn (right next door). My fave meal was at PF Changs (great vegetarian food). A bit disappointed with Del Torro at the Palazzo. Best gelato on the strip was at the little gelato place in the square at the Venetian. Make sure you hit up the happy hours they have for drinks ($5 or less for beers or wine). We made the mistake of having a few of drinks on a patio on the strip and paid a FORTUNE! Re shopping: we went to the Primm Fashion Outlet mall. Not worth it! The Burberry store has closed and the mall looked like it had been hit hard by the recession. Next time we'll try the Prime outlets close to the strip. It was a great vacation for a couple trying to get away from the kids for a few days. Lots to do, plenty to see, great time! Next time we might stay at the other end of the strip (it really is super far to walk!). But we'd be happy to stay at Palazzo or the Venetian again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs more to be in the class it thinks it is in”
Reviews.Author: outbax
Reviews.Content: Suites are large, spacious and comfortable. For a newer hotel the walls and desk have chips in them and stained carpet. Housekeeping is horrendous as they missed one day even cleaning room and when do, do not do a very good job. Don't need to get in details of hotel as has all the ammenities of any upscale Vegas hotel with prices to match. Front desk and concierge are pleasant and helpful. Beware of $17/nt resort fee hidden in fine print. Also really look at bill as ours had two $6 bottles of water from the rooms mini-bar that we never had. I am sure they would take it off if you ask but I assumed my wife had purchased elsewhere as does not clearly indicate they came from the room. They must make thousands of dollars on these charges. Wasn't a bad stay, but will look for another accomodation on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific suite, very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: LivetoTravel1066
Reviews.Content: We had a nice trip staying at The Palazzo. This was my first time staying there, as we found a good deal online. The suite was very well designed for comfort and space. They have a total of three flat-screen tv’s so you can watch a game or a movie from any of the rooms. The tub was super relaxing. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. Room service was pretty fast and the staff was quite helpful. These suites are really a good idea if you are traveling with friends or family as you can truly have people stop by for drinks and visit before you go out for your evening-there is just that much space and seating to accommodate everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh... It's Okay”
Reviews.Author: missericayvette
Reviews.Content: I usually like staying in the Palazzo ... huge rooms, nice décor, centralized location on the strip. I stayed there a couple days before NYE so the place was super crowded. I got a room on the 45th floor of the hotel which meant great views of the strip BUT the second I got off the elevator ruined my stay... the smell of rotten eggs in the hallway. =( we asked the maintenance guy what the smell was and he told us "what smell, I don't smell anything." I would have let that pass but the next morning when we left the room it still smelled like rotten eggs. I would have expected the Palazzo to fix this problem as quickly as possible since there were maintenance guys hanging out the hallways but they didn't... maybe it was just a bad experience. I'll probably just stick to staying at the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: RachelNRuss
Reviews.Content: Always a great stay here. The rooms all feel luxurious and spacious. Everything is perfect the pillows, the chaise, the couch, the view, the magnificent bathrooms! I will stay here every time i go to vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Too busy to accommodate”
Reviews.Author: Trinity33
Reviews.Content: I booked a non-smoking room, but when I arrived I was told they only had smoking unless I was willing to pay an extra 75 dollars a night. I was told to come back the next day and they would try and find me a non smoking room if one became available. Went back, to be told I was too late and I should have shown up earlier. So I gave up. It's interesting in this age of smoke-free living, just how much a smoky room and corridor affects you. It definitely spoiled my stay.
