I think the staff should have done more to help, although I recognize their options may be limited at these peak occupancy occasions. One warning which is given in previous review and I wish I'd noted. The water is 5 dollars, and the one they leave out on top of the mini bar isn't free. There are guys outside the hotel selling similar bottles for a dollar. So best pick them up there.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, not as "high-end" as you would assume for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kamala69
Reviews.Content: ok, I am not a VEgas girl but am there every year on business, and stay for a week. The suites at the Palazzo are really not all you would assume.......noisy, poor air quality, -- frankly the INn at he Mandalay FAR superior. I found the bed to be comfortable, and that was about it -- not thrilled about the layout, the bathrooms were adequate. Not what you expect from a high end VEgas hotel Staff were cold, indifferent in all aspects, from front desk, to housekeeping t the guys in the coffee shop. Better way to spend 300 a night on a hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: GerardNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel on the strip, interconnected with The Venetian Hotel. Stayed there for 6 nights with my wife. Room on the 42nd floor, overlooking the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: mike424u
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived from are flight from sanfransico as part of are 3 city USA tour, We were over the moon with the look and feel of this hotel. The location was just perfect for all are needs. check was no issue and very quick. Warning this hotel complex is massive, its connected to the Venetion as well. We stayed in a deluxe suit which was fantastic, almost as big as nomral uk house. It had everything you could wish from and more. Only let down if any was the wifi was not free in the rooms, $11 a day which was over priced, also a pc for hire by recption which was $1 a min again this was a rip off. Everything extra you want then have to pay for and is a bit pricey compared to other local hotels, but saying that walgreens supermarket is right on the door step and you buy whatever you need there at normal prices. We did no op for the strip view, but we had a better view out of the back over the golf course, with the moutains in the back gorund. We also got married in Vegas, Little chapel of flowers, again cant fault them in anyway. Pick up by limo from the hotle. We played the slot machines a couple of times for free beer, as beer prices are fairly high in hotels and for a couple of dollors on the 1 cent slots we got pissed on bud, so not a bad deal. The canyon spa was also very good value, my partenr had her hair do and spray tan tect the full pre wedding make over for less the £200. Eating in the hotel is a treat so many places in the hotle to pick from, no complaints at any we used. The indoor gondola ride was good as well. Only had couple of issues to talk about, one of rooms TV played up and the dvd player, when we tried to view are wedding dvd. only a small issue and they sortted it out very quickly. All round a great place to stay when in vegas and we will back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL IN FABULOUS LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Nickwot
Reviews.Content: Can't honestly fault this place, very clean, very well maintained, all suite rooms (720 sq ft), very polite staff, food fantastic (and lots of it, no euro portions here), right on the strip and well priced for what you get. Hotel merges into The Venetian complex so it realy is big with no shortage of things to do, drink is expensive but you can get what you want in most of the big pharmacy chains (Wallgreens, CVS etc) and bring it back to your room. If you can, ask for a view of the strip, it's well worth it. Most of the shops in the hotel are for the super rich with more money than sense so my advice is to head of to one of the malls nearby and grab a bargain. Get a rental car as you'll need it if you value your feet, Vegas is big. Use the valet parking if you need to park up in any of the hotels, very handy... The nightclubs are expensive and most are geared towards good looking and well off individuals (I didn't meet this criteria but had complimentary tickets)!!! If you do nothing else before you die go to Vegas and have a ball!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Decadence”
Reviews.Author: rolyholmes
Reviews.Content: Had never stayed here before, always wanted to, and am now glad we have. We had five days in Vegas and after three days of spaaing, shopping, seeing the sights, and gambling we checked into the Palazzo for the last two nights. Wish we had spent all five here. The size of the room gave you such a great place to get away from the noise and crowds and just relax. The room was huge with a wall of windows overlooking the wynn pools and golf course and you can sit and watch those huge planes flying in out. The gentleman that checked us in was excellent. Treated us like family not just another number. Phantom of the Opera music in the elevator was a nice touch. We were comped a few things and that just put the perfect spin on the whole visit. These people that complain about the rooms must really come from some fancy digs because to me this place was sublime and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: JNDTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo has been the best stay so far and I would love to return again! From the moment you step on the hotel, you are treated like a VIP! The staff is so attentive and are there to make you feel very welcome and helpful. Check in time was so quick and I felt so refreshed walking around the casino. I hate the smell of cigarette smoke and I have to say that I had no issues in the casino and folks smoking. The suite was so comfortable, fresh, good bedding, etc....just great! I have stayed at the Wynn, Encore, and The Aria, but The Palazzo just suits my travel needs! I had everything at my disposal without getting lost or tired in the Casinos. The restaurant options were great, for a quick bite "The Grand Luxe" Cafe was soo delish! The hotels location on the strip was great and I loved that crossing over to The Fashion Mall was just 5 min away. TAO was great to party even though I am a PURE regular. I loved that right before you go to the hotels elevators, theres a coffee place and snack store in place, just perfect! Overall, Spring Break and The Palazzo was a great choice! I had booked another hotel, but after reading so many bad reviews, I canceled it and booked at The Palazzo and it was awesome. Thank you Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I Clean a Bathroom at the Palazzo I want to be on payroll.”
Reviews.Author: Srose1062
Reviews.Content: First of all this is our second stay at the Palazzo and will be our last! I have come to understand that "Green" means two things, no water pressure and not clean. Both times we have been given filthy rooms to begin with, upon complaint we were immediately moved to cleaner rooms. We have had many of the same issues other reviewers have mentioned. CHECK YOUR BILLINGS! If you don't you WILL regret it. Requests made in advance mean NOTHING! If something is available when you show up you might get it or not. My partner requires refrigeration for her medication and even though we have requested in advance and it's in our records, we have to wait until they can bring it up at their convenience after we check in. We run away from home once a year, we pay for a nice hotel and services, we plan months in advance and the last thing we expect to be doing on our first night on vacation is scrubbing our Hotel bathroom. And if you are short be aware the toilets are made for giants, the telephone books in the bottom drawer make for a nice foot rest. The BEST thing about the Palazzo is the Canyon Ranch Spa! Excellent treatments every time. Love them!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel and Biggest Room”
Reviews.Author: VTbrooklyn04
Reviews.Content: I've never been to Vegas before and went ther for business last month for ten days. I stayed at the Palazzo and seriously never left except for work. Everything that you need is right there- amazing restaurants, shopping and shows and the hotel is beyond gorgeous. I'm not a huge Vegas fan but I would def go back JUST to stay at his place. Tips: If you eat healthy, try the CanonRanch Grill Postrio in the square has amazing food and is one of the cheaper places for dinner. The Mexican place in the casino has amazing guacamole!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN LAS VEGAS!!”
Reviews.Author: LESERLEE23
Reviews.Content: OMG...screw the bad reviews, I LOVED THIS HOTEL! I've been going to Vegas every year since I was little and while on a business trip I was finally able to stay here...The room was amazing & huge!!! The bathroom made me feel like a princess & the room made me feel like the president. Location wise, it was almost towards the end of the strip so it was a long walk to a lot of places. Overall, I hope I get the chance to stay here again. <3

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nSx4
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at a different hotel every time I go to Vegas and decided to give Palazzo a try this time. I wanted to get something nicer than a standard room and opted for the Prestige Siena Suite. This is basically the nicest room you can get outside of the super high end rooms that you need to call in to inquire about. I booked the room online, got my confirmation, and didn't think about it again until it was time for the trip. I left for the airport after work so I didn't get there until later in the evening. It was probably about 7pm when I got there. The front desk was pretty empty, there were maybe 2-3 other people there. I walked up to an open counter and checked in. The person helping me must've been ready to leave work for the day or something as he didn't really seem to care too much and just wanted to quickly get me checked in and be done with it. I walked into the room and instantly knew that they had given me the wrong room. It looked just like any other standard room in Vegas. I went back down to the front counter and told them that they checked me in to the wrong room. The person that was helping me before was gone and I got someone new. She asked me for my name and looked up my reservation. After a few minutes, she told me that it looked like there was no error and that this was indeed my room - a standard room. I had printed out my reservation confirmation so I pulled it out and showed her. My credit card had already been charged and I definitely did not book a standard room. It was very clear on my confirmation what room I had booked. She spent a few more minutes on the computer and then told me that she needed to check with the people that worked on the online reservations. She left me at the front counter and goes into a back room. I ended up waiting at the front counter for a good 10-15 minutes before she came back. All she said when she got back was basically "Oops, looks like we made a mistake, you were right". No apologies or anything. At this point, I was a bit upset as I had already spent an hour just trying to check in. Seeing that I had spent a good chunk of money and had booked one of their more expensive rooms, along with the fact that they had messed up my reservation and wasted a bunch of my time, I figured they would do something to make it up to me. Nothing. She punched me in for the correct room, and gave me a new set of keys. I asked her which room she gave me and what the view was like. She had given me a room that was facing the back of the hotel and basically just had a view of the top of a parking garage. I asked if she had any rooms with a better view available. She said yes, but wouldn't give me the upgrade unless I paid an extra fee (which was quite a bit more). I wasn't asking for an upgraded room or anything knowing that I had already paid for basically the best room I could get, I just didn't want to be looking at the top of a parking garage. She wouldn't budge. I was already running late and didn't feel like wasting anymore time so I just took the room. Again, no apologies or anything for their mistake and wasting my time. I walk into the room expecting it to be really nice. Instead, it looked pretty much just like a bigger version of the standard room I was in earlier. The only real difference was that they split the living room and the bedroom into two seperate rooms and gave the living room it's own seperate restroom. The first thing I noticed was that a few of the light bulbs were out. Then, when I tried to use the "automatic" window curtains, I found out that the remotes for the curtains didn't work and there wasn't any way to open the curtains manually. BOTH of the curtain remotes were dead, for both the curtains in the bedroom and the curtains in the living room. The doors to the restroom in the living room was squeeking badly and the lights inside this small side restroom was so low that it was hard to see. I wondered to myself how long it had been since someone had actually come into this room with all these problems. Definitely not something you expect from a 5 star hotel's "top of the line" room. Everything else looked ok, but again, nothing special, just the standard room with a bit more floor space. I definitely felt ripped off after seeing what I had paid for. Since I got the "Prestige" version of the room. I had access to the lounge on the floor. It was a fairly nice lounge and you get free campagne, coffee, snacks, and cocktails during certain parts of the day. I only went in there once or twice as I was out the rest of the time so I didn't really use it much. I also tried using the special priority service line that the "Prestige" room came with to ask for a few extra glass cups for a few friends that had come over and brought ther own drinks. The room came with two glass cups and they would only give us two more cups saying that we'd need to pay a fee if we wanted more. I thought that this was just ridiculous. It then took them over half an hour to bring the two cups up to us. My friends were staying in a cheaper standard room at another hotel and had no problems getting more cups when I went to visit them. All in all, the experience at this hotel wasn't very memorable. The room itself was very plain with lots of issues and the service was horrible. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for how much it costs and what you end up getting. I can get a room of similar or better quality at a different hotel for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort but expensive Trip Report too”
Reviews.Author: LondonLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo from Wednesday March 30 through Saturday April 2. We arrived just before noon on Wednesday. Check in was easy although rooms were not ready. They did have rooms available immediately but we wanted adjoining rooms so we had to wait. The first room was ready around 3pm, so we were able to get our luggage into that room, but the second room wasn't ready until around 7pm. They call your cell phone when your room is ready to let you know. The rooms were very clean, decorated beautifully and quite roomy. The beds were very comfortable, flat screen TVs, etc. Also the front desk was very accommodating. I called down to find out where the business center was to print out my boarding passes, (I didn't bring my laptop, but there are connections and printers in every room) and they did it for me so I wouldn't have to pay for internet access. We had a problem with the lights, and housekeeping responded very quickly. Baggage was handled quickly and efficiently. We were able to store it on Saturday as we were flying back on a late night flight on Saturday. When the baggage clerk saw the taxi line, he walked us out the back door so he could flag a taxi out of the line for us since we were going to the airport. They do have late check out, but they charge for it. That is probably why the second room was late in getting checked in. Check out is 11am, if you want 2pm it is an additional $50 plus tax, and 6pm is an additional $100 plus tax. We decided against that. Be warned: the hotel has a resort fee of $17.00 plus tax per room per night, and that is settled up when you check out. The bar in the room is well stocked, but very expensive - water is $5.00 per bottle, pop is the same and it is motion sensitive - if you touch anything it records it. We checked the bar when we got in the first room and several items were missing. We called the front desk immediately to let them know so that they had a record that we did not use any of the items. No coffee maker in the room, there is a coffee shop right at the bottom of the elevators, very expensive, one coffee, one hot chocolate, one bagel and one crescent - $17.00. The pool was crowded, you have to be there no later than 10am to get a seat. Towels were plentiful, and you can use the Palazzo pool or walk over to the Venetian pool. We did have breakfast at the Grand Lux Cafe - they have a buffet breakfast, it was very good. Also had dinner at Zine's, the Asian restaurant, also very good, we had coupons for Zines for $30.00 off, but it just about covers the tip!!! Not cheap. Also ate at First Bar, with a coupon, that was also excellent. Carnellettos in St. Marks Square was also a choice for dinner, very good too. I did find the service very slow in the stores and restaurants, for some reason. We did a bit of shopping, and it just seemed like there wasn't alot of help. Not sure why. Took long to get checks, etc. Took the tour to the Grand Canyon, be warned, you are on the bus probably a total of 11 hours. The bus left Treasure Island around 6:30am, you go to the bus depot, breakfast is water and a power bar, some coffee, you load up onto the bus around 7:15 am and set off. Lunch is a buffet around 11:00 and you dont' get to the grand canyon until about 12:30pm and you depart around 3:30pm with some bathroom stops. I enjoyed the Grand Canyon, but you are on the bus a LONG TIME!!!!!!! We used Grand Canyon Tours. Also, be aware the trip is expensive, $189.00 per person plus a fuel surcharge, and then you also are requested to tip the drive $15.00 per person. Our driver was excellent, gave great advice, and had fun movies to watch so I was happy to give him the tip. All in all, a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but they charge you for everything”
Reviews.Author: CaroHouston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect. The price is good, but they charge a fee for using the fitness center and internet, doesn't matter if you're no interested, you have no option. No coffee maker in the room. The pool was packed, without enough chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with Amazing rooms - I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayCaz
Reviews.Content: I visited the Palazzo in September 2010 with my boyfriend, mum and step-dad. There were a few bad reviews on here and we were a little concerned before we went, however there was nothing to be concerned about. The hotel is huge and you could spend all day in there without seeing sunlight as it connects to the Venetian so the complex itself is massive. The Rooms - These were amazing. A large suite with a comfy big bed, living area and gorgeous bathroom. This is probably the best room I have stayed in and I have stayed in a lot of hotels. There was a dressing table in the bathroom which was great for getting ready in. Location - The best. Central on the strip and near to many of the main hotels and nightly shows. You wouldn't find a better spot. Casino - This was good and always busy, although most of the tables are higher buy ins which fits in with the standard of hotels. One issue was they wouldn't accept our English driving licences as ID and we had to go get a wristband fro security (this was the only place this happened and we are in our lates 20's) A passport would have been fine. Food - The restaurants that we went to were fabulous. There are so many to choose from and we didnt' have a bad meal our whole trip. A couple of times we asked the conceierge to book us a table which they did and they were really helpful. On Friday and Saturday lots of places were full so if you want to go somewhere specific book early. My favourites were Morels Steakhouse and CUT. I don't think there will be a bad place in the Palazzo or Venetian. Shopping - The shops in the Palazzo are high end/designer, nice to look in but I didn't buy anything. There is a big mall accross the road, you can cross safely to get there on the walkways. Here there are more high street names which were cheaper than in the UK eg Diesel, Levi etc. Pool - The pool areas are large and you can use pools from both hotels. Due to the height of the buildings sunny areas in a morning were shady by the afternoon, which was no problem as we just moved around. It was often too hot to be there for too long. At about 4 o'clock there was a good place in the sun by the Venetian. Other things - We went to see Love which was one of the best shows I have ever seen - would highly recommend. We also went to Bills Gambling Hall for cheap beer, the Bellagio for the fountain show. You can explore all the hotels so that is great. We stayed there for 7 nights which we thought might be too long - However it wasn't long enough as we loved it so much. I can't recommend this hotel enough, one of the best places I have been ever. I hope to go back someday soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Nelliebird
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, helpful and respectful. All staff treated you like you were a top guest. I've been to Vegas quite a few times, and will not be staying anywhere else after this stay. Rooms were were very generous in size and gorgeous! We didn't want to leave. Stay here, and you will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and view”
Reviews.Author: cogagni
Reviews.Content: Price - we paid $144 + $17 resort fee Booking - we picked this hotel based on tripadvisors reviews and we weren't disappointed. Parking - self parking was convenient Internet - access speeds were awesome. Budget Breakfast - Don't want to spend $40 for breakfast? Level 2 has a Cafe Presse - we split a large coffee and 3 bagels with creamcheese for < $15. Floor - based on reviews we asked for high floor at the back. We got the 42nd floor and had a beautiful of the mountains. Bathroom - amazing. TVs - 1 in the bathroom, and 2 in the main room. This is excessive. :) Sunken living room - this is a very nice detail. Big windows - the view was great. Pool - the swimming pool is beautiful. We had a great time at the pool. Best things - room decor and fast internet, and GREAT pool. Worst things - no free attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Neighbours Ruined Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Schosco
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Venetian around midnight after a late flight to discover that the room type we reserved (non-smoking king bed) was not available and in fact only smoking rooms were available, so they offered to move us to the Palazzo, however they still only had two queens there. We didn't mind the change and were told we could call to switch to a king the next day. When we got to our room I went through the papers the front desk had given us to find our breakfast coupons as the rate we reserved included continental breakfast. They weren't there, so I called to the front desk and they asked me to come down. I was surprised they would not bring the coupons to the room, which is what I would expect at a 5*. After waiting in line at the desk I got the coupons, but upon counting them later I realized that we were short two. We decided not to go back because we figured we would eat elsewhere one morning. The room was very nice. Great furnishings, large living room area, multiple televisions, huge bathroom with separate shower & soaker tub. All of the pillows were feathered and since I have allergies, I requested hyperallergenic ones. Somewhere the message got mixed up because housekeeping showed up and wanted to change all of the linens. The next day we decided not to go through the hassle of changing rooms since we are used to a queen anyway. Big mistake. We came back to our room the next night to hear the TV in the room next door blaring so loudly that we could hear what show was on. I guess we got some new neighbours during the day. We called security and they came up and found no one in the room - people left the TV blaring while they were out. Security turned off the TV and left. Next night, same thing. However, this time security didn't show up, so we didn't sleep well. We've stayed in Vegas several times at different hotels and though it's known as a party town, we've never had problems with noise at night. One other annoying thing is that there was some sort of security light because there are two stairs between the sleeping area and the living room area. I guess it's so people won't fall down the stairs at night. However, we couldn't turn it off and it seemed pretty bright when all of the other lights were out. As for other amenities, we wandered down to the pool area which was absolutely gorgeous, though we didn't get to use it because it was a little too chilly during our stay. The parking garage was big and we never had problems getting a spot. The free continental breakfasts at the Luxe Cafe were mediocre and the wait staff seemed confused about what was included. We upgraded to the buffet one morning and it was decent, but nothing special. We had a very yummy meal at Dos Caminos just off the casino. We like this location on the strip as it feels very central, it's attached to shopping and near the Fashion Show Mall. We like to try different places on the strip, so we probably won't be back to this one next time. Overall, it was nice rooms and just OK service, but it was the rude neighbours who ruined our stay. By the way, they do charge a resord fee at this hotel. Don't know why these stupid fees are not just included in the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Live-Life-2-Travel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, gorgeous, huge suites. Excellent service. On the strip near TI, Mirage. Not in heart of action - if you want lively stay near MGM/Bellagio/Planet Hollywood. Excellent pools. Casino area lacked excitement compared to other casino's. Restaurants were lovely. Denny's for breakfast nearby. Connected to Venetian which is picturesque and ambient. Watch 'Beatles Love' at Mirage - it was brilliant. Want to go back... Vegas is always amazing. This was perfect for a romantic trip. For more fun I'd stay in Planet Hollywood/MGM etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: global5000pilot
Reviews.Content: Check-in was ok, very nice people but had to wait 45 min for room at 3pm. Great room on top floor with excellent view of Wynn and Stratosphere. Had to call down for extra blankets and pillows for pullout sofa. Called a suite, but really just one long bedroom with sofa and extra tv and desk. Liked the remote controlled shades. Very nice bathroom with separate shower/bath. Casino is nice but kind of dull atmosphere compared to Palms or Hard Rock- older crowd. Some dealers very fun, others boring to rude. Restaurants were very good with plenty of choices- food court in attached mall, great shopping. Loved Lavo- excellent food with HUGE portions, fun atmosphere and great service. Sports book in the Stadium is great, but charge WAY too much for a table during NCAA tourney. Half the tables stayed empty until they lowered the price. Very good food and service, great big screens everywhere. Tao at the Venetian was excellent- eat dinner, no wait in huge line and free entry to nightclub. Overall a great stay, but rooms were a little expensive due to Spring Break/convention/ March Madness. Very nice spa/workout facility. Pool looked nice, but it was too cold to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back. Bad service, Bad Food, Terrible value.”
Reviews.Author: likethesun916
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many hotels on the strip and was really looking forward to the Palazzo. Positives: The rooms are quite large although the decor is uninspired. And the shops that wind through the Venetian have a cool "fake sky ceiling" as if you are outside. The rest was disappointing. We thought because they keep their room prices up that it would attract a slightly older, less rowdy clientele. Wrong. I don't know how the 20 somethings afford it but there are lots of them. Was woken up on the 2nd night at 4:00am to singing, chanting, screaming etc. What was weird is that I looked into the hall and the sound did not appear to be coming from my floor - no noise. But the party sounded like it was in my bedroom. For an expensive hotel the construction must be really cheap for the sound to come through loud and clear from another part of the hotel. At 4:30am called front desk who supposedly sent security. Noise eventually stopped. Found out later security did nothing, another guest must have stepped in. Called the front desk the next day asked a manager for some sort of compensation, a fruit basket, something. Nothing. They couldn't care less. Again in a less "classy" hotel I would have expected less. The other major thing was that the food was bad. Having been to Vegas a dozen times and shelling out big bucks for nice dinners, I don't remember ever having bad food. But it happened at the Palazzo restaurants again and again. Overcooked seafood , fatty chicken, just bad seasonings. Finally started eating at the Wyhn next door. Much better. Overall just felt it was a really bad value and I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, excellent rooms, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: King06
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for a business conference. Room suites are very nice, plenty of room, two flat screen tv's. very convenient to plenty of shopping, if that's your thing.... fitness facilities outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A GIRLS WEEKEND WENT WRONG!!”
Reviews.Author: MJA26
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay i ever had experience being in las vegas. upon arriving at 10pm to checkin the girl makes a mistake and charges my friend the wrong amount on her credit card and then tried to fix it and made it worse..ok so now they are holding 1500 of her money..ok we will move on though! I try to order room service in the room but they were rude on the phone also...ok maybe everyone is having a tough night...we will try it tom! upon we waking up i come in from a long night to find my friend spending 2 hours on the phone with her bank trying to get everything worked out since this hotel screwed her acct up SO BAD!! at this point my frind didn't even want to stay in vegas any longer! after coming her down at 1pm we went over to the cosmo hotel and enjoyed our day! then the topper was at night we were getting ready and we needed more than 5 bandaids due to feet issues..lol! when calling the girl told me that she could only give us 2!!! i asked her if she said 2 and she said thats what i said do you want them? I called the manager and he said he was handling it but when he had the bandaids brought up to us we were only sent 1!!!!!!!!! ok we got the point!!! so we went over to the cosmo again were are friends were staying and had them brought up asap!! hello we are in vegas and are trying to have a girls weekend!! upon checkout we were told two different stories and amounts that we were being charged and it took so long that WE MISSED OUT FLIGHT!!! can i just say I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN! i have never been treated so poorly and there was more but i won't bore everyone but the service was below a 1!!! thanks for not allowing me and friend to have a great girls weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room but complaints were not handled”
Reviews.Author: raquel030
Reviews.Content: Check in was fairly quick at Venetian but as other readers have expressed, we too were told that a better room was available at the Palazzo for an extra $45 per night. We were told that our room had been booked as one king bed (there were 2 adults and 2 preteens) so we had to pay for a room with 2 queens. The room itself was beautiful and the view was great. We could watch the TI show or the volcano at the Mirage. The bathroom was the perfect size for 4 of us. On the second day we came home at 9pm only to find our door was not shut properly. Our door had been open about 9 hours!!! The next day I lost my gold & diamond tennis bracelet either in the casino or left it in the room in the morning. We reported this to management and also the incident of the door ajar. They said they would make a report. We also asked that our room no longer be cleaned for the remainder of our stay. Never ever heard back from anyone at the hotel. No phone call if we had found the bracelet. Nothing.....a little disappointed on how that was handled.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the strip! Palazzo has it all!”
Reviews.Author: iloveshoes878
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up and were greeted by the valet, everything was spectacular. We were checked in very quickly by the wonderful staff at the front desk who upgraded our room to a fortuna suite. It was wonderful! The best hotel the strip has to offer. Exceptional service, beautiful suites, and the most comfortable beds made this hotel a must-stay! Everything was quite clean, and the bathroom had an extremely large steam shower which was great! The Palazzo is also linked with the Venetian hotel so there are limitless options for shopping and/or dining.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and classy”
Reviews.Author: kachst2011
Reviews.Content: Love the larger suites at the Palazzo Las Vegas, much better than it's sister property the Venetian and more modern stylish rooms. A definite winner!

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious room with enough beds for 5!”
Reviews.Author: CandCandC
Reviews.Content: We booked a good rate at the Venetian for $179 per night, but were offered an upgraded suite at the Palazzo with a view of the strip for $25 per night, which we took since it was our 3 kids first visit to Vegas, we thought they would enjoy the view. The rooms were only 3 years old, and were lovely, classy and S P A C I O U S! 2 queen beds, our own living room with another pull out bed, desk, table, tons of chairs and seating, own fax machine, 2 deluxe flat screen TV's and a third in the huge bathroom. Nice tub and good amenities. We've stayed at many hotels in Vegas, including Mandalay Bay, MGM and Paris, and this was far nicer. The ONLY problem was that one of the queen beds was, no joke, as lumpy and noisy as a hundred year old mattress. The tiniest movement emitted an ear piercing "SQWAAAAK, AND SQUEEEEAK!" We were only here 2 days and made the kids sleep on the noisy one the second night, staying longer would have definitely warranted a call to managment about it though. Would recommend the Palazzo, esp. for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “The best Option in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mungo888
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 boys (11 and 13) and I had 2 adjoining rooms for 6 nights here in august 2010. Having been regular visitors to the sister property Venetian before we tried the Palazzo this time. We were not disappointed. Check in and out service was quick and efficient and very courteous. The rooms are huge and very well decorated. Bathrooms massive and very clean and good. Location is perfect for us. Mid (ish) strip - opposite the Fashion Show Mall. Lots to do within walking distance. Though when we did need our car the access to the car park is very easy from this hotel. Food throughput was very good. The casino is great - and you can easily walk to the Venetian casino as well. Ultimately it is the rooms and the location that make this the best place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not world class”
Reviews.Author: m22z1
Reviews.Content: Five night stay at the Palazzo, March 20 - 24, 2011. Room spacious and luxurious - overlooked Wynn golf course. Bed lumpy. Housekeeping spotty at best - one day left no wash cloths - next day no shampoo (hadn't even used up half of the original). Checking in - waited 20 mins. Checking out - waited 10 mins with 2 people in front of me. No matter what time of day or night, housekeeping carts in the hallway. Lots of noise at night. The room itself - roomy, luxurious with marble in the bathroom and 3 tvs, however one could not soak in the tub and watch the tv (in the bathroom) at the same time. Very nice room, but expected better housekeeping. Service in general in Vegas (not just this hotel) is tolerable at best.

Reviews.Title: “A kind of super-luxury”
Reviews.Author: joedoe587
Reviews.Content: The rooms are all very large suites, with sunken living rooms and three TVs, and (mostly) great views of Vegas and the far-off mountains. The Palazzo/Venetian casinos, shopping areas and restaurants are all very nice, though overpriced by any standard. The decor of the rooms is Las Vegasy, not really to my taste, but comfortable. Although a newer hotel, the velvet is starting to show its age a tad, with the occasional odd stain here and there. Also, despite the mandatory "resort fee", there are few freebies common even in cheap motels nowadays: No coffee maker in room, no free newspaper, no free business center, no free breakfast for all, no really close-in parking, etc. As in all hotels with a casino, they try to keep you lost and make you walk through the casino to get anywhere, hoping you are dumb enough to stop at a slot machine and give away some of your money. Shop around for good rates on their website. Since they had dropped the internet rate a bit after I booked, I politely informed the desk of this when I checked in and asked for a free upgrade, after he had so very generously offered an upgrade for $45 and early checkin for $75! I got the upgrade to a view and the early check in for no extra charge. (Hint: Beware all sale pitches in Vegas and never pay extra for anything,) All in all if you take things in stride, you could do a lot worse than the Palazzo for the price, but if I could get the same price or say $50 more, I'd go to the Fours Seasons for real class, spotlessness and service. In summary, this is what you get when you try to run a "super luxury" hotel with 3000 huge suites, even if you are run a world class company: It's probably next to unmanageable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room, Great Las Vegas Location”
Reviews.Author: kjbms
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March of 2011 to celebrate his birthday. It was his first trip to Vegas. I have stayed at the Venetian before and the Palazzo was a great upgrade. The rooms are basically the same as the Venetian. Very spacious! Large bathroom with separate shower & tub and TV; sleeping area with large TV; very large living area with another TV, dining area and desk/office area complete with printer/fax machine. The only thing I didn't like was that the walls seemed thin; you could easily hear noise outside in the hallway. The Palazzo had an excellent gym and workout area. The Palazzo seemed to be more quiet and less crowded than the Venetian making it more luxurious and relaxing. The Palazzo is a short walk to the shops and many dining options. You really don't even need to leave the hotel to meet any of your needs. Service was great. I had flowers and a birthday cake ordered. The concierge was easy to work with and everything they sent met my expectations. The hotel has ample cab lines to quickly and easily get you in a cab and on your way. The hotel, casino, shops and rooms are clean and modern. The value received for the price paid is excellent. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Suites, But Not Quite Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: profxfiles
Reviews.Content: My better half and I were in Vegas for a combination work trip and vacation and we chose to stay in the Palazzo for the first time. The suites are huge--I'm quite certain our suite was larger than our first apartment. The location of the Palazzo and the friendliness of the staff were all top notch, but there were a variety of small things that bumped it down to four stars rather than five. For example, check-in was an endurance test--we stood in line for nearly 45 minutes before checking in. Another minor issue came with the towels--for what we paid for that suite, I really expected something better than a standard Super 8 bath towel. I've stayed in many legit 5-start places, and what the Palazzo tried to pass off as bath TOWELS would have been bath MATS at any other 5-star place. That said, we would definitely come back again, as the location and size of the rooms would make it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel- Nicest Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jetsetprincess
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel. It is super luxurious. I am not a gambler, so I spent a lot of time relaxing in the room and going to the spa and working out. The rooms are huge!! I cannot wait to go back. The shopping is amazing in the hotel, and there is great shopping all around the hotel. Great restaurants / clubs are in the hotel (Lavo and Tao).

Reviews.Title: “Not on par with other five star resorts”
Reviews.Author: Goober818
Reviews.Content: It is nice but not at all comparable with the other five star Strip resorts like The Wynn or Bellagio. The casino itself is boring but the shopping area is nice. The room was large with a nice sitting area but the bed and pillows were poor and the lighting system was not intuitive whatsoever. Its odd that another reviewer said the crowd was older, i am mid-30s and saw mostly 20-somethings. I travel a lot and this is the first time I experienced a massive error on my hotel bill at check out, being charged for full bottles of liquor from our mini bar. The hotel did rectify it but it is suspect to me. If the rates were similar I would opt for The Wynn/Encore instead.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet suite!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_SD
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice. They are good size with a great living area. You could easily fit four people in one room. The bathroom is good size too with a separate shower and tub. The toilet is also separated. The hotel has a good gambling facility and is linked to the Venetian hotel so the options are large.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time for Bachelorette Party Weekend”
Reviews.Author: dandelion_hds
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved our room. We had a nice view of the mountain. We stayed there for 2 nights to celebrate my Bachelorette weekend. The rooms were perfect size for the four of us. Staff was very helpful. If we needed to know were to go or contact the other hotels for show times and VIP tickets, all we had to do was go to the concierge and they would take care of everything. Great service and very helpful staff. It was my first time in Vegas and we had a great time. I wish we would have been able to enjoy the pools, but because it was rainy and cloudy, we decided to just do some shopping all day long. It is pricey, but maybe because it was a holiday weekend as well, so they didn't have good deals at the time. We didn't care either because we all pay the rooms together and we planned this for months! I definitely recommend this hotel for large groups of people if they want spacious rooms, and also for the great service and all the things to do inside.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice rest of the experience not so great.”
Reviews.Author: rprosisely
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great. Hotel feels nice - bit feminine with all the butterflies but I guess every hotel has their thing. What we first noticed is it attracts a older crowd. What we last noticed was the 155$ fraud charge from the pool. What made me really unhappy is at checkout front desk said they would dispute the charge for us but if it was determined by accounting to be ours our card would be charged - and if we wanted we could follow up to the outcome in 3 days. Really?!?! An employee at your pool area made a mistake or worse is contributing/facilitating fraud and you are making me do all the work?? Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: hermakos
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from our second Nascar trip to Vegas. We stayed at the Palazzo once again and we loved it! I don't care what people say about not staying at a nice hotel cause you're never there anyway, it makes a huge difference. The hotel was impecably clean, even on the cheapest rooms are spacious and the staff is second to none. When we got there we noticed we had no hot water for the first few hours, they upgraded our view for free, sent someone to our room to get our bags and had us in a new room withing 20 minutes.The staff will go out of their way to be accomodating, they are friendly and always right on top of everything. The location is awesome, you can walk to 2/3 of the strip and see everything, we didn't have to take one cab. The bus for Nascar picked us up right accross the street at TI. The Grand Lux max burger is the best in town, their breakfast buffet is fantastic, great omlettes and great value at $15.95 each compared to $30.00 each at TI. We tried the newer "I Love Burgers" place to compare but we were very dissapointed with the quality, definitely skip it. Fashion show mall is right accross the street and they have an ABC store where you can load up on alcohol, snacks etc... The prices for drinks at the Palazzo can be very high but we don't gamble therefore no free drinks.We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kristina009
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here! Wonderful rooms, great food and lots of fun to be had on the casino floor.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: 1mayday1
Reviews.Content: When in Vegas I just don't think you can do better than The Palazzo (or Venetian) for the money. I've stayed in these properties multiple times and am always very impressed. The suites are comfortable and large. Service is exceptional all around. The casino is great. I love the restaurants on the property, especially Carnevino. I will say that our room was not ready on arrival at 3 p.m. They supposedly gave us an "upgrade" and some coupons for restaurants. I personally find this situation unacceptable. I spoke to a friend staying at Caesars and he had the same problem. Just another unique joy of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsT21
Reviews.Content: I've gone to Las Vegas many times, and this was a wonderful hotel! The shops and restaurants are great (especially Lavo), the staff was very nice, the dealers were lots of fun, and we all had a great time. The shows were fantastic as well! Definitely a top-notch Vegas casino!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel - Best Stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: adrian1275
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this lavish hotel and cannot find words to describe it! The best hotel on the strip with grand rooms and lavish bathrooms. This hotel is one of its kind when it comes to decor & style. Booked from tigerhotels.co.uk. Our room had such beautiful views of the strip that it was worth every penny. The popular sports bar opened by Hip-hop mogul Jay-Z at the hotel features lavish décor and sports memorabilia. Restaurants and casinos are never ending. This hotel has set new standards for all the other hotels on the strip and is out of this world. We would love to come back again and stay here only!

Reviews.Title: “Still the best on the Strip...”
Reviews.Author: phxtravelguy
Reviews.Content: As Vegas regulars... we know what we like and expect for our Vegas weekends. This was our 6th time staying at the Palazzo and it was great, as usual. We got the oversized Fortuna suite - incredible. The room is really a lot larger than the regular auite. It makes for a perfect spot to refresh and relax. Everyone at the Palazzo... the bartenders, housekeepers, dealers, concierge... greet you with a genuine smile. Don't stay anywhere else... this is still the best.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY!”
Reviews.Author: mlenio11
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo was outstanding... The check-in took a bit longer than hoped for but still not too bad. The room was the best I've stayed in... Decked out to the max. I got the room last minute when traveling from California. At about 6pm, I called and got a suite for $130 on a Sunday night... It had 3 plasma tv's (one by the bed, one in the tv room, and one in the bathroom), a king size bed, huge sectional sofa, marble everything. Legit. I would stay here every time I go to Las Vegas if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkPP
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay in the Palazzo. Rooms are fantastic with a split level configuration. Connected to the Venetian which offers a number of fantastic dining locations within the 1 property. We upgraded our room for a scenic view and although we looked over the Strip you only face Treasure Island and the Trump tower - not the worst view in the world (and in fact good view of the free Treasure Island show held in the evening) but not the typical ‘Vegas’ view maybe we were expecting. The room could be enhanced with the inclusion of a coffee maker and i-pod docking station which is more the norm. Would highly recommend though and preferred over the Bellagio for overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great...some not so great...review on the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: theyanman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 5 nights in February 2011. My wife had a conference at the Venetian and I "tagged along." There were some really great parts of the hotel and some not so great, so let me delve into the details. Great things... 1. My wife checked in and there were no issues. Her flight got in early ~10AM and they were able to accommodate her request with an early check in. Great start. 2. There are three sets of elevators (split up by floor) that attempt to get to your room quickly. There was only one time we waited for an elevator for more than 5 minutes. 3. Floor hallways were decorated nicely and mostly quiet. Once in the suite, the room is tastefully decorated, with 3 flat screen TVs (really necessary?), a king size bed and comfortable couch (we napped on it a few times!). We had no issues getting to sleep. 4. Casino floor - the gaming areas are larger and more open than most. They must have had an advanced air filtration system because it seemed a lot less smoky than the venetian. We had lots of fun playing blackjack there. Plus, if you play there a decent amount, they are willing to comp you some of your meals and hotel stay at the end. Not a bad deal. They were able to comp our last night as well as our dinner at Delmonico. 5. Fine dining - We splurged and ate at Emeril's Delmonico for dinner one evening. What a wonderful meal. We really enjoyed it. Get the strip steak and creamed corn. Absolutely worth it. 6. Lots of nightlife and "scenery." Their nightclub is one of the busiest at Vegas with the longest lines to get in. Gentlemen, I'll leave that up to your imagination. 7. Location - all the best of the palazzo, plus the shops and the venetian just steps away...the resort is tastefully done with all the options you could ask for. Plus it is next door to the Wynn/Encore (which we enjoyed) and a short walk to the Mirage, TI, Caesars, Paris and Bellagio. This is one of the good things about this property, it's central location. Not so great... 1. Regular restaurant - We at at the grand luxe cafe for breakfast one morning, nothing special. Overpriced breakfast, but what would you expect in a high end vegas casino/resort? 2. Bathroom - maybe because we had a handicapped bathroom...but the shower was a bit hard to get in and out of, the shower pressure was on a bit on the low side and there was no door between the toilet and the rest of the bathroom. 3. Annoying motion sensor light in the room - I couldn't figure out what this was until I realized that the blinking red light was a motion sensor light. Very annoying. 4. No desk area + internet fee - I had to login a few times and it was very odd that the suite had no desk area. Plus it was $13 for the internet fee for 24 hours. I guess they want to squeeze every dime from their guests. 5. Our view - really bad view of the top of the casino floor with the HVAC units and planet hollywood in the background. Wished we had a better view. So all in all, we had a really good time and dealt with the minor negatives. We want to try the Wynn next time since we enjoyed it there, but if the price is right, I would consider staying at the Palazzo again, this time requesting for a regular room (vice a handicapped accessible room) and a strip view.

Reviews.Title: “favourite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JessieBun
Reviews.Content: had a great stay at the Palazzo, has everything we wanted, great casino, numerous pools, fantastic spa, good location, shops and too many bars/restaurants to use in a stay! this is our favourite hotel so far in Vegas, stayed at the sister hotel the Venetian in 2009 but preferred the palazzo now. No real criticism of The Venetian, just personal preference on the style and layout of The Palazzo. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricBeijing1964
Reviews.Content: This is a great property. It ranks up with the best in Vegas and features a great location, outstanding suites, painless checkin/checkout and a very competitive price. I plan to stay there again when I return to Vegas this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with very comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSpartan
Reviews.Content: A 40th birthday party with 5 friends couldn't have been more fun! A beautiful hotel with great amenities and wonderful service! Clean, spacious rooms with a fabulous view. Extremely comfortable beds which I find unusual in hotels. A great place to stay! It is also connected to a beautiful shopping and dining area with plenty to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel (showing its' age a bit already), excellent service and food.”
Reviews.Author: Rondo49
Reviews.Content: Although only about four(?) years old, the Palazzo rooms are starting to show their age. Our room was nice (32nd floor suite), but there were places in the room where wallpaper was peeling and electrical outlets were coming out of the wall. The thermostat in the room was also somewhat difficult to control since the hotel is "green". Never really did get it completely figured out but we were comfortable nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Great as Usual”
Reviews.Author: BevoXV
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Palazzo. Love the rooms - huge - and the location. Staff was friendly as usual. Other than not having a coffee maker in the room (hello, $4 cup of coffee), can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great, as expected but...”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: ...unfortunately, the size of the Hotel may be perhaps some of its downfall. We extended our stay at check in but the next morning we were berated by the housekeepers desperate to get in to clean it despite the privacy notice. Not happy considering we wanted to sleep in and not to mention telling the reception at 3am the night before to remind them that we were extending. Conversation as follows. He says "You need to come down and sign in again" I say "Um, i'm in my pj's man so cant exactly come down unless i wanna get tackled by security for bad dress sense. Can you send someone up?" He says "No, we're understaffed at the moment" (a sacralige comment in 5 hotels mate!) I say "Well I'll do it in the morning but it'd be late like after noon because I wanna sleep in" He says "Yes but make sure you come down before check out time" So very, very puzzled to say the least for a 5 diamond hotel. But other than that, everything in the room, perfect. Great views of the strip, comfy beds, too big to know what to do with the space and lived up to the standards expected. Though the bathroom could have a shower thats bigger... ;) ... am I being picky much?!

Reviews.Title: “Gee thanks for not honoring our repeat reservation”
Reviews.Author: sweptawayy
Reviews.Content: Loved the Palazzo last time we stayed and were happy to come back after making our reservation (with our Grazie number) months previously. We were told sorry, they were sold out and we would have to stay at the Venetian... We cannot stand the smokey, crowed casino in the Venetian and could not wait to play at the Palazzo. The counter person said they could move us back to the Palazzo the next day. We like to unpack and organize and this was an issue for us. I complained so she went to see her "manager"... after about 10 minutes (with a huge line behind us) she came out to tell us no- in fact we would have to stay two nights at the Venetian!! Plus the walk to the Venetian is quite long, my husband has a very bad ankle and limps and she did not even offer to have anyone bring our bags. We had to ask. After walking our bags out through the lobby, checking them so they could bring them over to the Venetian we started our dissappointing walk over. Not the way I envisioned our stay. We arrived at our room (identicle to those at the Palazzo) and were hit with the stink of cigarettes. I wanted to cry. I called the Venetian front desk and an apethetic voice made it sound like she could not do anything but finally she said there was a two bed room. Thank goodness it smelled good... It was fairly clean but the bathroom door was dirty- especially that of the water closet (uh, a bit gross). Also there were nasty stains on the bedskirt. We gambled a lot for us and my husband played a lot of craps and although he handed his Grazie card in, there were no credits and/or comps for him, however, we both really liked the pit boss Jeff who was friendly (this was at the Palazzo). We had a good time because we had a good attitude but never did move back to the Palazzo because our clothes were hung and we were settled in. We also were not planning on using the pool (the Venetian's were closed) so that issue did not affect us. We are very hesitant about staying at this property again (and we visit once or twice a year) and are looking for a hotel that is more polite, caring and accomodating to their "guests".

Reviews.Title: “Higher end, very beautiful resort, would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Stu3801
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Loved the hotel's location, features, amenities, restaurants, shopping, and service. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever in a hotel - ripoff”
Reviews.Author: diverinnm
Reviews.Content: This place was a disaster from the get go. Damaged furniture in the room. Setup on sideboard not complete. No outlet by the desk to plug in the lap top. Message light constantly going off on the phone with no messages. Card key would not work after 12 hours - always going back downstairs to get a new key. No in room coffee service and told couldn't due to fire safety which is a total fabrication! Staff appeared to really not care. One staff member appeared to have empathy but otherwise, they could've cared less. Then on top of it all, free Wi-Fi in common areas but in the room, it cost US$12.95 per day per computer!!!!! What a rip off at nearly $200/ night!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the cleanliness of our room.”
Reviews.Author: Fussy052
Reviews.Content: We had fully paid for 5 nights in the Venetian Resort-a luxury suite. When we arrived at the check-in counter at 6:00 p.m. we were told the rooms were full by 10:00 a.m. and there wasn't one for us. They did find a room for us in the Palazzo. It was a nice large room but the upholstery was very dirty, the marble was so stained that I didn't feel like putting anything on the vanity and there was gum or something in front of the washroom sink the whole time we were there (the maid kept covering it up with a bath mat). We didn't complain because it was a busy weekend in Vegas! The swimming pool was being renovated and closed.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Vegas yet!”
Reviews.Author: msklausler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip (together) in Vegas. We stayed at the Palazzo (Prestige) in a luxury suite on the 42nd floor. We didn't really need a concierge, but we are so glad we had one now! I chose the Palazzo because of the location and it looked like one of the nicest hotels on the strip. When we return, we will again have a suite - we loved the happy hour w/ free drinks, free breakfast, printer/fax/copier in our room, nice big soaking bathtub, the view was gorgeous, it was just an all-around great trip. We will definitely be back, and we will be staying at Palazzo! We also ate at the following: Dos Caminos restaurant (at Palazzo) - excellent food & good price Morels restaurant (Palazzo) - excellent for but pricey

Reviews.Title: “Always my favorite in all ways.”
Reviews.Author: TashaLin
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before (and other places in LV) - and again this is my overall favorite. Love staying on the Prestige level. Well worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Best room ever!”
Reviews.Author: ssgtotoole
Reviews.Content: My wife and were married in Vegas and we frequently visit and stay at a lot of properties including the Venetian, Bellagio, and other higher end hotels. Our room was by far the nicest we have experienced. I would say the rooms are over-the-top when it comes to amenities. The casino, shops, and restaurants were very clean and over-the-top. We didn't gamble there too much and actually paid $700 for your room for 3 nights, which is the first time we have paid for a room in years. This was a room worth paying for even if you can get comp rooms elsewhere. This property is a must if you are looking for a change when visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “As described, but stay away from I love burgers!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MMSATX
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and enjoyable, service was good, and rates were acceptable. We Ate at I love burgers in the shops and it was the worst dining experience we've ever had in Vegas. I ordered a beer, by the time it arrived to the table it was room temperature. The lime I requested never arrived. My husbands milkshake was half melted. Our fries were Luke warm. Good thing we didn't want shoe string ( or 3 other types of fries they were out of) fries on a Saturday at lunch! My husband ordered mustard and lettuce only, and got mayo, sauce and all the veggies. The meat used for the burgers was tasty, but not good enough to overcome all of the other negatives. Save your money and eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware: Not Really Suites”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: The vast majority of the accomodations are not suites; they are simply very large rooms. A suite would have walls between the sleeping area and the living area. Except for a few high end accomodations, the entire space is wide open. It is a very nice, large, well laid out space and I enjoyed it. But if you want/need a true suite, you'll need to go with the Sienna or Lago floor plans which, of course, cost over twice as much. You'd be better off just getting 2 connecting rooms. The property is also getting worn out, including my room. The furniture was chipped and scratched. The desk chair was the worst I've ever had in a hotel. The desk had a broken leg which had been jammed back on, resulting in a shaky accident waiting to happen. Other reviews have mentioned the lack of hot water in the shower. I found that if I let it run for 5 minutes, it would eventually warm up. I've never experienced a hotel where they don't have local hot water heaters, or a hot water looping system. Strange. Service was good. When I arrived for check-in, there was a long line and I thought Uh-oh, this is going to be bad. But they had an efficient queuing system with an employee managing it, and it went quickly. Check out was even faster. I had some problems with my first key, but the replacement one worked fine. Excellent fitness center. It was included with my group rate, but since it's part of the spa, I'm guessing most people would need to pay a fee. Internet access was very slow and dropped several times. It was also part of my group rate, but showed as $13 per day if unbundled. Of course, we had to walk through the casino to get to/from our meetings. I was pleasantly surprised that they ban smoking along the main walking routes. Unfortunately, many of the patrons were too rude to respect this. I was there on business with a group rate and didn't even see the bill. But looking at the public rates on-line, I would say this hotel is not a very good value compared to other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A double deck suite for the price of standard room!”
Reviews.Author: GVendryes
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Vegas. A short walking distance from the entrance to the main lifts, with short stay in the noisy casino area, is definitely a must, compared to others like Mandalay or Mirage. Rooms are all suites, and are huge. Having toilets separated from the bathroom is terrific - would still require more light though. Beds and linen are very comfortable, and the suite being equipped with 3 TV sets, you can follow news wherever you evolve while preparing yourself in the morning. And most of all, rooms are very quiet and communicating doors are amazingly soundproof. Also, the gym area shared with the Venetian is huge - don't end up in the first place when coming from the Palazzo, and do not hesitate to walk 5 more minutes in rainbow-colored hallways to find nice equipments, friendly staff offering you complimentary headset to plug in their high-tech video system. Good place to stay for an indoor and outdoor Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience! Upgrade to prestige WELL worth it!”
Reviews.Author: MamaBerube
Reviews.Content: Take the upgrade!! It is so worth it with all the extra's (breakfast, coffee/tea and snacks, ect) We had a great stay here, comfy beds, good local for us - we found the staff great - it was AWESOME!!

Reviews.Title: “Even my furniture has scars”
Reviews.Author: heart/e
Reviews.Content: I'm no gambler and lets just say Vegas ain't my scene. Regardless, a convention at the Sands Expo center brought me to town and since I was only around for one night thought I would make my life easy and stay at the Palazzo as its attached to the expo center. I showed up 4hrs early and was accommodated with an early check in on the spot by a friendly, efficient and helpful front desk. My room was very clean, comfortable and well designed. Unfortunately the majority of the furniture has been subject to a hard life. Virtually every cabinet had gouges or general bangs bumps and bruises. And the new carpet had a missing section which looked as though a portion unraveled and vanished after a loose thread got eaten by the vacuum. The desk draw didn't work, and an ornate dresser door hung ackwardly open refusing to close. A wall mirror had a cracked section repaired with glue. Whatever rough and tumble shenanigans are going on in Vegas, lets just say my rooms furniture had the scars to prove it. It made what would otherwise be an extravagant room feel tired and worn. So the question begs to be asked, did I have the one rotten apple? Perhaps a little more research on your part will help answer the question. I guess my feelings about Vegas are the same as my room. Trying to be classy but it just isn't. Regardless, a never ending source of new and remodeled rooms throughout the city makes me wonder if one could do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Casino for Players”
Reviews.Author: wendychen89
Reviews.Content: Venetian/Palazzo used to be my favorite casino/hotel in Vegas. I've been staying/playing here since Venetian first opened its door more than 10 years ago. They used to reward their players very generously. Starting this year, they have forgo all player's reward/offers, not only that, they are revoking people's confirmed comp'ed reservations 48 - 72 hours before their arrivals and asking them to pay for the room. This practice is both unethical and shameless. We as consumers need to stand up to scum business like this. DO NOT stay here. Take your hard earn money and stay and play at other casino who appreciate and value your as their clients.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - I'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: darrylcam
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas with my wife and two young girls, we booked into the .... hotel and were asked at check in if we wanted to upgrade for +- USD to a larger suite with extra ammenities. I took it up and we had a stunning room overlooking the strip, separate lunge, study desk, huge bathroom, and access to their VIP floor for free drinks and cocktails, etc.. Be prepared to walk quite far, as this hotel is huge. service is good, and really worth the price they charged. kids loved the Las Vegas vibe, we done the Heli trip to Grand Canyon, which was worth every cent. Go with Mavericks, it was really special. The Bellagio was our second choice, which is a little more in the centre of the strip, but if you dont mind the walking, this hotel is perfect. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Rags3377
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just wonderful. Rooms big and bathroom to die for. Paid extra for strip seeing room and well worth it. Restaurants great, but some pricey. Only one complaint, we had to wait 50 minutes for a valet to take our luggage down. Good thing we weren't going to the airport to catch a flight. Will be going back again this year.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: southernbelle19
Reviews.Content: I went here with 9 girls for a bachelorette party. It was March madness weekend so the entire hotel was booked. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms were really nice. However, the rooms were really really expensive. The restaurants were okay but they were so overpriced. I had expected Vegas to be expensive but I think everything at this hotel was more overpriced than the other hotels. And the hotel lobby and casino were freezing. I'm not sure who they think can deal with 50 degrees inside, but we basically had to wear winter clothes to enjoy ourselves in the casino. We actually ended up spending a decent amount of time at Caesars since the crowd was better and the atmosphere wasn't as stuffy. So, while this hotel is nice, I think its better just to drop by and see the atrium. I think with all the other options on the strip, we could have found a better/cheaper option.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel-lost my respect after double booking and double charged”
Reviews.Author: Swissfrank
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights over New Year as I had stayed 2 years before in Palazzo. Rooms still pretty decent but 2 things spoilt it for me. 1- The perfume(scent) is still overpowering and I am glad we didnt stay longer than 2 nights (stayed in Encore and Vdara after and were both much nicer). 2-Somehow Palazzo had 2 reservations instead of 1 and double charged me, then after cancelling the 2nd booking they still took deposit and have not received the money back yet (595 dollars).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fleur-di-lei
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and located in a great spot on the Strip. It's connected to the Venetian, so that also makes it easy to just walk over and stroll through Venice! The one issue with this hotel is that it is billed as an "all suite" hotel. We did have a large sitting area as well as a separate area for sleeping; however, there was no way to close off the two areas. Even just a heavy drapery to draw in between the sleeping and living areas would have been great. We had people coming/going/sleeping at various times of the day and night (hey... it's Vegas after all!), and there was no way to keep from disturbing those who were sleeping. Also, in typical Vegas fashion, no coffee pot in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AZRomandy
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel complex in Vegas, with plenty to do. Staff was very friendly and the hotel had plenty to offer, well you can’t really get bored in Vegas anyway.

Reviews.Title: “10 year wedding aniversary in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: blakester49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to do Vegas for our 10 year wedding anniversary. I’ve been to Vegas more than 15 times over the years but only 3 times since we married and had kids. Vegas and I have both changed a lot. There are quite a few unfinished (abandoned) buildings/projects on the strip. Big Blue is the scariest. Wow. The locals’ attitude has changed a bit. Tourists are not quite as expendable a quantity that they once were. Service attitudes in general seem a little better. The Palazzo is excellent overall. It is elegant, quiet, and the room rate we paid was reasonable. There was a long line at check in but they quickly opened more desks. I was sure we were looking at a 30+ minute check in but it ended being about 10 minutes. The room was very good but showing some wear. The mattress was excellent; the extra room space very nice, the view was good. The sofa sectional pieces were very worn looking but because of the delicate material choice they may have looked the same years ago. We did not feel comfortable sitting on it because it seemed like it needed something in between our skin and it. I imagined that an ultraviolet light would display considerable nastiness. Including a working fax printer was a very nice touch for printing out airline boarding passes. The WiFi worked OK (included in the rip off “required resort fee charge”). None of the other resort fee features were really available while we were there, so effectively we were charged $19@ day for WiFi. They don’t even deliver the “free” newspaper to your door for the fee; you have to go get it yourself. I advise Palazzo to include all required charges upfront in the nightly room fee. It avoids bad feelings. There are a lot of other vacation choices available… Our 42th floor room was very quiet. In contrast to previous Vegas trips we were not woken up by noisy people in the hallway. The bathroom was beautiful but dark. There were burnt out light bulbs and the room would still have been dark if all the bulbs were working. I like dark but not when trying to shave in front of a mirror. I liked the deep tub. The bathroom is huge by hotel standards. We ate at the Grand Lux the first morning and it was good standard buffet fare but way overpriced. We ate at the mall afterwards for breakfast. We did Dos Caminos at night and thought it was very good. We also ended up at First Food 2 nights. The fish tacos were excellent but tiny. The tap Beer was good there. We didn’t really enjoy the casino feeling there and spent most of our gambling time at other places. Its average and I can’t really explain the negative vibe. I didn’t lose any more than normal there… The fragrance that is added to the mall air is nasty. We passed through as quickly as possible. If you can get a good price Palazzo is well worth looking into. Despite my nit picking it offers unusually large rooms and some degree of elegance

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Travelin2Anywhere
Reviews.Content: Large suites with every amenity. Service was outstanding, the bed was extremely comfortable and they thought of all the little things that make a difference. Lighted makeup mirror, 3 TVs including in the bathroom, great working desk area, etc. Location on the strip is perfect. So many choices there for dining and the spa is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed for a 5 star Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jwh86
Reviews.Content: Arrived after booking direct to avoind getting messed around with 3rd parties. Our room we had already paid for was not available, we were told reservations wernt held despite us already having been charged. Offered us a lower quality room or we could upgrade for $75 to the room we had booked anyway. WTF? Instead they sent us to a room in the Venetian 15 Min walk next door. Got into out room, safe didnt work no hot water and TV didnt work. Bags took nearly an hour to arrive, after 25hours travelling from australia we felt like a shower and clean clothes. They fixed TV after 2 hours. Didnt fix safe, when i rang to complain they said i must have been doing something wrong, i dont think so i've use same safe 200 times plus and they are pretty basic, anyway he said nothing he could do and if we changed rooms the next day we might have more luck with the safe. Not to worry about the $10K cash we wanted to lock up with our passports and computers. They moved us to the room we should have been the following day which was a relief as it was a nice room, when i asked for a free breakfast for all the messing around he changed subjects. FInally got onto a manager who gave us some concession a meals voucher. Scott organised out new room keys and was great, giving us a great overview of hotel/casinos benefits. Gambled a bit but Grazie card we signed up for was not working so ended up going to casinos who looked after us. Nice place if you want a nice room and no service If you dont like being screwed around on vacation look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Too Much Scent”
Reviews.Author: RaineyRainey
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night ( a little expensive, but very nice ) stay at the Palazzo.Our room was as requested, a view of the strip, double beds, & very clean.Housekeeping was excellent,we recommend tipping! We had a delicious breakfast delivered to our room one morning as part of a pkg deal (there was a credit allowance in the pkg) but we noticed we were charged either for that or for a beverage on our next visa bill after we got home.We didn't fight it, probably should have but life got busy again.Walgreens at the front of the hotel is AWESOME..they have everything including reasonable souveniers. Lots of security at the hotel, including at the elevators so we felt very safe.We were treated extremely well by everyone, front desk included from check in to check out.The only complaint is there is a very strong perfume/powdery scent that is seemingly continuously pumped in to the lobby/casino floor area that I found very overwhelming.Enjoyed ourselves, we would go back to Vegas, we'd stay at a different hotel only because of the perfume scent though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but stay away from Burger Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: andypl99
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere (crowded but cool) and nice mall, nice casino. Just stay away from the Burger restaurant - be prepared to wait 30-45 minutes for your burger (as they kindly mentioned AFTER I had waited 30 minutes already). Really ? Burger came at 45 minute mark and was cold, fries clammy. What a waste. And also horrible attitude amongst servers. This place doesn't belong in a nice resort like the Palazzo. What was Sands management thinking ?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service and rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo in a view room December 26, 27 & 28, 2010. This was my first stay at this hotel. Don't let the title of my review fool you. I did like this hotel and I do recommend it. However, the rooms are showing their age. The Drawers of the beverage center could not be closed, Design material on the cabinet under the bedroom television was broken off and sort of hanging there.
