Outside area of wall mirror was broken a as if someone had thrown something against the wall and hit it, then the mirror itself was repaired, but not the border. I did not notice this but my brother who visited did. Coffee table was a bit battered. Lets face it, it's a popular hotel and three years old. These are fixes that come about with a renovation and that's one or two years away. So, the rooms could be better. For some reason, the circuit breaker for the desk are blew and maintenance had to come to flip the switch which is located in a secret panel and I'm not tell'in where it is. A nice plus is the fact that they have a printer in the room so you can print you boarding pass and otherwise do work in your room. I liked this feature a lot. The view I had was just terrific and I was able to watch the pirate show had just come back from a break. Loved the fireworks. Good security with a guard that asked to see everyone's card key all the time, not just in the evening. Check-in was great with a really nice front desk staffer who really seemed to care. But the woman who was working the bell desk on the 28th at 9:10 AM really needs to learn some manners. Very offensive. Wrote about the issue in the exit survey and was told that a refund of laundry costs would be coming my way. That they would care enough to do this won me over and I'm staying there again April 1 and 2. I'm hoping it was an anomaly. Except for that one incident, I had a great time at this hotel and casino. Even won a few bucks! I truly enjoyed myself at the Palazzo and hope you do too.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: snubill
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! My husband and I originally booked our stay at the Venetian but we upgraded to a strip view at he Palazzo. The Palazzo's rooms are pretty much the same style as the rooms in the Venetian but they are a little bigger with a more modern flair. Note - The Palazzo and Venetian have the largest rooms on the strip. The Palazzo is only 3 years old so it still has that new feel. Loved it, loved it, loved it! Our room was on the 44th floor (out of 50 floors) and the view was great. The room was spotless and the bed was heavenly. I hate that we didn't get a chance to enjoy the room more because we were busy checking out the city. There was so much to do at the hotel itself that we really didn't have to go outside to explore. Room service was wonderful. The food was great. We ate breakfast each morning at the Grand Luxe Cafe (awesome food). Ate there for lunch a couple of times as well. We were never disappointed. The people at the concierge desk were so helpful. We received maps and advice about shows, restaurants, transportation etc. They saved us a lot of time and money. I really appreciate that. All in all, I loved this hotel. Take your pick, the Palazzo and the Venetian are truly 5 star hotels that would exceed your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Sunken living room,electronic window shades,security at the elevators”
Reviews.Author: shop4u18
Reviews.Content: The PALAZZO offers elegance, security and beautifully appointed rooms. We took advantage of the self parking. Easy to navigate the parking garage maze...The garage is well lit . There are large signs guiding guest to the elevators and escalators. The check in procedure was efficient, friendly and quick! The entrance to the elevator banks was guarded by a security guard.ID/and room cards were randomly checked. The room was old world elegant with many modern twists! Upon entry, to the left are double doors leading into the marble appointed full suite bath. the room had a vanity table, bench, and mirrors. Sconces on the wall could be dimmed to bring a 'mood' to the square two person tub, A large glass shower, fully decked in marble was along side the tub. The room featured double sinks, encased in marble and trimmed in dark woods.The toilet room was wall papered, and had a wall phone .The bath accessories included the 'usual' with the addition of a sewing kit! The carpeted bedroom had a king bed, side tables, sconces, flat screen TV, and bar. the bed was 'yummy comfy'!...(100% cotton sheets and pillow cases)...and YES I CHECKED >>NO BED BUGS!...The mattress and box spring were encased in protective coverings... Just two steps down from the bedroom lead to the sunken living room.The living room furniture included a round table and 4 chairs, a full 'business center' desk, fax machine,phone, computer outlets,'L' shape sofa, club chairs and glass top square coffee table. The windows were covered in sheers, with an over layer of room darkening curtains...all electronically controlled. We walked around the property, which includes the sister hotel, the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo has gone down hill!!! Stayed Dec 31 2010- Jan 3 2011”
Reviews.Author: limo4fun
Reviews.Content: I would first like to say I have stayed at the Palazzo at least 4 times prior to this stay and the Venetian maybe 5 times. All of the stays prior to this one I was amazed and treated with the upmost respect, as well as the guest that traveled with me. For the stay as listed above I stayed in Suite 12-839, another guest of mine and his wife stayed in connecting Suite 12-837, and I had another guest that stayed on the Prestige floor. Upon arrival to our Suite 12-839 the makeup mirror was broken, T.V. changer was broken, and the remote control curtains were broken as well. For my guest 12-837 makeup mirrors broke, dirty glasses in the room. My guest made the call to get the items fixed in which makeup mirror and glasses were fixed and replaced. Our room 12-839 nothing was fixed. Yes I know it was New Years Eve when we checked in but it seemed that Palazzo was understaffed for what is one of the biggest days in Las Vegas. My guest called room service and could get no one to answer. Finally he resorted to calling the front desk to speak with a manger. All we wanted at this point was grapefruit juice, which was not available in the gift shop. The manager attempted to call room service on a manager’s line and he stated he could not get thru, nor was grapefruit juice ever brought to our rooms. Lunch at the Grand Lux Café on the Palazzo side on 12/31/10 started off well I had a group of 9, as far as taking our order, after that it went downhill. Refills on drinks 20 minutes; our server we are still looking for her. Once it came time for the check which I picked up for 6 of the guest, we waited at least 30 minutes maybe 45 once the waitress knew we wanted our check. I spoke with the manager about this issue, who stated its New Years Eve, and clearly didn’t care. Dinner at Dos Caminos on 01/02/11 I took 10 people to dine, our waiter from the start acted as if he were on his own time and was not enthusiastic about waiting on us. We started off by ordering 2 double orders of Guacamole, followed up by 10 adult beverages. Once placing our order for dinner I ask for a round of shots for everyone, while in mid-sentence the waiter just up and walked away. Once dinner arrived it was less than desirable. All 10 guests were ready to depart and ask for the check. At this point I am embarrassed that I have had my guest dine here because of the service and the food. To get our check took easily 40 minutes. My guests were ready to get up and walk out, in which they didn’t because they are business people. Once again the manager never comes over to ask how our meal was or anything. So I go and find him lollygagging around in the bar area. I advised him of our terrible service, and the time we have been waiting for the check. He acted as if he were going to go see what the issue is and return. The manager never returned I am embarrassed once again. As it looks to me there is a reoccurring theme that no one cares about customer service at the Palazzo anymore. I also must have misinterpreted the Grazie Club points system. New Years Eve $157 for lunch at Grand Lux $1202.00 for dinner at Carnevino which was amazing $4000 table at TAO for Kim Kardashian party which was amazing as well. But don’t understand how that doesn’t apply towards your Grazie points on New Year’s Eve, but does any other night. 01/01/11 In Suite dinning $70 the lady that delivered the food was rude and slammed the door on the way out because she didn’t get a extra tip. ATTITUDE is why. Sushi Samba $726 amazing I stopped by to talk to a casino host on 1/2/11 because we were checking out early the next morning to see if I would have any comps. I was unsure at this point. She didn’t even check she said to return the next morning. When I did return I was told no one was there to help me so they would have to call the Venetian. The lady on the phone laughed at me and said nowhere close. That’s fine but no need to laugh, and then she wanted me to give the ladies name that told me to come back so she could write her up. The saga continues bad customer service, and attitudes, embarrassed In ending any manager that I spoke with at restaurant didn’t seem to care or follow up so it is clear that the customer is never right at the Palazzo. As far as the pit boss I am at a loss for words on him. Overall the ATTITUDE of the staff I encountered as well as my guest was poor. Clearly understaffed, on New Year’s Eve. Every time we left the hotel we used an Executive Limo because my guests were afraid the ATTITUDE of the limo driver would follow the same path.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service & Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Smasher1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and its fair to say that it has gone rapidly downhill. After a long drive from San Diego, I was given little or no help from the valet staff to help in returning a hire car to the Avis desk. Signs giving directions to the desk were poor and I was threatened with security if i did not move my rental vehicle. I was looking to hand the vehicle back correctly and as soon as I challenged them back, they done the usual and all walked away! Following that, I joined my wife at check in to be told that we had been moved to the Venetian hotel (only a 10 / 15mins case drag away) as they were overbooked, great! Again when they made me feel that I was complaining, they asked if I wanted to raise a grievance with the manager and when I said yes, they went out the back and all of a sudden a room was made available. It was clear that they were trying their luck with people that were checking in and offering an upgrade (not wanted) as they had a conference in town! As far as service goes this was the worst I have in a 2 week trip in California and I will never stay at this hotel again. So many options in Vegas I would look to book Wynn or Encore next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: CatK2000
Reviews.Content: Very large rooms & bathrooms - great for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freddy2300
Reviews.Content: After staying at many other LV properties in previous visits (Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Paris, Bellagio, MIrage), my recent stay a the Palazzo was outstanding. Large, beautiful room, 43rd floor facing south, amazing view. Prompt housekeeping and room service, with pleasant personnel. Nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “True disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rosweet
Reviews.Content: I booked Palazzo because it’s the newer hotel comparing to Venetian, and it also has all suite rooms. However, after paying 3 people price for 3 nights (they charge $30 extra for third person per night), I found the hotel is a major disappointment. First of all, the room is quite a run-down, light didn’t work in the bathroom and sofa bed is quite uncomfortable. Worse thing is, there was no extra blanket or pillow for the third person after paying the price for it. I had to call the house keeping, and it took them almost half hour to deliver the extra blanket and sheets. As other people commented earlier, I had never received the daily newspaper either, even though it was included in resort fee I was paying. I have stayed at Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn, Encore, and other five star hotels, and this one is at the bottom of my list. If you don’t need a suite, go with other options.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sheba611
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my first stay at the Palazzo. Valet and bellman were courteous. Check-in was a breeze. The room (luxury view room on 19th floor) was nice and roomy with loads of amenities: 2 large screen flat screen TV's in living room and bedroom; small TV in bathroom; remote control for blinds and drapes; separate tub and shower in bathroom; vanity table with lighted makeup mirror; comfy bed; thermostat control for heat/ac. All the restaurants are expensive but there is a food court in the Venetian with lower price food options. My only disappointment was room service. I tried to order breakfast one morning and could not get a person to take the order and I was online for 11 minutes. Considering what they charge for room service (18% gratuity and $4 service charge on top of the high food prices) you would think they could afford to hire more people to answer the phones.

Reviews.Title: “5 star pretender”
Reviews.Author: MichelinFoodie
Reviews.Content: One of the places that claims to be 5 star but is far from it. First the positives, location is great, rooms are very large for being right on the Strip, rates are very cheap. But they sure don't pay attention to the details that define a true 5 star. No newspaper delivery during my 3 days, phone next to bedside didn't work, one of the dresser drawers was broken and just left there. No remote for the DVD player. They don't change sheets unless you remember to grab the card sitting on the bathroom counter and place it on the bed before you leave the room. One night I ordered room service and felt like I had to apologize to the person on the phone because they sounded so unhappy. And to top it all off the valet damaged my car, I didn't notice it until after I had left the hotel...I pointed it out when I returned back to valet. they filed a claim. They denied it since I didn't notice it right away when I picked up the vehicle. Stayed here only because of the cheap rates, I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is much worse than before”
Reviews.Author: wolfie73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Venetian and Palazzo in the past but this stay we noticed a huge change in the hotel and not for the better. No more freebies or discounts for the Grazie members, they downgraded the toiletries, they are rationing soaps and shampoos, never enough towels etc. The shower in the bathroom had a bunch of someone elses hair in it and glasses were dirty as well. We had to call for extra towels twice. Robes were not provided. We left cleaning staff 10dollars a day hoping that they would give us extra towels or an extra shampoo but nothing. Internet is included but due to CES conference, it was not working well at all. They did give us a refund for those because it was just not working. Restaurant Morels was good but one of hate waiters was just not happy to be there. It was not our fault the restaurant was half empty. Next time we a staying somewhere else like the Wynn. At this time Palazzo is going downhill and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: milspo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo two nights. The room was very comfortable. It featured a sectional couch, three tvs (one even in the bathroom) a large tub, vanity, large shower and a great view from the 37th floor overlooking Treasure Island. The only issue we had was a housekeeping issue with the bathtub. It took someone 5 hours to come up and clean it for us. I found it very annoying but overall the hotel is nice and the rooms are plush. Great location on the strip, superb food and good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay even after many issues”
Reviews.Author: 5startraveler
Reviews.Content: NYE in Vegas is very difficult if you are not a "VIP" aka someone who loses a lot of money at the Casino. We are not VIP's and had some issues with our very expensive confirmed multiple Suite reservations being downgraded by management to accommodate the overflow of VIP's during our stay. (4 people - 1 bed). Long check in lines, A few a/c issues and some towel rations. The business center internet will cost $$$/min +++ but, everything else was pretty satisfactory. The limo's and taxi's were always readily available and the location was great for us. If you want to be a "VIP" at Vegas hotels... The Casino is the cash cow... not the $10k dropped on rooms or the $5k in meals/shows/entertainment or $20k jewelry, etc... As a matter of fact, they wouldn't even know if you were a "VIP" if you don't use your Grazie card or room key to charge. So, we were often treated as a "nobody," but I would still give the hotel pretty good ratings overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, large, and very plush rooms.”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaGoSooners
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a very high end hotel at a good price. Very large, nice bathroom with tv, separate vanity, nice tub and separate shower. Large sitting area that can accommodate a small group. We had friends over for cocktails at 6 pm and a staff member came to the door to tell us to quieten down. In Vegas at 6pm! One of the people attending was 82! We got a kick out of that, especially since someone was having a very noisy party at 3 am across the hall. We didn't complain because that is why people go to Vegas, to have fun. The casino is also very upscale. Wider aisles, less garish decor. The Lagasse Stadium sports book/bar is a great place to watch your favorite game. (Make reservations in advance.) Easy walk to Fashion Show Mall. (It's across the street.) Pool area was fun and well arranged. Our only complaint was the temperature in our room. It was a little too warm for us. Maintenance came and worked on it, but I think it may have been because it was unseasonably warm and the system had not caught up with cooling the building. One would think Vegas hotels would have adequate air conditioning. Overall, it is a great hotel and I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Vegas Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: TXRedhead86
Reviews.Content: Spent a full week in this "all suite" hotel. Extremely beautiful and the suite was great. Staff was pleasant and friendly. We had a view overlooking the strip. Loved the oversized bath. They do go a bit overboard on the lobby air freshener, can be a little too "perfumey" until you get used to it after a few minutes. Casino and hotel were kept clean. Nice mall attaches the Pallazzo to the Venetian and it's a good central location. Lots of places to grab a bite and spend money! Not as over-the-top as you could expect in some of the newer, more expensive hotels, but really very nice. Would stay there again - no regrets. BTW: Be sure to eat at Joel Robuchon's while you're in Vegas. Food is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “It's good, but it's Vegas - it should be sensational!”
Reviews.Author: HappiestTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo doesn't really do anything wrong (other than some bad service by some staff) but it also is just a hotel. Don't get me wrong, the rooms are large, the beds are comfy and the place is opulent...... but it is Las Vegas. I was kind of expecting to be absolutely blown away and it falls a bit short. I was there for a conference which is probably why my room views were pretty average (overlooking a car park) and for conference facilities it is perfectly adequate. The overall feel just never passes from average to fatastic though.

Reviews.Title: “Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: LVETOTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: This used to be a great hotel, now it's average. The sheets felt like sandpaper as did the towels in the bathroom. While they offer a very good size room compared to most hotels on the Strip, the rooms are getting dated and need attention to detail. Even the remotes didn't work and one had the back of it completely missing so when using it you had to hold the batteries in. Time to check out The Aria....

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Partymonster99
Reviews.Content: I stay at plenty resorts and this resort is beautiful. I the rooms are spacious and clean and the decor is elegant yet modern. The service at check in is better than I've received at other resorts. I did have an issue with my room and was locked out at 3am. There was a problem with the key reader on the door and security and maintenance were trying to get us in for nearly half an hour. They seemed to laugh at the situation rather than apologetic that I had been waiting 30 outside for them to address the situation and another 30-40 minutes to get in the room when I had to check out in less than 5 hours. They weren't very apologetic or seemed to care I was standing out in the hall for over an hour to get in my room. Other than the service that evening, I do like the resort and may like to give them a 2nd chance.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: NyC_Ak
Reviews.Content: I am currently in my suite as i write this review. I have had problems with my room key for the past 3 nights. My key works off and on. I just had my lock battery replace my some hotel technician, now i have to walk again all the way back to the hotel lobby. This is the 3rd time i have had to go back down to the lobby for some key related issue. Me and my fiance wish there was some better service with this, ie. "someone to save me the trouble of having to get my key." Also I came back to my room to find that the soap had not been replaced. I am trying to some with a smidge of soap bar that I had left. This is just terrible. I paid a premium for a room on New Years Eve, to have these problems right now is very disappointing. If you are looking for good service/ customer service don't come here. I feel like a fish in a very big sea.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts.”
Reviews.Author: LondonSolo_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo during December when Las Vegas is traditionally quite quiet. I chose the hotel as I received a good offer via email from them. Checking in took 5 minutes with no queue, and the very pleasant and helpful receptionist gave me a room on the 37th Floor which he said was an upgrade as there was a view of the strip. He waived the resort fee as my offer email had not mentioned it, but I still had free wifi during my stay. He also said the room would be quiet as it was away from the lifts. Because of the angle of the room I could pretty much only see the Fashion Show Mall and Treasure Island Hotel but that was fine. However it was far from quiet - for the first three nights the room next to me was occupied by what sounded like a party of about 8 people who all returned to the room each night at about 3 a.m. to continue their partying. I finally called security who did deal with it fairly promptly. But why does the hotel allow 8 people to check into the same room? Apart from a dozy security guard who did not seem to check key cards, there did not appear to be much security, no visible cameras in the corridors or patrols. The 6th night I was there a man tried to get into my room at about 4 a.m., when I told him quite clearly he had got the wrong room he tried to kick the door down. I called security who then let him wander off to somewhere else in the hotel rather than escorting him away. Frankly I was very scared he would return and at no stage did anyone from the hotel apologise or contact me, or offer any kind of recompense for the 4 dreadful nights sleep I had had. Twice my room was not serviced at all during the day until I returned at about 5 and complained. It then took 90 minutes before someone appeared to do the room, giving the excuse of shift changes. The room was quite clean when I checked in however they were slow to refresh the bathroom amenities. The room itself was lovely and looked exactly like the website, however there were several light bulbs that needed to be replaced or the lights were simply not working when I arrived, and it took time to get it sorted. Also there was only one remote for the 3 televisions which did not work in the bathroom TV. Other than that I was very happy with the size and layout of the room. The smell of smoke in the Casino was not as obtrusive as at the Bellagio where I stayed last year. There are a great choice of shows, shops and restaurants in the Palazzo / Venetian complex including a Walgreens where you can buy bottled water and snacks at a 10th of the price charged for mini bar water. Restaurants I would recommend include the Grand Luxe which I think is open all night, Table 10 and Carne Vino. Stay away from Postrio in the Ventian which claims to be a gourmet restaurant but where my beef ravioli arrived at the table within three minutes of ordering. And the Canyon Ranch Spa is pretty special and worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: Bfulk
Reviews.Content: A friend and I flew down for a 3 day weekend Dec.3rd. We arrived at the Palazzo around 11pm. There was about a 30 min. wait in line to check-in. (typical) The rooms were nice enough for a weekend. We just flew in to see some shows so it was sufficient. The beds weren't as comfortable as one might think fo the price of the room. But, again....it was okay for a few days. The Lavo restaurant has delicious Italian food. Although, the extremely loud music and the waiter who was trying to turn the table as fast as he could was a drawback. For a few hundred dollar meal for two, I do not expect to be rushed. We received our bread, appetizers and salads all at the same time. And when we requested that he hold off on the entrees for a while, he replied they had already "fired them". At that point, we told him not to bring them until we asked for them. (we had a lot to eat already) The Grand Luxe restaurant was of good quality for breakfast on the morning that we left. I also want to add that the room service food was good, but an hour wait each time. Big hotel.....it was to be expected. Another problem area that I see for the Palazzo is the "Taxi" line area. The taxi line is downstairs, underground. This is the only place you can get a taxi. Although, taxi's are dropping people off at the front entrance and leaving empty. 2 hours before one of our shows, we waited in the taxi line for 20 min. seeing only 1 taxi arrive, and take no one from the taxi line, but instead taking people with luggage (we assume to the airport) The line was long and not moved in line for 20 min. we decided it would be quicker to walk across to street to the Mirage, get in their taxi line which moves very fast mind you (dropping off and picking up at the same time.....makes sense) we waited approx: 10 min. hopped in taxi and made it to our show at the Rio with an hour to spare. I would probably not stay here again, as they are many other nice hotels in Vegas. (with more comfortable beds)(normally, I stay at the MGM Signature Towers) But, I would recommend it to anyone for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jal4950
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our stay in Las Vegas, December 21-23. Stayed at the Bellagio, Las Vegas last year with our family and loved it. Thought we would stay at the Venetian this year as this also a 5 start hotel. There were no rooms available upon our early (11 AM) arrival at the Venetian, so we were offered two identical "Venetian type rooms" in the Palazzo Hotel, which is part of the Venetian. The rooms were big and spacious. We found them very comfortable. Great view of the mountains, lots of room for 4 adults (we occupied 2 rooms with 4 occupants in each room), and we were given rooms on the same floor to make things more convenient for all of us. The view from the 39th floor was beautiful and the rooms were very quiet. If there were people in the rooms adjacent to us, we didn't know it. We received complimentary continental breakfast tickets at the Grand Lux Cafe. You could upgrade to their Breakfast Buffet for an additional $8.50 per person, which we did. It was well worth it as our family loved the breakfast buffet. They had a great variety of food and it was all very tasty! We paid a resort fee of $17 plus tax per room per night ($19.04); not quite sure what the fee covered, but it included internet and printer usage. I had no problem with the fee as I was informed of it "up front" when we made our reservations. What ensued caused me to give their service a rating of 2. The printer in my room was out of ink and had no USB plug to connect to my laptop for printing. I was told they would replace the ink cartridge in my room but I would have to pay $10 for the USB plug if I wanted to print anything. I informed them that there was no USB plug when I entered the room, so why was I required to pay for something that should have been attached to the printer upon my arrival? They informed me they were sorry, but Palazzo occupants had been taking their USB plugs and they would have to charge the next occupant for it if they wanted to use the printer. It would cost me $10 and I could keep the USB plug when I left. I found it incredulous that they would make me pay for something that they should be providing as a service that I already paid for. I did not buy their USB cable. Instead, I went to our son's room, where they had a USB cable connected to their printer, and printed our boarding tickets for our flight back home from their room. Other than the incident with the USB cable, we had a great time at the Palazzo. Their shops were great, the canal was beautiful, the staff was very polite and helpful, and the location of the hotel enabled us to leave our rented van in the garage so we could walk to most of our destinations on the strip. We would stay there again. However, next time, I will bring a USB cable with me to connect to the printer in my room in the event the same thing happens again. One other note: There is a 24 hour Walgreen's located right at the corner of the Palazzo. People packed the place buying drinks, snacks, and other "essentials" that would have cost many times that if you purchased it at the Palazzo. For instance, a package of 'M&M' candy at the Palazzo would cost $9; it would cost you $6 for a small bottle of Fuji water from your room. You could buy those items for many times less than that at Walgreens.

Reviews.Title: “Bid Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: kukubla
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. First time we were there for the great opening and were very impressed. Well 3 years later it's a big disaster. Usually people complain about the service, well, the service is fine - not the best, but OK, but the rooms... It seems that no one really cares how clean the rooms are. The light switches were disgustingly dirty. Layer of dust everywhere. The clock was broken, the marble in the room and in the bathroom looked like there was some kind of an acid party held on it. the toilet bowl was swinging. With the price being one of the highest on the strip it is a very big disappointment.Room 32711.

Reviews.Title: “How Vegas is soposed to be done!”
Reviews.Author: mypdx
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times, stayed in almost every top hotel. This last trip we again stayed at the Palazzo, our third time. I love everything about this hotel. The rooms are perfect we stay in the King sized suite with sunkin living room. They are large with plenty of seating, room for guests to stop by for a drink before a show. One of the best parts about this hotel is it's location, it's close to everything. Some hotels are crazy busy with traffic passing through from one hotel to another, Palazzo is at the end so you don't get all the crazy crouds. The club right in the hotel is great, spend the money for VIP service it's worth every penny. Our VIP host was amazing and security was fantastic. I'm very picky when it comes to service and when you pay for a table you get, a waitress that won't let you lift a finger also you get fantastic security and to pick where you would like to sit. Dance floor or more private. Call ahead for a VIP experience, our guy called us to let us know our table was ready. You've got to treat your friends once in a while so splurge a little, your in vegas and we don't do much gambling. Service, shopping, and fantastic food is what we really go for. Shopping is also right there just a short walk, don't buy too many clothes before you go, you will want something new. The pool is also fun with the sun in the right spot, plenty of room for everyone in the main pools. The Kardashians there one day. They have fantastic DJ on saturday at the club pool. This hotel makes you feel like a rockstar and you deserve to feel like one once in a while. I've found with vegas it's best to have a blast pay a little more and you will have the time of your life. Getting ready to plan another trip, just love the Palazzo;)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndyGirl23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo in October for a convention...for hoteliers. So, yes we are picky and we know what to look for. I had no complaints about the Palazzo. All of the staff that I encountered was fabulous. The suites were fantastic. Flat screen in the bathroom, bedroom and sitting area. A personal business center in your room. Very comfortable beds and enough elevators that you weren't waiting forever even in the mornings. I will definitely be back for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & space with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: tallsamoan
Reviews.Content: Luxury has its prize and The Palazzo/ Venetian complex is certainly not cheap, but worth it. Great shopping, great restaurants on all price levels, good bars and a surprisingly not-so-tacky decor. The casino(s) are obviously in your face but spacious enough to avoid bumping into the gambling crowd.. The room/ suite was fantastic, nicely appointed and spacious. It was a long-weekend, so it did not come cheap ($200 a night), although I still consider it to be worth it. The location of the Palazzo/ Venetian complex is spot on, dead smack center strip with the Wynn on one side, the Mirage and TI across the street and the Wynn's golf course behind. If you come to Vegas to party and only need a place to sleep, I would not recommend the Palazzo, there are many, much cheaper options. If you bring your loved-one for a great time, want to be pampered and live in luxury, then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room”
Reviews.Author: SDPocketAces
Reviews.Content: If you book early and pay under $200 you can't beat this place. Awesome huge room with everything. I can't think of anything I would change.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to customer service!?”
Reviews.Author: MLuvsM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Palazzo and Venetian previously. The rooms are nice and spacious. However, there is a resort fee that you are not told about until you check out. It's about $20/day. Also, we wanted to get a later check out on Sunday and were unable. The front desk said that the hotel was booked. However, if we wanted to check out later we could pay for another night! Does that make sense? If the hotel is booked then how can we pay for another night. It seemed that they were unable to accomodate us. It gets a bit frustrating when you spend good money on a hotel and can't get some flexibility or good service. Too bad. I'll stay at the Bellagio or Wynn next time! :)

Reviews.Title: “Oozing Luxury - Incredible Rooms - Casino Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Ant_and_Kresta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pallazo for 5 days in April. Firstly, it had the finest room I have ever stayed in. A loung room and bedroom in one, with three TV's and a full size bath. My other half loved having a bubble bath whilst watching the American tv. Every room at the Palazzo is a suite, and finished to the highest of standards. You could spend a week just relaxing, watching TV and ordering room service. But that is not what you do in Vegas! The only drawbacks we found, where that everything is a LONG walk away, even just to get food or a drink, and also the perfume smell that they pump around the casino really gets into your nose after a while and gets rather unpleasant. In terms of location, not smack bang centre strip, but good enough, there is also a nice big shopping mall just over the road For the price though, it was incredible, we paid the equivalent of $100 aussie per night, and could not beleive the level of luxury. Definitely reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: CaneIntp
Reviews.Content: May be we got lucky getting amazing deal and services at the Palazzo. We bid the hotl through Priceline and got a really good deal for the "standard" room. At the check-in, my mom (in wheelchair) and I were greeted very nicely by the representative. We waited less than a minute in line. The representative asked all the right questions to accommodate my mom's need for accessibility! We eventually were offered "up graded" room without any request. I have to say that was such an amazing check in experience. And this is through extremely deal on priceline. In the past I feel like priceline deal gets us less desirable room, but this is not the case at all. The room is AMAZING! It's very large and nicely appointed. It's not tacky or theme decoration. 3 tv! The one is bathroom is in odd location though. The hotel overall is great. There are good shops, especially Barney's! There are so many restaurant options including the adjacent Venetian's. We tried Table 10. It's ok not out of this world great. But again, the service there was great which made a huge different. After staying at a few hotels in LV in the past few years (Aria, Bellagio,...) this, to us, was the most comfortable experience. We will definitely consider coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: golf4fun69
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo for a food show and the room that we had was incredible. They upgraded up into a suite with a fitness room, large bathroom, and a living room. The view was great. The service was good, but that is the thing about Vegas, you really do not spend anytime in your room. Once again I lost money.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple stays at Vegas hotels and Palazzo is by far one of the very best”
Reviews.Author: motmemo
Reviews.Content: Just finished an extended vacation in Las Vegas having stayed at Casesar's Palace, Aria, Mirage and the Palazzo. Had no issues with any of them but the Palazzo is my favorite. During the stay a family member had a medical emergency and ended up staying at an area hospital for several days. Everyone I encountered who were aware of this asked how that person was doing. I love the casino as it is very open and has a high ceiling, so that the ventilation is superior to every casino I have been in. It can be very busy here but not crazy nuts like some of the other casinos. The rooms were always kept clean and well stocked. Requests for extra items were met promptly-like the need for a refrigerator for medications. I have to say we ate at Morel's French Steakhouse and were a little disappointed. Nothing was bad, just ordinary at a very expensive price. The only thing I would change is to bring the beds from Aria over-they are to die for. Not that the Palazzo's are bad but the Aria's are wonderful. Grand Lux has a large selections of items and the portions are huge,easy to split and still be filled. I know I would be upset if I had paid for a specific type of room and it wasn't available upon check in, I'm not sure what business practice this is suppose to model after but it can only make guests upset. And I know that waiting in line to check in can be an absolute bummer but keep in mind that most hotels in Vegas have this problem. Maybe management needs to develop more "flex" employees who can help out in several different capacities. Remember you are here to have fun so relax unwind and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Why no get a suite for the price of a room!”
Reviews.Author: nevets_83
Reviews.Content: Won the hotel through a bid on Priceline for an excellent rate for three nights. Getting to the hotel from the airport cost $27 and was uneventful. When we first arrived late in the evening we were able to walk right up to check-in. Check-in was extremely friendly, no Priceline stigma, and we were able to have our requests granted. We received coupons that we used, which basically made one night free from the savings of these coupons. The hotels public areas are beautiful and not overdone, overall a really nice classy looking hotel. The rooms were really roomy, large bathroom with great amenities, and a large separate living area. We had a view of the strip which was nice midway up the hotel. Overall, the accommodations were an excellent value! We rented a car from Avis which was on-site in the hotel, this was very convenient. The location of the hotel is further north on the strip, however still within walking distance to the more densly action packed mid area of the strip. The pool was great and guests are able to use most of the Venetians amenities. We went to Tao which was really good, as guest of the hotel you could use the guest list line, we got in for free with the coupons I previously mentioned. Overall, we had a great stay and would stay at the Palazzo again, even if we did not get it through Priceline. Side note: $19 resort fee

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable stay. Disappointed with rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: Was here for a business event. Booked room 2 months in advance, requested non-smoking. When I got to the checkin desk, the line was about 45 minutes long to check in. Guess what, got to my room, was smoke covered, and caused me to have watery eyes, and hard to breathe. Requested new room at front desk, and they could not provide it, because they were in a sold out situation. To me there is no excuse for this, they put an ionizer in the room for 2 hours, which was supposed to help. NOT. Nonetheless, I could not sleep the whole night. Was on the pool side floor, and had a room that opened up to the pool area (which I was told is a premium room). All it was, is a room that had a balcony on the same floor of the pool, and tucked into a corner where you could not see the pool. It was also very loud at night, so I was kept awake. BTW, smoking rooms are disgusting, they have a film of brown stuff everywhere, and if anyone tries to tell me that I am imagining it, just try to run a white cloth over the walls, you will see what I mean. You may ask, why didnt I go to another hotel? My company was providing the room, and would not be reimbursed for a different location...so I had to live with it. Yea, I suppose I could have made a big deal out of it, but that may be a career limiting move. So left it as is. Anyhow, the next day I got a new room on the 21st floor, which was a non-smoking room, it was cleaner, because of the lack of brown film. When I walked into the room, it smelled great! Like a steak cooking on a grill. This was nice for about 30 minutes, but the smell got to the point of excessive after a while, and would not go away. Almost like the vent to a grill was right outside of my window. WOW, this was awful, and of course, I could not get a new room. :( Anyhow, I lived with it, by forcing the fan on all the time (BTW, the cooling and heating will not work when you have the fan on all the time)...so I had to change the mode on the thermostat all the time to keep the room comfortable. This room was actually very nice, from a clean perspective, and "look", if you like the grandma style decor. It reminds me of when I was a little boy, and stayed at Grandma's house. The wall paper was similar to her home. The bathroom is very nice, clean, etc. The internet was awful! Very very slow, uselss as a matter of fact. The printer in the room did not work. I installed the drivers, the print job was sent to the printer, but nothing printed. Had to use the Kiosk downstairs to print out plane ticket when departing, cost 5.00 just to startup the session, then the keyboard did not work, so had to use another kiosk, which was another 5.00. What a rip! Room service is incredibly expensive. 1/2 pot of coffee 16.00 with delivery charge. Which will take at least 40 minutes to get. As a matter of fact, whenever I called for service of anykind, I would be put on hold for at least 5 minutes each time! Something that really frustrated me, was I had to walk through the casino everytime I went to a meeting, which has people smoking in it. I understand they need to entice everyone to gamble, but please dont make me have to walk through that smoke filled room to get to my meetings. Everytime I tried to find another route, I would get lost. Oh, and dont ask anyone how to get somewhere. I swear they are told to mis direct you so you end up walking aimlessly forever. Which forces you to wander by shops, and casinos. So, use a map! Anyhow, this was a very disappointing hotel, from smell, smoke, to service. I would NOT stay here again, unless my company mandated it.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest standard rooms on the strip”
Reviews.Author: cdinlondon
Reviews.Content: As I read some of the reviews prior to arriving much of my excitement was a little tempered. However as soon as we walked into the lobby of this magnificient property everything was laid to rest. This is a stunning property, every detail of it is fantastic, over the top and sure to please. Check in was smooth and quick, I tried the $20 trick at check in, and the girl tried very hard, but given it was a sold out weekend nothing was really available at the Palazzo (she did offer an upgrade at the Venetian but since we were travelling with friends we declined) She gave us as requested a high floor room, on the 44th floor. Most people wouldnt have loved this view as it was away from the strip, but it looked right on the Wynn golf course and so I personally enjoyed having a nice peak at that gem of a course. The rooms are simply wonderful, over 700 square feet of opulence. 3 flat screen TVs, ultra comfy bed, big sectional couch, and a wonderful bathroom with seperate tub and shower. My friend lives in a $3500 a month apartment in NYC and this room blows it away. The staff I encountered were all wonderful, and the restaurants we ate at Lavo, and Grand Lux Cafe were both very good with terrific service. Overall I would stay here again in a heartbeat, especially at the rate I got it at. Thank you to everyone at Palazoo for making our trip a resounding success.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shannon1000
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo for 4 nights. It was not the 5 star hotel we had expected. The hotel seemed to be understaffed. Every time we telephoned for room service, the concierge or the front desk, we were put on hold, sometimes for up to 15 minutes. The same response was always given - "we are experiencing a high call volume". The air conditioning was completely inadequate. On our second night a sewerage smell wafted through at 1am in the morning. I called the front desk to let them know and I was put on hold!! There was absolutely no point complaining as nothing was done about it anyway and we had to put up with it. On the positive side the rooms are beautifully appointed and a great size. Unfortunately the bad outweighs the good at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice duel decker....”
Reviews.Author: ChuckyNo
Reviews.Content: We got the room as a promotion... so the price was cheap but the room did not disappoint. The bedroom and the living is separated by different levels. And thebathroom is nicely done with touch of class.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Shuffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights in a basic suite. Why would you need to upgrade when these suites provide everything? Large bedroom, lounge and bathroom. The bonus was we had a fantastic view of the Wynn and the mountains. Room 31-915 if you're interested. Check-in and -out was painless. The staff were excellent. And the in-house Virgin Airlines check-in desk was a second bonus (just £10 a bag surcharge). We mostly ate outside the hotel but did try the Lux Cafe. Really good food and along the same lines as the Cheesecake Factory at Caesars Palace (which we also recommend). Drinks in the bars are unsurprisingly expensive but this was made up by the free drinks we got whilst on the slots. As for the slots, hunt out the goldfish game, it's addictive. All-in-all, a top hotel with great rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Casually, elegantly-Vegas rooms”
Reviews.Author: MissyK66
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how great this place was (!!!!)... most certainly a pleasant surprise. The only reason i didn't flat-out give it a 5 was due to the horrifically long line upon arrival, even though my honey had arranged for premier check-in. But whatever, because 20-30 minutes later we were on our way to our sweet little suite, and we LLL LOVED it. Super clean and very well laid out, the room really was quite lovely: i think it was the whimsical elegance of the furnishings and the layout itself that did it. There was a comfy yet refined, eclectic mix that really worked -- heyday vegas elegance with a modern Jetsons twist that -- with the infusion of selected fabrics/pieces that were so well chosen and splashed -- made me feel as if i were in my own groovy pied-a-terre in Manhattan (sunken living room and all)!!!! YAY: there's nothing like casual elegance to make you feel relaxed and comfortable, especially if you happen to be in a zoo of sorts. I'm not really into the whole Disneyland vibe of Vegas (the food and spas and the Barney's that stays open til midnight are juuuust fine though!).......so having such a comfy, quiet, lovely room as a base-camp made our whole stay very, VERY nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room, but Casino size overwhelming”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirl22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo with some girlfriends on a bachelorette party. I've been to Vegas several times and I like to try a different hotel each time, so this was next on my list. The service was great and there were no lines when we checked in, beautiful lobby, however it was a far walk to our rooms, naturally though with any casino. I found the casino to be so large that it was almost overwhelming. It was just one huge room to me. On the other hand, our room was beautiful! So big and the bathroom was amazing. Our view was of the Venetian and the south strip, AMAZING view. The room was very clean, but there were a couple things wrong (the window shade was broken, and the bathroom light switch was broken), but these were easily fixed when we called housekeeping. Room service was very fast and the food was great! I was pleasantly surprised that parking was free (because we had rented a car to drive to the Hoover Dam). Location was perfect, right in the middle of the strip. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service is ALMOST as good as Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: TiredTraveler103010
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palazzo for a business trip. This was my first trip to Las Vegas. The rooms were spacious and quiet. the views were great. The service was comparable to that of a Holiday Inn, Econolodge, or Motel 6. There is no evidence that management communicates or there is any quality assurance program in place. Once you check in you will be given key cards and a crudely scrawled map to find your room. You will walk at least 1/2 mile through the casino to get to your room. There is a security guard to ensure that you can only order food from hotel restaurants. They check for room keys about 75% of the time. They are unable to get you into your room if the keys do not work and will refer you back to the front desk 1/2 mile away. They are unaware of the operating hours of most the restaurants. Once in your room, you are left to figure out where anything is, what amenities come with your room, the location of the safe and how to operate it. If you have medications that need to be refrigerated, you will need to bring your own cooler and good luck finding ice. If you desire a cup of coffee, you will need to go to a coffee shop on the casino level to purchase one as it is against policy for them to provide a coffee maker in the room. There are three TV's in the room. Each have access to different channels so if you start watching a show on one TV and want to continue watching as you bathe, it may not be possible. They don't seem to check the rooms closely (with the exception of the refreshment bar) after guest check out, sometimes the TV and/or the remotes do not work. There is an iron in the room, but the front desk staff do not know this. Check the iron before plugging it in because it may be damaged as mine was resulting in a large water spill on the floor. If they move your items for any reason, make sure you hand carry anything that can't take harsh treatment or you may find yourself with a broken laptop or other items with no recourse. They charge a resort fee for internet and access to a spa and pool. Good luck finding the spa and pool. It may be just for employees who know where it is located. The internet is included, but be ready for the computer glitch that requires you to accept charges. The front desk will tell you to accept the charges and they will take it off when you check out. Be sure to tell them or they might not. If you provide any feedback or comments, they will tell you that they will pass it on to the appropriate department, but there is no evidence that my concerns went anywhere but the shredder. They will make promises like the delivery of a daily newspaper or they will call you when they have acted on a request. You will not get a call or a newspaper. You may be told that after your stay you will get a feedback form in the mail. It's been 11 days and no feedback form. All in all, a beautiful room and view. Service comparable to a normal motel where they give you the room key at the desk and you are left to fend for yourself. In those motels, you do usually have a coffee maker, a refrigerator, and can order food from nearby restaurants, not at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo/Casino/Grazie 5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: CZ24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palazzo 11/4 thru 11/7 and after returning I wanted to give my opinion after reading many reviews prior to our departure. **We arrived alittle after 430pm after a 5hr direct flight from ORF. Took a taxi from LAS to the Palazzo which was less than 10mins with traffic and about 23.00 total w/ tip. We were greeted right away from the bell captain to the gentleman opening the front doors. At check-in, less than 5 minutes, we were greeted by our desk clerk and even the clerks to the L and R of him. We were offered an upgrade for an extra 100 per night to the Bella suite (Mt view) but declined it due to wanting a strip view and then like past resorts in which we have stayed, I slipped him 40 and then we were assigned suite 41-736 facing dead center of the TI across the street. I always believe if you take care of them, they will take care of you. To finish this, past reviews talk about how rude the front desks were, I think its more about the attitude of the ones typing the review! **41-736 was beautiful, clean, well furnished and very accomodating for us. I even looked for the things that others tend to pick out on here, but nothing was discovered. Well cleaned every a.m. and restocked with the basics. We always left a small tip in the room and it was well received by our attendant. **Casino at Pallazo, don't know where to start here but what a great time. I play in many different locations each year and this one besides Atlantis in the Bahamas really deserves 5 stars. From the Pit Boss, to the dealers, to the waitresses, they were friendly and waited on you hands down. Nice when your in Vegas, that the people call you by first name and they always asked how the stay was going. Take advantage of Grazie, its there for a reason and l will explain later. **Food was excellent wherever we ate, from Grand Lux to The Grill @ Valetino's and even the quick small coffee shop by elevators. Grand Lux was true comfort food at a reasonable price. **Checkout, how simple can it be. Like I stated earlier, get the Grazie card. I called the front desk at 930am, she transfered me to Casino Host/Services and within 3 minutes, our whole weekend was comped (1100) and was driven back to LAS in a private limo. No standing in lines for hours and fighting with management. Alot of reviews on here talk negative about the comp program with Grazie, not a single complaint here. **Lastly, I just wanted to give my view knowing how "some" just take everything to extremes. Thank You Palazzo for a great time, we will definately stay with you again and will recommend your 5 star resort anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: vava_10
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I've never felt compelled to write a review on a resort until now. This was my first time to Vegas. I don't like casinos, big cities, ritzy dining, or expensive shopping and I still had one of the best weekends ever! I came with a group of 10 women on business. We were there for an Invisalign convention held at the Venetian November 4-7. Arrival: We took an airport shuttle w/ several other groups and were dreading being the last to be dropped off, as the Palazzo is one of the furthest resorts from the airport. To our surprise, we were the first to be let off in a quick 10 mins. Check in: The line was outrageous (this conference was expecting several thousand to check in on the same day) but moved fast and we were checked into all 4 rooms unbelievably smoothly in another 5-10 minutes. Rooms: Spacious. With 4 girls in their 20s and 30s it usually gets crowded and chaotic. Not the case at this resort. The rooms are so big for the money. The bathrooms could be bigger, but with 4 girls getting ready in Vegas, we'd complain about any bathroom. Another prob w/ the bathroom is the shower is all glass. So we had to wait for everyone to shower before getting ready. Separate toilet-great. The room was perfect. Extremely clean. One of the perks of staying at a new resort. The location was okay. Not in the middle of the action which was the only downfall b/c we had never seen Vegas before and had to take a taxi everywhere. However, this was eventually a plus as we were sick of the crowds and our feet hurt so bad by day 3 were thrilled with taking taxi's. We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe in the hotel as soon as we checked in, again at 4:00 in the morning and for the next day's lunch. It's delicious. Owned by the same people that own Cheesecake Factory, there's something on the menu for everyone. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our feet hurt so bad the last night from walking in heels we thought it'd be funny to ride up and down the strip in Rascals (motorized scooters). Guest services rented them to us for $40 per day! We rode them from casino to casino and just parked them next to an ATM and plugged them in to charge. All in all beautiful resort, I would definitely stay there again. A couple we were with said they'd stayed at 7 different top dollar resorts in Vegas and this was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travel918
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Palazzo for an anniversary trip and were very happy with the service, location, and room. Our room was not yet ready, as we checked-in early, and they promptly stored our bags while we waited for our room. Helen at the front desk was very courteous and a pleasure to deal with. The rooms are huge and easily the best value in Vegas. We stayed at Bellagio during our last trip, and with Palazzo costing less per night, coupled with substantially larger rooms, we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “They need serious training in customer service!”
Reviews.Author: kgragg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo to celebrate my birthday. The staff at the front desk was courteous and friendly, and they accommodated my request for a room in a quiet area away from the elevators. The bed was clean, but cups in the bathroom were spotted and had been wiped out with a cloth. Lighting in the bath was terrible, but that helped disguise the many layers of dust on the baseboards. On my birthday, we simply wanted to lounge by the pool with friends. Unfortunately, most of the pools were closed for the season and there was no pool service. There was no mention of this anywhere on their website, and it is a serious problem. We are not smokers, and we had to move multiple times to get away from people who were blowing smoke all over us. Eventually, we decided to move our chairs out in an attempt to seclude ourselves, but the pool manager promptly came over to tell us we couldn't do that. Rather than help us find a comfortable spot, she refused to even allow us help ourselves. We reported her to the hotel manager who apologized for her, but he also refused to help. He said he would give us a nice suite on our next trip... we would never stay there again! They didn't even replenish towels and shower gel without us tracking down the housekeeping cart. I am prepared to pay for luxury, but Palazzo leaves much to be desired and is very overrated. They simply don't care if you have a miserable experience. We will be back at Sunk net time where we always found a chair at the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Superb but not the best.”
Reviews.Author: Nolbu
Reviews.Content: LV is full of mega 5 star resorts and the Palazzo is worthy of being called one of them. The good: luxurious, roomy, flashy, wow factor at the lobby (decoration) The bad: no buffet restaurant. I don't understand why. Overpriced restaurant menu. Location is not great but OK. It takes good amount of walking to the main LV intersection (Bellagio). No matter how hard they try, personalized service can only be limited unless you are a high roller. And this applies to any 5 star mega resorts in LV due to its size and number of guests they have to deal with, maybe in exception of Four Seasons (more of boutique 5 star in LV). No major problems here. Somehow I don't feel completely satisfied though. Maybe I have become a spoiled traveler after being pampered at so many nice hotels in Thailand where service is unmatched. In LV, I prefer staying at Bellagio where the access is the most convenient and I can have any meals at buffet restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBum
Reviews.Content: I usually don't travel to Las Vegas anymore since I find the hotels impersonal and the strip too crowded. Usually, I have gone back to LV to do more outdoor activities. However, my conference was moved to LV and so I had no choice. The Palazzo was the highlight of this trip. I was surprised at how friendly and pleasant the front desk were when I checked in and called me by name. And the room was one of the most beautiful rooms I have stayed in. Not only was it large with a separate sitting area and a large bathroom, it was beautifully furnished with excellent taste in decorating. I was so comfortable throughout my stay and slept great. I could not have asked for a more convenient location. The shops and eating places and the wonderful European type cafes were such a treat and it was right there off the lobby. Mario Batalli has a restaurant right there in the lobby level that was delicious! What impressed me the most that on my last day, the bell hop was so helpful with storing my luggage while I attended the rest of my conference. The only negative is that the price of the rooms are very high and I did get conference rates which were reasonable but if I were to return, I don't know if it would be worth it to pay the full price since there are other hotels not on the strip that are also well appointed with a more reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Wynn”
Reviews.Author: Irene7457
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Venetian where my son picked to celebrate his 30th birthday with family and friends. We were checked in to the Palazzo insead. The room was large but the first thing we had to do was call to have our bathroom light fixed. There cleanliness of the room was also not up to Wynn standards. There were disgusting stains on the couch which I wouldn't even sit on without placing towels on it first. The highlight of staying there was having breakfast next to the very gracious Emirelle Lagasse who kindly took a few minutes to take a photo with me. The service and restarants were also worth it. The only way I would stay there again is if I get comped. Other than that I'll be back to the Wynn come April 2011 for my other son's birthday. On a good note the boys had a FAB stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yvette2121
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo halloween weekend. The Room: We stayed at the Palazzo Luxury Suite, this room is beautiful, spacious, and just perfect! Restaurant: We ate at the Dos Caminos Restaurant which has great good and good music, make sure to try their guacamole, and frozen margarita they are delicious! Nightclub: We went to the LAVO on Friday night, if you like hip hop it will be fun. We have no complaints everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Jugi
Reviews.Content: I would absolutely stay here again. The rooms are HUGE (700+ square feet). They are tastefully done without being over-the-top of gaudy. The bed and pillows are super comfortable. The draperies are remote-control operated and do a great job of shutting out the bright lights of the strip. Between that and the comfiness of the bed, I slept in until noon one day without even realizing it. The sitting area has a very comfortable L-shaped couch that was great for relaxing or napping. There were three flat screen TVs. Only a few complaints about the room: while generally quiet, there were a couple of noisy parties at at the pool that I could definitely hear from my room. The do not disturb sign was missing from my room. There was no coffee maker in the room, and there was no extra blanket. I entered the bathroom to find the toilet unflushed (!). The other people I was with found limes in their mini-fridge left over from a previous occupant. The room includes a printer/scanner/fax/copy machine, but I could not figure out how to work it and I couldn't find any instructions either. Room service was very expensive, even by room service standards. I splurged on breakfast and the total bill, for a standard bacon/eggs/hash brown/croissant/juice/coffee was $42 after the 18% gratuity and room service fee were included. It was very good, though. I found all of the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. There was a short wait to check in (around 3 pm on a Wednesday) and no wait to check out (around 6 am on a Sunday). The casino was very nice - again, without being too over the top or gaudy (the same cannot be said for the Wynn). The minimums on the tables were high, which was to be expected. There was a really great selection of slots, especially video poker and blackjack. Not very smoky at all. We ate at Zine one night and it was good. Also good was Grand Lux Cafe - which was casual and very reasonably priced. I found the location to be a little inconvenient, being towards the far north end of the strip. Most of the action is further south on the strip - I personally prefer to stay right in the middle near Bellagio, Bally's, Paris, etc. We wound up doing a LOT of walking. It was nice having the Fashion Show area across the street, however, since it has lots of good dining options. I would definitely recommend the sushi place and the southwestern place as good options that won't break the bank. Overall though, I think it was a great bang for the buck, especially compared to the Wynn next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip! Hotel was easy to work with!”
Reviews.Author: MrLeeHarvey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, luxurious, and the personnel were friendly. These guys didn't do "go through the motions" service, they actually took care of us! Of course, not everything was perfect, but i would not stay anywhere else without a darn good reason!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: seersucker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room at The Palazzo for 5 nights in late October. We had stayed at The Four Seasons and Bellagio before and had excellent stays there but were looking forward to giving The Palazzo a try. Unfortunately our experience couldn't have been any more different than our wonderful stays at The Four Seasons and Bellagio. We arrived to the hotel from the airport late in the afternoon and went in to the front desk to register. The front desk attendant matter-of-factly and unapologetically told us The Palazzo was overbooked and that we would have to stay at The Venetian instead. We were told there was no recourse in the matter, such as a refund so we could stay at another property. We were very disappointed by this as we had booked The Palazzo specifically and had planned our trip for quite some time. To add insult to injury, the front desk attendant seemed to be amused by our situation and asked us how we would be getting to our room, by taxi or shuttle, apparently since it was so far away. The front desk manager standing nearby seemed to find this humorous as well and although we usually have a good sense of humor, we were appalled and dismayed by their lack of tact and professionalism. It was embarrassing; I've never been treated like that before, especially at a high end hotel and casino. That evening we had dinner reservations and tickets to a show so we did not have time to press the matter further. I was able, however, to call the reservation line and we were told that there was availability at The Palazzo for the rest of our stay, contradicting the story we received from the front desk that the hotel was overbooked. The whole experience with the front desk left us with such a bad taste that I made reservations at another hotel the next day, The Four Seasons, where we had a great stay for the rest of our trip. (I can't recommend The Four Seasons enough, awesome place) I had read some bad reviews about The Palazzo before our trip and chalked it up to 'everybody has to get some bad reviews now and then'. Unfortunately the horror stories about arrogant, rude, and condescending staff were spot on. This attitude seems to permeate throughout the entire Palazzo/Venetian complex. We, of course, will not stay, errr, make reservations at The Palazzo again, and I would certainly be leery of making reservations with them as you might have a big surprise in store for you when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SierraToGo
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel rooms I've stayed in in a long time. Excellent bed and linens. Great bathroom. Large living space. 3 flat screens. Excellent quality. Very quiet sound proof rooms. Spend the extra money and stay in a prestige suite. Great breakfast in am, open bar 5-9, great free food. Really pleasant Vegas experience. Not very smokey. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother!”
Reviews.Author: kobebean
Reviews.Content: We pre-paid for the entire package 2 months prior to our arrival.First we waited on a long line for about 40 minutes and then we were greeted with "Sorry but we do not have the room you requested!.Why pay in advance when they do not honor reservations? The front desk help were polite but inefficient and very slow. It took another 45 minutes for them to get a manager who finally placed us in an upgraded room but with a caveat. We could only stay in the room for that night and be out as soon as they could get us into another room. We did not want to pack and unpack two times for a three day stay. They could care less. The rooms are lovely but the service is a disgrace for luxury hotel. The lines are excessively long and there are better places with similar amenities in Las Vegas. Save yourself the aggravation and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: hazelmei
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The rooms were beautiful and the staff were very accommodating. THe rooms were very spacious and I love how there's an extra living room area where you could hang out. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I'm Not a Vegas Person”
Reviews.Author: daetime
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to Vegas. We were on a road trip on the way to the National Parks of Utah. We had a reservation at the Venetian but at 7:30 pm our room was not ready and would not be ready for "hours". We later found this interesting because housekeeping walked into our room twice before check-out to ask if we were leaving now. We were offered a room at the Palazzo which we took. Like many it took us a long time and a lot of walking to get from our car to the Venetian front desk to our room at the Palazzo. We used my Agoda points for our reservation and the front desk was dismissive about our "discounted rate" room. He scribbled on a map and sent us on our way. The Palazzo room was beautiful but I find it inconvenient to go down 15 floors to get a cup of coffee in the morning. Dinner at Wolfgang Puck's was only okay. We went there because we had a coupon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice? How would I know - they walked me...”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation, prepaid first night. Arrived in Las Vegas and told that the Palazzo was 100% sold (not my problem) and that they couldn't find a room at the Venetian either (again, not my problem). Ended up 2 casinos, several long hallways, then an elevator, than a bridge, then another long hallway, then another elevator away in a dump they call Venezia, overlooking a parking lot. AND they don't even have wireless in this place!! In 2010!! No apologies - basically tough luck, dude...

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend,will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Darrylict
Reviews.Content: Got in on Thursday, Oct 14th at 10:30AM, went to the invited guest check in, and quickly got our room. Being first timers, everything was explained and within 15 minutes our bags were delivered. The service was excellent. Hit the pool, which was beautiful, but bar service was slow by the pool girls. Only service that was not 1st rate during our 3 day stay. Highly recommend Sushi Samba, great food, high energy and superb service. Had drinks and apps at Carne Vino, so good we regretted meeting friends up the strip for an uneventful dinner. The Serbian bartender was as good as they come and quality of the food and drinks were phenominal. As everyone says, Grand Lux is great for breakfast and the buffet is fresh and a bargain. $15.99 includes all of your beverages too! The Concierge got us on the Lavo guest list and was very professional. The club was insanely crowded, but had a good vibe. Drinks were flowing at the casino and the crews at the craps tables were accomodating and always called you by your first name. The beautiful room was a haven from the madness and the bed was super comfortable. Having been to Vegas nearing a dozen times, we definately will be coming back to the Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “Prestige level not worth the $100 extra”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: 50th Birthday weekend and we had very high hopes and expectations for the Prestige concierge level since we normally stay at Wynn/Encore. So we bought the two night Bordeaux package and upgraded to Prestige. A mere $660 prepay rate for two nights. In Vegas, that's steep, but having stayed on Ritz Carlton club levels around the world, we figured it would be an equally sublime experience. We requested a room with a strip view by email in advance of arrival. Upon arrival it was denied. We had a room instead with a perfect view of Wynn/Encore which left us laughing. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed in both the Venetian, where we have stayed previously and the Palazzo. Almost identical. The maid service is also very good. We had no complaints whatsoever regarding the rooms or maid service. For the Bordeaux package, we received a bottle of wine each night from Bordeaux. You can buy the bottles retail if you search Google for a whopping $12 and $15 respectively. Now, why on earth would Palazzo want to sell an expensive wine package and then embarass themselves serving cheap grocery quality wine? Mind you the fancy french reds came with a cheese plate and some fruit. This was a major disappointment but has proven great fodder when talking with our friends who are all foodies. They're as shocked as we were. And if a bottle retails for $12 or $15 you know the hotel is paying 1/2 or less! On the Presitge level, $100 additional per night, the rooms are EXACTLY THE SAME as other hotel rooms. No upgraded amenities or linens. You are offered bottled water or a glass of champagne at check-in. They also offer continental breakfast in the morning, which was a cattle call. Pastry, cereal, oatmeal, fruit if the plates aren't empty and juice. NO hot entree items and no mimosas. If you are counting on a Ritz Carlton club level experience you are in for a definite surprise. In the late afternoon and early evening there are two hours where you can have comped cocktails on Prestige. We had one cocktail each and then headed to dinner or shows. They do offer a hot hor s deouvre or two during this period of time. And be prepared, the help will watch their clocks closely not starting the free cocktail service too soon and ending promptly. Some people sat at the bar and tried hard to get their $100 worth of liquor and they may actually have accomplished the task. For us, there are plenty of free cocktails on the gaming floor, so we didn't find this a great value. In the evening there are desserts for another two hour period of time. 7 pm to 9 pm. We arrived on one evening at 8:30 pm and the help said they were out of desserts but they had cookies! Whoopee! Seriously, that's a major gaffe and shows tremendous lack of managerial oversight that employees would be acting in that manner. There are also some public computer terminals in the Prestige lounge and for those who need unpacking services you can request help when checking in. Upon check out our bill had jumped...just a tad. We had only charged a $187 meal at Morels, an excellent French inspired restaurant, and no other charges, but we were presented with a $1400+ bill that the clerk could not explain to my satisfaction. Once he was fully aware I had prepaid $660 for both nights he screwed his face up and tried to fix the bill. Then came a manager named Nathan who whipped out a Sharpie permanent marker and had trouble making heads of tails of the bill. He did understand that we had fully prepaid $660 for the two night stay called the Bordeaux Package. The more he did math games on the bill the more confusing it became. Neither Nathan, nor myself or the clerk could come up with a final answer. After 20 minutes of this nonsense he sent me away and said he would fix it and give me a call to confirm the bill was fixed. Well, that was over a month ago and no phone call from Mr. Chapas. But AMEX confirms it is fixed. Can you imagine checking out of Ritz Carlton or better yet the Encore across the street and standing like an idiot at the counter while two different staff members try to sort out your bill for 20 minutes.
