I kept thinking Ashton Kutcher was going to pop out from the tv show, Punk'D. While the hotel is nice enough, we certainly had what I would call a corked stay. It clearly was not worth $660 for two nights. If anyone is planning on staying at this property, just get the base room and spend the least amount possible. Don't buy the Bordeaux Package unless you love cheap wine. Don't expect or ask for an upgrade regardless of the reason. If you think the various freebies of Prestige warrant an extra $100/night, then book it and enjoy, but for us it was a lot of fluff that we didn't use or need or care about. For some people, that have not experienced other club levels, it was apparent they thought it was the greatest thing since sliced bread. I would encourage those people to visit a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons club level and luxuriate in the differences. And for overall atmostphere and complete ease of checking in and out I would suggest the Encore Towers. The experience is overwhelmingly positive, seamless and effortless.

Reviews.Title: “Shamelessly expensive”
Reviews.Author: heitmann
Reviews.Content: Roomrates were $220 per night - a requested late checkout (of one hour) was $120 more. A Cup of coffee to go was over $4.00, 2coffees and 2 blueberry muffins to go were $18.00.

Reviews.Title: “When I go back to Vegas, I might stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: AdamNTrish
Reviews.Content: The only reason I say I might stay there again is there are so many other good casinos to stay at. Other than that, what a beautiful place. This is a newer casino that is connected to the Venetian, which is also a beautiful casino. It's located on the north end of the strip. When you walk in you know that this place was built with elegance in mind. When we checked in there was a small wait, maybe 5-10 minutes. The individual who checked in was very friendly and we were off to our room quickly. In the rooms the living room area is sunken about a foot which gives the feeling that the bedroom area and living room are two different rooms. The bathroom, which has a larger stand up shower, tub and two sink vanity was top notch. The street view of the room at night was pretty impressive. I had a front row seat to the treasure of island show. The pool was pretty small and due to the way that the sun rises and the position of the hotel, the pool area isnt in the sun until somewhere around noon. There are also a couple of other little pools that were closed. I believe that they were only open during special events. But, because the Palazzo and Venetian are owned together you can use the facilities from either property. So, when we went swimming early we went to the Venetian pool. Parking was pretty easy and free. And the walk from the parking lot to the casino to the room was about 5 minutes. The hotel is not a party hot spot and I would say that this place is more targeted for the non-party and older types, which suited me just fine. All of the staff were friendly and were helpful. Not one single complaint about the staff. Overall I'm giving the hotel 4 stars. If it werent for the pool being way too small and the fact that the sun doesnt touch the pool area until late morning/early afternoon, I would have put 5 starts. But, again, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms in the world”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: I love the rooms in the Palazzo. Im my opinion the best hotel rooms out there not including suites and/or penthouse. I'm not very fond of the staff, but other than that, I usually have a great experience here. Great location for shopping and sightseeing. You can't go wrong here if you want the full experience of vegas.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: hymerman
Reviews.Content: We stayed, by chance, in one of the four normal sized rooms on the top floor, so felt like super-stars everytime we got in the lift and pressed the golden top floor button! Our room was huge, with an L-shaped sofa, 3 tvs (one in the bathroom!) and a great view of all the activity going on below on the street. The hotel also has a nice pool, which gets the full sun in the afternoon, and has a cocktail bar with cocktails at $10 each. We would recommend this place as a romantic get-away, or great for the gamblers as it is at one end of the strip, so you can start from there and work your way down if you wish. One downside is the confusing underground car park, which seems to lack signs which tell you which way to go. We know we weren't the only confused ones as there were lots of cars driving round, and when we finally made our way own to the second level it was practically deserted!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service not great”
Reviews.Author: Jayneyb_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights with my husband and friends as a treat for my birthday. Had booked 7 months earlier and so were surprised when we checked in to be told we had to stay at the Venetian as there were no suites available in the Palazzo. After kicking up a stink and telling them that if we wanted to stay at the Venetian we would have booked the Venetian, we were found a suite in the Palazzo. One hour and a half later we were still waiting for our luggage to arrive in our room. My husband had also previously arranged for (and paid for!!) champagne and roses to be in our room when we arrived and these were also missing. Have to admit that the room was lovely, with the large bed being the most comfortable i have ever slept in. Would also say that the food in the Luxe Cafe was wonderful. Service was again poor in the casino, where you could easily go an hour before being asked if you want a drink. All in all we were disappointed with the service in the hotel. We have previously stayed at the Bellaggio, which we could not fault, and next time plan to give the Wynn a try. We would not stay at the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs new furniture in rooms”
Reviews.Author: joey123456
Reviews.Content: This was real disappointment, The furniture looked like it was from a flea market. So badly used and marked, the drinking glasses had dust on them, The rugs in the casino were so ugly and stained, The window was so dirty I could hardly see out of it. We spent $300.00 at the Lagasse Stadium on Thursday night food was horrible and the waitresses even worst, miserable with attitude. One actually threw a pizza down on the table. I have stayed at Sheraton Hotels that were cleaner. After going in the Wynn I didn't even want to go back to my room. I would not recomend it. Donna Volpe room 726 19th floor

Reviews.Title: “Solid Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mchud
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Palazzo with my spouse and another couple. A year or so back I stayed at the Wynn and was somewhat dissapointed - great casino, but very mediocre rooms, where depending on what side of the hotel you were on, let in alot of outside noise from their nightclubs. We have stayed previously at the Venetian and enjoyed it, so we gave the sister hotel a try. Check in was smooth, and we were able to get into a room right away even though we were early. The rooms, being newer, were a bit more updated and "warmer" in color scheme compared to the Venetian. Bed was high quality pillow top and very comfortable. Rooms and bathrooms were sparkling. Unlike many strip hotels, we never heard noise from the hallways - what a pleasure! Very nice and active pool area - great for relaxing and watching people going by. We ate at the GrandLux cade a couple of times. Unlike most of the hotels on the strip, there is no massive buffet to chow down on. However, there is a nice breakfast buffet that has plenty of options, but not to the extent of others on the strip. The price at about $16 per person was also reasonable for a higher end locaiton. The Palazzo and Venetian carry alot of traffic - these are convention hotels attached to the Sands CC. The place is very busy at all times - and the casino seemed a bit smokier than it was on previous stays. The Wynn and Encore casino's by contrast are a bit more sedate. Hotel security was reasonably decent, with someone checking for room keys 24/7. Nothing stops you from keeping a keycard and going up anytime, but at least there is an effort being made. A bit irritating, but it reflects today's times, a picture ID is required for any purchase using your room account. So be sure to take your ID with you to the pool etc. - otherwise, no purchases! We caught Jersey Boys and it is a fun musical, if you like the Four Season and Frankie Valli stuff. Very professional and well done. There are disocunt tickets to be had, but they are not giving them away. Bottom line, not an inexpensive weekend stay - but you will not be disappointed for what you got! Will keep this hotel on my top places with the Bellagio and Venetian!

Reviews.Title: “poor pool”
Reviews.Author: LGC13
Reviews.Content: Pool didn't get much exposure to sun due shadow of building

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply a superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanSkinner
Reviews.Content: My (now) wife and I have just got back from Vegas where we got married. We travelled with another 30 friends and family in tow, with all of us staying at the Palazzo. Having stayed at the Venetian before, as well as a number of other Vegas hotels (Caesar's & Signature @ MGM Grand) I kind of knew what we would be getting, however it was a first for our other guests. Everyone was delighted with the hotel - the pool was superb, the rooms great (especially ours as we got a complimentary upgrade to a Fortuna suite), the restaurants very good (if a little pricey, but to be expected!) and the staff very pleasant. We took our 4 year old son with us, and whilst he obviously couldn't drink or gamble (!!!) he thoroughly enjoyed himself - the pool was great for him and most of the staff went out of their way to talk to him. Next time we go back to Vegas I'm sure the Palazzo/Venetian will be the place we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our first encounter with Vegas was awesome - Thanks Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: MCNICE9
Reviews.Content: I travelled to vegas with my family during the Holiday season. We did not know what to expect in the Sin City. Palazzo was a home for us. We stayed in a quite side of the hotel. We had just come back from Venice, Italy so the Palazzo not only reminded us of the great time in Italy but added a bit of quietude to the Vegas experience. We recommend the hotel to families with children. Do not expect to find anyone from the staff. The hotel seems to run my itself.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Rooms”
Reviews.Author: katensteve
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo has rooms almost exactly like the Venetian, but since it was built more recently, the rooms feel a little newer. Great rooms for a group - I stayed here with 4 other girls and we had plenty of room in which to hang out, get ready etc. The bathrooms are HUGE and overall, the rooms are just luxurious and the beds are super comfy. The sunken living room is a huge plus as well. The one thing I would mention is that the hotel is packed and thus the service isn't great. I got in early and the hotel did not have a room ready. They said they would call at check-in, but by check-in I received no call and when I checked back the room was STILL not ready. They also could note provide the adjoining rooms that my friends and I had requested, so I was less than impressed espescially since we were there for a special ocassion. I'd still recommend staying here - the hotel is GREAT, in a good location, and perfect for a getaway with lots of food options close by.

Reviews.Title: “bad start, strong finish.”
Reviews.Author: hotchick2
Reviews.Content: We didn't get to our hotel in Las Vegas until midnight due to a late flight from the east coast. I had informed The Palazzo of our late arrival in advance and they promised to have our suite, on the conceirge level, ready to go. Needless to say, when we arrived they told us that all suites on that level were full. I spoke to the hotel manager (Rachelle) who appoligized for the problem and was able to find us a suite. We didn't know until we got to our suite that it was a handicapped suite. Now don't get me wrong, it was just as beautifull as a regular suite, but it was set up for handicapped which we are not. When you're not handicapped that type room is actually uncomfortable. (especially the shower) The next morning i went down to the invited guest counter and met an employee named Kent. Kent was unbelievably helpfull in finding me just the right room, on just the right floor. Our experience from that point on became fantastic. Now for the rest of the hotel. The location is superb. Dead center in the middle of the strip. You can walk to any number of great casinos, or just up and down the strip if you prefer. It takes all of 5 seconds to get a cab to go anywhere else you feel like going. The dealers at the tables were very friendly and helpfull while gambling. The food at the restaurants was great too. (including room service) The pools were AWESOME. The lounge chairs were abundant and very comfortable. The food and beverage served poolside was also awesome. I would recommend this hotel, but suggest that you get an exact room type in writing when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo is a hotel you go to if you need a great sleep and relaxing room!”
Reviews.Author: DeedsInc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo as a friend of ours was getting married at the Venetian. I have never stayed in any suites in Vegas so this was a first. The amount of space in the room is great. Having TVs in the living room, bedroom and bathroom is great - especially if you don't want to watch what your wife is (or having two different sporting events on!). The bed was a king and was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Check-in was early (around noon) and the line ups were short and the service was fine. The casino itself isn't huge but a good size...if you aren't a big stakes gambler then perhaps a Harrah's or Bally's is better as the minimums are lower. I didn't find it too smokey, they had smoke-free areas set up which was nice! Overall a great hotel and resort - try the gilatto!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed At The Rest, Wynn Is Still The Best....”
Reviews.Author: Orchidaceous
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Palazzo during the 1st week in October. Check-in was good. No line, friendly service (although we checked in at 11:30pm on a Sunday night) and the hotel smelled great (not smokey like some other hotels) - what is that smell they pump into the vents?? Room was fine, big, comfortable and clean. Enjoyed the TV's throughout the room (although they need to add more "female friendly" channels rather then ESPN/ESPN2/FOX NEWS/MSNBC, etc. No E! or Bravo?). Middle of the road stay. Wasn't blown away by the customer service or ammenities. Was disappointed that I couldn't find (or use) a computer to check-in on-line (for my flight) at 10:30pm on a Thursday night. Business Center was closed and so was the concierge (on a busy Thursday night?!). I resorted to paying $6 for 3 minutes and 2 sheets of paper from one of those "pay as you go" computers in the lobby. What was the point of a $17 a night resort fee??? Wasn't permitted to check out late either (our flight was at 11:30pm - check out was 11am!). They wouldn't even give us a noon (free) or 2pm ($50 more) check out. AND they wanted half of the days room rate to stay until 6pm (which we couldn't even do anyway). I've stayed at many of the hotels on the strip and the Palazzo was just average. If you're going to spend a little more money per night, stay at the Wynn next door.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay at the Palazzo again.”
Reviews.Author: EbitdaChicago
Reviews.Content: The room was in disarray, sink clogged, foreign matter on the wall next to the toilet, I don't even want to guess what it was and it was probably what you are all thinking. Room lighting was terrible, Had to call maintenance to replace bulbs that were out. Room service food terrible Casino reeked of cigarette smoke. Not attractive at all. I booked a King room and was given a a double queen. I had to negotiate to get my original reservation. Given passes to the adult pool, and was rejected because my 47 year old wife didn't have her driver license with her. I had room key and my license. Go figure. Daily Resort Fee is a total rip off. It's a hidden room charge.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo was a huge disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaCR
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 suites for a Girls' Weekend and the hotel was the only dissapointing aspect of our stay. Though we had booked far in advance, in order to get our rooms on the same floor as we requested, we had to wait long past the initial check in time. They were uncaring and unapologetic about the fact that we couldn't get ready in our rooms in order to make our show reservations that evening. The rooms were spacious but tired. Handles were missing on the chipped furniture and the lock was irreparably broken on our safe. The man who tried to fix the safe was not only unsuccessful; he was not helpful and very unfriendly. The day we checked out, we asked for a late check out. We were denied because they said they were booked. When we reminded them we didn't get to check in at the normal time, they told us we had until noon to get out. I called the hotel on my cell phone and was told they did have available rooms so not only are they rude, they are dishonest. I am a very nice person and usually get great service. It's not as though we caused any problems or were even drinking. There was absolutely no reason for their terrible service but there it was. The only good thing about the hotel was the Canyon Ranch Spa. Though the restaurant manager messed up our gift cards and tried to tell us we had already used a card we had not (he eventually figured out it was his error and apologize), the massages and the facility were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: JohnTsouris
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the Palazzo's total lack of customer service is prompting this review. If the Palazzo had even asked us how our stay was at check out, they would have had the opportunity to remedy the situation, and I would be writing a different review. A questionnaire was emailed to me two weeks after my stay, and a hotel manager did not contact me even after I again listed the problems with the stay. I am a 41 year old frequent business and pleasure traveler with 100 hotel stays a year, and over 35 cruises to date. I am a Platinum Elite member of Intercontinental Hotels Group and a Triple Platinum Milestone Elite member of Carnival Cruise Lines. My wife was with me for this stay. The customer service received at this hotel was absolutely sub par and certainly not worthy of their four-star rating. The room amenities and room layout were superb, but the positive review ends there. During our stay, we found numerous problems with the room. At a hotel of this stature, all of the room amenities should be inspected prior to each new guest. 1. We found a large leather bag in the night stand which contained four dildos/sex toys, numerous bottles of lube, and a plethora of batteries. This obviously brought into question how thoroughly the room was cleaned prior to our visit. When I notified the front desk, they took absolutely no action. In fact, we left the bag right where we found it to see if our complaint would prompt them to clean properly for the next guest. I am adding a photo of these items for anyone questioning this review. I am also amused to see if the posing of this review and the image would finally prompt a contact from hotel management. 2. The motorized curtains were not working. (Maintenance did fix this upon request) 3. The room thermostat was broken and registering a room temperature about 6 degrees lower than actual room temperature. In other words, we had to set it to 65 to get a room temperature of 71, and as such when it displayed the room as 65 degrees, it was actually 71 in the room. (My travel alarm clock registers room temp.) 4. The bathroom scale was broken. 5. The DVD player in the room had no remote control, which made it non-functional for any DVD that has an initial menu. (No buttons on the player itself) 6. The room business center had a non functional printer, and no printer paper supply. 7. Several room light bulbs were burned out. 8. There was broken glass in the carpet which was found by my getting cut in bare feet. The room was clearly not cleaned correctly following a glass accident by one of the previous occupants. 8. And the worst issue, we saw a baby German cockroach crawling in the bathroom which disappeared through a crack in the baseboard. Most if not all of these issues were reported to the desk. Most issues went unresolved with no contact from anyone. Upon checkout, I was awaiting the representative to ask me how our stay was. Incredibly, she did not do so! I cannot stress enough that in decades of travel, I have never, ever not been asked how my stay was at any property. What is even more puzzling is the absolute lack of contact from hotel management or customer service on any of these issues. I have never before encountered a total lack of interest when the rare problem has arisen during one of my stays with even the lower rated hotels. Incredibly, I'm certain if we had found a bag containing sexual items in any other property in the United States the hotel management would be beside themselves with embarrassment over the issue. At the Palazzo we received absolutely no contact about it whatsoever. I must highly recommend that the reader choose a competing hotel when contemplating the Palazzo if customer service and room cleanliness is of concern. Anyone can also contact me personally for additional details if you like. John L Tsouris {--}

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blingster44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights end of Sept 2010, fab hotel bedrooms extra large with queens size beds very comfy and sitting rooms area 3 tvs inlcd one in luxury bathroom ,with seperate shower cubicle and seperate toilet room.Very clean we had a strip room view which was amazing..also eat in the Mexican Rest by casino which was again excellent and great value for money,made even better with a voucher we got a check in giving 50 dollars off , we were also given a voucher for free Blue Man Group tickets which again was excellent ..Would def stay here again and have stopped in the Venetian MGM Luxor Alladin Mandalay Bay think this was our favourite....Great Stay..

Reviews.Title: “Grits Sandwiches for Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGrl77
Reviews.Content: Me and two girlfriends decided to start our 2010 travel season with the tried and true trip to Vegas. Vegas is known for allowing the common 9-5 working, 2 vacation weeks a year having, sneakers and velour jumpsuit wearing single ladies to experience New York, Paris, Venice, Hollywood, and Rio all in one trip. Having been in 2003, I had long been holding onto the thought that nothing much could've changed on the Strip. Oh, how wrong I was! And square dap in the middle of collective change was the beautiful Palazzo. From the walk inside, to the attentive concierge, to the AMAZING room -- I was in awe. I consider myself a travelista so generally, I'm hotel-smotel blah about accomos -- but I was truly impressed. Wow. We stayed on the 37th floor which wasn't as concerning as I first thought. Sunken sitting area? Check! Multiple flat screens? Check! Bathtub AND Shower -- again, with a flat screen? Check! Excuse my redundancy -- Wow. I planned to visit some other Vegas newbies on the Strip, but, I think I've found my pillow pal in Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Less Could Be More”
Reviews.Author: JMW405
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility, great room and good staff. If this is a stand alone facility, then its great. But its part of the Venetian Resort Complex which is a massive facility that can be crowded , noisy, and you can easily get lost in. No buffet offered, and restaurants tend to be better but expensive. Between Venetian and Palazzo, chose to stay at Palazzo as it is a bit more comfortable and quieter environment. No free internet but there is a fax/printer within the room.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: jovanar
Reviews.Content: Great service. Professional stuff. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: astoner
Reviews.Content: Palazzo casino offers very good players card dicounts - we normally get 4 nights free and $250 slot credit. Rooms are still very luxurious - and service excellant. Sometimes casino gets busy if a conference is in town; but normally for crowded action go to Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Serivce Ruined the Trip”
Reviews.Author: ShopSD
Reviews.Content: 9/13/2010 I stayed at the Palazzo in Vegas for this past Labor day weekend. I'm a regular Vegas visitor and enjoy my stays at most of the hotels I've been at. Palazzo is the first time I've stayed at any hotel chain a second time (I was at the Venetian previously). All in all I had fun and the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are clean and luxurious, room service is relatively prompt, but I came across a serious Customer Service issue at checkout that I believe all need to be aware of. -On that Saturday night, there was a fire in the parking garage and cars were not allowed into the driveway. However, Security neglected to inform us (something we found out the next day), that pedestrians can walk up to the hotel. Instead, we were turned away in our cab at 2 a.m. to circle the streets for over an hour (a $100+ cab fare) until the hotel was reopened to cars. -We brought this to the attention of the Front Desk manager AL SANTOS when we were checking out. At first, he denied that the hotel was not letting cars access the hotel and that there was a fire. We were bewildered. He kept insinuating that we were inventing the story to get credits to our room. After us starting to get upset about his behavior and treatment, a front desk representative leaned over and updated him about the fire. He apologized. He proceeded to get a Security guard to watch us, while he went to get claim forms for us to document our complain. Strike 1. -I asked to have the room credit to be put on my Grazie card and after being told at check in, during my stay and at the Grazie counter that it won't be a problem, he proceeded to tell me that it was impossible b/c I'm a secondary on the room and not a primary. I asked him to change that - He threw a fuss, and then relented. I checked the next day and my Grazie card was never credited. Strike 2. - Then he charged the wrong credit card for the room. After I asked him about it, he lost his temper and berated me about that being the credit card the reservations were made with. I informed him that another credit card was submitted at check in and CHARGED already. He refunded the initial card and proceeded to re-charge the second card. I left that day with my card being charge double the room charge. When I kept explaining that he was double charging me, he started loosing it again and informing me in the most derogatory manner that this was standard procedure. Strike 3! -I leave the hotel finally (after over 1.5 hours at checkout). On the road I call the reservations department to reverse those double charges, which I had confirmed with my bank at that point) b/c it was causing overdraft charges on my bank account. I came across another Manager, Michelle who offered to call the bank to verify whether any overdraft charges had occured and if we had charged more than we owed. 15 minutes after I speak with Michelle, AL SANTOS called me, yelling and insulting me for speaking to another manager about the double charges, informing me that Michelle works UNDER him and that he never double charged me. I reiterated that I checked my account online and I was double charged, but he wasn't listening, he just kept screaming at me. STRIKE 4! Well, at this point I was angry and I asked for the next Manager up. She (Nicole) was not available and I was told she would call me on the next business day. It's been over a week, I've called her myself again, and have STILL not heard from her. Yeah, so a whole lot of yelling by customer service. It ruined my entire stay at the Palazzo and my entire view of the hotel. I have never heard of Customer Service reps screaming at customers and being so uninformed about the happenings at their hotel. If you have no complications, I guess it's ok to stay there. Otherwise, management is one unreliable rude group to interact with at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Got to stay here- don't go elsewhere- you need to read this”
Reviews.Author: nceyedoc
Reviews.Content: I read others reviews of the Palazzo before I made our reservations, and did not have any problems with the hotel at all. Let me start by saying I planned my trip and attractions based on these reviews from others and want my review to help people. The Palazzo is great. First there was no problem with check in, done in 3 minutes. You have to walk thru the casino to get to the guest elevators, but not bad because they have a smoke free walk way thru which was nice. You have to show your room key to the security guard near the elevators, just hold it up and keep going. The elevator area has 3 groups of 8 elevators. 1 group is floor 1-25, 1 group 25-36?, other 37?-50, so there was never waiting more than 20 seconds ever, and typically you were by your self because of 8 elevators for only your floors. Yes, the hall ways are long and we were the next to last room 31-736. The room was great, from the big bathroom to the extra sitting area, to the electric curtains. Our view was directly infront of treasure Island. They have the Sirens of TI nightly which you really could not see the detail of the actors but could hear the cannons some- but not enough to wake you or bother any at all. The bed was comfy, yes, table had some scratches, etc, but top notch. There is only a minibar refrigerator which is weighted. Also infront of the TV is boxes of nuts, candy, etc which are weighted . The front desk said if you pick up and it stays gone for over 20 seconds they will charge you, I picked up to boxes, replaced before I knew of the charge, but the front desk said it must not have been off long enough so was not charged. There is an ice machice down the hall room 31-710 which has its own door and the door closed quietly, so I don't think even if you were near it it would bother you. The floors all around inside and out were very clean. There is a Walgreens attached to the lower left side(when you walk out the front entrance) outside of the hotel which is 24 hours. We went there the first night, got water, cokes, snacks and brought a collapsable cooler, filled it with Ice and it worked great because there ewas no refrigerator for you to use in room. The casino is very nice and not real crowded compared to others we visited and not near as smokey. If you like to smoke Bally's, treaseure Island, is for you. We went to the Jubille show which was ok, but the theater smelled like smoke which if you had a breathing problem, you could not stay in ther thru the show-really-Compared to the other Casino, common area, the Palazzo is so much nicer, the Venetian similiar , but not as nice . I would definately go back. There is a bridge at Walgreens that you can walk over to the treasure island and a bridge to the other side across the streeet to the Whyn. There is also 2 taxi stands to take 1 at front door, another at the lower level which is accessed going down the escalator in the main check in area and out side. We also rented a car from avis which is on site at the lower taxi stand outside of the Palazzo, which was great and flawless transaction. Also went to the canyon ranch Spa which was first class and would recommend. Please see my reviews of attractions we went to which I feel will help you choose what to see. We also used Presidential Limos for the trip to and from the airport. This went flawlessly. The driver was at the baggage claim area as described with my name on a sign. He helped us with our bags, went to the limo, opened a bottle of champ. and gave my wife a rose(just as described on their web site). On the way back we requested a 4:40am pick up, he showeed up at exactly 4:40am at the lower taxi area and we got to the airport without problems. If this is your first time in Vegas, this is the way to go and then rent a car from Avis onsite to go to the Hoover Dam, etc. and drop it off the day before you leave. We definately will stay her again and use the same services above. I hope this will help.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: Traveluver3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo for my sister's birthday and it is a beautiful hotel with a variety of clubs, bars and pools to keep guests entertained. Checking in and out was a long wait each time, and the woman who checked us in signed us up for the Suite package to include internet etc. even though I specifically requested to not include this feature. Billing issues aside, our stay was fabulous. Our room was stunning and comfortable and had a great view of the strip, not bad at all for the price! Room service was superb, each time we had a pleasant server. The furnishings are plush and luxurious and the beds are extremely comfortable. I would definitely stay here again considering how it is conveniently located on the strip and we loved our room.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: roddney
Reviews.Content: we go to vegas every year this time we s stayed at the palazzo we had to call out the maintenace man three times security bolt on the front door falling off remote curtains not working blocked toilet room dusty chipped wall units couldnt open safe not a five stare hotel any more felt very let down

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: JNP06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo at the end of September. Our room was a Prestige Siena Suite (1280 square feet). It was really nice; it had a foyer area, living area with a table, powder room off the foyer area, bedroom and bath. The bedroom had a king bed with a separate dressing area and closet area. The bath had a nice shower, separate tub and separate vanities. We were on the "prestige" level, which meant we got a few perks. There was a separate check-in for prestige level guests and a complimentary cocktail reception every evening from 4ish-6ish. There were some other things but I can't remember what they were. I'm not sure on the cost of the room because my husband bought a package deal through Expedia for the airfare and hotel combined. If my memory serves me correctly, I think this room is around $700 a night. It is expensive but worth it if you have the money to spend on a room. If you are looking for a nice place to sleep for a few hours then get a cheaper room. It was very nice but I don't know that it was worth $700 bucks/night. We weren't in the room much, so a less expensive room would have done just as well. That said, it was a beautiful room, great service, great experience. Plus, the casino is not so crowded like the Bellagio. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palazzo for 12 nights in August 2010. I had stayed at Palazzo and Venetian several times over the years and always have a super time. A couple of those reviews are posted here. I like the Venetian poker room and that's the main reason I choose this complex (convenient). I admit that I'm not real picky but I can't understand some of the complaints about this beautiful hotel. Most of the staff is helpful and pleasant, the housekeeping girls try to please and the casino is huge. The Grazie club is one of the best on the strip. I used the gym and spa several times this trip and it has one of the most upscale wet areas I have ever seen. Saw Jersey Boys and it was fantastic. Paid extra for seats near the front and worth every dollar. One of the best shows I've seen - and I've seen many. Also saw Phantom with comped Grazie tickets -- great show! Vegas is hot in August so didn't get out too much except to the Wynn and mall a couple of times and down to Harrahs for their table games. Also hung out at the "M" in Henderson one day. All in all, a good trip. Even brought back some money!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was”
Reviews.Author: BusyBie
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Palazzo since it opened, 3 sometimes 4 times each year. We always stay Concierge level (now called Prestige). Whilst the rooms, level of service in the lounge etc remains the same high standard and the staff there are fantastic, the rest of the resort we found to be just 'not our style anymore'. However, you have the perfect figure, a loud mouth, plastic surgery and set of veneers resembling the keys on a piano and generally consider yourself to be something special or one of the 'beautiful people', you will love it, if not dont bother.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yoyoyo300
Reviews.Content: This place is amazingly beautiful and elegant and if you're looking for a great night life this is one of the hotels to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning but they really get you on the price of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Live4it
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 stars no doubt! the rooms are not your standard hotel rooms. You get a sunken living room, a huge full piece en suite with flat screen tv. In total there are 3 flat screens per room, and there are even electronic drapes. The place is gorgeous. But you do pay a heftier price. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes and the pool is wonderful too with plenty of chairs and not to mention comfy ones too. the only bad thing I can say is how expensive everything is. they charge you a resort fee per night of $18 which adds up. And if you order even a coke it is going to cost you $4 by the pool. i think that is just too over priced. A drink by the pool is $12. Most restaurant are very pricey, but thankfully there is the Grand Lux cafe which is just down from the elevators in the casino, and they have great breakfast lunch and dinner at normal (fair) prices, thank god!! So bottom line is this place is great, but just be prepared to spend a lot. The mini bar is the craziest rip off i have ever seen in my life! But it is so far the nicest hotel i have stayed at in Las Vegas. I would definitely go back, but will look for a better deal next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canes72
Reviews.Content: First time staying at The Palazzo and I fell in love with the place! :) I arrived around noon and my room was ready. I had a room on the 40th floor with a nice view of the Wynn pools and golf course and mountains. The room was fabulous! It was modern, spacious and the beds were very comfortable. I liked the vanity table and remote controlled blinds! Jersey Boys was phenomenal. I had the cheap seats and since I was alone, the usher moved me to the second row!! Thanks!! That was a highlight of the trip to be so close to the stage! Lots of bars, restaurants to choose from between Palazzo and Venetian. I didn't leave the hotel much since it was August and very hot! But I had been to Vegas before so didn't care. I enjoyed the pools and Canyon Ranch Spa. I went to the spa 3 times in 5 days!! My last day I was able to pay the daily hotel rate and have my room until 6pm since my flight wasn't until 10. That was worth it. Overall, I would definitely return to the Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: robl158
Reviews.Content: Found the checking in and out was a breeze we came in and there was no line ups. I told them we were to receive vochers which they gave us no questions asked and upgraded the room so we had a view of the vegas strip as well. Very large suites and found no problems with aging of the rooms or anything else all was good from what we experienced. Only thing you dont want to do is use anything from the fridge or take anything from the snack service in the room as they are on sensors and you will be charged if you lift them off the holders they are in. Thought it was petty to have a fridge in the room and you cant use it as they have there goods they sell in the fridge but other than these small items the stay was great rooms were always clean and we had a lot of fun at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some people have the worst luck in the world......................................”
Reviews.Author: chavilicious
Reviews.Content: Not me! I cannot fathom why people would give this place a bad review. Ok, if you were robbed by house keeping, I understand. Other than that, step down off your high horse and enjoy your vacation. I have been many places and stayed at many properties Vegas and beyond (4 to 5 stars). The Venitian was my favorite until now. The Palazzo was fabulous- and let me tell you why. Originally, I had one night booked at the Bellagio, but I ended up cancling and I'm glad I did. The single thing that makes this property different is the fact that the standard room is a suite and is freakishly HUGE! Sure you can get a suite at the Bellagio, but you will pay an arm and leg for it. Also, the property is NEW. I appreciate "old world charm" and "classic style" like the next person. But, I don't think the Bellagio should be charging $300 a night and I'm still watching old school "fat back" televisions. Not at the Palazzo, 3, count em, 3 FLAT screen HD tvs: one in the bedroom, living room and bathroom (that's right bathroom)! That being said, the review. Check in- Smooth as can be (and early)! The line was long, but I STILL only waited maybe 15 minuites tops, due to all the agents availiable. My room was on the 49th floor with an outstanding view of the strip at my request. Room- what can i say huge, lovely, relaxing. I was traveling with two girlfriends, when they left, i actually felt like the room was too big, The bathroom was well lit and gorgeous, the shower and the toilet was seperate. Everything was clean. The houskeeping staff was friendly and professional. When I called t the front desk for anythng, it was brought immediately. Any abundance of toiletries were provided without request based on the women in the room. Bathrobes and slippers (realLY?) We used the pools at the Venitian and went to TAO Beach awsome! It was a Tuesday, so on a crowded day it would problably be a pain in the ***- or more expensive. Shopping and dining- Shopping was bananas! There is a mall right in the Palazzo with a lot o great shops BeBe, Barney's etc. The Grand Lux Cafe is the greatest for inexpensive early or late nite dining. The menu is like 18 pages lol. They have one at the Venitian too which is 24hrs. Dos Comos, the Mexican resturant is fantastic! The open face shrimp quesidillas melt in your mouth. Go to Madame Tussauds Wax Museum- it was a blast! Didn't think I would enjoy it as much as I did. Casino- it was a nice size; but still intimate and not smoky- loved it. The pit bosses were a little snooty, but no biggie. Misc- I was on the 49th floor, and it never took more than a few second to get to my floor, no waiting for elevators, that was amazing to me :) Summary- I'm a little torn, I'm one of those people who like to try someplace different when i travel, but I will definately be staying at the Palazzo on my next trip to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: 4ever-us-1106
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a very intriguing hotel resort! The rooms are very spacious and tastefully decorated....the bathroom, itself is beyond belief. The excellent service and security provided by the hotel staff made our stay extra special. For an extra fee you can request a scenic view of the Las Vegas strip. However, my spouse and I did not take advantage of the strip view, nonetheless, the view was still breathtaking with the expanse of the mountains surrounding the desert in the background. The Palazzo and the Venetian Hotel are adjoined and share many wonderful shops, resturants, and not to mention, a Venetian scene with Gondola rides, and a simulated sky with moving clouds. Words cannot describe the elaborate taste of this hotel, you would have to see it for yourself. My spouse and I are looking forward to our next trip to Las Vegas and we would stay nowhere else but at the fabulous Palazzo Hotel and Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Covered all the bases and then some...”
Reviews.Author: kimmiser
Reviews.Content: We met some family and friends in Las Vegas for a week this August. The Palazzo was excellent. The room was large and sapcious and easily accomodated our family of 5 (2 adults and 3 children 8,10,11) the kids loved the pool area and the resturants and shops were nearby and easily accessible from our room. We saw Blue Man Group and our kids loved the show. In fact, we never left the hotel for 3 days until someone said we should check out "the strip" and go see some sights. From our room we could see Treasure Island and the kids loved to watch the pirate show from the windows. I would definately stay at the Palazzo again and again and again. The beds were very comfy and there is a tv in the bathroom so you can watch from the huge bathtub. Nice hotel for both adults and kids alike.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel with huge rooms!! more square foot for your dollars here”
Reviews.Author: Chets_9
Reviews.Content: the hotel is magnificent and is grand in every way. the rooms are large and stylish, the bathrooms are huge, makes you feel royal. the hotel has great shopping attached to it. good restaurants like sushi samba in the shopping area. tao a vegas legend is a few mins walk through the shopping area into the venetian. the pool area is nicely done. the casino floor is more open and much better in my opinion that the wynn. you feel more comfortable gambling here as its got energy and buzz. got a great deal on the hotel website as well, would come back and stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever”
Reviews.Author: ustwo2
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to celebrate my 50th birthday and also my husbands birthday as our birthdays are 2 days apart. We booked with Virgin and we got complimentary entry to the V Room which was excellent, food, service and setting. The 10 hr flight was very comfortable and service and entertainment was excellent. It was our first time in Las Vegas and we were slightly sceptical especailly after reading some of the reviews but we need not have worried as it surpassed all our expectations. The Pallazo was a fab place to stay, we had a suite on 42 floor with fantastic views of the strip and a full view of the show at the Treasure Island. The staff were very helpful, friendly and very prompt, they were all lovely. We walked the lenght of the strip and found that there was a vast contrast on both ends. The end of the strip that starts at Circus Circus is old and tired and like Blackpool, UK on a bigger scale, its dirty and completely run down. The other end is the lap of luxury and the Pallazo is simply fantastic. We stayed for 5 nights and packed a lot in, highlights were the sunset tour of the grand canyon, limo pick up, helicopter to canyon, champagne picnic in the canyon and then ride over the strip at night, truly amazing. We had VIP seats at the Jersey Boys show which was a fantastic show, would recommend 100%. The gondala ride at the Venetian was really good, we rode outside as there is also an indoor area. The dolphins at the Secret Gardens at the Mirage was a lovely experience. We had a night a Freemont Street which was very entertaining. Breakfast buffet at the Bellagio is the best ever and reasonably priced, you will be full for the day. Zine restaurant at the Pallazo was excellent and also the Italian at the Fashion Show Mall. A visit to see Big Elvis at Bills Gambling Hall is a must, free show and cheap beer. We didnt have time to gamble except for 10 minutes on the slots, won nothing! All in all a fantastic place to visit and would thoroughly recommend a stay at the Pallazo.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Fun, Good Value and Great Room Service”
Reviews.Author: jfuller77
Reviews.Content: Loved the Palazzo! Great location on the strip close to shopping and the staff were all very friendly. The check in was smooth and they upgraded us to a strip view room which was sweet. We overlooked the pool and the strip. Great added entertainment being able to watch fireworks etc right from your room at night, We ordered a lot of room service since we were hungover and it was awesome! Lavo was also very good in the hotel as was the Mexican place inside as well. Book early if you want to watch football at Lagasse's Stadium. It was jam packed sold out. The casino was OK. But in my opinion they're all pretty generic. Beds were awesomely comfortable, rooms are HUGE for a standrad King Suite. TV's are abundant and the entire place is very clean and modern. The attached shopping was my savior. Husband in the Casino me at Barney's NY. Couldn't ask for a better marriage there. Loved it. Would likely stay again. Tao was also a must do for dining!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Opulent yet Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mistercy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo with my one year old and my wife, who was in town for a conference. We stayed for four nights from Sept. 27th, 2010 to October 1, 2010. Overall, we were highly impressed by the hotel, the service, and the amenities available. Arrival: We took a shuttle from the airport. The shuttles are run by Executive Shuttles from gate 8. It is $6 per person each way, and transports you directly to the Venetian and Palazzo. One note is that the shuttle will stay at the airport until it fills up with passengers, so I hope you are not the first one on the shuttle. BTW, the return shuttle leaves on the hour from a side entrance. Check In: We had booked the Palazzo with a package that gave us preferred check in. I would highly recommend booking directly through the hotel with their package deals if you are staying weekdays, as these have a lot of bonuses. Our package gave us $30 food credit daily, a suite upgrade, and $50 towards the spa, as well as some casino credit - not bad for $139 a night. We also had preferred check in, which helped us to get our room for an early arrival. We brought our 1 yr old with us, so we were able to get a minifridge and crib added to the room, and the snacks from the room removed. Normally, they charge $20 to get the snacks removed, but they comped us that fee, since all the snacks are on sensors, and with a toddler, we would have been charged regularly. The whole hotel smells good - we found the spray scent they use pleasant, unlike some of the musty or smoke filled places in Las Vegas. Room: Our room was a Deluxe King, which is their standard room. Their standard room is HUGE! The living room gave the little one plenty of room to roam, which was a huge bonus for us. There was a comfortable couch, and a leather coffeetable/ottoman area ideal for putting your feet on. We had a room on the 42nd floor with a perfect view of the Treasure Island and Mirage evening shows. Our daughter loved to look out the window and exclaim, "ooh!" - her parents did, too! Each room also has a remote controlled curtain and shade - she had fun playing with that remote as well. There were flatscreens in the living room, bedroom, and bathroom. ESPN while showering is a new guilty pleasure! The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The bed and sheets were excellent. On the downside, the shower was not very powerful, there is no coffeemaker in the room, and the seperate room for the toilet was poorly lit. There is a daily resort fee, which gave us internet and pool access, but we never received the daily newspaper that is supposed to come for that fee. Dining: Most of the restaurants in this hotel are in the overly expensive area - if you are willing to pay $200 for a world class steak, you have come to the right place. This is not our preference, however. One restaurant, the Grand Lux Cafe, had excellent food at reasonable prices. Their breakfast buffet each morning was filled with healthy and not so healthy options. We went there for dinners and lunches as well, and were never disappointed. Many meals and desserts are gargantuan sized - we would often split the salads, for instance. Grand Lux is based off of Cheesecake Factory, but the meals are higher in quality and slightly pricier. Service was excellent, and there are tons of choices for your meal. They are the one restaurant in the Palazzo that will do takeout as well. Pool: There are multiple pools in the complex between the Venetian and the Palazzo. Most of them do not get sun until about 11am. It was warm and sunny while we were in Las Vegas, not surprisingly. The pool we were in had side sections that were only one and a half feet deep - perfect for lounge chairs and toddling children with toys. Being out of direct sunlight until the afternoon was an unexpected bonus for us. Sun lovers could head to the Venetian for late morning sun. Spa: My wife went to the spa for a massage and facial. She felt the quality of the massage and facial were only average at best, were overpriced, and the receptionist staff within the spa were rude and snooty. They made a big fuss over accepting the promo coupon from the Palazzo, whcih definitely did not make for a relaxing experience. Supposedly, Canyon Ranch is one of the top spas in the world, but it did not come close to meeting those expectations. Casino: What makes the Palazzo special is that even thought the casino area is one of the largest, it does not feel large. The whole place, despite being made to feel luxurious, still retained a comfortable, cozy feel. This is very different that the feel within the Venetian, where you feel like there are slot machines crammed everywhere. If you do gamble, make sure to get in on the Grazie program and the Pocket Casino concepts to get comps. Overall, I would highly recommend the Palazzo, and would return. Having been at other Vegas properties, the Palazzo is definitely a high quality facility.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winther
Reviews.Content: We love The Bellagio but because we went through Priceline this time, we ended up at The Palazzo. I do not understand how some can rate The Palazzo as low as they do. This is a beautiful hotel with big rooms, fast check in and good service. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, with the Bella View Prestige package”
Reviews.Author: Googleland
Reviews.Content: The rooms are gorgeous, the bathrooms huge, the beds ultra-comfortable, the free, easy-to-access WfFi is great. I reserved through the Palazzo's own website where I think the offers were as good or better than through intermediaries. I booked a two-night stay in a Bella suite with a view of the Strip (I had to ask when we checked in), and I paid the extra amount for the "Prestige" option which was more than returned in the "extras" we enjoyed. Specifically, we had access to the Prestige Lounge on the 23rd floor, where we had a very complete breakfast each morning (hard-boiled eggs, no hot food, but lots of fruit, breads, pastries, yogurt, etc.); coffee and tee in mid-afternoon; free cocktails and snacks in the early evening; and desserts from 7 to 8 pm. We enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and NOT having to find a cafe/restaurant for each meal/snack. One of the perks of the Prestige package is being able to register on the 23rd floor, instead of in the main lobby. Somehow this was not pointed out in the confirmation I received, and so we missed a useful service. So be sure to get details of what is included in your package, and how to obtain each perk. My one quibble is that there is no good excuse for leaving piles of linens in the hallway for hours, in a hotel that has 24-hour housekeeping serve. Our room was made up in mid-afternoon the second day, at our request. When we returned at 11 pm, the pile of linen was in the hallway; and next door was another pile of linen and the remains of a room-service meal. The surprise was that all this detritus was STILL there ten hours later.

Reviews.Title: “Place is awesome! rooms are huge! Very upscale”
Reviews.Author: Enfinite5
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at luxor, MGM, Rio, and caesars palace...But I think this is my favorite. First off the standard rooms are the biggest Ive ever come across and a very good price, there amazing! hotel and rooms are very Upscale, great food, although there are no food courts only high end resturants. I would say this is an adult hotel, dont even bother bringing kids here. Overall Great stay, blew away my expectations. 100% gonna stay here, not to mention great location on the strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of the strip...”
Reviews.Author: MrHao
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is easily one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Check-in was a breeze - 5 minutes tops. This in a town where its not uncommon to wait in line for 30 minutes or longer just to speak to a reception agent. The room itself was gorgeous. Basically the same layout as the suites in the Venetian, but newer and "fresher." Everything was very nicely appointed, the TV was big, HD, and many of the channels were HD. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. Gratis valet parking. Friendly and knowledgeable concierge service. Fantastic pool(s). Between this and the Venetian (which it adjoins) there are a multitude of outstanding restaurants. The nightclub's the only thing I wasn't really a fan of. Lavo's really just an excuse to charge for exorbitant table service. Its a tiny club, lined on all sides with roped off tiny tables (swarmed by desperately-wanting-to-be-cool 20-somethings) and a crowded dance floor. But the go-go dancers are a nice touch. Also stayed at The Venetian itself on this trip, and would choose the Palazzo between the two hands down. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie17
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. Decor was very beautiful in lobby. Rooms were suites. Nice. I thought the beds were comfy. Connected to the Venetian, so it is easy to go back and forth. Shops were high end, but nice to browse. Casino was easy to navigate, not as big as some of the other hotel casinos. I was really disappointed in the cleanliness of the rooms. The housekeeping people were very nice, but the room felt a bit unclean...counter tops, carpet. Colleagues were disappointed there was no coffee maker in room....and the coffee shops seemed always to be crowded in the morning when we were running to our business sessions... Grand Cafe Lux was the best place to eat, along with the food court at the Venetian. Be prepared to spend a few bucks on food and drinks. It wasn't a bad stay. However, I probably wouldn't stay there again, except for business.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: LaLaRN
Reviews.Content: I came to the Palazzo for a convention. My flight was a late flight, so I called the hotel to make sure I would get my king non-smoking suite, as I had already paid a night's deposit. I was assured on the phone the late check in would be "no problem". Well thanks to Delta and a 90 minute wait for our luggage, we got to the hotel after midnight. When we went to check in, we were told "unfortunately, we don't have any king non-smoking suites". The original clerk checking us in was pleasant enough but the "manager" she brought out when we were not understanding how this could happen was extremely hostile and rude. In all my extensive travel, it was the worst check in experience I have EVER had. The manager tried to say she'd "upgrade" us to a king the next day...the king we had reserved, and already paid a deposit on! They told us there wasn't a single king suite available the night we arrived. Right. So we went to the queen suite for the night, and it was 78 uncomfortable degrees...and we couldn't adjust the thermostat! So a very u restful, hot night. They did move our luggage to our new king suite later that day. The room we should have had from the start was very nice, and everything was functional. We avoided touching anything in the fridge, thanks to previous trip advisor reviews warning us of the exorbitant prices of those items. It was a bummer there is no fridge that is useable for water or leftovers. When we went to use the TV check out system it was 11:00am and they had turned off cable in the room, so we could not check out that way. We had to call downstairs, and spent almost 15 minutes on the phone. Lastly, the room was clean, but the hotel areas had some inconsistencies. For instance, there was a bag of linen blocking the hall for almost 24 hours, even as the hotel staff walked around it. Overall it could have been a much better experience

Reviews.Title: “Great week's stay.”
Reviews.Author: KimmyCustard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Sept '10 after seeing the hotel being built in '07. It didnt disappoint, beautiful inside, arrived at 11am and was 3rd in the line to check in. All done efficiently and bags arrived at our room straight away. Rooms are very comfy, roomy and the bathroom is huge with a great range of products. Yes the sofa was looking a little worn but who inspects the furniture on their holiday?? Beds were very comfy also and husband loved the 3 tvs. Maintenance arrived promptly when I pulled the shower lever round and it came off in my hand, looked like this had happened before but was fixed with no problem. The security asked to see our room cards every time we went past to the lifts but we didnt have any problem with this, I would rather guests are let through to the rooms than strangers that then burgle my room! Would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: gnd
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Palazzo in mid September. Really quick thoughts are that the property is great. I maybe waited 5 minutes in line to check in. The room I had on the 41st floor was great, Large room, very clean and a partial view of the Strip and the mountains. My room was right around the corner from the elevator, but heard no moise from it at all. Pool area was nice and relaxing and not blareing loud pop music like many of the other places on the strip. I noticed that every now and then, two employees would be walking around handing out Orange slices to people laying out by the pool. The best thing about the pool, is that you do not have to go through the casino to get to it. NIce assortment of restaurants in all price ranges to choose from. The fact that it it connected to the Venetian is also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here ... not sure what others are doing...”
Reviews.Author: Azgators
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a little rendezvous with family. We had no problems whatsoever, so we can't relate to the issues other people had. We arrived around 1pm on a Tuesday to find no line at all for checkin, in fact we got to take our pick from all the smiling faces. The gal at the desk let us know that a room was available for early checkin which was nice. Since we booked on Priceline we had to pay the $17/day resort fee which gives you access to the internet in your room and to the gym and pool. No option to refuse was given as previously noted. The room: As usual with Priceline you don't get a great room, all the rooms are pretty much the same here. HUGE!! (family members stayed at the Encore, and their room was half the size of ours and twice the price) We didn't get a room with a view of the strip, but so what, I've seen the strip. The room we got was at the end of the hall so no slamming doors were heard, nor any walking drunks in the night. The bathroom was awesome (same as all the 5 stars though, tub, walkin shower, seperate toilet room, two sinks). 3 tv's in the room is nice to have too. The bed was very comfortable, and we checked for bed bugs, none found, and its been 5 days since we are home, none found. The keys to the room worked everytime, one hint, it beeps then open...haha. There is a remote for the blinds, very cool touch. Don't know about the restaurants here since we were elsewhere to eat (the buffett at the Wynn/Encore is great especially the desserts). The shopping in the Palazzo and Venetian is top notch, if you can't find what you need go across the street to the Fashion Mall, or down the way to Caesars' Forum Shops. Did some gambling here, nice, almost too nice. Not the place for the rowdy crowd, so if thats your thing then its a good place. A few hints: There is a Walgreens on the strip street level in front of the Palazzo, go there to save a ton of money on water and other goodies. Do NOT take one of those cheesy buses from the airport to get to the hotel. They cost more for two people then a cab does, not to mention the hour and half it took to get to the hotel versus the 10 minutes for a cab. Ouch. I don't go to Vegas for the hotel room, but was very happy that we ended up at this one. I wouldn't pay full price for this place (or any) but enjoy getting it on Priceline ...fun fun

Reviews.Title: “Management needs to pay attention to the details”
Reviews.Author: tiggerm
Reviews.Content: Arrived Monday around 11:30 to a very long check in line. Waited approx 30 min for check in and no rooms clean so we checked baggage and was told we get a call. Went grab a bite by the time we done room was ready. By the time I got to room luggage was there. Great!!! Started putting stuff away and went to lock all our show tickets and safe would not work. Called for it to be fixed and was told 15 min. So we waited aprrox 25 min later no one so I called again first the phone just rang and rang then someone answered I questioned how mutch longer and was put on hold another 10 mins then the recording stoped and was hung up on. Called back again and phone rang and rang got another person on phone who told me to hold. I explained I have already done that and they hung up on me. So she told me she wouldnt put me on hold she just called the department and got right back on the phone with me. she told me the person was just getting to my floor and hung up.. No sorry no nothing. Later that evening we were leaving hotel for dinner and I decided to stop at front desk and put in a complaint. Was told I that they were busy at the time and thats why my call was hung up on. Manager on duty still didnt appologize just kind of gave me a look like what do you want. I hope management pays attention to these details loved the pool and the room but the Customer Service is very laxed at best and needs to be given a refresher course.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel The Palazzo Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Benzi07
Reviews.Content: Bought upgrade to Prestige, the hotel was confrontational in many aspects, the continued inspection of guest cards/keys everywhere you went became tedious and tiresome. Prestige allowed private pool access, that's not true pool area closed Monday to Friday, private pool access denied and when open on weekends the security deny entry with identification ie: Passport/driver license, again confrontational and inconvenient. One case I was asked for ID for Azure pool entry as there was alcohol served in this area as well as all other areas do not know why all the fuss, I did not have my passport so I was refused entry by a young aggressive security person, the director of marketing was then summoned he said he would gain me entry if I was to book a cabana with a minimum spend of $400 (US) i declined saying that was extorting money out of me. Confused message ring throughout the stay, some concierge say you dont need keys to gain access to pools and they say there is a minimum spend of $50 per private pool area infact they say up to $500. Rooms were left uncleaned for up to two days clearly frustrating and not expected in Prestige clients. Management pride themselves on service well that is not one bit true the service is very relaxed and inconsistent I highly recommend that one does not stay a the Palazzo or Venetian Hotel groups, the nightlife and retail shopping is sound but the hotels are pool and do not present service and value for money, there are far greater Hotels within an arms throwing distance, ie: Paris Hotel, third of the price and far better amenities and services than the Palazzo/Venetian. I STRONGLY advise that the PALAZZO IS A VERY POOR AND UNWISE CHOICE OF HOTEL to stay in whilest in the exciting and vibrant Las Vegas city, it will leave a sour taste in your mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Points & Rewards are pathetic”
Reviews.Author: KitcnenerGamblinman
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for the 1st time and stayed at the Polazzo for 7 days. While the hotel itself is beautiful, the Grazie points & Rewards can only be described at pathetic. We were told by 2 cab drivers & staff at the Golden Nugget that the Polazzo is known to be cheap. We do better back home in Ontario at our Charity Casinos, I was especially offended by the Club Grazie staff who seem to look down their nose at you if you ask for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “STILL........a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom43302
Reviews.Content: Third time at Palazzo and I still love the place. A wonderful hotel and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more, got less...”
Reviews.Author: tennesseine
Reviews.Content: Since I won enough money in their casino to pay for the trip, I guess I shouldn't complain too loudly, but I must say I was disappointed in the Palazzo. I had high expectations of this Venetian/Palazzo brand. And if it were a lower class hotel, the little things wouldn't have bothered me. But the difference between bad and great at this level of accommodation, all comes down to the little things. Every hotel of this caliber gets the obvious stuff right. Some examples off the top of my head: -The hot/cold taps were reversed in one sink (but oddly, not the other). -The toiletries provided had caps that were almost impossible to remove with wet hands...and whose hands are dry when one is shampooing?! -They didn't think to add noise-dampening insulation around what I assume was an ice machine, so any room (like mine) within shouting distance of it heard a loud rumbling each time ice was dispensed. At least, I HOPE that was an ice machine...! If this were a Ramada Inn, I would be giving it five stars. But it's not. It's the Palazzo. They should get these things right.

Reviews.Title: “had no complaints, except...”
Reviews.Author: lovesvegaslongtime
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights at Palazzo (comped). The rooms are beautiful, well appointed and comfortable. My own opinion is that I like rooms at Venetian better, they seem a little more plush, but again that is my personal taste. The location is very good, there is a Walgreens near the driveway entrance which was very handy for picking up a couple of forgotten items. We also enjoyed breakfast at Dal Toro, which located on the lower level near the Valet. We ate on the outdoor veranda which is facing, but below the Boulevard and is quiet. Also, in the morning the sun hasn't come around yet and is quite pleasant. Hotel service was very good, including getting a maintenance man within 20 minutes of calling. Only real complaint is lack of quality toilet paper. I mean, I know everyone is trying to save a buck, but would it kill them to spend a few more cents a roll? I may provide my own next time but otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay but Don't Go for the Pool”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveller000
Reviews.Content: My partner and i wanted a long weekend extension of our summer. We picked the Palazzo for the room and the pool (shared with The Venecian). The room was not a disappointment! Large, in good shape, wonderful bed, sunken living room, and a fantastic bath. Quiet and incredibly comfortable. After some sightseeing (Hoover Dam) and shopping on our first day, we looked forward to some time by the pool to keep our tans going. After breakfast, we headed to the pool area only to find it almost completely i the shade! Learning that the sun doesn't hit the Palazzo pools until 1 pm, we searched for seats at the sunnier Venetian pool but found most occupied or "reserved" with towels, books, and sunblock. We crammed ouselves into a sunny spot and made the best of it. Day 2 we had the brilliant idea of hitting Azure, the paid area of the Palazzo pool which gets sun earlier in the day. Specifically asked for seats (which are assigned)with all day sun. After an hour we were in the shade. Asked the 3 staff just standing and chatting at the entrance twice to be moved to obviously empty seats. Never happened. Left and found now sunny spots at the regular pool, and not one apology on our way out. If the Palazzo wants folks to pay extra, they may want to train their staff on guest service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Texas76
Reviews.Content: Just got back from three nights at The Palazzo. I have previously stayed at Venetian and Bellagio. Palazzo an Venetian are very comparable - nice, big rooms; very comfortable. Service we received was great. Check-in folks, housekeeping, casino personnel were all very nice. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE WITH GREAT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: crauto1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my weekend getaway. This was my second time staying at Palazzo and pretty much, just as great as the first! From checkin to checkout, everyone tries to make your stay wonderful. The rooms are sooo comfortable and spacious! Love the casino and the cocktail waitresses are the best in vegas! A great hotel with great ammenities! The Grand Luxe is always great food and smiling service!

Reviews.Title: “Is my love affair with Vegas over?”
Reviews.Author: MarkHooper
Reviews.Content: I`ve just returned from a 6 night stay at the Palazzo with my wife and have mixed views about the hotel and Vegas as a place to visit. My experience of the hotel was overall very positive in that the staff were extremely polite and attentive and especially so during check-in when I was given a high floor and strip view for no extra cost.The view of the city lights at night from 40 floors up is spectacular! I did mention during my on-line booking that we were a honeymooning couple and to their credit the Palazzo did respond. The room itself was excellent as it was extremely large and well appointed with 3 tv`s, a small dining table and even a fax/copier. The bathroom was expansive, with his & hers hand-basins and I have to say that watching tv while taking a shower was an indulgent pleasure. It would be easy to make the odd criticism of a less than perfectly clean corner sofa or the slightly fraying carpet but overall I was very impressed with the standard of the fittings and how quiet the room was. The room really was a peaceful and tranquil retreat from the madness that Vegas can be. One mistake I did make however was inspecting the luxury boxes of sweets and nibbles next to the lounge tv without realising that I was immediately being charged for them. They sit on a pressure sensitive pad and they are very expensive( I was however refunded in full by a very accomodating check-out clerk..another brownie point for the Palazzo!) For me, the only real but very important let-down was the pooldeck. When I arrived on the Wednesday afternoon I was informed by a guest in an elevator that ALL the pools in the resort,including the Venetian were closed until the Friday morning.This was confirmed to me at check-in when I later complained and I was FURIOUS! An event was apparently being conducted that meant that all 12 pools in the Palazzo, the Venetian and the Venezia were out-of-bounds to paying guests. When I did make my complaint the desk clerk did offerme a 50 dollar food credit and a free late check out which did go some way to calming me down. It would have been much more professional however to inform me of this event when I checked in. My issue with the Palazzo pool-deck, when it was available, was that the huge hotel tower casts a giant shadow across the pool deck and therefore early in the day everyone is crowded into one small sunny area. As the beds are jammed up against each other anyway, which is typical of Vegas hotels, the whole situation is quite claustrophobic. There is little shade and the cabanas are 500 dollars a day! Although the Palazzo boasts 7 pools, only one of them is of a decent size, the other 6 being almost ornamental. I feel that this aspect of the resort is a major let-down as I have stayed at the Mirage and Caesars Palace and their pools are massively sized with interesting features such as water fallsand rock pools. The Palazzo casino was excellent in that it never really felt crowded, cigarette smoke was pretty much non-existent and I was even served drinks as I played the slots, a benefit generally kept for the table gamblers. We saw the resident show, the Jersey Boys and really enjoyed it, the guy playing Frankie Valli had a fantastic voice. Tickets from Tix4Tnite near Dennys were well discounted but the seats were a bit far back for my liking. In closing, I have visited Vegas many times as it is one of my favourite places in the world, I love the buzz, the energy and all the many distractions and attractions, but I have to say that certain resorts such as the Mirage and Treasure Island, old favourites of mine are beginning to show their age. The other disappointment is that given the state of the world economy, many hotels are practically giving rooms away in the hope that guests will pay their way by gambling.This has resulted in Vegas attracting a certain social class that previously haven`t been able to afford to visit. I saw one of the Cirque de Soliel shows and a family brood numbering 2 adults and heaven knows how many kids were ruining the show running up and down the aisles and shouting during the performance. The Mexicans who flick pornographic cards in your face have returned with a vengeance and in general the streets and some of the hotels have become very tacky. My love affair with Vegas may be coming to an end and that is depressing. It will probably be a good few years before I return again if ever, but having said that,if you`ve never been, please try it, there really isn`t anywhere like it in the world. I hope this long meandering review proves useful to you. Regards, Mark.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every bit of the price!”
Reviews.Author: jd0620
Reviews.Content: There are so many options in Vegas as to where to stay. My husband and I had not been before and got opinions from everyone we knew. We opted to stay at the Palazzo. We wanted to see the Jersey Boys and got a pretty sweet deal with great seats and 2 nights in a great room. From the moment we walked in we were taken care of. The front desk and housekeeping were very friendly and helpful. The room had a wonderful view and was very spacious. We found everything very clean and well stocked with whatever you may have forgotten. I will agree with a previous poster that the water pressure is low in the shower, but that is really all we can complain about. The casino workers were friendly and nothing seemed scary. We did go to another casino at another hotel and IT was scary...

Reviews.Title: “It's what they don't clean...”
Reviews.Author: docbledsoe
