Reviews.Content: When I arrived, the minibar fridge had old takeout rotting in it. I reported it to the front desk and they assured me it would be handled. It was not. I later found, when removing the cushions on the pull out sofa, that the sofa was wasteland. wrappers, a bottle, a coastline of crumbs...I'd be shocked if it had ever been cleaned. To make matters worse, they fax/printer which is touted as a benefit of the high "resort fees" was out of cyan ink and would not print. What exactly does house keeping do here? Imagine paying minibar prices for items that have been sitting next to moldy food. When I asked for a fridge to be brought up I was offered a 25.00 a night rate for it. No thanks. I doubt they clean those either. Unlike MGM properties, Tropicana and the Wynn properties, you'll find their Twitter account is as unhelpful as the front desk and house keeping. I won't be back. The worst part is I had planned to propose to my girlfriend on a private Gondola ride on property. But after this poor treatment I refused to waste money here. Did it at Paris. Thanks for nothing Las Vegas Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fantastic view perfect location excellent pool”
Reviews.Author: travelwithaview
Reviews.Content: What else is there to say. I usually stay at the Encore but ended up here to be more central to the strip. I was very surprised as I had stayed at the Venetian once and was not impressed. The palazzo is only 3 years old I think also they have a really good gym. Might start saying here.

Reviews.Title: “5 star - upscale facility”
Reviews.Author: Slavio
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo and Venetian combined together (as they are combined in reality) create the biggest hotel in the world in terms of number of rooms. Therefore, there are some glitches like some light bulbs not working and water pressure being weak... Other than that, this hotel feels very upscale, not many children, great pool, great service, great social material and fantastic scent pumped through air conditioning system. Sign up for their Grazie card promotions - there are great deals these days. Got a room for $119 + resort fee + tax including $25 slot credit per person, 2 tickets for Phantom (each ticket worth $145!!) and some other discounts for hotel restaurants. Good places to eat in vegas: Wynn Buffet Stripburger Le Burger Brasserie California Pizza Kitchen (at the Mirage)

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo hotel Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pac4fan
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel with everything you need; including a mall!! Jersey Boys play in the hotel, great show!

Reviews.Title: “Palatial Palazzo!!”
Reviews.Author: NeilBelfastN/Ireland
Reviews.Content: 2nd stop on our recent retailer trip to the states , the Palazzo impresses from the minute you enter it, the check in area is gorgeous and gives a taste of what is in store for you in your suite, we had a twin queen suite which was very nice, with a view facing treasure island , my only problem was finding time to look out at the view. We only ate at the grand lux cafe , for breakfast both mornings, the grand lux was also very impressive both the decor and the food. We met for predinner drinks both nights at the champagne bar , nice champagne cocktails!! As regular visitors to las vegas I can say I will be back at the Palazzo real soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge rooms, very much worth the money”
Reviews.Author: susanabenavidez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my bf's birthday weekend and I am happy we did. The location is great to access the night clubs at the Wynn and Encore as well as the restaurants nearby. It's in the nicer side of the Vegas strip and the rooms are newer than the older hotels. The Canyon ranch Spa was just okay but for only $20 more to access it I can't complain. I didn't use the pools because they were super crowded and there wasn't any shade but maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Practically never the left the hotel”
Reviews.Author: healthmate13
Reviews.Content: Each time I go to the Palazzo it seems to get better and better. Checked in about midnight, some very minor issues with my room , and they fixed it right then and there, The Canyon Ranch spa is very good..The outdoor pool staff was excellent , and the restaurants as well. . Saw the Jersey boys which was fantastic. Peter Saide of the cast's performance was "TonY" worthy. The casino employees are friendly. Highly recommend to any Vegas traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: mrenert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 days at the Palazzo and loved it. The checkin was easy and the service excellent. The room was very large and well decorated. It was a little darker than my taste, but was very comfortable. The resort had everything you could ask for and were it anywhere but Las Vegas it would knock your socks off. The fact that it was attached to the Venetian Hotel added significantly to the experience because you had all the additional restaraunts available. We enjoyed Canaletto primarily because of the ambiance of being on "St. Marks" square. I used the pool area and the fitness room in the Canyon Ranch Spa and they were very nice. Beware, however, that they do charge and additional $19 "resort fee" whether you use these facilities or not . I was particularly impressed by the casino which was relatively smoke free and spacious. It never seemed crowded because they have designed it with lots of open space. The location is good as it is near the Fashion Mall (my wife likes to shop) and the Wynn, Treasure Island, and Mirage are fairly close. I have been to Las Vegas many times and location is more a personal preference as many people prefer to stay at the Flamingo Road or Tropicanas insersections with Las Vegas Blvd. Some also prefer downtown. Overall I would highly recommend the resort and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swooks
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Palazzo and , like the last stay, we had a great experience.. Check in was fast on Labor Day afternoon and the service was friendly and efficient. Our room was huge, quiet, spotless, very comfortable, and we had a partial strip view. Every hotel employee we encountered was very friendly and helpful. The restaurants are great and while drinks are expensive, no more so than any other upscale hotel on the strip. We spent a lot of time at the beautiful pool area and the only problem was the last day when the pool was closed for a private event. We were directed down a long corridor to the Venetian pool so it all worked out. I highly recommend the Palazzo and we will definitely choose to stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Palazzo..”
Reviews.Author: Jaymars1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a sunwing vacations tour from Toronto and we felt for the money we received excellent value. We arrived 10:30 am in the morning, however, our room was ready for us which was greatly appreciated. Many previous reviewers have commented on the rooms, we found it to be beautiful and clean and most important quiet. Locatiion was well within walking distance to all the sights along the strip, please bare in mind we love to walk. Shopping at the Palazzo varied to meet everyones tastes as did the restauant selection. I coud only fault the breakfast buffet which was very small compared to the Mirage, Bellagio or Wyn and did not include coffee or juices. We do not go to Vegas for the pool scene as I do not enjoy being crowded, however, the pool areas were beautiful and clean. We will return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS at Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: EB2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the labor day weekend and woke up Saturday morning with what turned out to be bedbug bites! After joking "Oh, I bet it's bedbugs," I came home and in the following days have been bitten again and even found 2 bugs on my couch. Thank you, Palazzo, for giving me the gift that keeps on giving: bedbugs. I now have to have the exterminator come and it is not cheap...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: Dennis-Kathy
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Palazzo. The room was spacious and our view of the city (not strip) was very nice. We really enjoyed the comfortable bed and mostly clean room. The night was fairly quiet except for slamming doors (the doors were very heavy and it was hard to not "slam" them, even if you tried). The amenities were inconsisent. My wife's parents stayed four doors down and we would get different coupons, toiletries and the like but overall the soaps and other items were high quality. Only 2 towels left in the bathroom. The bathroom was a little dirty (floor around toilet) but mostly pretty clean. Very spacious. It's hard to think of a huge hotel as "cozy" but this one was. The rooms were laid out so you aren't that far from the elevators which load you into the casino and straight across from registration. The Lagasse's sport book was awesome and the helpful staff helped an inexperienced gambler place bets on the Saints and Colorado Rockies (both won!!). Very nice setup for major sporting events. The casino is smaller and less frenetic. That worked for us but others may find it boring. Fear not. The Venetian casino was a different environment and a short indoor stroll away. The shops are very upscale but fun to browse. The access to the Venetian is awesome with the canals and fun restaurants. Overall we enjoyed our stay very much. I would recommend the Palazzo for those looking for fun and excitement but still want a good nights sleep in an upscale and fun environment.

Reviews.Title: “Could be one of the best hotels I stayed at”
Reviews.Author: BlackBoriken
Reviews.Content: I initally made reservations at the Venetian for my wife's birthday and upon checking in we were offered a discounted upgrade to stay at the Palazzo tower which mean that we would have a nicer view so we upgraded. The hotels are huge I stayed there for a week and I still had trouble sometimes finding my way around. Theres a smell like some sort of perfume that can be annoying but you get use to it. A very entertaining and lively atmosphere that as a New Yorker I never get tired of. Im not a gambling man, I only played the credit I was given as a bonus for upgrading so I cant really comment on the casino ( I know going to Vegas and I dont gamble). The design makes you feel as if your in an Italian village of sorts and I swear the ceiling that looks like the sky moves with me as I walk. The room itself was amazing, spacious, elegant, just awesome. The bed is one of the best beds I slept on. The climate control was perfect. The bathroom was spacious with a separate tub and shower. The shower had good pressure and there was a separate room for the toilet and even a phone for just in case. The view was worth it, not the best view of the strip but still worth it. Overall I definitely recommend. My only complaint is if/when I go to Vegas again I would want to stay at another hotel but I enjoyed staying at the Palazzo that I dont think I would go anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “You are much better off at the Encore.”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: PROS: Nice lobby, fun to walk around in the shops, fun atmosphere, the faux-Venice interior area is nicer than many of the other hotels’ interior areas. CONS: ridiculously long lines for checking in and out of the hotel, serious crowds in the elevators (but it was Friday night). "Suite" means the room has a couch in it, but the couch looked so gross I wouldn't sit on it. The bathroom was OK but the room looked sort of shabby – even in the dim lighting – it really looked like it had seen better days and did not look new or stylish. Looked like Hilton or Sheraton rooms. Rough towels, the bathroom supplies were not very nice... Basically I was not impressed. You are much better off at the Encore.

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay Was a Charm”
Reviews.Author: doremi1999
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Palazzo and we still love it. We have stayed in quite a few of the Vegas resorts, and so far this is definitely one of the best for us. We were assigned a room close to the elevator banks, so I was a bit concerned about noise, but after being there for six days, over the busy Labor Day weekend, we heard nothing. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and everything was in working order. We especially appreciated the multiple shower heads which were great for a sore back after a long day of walking. They also provide robes and lovely smelling shampoos, shower gels, lotions, and a travel kit. Coupons were also left on the vanity for the coffee shop on the second floor, along with a spa coupon. The casino is well laid out with a wide variety of slots and generous cocktail service if you would like a drink or need a bottled water. Security personnel were posted at the elevators on the casino and shopping levels to check keys. They do charge a $17 resort fee but it does cover wireless internet, newspaper that needs to be picked up in the second floor coffee shop, local and toll-free calls and access to the fitness center for two. The large pool as you first enter the pool complex is mostly shaded, so if you want sun in the morning, turn left for a sunnier area. For lunch, be sure to eat at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant near the pool, as it was very good and they gave us coupons for other dining establishments. We used the 20% coupon for our dinner at CUT which was much appreciated. We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience...”
Reviews.Author: MFCDBC
Reviews.Content: I always do a lot of research before I travel and I use TripAdvisor to help me make the right choice in places to stay. The Palazzo was recommended to me by a friend, but after reading some of the reviews, I wasn't sure about staying there. I decided to go with the majority, and reserved my room for five nights. After a long, late night flight, we arrived at the hotel very tired and dragging heavy luggage, fully expecting long lines for check-in. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked up to the check-in counter and were greeted by three smiling employees. Check-in was a breeze and all our questions were answered quickly and professionally. We were equally pleased when we opened the door to our luxury room to find everything clean and in order and with a view of Treasure Island and part of the Strip. The king size bed was wonderful and so comfortable! The bathroom is huge and the stand up shower is amazing! The room was spotlessly cleaned and we had fresh towels and facecloths each and every day. Our five days passed quickly, and it was time to leave. Check-out is 11:00am and our flight did not leave until 11:30pm, so we had a luggage issue. This proved to be no problem - the hotel eagerly agreed to store our luggage, free of charge, for the day. Retrieving our luggage later in the day was no problem either - only took about five minutes. I had read some reviews indicating that the rooms are showing some wear - well, considering thousands of guests pass through them each and every week of the year, it would be virtually impossible not to have a few nicks and scratches here and there. I found the service at this hotel to be exceptional and friendly. Overall, I found the Palazzo to be everything and more than I expected it to be. I will definitely find my way back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: miniwalt
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed a Wednesday and Thursday night. We'd stay here again. We feel the rooms are a good value. We pad an extra $30 a night, totaling $169.00 for a strip view and asked for high up. We we're looking down on the Treasure Island and a bit further, The Mirage. Both TI pirate show and Mirage volcano could be seen. We particularly enjoyed the pools. There were 4 open, the other three are part of the Azure area, which is not opened weekdays. The lounges in the pool were very relaxing and provided a great way to cool off. We never had a problem finding a couple open lounges. We are not gamblers, but the casino always seemed moderately busy, much more so than the Wynn resorts across the street. I think this may have to do with the amount of walking the masses must endure to get to a casino. Had dinner at Lavo. It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: myboo
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps my third stay at this hotel and I enjoyed it once again. The hotel is quite elegant with its Italian-themed decor, and I particularly appreciate the high ceilings in the casino area - gives everything more of a bright, open feel versus the cave-like dark settings of most of the casinos in LV. The highlight of the hotel are the spacious rooms which are more like suites. The 'regular' room there is extra-large with a sunken living room, three TVs, great bathroom with double sink, soaking tub and separate shower (I love the bathroom). Best of all it was quiet!!!! The hotel was particularly crazy/busy since I was there over the Labor Day weekend holiday - but, once in the room, it was complete bliss. We slept great! The other great thing about the Palazzo is the shopping options - without leaving the Palazzo/Venetian complex, there are myriad stores for hours of exploring - this and endless options for dining. I do agree w/other reviews that the rooms are starting to show a bit of wear and tear - hopefully the hotel will attend to this in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: BlueRTA
Reviews.Content: We spent an entire week at the Palazzo in a Luxury View suite. This room was a good value as we paid under $200 per night on average and received a daily dining credit. The room was very large, with high ceilings and an awesome view of the strip from near the top of the hotel. Everything was clean and comfortable. The hotel has coffee shops at the base of the elevators on the 1st and 2nd floor which is a big plus, as you do not have to go through the casino to get coffee. Furthermore there is a Walgreen's at the base of the hotel ... close enough to bring items back to the room. If you enter the parking garage from Sands Ave (not the Strip), it is easy to park near the elevators to the rooms as well. The hotel compared favorably to other luxury properties and the selection of restaurants was excellent. The spa featured a great fitness center (use included in the resort fee). Both the Venetian and Palazzo pools are accessible from the pool deck, so it is easy to find sun at any time of day. Room service was also nice, we ordered breakfast and were happy. It is worth noting that everything in the hotel other than the rooms is fairly expensive, but that's what I expected from a resort of this nature. All in all a great hotel and would definitely like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great.Palazzo airport shuttle was awful.”
Reviews.Author: jamesfelonk
Reviews.Content: Our stay at palazzo was very enjoyable.Fast check in,maid service good,nice staff.But the palazzo airport shuttle was the pits.No air conditioning on this shuttle ride to the airport in 108 degree heat was just brutal.I could not understand how the driver could even stand this hot box. At least 1 open window would have been better than nothing at all.If palazzo has anything at all to do with this service they need to address this problem.DO NOT TAKE THIS SHUTTLE! If you do,good luck!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best luxury hotel in vegas (& we've stayed in a lot of vegas hotels)”
Reviews.Author: msschark
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a package deal for the Prestige Suites...we can't do Vegas any other way now. Limo to and from the airport, champagne in our luxurious suite, complimentary breakfast, open bar and appetizers, dessert and snacks during the day. From the beautifully appointed rooms to the elegant casino, if you are looking for a high end hotel, this is the one. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty, and the Canyon Ranch spa was fantastic. If you have the budget, I highly recommend splurging on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay while in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Travelcouple2
Reviews.Content: This all suite hotel was very nice. The rooms are huge and comfortable. We are non-smokers and there was no hint of smoke on our floor which was nice. Also the casino and shopping area was a lot less smokey than a lot of others. While we enjoyed our stay, next time we will try the Encore as we liked the entire property better. For us it was very confusing to get around in the Palazzo, but the staff was very helpful and friendly. The pools/spa and surrounding area was the best part, very nice. The hotel was very quiet on the 18th floor were we stayed. Join the grazie slot club for extra benefits. There is also a +$20 resort fee. But it does include your wireless internet if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, not worth it !”
Reviews.Author: Rania48
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this trip, and all I can say I was very dissapointed in the service received ..............also the rooms are not very clean. Shower pressure is very low , that i had to use the tub rinse off some soap. This is a rip off hotel , & front desk do not care. Very ignorant. Stay @ Wynn or Aria this is more worth ur money & time !!!!!!!!!!!! BELIEVE ME!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: LGrove5
Reviews.Content: Travelled with our teenage daughter. We got a 2-Queen Suite which was perfect for the three of us. Good Strip location if you want to avoid large crowds like around Paris/Harrah's. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were very quiet even though we faced the street on the 17th floor. Great shower with lots of pressure. Nits: Mini fridge is full so full of liquor and drinks for purchase that you can't still your own water/soda to keep cold. Also watch out that everything in the fridge and on top of it is on pressure sensors so you don't want to even touch things. Housekeeping tipped on of the bottled waters and our room was charged 5 bucks - fortuneately we caught it at checkout and charge was removed. If you don't like Phantom of the Opera or The Four Seasons then you'll suffer in the elevators because they are promoting these shows. Pros: All rooms are suites, sign up for their email list for great deals (not as cheap as some other hotels, but great value for what you get). Grand Canal area is fun for everyone. There is a Walgreens very close by to pick up bottled water and other items. There is also an Avis desk so you can save money on a rental if you take a cab or shuttle from the airport and pick up the car at the hotel the next day (because of the day rental and aiport fees we save $50 doing this even after cab fare both ways).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Beautiful suites, great...”
Reviews.Author: brianz09
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Beautiful suites, great location and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ianto999
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family for a week at the end of August, probably the best hotel we have stayed in together. Suite was huge, very well equipped, great view of the strip (maybe the $20 we tipped the reservation clerk had something to do with that) and service was first class throughout. Amenities throughout the hotel, and it's sister the Venetian, are fantastic, can be a little pricey but lots of the bars and restaurants have daily happy hour offers so look out for these. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as Encore”
Reviews.Author: TF66
Reviews.Content: Maybe if I hadn’t just checked out of the fabulous Encore I wouldn’t have been so disappointed. It also didn’t help that the check in desk where extremely rude to my husband. I made the booking in my name but it was his credit card that was used to hold the room. I went shopping and left him to check in with a confirmation print out of our booking. Unfortunately they wouldn’t let him check in without me ??? why I don’t know ? – after a bit of shouting they let him check into another room at full rate and for some unknown reason would not let him use the mini bar. I came home to a very irate man and spent half an hour in a queue until I got to the front desk where it was eventually all sorted out. No apologies and no reasonably explanation why. To be fair the rooms are nice and they are big but the rest of the hotel looks like a tired cousin compared to the Encore and The Wynn . Cons - The check in desk is on one side of the casino and the lifts to the rooms are on the other side of the casino. Its quite a hike with bags! Some horrible perfume / scent is sprayed in the casino Big hotel – impersonal – crowed – crowed pool Pros – Had a nice Italian meal in one the restaurants Big rooms

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful, quiet suites are a sweet deal”
Reviews.Author: SoloMe-oTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was treated like a princess by the staff, they all had a smile and positive dispositions (amazing!). I loved the room too, it was large, comfortable, and had all the bells and whistles like a separate deep tub and shower, a make-up table with 10X mirror, two sinks, a comfy couch and dining table and a desk with an adjacent fax, copy machine and, of course, the plush terry bathrobes. There's only one thing that I would give a "needs improvement" on and that's because there was no coffee/tea machine in the room---that you had to order.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Splendor!”
Reviews.Author: PReyn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo for our honeymoon, and what a great choice!! I am a hotel manager, so I tend to look at hotels differently than other guests. To my suprise, I could find nothing wrong with this hotel! Our room was clean, housekeeping service was outstanding, and every employee we passed in the halls went out of their way to say "Hello" to us! Others have rated this hotel as impersonal, but I had the complete opposite impression. The girl who checked us in was thrilled to hear it was our honeymoon, and upgraded us to a higher floor with a strip view since our original room was not ready when we arrived. This was my first time in Las Vegas, and I cant wait to go back! The room was wonderful, not to mention huge! We found a store downstairs to buy a bottle of wine from, and there are wine glasses and a wine opener in the room which was more than convenient! Topping off a night of nonstop walking on the town was well suited with a glass of wine and a warm bath in the deep soaking tub! The Grande Lux Cafe, First Food and Bar, Dos Caminos and CUT were all above expectation (which were high to begin with). The only downside was the $10 minimums at the card tables in the casino, but what else would you expect from such an upper-class Resort?! As I said before, this was my first trip to Las Vegas, and I will not stay anywhere but the Palazzo because of this excellent experience! You have my business for life!! As a hotel manager, we are asked about other accommodations frequently, especially vacation cities such as Vegas... this hotel/casin/resort will be my ONLY recommendation! Thank you Palazzo and Staff for making our honeymoon more than enjoyable! We will be back very soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, crowded and impersonal!!!”
Reviews.Author: Whizzzy
Reviews.Content: All prior posts about the generous room size and nice amenities are true. The hotel is proud of their air ventiliation system and the fragrance that is emitted - but it has a cloying sweet smell that gets old after a while. I stayed on the 38th floor with a view of the back of the hotel - the mountains are attractive, but the main feature is a huge ugly white roof of some building next door - not very scenic. Did not want to pay $50 extra per night for strip view. The bed is comfortable, but you get tiny little lumpy pillows. I could not get the room temperature right - I was always either too hot or too cold, and the air conditioning system is loud. My room had some wear and tear - the couch was missing buttons, the marble had been stained, the TV console had broken hardware, and the light over the table was broken. A console in the bed area had a switch for some missing element, and a light feature between the double beds had no switch to turn it on. You pay $15 per day to use Internet. The bathroom is quite nice, but the commode is in a separate small hot room with dim lighting and dubious toilet water pressure - and a door that insists on slamming shut. The hotel swells on weekends starting Friday nights and hoards of trashy drunken partiers take over the casino and run amok in the hallways to the wee hours. Note that in a security effort you are constantly asked to show your room card to gain acess to the elevators. I was at the hotel on business and needed to wake up early on a Sat morning to catch a flight - but I had no sleep Friday night because of the raucus party people on the floor and loud thumpa-thumpa music until 4 in the morning. I reported the noise to security who told me they could not find where the noise was coming from and seemed indifferent to my plight . The room doors close loudly and you cannot manually close them quietly so all night long you hear door slams on the floor. The check in staff are curt and seem to have a blase "I've heard it all before" attitude. You are warned not to touch any of the mini-bar items as the minute you do you will be charged because they are weight sensitive. Watch out for the hotel bottle of water - the mini-bar menu is not clear that you will pay $5 for that water (the menu looks like you only pay for the Fiji water, but no, you pay for the hotel bottle as well.) You are given a small map of the hotel layout that makes no sense and does not have any detail, making finding things very difficult. The map has conference room numbers, but when you go to the conference room area the rooms are first by name and then number. I was mis-directed twice in trying to find a restaurant and ended up wandering about for a long time. Checking in took over 20 minutes and there is not enough staff working the desk. Strangely, you do not receive your bill under the door, you have to manually check out - which adds time. Note that the airport shuttle service runs only on the hour on weekends. The main pool is just a big rectangle; there is a strange little pool by some cabana rooms, and a smaller rectangular pool at the rear. All in all not a very inspired pool area. The Canyon Ranch has two work out rooms - one small one by the entrance, and a larger one that is a long walk away. My recommendation to a friend is just a slim margain from not recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Taking A Dim View”
Reviews.Author: Madweber
Reviews.Content: My new favorite hotel in Vegas. Very large rooms, remote control curtains, three televisions, in-room wireless and wired internet with printer. The safe has an electrical outlet to charge whatever you are safekeeping in there. There's a six-drawer lighted-top dresser plus a large 2-drawer night table for clothes storage and a closet of course. There are plenty of lights in the room, they just don't put out much light. It's energy saving I'm sure. The master light switch by the door is a stroke of genius when it comes to easily saving electricity - no running around turning all the lights off. But having a dimly lit sleep area is one thing, in the bathroom this is bad. You really can't see your face well to shave, so it's more of a shave by feel process. Maid service was terrific. The elevator service was fast and the smoke in the casino was kept to a minimum - much better than other hotel casinos. There are plenty of moderately priced places to eat and shop in the Palazzo-Venetian complex. Self parking was convenient and easy. The hotel is diagnally across the street from the very nice Fashion Show mall - worth visiting. For breakfast, we ate at the Grand Lux Cafe - excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Living the Life of Luxury at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Cordelia01604
Reviews.Content: After signing up for the Palazzo & Venetian's "Grazie" player's club card last summer and spending 1/2 hour on the slot machines at the Palazzo, they sent me a $79/night room rate that my husband and I decided to take them up on this past week. Very classy hotel with amenities, food and service all top-notch. The room we received (their basic suite) was just about the size of the last apartment that my husband and I rented for a year before our house was built (700 sq ft). Baths were luxurious, with separate shower and soaking tub, TV, and makeup table. Beds were so comfortable the only way we could get ourselves out of bed each morning was to use our remote control to open the curtains. Every employee was personable (from the great staff at the Grand Lux Cafe to the security staff to the pool attendants). The pool area was beautiful; several different sizes and types of pools to suit couples and families. We put our chaise lounges in the pool and just spent 3 hours laying out in the sun, still keeping cool because we were an inch or two submerged in the pool by the lounges. Perfect setup! We had dinner at Dal Toro one night and went to see Blue Man Group afterward; great date night (there are literally no words to describe Blue Man Group; just something everyone should experience once in their life to feel as indescribable as I do writing this!) The only negatives I have (and they are extremely slight ones that can't really be helped) is the location being in the north-central strip portion of the "action"; wish it were located near the Flamingo or NY-NY instead; and the almost $20/night resort fee that you are charged for afterwards. It includes all local and toll-free calls, use of the machines at the Canyon Ranch Spa, and a daily newspaper. Too bad it wasn't alacarte, because the only thing we took advantage of was the newspaper. Again, only slight negatives, but I don't mind giving The Palazzo my seal of approval and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. If they offered us a special rate again, we would definitely go; we just could not afford $250-$300/night rack rate plus to stay. But it was amazing to feel as pampered and as spoiled as we did for 5 days last week. Two very big thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, but pay extra for the view of the strip”
Reviews.Author: mishka999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 4 nights- the rooms are huge (and we just got the standard) and in very good condition. Three tvs, a separate living area,large bathroom etc. We had initially been booked into a standard room on the 9th floor with no view (It was terrible- overlooking a horrible roof) so we requested to change rooms, we were relocated to the same type of room on the 29th floor with a view (extra $50 US per night)- this was so worth it as we overlooked the hotel pool and the Strip. It was fun getting ready to go out and watch was was happening below. We were tossing up between staying at the Bellagio or Palazzo when booking this holiday, I am happy that we booked the Palazzo as it looked newer and seemed to have more going on as it was connected to the Venetian. Service is quite impersonal but I guess that is what you expect staying in such a massive place.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: travelmore149362
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of an e-mail package offer and stayed here for 3 nights. Because I was traveling with a friend, I wanted a room with 2 beds-thus my choices were somewhat limited, as most of the room categories have king-size beds. Nevertheless, our Bella View Suite was incredible, and huge! The bathroom was gorgeous and enormous. It had a television, although the placement was kind of strange- you couldn't really watch it from the tub. I had paid extra for a Strip view- but the view was only OK- the hotel is set very far back from the Strip, and the angle was such that we faced Treasure Island head-on, and only saw part of the rest of the Strip. Nevertheless, for me the location was perfect. The hotel was near everything I wanted to do. The casino had the latest slots and I liked that it was not overrun with loud packs of partyers- if you are the kind of person who wants to be where the action is, then maybe this is not the best choice for you- but I appreciated that it was quieter than, for example, the Bellagio casino. It was not dead, but it was more of a hum of activity than a roar. Although you did have to go through the casino to get to the guest elevators, the path was very wide, so it was easy and quick to navigate with luggage. The hotel has its own driveway, lobby, and front desk, but is connected to the Venetian. It was no problem to go back and forth between the Venetian and Palazzo. I liked that I did not have to exhchange slot vouchers for cash, but could use the same one in both casinos. There were many restaurants and lots of shopping- it would have been quite possible to stay on the property for the entire vacation. I did not have the time to take advantage of the pools or health club, but look forward to doing so on a future trip. Check-in was easy- we arrived at about 10:30 a.m. after a cross-country flight, and were delighted to be given a room immediately. Check-out would have been easy, but there was a glitch on the bill. The clerk went to talk to his manager to settle it- while he was gone, quite a line built up behind me. I felt bad for those people, and thought the hotel should have more desk clerks to assist them. The problem with my bill was resolved satisfactority, and I have no hesitation about going back or recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great free room at the Palazzo.”
Reviews.Author: Jade M
Reviews.Content: We were sent an offer to stay for four nights for free, at either the Palazzo or Venetian, we chose the Palazzo, due to it being the newer property of the two. We were only able to take advantage of 3 nights, but it was great, those 3 nights were Fri, Sat and Sun, which normally I only ever see them offer the free nights for week nights, and we were also invited to be in a wheel of fortune slot tournament and free tickets for Wheel of fortune. We arrived very early about 09:00 a.m , and we requested a room close to the elevators, we were called by 11:00 a.m to say the room was ready, everyone was very friendly and our request was granted, our room was very close to the elevators with a nice view of the Wynn golf course and Mountains. The room is gorgeous, the bed is so comfortable, we loved the step down into the living room area, it's very spacious, the room has 3 flat screen TV's, one in the Living room, one in the bedroom and one in the bathroom. The bathroom is fabulous, lots of counter space, double sink, huge tub, walk in shower, separate room with toilet, another area with a seat and mirror. We also liked the light up bar area underneath the TV. Everything about our stay was great, no complaints, Casino had good drink service, we ate at Grand Lux, first and Dos Caminos all excellent food and service. We love that the Palazzo connects to the Venetian, and also very easy to get to Wynn, Encore, fashion show mall, TI and Mirage from here. Being in the slot tournament was fun even though we came in 458th place or something like that, it was out of about 800. Seeing wheel of fortune was an experience, Pat Sayjak stood right next to me, it was great being there. It was a fun weekend in Vegas, with our free room and free tickets, and even if we had to pay for the room, we still would have been happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too many issues to recommend though lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Karen0101
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights to relax after a road trip through Wyoming, Grand Canyon etc Booked on Prestige level and received an e mail a few weeks beforehand offering assistance so requested a car from the airport. A stretch limo was considered most suitable and I decided to go ahead with this for a bit of fun. However the driver was nowhere to be found and after trying other possible meeting places we called the hotel who asked him to call us. He was waiting outside, not at the agreed spot and with no ID, name plate etc. No idea how we were expected to locate him. Then we found air con was not working and after 15 minutes in the car found ourselves more hot and exhausted than during our whole road trip. Was glad of the instant check in having seen the queues downstairs. Check in efficient. After 45 mins we had to call for our baggage, luggage dept had not received the promised request to send it up. I had also requested a gondola trip which had not been booked. Eventually this was acheived but when we arrived we found it had been booked for two not four. No mention had been made of the fact that there are two Gondola options. Prestige lounge was very busy, service slow. I have stayed in a number of Shangri La and Intercontinentals in the Far East and this Club floor service is not in the same league. We had been told that children were not allowed in the bar area which was perfectly understandable but it was pretty annoying to find that the food was also laid out in the bar area so we had to get up any time one of our teenagers wanted a few peanuts. Hot dish had no non-nut or non meat options, these could only be provided at the end of the service and no indication could be given of the next days food content so we could not make plans. Most of the appetisers had run out by 6.15 and were 'finished' even though the savory part of service was meant to continue until 7pm Breakfast was also served in the bar area, no alcohol was evident but presumably the legal requirement remains as we were quite abruptly told to leave and when I pointed out that I could not find seating elsewhere I was just told to 'go and look' no effort to help,find a table, pull a few chairs together etc. Again getting up and down to help two teenagers complete breakfast certainly provided some exercise. Room was excellent, clean, spacious and good quality, all we had expected but again disappointed with no turn down service or even a bottle of complementary water. Everything seemed to involve long waits and queues. In no way a dreadful hotel and our stay was fine but with plenty of choices I would go elsewhere if I returned to LV.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome-o”
Reviews.Author: MongolGlobal
Reviews.Content: This was the first stay at the Palazzo and I must say it was very impressive. All the staff there was incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were amazing, loved the decor, very comfortable and soundproof. Only one time did I even hear anything from outside the room. The views were great from the 45th floor, even in the back of the strip. Really liked the Casino. Went over to another one of the Casinos, and it made me appreciate the Palazzo that much more. The hotel is really well layed out and it's easy to get from one place to another. Ate at the Grand Luxe Cafe twice and loved the food both times. Pool chairs in the pool was amazing. My new favorite Vegas hotel for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Overratted”
Reviews.Author: mandm3849
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying here, and probably the last. The Maid service was poor at best, for a supposed luxury suite it was 2 star at best, the dresser was worn, the dresser drawer was broken ( it pulled out all the way and hit the floor),the room was dusty and one of the lights wouldn't shut off. We left our suite at 9:30am in hopes that it would be cleaned by noon or 1 at the latest, since we had dinner reservations at 6 pm. Well at 4:30 the room was still not clean we kept checking and saw maid carts next to our room across the hall from our room but for some reason not our room, (I had always left a tip the previous days too) . I finally asked the maid when she was going to clean our room she didn't speak english or pretended not to so needless to say we were rushed to get to our dinner reservations luckly it was in the same hotel. I didn't complain about anything I figured they wouldn't do anything anyway so I figured I'd would just not stay there again. They are charging $499 a night on weekends and that's just way out of range. Also the nicer pools aren't open weekdays and the pool is nothing special just a rectangle shaped crowded with kids. We upgraded to a strip view and it really wasn't worth the price. I'm not sure if it's the economy or what but they need to hire more help or at least people who want to work.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Accommendations”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyD4
Reviews.Content: Wonderful accommendations. Pleasant helpful staff. Good resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - with terrible service- and no buffet at all”
Reviews.Author: FrustratedTravelor
Reviews.Content: If you could take my room- and put it in a 200 room hotel- i'd give the place 5 stars. It's just too big- 40 minutes to check in- 15 minutes to check out ( at 4AM )- 2 hours to get light bulb replaced- pool beautiful- BUT 1) if you get room on back of hotel- you will have a view worse than a parking lot. 2) the only hotel without a buffet ( breakfast or dinner )- they only have expensive restaurants ( this includes the Venetian )- Coffee and a muffin cost almost as much as a 6 plate gorge at other Vegas resorts.-- 3) internet expensive - I still like the Paris better

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kay922
Reviews.Content: If you are a returning traveler to Vegas, Please change your traditional hotel from Caesars or wherever you stay to the Palazzo hotel. I stayed in Caesars twice prior to staying in Palazzo and I must say this hotel really has everything and more. The restaurants are great! New nightlife Lavo is very fun and the shopping is amazing! The best of all were the rooms. Very large rooms!! The BED was the best part. I do not think i have ever slept better then I did in the bed at the Palazzo!! Soo comfortable and who can say they really sleep in vegas, but with a bed like that, you will not want to move! The pool is very relaxing. They have relaxing reclining chairs in the pool for you to lay on and it is nice to get some sun and be cool from the water. If you want a pool party, then the beach club Azule is very nice! Cabanas are expensive but it is very pretty inside. The only thing i would reccommand is that you stay at Palazzo if this is your second time to Vegas, because it is further down the strip so walking to other hotels is alittle jont but if you are willing to put your Nikes on and hike up the strip, then this will not be an issue for you. Other then that I really enjoyed that hotel. Service was amazing and I would stay there again on my next trip to Sin City.

Reviews.Title: “It was very nice”
Reviews.Author: nyJt
Reviews.Content: The trip was comped for my past gambling loses, LOL, but if you shop around for specails you can get a room for under 150. There is a resort fee now also which runs 19.04 per night but it includes interent access. I also must say they had decent channels on the tv's and as I remember Harrahs properties had very very limited channels which is very annoying.(that may have changed but I thought Palazzo had a decent selection, so if you like to hear the tv at night or want to spend a few hours in your room at least there is something on tv!) The rooms as most say are big. Mine was very clean, nice, did not show to much wear, although both beds seemed to be getting a little old soft feel to them. Bathrooms ver nice. Check in check out was a little long but not horrible. All requests or dealing with staff were always very nice. Staff seemed to always be professional and nice. The only thing I don't like is once you get there its not as easy to get on and off the strip, but thats the new Las vegas and I kind of miss the old Las vegas with the ease of just hotel casino hopping. All in all I would stay at the Palazzo anytime as it is very nice and I felt safe there also. Very Nice Stay

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel at the end of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: ob1dob
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the Palazzo, what a great experience. It was spotless and sparkling. Absolutely recommended for a stay when in Vegas. Great casino and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: OzTink
Reviews.Content: My SIL and I stayed here on our first day of arrival from Aus. After a long haul flight with a tight connection, to experiencing Southwest Airlines in LAX at 8:30am on a Saturday morning, to missing our first flight to LV because of their never ending lines, to getting bumped to the next flight and thankfully getting that one, we were just relieved to arrive at the Palazzo on the Saturday morning. (However our taxi ride was $26! - definitely the scenic route) I had booked one night through Hotwire as it was a Saturday and all the resorts were charging premium rates. We were booked into the Aria from the Sunday for 4 nights but the Sat night was $440 so I gave Hotwire a shot. I had narrowed down the search to 2 possible properties - Venetian or Palazzo and was actually hoping for the V due to the reviews here. We got Palazzo for $165 and I paid the extra $30 to guarantee a double room. We were at check-in at 11:30am with a small wait. The check-in guy was very friendly and was telling us that he was off to Australia in a few days. The Hotwire double room request was NOT sent over (booked through as a single King room) so as I started to scramble around for my paperwork, he said not to worry and it would be a complimentary upgrade (that I had paid for). He also asked if we would like a strip view (?!) which we of course said yes. He said we could have a room immediately if we didn't want a view or to come back at 1:00 for the room with the view. We decided to come back. We came back at 1 and our room still wasn't ready but they offered one on a higher floor. Our phone was ringing when we got into our room and it was the luggage wanting to come up. The rooms were beautiful - we didn't use the lounge area but it felt nice and spacious to have. The beds were beautful and so comfortable! My favourite bed of our US trip. The pools were great - wish we spent more time here. My favourite restaurant of the trip is in here too - Grand Luxe which we had breakfast, lunch and dinner in. All meals were great, especially the weekend buffet breakfast. We also spent 4 nights at Aria and I think I like the Palazzo side of the strip better. Loved having Wynn next door (we went to XS) and the mall is fantastic across the street. We both surprisingly really loved Palazzo and would definitely return here on another trip. Their end of the strip seems cleaner too and they don't have as many cards littering the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: I went here for a business mtg. Everyone else was having fun. That was OK. I could into partymode for the duration of an elevator ride. Rooms well appointed, food very good, service excellent, shopping outstanding. I would go again. Just one small point - the gym cost of $35 - ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at an Economy Price”
Reviews.Author: jeanneann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pazazzo July 28-Aug 1 119 per night w/ lots of extras ie dinners at a huge discount, shows and it is so beautiful. The pools were wonderful and the staff most attentive - we hesitate to stay elsewhere; oh yes, the shopping mall is directly across the street. Also saw TI pirate show right from our window every night. We can hardly WAIT to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: janjanBoston
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a slot tournament at the Venetian - stayed at the Palzazzo 5th time staying at this hotel, LOVE IT...Have stayed at Aria, Mirage, even Mandlay Bay (which noticeably has changed with no staff in site and restaurants same) Pool at Palazzo/Venetian is the best, Clean, enjoyable, staff is extremly courtesy and hotel suite is the best...Views from hotel are the best ..especially at night. Love the restaurnts , ambiance and the Grand Lux is a great place to grab a quick meal. Slots are extremely tight at both hotels...actually at all hotels...only disappointment...I wouldn't stay anywhere else but the Palazzo or Venetian...(actually like the Palazzo rms better as they are newer than Venetian) the suites are the best... Our sons came with us (21 & 22 yrs old) and had a great time for their first trip...See the Jersey Boys !!! Even my sons enjoyed this !

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: marathonman262
Reviews.Content: I've been to few 5 star hotels in the past but this is one of the best i've been to. i don't need to repeat what others have said. only thing i didn't care for was the pools, nothing special. as far as gambling, you might want to check out other hotel in the area. lowest black jack table was $25 at nights, less during the day. stay here, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Was great in May but not so much in August.”
Reviews.Author: Boopers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last May and the room was immaculate, service was great. We came back in August. Not the same. We realized we may not be able to check in early as we had in May, but getting someone to hold our bags for us was very unprofessional. The desk clerk pointed to a staff member standing in the middle of the lobby. We walked over to him (Carlos) and he asked us what was in the bags. Uh, just check them and none of your business. He also had his front shirt pocket flap open with dollar bills hanging out. When we weren't quick to hand him a tip, he *accidentally* let some singles fall from his pocket onto the luggage. I felt like we were in some cheap hotel. And we never saw where the luggage was going. We later got a call that our room was ready. We went to our room about 2 hours after the call, expecting the luggage to be there. We called and were told that the porter tried to deliver the luggage but we weren't in the room. Since when is this a requirement? They just wanted another tip. A tip to take the luggage and a tip to get the luggage. And it was another 45 minutes before someone brought up the luggage. By the way, the internet and weight room are not free. The hotel charges a $19.04 per day resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies trip to Vegas Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: MEDISKIS
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at the Palazzo Las Vegas. We were a group of 4 celebrating my daughter's 30th birthday. She picked the Palazzo as where she wanted to stay. We really enjoyed the whole facility ..... rooms lovely although we hardly used the living room portion at all..... the beds were WONDERFUL ..... the location is unbeatable since you are about center on the strip., the atmosphere is a little more serene and contemporary than many of the others we walked though during our explorations (exception being the Wynn / Encore which was saw on the last day and which I absolutely LOVED- similarly upscale, contemporary). I do have a little complaint about the Palazzo bathroom...... in a Bella suite with two separate beds one might assume that family groups or mixed groups of friends are staying together -- the shower area is all clear glass open to the whole bath and vanity area so no privacy there. At the Palazzo,we dined in both LAVO (Italian big big portions) and CARNEVINO (steakhouse - melt in your mouth filet and great service). My daughter and niece enjoyed Dos Caminos almost every day at least for happy hour. We lunched twice at the adults only AZURE pool and all food on the pool level is supplied by Wolfgang Puck - wonderful! We did encounter confusion on several occasions with the package we booked. Knowing it was August in Vegas we booked the AZURE (adult pool) package which lists free admission and complimentary chairs, along with a $100 food credit as package benefits. I had asked prior to arrival if we would have admission and chairs EACH day of our stay and asked again at check-in -- both times we went on hold for long periods while supervisors were asked and both times we were told YES. There is confusion though up at the pool since they were telling us to use our "chair voucher" one day, and use the food credit another day and we seemed to be getting charged for chairs ...... but it turns out the charge equals a Food/Beverage minimum which varied from $25 on Friday, to $100 on Saturday, to $50 on Sunday. I am still a little confused what we paid for and what we did not up at the pool when all was said and done. It is easy to burn at least $50 if you order food and the specialty drinks are $17 each. One good thing to know is that they often hand out promoter cards for free (ladies) or reduced (guys) admission to Azure and then you just have to deal with "booking" the chair (committing to that minimum ). On Friday a very nice server told us that each Saturday they open an additional BIG pool as part of Azure and that there would be plastic chaises in the water which did not have ANY fee or minimum attached to them. In hot weather it is where you want to sit anyhow. It does beg the question where will you put your stuff to stay dry and safe -- best bet is to book at least one $100 chair on a Saturday and you will eat/drink that much easy if you are a twosome or more. We had 4 people and booked two chaises and grabbed several in the water to stay cool (arrive early). Two other trip highlights were dinner at TAO in the Venetian where our savvy server put together a tasting menu for our group - checking with us first to ask what kind of things we might want to avoid. That was wonderful and made it easy and we went into TAO club afterwards. One of my favorites of our stay was walking each morning from the Palazzo into the connected Venetian for "coffee in Venice" each day. I have been to Venice at least 7 - 8 times and thought the decor, squares, canal, bridges were very well done --- the gondoliers would usually walk by at 9:45 am (when I likely was there for coffee) singing as they reported for work. NICE. All in all a lovely stay (did I say it was my first trip to Vegas....?)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: aramjames
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas a number of times and decided to stay at the Palazzo. They gave ne a great military rate that I could not refuse. Check in was very fast and I was asked what room would you like. All rooms are suites, we were on the 24 th floor overlooking all the pools and the strip. In my opinion the Palazzo is the the best Hotel on the strip, connected to the Venitian. You have the Palazzo Pools as well as the Venitian pools, awesome! The room has a sunken living room, remote blinds, three flat screen televisions with one in the bathroom. Seperate tub, seperate shower, two sinks, make up vanity with chair and toilet in a seperate room. The hotel is exceptional with a lovely scent being pumped through the HV system. There is even a Lambergini Dealership on the lower level of the hotel. You know if there is a Lambergini Dealership it is all pure class. Fantastic restauants and casino. Hit the Wheel of Fortune Slot for $1,000.00. I highly recommend this resort, you will be very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Family time together”
Reviews.Author: TiaC2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, food was good. Had a wonderful time. Only complaint is the penny slot machine's, wasn't as loosed as I wanted to be. hehehheheh. For sure we will go again.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JWC1978
Reviews.Content: Precursor: I have not been to Las Vegas in a few years. We stayed at The Palazzo Resort Hotel Casino on business for the events ticket meetings and Ticket Summit show as part of EventAdviser.com. Cleanliness: We stayed on the Prestige Level which requires taking private elevators to the 23rd floor and stayed in one of their Luxury Suites (as they call it). I am not sure if the rooms are any different on the lower floors but the room we had was like walking into a very nice 720 sq/ft studio apartment. During our stay the room was cleaned daily and we were provided fresh linens and replacement soaps in a consistent and timely manner. The hallways and lobby also appeared well kept. Location: We were there mostly for meetings for EventAdviser.com but the Resort offered hot tickets, VIP tickets and show tickets for entertainment events within the resort which included David Spade, Joan Rivers, A Bronx Tale, Blue Man Group, Phantom and Jersey Boys during our stay. The Palazzo Resort Hotel Casino is nearby The Wynn and The Encore which also have many concerts, theater, Las Vegas and Broadway tickets and shows. Rooms: The room we stayed was pretty amazing including a very comfortable kind-sized pillow-top bed, three flat-screen LCD HDTVs located throughout, a sitting area with an L-Shaped sofa, fully-stocked refreshment center and dining area. The bathroom was equally impressive with a large tub and glass shower. Service: The service on the Prestige Level was excellent. Some of the complimentary amenities included a private champagne check-in, daily cocktail reception that started at 5 p.m., admission to the Canyon Ranch SpaClub fitness center and pool, etc. During our stay The Palazzo Resort Hotel Casino event offered cheap theatre tickets and cheap event tickets to Phantom and Blue Man Group. Value: We stayed from 7/14 thru 7/18 while on business for EventAdviser.com. The room rate was ($139.00 + (an additional $100.00)) or $239.00/per night to upgrade to the Prestige Level which is well worth it since everything is a la carte for non-Prestige Level guests and would probably cost more (not bundled). Also, if you get tired of gambling its nice to get offers for discount theater tickets and show tickets, from the concierge, which I am not sure non-Prestige Level guests are offered. Sleep Quality: The blackout shades, air-conditioning, and large king-sized bed with cotton sheets can make you lose track of time and sleep indefinitely. Overall: I would definitely stay at The Palazzo Resort Hotel Casino again for personal leisure and if not on business for EventAdviser.com.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo and Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Denvergirl3000
Reviews.Content: Both great hotels. Palazzo newer and a bit nicer. Venetian rooms a bit smaller. But hotel is so beautiful inside.

Reviews.Title: “Cool inside-Hot outside”
Reviews.Author: Freeatlast09
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is priced right, centrally located, the Grand Lux Cafe is great for all types of food and has great prices and the public areas are not as cigarette smokey as most and It is kept very cool. Because of the heat the pool was very crowded but fun. The penny slots made this hotel very fun. The Jersey boys are a must see. We were their for four nights and will return next summer. Great Place...

Reviews.Title: “Very large hotel”
Reviews.Author: nevdestine
Reviews.Content: Day 1 Checked in that morning. Informed it was good thing I was early because they were sold out. As usual this trip, my request for a bottom floor near elevator, near casino was ignored. I was told only “preferred guests” where place on bottom floor because suites are larger. Ok? Uhm, I was invited. After about a 1 mile hike up 2 elevators to the 11 floor and down the end of a very, very long hallway I discovered a nice suite with a sunken living room. Dropped my stuff, got clean up, went out, got back around midnight. Tried to watch TV in the Master. The noise from the dedicated air system was too loud. Sounded like a jet engine pushing air. Around 3am the first system was pusing hot air so I had to turn on the second system. With both going I put two pillows over my head to sleep. The room was very clean and the bed was great. Day 2 Moved to the 21st floor and assured “the view” would be very nice. I do not care about a view!!! They act like they are doing me a favor. The room was quiet and clean. Before I moved the maid knocks on the door and informs me I have mini bar charges. I don't think so. She does an inventory and then says their mistake. Sorry. Day 3 Vegas is packed with people. A cop told me it hit 116 on the strip yeaterday. Crossing over to Bellagio on the escalator, my tennis shoes felt and looked like the bottoms melted into the metal steps. After the first night not sleeping because of the air conditioner noise I was exhausted the rest of the trip. Maybe next time, :).

Reviews.Title: “We just got back from a two night stay at...”
Reviews.Author: howdyUsa
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two night stay at the Palazzo. It was fantastic. We have stayed at many of the big name hotels and this by far the best. We took the early flight in, so we arrived at the hotel at 9am. We walked right up to check in and to our excitement we were able to get our suite. Great room, better than Bellagio suite. Pool cabana was wonderful, great food every where, and perfect location. We got two free show tickets. We went to Phantom. It was great, free tickets in the forth row was a nice surprise. Value was over $300 for two ticks. Gambling was tight, but we were there to relax. Best overall hotel on strip when combined with the Vennitian.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOTHER”
Reviews.Author: bokoz
Reviews.Content: .Don't Bother with this hotel, a low rate hotel, masquerading as a high end hotel. the staff was friendly, the didn't seem to care. they didn't honor coupons, which were part of the package that was bought and paid for , By saying the package had expired the package was in effect when bought. The lighting in the "WATER CLOSET" was so low, you couldn't even see the numbers on the phone that was in there . explained away by a front desk manager as "STRUCTURAL" , all they had to do was change a light bulb. .we were on a non smoking floor, in a suite they upgraded us too, smelled from smoke, but not short term smoking, but in the furniture, drapes etc. and the dust was so thick, it was on everything, you'd think the room hadn't been used in months, light bulbs were missing over a sitting area. (BET THE ROOM IS STILL IN THE SAME CONDITION NOW). This was a suite, yet only towels and glass's for two people were provided, we left a note stating 3 people were in that suite, please leave more towels and glass's IGNORED. this is a short list.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, no problems !”
Reviews.Author: CWS
Reviews.Content: Our experience was very positive. As already reported may times the hotel is very clean and modern. We found the food & service in the casino, bars and restaurants all to be excellant. The rooms are great, especially for the price of $140 p/n over a busy weekend. They must be some of the best available on the strip for the price. The casino itself was airy and never crowded. Can't say we experienced any negative issues at all. We were able to check-in 12noon, they even upgraded our room. My wife really liked the in house shopping mall and we used many of the hotels facilities such as gym, pools and various bars/restaurants. Security was very evident (a good thing) and not having a 'hotel theme' means that you don't seem to get the huge waves of people passing through as you'd find at say Bellagio. A good tip if hiring a car would be to reserve with the inhouse AVIS desk. Find the hotels AVIS promo code on hotel website. We found the rate to be heavily discounted ($200-300 less than other options) plus car is delivered directly to hotel entrance...all very easy. The only slightly negative comment we could make is that the hotel has little of the Vegas aura you find at say Caesars which you may want to consider if its your first trip, but its really hard to find fault with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....LOUSY customer relations”
Reviews.Author: traveler6251
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with gorgeous, luxurious rooms. The housekeping staff was VERY friendly, efficient and helpful. Unfortunately, that's where the "Pro's" stop. The service was awful from the beginning. Check in lines were extremely long while clerks stood around talking among themselves and ignoring guests, who grew increasingly frusrated and irritated. Staff at the Club Grazie desk and on the casino floor were disinterested at best. We attempted to call the front desk on several occasions and never got anyone to answer the phone. The concierge desk closed early which seemed absurd in a city that doesn't "come to life" until late at night. When we were sent a survey by the hotel after our stay, their main concern seemed to be whether or not staff called us by name. Much more to the point, their concern should have been focused on providing the standard of actual service one would expect from a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and classy”
Reviews.Author: Reader13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 5 nights. We had been to Vegas once before and stayed at the MGM. So glad we picked the Palazzo! It was small enough that we felt comfortable there, and incredible inside. Clean, classy, beautiful. Loved the marble floors & waterfall. We spent a lot of time there and at the Venetian, which is a very quick indoor walk. The food court at the Venetian was convenient, so we ate breakfast/lunch there. We are not big gamblers, but we took a free lesson on craps in the Palazzo casino. We then went to the Casino Royale for $3 craps tables. We found $1 blackjack at the Sahara - just get a ticket from the vending machine outside the Wynn on the strip for the Ace bus. Very easy. We recommed the Minus 5 ice bar in Mandalay Bay. It's a long walk & a bit pricey, but totally worth it. When it's 110 degrees out, nothing beats wearing a parka and drinking out of an ice glass! If you're walking mid-day, it's hot, but if you drink water it's fine. There are guys all over the strip who sell bottled water for $1. Wear sneakers & plan on walking a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, too many rules, not impressed - going back to MGM Grand”
Reviews.Author: joeybagz312
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a few girlfriends end of July 2010. Was not impressed. We did love our room, very nice and the concierge level was good, with free water bottles, some small snacks and tea, etc. However, they were very strict about who went in and when, etc. Check in, we thought, was at 3, but we were told it could be in a 3-5 pm window. Wasn't ready til almost 5. Found the pool, and the Azure pool, to be very pretentious and boring. Gambling not great, Lavo nightclub busy and bad music. Lagasse Stadium = boring. The whole time we couldn't wait to get back to staying at MGM and wondered why we ever strayed. We thought the room and luxury would be nice to try, but really were not very impressed at all. Paid extra for a strip view, but all you can see is Treasure Island and a bunch of cranes. Would have preferred to have seen more of the strip for paying extra to see it. Grand lux was a let down, and Table 10 was very, very disappointing. In a way, glad we strayed because it confirmed how great of a hotel MGM Grand is. We will never return to palazzo as a hotel guest, or even visitor. Nothing was worth coming back for. Would NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Rooms Are Questionable”
Reviews.Author: techmaximum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo on the first week of July in the Luxury Suite. I must say, was expecting a whole lot more. The room was spacious and the decor was nice, but it still didn't have a luxury feel to it. I guess this is expectation management, we were expecting more and got less overall. The Palazzo being a fairly new hotel, we were expecting our room to be immaculate, but it wasn't. Dust everywhere, cup marks on the coffee table and desk, stains on the couch, and a chip out of the coffee table. I swear this place seemed ten years old already. Remote control curtains didn't work, had to nudge them everytime to get them to move. The safe battery was low, wasn't sure if we were going to our money out after we locked it. These are details that should have really been taken care of before guests ever stay in a five star rated hotel room. Another issue, and perhaps the most disturbing is the one star toilet paper. Ok, I can put up with the other short comings of this place, but please don't skimp on the toilet paper. The reality is that I've used better toilet paper at truck stops than what was available here. I know a hotel needs to manage its bottom line, but using the absolute cheapest, thinest, sandpaper they can find for their guests who expect five star quality leaves one wondering who's decision this is. Having said that, if you stay here, pack your own toilet paper. Even if you buy the cheapest stuff you can find, it will be better than the newsprint they use here. On the good side, the Palazzo is overall a very nice hotel. The casino is large and has a style of its own. We spent a lot of time and money in the casino as the drinks kept coming and even a few unexpected wins. While we did browse the shops, we didn't buy anything, we usually do our shopping at home. We did eat at a few of the resaurants, which we enjoyed very much. We also visited the pools section, which was very relaxing. After staying at the Encore a few months earlier, we thought the Palazzo rooms were going to be equal or better. We were wrong. I recommend everything about this place except for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Casino and Room”
Reviews.Author: Tess47
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Venetian, so when we had a chance to tag on a few days at the Palazzo after our Bellagio stay, we jumped. The check in was a breeze (as was check out), the suite was wonderful, love the seating area in the sunken living room, the beds were comfy and the bathroom was great! Just a few minor problems that we did really bother us-the makeup mirror light was broken and the mini bar treats that were out were dusty (not that I would have been tempted to buy them anyway). Also the room does not really get that dark with the stair lights. Service was fine- were were asked if we wanted turn down service or not (not). Casino was ok, we are not big gamblers, but we enjoy quarter slots- most of the slots seemed to be penny slots- and those are just too complicated to follow for us, but it is obvious that they are bigger money makers for the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: merrytime
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference at the Palazzo and took me with him. We upgraded to the Sienna Suite. Mainly, we wanted the oversized jetted tub for two. The suite was great. I wasn't sure about the tub and I was correct, quite a tight fit, but definitely fine. We watched the world cup from all 3 televisions including the one over the tub. Housekeeping was very helpful and friendly. We changed from the mountain view to the strip view, but really the strip view is just so so, not like Bellagio's strip view! but the best part of the strip view was I could see directly over the pool and could see when they were the least crowded. I loved the spacious suite however, I noticed much wasted space in some areas and in other areas where it could have been bigger. Huge wonderful shower, vast, but no bench to sit on while the jets did their work. As big as the bathroom in the master suite was, why not have the tub be a real two person jetted tub? Guests are certainly willing to pay for it, why not have it, there is certainly enough room. The suite is about 1200 square feet and very nice. there is a second half bathroom near the front door. and there is an exercise machine in the suite! the sofa was big and curved or L shaped, very comfortable, plenty of drawers for clothes, and a vanity area with a mirror and a second magnifying mirror for make up, the curtains work via a remote control., awesome. One thing about housekeeping, I thought the shiny speckles were part of the decor, but it was dust. Several times like this, so I just dusted myself with a towel. There is no buffet in the hotel, so we ate at the Grande Lux which is part of the cheesecake factory, and I would eat there over and over, Oh yest the grande lux had a breakfast buffet, however, ordering off the menu might be better. All the meat products were pork, no chicken or turkey sausage, no smoked salmon, but the omelet station was fine. But ordering off the menu was divine. I get sick of really fancy restaurants sometimes. Overpriced, small portions, I liked the Grande lux, casual but very fresh. and if you can't finish through it away or take it back to your room. We ate at an Italian\/ Mediterranean restaurant one night when we crossed over to the Venetian, called Zafarreno or something like that. It was stuffy and didn't care for the food at all. Preferred the Grande Lux or room service. Room service was great. They are polite and come when they say they will. Yes I would stay there again. There was nothing even in my picking or light criticism that would prevent me from staying here again. I went down to the spa and paid a small fee to use the showers, the relaxation room and the saunas and hot tubs, it was very nice, they had a room called......quiet room or the wave room. when you go in it is dimly lit and quiet with reclining chairs circularly situated and titled back so you could see the ceiling which was reflections and sounds of ocean waves. at first I thought it was dumb, but if you lie back and relax and stare at the ceiling, it was quite enjoyable and relaxing, I fell asleep and kept waking up snoring, (embarrassing, but I wanted to stay) At one point I woke up and everyone else was gone, so I decided to go too, before I ruined any one else's experience with my music. Palazzo/Venetian has Jersey Boys and Phantom of the Opera, and something else that I can't remember, but I got tickets to "O" and saw this at the Bellagio. I bought seven copies of the sound track. I heard the Jersey Boys were good, and if you are attending a conference and wear your badge, Phantom of the Opera gave 50% off the tickets even in the golden circle section where the chandelier drops. All in all I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “My heart was set on a nite in the soaker tub watching MAD MEN...”
Reviews.Author: MustangSonny
Reviews.Content: This is a frivolous aside to an otherwise magnificent, all-suite property. I had checked-in distinctly desiring to soak in the tub...luxuriating as I sipped wine and nibbied on tapas...while watching MAD MEN in its new 2010 season. Alas: NO AMC on the hotel's TV offerings!!! Ha! Couldn't believe it! My evening was dashed! Otherwise, The Palazzo is beyond being "The Palace." This is a magnificent property. The regal foyer is reminiscent of The Metropolitan Art Museum in NYC or approaching "DAVID" in the Accademia Gallery in Florence, Italy. Stately. Gorgeous. And that lovely and subtle Green Tea aroma throughout the entry area? Delightful! Despite 10 Front Desk personnel working quickly and with great cordiality, the wait mimicked the check-in for a charter plane junket to The Bahamas. I felt rather "touristy" waiting in line -- like an "E" ride line at Disneyland in years gone by. But staff are outstanding/helpful. These suites are stunning and impressive. Sunken pit living areas. Three flat-screens. Luxurious linens. Spacious bath. A self-indulgent odyssey and great place for an extended stay, BUT -- As with many Vegas properties: NO coffeemaker in-room; perhaps the oddest FACT about Vegas properties. They want you down on that Casino floor ASAP -- and this includes grabbing a morning coffee...NO kitchenette or anything like that here. This is a truly outstanding, First Class experience.
