Indulge yourself, as I did! I like a HOT cup of coffee in the mornings. Next time: I'll pack my French Press and electric tea kettle! (ha!)

Reviews.Title: “Service has dropped to sorry levels”
Reviews.Author: wildguyoftoday
Reviews.Content: I'm a very frequent traveller, and have been staying in the Palazzo whenever I come to LV. It has been my wife's favorite hotel as well, but we're now looking for another. The service quality has dropped dramatically since we were here in March 2010. Twice I requested over the phone to "Priority Service" having the room made up only to find that they never made the room. Turndown service is no more, it's been eliminated. The waitstaff service at the casino tables is extremely slow, and the list goes on. Mind you, I'm staying on the Concierge (now "Prestige") level; I can't imagine what non-Prestige customers get for service. Even the Prestige lounge has become an epic wait to get a drink during their evening reception service. Despite the beautiful rooms and convenient location, this has gone from my favorite LV hotel to one no longer on my list at all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Saffron2010
Reviews.Content: After months of research and reading reviews on tripadvisor we finally decided to book a 7 night stay at the Palazzo. We booked directly with the hotel and had no problems. We kept checking the rates with the hotel site and with smartervegas.com. and got a good deal. We arrived on a Wednesday at 12.30pm. Check-in was quick and easy. We had requested an early check-in and we were given a room by 1.30pm. Our Bella Suite was amazing with plenty of room for a family with three children. Walgreen's was downstairs so it was easy to stock up on snacks & drinks for the kids. Our stay was hassle free. House keeping was quick to respond to requests. Ice machine was down the hall. It had a great pool area but this tended to fill up with college students on the weekend. The hotel was easy to navigate and you had the option of walking through the casino area or exiting onto the strip through the shopping precinct of the hotel. The Fashion Show Mall was just across the road via a bridge overpass from the Wynn. Absolute luxury in a prime location. It connects with the Venetian and you are able to use their pools. My kids loved watching the Sirens of TI at night. We loved our stay and would recommend to anyone traveling with children. (No charge for children under 12). I have stayed at The Mirage and TI. This was the first time traveling with my family and The Palazzo was luxury and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, needs some polishing”
Reviews.Author: julbull73
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is an amazing hotel. The casino is extremely easy to navigate through, and while you still have to go through it to get to the elevators, its simply, quick and easy. Unlike some casinos that are either so massive or so labyrinthine that it makes getting to your room challenging, especially for first time vistors. The Pallazzo does not have this issue. The rooms are gorgeous, we got an upgrade to the 2 bedroom suite our first night and we were blown away. The rest of our trip was spent in the much smaller but equally impressive standard suite. The rooms are large, spacious, and extremely clean and well taken care of. The remote control curtains were nice as well as an actual thermostat in the room. However, it seemed to struggle to keep up, or turned off randomly in the night. The only downside was the service flip-flopped from amazing to questionable. Our upgrade was nice, however, the lost luggage following our move to another room was not. Turns out they put someone in our room, before they sent an employee to get our bags. When we called and asked, they went to the room we were supposed to be moved to and found it was also occupied by somebody else! Thankfully things were resolved and we did recieve a $50 credit to make up for it. However, it's clear they either have some gaps in customer service or a lot of new people who will get better as they work here. All in all it was a great stay. I'd highly recommend it. But would definitely try and do it for a low rate. We got ours for ~$80 a night, which would be about right, but I'm pretty cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Large, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ratnrol
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palazzo for a total of four nights. We were generally impressed with the cleanliness and lack of smoke in the casino and hotel. In order to better organize my thoughts I have tried breaking down out experience into sections; Check-in: The line went fairly quick and we were greeted by a front desk person that did not really seem to enjoy what they did. I had considered asking for a complimentary upgrade ($20 trick) but was not getting a great vibe so did not bother. We had asked for a King bed, non-smoking in a quiet location. We received everything and were happy that they put us at the end of one of the halls. The instructions to find our room from the lobby were easy. Casino We did not gamble this trip (we generally do not gamble). We were however very impressed with the high ceilings and ventilation system. We are non-smokers and this casino felt almost smoke free. The casino itself is spacious and you never felt crowded walking through it. Lux Cafe: We ordered food from our room and picked it up from the Grand Lux Cafe. This was extremely convenient and very fairly priced. We also ate dinner at this restaurant but this is not covered in this review. Room: The room is very large and nicely laid out. The beds were comfortable. We found the rooms to be clean. Would have liked to be able to remove the contents from the fridge to put our water, etc in but the goodies are on censors. Once removed they are billed to your room. When the doors shut, they are extremely loud. I tried to ease our shut but they still slammed (sorry neighbors). It helped being at the end of the hallway as the foot traffic was minimized and we found it quite quiet (except the doors). We stayed on the 39th floor. Continental Breakfast We received eight certificates for free breakfasts. The breakfast area is located on the 2nd floor by the Palazzo shops. This breakfast is much but if you want something quick then it may be enough. They served coffee, juice, pastries and fruit (orange, banana and apple). Otherwise don't bother. It was never very busy. I did find out that there is free internet in this area of the Palazzo 'mall' so that was nice to be able to have a coffee and check emails etc. Pool Sun came around the buildings around 11:45 to 12:00. Never had troubles finding chairs. We sat at a smaller pool area with half the loungers reserved for cabanas. This worked well as the pool was never crowded. I wish there was a smoking and non-smoking section. I used to be a smoker and don't enjoy being around it at all. Some smokers are considerate, while other not so much. We had a bite to eat at the pool. We had to go and order the food ourselves, pool side service was non-existent. I really expected more. I don't mind paying more for food by the pool. But the food quality was much like you would get at a cheap diner. Would not eat there again on our stay. Concierge: Extremely helpful and friendly! Bellman: We wanted to catch the Palazzo shuttle to the airport. We explained to the bellman(s) there was a supervisor and bellman there that we needed to get the airport to catch our plane. The shuttle comes every hour on the hour and we were told that we did not miss it. 20 mins later we inquired again. We were then told the next shuttle comes in another 40 mins! What, didn't you see us standing there after you told us it was coming shortly? Overall, I hope my posting of our experience did not just focus on the negatives. Overall we had a fantastic time and would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Cambria2002
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and have never had a bad experience. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable - wonderful beds. I love the bathroom, wish I could take it home with me. Great service. We always ask for extra hangers - they are delivered immediately. We ususally ask for a light blanket - again, it is delivered immediately. Room service is always prompt. There is really nothing negative to say about it. It's a great hotel. Okay, here is a negative - the internet is $12.95 a day. That is too much.

Reviews.Title: “World's largest hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gemonholidays
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Palazzo for 5 nights for a work trip and it was amazing. We stayed on the 45th floor and had a view of most of Vegas. The staff were really nice. Most of the restaurants were really nice and provided nice food with good portions. It is close to everything, within walking distance to a lot of other hotels. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A top choice to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hula_monk3y
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a beautiful place to stay and is one of the newer additions to the strip. We stayed in a spacious suite which had great decor and was very clean. The staff here are super helpful and really when above and beyond to help us when we needed to print out ticket confirmations for a show last minute and the printer in the common area was broken. I would absolutely recommend staying here - it's a treat in addition to the whole Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't try to sleep in this Hotel but I guess Vegas is not for sleeping anyway”
Reviews.Author: Steffen_Holzt
Reviews.Content: Nice and very large rooms, this is a mega hotel. Breakfast is good and relatively cheap compared to other Hotels. Very good location. Issue is that between the people coming home between midnight and 3 am, and the guys checking out at 6 am, you have abt 3 hours of sleep. People banging doors all day around. I was there for 4 days and it was the same every day despite people around me checking in and out, so I was not just unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room and views - loved the Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: everyshadeofblue
Reviews.Content: I had no idea how nice the rooms were at this hotel! Walking in the door you are greeted with a beautiful bedroom area with a few steps down into a sunken living room wit ha large L shaped couch, desk, and TV. There are a total of 3 TVs in the rooms - bed area, living room, and bathroom. I could never find a remote for the bathroom TV so I never did get to turn it on. Check in was a hassle as we checked in at 3pm but was told our room was not ready and we would be given a call with the room number when it was. By 5pm we were getting irritated and went back to the front desk where they told us they called but we knew they hadn't. No message, no nothing. They did make up for it by allowing us a noon checkout instead of 11am so that was nice. Like I mentioned, the room is stunning with remote controlled drapes, a comfy couch, and very comfortable bed. Flat screen TVs throughout. The room could have been cleaned better as we found lots of crumbs on the couch. Had a beautiful view of the Wynn/Encore, including their landscaping and breathtaking golf course. The bathroom is also amazing with a separate shower and tub and small vanity with makeup mirror. The bath products are lemony delicious and smell like something I'd eat! A great vanity kit is included with the motherlode - a sewing kit that I'll never use!!! You know you are in a nice hotel if you get one of those :) The Palazzo is crowded and noisy but not as bad as other mid-strip properties. We ate at Table 10 for lunch the next day before going down to the Canyon Ranch spa. Table 10 was good for lunch and not too unreasonable. Canyon Ranch spa was also very nice although I prefer the spa at Aria. I would definitely stay here again and despite a few small issues this was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The suite was larger than a townhouse I lived in”
Reviews.Author: luv2golfDenver
Reviews.Content: Whoa....What a really nice suite. Place was huge. Like 1000 sq feet? Very very nice room. Nicest room we have stay in Vegas for $300. Highly recommend. Great pool too... Tthe Grand Luxe cafe, located in the hotel, was awesome!!! Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hote, But Not For Us!”
Reviews.Author: mfinn
Reviews.Content: We received a offer for up to four free nights at either the Venetian or the Palazzo through Carnival Cruise Lines, so we opted for the Palazzo for three nights instead of four since the Sat. before was not available through the offer. We had already spent three nights at another property prior to our stay at the Palazzo and had our air booked. We checked in around 3:00 PM on a Sunday. The line was enormous (reminded me of a airport security or an amusement park line) and little did we know, that we could have gone through the express line for invited guests. We found this out after we checked in, which took approx 40 mins.. We were given a choice of a top floor room with a view of the golf course/mountains or a strip view suite and were placed on the 32rd floor. The property is very nice and clean, but large as with any mega resort in Vegas. We were very happy with our room and had a good view of the Treasure Island and pools below, although our window was so dirty that we could hardly see out of it. The bed was very comfortable and there were adequate pillows and lighting, although the lights have individual switches and a main switch that controls all the lights. This was a little tricky. The blinds and curtains were operated via remote control, which was nice. There were three televisions in the suite, all flat screens. The sectional sofa was very comfortable and was a nice touch since we could actually sit in a living room type of setting and enjoy a television program without laying on the bed. The bathroom was huge, even though the tub faces the opposite direction of the television, so you would not be able to bathe and watch television if that's your thing. The shower was nice, with very good pressure. We did not pay the resort fee with our offer, so we didn't use the spa or heath club. We also didn't go to the pools so we cannot comment on that, although there are several to choose from and we could have used the Venetian's as well. We did eat lunch at Lagasse's Stadium and it was just O.K.. I wouldn't go back there for the food, although it's a nice sports bar. We were given a pass for four to the night club at the Palazzo ($120 value). The pass was attached to the room info. given to us at check-in, so when we gave it to our waitress so she knew which room to charge our lunch to at Lagasse's, she kept it, so we were not able to go there. We played a bit in the casino, but didn't have much luck. The parking lot is all underground and is a nightmare. There are sensors on each floor to indicate the number of spots available on each level which is kind of nice, but we had a very hard time finding a parking place and be prepared to walk a lot. Overall, this property is very nice, but it's just not for us. We prefer a smaller, more intimate property with less pretentious patrons. We would stay at the Palazzo only if it were comped again, but would not pay to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “never stay here unless you want a dirty room”
Reviews.Author: alexwmpk
Reviews.Content: we checked into the room and had a bed that was slept in and ashes on our coffe table. from 2pm till 1 am, and after 3 phone calls, we still did not get anyone to clean our room or at least switch us to a clean room. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and Elegant, good gym and spa services”
Reviews.Author: liawim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for three nights, and were very pleased. The resort fee ($19 per night) included WiFi and gym access, which was perfect for us. The room was huge, we had an awesome view, a comfortable bed and good shops and restaurants. We used some of the spa services and were pleased with them. The gym was ok, it had some weights, lots of cardio machines, and TechnoGym equipment. The pool area was great too. In the spa area there was a restaurant where you could find a good healthy breakfast, protein drinks etc. As with everything in LV, they make you pay for everything else, such as TV, $5 for a bottle of water etc. Also, the bathroom in our room was not clean, which was rather disgusting. Still, we were happy with our choice of hotel and would recommend it to anyone going to LV.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Rook3rs
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here in 2009, we were looking forward to another good trip. However it started badly with our luggage not being delivered to our room after almost 4 hours despite three telephone calls from myself, the Executive Lounge Concierge and the Duty Manager. I eventually got it back from the Bell Desk and took it to our room myself. Secondly the Executive lounge was very busy and seemd understaffed. At the evening session you had to queue for some time for drinks and the food disappeared as soon as it was put out and there seemed to be a lack of staff to replace it. Again queues formed and long waits were the outcome. It was not very relaxing. The hotel rooms are huge with good views and the Executive staff, including the Concierges, were very good in difficult circumstances. Although the pool area is quite extensive, the fact that they now put sun loungers in the shallow areas of the pool limits its use as it is not possible to sit in the water in these areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms. But we had bad service, so learn from our misfortunes”
Reviews.Author: LA996
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo rooms are definitely nice and spacious. However when we opened the window shades, the entire window was blocked by an enormous 12ft tall air conditioner. It was impossible to see anything out the window except for a small patch of blue sky if you looked straight up. Poor layout to stick a customer with that crappy of a window view. No need for window shades with that huge a/c in the way. Make sure you don't get stuck with a "no view" room like we did on the 5th floor. Our room also did not have any "do not disturb" or "maid service" tags for the door. Of course I didn't notice until I was about to go to bed, so I wasn't about to call the front desk and have to wait up in bed just to get them delivered. When we left the room to get lunch the next morning, we returned late at night to find that our room had not been made up! My wife or I did not hear anyone knocking on our door in the morning for maid service, and I also saw housekeeping down the hall when we walked out of the room for lunch. I guess they didn't think it was necessary to clean our room. Make sure to request maid service, otherwise you'll have to re-use all the towels that were left on the floor the day before. Our last night we were up extremely late in the Palazzo casino gambling at the tables. By the time I went to bed late, I called the front desk to see if I could get a late checkout of 12noon instead of the normal 11am checkout, but they refused my request. That is the first time I've ever been denied a late checkout when I had been gambling late at the hotel's casino. To top it all off, I had to valet my car the night before because their parking lot was too full to even find a spot in self park. I picked up my Audi from the valet service and stopped to get gas. As soon as I walked over to the passenger side I noticed a huge scratch on the passenger side front wheel where it appears the valet drove right into a curb. I am 100% sure it wasn't there before as I am meticulous about my cars, but it appears that's the risk you take using a valet at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: georgiaananias
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay. We have stayed in numerous hotels in Vegas and were very disappointed in this hotel. Our room was a disaster. Lights out, paint chipped, dirty sheets, holes in sheets, electrical outlets not working, mirror decorations toren off mirrors and last by not least ,a metal strip came out of our mattress. Tried to speak to the hotel manager but they didn't get him instead produced the Front Desk Manager Jonathan James. He was not sympathetic and he said the only thing he could do was discount our bill for one night stay of $50.00. He refused to give my a copy of my written complaint and I ask him to have the manager contact us but he didn't. Do not stay at this hotel as they are letting it run down. There are many other fantastic hotels near by, try one of them. There is not customer service here!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great fun...can't wait to do it again”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyMidwest
Reviews.Content: OK, so I read all the reviews before I booked the Palazzo. I was nervous because I hate bad service. I can put up with a ton of stuff, but bad service is just a thing of mine. To my delight, the staff of this huge mega-titanic hotel was awesome. I could not have asked for better service. The line was pretty long when we checked in...but they had all hands on deck and zipped us right through. The suite was outstanding! Very comfortable. We used room service on a few of our "out all night and we need breakfast" episodes and the food was perfect. Yes, it is not cheap to eat...or for that matter do anything in Vegas anymore. So be sure to bring your bank card. We spent our days at Tao Beach, which is part of the Venetian but shared by the Palazzo...Tao Beach was great because we wanted a no kids vacation and you get that in the Tao. Lots of drinks...they keep them coming. This place is expensive too...week days was $200 min and Sat was $500 min. But the two of us spent more than the min each day with drinks and food. Overall a great place, will def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo was ok.”
Reviews.Author: twhite4809
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Palzzo for 4 nights on business/pleasure. First up check-in took forever; my first time staying here so I did not have the "VIP" card which allows you to bypass the line. My room was very nice by Vegas or any other standards. Getting to the room was another issue. As do so many of these Vegas behemoths, the floor plan is such that you have to wander through the casino to get to the elevator bank. I ate at several of the restaurants in the hotel and they were good, but not great for the $$$. The nicest place to eat in the hotel is at the sports bar; not exactly a restaurant, but a fun place to hang out. While it is a nice hotel, I would not stay here again as there are so many other better places for the price in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Fabulous! Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: hillary210
Reviews.Content: I will sing to the end of times, this is a great place... a true service-oriented place that is luxurious, clean and attentive to their customers. The rooms are truly beautiful and well decorated. The beds are comfortable and you really feel like someone special here at the Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “Flamingo Grand vacations Hilton, not your typical Hilton property!!!”
Reviews.Author: hillary210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 4 nights, I am a Hilton Honors meember and travel quite a bit. I usually stay at the hilton family properties. I was devistated at the site of these rooms. the decor was 1970's style, old! The smell was OLD. There was a tub that encompassed the room, which is strange, not sure why it was there. The website did not represent the room at all. The halls were hot, it just looked like a old hotel, very disappointing!!

Reviews.Title: “First stay... unsure if I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: kekaimalu22
Reviews.Content: First time stay... I usually stay at the Bellagio but wanted to give this hotel a try. Booked Luxury Suite but given upgrade to Bella Suite at check-in. Thanks!!! What other members have stated in previous posts is true. From the moment you step into the hotel, perfumed air is strong and can be overbearing at times. Room was very large and beautiful, overlooked Strip and TI. Loved the large flat-screen TVs in the living room and bedroom areas. Beds were pillow-top and comfy. Bathroom was very large and beautiful too, but I didn't particularly like the toilet room. It was way too dark. I did not like the shower because the water pressure was low and the water temperature wasn't hot enough. I realize that this is a LEED-certified building and all, but I love my scalding hot water and strong water pressure. Another issue in bathroom is that it is hard to view the television from the tub. Disappointed with the room service. Once I ordered the fish & chips and the fries were way overdone. I thought I'd try again, and the same thing happened again! Gave cleanliness 4/5 since room wasn't thoroughly cleaned. I found menu items from previous occupants in nightstand. No luck in the casino *sob*. Maybe I am biased because I am partial to the Bellagio, but overall this stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Even the nice places have there issues”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple89
Reviews.Content: I really can not elaborate since it has been over year since we stayed here. All i can say is very disatisfied. Customer service horrible make sure if you add on a night and you pay cash to keep your hotel voucher or else they will charge directly towards your credit card. Its not the Westward Ho of Vegas but the Hallways sure smelt like it. Horrible late night smell. The rooms where very nice spacious and appealing. Thats about all i can say that is positive oh and Grand Luxe Cafe thats a good place to eat. Dos Caminos not so good. overcooked meat not my favorite.Other than that if you want to enjoy the prude be my guest.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect great service or management who really care.”
Reviews.Author: Fi0na1965
Reviews.Content: We reserved 3 rooms for 2 nights. One room was not ready until late in the afternoon, although checkin is at 3.00pm. On Sunday one of the rooms was not cleaned. I called at 8.00pm to ask them to come and clean the room, the response was, they were busy and it would take another 45 mins. We were never able to get the wireless internet in the room to work either. I expect better service and better management responses at a hotel like the Pallazo. This is probably the last time we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantatsic!”
Reviews.Author: Hash Brown
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the end June. We had a luxury suite on the 32nd floor and this was fantastic. The room itself was huge with a sunken living room area and a view looking out towards the Wynn and it's Golf course. The bed was so comfortable you kind of didn't want to get out of it and go and walk in the Vegas heat! The only downside to the room was that there were one or two stains on the sofa and carpet but it really didn't affect our stay whatsoever. The rest of the hotel is beautiful and I would recommend anyone to stay here if they can. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo and T.I previously and they are both very nice too but this place is on another level!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Spot”
Reviews.Author: nesabay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our 2 year anniversary. It was perfect for the occasion. The room was amazing. I have never stayed at the Venetian, but according to other people the Palazzo's rooms are a newer and bigger version. The bathroom was my favorite part, if I could redo that bathroom in my home I would. I also got the best night's rest, the beds were amazing. The food is pricey as expected for Vegas. The best part is that it is connected to the Venetian so we had easy access to the Canal Shoppes and the many restaurants there. The casino is really no different than any other casino in Vegas, however, the lobby was gorgeous. I have stayed in many hotels in Vegas and this by far was one of my favorites. It was a perfect way to celebrate our anniversary and was very happy with the selection.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge / Prestige Floor - My Choice!”
Reviews.Author: SJaneSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Palazzo is truly an oasis of affordable luxury. The rooms are extremely quiet, cool - simply wonderful. Decor is a bit more Italian modern than the Venetian rooms. Rooms provide a lovely respite from the vegas strip. Beds are very comfy and bedding is lovely. I stayed with a gal friend a night prior to a business event in Vegas (at another hotel) and we were so happy for two of us sharing 2 queen beds and that luxurious bathroom. We actually slept in and enjoyed our room as much as the location. Check in at the prestige floor is worth every penny - especially if there is a convention here. Pools are wonderful and we went early to find a quiet niche with our morning adult beverages. Special concierge lounge provided a better than continental breakfast, lovely champagne at noon or later check in, and a long happy hour with beverages that is amazing. The happy hour snacks are sometimes enough for dinner when i travel here alone. If you are in the mood to be treated exquisitely - this is the place. This was my 3rd stay at the Palazzo Congierge and I look forward to my next visit. Location is easy walk to Fashion Show Mall and plenty to see and do in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Trip to the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: BankerLisa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our four night stay at the Palazzo, from Thursday through Monday. We really enjoyed this property - it wasn't too big (we stayed at the MGM last year, and boy was that big), it was clean, the pools were nice, and the room was very nice. Service at the hotel was good, considering the size of the property. Although check in too a little longer than we would have liked, especially since it was 1 am, we were upgraded to a strip-view room and the 20+ minute wait was instantly forgotten. Room service generally took about a half hour, sometimes more. Housekeeping was round-the-clock and efficient. The pools were clean and empty chairs were quickly cleared of left-behind towels. We had no problems finding loungers at any time of day. Cocktail servers around the pool were few and far between, but the bar was a short walk away. There were a number of kids in the main pool, but few in the smaller surrounding pools. Overall, a very relaxing atmosphere, which is what we were looking for. The casino was smaller than other properties, but less crowded. Cocktail service was just OK. The property location was good for us - close enough to center strip to walk most places that we wanted to. Overall, I'd highly recommend the property for a lower-key Vegas experience - which is exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AP10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quiet, clean, large & beautifully decorated. The kids had a great time using the pools. I would ask about upgrading your room when checking in. We got a much large suite for a fraction of the cost. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing With a Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: billabong00217
Reviews.Content: --I have been staying at the Palazzo for over 3 years now. Going to Las Vegas since I was 6 months old ; ) Everytime is different, I have yet to encounter a Las Vegas trip that is the same. --The Palazzo is located in a very reasonable spot in the heart of The Strip. It is an add on from the Ventian but has an "new" sense to it. The Pool is composed of many different pools or different size and temp. The pool is very clean, relaxing, and has more space, so you don't feel like a sardine. :) The bathrooms in the Palazzo are to die for. Mini T.V.'s, clear shower, relaxing bath tub/jacuzzi, and very open space. The beds are VERY comfortable and big. I love the way the bed area and the living area are connected but on different levels. Gives the room a "bigger" appeal and makes the room very open and welcoming. I love these rooms I would recommend them for couples on a romantic getaway for families that want a relaxing vacation. --Fashion Show Mall is right across from the Palazzo with AMAZING shopping for anyone with a reasonable price range and style. Also the Palazzo has access to Treasure Island, the Wynn, and is in walking distance of the entire strip hotels. --Amazing location, freindly service, great rooms, and many more other amenities to insure a great trip for anyone. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room/amenities, great restaurants, higher minimums but would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: yankeegirlfriend
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed on a promotion for our birthdays. Room was not available at check-in at 3pm which we figured was because they gave the rooms to guests paying full prices first, then to promotional guests, but that was ok since we were hungry anyway. Room was very CLEAN ( I check mattresses, bathroom nooks and crannies, under cushions...), decent view of golfcourse, crowd was pretty quiet, but we still didn't sleep very well. Rooms have sensors in them I believe(they are a very green hotel) and if you do not move alot while sleeping A/C would not turn on throughout night-so we got a bit warm at times-this may also be because the room is so large that it doesn't cool well in spite of the heavy drapery and Roman sun shade. Furthermore I think the comforter and sheets, though luxurious, were heavier than is required in that climate. HOWEVER, the room was absolutely gorgeous and well appointed (LOVE the shower). Be prepared as the casino had higher minimums than most other less luxurious casinos, but we knew that would be the case and still played there. We ate at CUT, Canaletto, and Carnevino there at the Palazzo/Venetian. Hubby likes steaks but I normally choose something else but I decided to try the Filet at CUT and was extremely pleased with all the food there (try the heavenly Yukon potatoes and Australian beef), Carnevino was a bit of a disappointment though service was great-filet was requested medium but came welldone, which was a shame because it was a really lovely cut of meat. Canaletto was excellent-large portions, fresh seafood, intricate flavors, decent prices-fantastic. Palazzo also offers a fantastic service to check you in for certain airlines and check your bags there at the hotel-a real time saver and worth the extra few bucks not to drag your bags to the airport and stand in line there... Overall, we would definitely stay here again, and were sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TenerAmy
Reviews.Content: The trip was great from start to finish. We checked on the 4th of July and check in was busy but ran smoothly and quickly. At check in we were upgraded to a room with a view on the 43rd floor! It was an amazing view of the pools! The room was spotless and well maintained. All of the features and amenities are amazing! We also got coupons for a free continental breakfast. Good for getting a free cup of coffee and some pastries. Nothing hot but great for fruit and a sweet treat in the morning. We spent a lot of time in the Sports Book @ Lagasse's Stadium and it was great fun for the World Cup Games. Happy hour Specials are great in the hotel especially there and at Dos Caminos. The fresh salsas and guacamole are out of this world! Grand Lux food items are great and well priced. Huge portions! consider sharing items. We rented at cabana at Azure pool which was amazing! Definitely money well spent! Service is outstanding! We loved our stay and can't wait to go back! Canyon Ranch breakfast is great and fresh. We used the gym and the resort fee is well worth if you use the gym and great to have internet access in room. Office set up in the room is great and perfect for looking up where to eat dinner and making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOMS BUT BEWARE: KIDS, KIDS, AND MORE KIDS”
Reviews.Author: mimibel77
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an adult trip minus tons of families with their small children, most under 5 years old, don't stay at the Palazzo. I am sure summer time is the worst time of year because of the crowds; but literally, we saw lines of people, mostly families, standing in a queue for the elevators to get to their rooms. We did not see this type of congestion in any of the other hotels we went into. The rooms are gorgeous and big. Very clean and beautiful. If you are a family with small children, this probably is a good option for you. But if you are a young couple looking for a romantic stay... forget about it. Not unless you mind screaming children EVERYWHERE. You would think you were at Circus Circus. And the pool would have been awesome, except for that it was filled with nearly 100 kids all screaming and monopolizing the entire space. The water wasn't even cold. We stayed by the pool for 30 min and tried to lay in the sun, but couldn't even step foot in it. It was so overcongested, there were large circles of film everywhere on the surface of the water. We decided to avoid the pool the rest of the stay. Our second night, we went to Lavo for dinner. Everything was great until I got my Chicken Marsala which was overpriced at $28 and horribly prepared. It tasted like it was in a salty, sticky, barbeque soy sauce base. I couldn't even get it down. We sat outside and were disturbed by the annoying Treasure Island show that had yelling and explosions going on across the street. My advice if you are looking for an adult five star experience... go to the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill...”
Reviews.Author: rubyflash
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Venetian and Palazzo before and enjoyed our trip very much. This time was different. We always go with a special offer and the room is comped. We went to the Invited Check-in, as usual, and they had ONE person there. We waited for over 1/2 hour and finally one of the regular check in people waived us over. They didn't offer any upgrades (which I would have done), and the woman was NOT friendly at all. Our slot host was not working for Palazzo anymore and when I asked who would be our host, they said "Just see anyone at the desk" So much for the personal service we enjoyed in the past. The valets were abrupt, the waiters were brusk. Overall, they did nothing to make us feel welcome. I guess we'll go back the the MGM properties....

Reviews.Title: “Beautfiul...Simply Beautfiul”
Reviews.Author: rgupta0747
Reviews.Content: When we went there, we were surprised. The lobby was gorgeous with beautiful statues and fountains. The concierge service was a bit rude and wasn't very caring of our suitcases, but that didn't bother us. The hotel suite that we stayed in was beautiful. This was our first time staying in a suite in Las Vegas and we enjoyed it immensely. The bed was soft, the LCD screen was clear, and the electronic drapes were new for us. The best part was that the hotel was connected to the stores of the Venetian. We were able to walk right to the Venetian were we saw the Phantom. Very nice hotel. We got a cheap rate and we will definitely stay there again, even if it means spending a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms. Service, not so great.”
Reviews.Author: debmcl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Palazzo over the 4th of July weekend. The room was really beautiful, but the service at the hotel wasn't great. We waited in line for 40 minutes to check into our room, and this was after midnight! There were originally three people checking in guests, but even with the line for check-in very long, one left a few minutes after we arrived. Then when we finally made it to the front of the line, they would not honor the rate that we had been promised based on our comp offer. We were told to check with the guest service center, which we did. When we checked with the guest service center, we were told that we would have to call the reservation line the next day and ask to speak to a supervisor, which we did. When we called the reservation line and asked to speak to a supervisor, we were put on hold for 20 minutes while the supervisor listened to the recording of our original call to make our reservation, THEN they adjusted our rate to the one that we were originally quoted. Not fun. Also, we missed out on a free massage because guest services did not give us any information about the bonus being offered for first time players at the resort. We were only informed of the available bonuses when we cashed out our points as we left, which was too late for us to take advantage of a pretty cool offer. If it is your first time to play at the Palazzo, ask for details about the tiered bonuses for new players. The food at the Grand Lux and at the Mexican restaurant were really good, we enjoyed both and would definitely eat at both again. FYI, there is free wireless access at the coffee shop on the second floor. Coupon code smarter40 gets you 40% off Blue Man Group tickets through the summer. Buy the cheapest tickets available because everyone is upgraded to best available seats if the venue isn't sold out, which is usually the case. We bought tickets for the Saturday of the 4th of July weekend the day of the show and were upgraded to the most expensive seats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, but its still a casino in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ScribblesLongBeachCA
Reviews.Content: Our reservations were made less than 12 hours prior to our arrival - this is not a planned trip. I booked 2 suites; one for the grandparents. The suites are amazing; we were given a very high floor (47) and the view was stunning. The suites are huge, well-appointed, clean and comfortable. The bed was comfortable and the room was SUPER quiet other than the fact that the one-ton doors slam shut all night. Grandparents were in awe. The casino appeared to be average, I thought maybe on the small side. Dining options were good - location next to the shops was great. Too many 20-something amatuer drinkers running around by Friday night, but that's Las Vegas. The price is outrageous - over $350 per suite per night but it was the weekend. I would recommend going during the week, you will not be disappointed if you pay the week-day prices. We did not go to the pool but I have a feeling it was a zoo. All in all, this is a great hotel but unless you are totally in love with Las Vegas and all it represents, its just another casino with really nice rooms. Service ok; wireless STILL not free. But nothing in Vegas is.....

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL, WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: jilly912
Reviews.Content: WOW, WOW, WOW, is all I can start out with. The Palazzo was a great choice for me to have picked for my first time in Vegas. It was wonderful from the moment I arrived to the moment I left. Check in was a breeze with all smiles as I got to the invited guest check-in line courtesy of the Palazzo I was upgraded to the Fortuna Suite on the 44th Floor. I must add though my Fiancée and I arrived to Vegas around 10:30pm due to delays with Delta airlines (NEVER FLY DELTA TO VEGAS) just had to add that note in this comment. Now getting back to the Palazzo check- in was fast and easy helpful with any questions I had as well as explaining to me the Vouchers that were giving to me with the deal I got with Delta (ONLY GOOD PART ABOUT THE DELTA VACATIONS Packages). I would Highly recommended the Palazzo at the Venetian. The Room was huge and beautiful, we were upgraded to the Fortuna Room which I mention before and it had a view to remember. I would love to thank Theresa M for making my trip a trip to remember forever, she was wonderful and was on top of all my request and more. I have to add this though giving the beauty of the hotel and the ambience of it all it is a walk to the Bellagio, MGM and all those other big name hotels we all know Vegas for BUT, I would not have changed my reservation for anything in the world because this hotel made up for the walk double time. I enjoyed the indoor Gondola ride which was amazing, the host were on point and friendly and the "Driver" of the Gondola was really nice he sang to us while to drifted off to the "Little" world of Venice, The Venetian did a wonderful job with their hotels, the details were just immaculate. I could go on and on about the Palazzo/Venetian but it would take five pages and more to give all details. I just tell my fellow Trip Advisor readers THAT THE Palazzo/Venetian is the place to stay, it might not be cut out for everyone as some may think it is to Upscale for their taste but hey why not try it I LOVED IT.. NOW FOR ALL YOU UNFAIR WRITERS OUT THERE: I don’t think that you should take out your frustration out on people who are just doing there job at the hotel, if you want extra Towels and all the little nonsense that people type THEN JUST BRING IT YOUR SELF. These are jobs that people have to maintain for their families and so on not your personal SLAVE, if you want to hire them to be at your beckon call then ask them if they want a side job and PAY OUT YOUR OWN POCKETS OR DO IT YOUR SELF. There are a lot of Readers that follow what others have to say on Trip advisor and I am ONE OF THEM and I hate it when I read something so simple and it is made SUCH A HUGE DEAL and someone is nagging over NONSENSE. Now if it is really horrible then YES us readers would love to hear/see about it other than that, save the BS please. So for all those that are interested in the Palazzo go for it is BEAUTIFUL I LOVED IT and I know you would too.

Reviews.Title: “decandance for adults”
Reviews.Author: theredcentre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the concierge suite with a great view of the strip. The hotel is new so it is fresh and still has that nice new feeling.The room was huge with a fabulous bathroom, no spa but seperate toilet room which is always good. Very comfortable beds and lots of room with two boys aged 9 & 11. Seperate sunken living room area with another big TV handy for kids. The room service food was excellent big serves and very good food. We really enjoyed the cocktail hour compimentary in the Concierge level, and stayed a couple of hours enjoyed cocktils and wines had llots of niibbles. The pool areas are well done but still crowded. Overall thumbs up and I would stay agian definitley. Vegas is always better without the kids though. The best bit is the Ranch spa , it is the best I have ever been to ..and I do love spas!!

Reviews.Title: “Not this time...”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninPT
Reviews.Content: I love Las Vegas. And I love Las Vegas hotels. So I am an easy sell to start. I’ve stayed up and down the Strip going back to the 80s. Some good, some bad. I first stayed at the Palazzo in September of 2008 and was amazed. The room was enormous. The bathroom had a television. I was on the concierge floor and there were free drinks and hors d’ouevres! Even a “special” elevator. I couldn’t wait to come back. The Bellagio, fountains and all had been replaced in my affections. This time, the Palazzo wasn’t so great. Back in September, because the line for check-in was long, they opened up more of the counters and escorted people out of the line to check them in. Not this time. Easily a twenty minute wait. Not so special. Turns out I shouldn’t have waited in line at all but gone directly up to the concierge level to check in. Oh well, if there were a next time. The room was still large and the TV was still in the bathroom. The concierge lounge was overcrowded and the harried staff seemed unable to keep up with the demand. Plates littered with crumbs sat next to empty glasses. The Bellagio – even Planet Hollywood started to look a lot better. Then our bad experience with the restaurant Zine downstairs, and an unnerving incident with someone smoking in the hallway of our non-smoking floor (I complained and received an apology from the hotel) the Palazzo didn’t seem so special or luxurious, just pretty expensive and ordinary. We even had problems getting the wi-fi to work on two computers. With so many other places to stay in this category and at this price, I’ll try others before coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Be sure of all small print”
Reviews.Author: las012
Reviews.Content: We had booked into the venezia hotel, had paid in advance. Upon arrival we went to the room to find it dirty, soiled linens, frayed couches. Went back to reservations- who informed us for an upgrade of $45.00 plus $17.50 per day resort fee- we would be moved to another room. Or for $100.00 per day we would be moved to the palazzo with all the big extras. Which of course we did. HOwever, there were not much extras to go to -the Azure pool, to get a chair you had to spend $50.00. Beware of slick reservation people, - hang unto your wallets. The room we had upgraded to which I may add cost us an extra $200.00 per night was not much better than the original one. Buyer Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Newer Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernGuy13
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Las Vegas for her birthday celebration and stayed at the Palazzo. We found the hotel to be very nicely appointed. We did not get the anticipated upgrade when we checked in but were pleased with the standard suite. The service is good and the concierge staff goes out of their way to assist. Well ventilated casino. We did not try the pool - too much else to do in Vegas. The included continental breakfast is uninspiring but helps gets you started for all that walking. Overall we were pleased with the palazzo and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Free Rooms Ever!”
Reviews.Author: pgirl1
Reviews.Content: I was invited to a free slot tournament with three free nights. We got in late (after 11 p.m.) and were upgraded to the Sienna Suite (about 1400 square feet which included an excercise room) free of charge. I originally asked for a room close to an elevator but was told the hotel was nearly sold out so we were instead upgraded. I gave the very helpful gentleman a $10 bill AFTER he upgraded us. Nice! Room was superb. Bigger than my first house. Bathrooms were amazing. Shower was big enough for 4 people (didn't try that). Bed and pillows were amazing! Best sleep I have had on a trip. We were on the 47th floors with beautiful views of the Wynn golf course and the Las Vegas landscape. Kept the blinds up most of the time for the great view. Service was wonderful. Ate at Del Torro with a $50 gift certificate purchased for $25 at 3oclock.com. Food was good, service by waitress a little lacking but the manager/person in charge filled our requests. We sat out front on the patio with a view of the TI outdoor pirate show. Very nice. Jersey Boys is one of the best shows available in Vegas second only to the Cirque LOVE show.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility and room, good service”
Reviews.Author: ParkandGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference and really enjoyed it. It is our 4th trip to Las Vegas and this was definitely the nicest room we've had. Our 48th floor room was well cleaned, beautiful, quiet, and had great view of the Wynn and golf course. The maid service was excellent. The bed was comfy and that velvet sectional was way better than your average hotel seating area. The casino was ok. We didn't really like the table games much, but enjoyed it and were kept in drinks by the staff. The hotel conference services were ok at best. The food was really plain and sparse. They seemed to be encouraging you to go back into the hotel restaurants and shops to eat and buy drinks and coffee. The Canyon Ranch Spa was great. We paid the $20 to use the Aquavana and both enjoyed it. It was thrifty compared to losing money at the Casino! There were great restaurants here with CUT being the best. If you are on a budget, look online for the happy hour food specials and take advantage of them. Grand Lux also had good breakfast, the only meal we ate there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: saje26
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas. I stayed at the Palazzo Hotel, which is connected to the Venetian. I loved my stay! I would definitely go back and stay there again. I loved everything about it. I traveled with my fiend and we had originally booked a king with a sofa bed, but when we got there, we asked for a double bed suite and they upgraded us for free. The room was immaculate. The des and bedding were so comfortabl. The bathrooms were very nice. The water pressure was a little low in the bathroom, but there was 3 flatscreen tv's in the room. We had an ok view. I've been to several 4 and 5 star hotls and this was by far the best. There was a mall in the hotel and shops. The area with the mall and shops was set up like an Italian village. There was over 30 restaurants to choose from. The customer service was excellent. My only complaint was the contenintal breakfast was subpar for a hotel of this caliber. They had apples, oranges, and rotten bananas, which is unacceptable. they also had pastirs and juice. I choose to eat in the Grand Lx Cafe, which had excellent food and a wonderful breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “No Comparison with other comparable hotels on the strip”
Reviews.Author: CallaBudgie
Reviews.Content: I was booked there for a conference. The room seemed to me dark even at bright sunlight. The furniture is supposed to be italian (venetian) design but it is just dark. Probably this is the american designers impression of the palaces of the venetian duke. The windows (at least compared with Wynn and Encore) are small. Service was ok but not overly attentive. Good food at a couple of restaurants at the resort though.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met”
Reviews.Author: SeattleHawkeye
Reviews.Content: I had booked after reading the reviews, and was spending more than I really wanted to so I expected a lot. I got it. The room was huge and very nice, the staff friendly, the shops fun to walk through, the food was good to great, the casino was fun, the maid service was very good. Other than the room the high point was Morels for dinner, where I had a fantastic steak. The only thing that really bothered me about the stay was that there was no refrigerator other than the one full with very expensive mini bar good. Next time I will ask for one, but this should not be necessary. On a minor note, on the two mornings that we got coffee in the shops the staff did not seem to know what they were doing, I suspected cost cutting was to blame. I love that the hotel is so huge that everything you could want is nearby. The shops are above the price point that I often work at but the Fashion Mall is a few minutes walk away if you need to shop, and the Walgreen's which is part of the hotel is a big plus. Hint: if you want a bottle for your room go over to the ABC Store in the mall.

Reviews.Title: “I want a bathroom like that in my house!”
Reviews.Author: helenln
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Las Vegas for a conference and tagged on a few extra days for pleasure. The conference was in the Venetian/Palazzo meeting rooms and our lodging was at the Palazzo. I was very impressed with the rooms, comfort, luxury, and cleanliness. Due to the constant stream of alcohol and tobacco smoke in Las Vegas, many of the casinos (and subsequently the hotels) just look and feel dingy. However, the Palazzo has smoke-free corridors throughout the casino and the nonsmoking guest rooms are indeed sans smoke. Don't get me wrong, if I had it my way, the entire facility would be smoke free, but perhaps one day casinos will be seen as workplaces and thus be smoke-free. The guest bathrooms are gorgeous in the suites. The toilet chamber echos a bit, so I hope if you're with other people, you are comfortable with each others bodily bathroom noises. The beds are excellent - I rarely sleep well in hotels, but each night I was knocked out and woke refreshed. I wouldn't mind bringing home both the bed and the bathroom... There are three TVs in the suites - one in the bathroom, near the bed, and near the sofa. That's a bit excessive -- you can never watch all three at once. We were on the 41st floor with a view of the Wynn and Encore hotels - a great few. If you can manage an upper floor, I highly recommend it. We had high speed internet in our guest suites as part of the conference package. However, the general guest would have to pay for access per day. A suggestion I wish we had found sooner -- Dueling Pianos in the Salute Lounge just inside the casino -- what a blast! We found that two nights before we left and apparently they play nightly between 5:30 PM and 1:30 AM. It's an all-request show with two singers/piano players. They can do anything from Snoop Dogg to Jay Z to Alicia Keys to The Who to Journey to show tunes. I really wish I had known about this sooner, I would have been there every night. The blond musician, Phyllis, is my favorite! Lastly, and most importantly, the pools! It's easy to get fooled into thinking the first pool you see when walking out of the Solaro restaurant area is awesome, but don't stop there. Keep walking over toward the Venetian -- those pools are actually better with fewer people (i.e. kids). When you get to the Venetian side, you'll happen upon the poolside bar, the pool to your left was our secret. There were a handful of people there throughout the afternoon, but by the time 5:00 rolled around, we were consistently two of only about 6 people in the water. We took goggles and had a blast playing. The pool depth is 3.5-4 feet so it's nice and warm and shallow. If/when we return to Las Vegas, we will most certainly try to reserve a room at the Venetian or Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “On the Go - at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: lindafromNJ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Palazzo. Overall all it was a good trip and a very nice hotel. If we went again we would consider staying here. Here are the pros and Cons: Room - we had the Fortuna Suite which was huge and very nice. When we arrived they told us our room was not ready but we slipped them a $10 bill and then it was ready!! If you have or say you have medicine that needs refrigerated you can get a free refrigerator in the room where you can keep your water. You will need alot of water as it is hot this time of year. There were some nicks in the furniture and a stain or two on the sofa. Other than that the maids kept the room clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. One thing in the bathroom the door to the toilet area is heavy and won't stay open. It slams shut leaving you in a dark (bad lighting) unventilated room. Our view was good overlooking the pool and the strip. We had no major issues with service except you have to wait on hold for the front desk and also for the conceirge. The maid service was good and so was the bellstaff. Also the service at the restaurants were good. Casino - the Grazie players card's use is confusing. We were constantly standing in line waiting to find out what we were entitled too. We are now home and still don't know if we got what were entitled to. The slots were tight compared to the slots in Atlantic City which is near where we live. The Casino is well ventilated and not too smoky as at other hotels. The pools are nice but crowded. They are shallow and you have to go to the Venetian if you want to swim. There are alot of kids at the pool and no designated adult pool. We had breakfast at the Grand Lux which had a good breakfast buffet at a reasonable price. We also had good breakfasts at Del Toro and Solaro by the pool. We had dinner at Carnevino and liked it. The food was good but expensive. One thing that happened is I fell in the hotel and needed ice.I asked the hostess at the restaurant for ice and she said she was bringing it but never did. My leg swelled. She seemed to care less and I finally got the ice from my waitress. The hotel surroundings are very nice. The shops are nice but expensive. Between the Venetian and the Palazzo it is a big hotel. Jersey Boys - Don't miss it. This was one great show. Tip: If you are going to the airport between 10 AM and 1 PM expect a 45 min. wait for bellman service. They get backed up. Overall the Palazzo was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A1 - Our favourite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: P_Vegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch, From our arrival to departure we were treated very well. Thank you Palazzo!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave!”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStu10
Reviews.Content: We chose the Palazzo to be our home for our first trip to Vegas, and it happened to be the perfect place for us. We spend the week exploring the properties up and down the strip and never once regretted the choice. The Palazzo is far from the "family infested" southern end of the Strip. City Center is simply too dull and sterile for Vegas. While the Bellagio and the Wynn were unmatched in beauty and elegance, they seemed to be missing the fun. The Palazzo/Venetian complex had the perfect combination of elegance and classic over-the-top Vegas kitsch. The rooms (luxury suites) are just as described on the website. There cannot have been a bad view in the place. Our suite overlooked the Wynn golf course. You'd have to be pretty fussy to be dissappointed in any of these accomodations. The Palazzo itself is extremely easy to navigate (as opposed to the Venetian) if a little bit of a walk to get anywhere. The amount of restaurants and shops a short elevator ride away is staggering. The casino was much less disorienting than others on the strip. I found the perfumed smell throughout the Venetian/Palazzo property quite pleasant and welcoming. The pool complex is spectacular. No wave pools, water slides, or lazy rivers...just perfect for those of us who want to lounge in chairs, swim laps, or soak in the spas without screaming kids around. We had no problems with the service at this hotel. All employee interactions (which were rare because everything on this trip went smoothly) were friendly and professional. The front desk let us check in at around 11am, which we really appreciated. The concierge helped us score some badly needed tickets before some shows sold out. The valets were prompt and housekeeping was more than competent. The staff didn't go out of their way to make us feel special, but they did the job. I strongly reccomend the Palazzo for your Vegas vacation. Tips: - A room facing away from the Strip will be much quieter than if you upgraded to the Strip view. - If you can drag yourself out of bed when the pool opens at 8am, it's worth it. The summer weather is beautiful and you'll have the place all to yourself. -Grand Lux Cafe and the food court in the Venetian are some of the most affordable places to get a decent meal on the Strip. -Walgreens is located on the Strip in between the Venetian and Palazzo...stock up here.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: dolphinron
Reviews.Content: This will be a short review but unbelievable period. The cleanliness, friendly staff and overwhelming fun I had here was great. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Krissy121979
Reviews.Content: We received a coupon with our room for $50 off of a 50 minute spa treatment. I called the spa to redeem it but was told that the 50 minute "SPA pedicure" was not considered a spa treatment but rather a salon treatment. I'm not just being cheap, I wanted to check out the facility and so forth before booking any additional treatments. I don't need to feel stressed out by the spa so I skipped it all together. OK whatever...annoying but wouldn't totally destroy my opinion of the hotel as a whole. We ate lunch at the Lagassee stadium and were thoroughly unimpressed with the quality, service, and price. Disappointed in Emeril for stamping his name on it. Overall a crappy $57 non-alcohol lunch comprised of 2 sandwiches and 2 ice teas. The Grand lux cafe has decent food and is open late, however it takes forever to get your food and they are poorly staffed. I ate there 3 times so it wasn't just an incident, its just the way they do things. The pitt bosses stared at my husband as though he was some sort of a criminal the entire time he played poker. He lost $1500 in an hour so they should have loved him. The refridgerator comes stocked and on sensors so you can't remove so much as a water without being charged $6, and theres no room in it to put any of your own things such as left overs. The in suite movies that aren't at the theater anymore are $15 or you can watch an archived 22 min episode of the office for $5. The internet access is $12 per day. I have an air card but it was still annoying considering motel 6 gives it to you for free and they're probably classified as 1 or 2 stars. The M&Ms are $9. No mint on your pillow. I would say this is a 3 star hotel. If you want a jetted tub you have to get the siena suite. Overall just not 5 stars in any way. Of course there are restaurants and pools and so forth but that goes without saying. The air quality in the casino is so bad I got a nose bleed and my heart raced the whole time. I expect better air filtration. Just for you single men out there there aren't any pretty women working here either so I'd head somewhere else for that. I confirmed that with my husband, not just my opinion. I will be trying the Vdara next time, which is smoke free and connected to the bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tyfail
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 day break in Las Vegas, where we stayed at the Palazzo and let me tell everyone who reads this, that is an amazing place. We have previously stayed at the Flamingo and what was the Aladdin and is now the Planet Hollywood and the Palazzo is by far the best place. We ate in the Lavo restaurant, outside overlooking the strip and our waiter was " Tony " and he was brilliant. The food was very, very good and the dining experience was wondedrful. We also ate in the Grand Lux Cafe which also has great food, a wee bit cheaper than the Lavo but equally as good. Everything about this hotel was top notch. Go there,,, stay there,,, Oh I forgot to mention that my wife absolutely loved the chocolate martinis in the Laguna Champagne Bar. We went to 2 shows, Anthony Cools the hynotist who was very entertaining but somewhat crude, okay I guess but not fantastic. The second show we saw was Terry Fator at the Mirage, now let me tell everyone, this guy is nothing short of amazing, an absolute special talent who entertains from the DJ at the start of the eveniongs entertainment right through the show. This was the best show that my wife and I have ever seen in Vegas. Honestly and truly,,, FANTASTIC.... Go see him and you will be amazed as much as we were. Another memorable trip for Lesley and I, and certainly one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBobbymcgee
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Palazzo and I will definitely come back. I've stayed at the venetian twice before so I decided to give palazzo a try. Great room, great view and over all great stay, Minus our gambling losses. We stayed in the Prestige luxury suite and I recommend this room. We also had cocktails and snacks in the concierge lobby every afternoon as a part of our stay. The hotel is connected to the venetian and you can do plenty of walking inside without stepping a foot outside. The combined hotels have good restaurants, clubs and plenty of upscale shopping. My only drawback? Just one... Was a bellhop that was called up to take our stuff down. He had an attitude, rude and fished for a tip hardcore. "I will take your stuff down stairs, here's your ticket" "This is the last time im gonna see you, I wont see you downstairs" That just left me with a sour taste after a great weekend. But I wont let one a-hole ruin this hotel's visit.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Too many other choices in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Joski69
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights last week at Palazzo for a combination of business and pleasure. Check in on Tuesday at noon was smooth and the the room was ready when I arrived. They offered upgrades to a 1300 SF suite for $100 per night. A good value but I declined as the rooms are already much larger than most. The room was nearly 800 square feet with king size bed, large L shaped couch, 2 flat screen tv's, desk, sitting area/3 chairs small dresser, bath with seperate tub/shower, 2 sinks and seperate vanity with seat. The view in 45-729 was overlooking the Venetian pools and the Wynn golf course - spectacular. The bed was also one of the more comfortable I have ever experienced. This more or less ends any positive comments I can offer. The service experienced for the duration of the stay was far below the standards of any hotel, let alone one in this class and price range. There was a "package" department in the conference center that I was directed to for pickup of my materials. There was one person working the counter and two others milling about with little interest in the line out front. I overheard another employee on a radio asking for assistance at the counter twice but help never arrived. After a 35 minute wait, they could not tell me what room the materials needed to be delivered to and to come back once I figured it out. This is one of the largest conference facitlites in Vegas so I do not understand how one person is expected to facilitate any type of volume. After two hours of walking around and coming back to the counter for another 10 minute wait, my items were delivered to the conference booth. Upon leaving, we were told to fill out our paperwork for return shipping and leave in the exhibit hall. Our material was no where to be found for three days after we left and three calls went unreturned. Our packages finally shipped on day 4 with no explanation. Dinner at Dos Caminos night one. Food came out cold and was average at best. Our waiter disappeared every few minutes and we started to get drink refills from anyone that would stop. Our table was never cleared and we had to ask twice for our bill. Lunch at Lux cafe day two. Sat for 10 minutes without being acknolwedged and then had to ask for our drinks twice before they finally came out. Seared ahi appetizer was entirely inedible. It came out a room temperature gray color and was rubbery. Not sure how that made it out of the kitchen. Pizza and sandwhiches took 35 minutes. Server again was nowhere in site and we had to ask another server to track down our check. Table was still not cleared when we left. Dinner day 3 at Delmonicos. My drink was served with lipstick on the glass. Appetizers were ordered and never came. The server had no idea until our entrees arrived and I pointed that out. From the time soup and salad left the table, entrees took 25 minutes to arrive. The 9 ounce filet was 6 ounces on a good day - one of the smallest I have ever seen. They offered dessert and coffee as a gesture for the appetizers. The capuccino was muddy and cold and the pecan torte was as dry as once could imagine. Not at all the experience you would expect from fine dining at these prices. Dinner day 4 - went to Lagasses sport bar at 940 pm. A server told us to have a seat and she would send the hostess over with menus. When she arrived, we were scolded for sitting without her knowledge and informed that the kitchen was closing in 10 minutes. Aren't we in Vegas? Had a fabulous meal and service at The First Bar in the attached Palazzo mall. Pool service on weekdays and weekends was non existent. Two out of 5 days my room was not serviced as of 6 p.m. and one of those days took 2 phone calls to actually get clean towels. My reservation was split into three night and two nights. I let them know at check in and they assured me my keys would work and it would be seemless. After three nights, the keys were deactivated and they checked me out. When I went downstairs they said the other reservation was never linked. So much for the easy check in. Upon checkout I was asked about my stay and told the clerk I was disappointed and would not be back. When asked for specifics I referenced the key issue and the room not being cleaned. She said she sees that I had a problem with my keys but no record of my housekeeping issues and threw in some attitude as if I were making it up. Just would I would expect after my other experiences. I'm likely leaving some things out because it was a comedy of errors and poor service for 5 straight days. I am an easy to please traveler with expectations that suit the brand and the price I am paying. Having stayed in at least 12 or more hotels in Vegas, I put this place at or near the bottom. Friday on was spent at other hotels and restuarants and we had a fabulous time with good food and service throughout. Unless you are here for free, I would pass. Even then, use care when dining on site and limit your expectations accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “a bit of cost cutting shows”
Reviews.Author: Sunbu
Reviews.Content: Most recent of half-dozen stays at Venetian/Palazzo, Palazzo being the newer half of the complex. Upgraded to view suite. These are very spacious, nicely equipped 3-tv suites, well described at their web site. But some cost cutting was evident. In our room, for example a large picture or mirror was missing from the wall, the toilet seat was loose, and the little amenites were fewer. (No sewing kit, for example). And fewer towels. Once a day maid service, no turndowns. I'm not complaining. This was fine stay. Canyon Ranch has great healthy food. A fine dinner at Morels was 20% off for all Palazzo guests. A trip to the City Center Mall (free) is highly recommended. Amazing spaces there. Jim

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: RondaB4
Reviews.Content: .Thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. Rooms were fantastic and comfortable. Would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!! Nice, Classy Room. Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: europetraveler7
Reviews.Content: My husband was on a business trip and I tagged along for the ride. Definitely, one of the nicest hotels on the strip. We had a suite so there were 3 tv's (one in the bathroom), a separate area to do make up, an L-shaped couch, lots of room. Even the window curtains were remote controlled. All that "Bling" was nice, but what was most important to me is that the room was clean and well taken care of....and it was. It was a nice stay. It's all connected to the Venetian, so you never have to go outside to get to the Venetian Hotel and shops. We ate at the Mexican restaurant in the hotel on the 1st day, called Dos ???????. It was just "okay". We did eat at the Grand Lux for breakfast and lunch. It's owned by the same group that owns The Cheesecake Factory. Good food!! Beautiful pool area but we didn't use it. I would stay here again. Great Location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lastcallforboarding
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Las Vegas hotels in the past ten years, but the Palazzo stands out as one of the best: it has a beautiful but not garish lobby, the rooms are very large (The Bellagio is a gorgeous hotel but rooms are smaller) the pools are very nice and most importantly it is near everything. You can easily walk to The Forum Shops at Ceasar's Palace and the Fashion Mall is right across the street with a connecting bridge. The taxi station is one level below the lobby, sort of underground, but once you remember to take the escalator down, it's easy. You do have to go through the casino to get to the guest elevators, but that's pretty much standard practice in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Music too loud”
Reviews.Author: FireAnt30
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but the music, the pumping bass was going from noon to midnight all of Memorial Day weekend. We were on the 19th floor over the pool and there were times when the glass windows were vibrating from the bass. I was sharing the room with 2 other sisters, we are all in our early 50's. The music was too much. They should give those rooms to the 20 somethings that were everywhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, slightly away from strip”
Reviews.Author: MulhollandP
Reviews.Content: Having spent three days in LV and walked through many of the hotels the thing that stands out about the Palazzo is that its definately an elegant hotel, with none of the "trash" that you find in a lot of the others. The strip is very long and can take some time to negotiate the crowds if you want to get into the central strip area as this sits slightly north of the main part. Only dowside was the room cleanliness and getting something done about it - The Palazzo/Venetian has soemthing like 6000 rooms and getting anyone to do soemthing can take an extraordinary amount of time!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a mix of high end and middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: rhonda7325
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the end of April. First when we arrived we had two double beds and asked to upgrade to a king. There was an up charge to do this so we stayed with our room. This was a bit of a surprise but worked out well. Rooms: We had a large suite which was great although the bedroom is still part of the suite. Depending what you like this may be a pro or a con. We found this to be a con and would prefer a separate bedroom however this was another 150.00 per night. I feel this is not really a suite but a very large room. Otherwise the rooms are well appointed and it was clean. Great modern décor. No concerns here. Check in: Friendly and helpful. Our initial reservation was mixed up and a few calls later it was fixed. No concerns. Breakfast: Our package came with a free breakfast. Not only was it in the mall it was very poor. For a resort of this quality pastry and whole fruit is not acceptable. Just offer some yogurt or eggs and I think you would have less complaints. We never used this after checking it out the first day and I felt this was the idea. Step this up Pallazzo and do not pay for this as it is very poor. Gaming: Great time, great service. Drinks were efficient particularly on the tables. Players club. We signed up and it was confusing. Online it said we had no comps however I phoned daily and was comped at minimum 100.00 per day. This is a problem as some comps were directly at the restaurant and not there when we got our bill so took some time to figure out. (they did show up but it took time) Also on check out they were not there so took over ½ hour to figure this out. Not sure if this is a con but we ended up with more comps than on the phone. They should figure this out though as it is frustrating. Make sure you call as you never know what they may comp you. The casino is also small enough to find everone you are with. I like this as we always get separated. Spa and gym: Great gym. The spa was more like a gym club and not very spa like. My massage was mediocre at best. Be aware (thxs other trip advisors) if you go to the desk the day of you can get a massage for 100.00 if they have availability. You have to ask and re ask to get this but its there if they are not too busy. They will not do this by phone. Also mixed messages. I was told I could not charge to my room by one person and another said it was fine. Pool: Crowded but typical for Vegas. We rented a cabana one day on the Venetian side and by noon the Beach was booming music and there was no relaxing. We asked to be comped a cabana the next day as it was awful (there were no good ones to move to) and he said no. He did offer our money back which was great.
