It would have been a better deal for the hotel to keep our 400.00 and give us a cabana on the Monday when they were not even full but. The palazzo side is quiet and next time I will get a cabana there. Service was fine, drinks expensive but good. Food average, the restaurant was fine, not great. Restaurants: Lavo, first night amazing food and service. Several days latter amazing food and the worst service. Great atmosphere, portions are massive so think about sharing. Samba sushi: expensive but great food. Try the tacos, their version of. Lux Café: Basic fare but good. Massive portions, share. Location: great for shopping and walking elsewhere. Overall we loved this resort and would go back. I may try the Wynn next time but I really like this one. We have stayed at Bellagio, Caesars (on par) with smaller rooms, platinum and Paris and would go back here. I like the ability to eat high end or middle end, something the Bellagio did not offer. I also liked the modern feel of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bad/awful execution”
Reviews.Author: br54969
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great. Sheets were sandpaper. Drinks were impossible to get either at bar, casino or pool. Thumping thundering bass from live pool music was unavoidable. At 1 point I went back to the room to get away and could still hear it from the 39th floor. At this point I called somebody at the front desk and was told to stop saying, 'bs'. hmmmmm - you can rob me blind and make me miserable and I can't say, 'bs'.... I stayed in room 39-836 for 4 nights starting May 27. We paid top dollar to find bad service at every single turn. I work for the State of Nevada in the Unemployment agency and the rate in Las Vegas is approaching 14 percent. I think it would be reasonable to hire a few extras. Sheldon Adelson can squack over the way the shadows are painted on his ceilings but the man knows nothing of service. I spent nearly 3k gambling, 1600 on the room and the only thing I have to show for it is the skin off my elbows. I will never stay at another property of yours. Throw this out with the others but ratings online do account for something and it's interesting to note the the cab driver said he hears the same thing all the time. It's not my fault the little man built a 2nd casino he couldn't staff when he should have known better.

Reviews.Title: “I found Palazzo to be one of my favorite hotel experiences.”
Reviews.Author: travelesquegirl
Reviews.Content: The first night we arrived (Friday) the food was really good at the Grand Luxe Cafe. Very good Cafe Au Lait and pastachio ice cream at Espressamente Illy. Solaro was awesome! We sat outside under a much needed heater. The food was great! I asked about Azure Pool at check-in...the front-desk clerk then gave us free tickets. The Azure Pool was relaxing during the day considering it is also a 21 and older club with a DJ. LAVO Nightclub...we loved every minute of this nightclub experience! They even gave us free drinks just for giving them our email address. The suites were beautiful but, the make-up I spilled on the foyer floor on the second night was never cleaned up. My suitemate took baths in the bathtub everyday but she always had to clean the tub herself because housekeeping always left it the way it was. On our last day, the fourth night, the housekeeper did not leave any toiletries. I had to call the concierge desk to have some brought up.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Stay, Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: EventPlanner_7186700
Reviews.Content: I didn't rate value on this one because I bought a package deal and don't know what the individual sleeping room rate for this stay. However, having stayed here it is definitely high end and I would compare the experience to a stay at any Ritz Carlton or 4 Seasons hotel I've experienced. I can not say enough about the friendly service. From the bell staff to the concierge to the security at lost and found to the front desk staff to any maid you encounter, they are quick with a greeting and everyone seemed genuinely concerned about any question asked, as if you were the only person they were going to speak with that day. I am in the hotel business and was impressed. They need to train other hotel staffs in customer service. The rooms are fantastic. We stayed in the luxury suite which I think is the smallest, and "small" in this case is a misleading term. This suite was phenomenal. Our room had the bathroom to the left when we walked in. Very large open space with glassed in shower, soaking tub, separate water closet, marble counters, flat screen tv and dual sinks. Very spacious. Further down the corridor and you are in the bedroom which is beautifully appointed with mini canopy over the bed. Dresser with flat screen tv mounted on the wall. There is a master switch for the lights when you enter so you can set that to turn off and on whatever lights throughout the room you prefer. Step down into the living area and you have another large space with a table and 4 chairs, L shaped sofa, desk and chair and another piece of furniture with the large safe and mini bar in it. And yet another flat screen tv. Nice touches like remote controlled roman shade and blinds on the window, drawers that close automatically without being pushed all the way in, and the robes in the room are all nice pampering touches to have when you're on vacation. We stayed on the side of the hotel facing Treasure Island and the pool, so we could look directly at it. Word of caution: There was a lot of loud music at the pool during the day, so if you plan on being there during the day to take a nap in between morning and going out in the evening you may want to request to be away from the pool. And we went Memorial Day Weekend so it could have been special that weekend. I would definitely request the same location. The hotel is very convenient. It is right next door to Wynn, Encore and Treasure Island and Fashion Show Mall and Harrah's is a short walk. It is connected by walkway to the Venetian. Tons of dining and shopping options are under one roof. There is a Walgreens' drug store at the front of the hotel which is very convenient. I would choose this location again and look forward to my next stay at this hotel. You can get free wireless internet, local and toll free calls, access to the spa and some other perks if you pay the resort fee. We did not and paid one day for 24 hour access to wireless at $12.95.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE - Much better 5-star hotels in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Island-Marc
Reviews.Content: Hotel was disappointing given that it has a 5-star rating. Checking in and out is slow and staff are unfriendly. People with 6-packs of beers are checking in and this is not acceptable in a 5-star hotel! The toilet paper in the bathroom is so thin (cheap) that one has to fold it over 4 times before using. We were in Vegas to get married in the Grand Canyon and stayed 5 days. On our wedding day, the cleaning staff STOLE my wife's new lingerie and we filed a report with security. We did not even receive a call let alone a note of apology from the hotel's management and todate have not received any feedback. We had breakfast in the room for 4 days and when we returned to our room at the end of the day, the breakfast trays were still in the room and the room not made up! In summary, we have stayed at the Venetian, Wynn's and Bellagio in the past and all 3 hotels have been superb. But we will NEVER stay at the Palazzo again. It is a 3-star hotel passing for a 5-star hotel. For the rate we paid, we could have stayed at the other 5-star resorts which offer much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Factor”
Reviews.Author: SBB13
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the latter part of our trip. Check in/out was a breeze. Location is perfect...across from fashion Show Mall and walking distance to Wynn, Mirage and Caesars Palace. The restaurants and shopping were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “THE ABSOLUTE Definition of a TOTAL Cluster”
Reviews.Author: JULESVERNE66
Reviews.Content: This was a dream vacation turned into a nightmare. From the TIME of check in to the Bell Service everything was a total cluster. While we checked in Early on the Concierge level (what a joke) we understood our room wasn't going to be ready. But get this...it took over 4 hours to get our room as they told us they only had one house cleaner on that floor. Then to make matters worse once we got in our room the wine and champagne that I ordered days before never made it. Had to call for that. Then no face towels, call for that. Room service took 2 hours, no valet and the "priority service" forget that. Did I mention we were on the "premier Floor" in the real XTRA priced rooms for almost $2,000 a night? Also I failed to mention we had two rooms. Listen for the money we were paying we should have been treated like royalty. But my favorite part was I had to have the painters in the hall way help me take my bags down. Valet was busy. SERVICE? I think not.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Venetian”
Reviews.Author: TravelersInStyle
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Venetian, we decided to try the Palazzo and were not dissapointed. We were upgraded to a double size suite (too big if that is possible!) with a view although the views are not that good because of the position of the hotel, Conciege level was excellent with good breakfast and evening drinks at no cost - very good ambiance and worth the extra money. It is very difficukt to fault this hotel and I cannot think of any negative comments etc. Car hire from the hotel was efficient Restaurants were all first class quality and service

Reviews.Title: “Very Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: throughmyeyes10
Reviews.Content: Found the desk extremely helpful - arrived eary and got to check in at 10:30am however, when we asked to check out late we were charged for a $100 for their half day rate. Found the casino very refreshing - no smoke, well lit, and layed out well. Only isssue was that we found a pair of shoes and some receipts left from the previous guests. Rooms were clean enough but maybe they should check under things a bit more. Spa was very pricy - wouldn't recommend but Would stay again though - if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful one night stay”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: We were only passing through Las Vegas and thought it might be fun to stay in a casino hotel for one night and saw that the Venetian and Palazzo had a special. We booked the Palazzo because it was newer and were very pleased. The front desk person was very helpful when we checked in explaining all the extras from the special we booked. In addition, she was nice enough to even print our boarding passes for us. Upon arriving to the room we found that she needn't have bothered though since we had a printer and a fax machine included. All the rooms are suites and ours had a sunken living room and 2 queen beds, extra large bathroom with 2 sinks, separate W/C, shower, bath, make up vanity. The room had a variety of different lights which took some exploring to find all the controls. The large window overlooking the strip had remote controlled draperies and shades. The only problem we had was that the safe was locked when we arrived and they came up within an hour to unlock it for us so we could use it. The Palazzo/Venetian complex had plenty of places to dine and the casinos were very nice. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Edwina69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the 1st leg of our honeymoon, it was amazing, rooms were HUGE! no complaints. Service at front desk was excellent. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Hotel itself was unbelievable. So big and so much to do. Beauty Salon was very impressive and did a great job. Hotel was always very busy. Would recommend Grand Canynon Helicopter Ride - The sunset tour. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: lemondrop777
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at the Palazzo May 9-11. This was our first time staying at this resort and we were really impressed. Check-in was quick and the staff at the front desk was friendly. We enjoyed a fabulous room on the 36th floor overlooking part of the strip and the Venetian pools. Gorgeous room with lots of room to relax. The bathroom was huge and I loved all of the counterspace and extra vanity to put my makeup, etc. Also liked that it had a separate tub and shower. The pool area to the hotel is a dream - clean and tranquil. Just what we were looking for! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: drastaboy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for my wife's bday! we were upgraded from the Venetian to the Palazzo Sienna Suite.. the way everything was laid out as far as the floor plan was perfect, only things i could recomend differently about the room would be for the dvd player to work in the bedroom instead of only being able to use it from the other room and a ipod or iphone hook-up for music!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Girls Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MDKLHunter
Reviews.Content: Our party of 7 booked 2 rooms at Palazzo May 8-11 under one of their promotions offering various coupons and $25 in free slot play, mainly because it appeared comparable to Bellagio (where we stayed last year) but with larger rooms. My first good experience occurred when I had originally booked one of our suites for only 2 nights, but then needed to extend to 3 nights after my promotion had expired. They were able to honor my original rate with no argument. Nice! I was a little miffed that the Venetian and Palazzo properties charge more per night for two queen beds vs. kings, and for an extra $10/nt I can guarantee connecting rooms. I decided to take my chances with the $20 trick at check in. Since I had 2 king suites booked, I folded 2 $20 bills between my license and cc and gave it to my check in clerk, a mid-20's, pretty, hispanic girl. I stated I had "a few room requests I hope you can help me out with. I would love a couple of Bella suites, and connecting rooms are a must." She quickly replied "no problem," and it was absolutely perfect! She gave us connecting queen rooms with a view on the 36th floor. Awesome! It was so nice to have the living area and double bathroom vanities with seven women in two suites. We checked in around 11am, rooms were ready just after noon. Bell services had our bags delivered within 10 minutes of calling down. The pool area was shaded in parts before about 11am, but there were lots of chairs and a variety of places to sit. We rented a cabana on the first day and it was a great way to relax after traveling! We dined at Dos Caminos and Grand Lux Cafe. Both had very good food for prices that you would expect in Vegas, around $15-$20 per person. Not bad. I expected the casino to be tight and snooty, but instead it was comfortable with an upscale feel. Overall our experience was perfect at the Palazzo, definitely equal to that at Bellagio. It's a tough choice when I prefer Palazzo's suites but Bellagio's location. Oh, what to do next time...

Reviews.Title: “Invasion of the Moths: Beautiful Hotel, Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelMan53
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Palazzo probably 6 times. And we typically go there for business every other month. Each previous visit has been just fine and we've had a great stay. However, upon arrival this time, we were upgraded to a nicer penthouse sweet on the 49th floor. It was late when we got in and once we got into the room there were moths everywhere. Probably 20-50 of them flying around in various spots. We figured that we could survive a night with them, but we called the next morning to ask for a suite change or an exterminator. We were promised that they would be coming upstairs immediately. We left the room for the rest of the day (for work) and returned once again around 11pm to even more moths. Nothing had been done to fix the problem. Upon checking out, we made note of the problem to the desk-clerk who said that they would "take care of the problem". Unfortunately, this meant nothing since we were checking out. We asked for some kind of compensation and they gave us a $60 food and beverage credit. Obviously we thought that this was really quite disappointing. For a 5-star hotel to have an infestation of moths, do nothing about it and not comp our room is really disappointing and frustrating. We will be visiting the Palazzo again for work (we don't have a choice) but believe me, we will not be recommending it to any of our clients or friends in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, comfortable, great location, great spa”
Reviews.Author: crimsontidefan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on 34th floor, strip view hotel. Great room, great location, romantic, wonderful amenities. Picked hotel becuase of Spa which was the best I've ever been too. Right off the elevators so easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aleigh0119
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo the first weekend of March Madness. I was a little concerned about staying here as there were mixed reviews and I found a better rate at both the Four Seasons and Mandarin Oriental. But in the end, we decided on the Palazzo due to its location and room size; we were not disappointed. The rooms are very nice, very big. There is plenty of room to spread out and relax. The bathrooms are nice, but I would agree with other reviewers that THE hotel’s bathrooms are more luxurious feeling. The beds are comfortable – I had no issues with the sheets or pillows, perhaps they could’ve been a little softer, but that is just personal preference. We had the continental breakfast on the concierge level included in our room rate and that proved to save us quite a bit. We had breakfast there every morning – plenty to fill us up and a great way to start every day, very relaxing with a great view. As far as the rest of the hotel…..the pool is OK, nothing special, but still very nice. The casino is large, classy, not loud at all. It is so nice to be able to walk through the large walkway from the elevators to the lobby through the casino without feeling overwhelmed by noise and smoke (no smoke smell at all). And I never smelled the “strong” perfume others have complained about being piped into the Palazzo and Venetian. We really enjoyed Dos Caminos; their chips, guac and margaritas are delicious! And Café Lux is a great staple restaurant and also really quite reasonably priced for what you get. Be forewarned: the portions are HUGE! You can honestly order one entrée and share (that includes their salads). The only bad meal in the hotel we had was at Morels. I won’t go into the details here, but honestly, the service was absolutely pathetic. My husband does not get mad easily (at all) and he was fuming by the time we got the $400 bill. Their lack of service made us late for our show (The Beatles, LOVE – awesome!). We cannot recommend Morels. We did the Rasul Ceremony and couples massage at the Canyon Ranch Spa after spending the morning using the Aquavana . I would just say the spa is good, not great. The Rasul Ceremony is unique. I am glad we did it, but wouldn’t do it again. My massage was pretty unspectacular. My husband really enjoyed his. Service at the hotel was very good. Everyone that we came across was helpful and friendly. As far as housekeeping was concerned, I had read on TA that the housekeeping was bad so everyday I left a $5 tip with a note listing any items we needed (extra towels, glasses, etc.). Our room was always clean and we always had extra towels and toiletries in the room when we returned. I had NO complaints regarding housekeeping! Sometimes I think people don't realize that tipping housekeepers does help with the service you receive. All in all, the Palazzo is a really nice hotel in a great location. When we return to Las Vegas, we would definitely stay their again!

Reviews.Title: “One word - WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kel1982
Reviews.Content: My mum decided that for my dad's birthday she was going to treat him to a surprise trip to Vegas and having been to Vegas two years earlier my partner and I couldn't resist tagging along! After much deliberation we decided to stay at the Palazzo. There is only one word to describe this hotel and that is pure luxury!!! Rooms The rooms are absolutely amazing. Sorry I mean suites! Simply stunning. The views from our room were out of this world, that is once you had pulled the blinds with your remote control!!!! The bathroom was the biggest I have ever seen with LCD screens for when you’re brushing your teeth :-) The rooms are classy but extremely comfortable with a lounge area and huge TV. This has to be one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in. Casino A word of warning, if you intend to spend your evenings on the tables you can forget it here. With most of the tables having a minimum $25 dollar bet, our money was never going to last as long as it did when we stayed at Treasure Island. Drinks at the bar when you are not betting are incredibly expensive too but this is to be expected with the general ambience of the hotel oozing money (and lots of it). A round of drinks for the 4 of us was never under $40 so grab the waitresses when you see them as they didn’t come by all that often (even when you do generously tip). Pool We visited the pool (Solaro) a couple of times and I have to say that it was like something out of a movie. People who wanted to be seen in their swimming outfits prancing around trying to get noticed. However, that didn’t spoil the pool area which was beautiful and once again oozed luxury. Dining Grand Luxe – We ate here on a number of occasions for breakfast and the food was great. With huge portions as to be expected in the US. Zine Noodles and Dim Sum – Lovely restaurant. Food was amazing. We had a 7 course taster meal which was really nice! Lavo – We booked this as a treat and we were not disappointed. Overlooking the strip we sat on the balcony watching the Treasure Island pirate show. An experience all on its own! Sushisamba – We didn’t eat here but enjoyed a few cocktails before heading out. This is up in the mall area of the hotel and is well worth a visit. I think we had some buy one get one free vouchers given to us at the pool and they came in very handy! Facilities Make sure you register for the Club Grazie club on arrival. They issue you with a credit card type thing that contains a $50 credit. Believe me you will be grateful once your money has run out! As a guest of the Palazzo you can get yourself on the guest list at a number of clubs in its sister hotel the Venetian and we opted for TAO. A must if you intend to party in Vegas. We was however lucky enough to get into the new TAO Beach, a roof top club based around a swimming pool. The strangest partying experience I have ever had but soooooo much fun. I would also highly recommend seeing Jersey Boys while you are there. Based in the Palazzo’s own theatre it is a wonderful show and you get a good rate as a guest. To sum up I suppose the question is would I return to the Palazzo and I probably have to say no. Not because I was disappointed in any way, it is just my opinion that every visit to Vegas should be to somewhere new. Vegas has soooooooo much to offer and you would be mad to return to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Sienna Suite Delight With Photos & Videos”
Reviews.Author: ewing1212
Reviews.Content: I recently booked at the that the Palazzo and it confirmed why it is my only lodging choice in Las Vegas. Pros: Customer service is world class. Despite the resort being fully booked with a blue-chip IBM convention, I fell to my knees when I entered my suite and discovered I had been upgraded to a 1,400 square foot Sienna Suite! Words do not do justice, See photos and videos. All interactions with the staff was a world class/five star experience. From housekeeping to valet - all needs were anticipated and exceeded. Opulent and HUGE Suite. Shock and Awe to enter the suite and see a private gym, a guest bath and flawless views of the strip from the 46nd floor. Electric drapes in both the living room and master bedroom - you can spend HOURS enjoying this feature. Great lighting - even though a Green property the lighting was awesome. This is not the case with Trump or The Hotel which I have stayed before. Color Printer - No other resorts offer complimentary state of the art printer/fax machines. This was especially handy in printing critical work and travel documents. Slot-machines - Both abundant and GENEROUS! A reverse ATM. Casino service - I never waited more than two minutes for a drink, Housekeeping - AWESOME! How they arrange your personal items is masterful. And a request (with generous tip) resulted in an abundance of designer soaps. Complimentary gift basket - This was a total surprise. On on my second day I arrived to find an abundance of gourmet and other indulgent treats in the six person dining room table! Not worthy! Dining - Grand Lux at both the Venetian and Palazzo are a welcome and affordable 24 hour respite when you’re hungry after a long night of gaming. The menu is HUGE and everything was delicious. HUGE portions! Security is top-notch. You feel SAFE! You can’t enter the Palazzo suites without your room card shown to the security staff. Bags To Go - This vendor managed service is AMAZING. I was able to check two large bags and receive my boarding pass without having the stress and hassle for only $20. This service is conveniently located in the lobby area. More time for gaming and bags arrived in Dallas without having to lug them through flight check-in. You go straight to the boarding area. The beds are PERFECTION and there are extra pillows and sheets in the closet to choose from. The robes are INCREDIBLE! Previous reviews have commented on the long walks to get to your room. This is not the case if you self park and take advantage of the direct elevator to the Palazzo Suites located under the resort. And if you choose to valet park, the walk through the elegant and well appointed public areas is a real treat. The valet staff is personable and ATTRACTIVE! Priority Guest Services - press the P on the phone and your needs are met in less than five minutes. This was the case with a DVD remote and printer ink refill. Vibe - Electric! No other resort comes close to the excitement, class and sophistication. If you desire high energy this is the place. If you desire a nurturing low key and pampering experience this is the place. Cons: None. I would strongly recommend The Palazzo and look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: BrownEyedLady
Reviews.Content: We had one of the standard (luxury) rooms on the 34th floor, and it was absolutely fine. The bed was very comfortable, the power driven window blinds and drapes worked and the room was very clean, except for one glass stain on the table in the living area, which I spotted immediately but which remained throughout our week's stay. We had a good view from our window and suffered no noise or disturbance from the rooms on either side of us, nor from people in the corridors. Our room was made up daily, regardless of the different times that we vacated the room each day. We had a few problems with the room but these were sorted out immediately and with courtesy and apologies. Initially our in-room safe was locked, presumably left like that by the previous guests, so a gentleman came with his computer gadget to read the last code and open it. The hairdryer in the bathroom drawer didn't work, and this was replaced immediately by a working one. And we had rung The Palazzo in advance of our arrival to check if there were tea and coffee making facilities provided in our room, otherwise we would bring our own kettle for that vital 'first cup of tea before you get out of bed' without which my husband can't exist! We were told on the phone that all rooms had hot drink making facilities, only to find upon arrival that none did. I complained to reception and with a little 'persuasion' they arranged for a hot water urn, tray, coffee cups and sugar to be provided free of charge to our room for the duration of our visit. The urn duly arrived though without an electric cord, but this was quickly provided when prompted by me. Fortunately I had brought our own teabags and there was just enough spare room in the hospitality fridge for a small bottle of milk, so all was well with the world! The daily resort fee stuck in our throat a bit as we didn't have time to go to the gym and we don't have a laptop to make use of the in-room online facility. A daily newspaper was also included in the resort fee, but wasn't delivered to your room like I had imagined. Instead you had to traipse to some distant point on the second floor in The Venetian next door to pick it up. We didn't bother as I had understood it to only be local papers that were available. However, once the volcanic ash cloud crisis arose and we needed to see what the papers back home in the UK were saying about revised flight arrangements, we found out that we could get the previous day's British newspaper from the same second floor vendor and this was still covered by the resort fee. So at least we got a tiny bit back on the fee, albeit only 2 British newspapers! The longish journey to the newspaper outlet also enabled me to discover something I wouldn't otherwise have come across. On my way back to our room in the Palazzo with my newspaper, at 9.50am one morning, I found myself behind the line of gondoliers on their way to the part of the indoor Venetian canal bridge from where they start their daily work of punting visitors around in the gondolas. They were marching along in single file, like the Seven Dwarfs, dressed in their smart matching outfits, and singing a lovely Italian song beautifully. They hadn't finished their song by the time they got to the hump back bridge over the canal, so they all lined up over the bridge until they'd finished singing. It was wonderful to watch and well worth trying to catch one morning if you're in the vicinity. Having read some bad reviews of The Palazzo before our stay, I had some concerns about our visit, but these proved to be unfounded. I'm very pleased we took the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Not the service I would expect”
Reviews.Author: clvndrocks
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed with the service of this resort. It is beautiful and huge. The resteraunts were very good, the banquet food was substandard. I was here for a convention with over 900 of us. My room was not ready until 6 pm, so here I am hauling my carry on and briefcase for 5 hours.. Rooms were nice, but compared to some reviews I was excpecting huge. It was bigger than a standard room, but again, I live in a house, not a box. SO I do expect decent accomadations. The pool was closed at 5 pm and then the next day due to winds. Not sure why that was a big deal. I just went to the Hard Rock and spent my money at the pool there. I am usually very tolerant traveler, but this place was just not a good fit for me.... too big ( lots and lots of walking, but I am sure that is the case anywhere in vegas) too expensive ( $15 drinks in the bars..again a vegas thing) Maybe I am not a Vegas person, but I would try to find a more quaint place.

Reviews.Title: “Adjoining the Venetian - a safe bet”
Reviews.Author: Pandora68
Reviews.Content: This hotel adjoins the Venetian and is very tall - get a low floor if you don't like heights! It is a good option as you have all the benefits of being in the Venetian but I think weekend prices are less. The suite had two double beds and could accommodate two or even four people. It was fine - 3 TV's! - my only complaint was the sofa - there were some dubious white stains and given that weekend prices on these rooms can go up to $500 a night, this just isn't good enough. The bathroom was fine. The swimming pools were warm and had clean well kept pool areas with a nice restaurant. It seemed that the pools are one of the few places left in the world where one can legally drink and smoke. Like most of the hotels on the Strip, this is a huge busy hotel, but my guess is that the Venetian / Palazzo is one of the classier hotels. Certainly, it is in a good location and we did not have any problems with our stay. The shops were nice, but not in the same league as the Bellagio. This is not a hotel geared towards kids - but mine enjoyed the gondola rides, the rides at Circus Circus and the Mirage tigers , dolphins etc. We did not want to be stuck at the other end of the Strip, away from these attractions.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Heike_Alan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo for almost a week and really loved it. Very luxurious and felt also very safe for a woman on her own as I was here for a business course. I would gladly come back here with my husband. I found it very clean, staff extremely friendly, safe and enjoyable. Nothing to complain at all. I was very impressed of the shoppingcentre between the Palazzo and Venetian with all the Italian inspired waterways, gondolas and the beautiful market place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing on every level”
Reviews.Author: Venis3
Reviews.Content: First let me preface somethings, this was not my first time in Vegas (I have been multiple times the past year alone), we had the "concierge" package and are frequent travelers. The hotel... itself was beautiful (as is its sister hotel, the Venetian). The "smoke-free" corridors really limit the amount of smoke you breathe in and smell like. The constant pumping of fresh scents through the air vents gives the hotel (rooms included) a very crisp, nice scent. Not overbearing at all. Like most other Vegas hotels, everything is continually cleaned/maintained/fixed. The room... gorgeous. I am not sure if its just luck, or a part of the conceirge package, but our room had a beautiful view of the strip and T.I. across the street. The bathroom was clean, had his/her sinks, shower/tub and a seperate vanity. The service... top notch. Now this is where I will argue that it had to do with our conceirge service. Whether it was information from the front desk, dealers, etc., everyone was most pleasant to deal with (regardless of whether it was via phone or in person). In fact, my gf accidentally left money in a slot machine and they called us to make sure we came to the cashier to pick it up. Thats unheard of this day and age! The conceirge package... highly recommend. The continental breakfast every morning hit the spot. While we did not participate in "afternoon tea," but we did make the evening happy hour and apps. Again, service was immpecable. The conceirge service helped us get into clubs/lounges, recommend dining/sightseeing/etc (even places not within our hotel or its management company). Food... hard to say. We didnt order room service, but did dine at two of the hotels numerous restaurants. We had a "new age" Mexican dinner that was great. Slightly pricey but the gaucamole was outstanding. I had a pulled pork dish which was great. Our friends had a variety of tacos (fish, chicken etc.). We also dined at Lavo. The food was very, very good. However, the place is a little pricey. We had a great view since we were seated outside facing the strip. This restaurant is supposedly a hot spot for the rich and famous. However, we were just there for a meal. Its a-la-carte, too. Overall the food was great, service was great, but I would try somthing different next time. In all, I would def stay here again. The price is worth it by far. perhaps the only downside is that its at the far north end of the strip so you have to walk a little (not a big deal at all though).

Reviews.Title: “palace for idiots”
Reviews.Author: groovyrocks
Reviews.Content: lack luster furnishings both in the hotel and rooms, rude front desk, long wait times for check in and check out, one hour wait for luggage pick up at check out, slimy snack/room bar policy where if you pick up anything and do not put it back in 30 secs you get charged and no coffee maker in the room. the only saving grace was the size of the "fortuna suite" and the food at the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “don't get the hospitality suite”
Reviews.Author: silver2lining
Reviews.Content: we had a late check in around 9pm. by that time, the normal suite that we were supposed to have were not available. they claimed that they would upgrade us to a "hospitality suite" which is woth $1000 per night with a sq footage that is twice as big. when i saw the room, big mistake, essentially it was a conference room with a make-shift bed. which was fine, until i discovered that there were a gang of moth flying around. i must have killed at least 10 of them. i just can't believe this would happen at a 5-star hotel. definitely unethical. they couldn't accomodate us any room other than moving us to the venetian, but by that time it was past my daughter's bed time. the following night, we got our normal suite which if i had gotten it on the first night, i would have rate this hotel with a higher rating. all in all, i would recommend palazzo, just make sure they don't move you to a "hospitality suite".

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: I say probably because I haven't been to any of the others. However, the others would have to be even more over the top than this one. Ignore those that say this is not five star. Five star is definitely it. The beds, the marble everywhere, the large suken den area with a huge sectional sofa, the two HD TVs, the amenities, the auto blinds, the rediculously huge bathroom with seperate tub and shower (surrounded by marble) the double vanity, and seperate powder room are all five star quality and five star presentation. Most affluent people's homes don't have things this well laid out or of this quality. The color scheme and materials all reflect Vegas' attitude of young and sexy. I feel rich staying here. The clubs and restaurants are all THE places to be in Vegas for the well advertised nightlife. Their shopping areas abound with pricey but quality goods that sometimes you can only find in foreign countries. The casino is large, but very spread out so it's not crowded. However, cigarette smoke makes the casino dated and old school, not in line with the rest of the attractions. The service of the staff, although friendly and attentive, is lacking simply because there are not enough staff to cover this three in one hotel complex and the needs of everyone there (like a morning rush to check out) or a long line and the belldesk to arrange for transportation or taxi. And the guest services areas are not put into intuitive places. However, this is my first stay in a hotel complex this large, so maybe my expections are a little skewed, but it seems like the larger the hotel, the greater the resources should be. That being said, I'm not needy so I can pretty much get anything I need over the phone in the guest room and there is no need for me to have to journey anywhere to get something. Overall, I will be back because I cannot see how anything could be better than this experience. However, my room had a full view of the spectacular pool at the Wynn. So I'll have to come back several more times to compare places!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this, huge luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: LennW
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Venetian maybe 4-5 times now. This was the first time at Palazzo. The two hotels are linked and share facilities. In fact it's difficult to understand that these are two different hotels as they are under one "roof". Palazzo is identical to Venetian when it comes to room layout (or suites as they like to call them). My room was a standard "suite" and was pure luxury. Big and with everything you can expect, including a very nice king size bed. Three flat screen TV's (bed, living room, bathroom). Wifi available for a fee. Plenty of pool areas, shops and restaurants. Needless to say, this hotel complex is one of the best out there. Location is also very good. You can easily walk to Wynn or Treasure Island, or do some bar crawl along the strip. It takes maybe 15 min to walk to Paris and Bellagio. I can highly recommend Venetian/Palazzo when in Vegas for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Even after a dozen stays, it still amazes”
Reviews.Author: Minicoco
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal guest at the Palazzo for the past two years. Since I travel to LV for business on a regular basis, I am a guest there almost every month for a few days. I can't say enough about the service, the beautiful rooms and the truly awesome restaurants. Not every stay has been perfect, but anytime something went wrong, the service staff fixed it, and followed up with a phone call to make sure all was right. You absolutely cannot beat the location, and the spacious suites. The casino is the easiest of all LV casino;s to navigate and the dealers are helpful and friendly to first time players. It is overpriced in terms of drinks and amenities such as internet access, but what do you expect when you stay at a 5 star hotel? I've stayed here for both business and pleasure, and everyone I have ever brought here is in love with it. Recently, I stayed at the Wynn for business purposes and thought more than once how I wished I was across the street at the Palazzo. The rooms at the Wynn were nice, but cannot compare in size, and cetainly not friendliness of staff. Some of the most apathetic service I have ever had in Las Vegas has been at the Wynn. The Palazzo's restuarants cannot be beat- even if you are on a budget, you can do a "round the Palazzo" Happy Hour tour and come away full and with money left in your wallet. The earliest one begins at Table 10, then hit Sushi Samba, then go downstairs to Dos Caminos. Excellent appetizers and cheap drinks.....all from extremely worthy restaurants. If you arent on a budget, or are in the mood to splurge, CUT is your place. The most amazing steak I have ever had in my life, served by real people who love food, and don't give a [--]( if you are a high roller or not. They want you to enjoy your meal and make sure you do. Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with awful service”
Reviews.Author: d123456789
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is excellent. Great rooms, good beds (only a bit short for taller people). The experience was excellent in the first few days. But the service at the front desk can be really, really awful. Palazzo had checked out our group of 4 rooms one day early and was refusing to provide a solution in the assumption the mistake was on our side. The front desk manager was called in telling us to leave the hotel. The rooms were hired now for 500 dollar per night, so they were not planning to extend our package deal. After providing prove that we had really booked the rooms for that extra night we could keep the room. However, no excuses or whatsoever. This is really a weird experience in this country where service and courtesy is common. I hope miss Francesca Comelli will once learn how to deal with customers in a more professional way which would be in line with the class of this hotel. Strange things are now wrongfully charged to our credit cards, so unfortunately the story is not finished. It could have been great.....

Reviews.Title: “Opulence”
Reviews.Author: joyous924
Reviews.Content: So, when someone offers you a complimentary room at the Palazzo, TAKE IT! Man, this hotel had everything!! The hotel is so luxurious! The rooms are so spacious! Granite everywhere, it's so posh! There was so much room for a family of 5. Everything is gorgeous and every room has a t.v.! My 4 yo son asked me, "Mama, why is there a t.v. in the bathroom?" I told him is was so he could watch SpongeBob while taking a shower! His eyes lit up! My kids loved the fact that they could watch the Pirate Show at Treasure Island just across the street every night. And the pools at the Palazzo were awesome. We basically would eat breakfast, head to the pool, eat lunch, head back to the pool, have dinner and we were back in the pool again! I enjoyed the shopping mall that connected the Venetian to the Palazzo, you can just stay there and never have to endure the Las Vegas heat! The only reason why I'm giving the Palazzo 4 stars out of 5 is because they charged us a $50 restocking fee even though we didn't have anything from the in room fridge. My kids were playing with the items and didn't put them back EXACTLY as how it was left. So WARNING, don't touch the fridge! You seriously don't need to go anywhere else! We stayed for 3 days and it was the best and most relaxing 3 days in Vegas I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on the Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: Coyote24
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is bar none the best place to stay if you have the money and expect the best. We had stayed a couple years earlier and loved it then. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The view was nice even though our room was not on the Strip side. We face the Wynn and its beautiful golf course, which was nice. I'd have to give the service kudos also due to the simple fact the our son put some food in the pay fridge and initially they charged us $400 some dollars. @ checkout we explained the circumstances (if you move ANYTHING, they charge you for that item) and the reversed the charges with no issues. The pools and jacuzzi areas are clean and well kept. The spa there is very nice according to my wife. The casino is not nearly as smoky as some other casinos and its nice that its connected to the Venetian. There are numerous wonderful restaurants and bars within the complex also. Would and will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bun57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Tuesday through Saturday for my sister's 50th and we both LOVED it! The room was bigger than our apartments and we could both use the bathroom sinks at the same time! They even had a lighted, magnified make-up mirror for my "old" eyes. Room was cleaned perfectly everyday. We both liked that there is a security guard checking for room keys on the way to the elevators to the suites. We never heard any noise (it may have helped that it wasn't as crowded early in the week.) Everyone was friendly and service was excellent. Loved the location and the pool. Our suite faced the mountains, but we were only in it to sleep and shower, so not having a strip view didn't bother us. My sister said it was the most comfy bed she ever slept in. Lots of choices for eating. Grand Luxe was our favorite. There was a problem with the hot water one morning, but it was taken care of. Both the Palazzo and Venetian were beautiful! Can't imagine staying anywhere else next time we come (and you know we will be back!!)

Reviews.Title: “Already impressed”
Reviews.Author: dsdevlin
Reviews.Content: We are scheduled to stay at the Palazzo for a weekend at the end of April. In anticipation of the trip, my husband and I have been in touch with the hotel concierge regarding spa appointments and some problems with a gift card that I received for the on-property Canyon Ranch SpaClub. The concierge has already been wonderfully helpful and we are thoroughly impressed. I have read many reviews on this site about bad service at the Palazzo and just wanted to post my experience (so far) which has been VERY helpful and satisfying. We are looking forward to a great trip and will post more upon return but just wanted to share our initial experience with a great concierge staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our 3 Night Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TumbleWeed4
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 3 nights at the Palazzo (Sun - Wed). We arrived early but breezed through the invited guest check in (we had comped rooms). Our room on the 29th floor had a view of the Venetian, Mirage fountains and the pool area. Everything was spotless, the room was huge. The beds & pillows were very comfortable. All of the staff (bell desk, check in, room service, housekeeping) were friendly & helpful. We ordered room service (at 3 am); it was fast and the pizza was delicious. The Grand Lux Cafe had a variety of great food at good prices. Drink service in the casino was speedy. The coffee shop by the guest elevators was great for our early morning coffee fix. The only minor complaint I had was that the water in the shower took a long time to heat up. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: filmtheory
Reviews.Content: Incredible experience. I just returned from my third stay at The Palazzo in Las Vegas. I upgraded and got the 924 sq. foot suite and it blew my mind for only $275 a night. My only complaint is the pool outside is too shallow - not really deep enough to swim for adults and there were too many kids. If only they could bring over the pool from The Mirage, it would make a great Vegas hotel resort even better. I've said it once before and I'll say it again: Palazzo is one of the best hotels in the world. The staff here is fantastic, too. I can't wait to return again sometime very soon. Lavo Restaraunt and The Grand Lux Cafe were amazing food choices, too.

Reviews.Title: “For sure not a 5 Star Hotel - should be more a 3+ Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Strawberry3
Reviews.Content: Many things where just not like you would expect from a 5 Star Hotel. 1. Arrived after 15 hours flight to find no dental kit in the room 2. No slippers 3. Automatic blinds were not working for the entire stay; even after we requested to get it fixed they have not been able to do so 4. Remote control for movies missing (took over an hour to get that sorted (got connected about 6 times on the phone to get the right person), so much about a nice relaxing DVD evening) 3. room cleaning service very poor ( it seems like all the do is make the bed and change towels and not even that was done right all the time – missed a couple of times the towel for the floor, which I really needed as the bathroom floor is quite cold) 4. Any phone request takes ages 5. We talked a couple of times to the reception about our problems. They seem to understand and to be sorry, but do nothing to resolve the problems. 6. Out of 7 nights, on 6 of them we had problems 7. Had to pay the resort fee, which they explained was for the gym, daily newspaper and internet and we did not use any of that! 8. Business center is very far away and internet is ridiculous priced so went to the Planet Hollywood Hotel. No problem to use the internet there and the price was absolutely fair. 9. Forgot our key in the room once, took over 45 min to get help 10. I found a dirty bathrobe in the wardrobe!! After I put it on the floor so the cleaners can take it with them I requested to get a new one. When I came back to the room that night, the same dirty bathrobe from the floor was hanging in the wardrobe again! I can honestly say that a 3 star Hotel in Asia will be better than the 5 Star Palazzo. It seems like they have a lack of staff and understanding of standard service

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous concierge level!”
Reviews.Author: gaylansue
Reviews.Content: If you can spend a little more money than the regular room rate at the Palazzo, defnitely go to the Concierge Level rooms. It all starts with the staff at the private check in. Very easy, no line, wonderful staff, complimentary glass of champagne, and fabulous rooms. But then comes the Concierge Lounge itself. Each morning there is a complimentary breakfast, and not just the normal continental, it's a full breakfast. Then in the afternoon there are numerous bites to sooth you over that mid-day slump. However, the fun and party starts from 5-9pm when they begin their complimentary open bar and appetizers. If you are a drinker, there is nothing in Las Vegas to beat it. They serve top shelf liquor, and the two Jose's can make any drink you can think of, as well as, some of their own specialities. Plus you get to meet a lot of the concierge hotel guests and chat with them. It is a fabulous time and well worth the extra money. Appetizers served during this time change daily as does the breakfast. Then they put out desserts. My husband and I had a great time. It's like a party every evening. The rooms are huge, beautiful and the bathrooms are also wonderful with top amenities. The staff in the hotel is very friendly, down to the dealers in the casino. If you are wanting to have a fabulous room and feel like a VIP then the Concierge Level at the Palazzo is for you. Beautiful experience in every way. The Canyon Ranch Spa is not to be missed. I had the best massage I have ever had and I have had a lot. Just the amenities are amazing, and the fitness room looked like it was well equiped. Even my husband loved his massage and he usually doesn't enjoy that. They have daily specials, however, if you book one of the hotel packages, they have one that gives 50.00 off a treatment. All in all, it was the best experience we have ever had in Las Vegas, and we have stayed at all the top hotel in Vegas. Even won 500.00 in a slot maching.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Palazzo...Back to Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: weathergirl29
Reviews.Content: We ventured back to Las Vegas in March 2010, and of course we booked our stay at the Palazzo again. This resort/casino is our favorite in Vegas, and this trip confirmed it. Check-in was quick and painless, and we received a king bed luxury suite on the 34th floor. View of the mountains/airport in the distance. I know the strip view is considered the "upgraded view" but I much prefer the mountain view! I pulled a chair up to the large window and sat for awhile watching the planes take off and land (in the distance.) I thought the room was well kept, even though you could see a little wear and tear. This is to be expected, we first were there in 2008 right after the hotel opened. While there were a few worn spots here or there, it was nothing offensive at all, and I was very pleased with the room and the cleanliness. -Ate at the Grand Lux Cafe every morning for breakfast. Ended up doing the buffet each morning...not because we are huge eaters but mainly because it was the best deal. They have all the staples: waffles, omelettes, bacon, eggs, hashbrown potatoes, lots of fruit, cereal, breakfast pastries, etc. The orange juice is fresh squeezed and it is to DIE for! Would have paid for the buffet just for that :) -Lunches were usually by the pool at Solaro, and it was very good. Surprisingly good for a poolside cafe. Enjoyed huge burgers one day, and a yummy fresh, crisp caesar salad the next. Frozen drinks were great...although the pool staff was short staffed the first day we were there. I think it was the first warm day Vegas had had in a long time, and they weren't ready for the onslaught of pool visitors. The great thing is that they quickly remedied that situation and had many more pool bartenders out the next day. Bravo Palazzo! -Lunch at Dos Caminos was perfect as usual...it is pretty quiet around lunchtime. We ordered the famous guacamole (do it - it is as good as they say) and ordered tacos (fish for me, chicken for DH) It is well made Tex-Mex food, good quality ingredients, and the atmosphere only adds to the experience. This is a chain restaurant, but we were pleased with the Palazzo location. Will go back. -We decided one night to try Carnevino, one of the steakhouses in the Palazzo. We hadn't heard anything good or bad about this place, so we just randomly decided we were in the mood for steak. I don't know if the stars were in line or we just lucked out but this place was FANTASTIC. Seriously, one of the best meals we've ever had, anywhere. And we eat out a lot. To this day, when we eat out, we'll say "That was good, but it still wasn't as good as Carnevino!!!" We ordered the fried calamari, and the insalata romana (caesar salad) to start. We both had the 8oz filet, and ordered sides of parmigiano zeppole (TO DIE FOR GREAT! Like crispy puffs of cheesy potato-y goodness) and sauteed broccolini with pork belly. We didn't even talk to each other during the meal it was so fantastic! We were too stuffed for dessert, but it was a pleasant stuffed feeling. YUM is the only way to sum it up.... -Did some shopping in the Palazzo shops and the Venetian shops...very pleasant to stroll along and window shop. Love the fresh flowers in the Palazzo shops...beautiful to look at. -Canyon Ranch Spa: OH WOW. We booked a facial for me and a massage for the hubby. We spent at least 4 hours in the spa! Between the treatments, the lounges, the jacuzzis, the steam room, the Turkish sauna, the rainforest showers, the aromatherapy heat room, the salt relaxation room...you get the picture...we were in heaven. This spa experience is WORTH EVERY PENNY. Will most definitely do the spa again. Husband isn't even a spa person and he is already begging me to go back. -So, what about the gambling, right?? Well, believe it or not, we are not huge gamblers. I played the penny slots for 10 minutes, and he played roulette for about 45 minutes. He won playing roulette, so that was icing on the cake for us. We don't come here for gambling, but the casino is nice, clean, relatively smoke-free (as much as it can be) and nicely spaced. We never noticed much of a crowd, and we were there during March Madness. All in all, another delightful trip to the Palazzo! We talk about coming here at least once a year for relaxation, pool-time, spa-time and great restaurants. You won't be disappointed when you choose this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nosevens
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled to Vegas many times and the Palazzo is at the top of our list. Great food, shopping and the Venetian is only a 5 minute stroll through the shops. Basically 2 resorts in one. The rooms are awesome and the suites are even better. The Fortuna suite is huge and the curtains draw closed leaving the room totally dark for those afternoon naps. Very plush and modern. This was our 3rd stay and we were not disappointed. We really enjoyed ourselves and the staff is very friendly. Everything you can want under one roof. No need to venture out unless you just want to. Fashion Show Mall is across the street and a Walgreens is on the property. The ONLY complaint is the unfinished condo with cranes outside our window. Someone please finish this project or cover it with a tarp. Shopping is great with many, many high end shops. Even with the expensive shopping, it is cheaper than craps!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service made right”
Reviews.Author: Twibelly
Reviews.Content: It was amazing! To stay at a hotel of this level, and then not have them care that I couldn't get into my room for 5 hours! The card reader on the door was not working. It let me in the first time, then not again. So I had to make 5 trips through the casino (in my swimming suit) to the front desk to get help. They tried numerous times to just give me a new card. They wouldn't believe me that the cards weren't working. Finally they gave me a new room, and some food credits. The credits didn't work, had to pay cash for the dinner, then get reimbursed. I have had much better service from Bally's at 1/3 the price. Finally the woman in charge of booking conferences ( I was there visiting a friend during her conference) made it all right, and gave me a 3rd row center seat for Blue Man Group. Even that didn't go right, the ticket wasn't at will call. She had to show up personally and use her own credit card to purchase the ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Palazzo Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ScottyVegas_10
Reviews.Content: Not sure what these other reviewers are talking about? As soon as we drove up we were treated like VIP’s, even though we were driving a rented bright blue Ford Focus. The valet personnel were very friendly as several of them greeted us even before we reached the doors. The registration desk was close by the entrance. The line was kind of long but there were plenty of registration staff on hand to move the line quickly. No surprise that the entire process was a breeze and everyone, and I mean everyone, greeted us like royalty. Elevators were across the casino but were directly off the casino floor. This is always a definite plus in my book. Security is located just before the elevators and they request to see your room key before allowing you to pass. This was a minor inconvenience but worth it I guess as there are some shady characters in Vegas. Our room 47-727 was on the 47th floor overlooking the Northeast side of the valley and the Wynn golf course. Both my wife and I thought the room was outstanding. The decor and layout gave it a real “homey” feeling and not that of a hotel room. They did a great job dividing the room into sections without using walls. When you first walk in the spacious bathroom was on the left and included a nicely sized and conveniently located LED TV. As you enter the main room the king size bed was on the left and a 40 some inch LED on the right. Separating the bed area from a sitting area was a thigh high bench partition. The sitting area included a comfy wrap around couch with a good sized coffee table with another LED TV sitting on top of the snack station. In the same area was a small table with a couple of chairs and a desk for working which included an Ethernet cable for internet access, telephone, pen and paper, and a multi-function printer with USB hookup for continence. Both the Palazzo and Venetian are upscale properties in a great area of the strip they are next store to the Wynn and across the street from TI (Treasure Island). Between the two properties are many dinning and shopping choices to choose from and browse. The Palazzo and Venetian casinos are among my favorite places to gamble on the strip as they offer and wide variety of slot, VP, and table games. Their slot selection is a good mix of new and classic style machines. I always seem to be able to play here and consider it a good value for my dollar. I rarely have problems with drink service here. Top shelf drinks are available and cocktail waitress ratio to patrons is good. Another plus is I find that their waitresses engaged and very friendly which is always a plus in my book. Club Grazie is the name of the player’s card. Their comp program is competitive. Check out my full review at [---]

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo concierge suites are a great experience - beautiful, great service!”
Reviews.Author: SarSwan
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the Palazzo's concierge suites which include the following (their site is a little ambiguous): continental breakfast, dedicated concierge desk, free DVD library rentals, free non-alcoholic drinks (7AM to 9PM), and free open bar with hours d'oerves from 5PM to 7PM, free 'dessert' from 7PM to 9PM. The Palazzo is a very beautiful property with a beautiful lobby, casino, shopping mall, gym, spa, pool, elevators, and theaters. As other reviewers have stated, there is an enormous amount of fragrance pumped through the casino (but it's relatively smoke free in comparison to others); rooms are free of this fragrance. This trip was for a multi-generational family consisting of father, mother, teenage daughter, and grandmother. Service----------------- After 8.5 hours of driving, it was just heaven to catch the elevator to the 23rd floor and get checked in at the concierge desk with zero wait time; the staff explained the amenities , how to get to my room, offered baggage assistance, and accommodated my additional guest with out much issue (other than a reminder of the extra $50 per day charge.) We interacted with the concierge staff again to book phantom of the opera tickets (which they printed for us right there), rent DVDs from the library, and for extra robes and slippers (which are very nice by the way.) Room------------------ About 800 sq ft of just gorgeous room, furnished in a transition style -- it was both traditional in terms of flourishes but modern in terms of a more spare application of them. The color scheme was gray, mauve, brown, and cream and was very pleasant. The bathroom was a 12X12 marble covered dream with a huge soaking tub and separate shower and toilet room, and it included just wonderful lemon-verbena scented soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and bath salt! They really thought of everything. The beds were comfortable and nicely made every day, the sofa bed was both comfortable to sit on and slightly less comfortable to sleep on. Linens seemed to be of high quality. The table seating area was nice and the desk and printer/fax machine in the room was very nice -- there was also WIFI and wired internet access available there and it was very easy to connect to. Reading other reviews on tripadvisor.com, there were complaints of thefts and I didn't experience any issues with this at all. One evening we were surprised to find our ice container filled and chocolates on the bed -- I think someone must have called in to housekeeping for that and just gave the wrong room number or something (which is odd.) Location & Amenities--------------------- The location is kind of on the end of the strip, so it feels a little remote, but that's kind of nice. We could watch the TI-siren show from our room's window; and hear it completely from right outside the lobby. Breakfast in the lounge: oatmeal, fruit, breads, pastries, cold cereal, and hot cinnamon rolls are offered everyday -- they rotate in cheese omlettes, cheese blintz. Beverages for breakfast include the typical cast: coffee, tea, juices, milk -- or you can get a cappuccino, latte, or mocha made for you (gratis!) I loved the cheese danish, mini-croissants, and the fresh fruit was of impeccable quality. All day sodas and bottled water are also free -- so stock up and carry them around with you, you'll save quite a bit this way. Evening reception: nightly a full open bar is available with hot hours d'oerves -- soup, raw vegetables, hot savory bits, and roasted salted nuts; on one Friday night, Mario Battali's restaurant "Carnevio" did a presentation of their on-site made cured meats, stake tartare, eggplant, and large-pearl couscous & pea salad. That was an even nicer treat. What they labeled as dessert was a let down, it was just cookies -- some fancy ones, but still just cookies. Also the website said they would have an "afternoon presentation" -- I figured some cold cuts, cheese, and bread at noon -- but there was actually nothing. What made up for those inconsistencies (i.e. between the on-line description of the concierge suites and what you actually got) was the fantastic service, beautiful decor, lovely place-settings, and real silverware. Restaurants----------------------- We tried a few restaurants for dinner and lunch in the hotel and that's were we saw the most inconsistencies in quality and service. - Aquanox (lunch): fantastic! We ordered bay shrimp cocktails for $1.99, crab-cake burger, bacon-cheese burger, lobster bisque, and Mediterranean chicken salad. All were excellent, except the chicken salad which was slightly over-dressed and caused the greens to wilt prematurely. - Pinot Brasserie (dinner): ok... This was a let down as it was an expensive dinner, where only one person was completely satisfied. We ordered the short-ribs (requested well done, they were delivered medium), seafood linguine, lamb (this was liked), and scallops (one was cooked properly, the other two were mostly raw -- but seafood quality seemed to be sushi grade.) The flavors of the food were good, but we were all surprised at all the garlic slices in the sauces -- it is supposed to be French food and their style typically involves straining sauces to remove the 'identifying' ingredients -- possibly that's just the chef's intent. - Dal Toro (dinner): We ordered seafood risotto (good but a shell broke and the chef nor waitstaff noticed, and I got to pick out shell bits at the table), Chilean sea bass crocant (this was also excellent, fish was cooked perfectly). The tiramisu was the best I've ever had anywhere. Best & Worst --------------------- Aquanox was the BEST restaurant we tried during our trip. The concierge suites made the trip a breeze and the staff were excellent. The Palazzo, while not non-smoking, seems to have more non-smoking areas than most casinos and was therefore more pleasant and not foul-smelling. The worst: San Gennaro Grill at the Venetian -- I got sick from a tomato and mozzarella panini (I don't even know how that's possible.) The tomatoes were so un-ripe they were very hard to bit through; my stomach hurt for literally hours.

Reviews.Title: “Unidentified stains on sectional”
Reviews.Author: Crazypugs
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort. However, there are two issues. The first is that the furniture in the rooms is really worn. I imagine that Las Vegas rooms get much more wear and tear than rooms in other cities, but the hotels need to anticipate that and replace things more frequently. A colleague said there were stains all over the marble floor in his room and discarded water bottles and expired milk from the previous guest. The second issue is that they do not have the resources to handle guests when they are at high capacity. This could mean you will wait an hour in line to check in, depending on what time you are checking in, or it could mean that you are told it will take an hour for them to bring you oatmeal for room service breakfast. It might also mean that you pay $20 per day to use their exercise room, only to find all the treadmills being used--really, if they are going to charge you to use the exercise room, they should have enough exercise equipment that you don't have to wait. Otherwise, nice rooms and nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “poor service deceitful practices”
Reviews.Author: tombaud
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and four people at reservation desk. We stood there and no one acknowledged us. Then they have a $17 a day resort fee (mandatory) I know it is an insignificant amount but it goes to show their business practices. Lastly, the gentleman checking us in we could not understand (didn't speak very good english). We got lost finding the room, but finally a security guard helped us out. Rooms were nice, a little beat up but great view. They have a light at the step in the room that kept us awake most of the first night then the previous guest left the alarm on for 4:56AM - after turning off the first time, i found out that i just hit snooze. 5 minutes later i pulled the plug from the wall. did you know they have a battery in those? then 5 minutes later i had to take it and figure out which series of buttons you need to hit. At 8:00 AM housekeeping shows up (put out a do not disturb sign) - after the second night there you will remember because it will happen again as I found out. (i'm a slow learner). We were in the Venecia tower and they dont have internet, and their pool was closed for the week. Overall i have stayed at MonteCarlo, MGM, South Point, Bellagio all would be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was robbed”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler98
Reviews.Content: We had money stolen from our room. The hotel did not appear to have much security. When I spoke to the front desk manager I was told that it wasn't protocol for things to be taken from our room!! Worst part is they claimed no one had been in our room. How then did it get cleaned and the towels changed?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on LV Strip”
Reviews.Author: TeamC
Reviews.Content: We booked the Palazzo after seeing some friends photos, but after reading the mixed bag of reviews on T A, we were some what apprehensive as to what to expect. We were in L V for a week and stayed at the Signature at MGM for 4 nights and then moved on to the Palazzo to see what a hotel on the strip was like. We had rented a car and arrived about 3pm parking in self park and then setting out to find check-in. A bit of along queue, but it moved fairly quickly and the guy on reception was very nice although he did try to get us upgrade,but didn't hard sell. We asked for a high room and was given a room on the 37th floor, we had already paid for a "luxury" view (the L V Strip). He went on explain that the mini bar was very sensitive if you tried to use it to store your own food/drink (a very useful thing to know as I would most likely have tried to keep our own snacks cool!!!) As we had self parked we couldn't get help with our bags as they do not go in the parking area, only if you valet park. A bit of a bummer as it meant two trips for my poor other half. The room was very nice, if a little dark because of the decor, but the view outweighed this little niggle. We looked out on to T I and the strip, a truly fantastic view.Seating area, bed and bathroom all to a good standard, with added bonus of remote control curtains!!!.The room was of a good size and easily comfortable for 2 people. We had a good internet connection which although "free" you actually paid for in your resort fee of about $16/day, plus a mini office with fax and printer. The room was cleaned daily and towels replaced. We used the room service for breakfast and whilst a bit overpriced the food was hot and delivered when we asked. I would recommend going to the Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast, choose the buffet with unlimited juice and coffee and you have truly wonderful breakfast, the choice is limited but with omelette and eggs cooked to order you can't go wrong. They also do a really nice evening meal. Check out was painless and even though we left the room 30mins after check out time, no comment was made. My only gripe would be the lack of a coffee maker in the rooms. I do like to be able to make a coffee when I want, but sadly here the policy is not to put coffee makers in rooms, instead you are expected to use room service and of course pay twice the price. On the whole we really enjoyed our stay and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tha Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: ichingacu
Reviews.Content: The service is getting worse. I and my family always stay here when we in LV. But it's time to change. Due to the bad service. In 04/04/2010 when we check in at 3:15 pm they told us to wait for 45 min to get in our room they said it'd not ready yet. And then when we got the room we found the keys were not working then I tried to called the front desk guess what another 30 minutes waiting in phone for the front desk. NEVER STAY IN THIS CASINO AGAIN!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Princesstessa
Reviews.Content: Our first impression with The Palazzo was not a good one. The man that checked us in never spoke one word to us and acted like we were bothering him. We felt totally unwelcome. Our check-in took a total of about 60 seconds and the only words he said to us the entire time was to "take a left into the casino" to find the elevator to the room. We had absolutely no idea where we were going and neither of us appreciated the snotty treatment. The room was clean and spacious - and we really liked the automatic blinds. Nice touch! We ate breakfast every morning at the Grand Lux Cafe - awesome. The pool was great and we loved the thick padded lounge chairs. Wonderful! The maid service was spotty at best - one day our room was totally skipped and not cleaned. We arrived back at the room at 11:30pm and all I wanted to do was curl up in a nice clean bed. We were not at all happy to find the room not cleaned. This should never happen and it's not acceptable! We went to Lagasse's Stadium because my husband wanted to place a few sports bets and we were treated with the same unfriendly and snotty attitudes. In other words - if you're not a high roller - you're nothing. We get it. We took our gambling money and spent it in other friendler casinos where they actually appreciate your business. We've decided that next time we will stay at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Best 'standard' room we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dina4
Reviews.Content: All rooms at the Palazzo are suites. We had a standard suite that was incredibly spacious and comfortable. Everything was fantastic about the room-- gorgeous bathroom, sunken living room with sectional couch, comfortable beds and linens, great TVs, nice view. We did have to pay for internet, and it definitely was slow and spotty. It also took a long time for people to help you on the phone. The 11am check out was also disappointing, and we had to pay and extra $50 to check out at 3pm! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Doing Fine for a 5* with 3000+ Rooms in a Bad Economy”
Reviews.Author: ToilsToTravel
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a reunion weekend with friends. Reserved two adjoining Bella Suites, which were waiting for us following a prompt check-in on a busy Friday afternoon. Suites were spacious, clean, and comfortable. Some furniture was missing hardware, which isn't surprising considering Vegas' party reputation. I did notice a paint "touch-up" team working on the room across the hall. "L" shaped sofa in sunken living area was great for catching up prior to hitting the town. All service requests were quickly acknowledged, including extra towels, extra shampoo, and turn-down of the fold-out sofa. Housekeeping was also thorough, and had a large presence in the corridors during the day. I was pleasantly surprised to see this degree of staffing. Poolside service was also very good. We reserved a cabana, which I highly recommend. I continue to be a big fan of the Palazzo/Venetian. They are nice properties with an excellent location. The staff certainly put a lot of effort into ensuring a nice stay for their guests. It is unrealistic to expect a Four Seasons 5* experience due to the sheer magnitude of the hotel, but as it is Las Vegas, the energy of the casino, location, and pool deck are a nice trade-off.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel- NOT 5 star service!”
Reviews.Author: deaner101
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night trip staying at the Palazzo. Firstly we were not given the complimentary suite upgrade included in our package. Apparently complimentary does not mean free to them, but for a fee we could get the upgrade.....how shady. The breakfast was located at the Venetian, a 15 minute walk, which really stank if you want to bring a hot coffee to your room since there are no coffee makers. There was a 1/2 hr wait to check in and nothing to accomodate you while you wait. Rooms are clean, spacious and modern. Staff not overly friendly or helpful. I have stayed a various hotels in Vegas, this is not a 5 star property by far. Hint: Try the Wynn or Bellagio, great ammenities and service.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Resort”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 15th floor, it was very upscale and comfortable. The room featured two flat panel TVs, couch, mini-bar (don't touch it!---$$$), and a work center that included a multifunction unit. I ate at one of Emeril's restuarants on property and it was very good and expensive. Be sure to bring all your personal items with you, I had to purchase toothpaste and it was $18.50 at the local shop near the elevators - AVOID. Skip the room service, overpriced and not very good. I attended David Spade show, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: ar_sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for a conference. It was our first time (we had stayed in the Venetian 2 years previously), and it was a great experience.
