The front desk was helpful, and check in was fast. The rooms were nicely appointed, but I wish I had known that humidifiers were available (I had seen one in the hallway the day I left). The dry air in Vegas takes a tolls on your sinuses. This is a fabulous hotel when you have a convention at the Venetian/Sands Expo area. The restaurants were fine, you are connected to the Venetian and never have to step outside, Walgreens is conveniently located for all kinds of items, and there are great shows (Phantom of the Opera, Blue Man Group, Jersey Boys) within the casino. Overall, would stay here again in a heartbeat! Next time, I will try the Canyon Ranch Spa.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back Next Year”
Reviews.Author: blackwidowinsc
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel inside and out. The pictures you see on the web site are spot on to what you get when you are at the hotel. Very friendly staff. The restaurants provided great food and service. Our favorite was the Grande Lux Cafe. A visit to The Canyon Ranch Spa is a must if you need a place to rest and relax. The pool area was beautiful too. The only issue we had was with our door not reading our keys properly. We had to have the cards re-keyed and at times security or the maid service had to let us into our room. Not too much fun after a long day but everyone was great when attempting to correct the issue. The rooms were spacious, we had a nice view of the strip. We never heard any noise from the other rooms or from the hallway. The elevators were quick and were never crowded. It is a long walk from the elevators to access the rooms to the front lobby, but it is a pretty walk through the casino. You definitely get what you pay for. The Fashion Place Mall is right across the street, so you can take advantage of the food court. The mall is huge so don't forget your walking shoes. We saw the Blue Man Group at the Venetian. It was a very interactive show. It's a very short, indoor walk between the two hotels but the areas are like night and day. We were prepared to pay the resort fee as stated on the web site, but we let the staff know that we wouldn't use the services and we were not charged the daily fee. If the internet, gym and newspaper are important to you then it is best to pay the daily fee to receive those services. We've already planned to go back in March 2011 and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Best”
Reviews.Author: nessncali
Reviews.Content: This is the place for couples. The service here is great. We loved our room, it was clean and super comfortable, the size was unbelievable. We had a strip view as requested. We were facing TI and was able to see the great show and fireworks. We had dinner at Table Ten which is inside this hotel and we will go again. We shopped in all the stores and service is great there also. We had one problem. We were not given the spa tub that was requested with our room. I never got to the bottom of the problem but I'm still working on it. I just wanted to enjoy while I was there and I will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not The Wynn”
Reviews.Author: happysaint
Reviews.Content: Flew in Friday afternoon from Los Angeles and check-in took 30 minutes tops. My friend booked a great deal through the Grazie Club mailings and we got the room we wanted, resort double, on a high floor with great views of the strip below and mountains above. We could even see the Treasure Island Pirate show and the Mirage Volcano show at night. All the rooms at the Palazzo and Venetian have separate sitting area so the rooms are huge and the bathrooms lovely. Slippers and lots of toiletries delivered by housekeeping immediately upon request. Dined at the Zine Chinese for lunch, just so so but I am finicky about my Chinese food. Dinner at Carnevino Steak House was great even for a vegetarian. Service was top notch. Brunch at Cafe Lux was delicious. Very different kind of veggie burger. Service needs improvement. Casino floor was not crowded, plenty of penny slots, not enough of nickels, and not very loose therefore, didn't play very much. Don't know how well they comp since didn't play much this time. The room keys are not player cards like the Wynn, which was disappointing. Our room deal came with free show tickets for either Jersey Boys at the Palazzo or Phantom at the Venetian. We chose the Venetian and sat third row from the orchestra, fantastic seats!!! A must see if you get the chance. If you are looking for good deals on show tickets, just walk up to the box office inside the hotels and ask if there are any last minute seats at a discount for a same night show. They usually have really good seats for 40-50% off. That's how we got our Cirque du Soleil Beatles Love tickets at the Mirage and it was awesome. Will definitely go again. Manicure/pedicure was so indulgent and you pay for it. Canyon Ranch Spa felt crowded and busy, not very zen feel at all but facialist was still great and I did glow afterwards. I would choose Wynn's Spa over any other spa any day. As a whole package, i.e. service, food, casino, spa, feel, Palazzo is not the Wynn. Just a few notes, if you get a salon or spa treatment, gym is free for that day. The resort fee USD15.00/day is mandatory and offers free wi-fi. Maybe that includes use of gym too but double check. Canyon Spa Cafe offers healthy and tasty breakfast/lunch options.

Reviews.Title: “Siena Suite large wasted space”
Reviews.Author: chuckwag
Reviews.Content: I had 2 boxes sent to the Palazzo and were awaiting our arrival at the Business Center, Upon checking in we were assinged our room, not the room we where promised on a high floor overlooking Wynn golf course, but we were told we had a roof view and that they were sold out, I didn't believe that but the only other offer was to take a luxury suite (regular room) I asked the check in clerk to have the boxes I had shipped sent to the room as they were gifts for my wife and a surprise, he stated that he would. After an hour wait for the boxes, I called the business center and they told me that a request was never made and that it would cost me $14.00 to get them. Well I asked what they wanted me to do, I just told the to charge the packages to the room since we had waited an hour for them. After opening our drapes I was angry at what we saw. My wife was there to relax and spend time in the room, by the time we checked out she had a migrane from the noise from outside the windows. Siena Suite, this being a true 2 room suite over 1200 square feet, I rated this as average, No wet bar or frig for the dinning area, Dinning area just a large space with a small table and 4 chairs, the living room or sitting area had a sectional sofa thats about the same size as found in a luxury king suite, with a work desk, and sitting chair and small lcd tv, I think 40 inch. A small bathroom off the main entry was very small hard to enter, you had to put your back to the wall unless you were very small or a child. In my case a tall large frame male. The bedroom was separate from the living room by a door and was large, a sitting chair and hassock, king bed again not too different than a king luxury just a little more walking around area and a larger lcd tv 46-50inch. The bathroom off the the master bedroom was large, again a waste of area, their was a jucuzzi tub located in between a set of sinks, this tub is only large enough for one person, you might be able to fit 2 really tight. The shower is large very large again lots of wasted spacee unless the family showers together, the shower does have 3 fixed shower heads mounted to the wall butt , knee and ankle high with a hand held shower head, no seat, 6 foot long, so you can't sit and relax (this should have been a steam room for the quaility and price of the suite. The suite was clean and with a small amount of wear and tear, after you see its location you will understand why, We tried to move our location with no results other than our checkout to a king luxury. We were promised a high floor with a golf course view upon check in (Siena Suite). If I had known what they were going to do ahead of time, we would of changed hotels on this trip. As far as room service, 54 dollars for a small pot of coffe, 1 omelet, home fries (soft and warm) 4 sausage links, 2 small croissants, and 1 bagel, (not what I ordered) the food tasted off, not sure if they used real eggs, meat was just warm and greasy, bagel just warm and coffee was strong and bitter, last day there we were happy just to be leaving the Palazzo than complain. To be honest this was a comped room, when I contacted our host I explained to him I had a similar comp from MGM-Mirage(suite with jucizzi) and If he would match it we would stay at the Palazzo, I feel that, they over comped us(Siena Suite) and didn't want to provide what was promised up front for a gold card member. Our play of 1000 cash+, plus roll over (wins) a day in the slots covered the comp for 3 nights, the 4th night 1000 cash + play went to the 3 night siena suite comp and they wouldn't cover the 4th night in the luxury king. I wasn't warned of this during the stay only upon check out on the last day. When we went to change rooms at 11am they didn't have our second room ready , this was another room that was supposed to be assigned, they told us we could keep the Siena until our room was ready. several hours later we recieved a call our seond room was ready and that they would send a bell man to the room to go straight to our suite inwhich my wife did, upon arrive she was locked out and 30 minutes later no bellman, well I went up stairs to our new room and no clothes, no wife so I went down to the siena and my wife had to go to the bathroom so bad she was hopping around, so off to the casino she went, the housekeeping manager was walking around and won't let me into the suite, finally after a 10 minute wait security showed up, but no bellman, What bull this was finally a bellman showed up after a hour to move us. To charge me 140 dollars for a king luxury after placing us in a Siena with a view of airconditioner units and walls for 3 nights, poor customer service, they lost a customer forever. I spoke to several host about these problems and was finally told that our ex-host over extended his ability by placing us in a Siena Suite, between over 4k in cash play plus winnings played in slots just covered the Seina and they wouldn't comp the luxury king. I was told they were making changes to their host system. From what I understood, they were making a new job position (semi host) for gold card players and below. After years of staying at the Palazzo Venetian, this was the last visit.to the Palazzo . I read a post about Sheldon catering to Veterans don't belive it, because I forgot my lic one night and used my DOD Department of Defense ID, 100% Disable Veteran, they wouldn't accept it as proof of ID and the treatment we recieved was less then any paying customer, because of the room comp. I don't believe they would have placed a paying customer in the room we had. Look forward to long waits, poor cocktail service, weak well drinks, they state are premium liquor, on the slot floor. The Palazzo like other Hotels are understaffed and will tell you cash brings better upgrades when you arrive, so forget about even asking for an upgrade unless your willing to pay the difference. :)

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE...HORRIBLE SERVICE, HORRIBLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CAlexisC412
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked at The Venetian but when we checked in, we were told that they had overbooked and sent us to The Palazzo. We walked in to our room and it was a disaster, there were rags thrown on the floor, cleaning solution left on the counter, and the beds were not made with a chaise thrown on one and all the linens crumpled on top of the other. We went down and complained and were told that they would resolve the issue immediately. Two hours passed and we went back to the room and found it still in that state! We went back down and spoke with the manager who said that her housekeeping manager was on the way over to the room and that she would resolve the issue right away. Another two hours passed (this is now around 6 am) and we went back up to find the room STILL in that same state. We went back down and they finally transferred us back to The Venetian because they were unable to resolve the issue and we finally got to bed close to 8 am. What a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Third time the charm?”
Reviews.Author: gabbygambler
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Palazzo. I've enjoyed each stay there but there were cracks in the foundation this third time around. Service was not as good as in the past and I found my accomodation to not be as clean as in the past. Some furniture was chipped and a broken drawer fell out of it's place and landed on my foot. Palazzo is still a lovely hotel and the flaws I found were minor where the hotel is concerned. Restaurants were good as always and we were quite pleased with the dining choices and the food. The casino service was the largest disappointment, it was almost non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Suburb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dansterboy01
Reviews.Content: This was not my first nor last trip to The Palazzo, Las Vegas. Excellent Service, Fantastic Suite. I absolutely love everything about this Hotel and Casino. Thank you again all of you!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service doesn't warrant wasting your money here”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: I stopped staying at the Venetian next door when I was given a room last year that was soaking wet even down into the sunken living room (apparently someone let the tub run over). When the hotel merely changed the room and didn't offer any "makeups" (MGM gave me 2 free buffets when something similar happened) I knew it was time to stick to the Palazzo. Well, now it's time to bid adieu to both properties as management has clearly decided that service and cleanliness no longer apply at this property. While the rooms are less worn than at the Venetian (only because it's newer) and they have the electric shades/drapes, there's very little else here that makes it worth spending money for, especially when other properties are fighting for our travel dollars. You are charged a $16 nightly resort fee (incl. tax) that gets you unlimited local and 800 calling (have a cell phone so I don't need it), free internet access (could never get past the sign up page "accept" button) and access to their Fitness Room. This is only access to the gym and NOT the spa facilities which requires an additional $20 upfee but the gym is large and has everything (it just takes forever to walk there from the Palazzo). The rooms are spacious and the bed is comfortable but the rooms are not always clean. And the evidence I have to prove that is that during my 2 night stay there recently, housekeeping did not ONCE service my room. Even after making 3 requests and being told that a maid was assigned to my room, I was disappointed to see that when I returned to my room at 10pm that nothing had been done. Discussions with the general manager on site did nothing to rectify the situation, only a weak apology and no effort to compensate, just a promise that I would receive better service the next time (who said there would be a next time). It's obvious that management has cut back on expenses during the recession but cutting back on cleanliness makes me wonder if they're risking more serious consequences (novovirus anyone?) by doing so. I would NOT recommend this hotel or it's sister property the Venetian to anyone, except my worst enemies (let them get sick, not me!). If you want 5 star service, go next door to the Wynn where they understand that concept (and it's usually cheaper too!). If you want a nice room, stay at the MGM or Mirage for much less money and better service.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo is my favorite place in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Redrockgirl99
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a beautiful hotel with outstanding customer service. We’ve stayed there the last two times we’ve gone to Vegas, and we will keep coming back. The rooms are all large with either two queen beds or a king, with a sunken living area that includes an L shaped sofa, dining table, desk, and entertainment area. Everything is decorated beautifully. The bathroom is huge and all marble with a large jetted tub and seperate shower (sometime water does leak under the shower door). The restaurants are all fantastic, the pools are beautiful, and the spa is amazing. Canyon River Ranch Spa will pamper you, and the food they serve is light and healthy. Definitely a great place to start your day for breakfast or lunch. Try the steel cut oats served with fresh fruit or their omlettes or frittatas. The Palazzo is a little on the quieter side so if you are looking for a roaring party hotel/casino, this isn't it. But it is very classy, the air filters work really well to keep the smoke out of the air as much as possible, and the lobby and atrium are always decorated exquisitely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker087
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Palazzo and were very impressed with the service, friendly staff and the great suite that we had. Ate at Don Camino and Restaurant Charlie; excellent food and service. Had fun playing the slots; even had a good win. Did find the drinks expensive, but that's Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Great hotel and great stay!”
Reviews.Author: afriend0607
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! My husband and I had such a great time (but we LOVE vegas so maybe we are biased!) The rooms: Great price, huge, very clean, beautiful furnishings and decor, flat screen tvs, comfy bed, big couch, desk area, etc, huge whirlpool tub The service: Everyone was so friendly and as always a little tipping goes a long way...everyone greated us with a smile and all of our requests were gladly completed

Reviews.Title: “Too Big. Too Noisy. Too Smelly.Too Bad.......”
Reviews.Author: Joyce333
Reviews.Content: Just came home from here. Stayed in basic suite 15th floor. We were located a looong distance from elevator banks. Room was huge, bathroom lovely (not as nice as the Signature's tho). Bed very comfortable, and appeared clean. Living area comfortable and spacious. Fax/copier came in handy. Safe large enough for a laptop. Room was exactly as described online. They forgot to add that although this hotel is relatively new, the guests are "hard" on the rooms. Dressers chipped, mirrors broken, scratch marks, cracked tiles. Housekeeping was lacking. Floors weren't washed, tub appeared dirity. And DO NOT... I REPEAT DO NOT.. touch the material padding on headboard or drapes on each side of bed......... 50 pounds of dust will fly (very very dirty). Lamps cheap and nobs are beginning to break off. lightbulbs burnt out were not replaced while we were there. Bathroom amenities were cheap, and smelled like Lemon Pledge. Not enough towels provided, bathmat dirty. Housecoats good. I fixed the one bathroom sink for them (should have sent them a bill) Elevators are quick. Suite doors slam when closed. Front desk, friendly and efficient. Concierge desk always lined up. Casino filled with smoke which wafted up into hotel. Valet parking understaffed and apparently staffed with a person who didn't know what he was doing one evening and misfilled all cars. Wait time for vehicle is too long. Breakfast for 2 was $64. We didn't find the wait time too long for this and was actually a good breakfast. The coffee shop by elevator banks is HUGE $$$$ This hotel is too large. You have to walk to far to get to guest elevators. You smell smoke 24/7 It is nicely located on strip (reason for choosing). Emerils Table 10 was ok only. First wasn't worth it. Shopping was all high end. I wouldn't stay here again, but if you were there for the casino action and never in your room then, it might suffice. It definately isn't a 5 star, more like a 3.

Reviews.Title: “This so called 5 star resort should be a two star hotel instead!”
Reviews.Author: theresorttraveler
Reviews.Content: Where do I start! This so called 5 star resort is the most terrible 5 star resort I have ever stayed in. I have stayed at the Venetian many times over the past years and I had no problems! I had to change about 4 rooms in this hotel. One of the only good things that were good about this hotel are that the elevators were close to the room. The problems were..... Room 1- Blood Stains on sofa and toilet. Room 2- Food on the floor and hair and toenails on the bed Room 3- A strong food scent and weird stains on the bed Room 4 ( this is the room we settled with)- FINALLY! A much better room but....... the AC didnt work! It is controlled by the hotel! It stayed around thd mid 70's for the whole night. But I was too tired to complain so I suffered it for the night. On the plus side the rooms have nice features like automatic shades, TV in bathroom, and a large living room. But it is not worth it to stay here. A good thing that came out of this was I lost some weight walking to the lobby mutiple times!!!! I will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel i've ever stayed in my life...will only stay there next time I head to vegas”
Reviews.Author: saraflikks
Reviews.Content: There is so much I can say about this hotel..my sister and I just got back this morning and it could not have been better. we had such a perfect time. The room was amazing. We had a great upgrade for $100 a night which was worth it for us. We could go and grab something to eat any time of the day, and also drinks after five. The staff is amazing, friendly and so helpful. really i was just amazed and in Awe of this place. we had such a great time I can not wait to go back. The pool and hot tub is great even at this time of year..just remember to bring your robe down with you to keep warm after getting out and sitting by the pool. We went to a few shows and loved everyone one of them..especially the Mac King show, and the Lance Burton magic show. cant wait to go back there again very soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply luxurious”
Reviews.Author: MrsChan
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon for 3 nights. When we arrived we were given a free room upgrade (after some persuasion). It was definately worth it as our room was overlooking Treasure Island and it was a studio room - very spacious and definately 5*. We loved the fact that it shared facilities with the Venetian hotel as its part of the same hotel group. We could explore both leisure facilities like the huge swimming pools and loungers. It caters for both honeymoon couples and singletons. There was a dedicated area for the 'young ones' with music and waitresses bearing a lot of flesh but I guess that's Vegas for you! There are great bars and nightclubs here. The only downfall was we didn't have much luck at their casino! Just beware of Timeshares sellers. They try and drag you in a 4hr meeting with them by offering you free tickets. If you are prepared to waste 4hrs, than make sure you are not brainwashed into signing anything because I have heard many bad stories. I would definately come back here but maybe with a group of friends this time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: nagabi
Reviews.Content: The room was warm, comfortable and big. The bathroom was clean and big. The casino is, maybe, one the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: CrystalR7
Reviews.Content: Had a great time with my teenager, she would of had more fun if she had another teen to enjoy the pool with. We are going again this spring break!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo--Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TeentyOne
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect as we received an offer for 4 free nights as members of the Grazie (Player's Club) Club. We are not high rollers, in fact we had spent only an hour or so at the Venetian Casino on our last trip to Las Vegas, but what a pleasant stay we had. The room was a suite with 2 queen beds, huge bathroom with double sinks, separate tub, shower, and toilet, and a step down living area with a large sectional couch, desk, table and 3 chairs, and an entertainment unit with 1 of the 3 TV sets. Beautiful remote controlled Roman Shades and drapes,and although we did not have a Strip view, the mountains were pretty and certainly better than the snow we left in Chicago.The clerk at check in warned us that the bar was weight sensitive, and if we moved anything in the refrigerator it would show up on our bill so we were careful not to. We did have one box of candy--$11, but since the room was free that was OK. The hotel is beautiful, our room was spotless, the hotel staff helpful and friendly,and the bed very comfortable. From the time we checked in until we left we were pleased with any contact we had with the hotel staff. In case you wonder if signing up for a Player's Card is worth it even if you aren't a big gambler, my answer is yes, yes, yes. I'm sure when the economy improves these kinds of offers will go away, but I was certainly glad to be on the receiving end of this one.

Reviews.Title: “Continued Excellence”
Reviews.Author: MortyCanada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palazzo several times. We are usually comped for the room, and usually spend $100 to upgrade to the concierge level. The concierge level provides several amenities: (1) check-in is on the 23th floor and there is never a line (the security guard at the elevator will have your name and allow you access to the elevator); (2) an adequate breakfast is provided each morning with a selection of cold items plus oatmeal, hot cinnamon rolls and a hot item such as a miniature omelette; (3) evening hors d’oeuvres with free drinks – the food was just barely adequate, but the drinks are consistently good. The staff on duty are, of course, very congenial and helpful. We always ask for an humidifier, and, as always it was delivered and setup promptly. The dismal economy and the decline in visits to Las Vegas is having an impact on the Palazzo. Some of the light bulbs in the swag lamp over the table were burned out but quickly replaced. For some reason, the bedside lamps and the clock had been disconnected! I simply plugged them in. The bathrobes are a bit tacky and in need of replacement. Beyond these minor complaints, the room is still as spacious and comfortable; the bathroom, with double sinks, separate tub and shower and room for the commode is simply very nice; the two flat screen TVs are great with an excellent selection of channels. Room service is still prompt, courteous and efficient. Both of us used the spa for the first time and found the services only adequate., but the physical facilities quite pleasant and worth the price. Service is always prompt and courteous; most of the dealers are competent and pleasant. It has always been our favourite place to stay in Vegas, and remains that way.

Reviews.Title: “Belle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crystal7982
Reviews.Content: The Pallazzo is a great hotel to stay at while in Vegas. Staff was great, room service was fast and delicious, (a lillte on the expensive side). Everything you can need is in the hotel. The rooms was beautiful and spacious with a great view of the strip. Just take a wonder around the hotel especially at there night club and shopping strips. You'll have a geat time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: KTBSanJose
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the major casinos in Vegas. Palazzo is a personal favorite (along with Venetian and Wynn), as the rooms are far superior to the other hotels in Vegas - that are comparable in price. FYI - To all those that complain about the absence of coffee makers in the room, this is a Las Vegas staple. All major casinos much prefer you walk downstairs for those minor extras, as management hopes that on your way to retrieve those items, you will drop by the casino floor and gamble. Furthermore, management prefers that you spend your time at a slot machine or table, as opposed to “waste” valuable potential gambling time in your room, on the internet. Consequently, I foresee this will never change. I am actually pleased by the addition of the daily “resort fee”, as gym access used to run for an outrageous $45/day (now included). Also, if you plan to return to Vegas, sign up for the Club Grazie (loyalty program). Palazzo/Venetian has one of the best comp programs in town, and in 3 years, I have not paid for a hotel room at either hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ymmitg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Palazzo this past weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. A couple of features that I really enjoyed: 1) The room style. It was a suite, but layout was such that you could see out the very large windows from almost anywhere. 2) The Restaurants. There are tons of top notch restaurants in the Palazzo / Venetian complex, and if you don't like them you are 2 mins from the Wynn with even more. We will go back there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the criticism...”
Reviews.Author: blinky1004
Reviews.Content: ... of this hotel. I've been going to Vegas since the early 80's and this was by far the best property we've stayed at. We had a Fortuna suite on the 39th floor with a west view. The room was spacious (huge understatement), nicely appointed, and invitingly comfortable. I had read reviews about things not being right with some rooms. We had two lights out in our suite, and the makeup mirror didn't work right. All was repaired and the mirror was replaced within 15 minutes of my call. I can't understand complaints about noisy ventilation; the thermostats allow users to select the fan speed. Yes, it's noisy at high speeed, but was very unobtrusive on medium or low. Serice was always prompt, knowledgable, and friendly. The Grand Luxe restaurant is the best day-to-day eatery of any in Vegas. Everything on the huge menu was top notch and reasonably priced. We also ate at Dos Caminos which was excellent, and Charlies which was world-class. With all of the restaurants, shops, shows, and amenities available at the Venetian/Palazzo you really don't have to leave. However, the location places it within easy walking distance of everything on the strip between Riviera and City Center. The bottom line is, experienced travellers should take the criticisms of this property with a grain of salt. This resort is one of the very best, and is well deserving of its 5-star rating. Savvy travelers will be able to find deals on rooms here that will make it one of the best values on the planet. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “perfect view from 44th floor”
Reviews.Author: apricot24
Reviews.Content: We initially planned to go the Venetian, but received an upgrade for a handful of dollars for a suite in the Palazzo Resort. The view was awesome, the room was gigantic and perfect, everything quite new, pure luxury. We would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: leefsmith
Reviews.Content: I never even left the resort area of the sand convenion center, n need to EVERYTHING you would need or want was there; Entertainment, food, recreation, you name it was there and the suites were without equal.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo- Once again a winner!!”
Reviews.Author: vgasdude
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo from 02/21/10 to 02/24/10. I wont comment on price because I got a deal. All I can say is if you have a chance to stay here do it. This is the third time I have been there with no problems. I realize some people have had problems but I personally have never encountered one. A friend of mine also stayed there and her safe was not working and someone was in her room and had it fixed within fifteen minutes. The rooms are all suites with a tv in the bedroom area and one in the living room area and another in the bathroom. The bed is very comforable and I slept like a baby all three nights. I can only comment on the hotel itself this time as the weather did not cooperate for the pool area. If you are a gambler there are plenty of machines of all coin values to interest you. The only reason I mention this particular item is because I also visited a certain casino that they took five years to build and if you want to play video poker at less then a quarter amount you are out of luck which I find alienates some people. I have always felt both the Venetian and the Palazzo catered to anyone who wants to gamble at least on the slots or video poker no matter what thier budget and whether they were staying there or not. The only bad thing I could say which is just a personal preference and very minor is that I wish the DVD player was in the bedroom area so you could watch it at night instead of the living room area. I love the Palzzo and I think if you have the opportunity you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: papasandnic
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a Vegas trip and booked a suite over Valentine's weekend. The room was AMAZING. We had a living room, bedroom with a king size bed, and a wonderfully sized bathroom with separate shower/bath. Each room had a flat screen TV. We loved the electronic shade/drapes… we kept opening and closing them with the remote! We ordered room service one morning which was pretty good considering it was hotel food -- a little pricey but that is normal in Vegas. My only complaint (if it really is one) is that my husband paid a little extra to have a view of the strip but our view consisted of Treasure Island, the pool, and the Trump hotel… not much else. Again… this is not really a complaint against the room/hotel but something to consider when paying extra. All in all our experience at The Palazzo was great. A wonderful hotel with great restaurants and shopping. We couldn't have asked for anything more when staying in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo the Opulent!”
Reviews.Author: VETTESHARK
Reviews.Content: What a magnificant work of art, from marble floors, statues and nature all around you. What ambience! As anyone who’s been fortunate enough to visit an Italian countryside and seaports knows, the country is famous for its hospitality and a divine range of diversions. The Palazzo was created with precisely that in mind. The beauty of Capri. The luxurious serenity of Portofino. The couture of Milan. The culinary greatness of Tuscany. The graciousness of the people. Here, it all comes together to fashion the epitome of a lifestyle of luxury. And amid every convenience and amenity, you’ll be welcomed into the palazzo, where throughout your stay you’ll discover a new view on Las Vegas, where impeccable service and unforgettable ambience are at every turn. The food, entertainment, shopping, casino, Spa and what a great place for romance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexDupe
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and casino. The location of this hotel is right on the strip making it easy to walk to any other hotel or casino as well as other attractions. Although the palazzo is a more expensive hotel the rooms are worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelnut27
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful! The rooms are nice and the bed was so comfortable. Another thing I like about this resort is the location of the hotel elevators. They are all in one area so if you are with a group you aren't all going every which way to get to your rooms. Also for those who find the people that stand out on the Blvd. passing out those nasty cards and magazines annoying they are not around the Palazzo, Venetian, or Wynn hotels so you can walk in those areas in peace!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too damn'd expensive”
Reviews.Author: JWKCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great but even though we got comp'd we spent a fortune. They are trying to save a buck everywere they can. They've eliminated turn down serivce. They cut back on the air conditioning at night. We woke up sweating both evenings. They charge $15/night for a resort fee which gives you a free newspaper if you want to go get it yourself, free local calls for anyone without a cell phone, use of pool and internet access. Doesn't the pool come with the hotel? And this fee is not optional. Try Wynn or service or Trump for amenites as a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and complex in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BalajiS
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on business (CES) and pleasure. The Venetian has the best poker room. The rooms, the outdoor pool, jacuzzi complex at the Palazzo are amazing. The indoor shopping, food and access to the strip are perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeighK4
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Food, be prepared to fight for a lounge chair by the pool

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: csisaac
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suites...great view of the strip from the higher floors

Reviews.Title: “Wow.......really nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom43302
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Pal and loved it again! Free rooms help, but I would pay to stay here. The suites are very, very nice. Clean as can be; comfy and I have not one complaint about the rooms. I will stay here again and recommend this place to anyone! Hey, I even won money in their casino....again! Front desk people were very nice; plenty of security and the beds & pillows are wonderful!! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Vegas Hotel we all agree on.”
Reviews.Author: davex25
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the other Venetian properties we were keen to try the relatively new Palazzo. In short it did not disappoint. If you like the other hotels in this complex this is just a variation on the same theme. The only negative is the pool area which is uninspired and in shade for too much of the day. It looks like money ran out at the pool deck and in no way lives up to the rest of the hotel. We used the Venetian pools instead.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo is in the best location on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: CJThayer
Reviews.Content: IIt’s walking distance to the Wynn, Venetian, Mirage and lots more. There all great properties, but the Palazzo is my favorite. It has everything. Great food, fun gaming and exciting entertainment. I just love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Noisy Airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: Jamesthefirst
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel and the rooms are fab however the AC is so noisy. We upgraded from the Venitian to the Pallazzo for an extra $50 a day. It is well worth the extra money. It gets you access to the concierge lounge and all of the nibbles and things that go with it. Between 7-9 they have free drinks there too which is a great stsrt to the evening. The hotel has a good location at one end of the strip. As for Las vegas its more of a boys place than somewhere for a couple. One of the big things that is tacky is that they have groups of men in large rows along the street giving out flyers for call girls. They are very in your face with this and thrust the flyers at you as you walk by. The theatre and concerts are great and I would recommend that you take one of these in during your stay

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: chriscgardner
Reviews.Content: Pricey but well worth it if you want to do Vegas in Style. Gigantic room with separate sitting area and a bathroom bigger than most hotel rooms themselves. The staff was excellent and catered to our every needs. He even upgraded us to a room with a view of the strip because it was our first time in Vegas. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2much2do
Reviews.Content: Short review, just to say that the hotel was a great venue for our company event. The room was a good size with nice bathrooms and a living area with desk, which was handy to work from after conferences using the wifi. As it is connected to the Venetian you have easy access to the "canal" area and the St Mark's square experience etc which is cheesy but fun. There are some great shops and restaurants at Palazzo too. We went to Lavo at Palazzo which was pretty cool, and had a nice outdoor area too - good view of the pirate show at TI opposite if you are there early enough for that (I think normally it would be a late night venue, but this was a work thing as part of conference hospitality) It is in a good position, almost opposite the Fashion Mall - which was handy for presents for home. We tended to walk down the strip towards Bellagio, Paris, Caesar's etc at night, and to be honest it did not seem that far when we walked all the way back from NY, NY hotel either (we maybe had a few drinks by then though).

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing - Beautiful Hotel and Peaceful Pools”
Reviews.Author: Wisey_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed tor 5 nights in early September 2009. The weather was lovely - over 100 degrees most days, and it didn't get much below that during the night at the time we were there. Hotel Room We were in a luxury suite (which is one of the standard rooms) on the 44th floor - which had views across the mountains and of the runway for the airport. It had a huge king size bed, which was very comfortable, lovely pillows and bedding. There was plenty of closet and drawer space and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was huge - over 120 sq feet - with a seperate shower, tub and wc. The wc even had a self closing seat and lid. There was a small'ish flat screen TV above the double sink area. Downa few steps to the sunken living room area, which had a large corner couch and coffee table. A third flat screen TV. Electronic drapes and roman blinds, and a safe. Hotel Pool Area The Palazzo shared a pool area with it's neighbouring sister hotel, the Venetian, meaning each hotel had it's own pool area, but you could use either as they were adjoining at the front side of the hotels. Large soft towels were a plenty, comfy loungers - some with thick mattresses, and a number of pools - around 10 or so ( I don't think we saw them all!). The pool staff would pass round chilled orange slices, cucumber slices and chilled face flannels - which were very refreshing in the desert heat. The pool area was very peaceful - we never had trouble finding a place to relax. Casino, Shops, Reception and Restaurants Large, bright and airy casino. Nice selection of restaurants and bars - in he hotel and in the shopping mall which you could walk through to get to the Venetian's next door. The reception staff on the front desk were very friendly and welcoming, and as helpful as you could wish for. We have been to Las Vegas 7 times, and stayed at 12 of the hotels on or just off of the Strip. Out of all these trips and stays, I would say that our stay at the Palazzo was the most enjoyable - truly a 5 star resort, and we felt thoroughly pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Best Room in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Belfastkid
Reviews.Content: Palazzo, room's are off the hook. You, can not get a better room! Well, maybe. These are awesome room's though!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: rberger669
Reviews.Content: We spent the Christmas Holiday with my Sister and her family at the Palazzo. Our rooms were absolutely elegant, quiet and very spacious. The check in was very fast. The Grand Lux restaurant was our favorite visit on a daily basis. The location of the hotel is wonderful for walking on the Strip. Many restaurants to choose from between the Palazzo and Venetian. We are returning in April, 2010 for another wonderful visit at the beautiful Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury is a standard”
Reviews.Author: hikariliang
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas, we chose the Palazzo because of their "all suites" standard. I was more than impressed by the spacious room that easily could've fit 2-4 more people. We were situated on one of the top floors with a view of the Wynn golf course. The remote controlled curtains made the view seem like a theatrical display. Although the extra space in our hotel wasn't exactly necessary, considering we barely spent any time inside, it was definitely a luxury to have. The bathrooms were also spacious, with double sinks, a vanity table, glass shower and tub. A total of three TV's were inside our suite, with one in front of the extremely large and comfortable couches, one in front of the bed and one inside the bathroom. I would definitely recommend staying here if you can afford the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Palazzo-Almost”
Reviews.Author: PerthMovers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from spending the Christmas- New Year’s period at the Palazzo (a total of 8 nights.) This hotel ticks all the usual Vegas boxes. It’s still newish (2yrs old); it’s big and is clad in enough marble to bring a tear to the eye of even the most ambitious Renaissance sculptor. But beneath the mirage of post-Raphaelite Italy is there anything new or unique about this hotel? Well in short-no. Perhaps it’s because Vegas receives so many tourists we found the check in to be professional if a little per functionary. During the process of handing over your id and credit card for billing purposes later, the reception casually slip into the conversation that there is a $15 US dollar per-day “resort fee” on top of your room rate to pay. We had booked via an agent and the resort fee was explained to us and was payable if we intended to use the services that it covered ergo (daily newspaper, use of pool/gym and internet). However, we were told by reception staff that this wasn’t the case and the fee was mandatory on all guests. An argument was the last thing we wanted after a 26hr plane trip from Perth Western Australia. So with a couple of polite but stern words the fee was removed. Just as a side: how can resorts such as the Palazzo and others in Vegas justify charging a “resort fee?” We have stayed at many 5-star hotels around the world and all of them thus far manage to provide the amenities mentioned within the cost of the room rate per night. So to the room or suite as they prefer to call it, but first, like all Vegas casino hotels you have to run the gauntlet of navigating the gaming floor before you can access the guest lifts at the far end of the gaming floor. Finally you make your room. All in all the room was well furnished and proportioned. However, the hotel had made no acknowledgement of the fact that we were on our honeymoon unlike LA or Dubai who laid on chocolates, specialty cake and drinks. It’s a split level room with the bed as you enter and two steps leading down to a sunken lounge area which gives the room depth and definition and adds to the illusion of extra space. In this space there is one or two things that are not quite right. One, there is no master controls switch near your bed that controls all the lights (standard in most 5 star hotels). Two, there is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. Now I know having read a lot of reviews on this site that this gets mentioned a lot (particular in regards to American hotels in general.) I realise that this service is more common in Asian and European hotels, but one has to ask the question again, just what are you getting for your money? This may sound a bit like knit-picking but it isn’t. These are the little things that one remembers. In general our stay both in Vegas and the Palazzo was pleasant, but a casino is a casino is a casino no matter where it is. Before I finish, we would also recommend Pink Jeep tours. We took their tour of the Grand Canyon tour and it was fantastic! In the endless cornucopia of themed casinos that is Vegas, The Palazzo holds its own. Would we stay here again? Perhaps we would. However, Vegas by day in winter reminded me of an “old drag queen” who has applied his makeup too heavy once too often. By night if you look closely you can see the cracks.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: lfthorn
Reviews.Content: After waiting in a rather long line. the room looked great, but smelled like body odor. I decided not to complain since I was there on business, I wouldn't be in the room very much. The next day, one of my colleagues said she had to wait 45 minutes to get into her room since they had locked her out of her room due to a reservation error. She waited for security to come to her room, and when they didn't arrive, she went to registration and waited another 15 min. I was awoken the first night by my noisy neighbor arriving at their room at 3AM, quite loud in the hall and I could hear what they were saying in their room. I was then awoken at 5:30 am by continuous retching from my neighbor that was quite graphic for more than an hour. Certainly no sound proofing! I attended my meeting for the day and returned to my room which smelled quite strongly of smoke. I called housekeeping and was informed that the floor below me was a smoking floor but they could "ionize" my room as long as I was gone for two hours. I notified them at 2:30 pm that they could install the ionizer. I returned to my room at 8 pm. My electronic key did not work. There was a maid across the hall and she told me to go back to the elevator and call security. So I did, the phone didn't work. I returned to my room and the maid allowed me to radio her contact directly. He told me a security person would arrive shortly. A security person came down the hall, but told me he couldn't help me because he was assigned to another issue. After he stood down the hall, doing what looked to me like nothing, he still wasn't able to help me. I called the front desk twice and was told someone would be with me shortly. Another 10 minutes later, I became angry and was told by the security person, that continued to do nothing down the hall but stand there, to go to the front desk. He followed me to the elevator and then told me to get off with him on another floor if I wanted "him to help me." Well, excuse me, but no way was I going to get off on an empty floor with a strange man!!! I don't care if they're hotel security. He didn't seem to want to help me when I was on my floor! I went all the way ( a long way!) back to the front desk and the desk person was very polite and contrite, She gave me new keys. I proceeded back to my room, the new keys didn't work!!! I went back down to the desk and spoke with the same woman. She was very apologetic and didn't seem to get a good answer from her supervisor, but assured me that engineering was taking care of my issue. I headed back to my room, a security person was walking down the hall and I asked them to make sure I could get into my room. My keys worked., but there was still the ionionizer machine going in my room. I called housekeeping and was assured someone would come remove it. I waited about 10 minutes and then chose to disconnect it and put it in the hallway. I had someone about 15 min. later try to get into my room without knocking, but I had the security lock engaged and told them the machine was in the hallway, and then an hour later someone else came again for the same issue!! For a hotel of this supposed caliber, this was unacceptable! I have traveled all over the world for work and pleasure and this has been one of the most disappointing stays I have encountered. I would not recommend this hotel for pleasure or business. Way under expectations for this type of hotel. I have stayed at 2 star hotels that were cleaner and had much better service. I was very disappointed and will NOT stay here again. My company had over 4000 employees staying at this meeting and the travel service will definitely be receiving the same feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this property...they employ thieves and condone it!”
Reviews.Author: MLML1234
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property right before christmas for 4 nights and 5 days. On the 3rd day, we received a call from the Security department and Las Vegas police to let us know that we had to immediately report to the security desk. We were then told that one of their employees (chamber maid) had gone through our belongings in our hotel room and had stolen from us. Apparently their employee had been under investigation for quite some time, and was finally caught in our room with large amounts of cash. This employee was known to be stealing from hotel guests for awhile (hence the serveillance and investigation), but was still allowed to enter guest rooms day after day....stealing from them. When we arrived at the security desk, we spent over 5 hours filling out our statement, and helping the hotel with the investigation process. In the end, the amount of money stolen from our room was not what the hotel recovered from their employee. After dealing with their investigation team, they have chosen to side with thier stealing employee and pretty much called us liars. Further to this, we have still not recovered the money we are missing, and hotel management has made it very clear that they are not prepared to return this money to us. Even though this was their employee who was caught stealing from our room, and was taken to jail for grand larceny. This matter will now be dealt through legal matter, and I would suggest anyone who is in this same situation with the Palazzo to seek legal advice as well. Other's I would suggest to stay away from this property!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Room!”
Reviews.Author: CnPScotland
Reviews.Content: Having visited Vegas before, I was fully prepared to stand in line to check in, wait for luggage, walk for miles to the room, for communal areas to be smoky etc.... however I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness, and speed and quality of service at this hotel. The room was incredibly spacious and well appointed. We selected a basic room with a strip view and were not disappointed. My husband and I agreed that there would have been little point in opting for an upgrade (which we were offered at check-in) due to the size of the room; our room had a huge bed, ample seating around a second flat screen TV and a large bathroom. The Palazzo is joined to the Venetian, and the common areas are very impressive. We also noticed that the ground floor of the hotel was significantly quieter than others we visited (we can only imagine that while people choose to wander around the Venetian, they don't bother with the Palazzo). Another advantage was that the Palazzo offers 'smoke-free corridors' - a real haven to a non-smoker in Vegas! We ate at Wolfgang Puck's restaurant 'Cut', located within the hotel and were really impressed. I would highly recommend this restaurant for a treat during a trip to Vegas. My only criticism would be that the hotel can feel impersonal at times due to the sheer scale of the building, however this is typical of Vegas and unavoidable in a hotel of this size.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice, maybe a bit over the top”
Reviews.Author: Kswck_Dinner_Jckt
Reviews.Content: This is certainly a beautiful hotel and casino. This hotel has spared no expense, and every detail has been taken into account. For the average traveller, this place may seem a little over the top. Opulent is a good way to describe it. The rooms are incredible, with a the sitting areas being a nice touch after a long day of walking the strip. The bathrooms have amazing, with a soaker tub and glass shower. The bath robes are a nice touch as well. The pool can get pretty busy, and finding a chair can be a task, but overall they are nice. I would say Bellagio has a better pool if that's what you are looking for. Overall a pretty nice place, but I prefer Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!! - employees caught stealing cash from my room!”
Reviews.Author: Nismocha
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Palazzo and while the rooms were nice, I had an incident that completely changed my view of the staff and security of this hotel/casino. One of the housekeepers was caught stealing money from my room by security. After further discussions, I was told that this employee was under investigation by security for a prolonger period of time as she was stealing from other guests. However, she was still allowed into my room unescorted and went through my personal possessions. She stole $2000 from me which was not in plain site. I was essentially a guinea pig to get her to steal! I then spent a day with security and las vegas police to help with their investigation, and then was told that they only recovered $700 from her, and that is all that they would pay me for. After going through a month of investigation, they still concluded that they would not return the full amount to me. My biggest issue is the breach of security and obvious neglect in the situation. This was a Palazzo employee known to be stealing, and she was still allowed into all the guest rooms unescorted, and able to steal whatever she wants. What kind of operation allows this to happen? She was caught by internal security, and they still won't pay me back my money. This is a huge legal matter, and I will be taking this to much higher levels. The management of the hotel does not think this is a big issue, and they have told me to pursue legal action if I wish to. Big legal issue here, I would recommend never staying at the Venetian or Palazzo as their ethics are in definate question. Who allows their known employees who steal into the guest rooms? Why would they even keep her on staff in that role? Remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Room 808 has water drainage problems”
Reviews.Author: VSS13
Reviews.Content: Hi We stayed in Palazzo in Room 808 which is palazzo fortuna suite. We stayed overnight. Our experience is Pros The service is greate The rooms are huge Cons There is a serious water drainage problem in Room 808 shower. the drainage pipe is on the upper side of the slope. So water collects around your feet the whole time you are showering which is kind of yucky. Marbles have been burnt or something. You see white streaks on the marble every where. There is no complimentary slippers kept in the room any more which was in Venetian. We stayed in Palazzo twice and both the times we had to call down to get the slippers. The main issue was the water drainage issue.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ive ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jjess135
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo resort is the nicest hotel ive ever stayed in. A little pricey, but its definatly worth it. theres tons of stuff to do inside the hotel, let alone the rest of Las Vegas. From the Ferrari dealership, to the indoor/outdoor canals with gondola rides, to the incredibly luxurious resteraunts and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Need To Remember That There is LOTS of Competition on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: wisnat
Reviews.Content: We stayed off-strip for 3 nights previous to our Palazzo stay (for business purposes). Have been to Vegas many times & stayed at numerous strip hotels - first time at the Palazzo, however. We checked in at 3:00pm and were told our room was not ready but would be shortly as housekeeping was just finishing up. The desk staff said we would be called when it was ready. In the meantime they suggested we have a drink, gamble, etc. (at our expense, of course!). After 50 min. of sitting at a bar we decided to call the hotel to see how much longer it would be (not exactly the 'shortly' we were told when checking in). The woman who answered said that our room was ready!! WHAT?!! When were they going to call us? She said they only 'pull reports periodically'. Well, the hotel we stayed at the previous 3 nights called us promptly when the room was ready - which is how customers should be treated. The room was wonderful - really appreciated the space. But beyond that, there wasn't anything to tip the scales towards the Palazzo vs. other nice hotels. The ambience of the casino was extremely non-descript (it could have been in Omaha or North Dakota as it certainly didn't exude anything special - & the slots were beyond tight - not the least bit fun to play). (Aria's casino is at least gorgeous.) Would I stay again? Maybe - but only if the rate were rock-bottom. There are too many other fabulous hotels that offer better service. (Unfortunately, most - if not all - of the Vegas hotels are ripping customers off with the required 'resort fee'. It should be charged ONLY if the guests want to use those services.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: jeremy78Maine
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I's first trip to Las Vegas and the experience could not have been better. We chose the Palazzo largely because of a promotional deal that included a reasonable price on the room and a bunch of credits and coupons. From the moment we arrived the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. At check in I told the check in person that my wife and I had not been on vacation in a long time and they upgraded our room at no additional cost. The room was big, bright & clean with a great view of the strip. The location is perfect you are in heart of the strip and everything is in walking distance. We would highly recommend a trip to spa and a hot stone massage. My only complaint was the smell they used in the casino to cover up the odor of smoke but I did not find it as bad as some of the other reviewers. Overall we had a great experience and can't wait to return, plus we left $500 up.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line Resort Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: stonecroft
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days and 4 nights at the Palazzo from 1/9-1/13/2010. We upgraded to the PALAZZO CONCIERGE LUXURY for $100.00 additional per night which grants you access to the elite Concierge Lounge with private check-in, packing/unpacking services, hors d’oeuvres, a nightly open bar, etc. Well worth the $100/night if you take advantage of the Lounge. Look no further, the Palazzo is a great resort and one of the best on the strip. Other Hotels are within walking distance and the hop on hop off bus stop is across the street at Treasure Island. You will not be disappointed staying at the Palazzo. As far as the smell mentioned in other reviews, it is used to mask the smoke smell and you don't notice it after a short time (Note: the same smell is used at all the other high end resorts on the strip).

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Experience Worth the Price!”
Reviews.Author: ray3127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for a quick weekend getaway over Halloween weekend and were blown away. We didn’t spend much time in the hotel/room, but the time we did spend there was incredible. This was my second trip to Vegas and I wanted to stay at a really nice place—the first time I stayed at Imperial Palace and vowed to never set foot inside that dump again! After reading reviews we chose the Palazzo, and it did not disappoint. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating from top to bottom. The room was fabulous and very luxurious. Super-comfortable plush bed, HD televisions, an incredible bathroom, breathtaking views from high above the Strip… Everything was just phenomenal. The enormous foyer was fantastic, and the casino is nice and new also—very open and welcoming. If you can swing the money, stay at a nice place like the Palazzo. It’s definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a non standard issue you might be lost”
Reviews.Author: CamAutSantiago
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent reviewer on Tripadvisor and a frequent traveler. When traveling you are out of your town, home, country and if you have an emergency you need special assistance. I staid at the Palazzo for 4 nights. Place is nice, clean staff is friendly but they are not equipped to help in an emergency. I forgot/lost my passport in the hotel. Noticed at the airport. Called the Palazzo for assistance. It took me 20 minutes to get through. I spoke to a nice staff who told me she would call me back as soon as house keeping got back to her. Of course I missed my flight. She had not called back in 30 minutes. I called her again waited 15 minutes on line to be able to speak to somebody (!). She told me housekeeping did not get back to her. Something to know. The Palazzo is together with the Venetian and together they have 7,000 suites. Don't expect anything which is not standardised. Sauna and Internet have to be paid seperatly even though the price of the Suites is steep. It would have been USD 40.00 for going to the sauna and the inet is USD 13.00 If you don't care about emergency situations you should know the Hotel is nice, clean and modern

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping remains the sore spot”
Reviews.Author: Ferbdog
Reviews.Content: An impromptu trip to Vegas brought me back to the Palazzo during Christmas week. I had SERIOUS issues with the hotel in July, but want to report on this most recent trip. Summarizing, if you can get a great price for the Palazzo, it’s an outstanding hotel. However, you should know that housekeeping appears to be run by the “gang that couldn’t shoot straight.” They may try to get it right, but never do. Upon check in, our suite had no soap dish, no amenities in the vanity drawer, the safe was locked, the bathroom floor was dirty, a lamp was broken and an open box of condoms was found in the night stand (by my pre-teen). Fortunately, the furniture was not horrifically damaged nor was the staff in a constant mood of misery (as we saw in July). After three calls, housekeeping fixed everything (except the lamp). But it does take the joy out of your trip to be on the phone with housekeeping for the first two hours of your visit. This hassle has become the norm with Palazzo housekeeping staff. The rest of the resort is fine. (Had a sensational haircut in the salon!) It just seems a shame that they fail so miserably at the basics of running a hotel. As long as you manage your expectations, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A decent property but the service is lousy”
Reviews.Author: CCHLondon
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Las Vegas so I cannot really make comparisons properly. However, our impressions were: 1. Property The hotel looks great and creates a good first impression on arrival. The casino looked pretty much like all the others, though perhaps a little smarter than some. We stayed in a Fortuna suite - at just shy of 1,000 square feet it was an enormous space. All the fixtures and fittings were in good condition and it was definitely worthy of a five star hotel. We particularly liked the large L shaped sofa. As a tip to anyone looking at staying in this room, in all honesty (given the size of the standard room) it is probably not worth the extra money. The fixtures and fittings are all the same, you simply have a large space between the living room and the bed. 2. Cleanliness This was a bit of a let down - I think their staff have too many rooms to clean and are cutting corners as a result. For example, during our 4 days there we noticed (a) they did not replace dirty wine glasses with clean ones; (b) my other half used the ironing board once and they just left it in mid-room for 3 days; (c) our toiletries were not replaced on the 3rd day (we actually had no shower gel as a result); (d) part of our room service food was not taken away and (e) a dressing gown which had been left on the bed was unceremoniously thrown over a chair rather than folded up. In addition the window looking out on the strip was filthy and had not been cleaned for sometime. It spoiled the view. 3. Service Poor (and as a result we would not stay again). I don't know how the other large strip hotels compare but it felt like a real effort to get any assistance at all. There are 2 examples I would give. Firstly, on our last day I wanted a later checkout (the default checkout time is 11am). I called the front desk (via one of those irritating automated "press 1 for billing, press 2 for general information......" systems) and waited 10 minutes on hold for "one of our agents" to come on. When I asked if we could extend checkout to 13.30 they said that an extension to midday was free (wow - in my experience all half decent hotels have midday as the standard checkout time) but an extension to 13.30 would cost me 50 dollars plus taxes. My only conclusion from this is that they don't want repeat business... Second example was the room service - we ordered and it took an hour for the food to come. They still hit us with the ful gratuity and the extra 4 dollar delivery charge which I found irritiating giveln that it was hardly a smooth service. 4. Resort Fee Beware the resort fee of 16 dollars a day. We could not get the wifi in our room to work and we didn't use the healthclub. I'm therefore not really clear why we handed them 60 plus dollars over 4 days for absolutely nothing. 5. Restaurants We ate in dos Caminos one night - it was very good indeed. The remainder of the restaurants looked good. Be warned though, there is an emphasis towards the higher end price bracket so if you want something more simple (as most of us do on holiday) then go elsewhere. 6. Shopping Designer shops galore in the (slightly bland) mall section. Mostly they were deserted when we were there. Not a lot else to say - if you want more reasonably priced fare head to the fashion mall across the road. Final conclusion - with so many other hotels to choose from, we would go elsewhere in future, in search of better service.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo is palatial!”
Reviews.Author: C-Bernie
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading numerous reviews on Las Vegas hotels. My husband and I were not disappointed. Stayed in a suite with view of the Strip. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to view on checkin and decided it was worth it - only in Vegas once! Had a wonderful view of the show at Treasure Island each night. Room was huge with comfortable king bed, 2 large tv's plus one in the bathroom. Easy to use internet access, bathrobes and slippers. We had noisy neighbours on the first night - much slamming of doors in the hallway. We booked a Grand Canyon tour through the concierge and the staff were great as our tour was cancelled due to Obama visit and had to be rescheduled. They kept us informed of the changes. Only complaint was we had difficulty finding pickup point for our tour as it was at the Venetian Resort and the directions were vague to say the least and also nothing was signposted. After wandering around for half an hour we just made the pickup - and this was after asking several staff for directions - but we were on holidays and the Grand Canyon quickly made us forget! Tip for visitors to Las Vegas - wear COMFORTABLE shoes as you will be doing lots of walking. It is not possible to walk in a straight line through the casino/hotel/shopping complexes and get somewhere in a hurry. Also we are not gamblers and did not put a cent on the tables but still had a great time - saw some great shows - so if you think you won't enjoy Las Vegas because you are not a gambler don't worry there are plenty of things to entertain you!

Reviews.Title: “Quite luxurious and laid back”
Reviews.Author: bruisedlee
Reviews.Content: For our second time in Vegas we opted for a 5-star hotel and chose the Palazzo as it is one of the newer ones on the strip. The free valet was a lovely perk, but walking into the lobby I wasn't so impressed with their fall/winter wreath theme. It was a bit grotesque, to be honest. Upon check-in we were helped by a great guy who had the answers to all our questions. From him we learned that the hotel can provide a mini fridge at no charge as long as it's for medical purposes, and for our case we had a family member with diabetic supplies and needed a refrigerator for his medications. To use the internet you'd have to pay a $15/day 'resort fee' which includes use of the gym, the pool and other amenities. But I believe if you go down to the 2nd floor where the shops are and look for the Café Presse/Lavazza Cafe, you can use their free WiFi there. We were given the teal-themed Bella suite which faced the Wynn's golf course and the Nevada mountain range. The suite was very spacious and nicely appointed, but when I walked into the bathroom I noticed the doors don't lock, including the one for the enclosed toilet cubicle. Also there was no toilet paper - and when I requested for that and an extra blanket, I was informed that the hotel was running an hour behind on all requests. This went on for the three nights we stayed there - which was pretty understandable since it was a busy New Year's Eve weekend. I noticed the dust on some of the furniture and in-room electronics such as the clock radio, the fax/copy/print machine and the vanity in the bathroom. There were also hardened stuck-on bits of crumbs/food on the carpet and pieces of chips on the couch. Perhaps because it's such a big suite housekeeping does not have enough time to pay attention to those little details. The pull-out sofa sleeper was a lovely addition. I also love having three LCD TVs in the suite so the kids and the adults can watch their own shows. I loved going down to the shops and actually snagged a great deal on a shirt at the Ralph Lauren store. And since the shop level directly connects to the shops at the Venetian, we had ample opportunity to browse and enjoy the sights. The way the hotel is structured makes for a more hassle-free stay. It's simple yet elegant, but not too gaudy or flashy. Despite the small details that turned me off a bit, the Palazzo turned out to be just perfect for our family. One tip, though - the ice machine takes some work to locate. It's in its own room behind a door that looks just like the suites' - except there's a little sign on the door that says "Ice". Make sure you scan all the doors for that!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good, but some issues.”
Reviews.Author: gotogo
Reviews.Content: Overall – A Great Hotel, nice ambiance, rooms large, well laid out, clean and comfortable - 2x Large LCD screens as well as a smaller one in the bathroom. Bathroom large with both bath and shower, separate WC compartment. As far as Vegas goes probably one of the best – close to all the action and easily surpassing most of the surrounding competition (namely the Wynn and the Encore). Free WIFI in the lobby and some of the Café’s. However – #1. Be prepared to Wait ! Check In, accessing reception on the house phone, Concierge, all take substantial patience. #2. Apart from that there is a serious ventilation problem in many of the rooms, whereby the air from outside the building is “pumped” into each room at a howlingly high speed (similar to the problem at the Wynn) – they told us at reception that some complain and others don’t ? – Believe me, we complained it was like having the Sirocco flowing over your head in the room We were moved to multiple rooms, had the maintenance man up and finally came up with the following solution – the maintenance guy closed the vent from inside, so reducing the torrential flow of air to a minimum, afterwhich we took one of the cushions from the couch and used it to block the vent (Note: The pillow as suggested by the hotel staff is not heavy enough and has little impact). With the cushion against the vent the noise level in the room dropped back to an acceptable level. Sounds ridiculous but it was so loud we were ready to check out if no solution was found. #3. They have an 11:00 checkout policy which is ridiculous for Vegas. I suspect some bright spark in management thinks this is a good way of generating additional revenue ? (there is a stated $75 surcharge for exceeding 11:00), instead they should be clear this is one sure way of pissing off your average guest. Thankfully, the nice girl at reception was more focused on ensuring we would come back than pinching some more dollars from us.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Vegas, made a great choice.”
Reviews.Author: CantWaitForTheLake
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Vegas. I am super weird about hotel rooms, and had read some horrible reviews about a lot of Vegas hotels being dirty, smokey, ect. We got a GREAT deal through Southwest with flight and room, so it didn't cost us a whole lot more to stay in a nicer hotel. When we first arrived, they took our bags and sent us to check in. We were checking in early so I was surprised we got a room right away. Our bags, on the other hand, took about an hour and a half to get to our room. If I would have knows this we would have taken them up ourselves. The rooms are awesome, very big. Three televisions, a couch, nice size bathroom. I loved the vanity area, it helped keep my makeup out of the way. Nice water pressure, the toilet is separate, which i nice. The casino was very nice, we noticed we were asked if we wanted drinks much faster then at other hotels. And the beer is bottled not tap, which is nice, for anyone that cares. The tables were higher minimums (which were expected), I want to say 15. We just went next door to the Wynn where they had a couple $10 tables. The only restaurant we ate at was Dos Caminos, the website says casual, but I thought you could definitely dress up and not feel out of place. The food was awesome. It reminded me more of a steak house then a mexican restaurant. With our package we got from Southwest we got a little booklet of coupons (like $50 in slot money, and coupons for food), I think it saved us $25-$35, and we still spent $75. We both had a drink, but still a little pricey for lunch. We both enjoyed it though, and would eat there again, just maybe for dinner. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But...”
Reviews.Author: chm0815
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas several times both for pleasure and for business. My stay at the Palazzo was for business. It is a big beautiful hotel but I would not go out of my way to stay there again. First, when I got there, my room was not ready yet. My collegues were checking in and getting their rooms but, for some reason, I had to wait. To make matters more inconvenient the bell desk would not take my luggage from me while I waited. Finally after an hour or hour and a half, I was given my room number and key. The room was gorgeous with a great view. It was very spacious with a sunken living room. Just to give you an idea of the size of the living room alone- I was able to push the coffee table to the side and do my kickboxing workout every morning with space to spare. The TV in the livingroom had a DVD player connected to it. There was also a TV in the bedroom and in the bathroom. The restaurants were very expensive. Because I was there on business, my meals would be expensed and paid for by my company. Although my company provides a generous daily meal allowance, a meal within the Palazzo (or the connecting Venetian) would not have fit into the allowance so I ate several times across the street at the Treasure Island Resort. I highly recommend Pho, the Vietnamese restaurant at TI. I wish there was more casual dining places within the Palazzo but this hotel doesn't seem like the place that caters to the casual diners. The shops were premium boutique type places. I window shopped on some down time but wasn't really interested in what was being sold. The business/conference facilities were located in the Venetian and are very large and can accommodate hundreds of people. The hotel complex (Palazzo and Venetian) is very large and it is easy to get turned around and confused in. Like I said, I was there on business. When I go to Vegas for pleasure, I spend very little time in my room so a place like this would not be worth the money for me. I prefer the mid range hotels that have a definite, albeit gaudy theme. It's just more fun that way.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo Resort Hotel Casino”
Reviews.Author: DoraDementia
