There is nothing genuinely surprising or that stands out. Check in was the typical Vegas drama – is it just foreigners who they never give the brooked room to hoping we won’t complain or does that happen to everybody? I don’t think we have ever been to Vegas and actually got the room we booked. So after all the usual rubbish, “that is a strip view room”, “we don’t have any rooms of that type available”, “your booking is accurate”, that went on for almost an hour we were finally “upgraded” to a room that met the original room description on our booking confirmation. To their credit while the people on reception were VERY difficult to deal with we got multiple phone calls from Duty Managers, Guest Relations and so on to apologise – in fact we got so many we thought it was overkill – better to have got the room right in the first place. OK, the features of the room that impress are the sheer size of the rooms, the massive plasma screen TV, the huge marble everywhere bathrooms which included a Jacuzzi, and very plush and comfy lounge chairs. We missed the fresh air feature that we had seen in other Vegas hotels that allows you to open a window, if just a crack. The swimming pool area is terrific if a little hard to get a booking at peak times. Concierge was also terrific and better than at Bellagio and Wynn. Where of course locals have it all over international travellers is the room tariff – we met people who were paying a third of what we were for the same room – if I could get what we had for that rate this would be a 5 instead of a 4. Pretty good all up for a Vegas hotel. Easy to get lost in the crowd but above what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: business-class08
Reviews.Content: When I first booked at the Palazzo I was wondering if they could top Venetion. When I left I feel they didn't top the Venetian, but offered something just as good, just with a different flare. Great spacious rooms. The automatic drapes on the windows might be the best idea in the world. Great hotel. The casino took my money though... Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Yourluckyday
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very nice rooms. They are spacious, clean, and comfortable. The downside is the spa/gym is 40.00 a day and the internet worked on and off for 10.00/day. The guest rooms are kept secure by a guard at the elevators and you had better buy your gift for loved ones elsewhere, unless you are into the 1,000.00 flip-flops. Overall it is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Would always come back here”
Reviews.Author: IVsystem
Reviews.Content: Great room, (like the ones at Venetian) great staffs, nice shopping, great restaurants, less crowds, family friendly, no loud party kids... Enjoyed the stay very much. Would always pick this hotel over Bellagio and Wynn in no time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LouisDogFrenchie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Palazzo with some friends. For the past 6 years I've been going to Vegas twice a year and out of all of the 4 & 5 star hotels I've stayed at, this was the best. For the first time I didn't feel compelled to venture out onto the strip and explore other hotels. The Palazzo has everything you need .1 We arrived at the hotel around 12PM and there was a good size line at guest registration. However the line moved exceptionaly fast due hotel workers get pre-registration information from guests in line. When you finally made it to the front desk, the receptionist had all of your information. Rather than giving us the usual run around about check-in being at 3PM, they were able to check us in immedialtly and even upgraded our room to the 41st floor!!! The room was the nicest I've seen. It felt more spacious than even the Wynn or the Ventian. There were two flat screens in the room and 1 in the bathroom. The whole bathroom was decked out in a nice marble with seperate tub/shower and toilet. Event he toiletries were nice. There were nice floor to ceiling windows with automatic shades and blackout curtains. Elevators were very fast and made it to the 41st in about 20 seconds. Not too bad. The appointments throughout the entire hotel are very tasteful and not too gawdy. Didn't contain the element of cheesey colors you you would get from the Wynn or Encore. Nice high-end shops. Would totally recommend if you could get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, good service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Missyjas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Palazzo for two nights in a Palazzo Sienna Suite. 1280 sq. ft. suite that was wonderful. We were on the 10th floor so I'm sure a higher floor would have been better, but other than that I have no complaints of the room. Double doors leading into the suite, a powder room as well as an enormous master bathroom with a large jetted tub seperating seperate his/hers vanities. The shower was large enough for several people with a huge shower head, body sprayers, and hand sprayer. A printer was provided in the suite at the desk area which made it very convenient for printing boarding passes for our flight. We enjoyed room service for breakfast on two mornings which was quick (less than 45 minutes) and good! We also were able to order Krispy Kreme donuts for room service! Fantastic! The service we encountered was very friendly. This includes a quick check-in, pleasant bell staff, and friendly, attentive room service staff. Our check out was quick, easy, and painless on the television and a confirmation receipt was e-mailed to us before we even made it to the airport! The shopping is high-end and wonderful. The location is fabulous being tha it is connected to the Wynn and the Fashion Show Mall by outdoor elevated walkways. I would avoid the Sushisamba restaurant. We unfortunately had a bad experience there although the food was really good. The music was so loud for dinner that it felt like we were dining in a night club. Don't get me wrong,my husband and I are experts at going to the clubs and listening to loud music, but it belongs in the club not in the restaurant. Also we were advised not to order much from the sushi bar because the people at the table next to us had waited over 30 minutes for theirs. When we did order, our waitress had to come back to our table two times to tell us that the food was unavailable! We could not wait to get out of there and wished we had ordered room service. We will definitely stay at the Palazzo again. The room rates were very good for such a large suite. We would have paid $900+ at theWynn for a suite of this size and we only paid $449/night. It's location is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed It”
Reviews.Author: BevoXV
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Palazzo Feb. 19-21. Room was huge and very nice. Staff was also nice and helpful. Great location near Wynn and Encore and the mall, too. We would definitely stay again. Couple of things - unless you have a lot of bags, don't have the valet service take them to your room when you check in. Do it yourself. Took a while to get our stuff, which was annoying. Unless you're going to actually buy something out of the fridge in the room, be careful about opening the fridge. I got charged for putting our own water bottle in there. Wireless internet is $9.99/day. If you stay at Palazzo, you have to go to Morel's Steakhouse. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Big dirty expensive rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jugdishtx
Reviews.Content: I loved the casino and other public areas of this hotel, I found the room to be dirty ( stains on couch and floor ) and there were also technical issues with their tv system. I was very disappointed with the room as there were sconces missing from the wall and the shower could best be described as a light mist.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of luxury”
Reviews.Author: SJaneSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Loved the Venetian and the Palazzo is a new take on the same principles. Oasis of luxury. Splurge on the concierge level if you can, usually $100 per night more. The check in process is very gracious and easy, and the lounge is lovely. Lounge appetizer offerings were delicious. Really a special experience. To me the extra fee is worth it to be treated so well. This hotel even smells great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay in Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Alexandros D
Reviews.Content: We had 3 wonderfull nights in Palazzo hotel. The suite was very big.It had a big beautifull bathroom and a huge room with living room together (not separated) and of course a splendid view at the Vegas Strip. The room service was quick and very good.The staff in every part of the hotel (reception,room service consierge,casino etc.) is very friendly and really helpfull.Always with a smile. The casino was very bright and pleasant. There were many restaurants,any cuisine you desire.The only thing we didn't find was hamburger for dinner,and a good patisery like the one in Bellagio. Also the location is ideal because is very close to all the known hotels. While being in Las Vegas we did a tour in Grand Canyon,South Rim just great.,as well as the night helicopter tour.For the night helicopter tour the best place to seat is at the back left side, you will have the best view of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ediggidy
Reviews.Content: Check in was excellent, very well run. I asked for an upgrade and was offered a strip view for free. She then asked me to wait a second and made some calls. For a small fee she then upgraded us to an incredible suite on one of the top floors. The staff was prompt and very helpful. I love it that this casino/lobby is not a zoo like some of the other top hotels. You can walk around the floor without feeling like you are in a mob. I loved being next to the venitian and the wynn group-- lots of good food and shops close by. It is very obvious that this hotel is new in that the rooms do not have that worn feel. All in all, it was a terrific experience and I would stay here again. The one problem was the spa. The Venitian and Palazzo share the Canyon Ranch spa. The gym was ok. However, the spa area was terrible in comparison to Bellagio or the Hotel. There was only one spa and it was luke warm and the size of a tub. Other hotels have numerous jacuzzis with different temps, not here.

Reviews.Title: “not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: pickygirlmn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Las Vegas 2x a year for the clothing trade shows. We usually stay at The Signature at the MGM...and we love it!!! We choose The Palazzo this time as it is closer to where we need to be. In my opinion I did not think it was that great, but would maybe stay again since the location was convienient, but probably not. The lighting in the bathrooms was terrible!! I struggled every morning with my make - up. The placement of the lighting was so poor that it casted shadows on your face in the mirrors and the lights were so dim. Really annoying. I love a water or tea as soon as I wake up and my hubby needs his coffee.The room had no coffee maker or fridge to keep your beverages cool. There is a fridge in the room but it has a sensor on, if you move anything you will be charged for it. We waited in line for 30 mins to get our coffee and waters. The furniture....ICK!!! Don't get me wrong, everything was beautiful but, certainly had an identity crisis. There were LOTS of stains/spots/splatters on the couches....SO GROSS!!! I did not sit on the couch once. I did not bother to call the front desk to have our room swithched, as it probably would have been another issue to deal with.There were a few paintings missing on the walls, when the bell man came with our luggage we told him about the missing paintings, we did not care that they were missing we just did not want to be charged for the wall art, he rudely told us that this was not his department, stuck his hand out and waited for his tip. This was not my favorite hotel...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: eckythump
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June 2008 and should have written a review sooner, as it was an amazing experience. Got a great price on a room with access to the Concierge Lounge which was well worth the extra money. Check in was simple and was quickly assigned a room on the 22nd floor with views of the Wynn Hotel. Like most strip hotels you have to walk through the casino, but it's at least a straight line and it's not too far, unlike the New York New York hotel which we've stayed in before which can be a nightmare to navigate with suitcases when it's busy. The room was unlike anything else we'd stayed in before. If you're not impressed by the suite then you're extremely hard to please. We're not wealthy by any means but enjoy staying at moderate to higher priced hotels when on holiday, but this room was unlike anything we'd ever experienced before. It was truly amazing, from the comfortable king sized bed, 2 42" HD plasma's (with a 3rd slightly smaller one in the bathroom!), sunken lounge, dining table, great shower, the room was just spectacular. We could have stayed in it the whole 4 days and still had a great Vegas vacation! Concierge floor was great, good breakfast, free drinks, great view of the strip, good food, great staff, loved it. We ate at Morel's Steakhouse, one of the best meals we've ever had, i had a fantastic steak, not cheap but a very worthwhile splurge meal. My girlfriend had the Maine Lobster and she also raved about it. Also ate at Grand Lux Cafe which was also excellent, fantastic huge meals at a great price. I can't say enough great things about this hotel, next time we're in Vegas without doubt this will be the hotel we choose. With the type of deals coming out of Vegas currently hopefully that won't be too far away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon in Concierge Suite.”
Reviews.Author: benfrye51
Reviews.Content: We booked a basic suite, but decided to upgrade when we checked in. I would recommend the upgrade. The Concierge lounge was the way to go. It included breakfast in the mornings, snacks all day long, softdrinks all day long, and cocktails from 5-9 each night. Well worth the money. We met some nice people in the concierge lounge (ron and christine). They had free tickets to see blue man group and they didn't want them. They hooked us up with free tickets valued at $132 each. Show was great. The staff was friendly and happy to help with anything we needed. Overall, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: sftravler-castro
Reviews.Content: 1. Bathroom ceiling light inoperable. 2. Bathroom vanity light dimmer inoperable. 3. Bathroom dressing table missing light bulbs. 4. Sleeping area ceiling light over one side of dresser inoperative. 5. Dresser missing one drawer. 6. Light between beds did not work. 7. Hanging lamp over dining table not working. 8. Living room television remote missing back and one battery, making it inoperative. 9. Outside of windows so dirty that we kept shades drawn so as not to have to look at the filth. 10. No apparent cleaning of room each day. IE. Bathroom tub and shower not cleaned to remove scum from previous day's bath. Carpets not swept at all anywhere within suite. First call for repair took an hour for maintenance to arrive to correct the defective items. Lighting was so poor we had to wait for repairs before unpacking. Dining table hanging lamp was not repaired. Light would flash on and then off again. About an hour after repairs were performed the dining light snapped, went out and all lighting in the suite went completely dark. The second call for help took another hour of total darkness before anyone arrived to restore power.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: lonav
Reviews.Content: We had a luxury suite on the 35th floor. The accommodations were fabulous, and we had a view of the desert and the planes coming in. The bathroom and bathtub were very large, clean, and better than any other hotel I'd been in. The service at check-in was flawless-- staff was helpful and friendly. We checked in early with no problems. The casino felt open-air and not confining. All of the staff was helpful, including the security. Service at the Grand Lux Cafe was great, and I highly recommend their breakfast-- the only 24-hour diner at a casino my fiance would recommend. I highly recommend the Palazzo and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Good News and the Bad News”
Reviews.Author: Checking123
Reviews.Content: Good News: Great strip location; exceptional rooms - large and beautifully designed - down to the showerheads. Excellent amenities - everything you would expect from a 5-star hotel. Bad News: A closer look showed lightbulbs that hadn't been replaced; dust thick enough for me to write my name (BAD when it's marble and you don't check)! ; room hadn't been vacuumed; but the worst ever - a bloody washcloth in one of the drawers! Yikes!! Housekeeping manager was apologetic; front desk staff (Chris) was abrupt, with a "so what" attitude. I will say that getting through to the front desk or in-suite dining was almost impossible (and this was LOW season)... Front desk staff were uninformed, unable to print a boarding pass, didn't know that extra time was needed due to airport construction... Once we got squared away on the room problems, I just loved everything about the Palazzo. Pedicure at the spa was a little pricey for the average person, but Miriam is exceptional and made it worth it with her pressure point foot massage. Bottom Line: Palazzo is adding new construction, including villas. The hotel is a little over a year old, I believe. My recommendation would be that they ensure they have a strong maintenance and staff training program. Could already see the chipped marble, the cracked mirrors, the damaged coffee table... Housekeeping reports all, then it's out of their hands. I'm just too detail-oriented - something's not working with keeping the rooms cleaned and maintained - staff stretched too thin?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it loved it loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amagolf
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and let me tell you something my husband and I Loved it especially at the Palazzo it was the most breath taken place that i ever seen. The people, restaurants, the shops and casino were fantastic. The people are friendly, the rooms are clean, I have no bad comments about this hotel. I recommand anybody that want's to book in vagas the Palazzo should be first on your list, trust me you won't be disapointed. Thanks again "the Palazzo" for making my vacation memorable. Amalia from Laval, Quebec

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: travelboy99
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the superbowl weekend and had a great time. Hotel was easy to check in, room was very nice, great view of the TI show and strip. Will definitly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing, but will stay again”
Reviews.Author: CessRay
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel while on the internet planning my Christmas/New Year/Birthday vacation with my mate. I was excited because the online photos, and amenities seem impressive for the special price they were offering. I immediately booked online for my birthday. A few days later we decided to look at prices at the Venetian realized that they had a great rate also and called on the phone to book one night (just for the experience). We decided to request the same package they were offering at the Palazzo and was told by the reservation agent that it was not available as displayed online. So to prove our point we asked them to check the reservation I booked online for the Palazzo. To our greatest surprise they claimed we did not have one and that package and price did not exist at the Palazzo. The package was (VIP admission to Club LAVO and $50.00 drink credit, $50.00 gaming credit). They were quoting us a higher price and a different package. At that time I did not have the reservation number with me. Once I obtained it we called back and gave it to them and then they mysteriously found the reservation. All was well… or so we thought. A few weeks later I wanted to upgrade on my birthday reservation and called to ask a few questions. Once again they could not find our Palazzo reservation. I gave them the reservation number and they said I booked that date at the Venetian and the rate I claimed to have did not exist even though we had a reservation confirmation email with the price. After staying on the phone for approximately 20 minutes while they sort things out the reservation agent mentioned she fixed the problem and gave us what we requested. I asked for the confirmation number and she said it was the same. Our reservation at the Venetian was before the Palazzo one so during our stay the Venetian we called to extend a day on the upcoming Palazzo reservation only to find out again that our reservation did not exist there. We had to rebook and request our package and rate once again. We were told that all was well. Check-in was fast but not smooth. There were no lines and our room was ready even though we were early. Upon checking in we were unable to get our package because the front desk agent said that the package I wanted was not listed on the reservation. So we received only credits for the casino. Would you believe after all that we still did not get what we were promised? We really wanted to get the VIP passes for the Club LAVO for my birthday, but did not. Room: Similar set up as the Venetian. Spacious but not private it had studio effect. Big bathroom with separate shower, tub and private toilet. I was a bit disappointing because after staying at the Venetian I expected the room décor to be a bit nicer. The couch was a dreary brown color which made the room feel a bit depressing (only because I was comparing it to the Venetian). The towels were dirty, so I took two clean ones from the housekeeper's cart in the hallway. Bed was comfy but not as comfy as the Venetian. The sink was clogged a bit and filled up when we went to brush our teeth. We pumped it a bit and was able to get it functioning again. The small fridge/bar had a sensor on it so of course we could not store our juice or snack in it. I surely didn't want to be charged for something I did not take. Casino: The lines for the Grazie Club(casino club) was a killer. I waited in line for 45 mins to get my gaming credit on my players card, only to find out that none of the cards worked. I went back in line for 20 mins to redo them. After 1 hour of playing my card quit working. I decided to wait till next day to try the line. Same thing happened again. I was so frustrated with those cards. During my 3 day stay in the casino only once a server passed by and I asked her for a drink. She said that I was not playing the machine so she could not give it to me. I actually was trying to play the machine but the buttons kept sticking so I took my money out and was waiting for my mate to finish on his machine for us to move to another. So in order to get the drink I put my money back into the machine and struggled with the sticking button.... Only to hit a small jackpot. Not once but three times on that machine. (1 cent slot). She finally came with the drink and never to be seen again. The only thing is I hit the jackpots after the walked away and I didn't see her to thank her for forcing me to play the machine for a drink. LOL Restaurant: The food at the Italian restaurant downstairs (Del Toro, if I'm not mistaken) was not tasty, neither the waiters nor waitresses were polite. The manager however was attentive in an attempt to make up for the incompetent staff. I enjoy eating at The Grand Lux Cafe. Food portion, price and service were all wonderful each time we went there. All in all I would recommend the hotel for anyone who wants to experience Vegas and the Palazzo. The rate with the packages were rewarding (if you are lucky to have them honor them). The lobby decor is beautiful and there are lots to do. The atmosphere however is a bit impersonal and impolite. I guess it's because of the size of the hotel and as it was around the New Year, lots were going on, so maybe they were overwhelmed. I will give it another try in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent with a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: StevenWigan
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay here after our 3 nights at MGM. Check in was excellent, allocated a suite on the 31st floor with a view of the Wynn golf course. Slightly disappointed not to have a strip view but no matter, we have been to Vegas 5 times already and seen it before. The room / suite was finely appointed. Immaculate in all aspects. I say room / suite because actually it is all one room, they call them suites but if you are expecting seperate rooms then you will be disappointed. The bedroom part had a king size bed, flat screen TV, alarm clock and comfy chair. The living room part had flatscreen tv, fax/photocopier ( with no ink in it ! ), a safe with an excellent shelf with a power charger to charge a laptop whilst it is in storage, round table with 3 chairs, writing desk with a chair and an L- shaped couch with footstool. Quite a room ! Oh yes....... and a remote control to open the drapes and curtains. What a great touch ! The bathroom was superb. Large walk in shower, seperate bath, 2 sinks, a vanity table and seperate toilet in its own room. And........ a flatscreen TV ! Plus they give you bath robes and slippers. You can keep the slippers but they want $65 for a robe.... erm thanks but no thanks. The only minor issues we had were with the air con unit over the closet.. this was very noisy and kept my partner awake for some time. We enquired at the front desk about this and they said it could not be switched off. Also the first night, housekeeping came in and closed our curtains and left us a couple of lovely chocs on the bed.... 2nd night.... nothing. The property itself is small by Vegas standards, but still impressive. It gives an immediate feel of total luxury, both in the public areas and in the guest corridors etc Next trip, we will most likely look to stay at the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “Musical Suites!”
Reviews.Author: FrenchWench
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Las Vegas on Sunday 01/18/09 and took a cab ride to the Palazzo Hotel and Casino for check-in at approximately 7:00 p.m. The hotel did not have the suite type available that we had booked through AirTran Vacations so they asked if they could put us in a 2,000 sq. ft. suite on the 49th floor until the next day when we would be switched to the proper suite type. It was a great suite with it's own media room, pool table and grand piano so it made the first night special! Late the following morning, we contacted the front desk as instructed to let them know we were ready to be moved and were wisked away from the plush digs to a suite overlooking the strip several floors below at the very end of an extremely lengthy hall. We called down to request that we move closer to an elevator. Out of 3,000 rooms, they didn't have anything like that ready but had a room with a view of the Wynn Hotel and its golf course. As that was the view from the first night's suite, we accepted that and headed for the room only to find that it was not facing the Wynn, but all the construction going on beside the Venetian. So..........we contacted the front desk again and they had a bellman come to move our luggage to a room that was being cleaned that we could have when finished. Therefore, all our luggage was placed in the closet in that room and we stayed in the other suite waiting for a phone call to say it was ready for occupancy. Over an hour later I took a walk down to the suite to see how the housekeeping staff was coming along. There was no one cleaning that room and it was occupied by a young couple who had just checked in! And, yes, our luggage was in the closet. Thankfully they hadn't been in the room long enough to realize the luggage was there but were stunned as I was to think the hotel could make such a mistake. Needless to say, we were assigned to another suite which was the 5th suite within a 24-hour period. We finally got to unpack our luggage about 5:00 p.m. on Monday, 1/19. What a nightmare! I truly believe they could have done better than that with the total number of rooms they have. Apparently the Intel convention was on site per the bellmen that helped us. We feel that the management was making the big guys happy at the expense of the everyday traveler. All the staff seemed to be quite pleasant which helped to make a horrible situation more bearable. In addition, we dined at the restaurant Woo in our hotel and it was quite good. The proximity of the hotel to the Fashion Show Mall, the Wynn and Encore was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: stanatl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo for five nights from January 20 - 25 and was very impressed with the hotel. We had a room on the Concierge Level with a strip view on the 27th floor. The room was larger than comparable ones in the Venetian and larger. It was in good shape and everything worked - no problems with the phones, power shades, etc. that we had read in other reviews. Also did not notice the pumped in fragrance that others had complained about - in fact very little offensive cigarette odor in the casino. I actually liked the Palazzo casino more than the Venetian - the wider aisles help a lot. The Concierge Lounge was very large and comfortable and served a continental breakfast afternoon selections and evening cold and hot food. There were free drinks as well. Service was fine with the exception that for some reason we did not receive the turndown service (included with all Concierge Level rooms) for two of the five nights. Had one very forgettable dinner at the Italian Restaurant next to the Lamborghini Musuem - terrible food but the Grand Lux was very good. Saw Jersey Boys for the first time and it was great. Also saw Bette Middler at Caesars - also highly recommended but more expensive. Overall a great stay and I would stay there again. I've been to Caesars, The Venetian, Bellagio, JW Marriott, Luxor, and Bally's. The Palazzo is as good as Bellagio and the rooms are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tedrox
Reviews.Content: Service was friendly in all restaurants and hotel. Rooms are gorgeous. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Donna P
Reviews.Content: This is a big, gorgeous property, but there are still some "rough spots" . We arrived quite early on Friday morning, about 8:30-ish, and we were able to check into our room immediately. This was most appreciated--and not as common as it used to be. The place is lovely, the suites are big and comfortable, tastefully appointed, and include all the amenities you'd expect in this price range. The view from our 39th-floor window was very nice. However, as stated in some prior reviews, it takes a very long time for anyone to pick up the phone at the front desk. This led to our dry cleaning not being picked up until shortly after 9:00 a.m.--the "deadline" for same day service. (We needed the clothing Saturday night.) I was specifically told that it wouldn't have to be an "express" regardless of this, and we would have it back that evening. Of course, it wasn't delivered that evening, and when I called the next day, I was told it wouldn't even be back until the following day--Sunday. So "In By 9:00/Same Day" just isn't. It sounds like "Express" might actually mean the next day, in reality. To the hotel's credit, we received the clothing around noon on Saturday and they took the charge off our bill--but I had to make a fuss and absolutely demand the clothes for our event that night and it was upsetting. Regarding the phones: The desk phone didn't work at all, and the cordless phone on the bedside stand didn't work every time. (I never tried the water closet phone.) Also, I believe soemone else mentioned having trouble with the remote draperies. The sheer Roman drop shades worked perfectly, but the pull drapes didn't respond to the remote without several tries. In addition, there was a pull missing from the mini-fridge cabinet. This should not be so in a hotel on this caliber, in my opinion--basic room maintenance should be better than that. We were going to open a split of Chardonnay from the mini-fridge, and we took it out only to discover there was no cork pull in the room. We put the Chardonnay right back, and pulled out the Champagne instead, (you don't need a pull for that one. ;-). Well, of course we were charged for both, and I had to call about that, too. (I'm a little mystified as to how they knew we intended to drink the Chardonnay, but maybe I don't want to know that...) The Spa is nice--my manicure started and finished right as scheduled. Our Friday night dinner at B&B (Batali & Bastianich), was utterly superlative. I highly recommend this restaurant--sit back in the "wine room." All in all, this is a nice property, with great access to both casinos, (The Palazzo and The Venetian), restaurants and shopping. It's just not quite up to par with its image and its "neighborhood."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: WldHrt60
Reviews.Content: We received a great rate through the Palazzo website with discounts to several restaurants and shows at the hotel. Room was above our expectations. Very pleased. Restaurants were affordable with the discount coupons - Vegas is expensive to eat and we took our 9 year old with us. Great food at Wu Restaurant. Overall memorable and very enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mge991
Reviews.Content: Date: January 20-22, 2009 At arrival around 4pm, the receptionist claimed that the room was not ready but suggested to take a room with tub only and hand-held shower head. Agreed. When got to the room and arranged things, we found that there was simply NO tub at all. The suite size is good with a very tiny closet (haven't seen closet in any hotel that small). The room did offer a nice view but the window was just dirty with water marks everywhere. The window curtain didn't close using the remote. Calling front desk was sometimes challenging because the receptionist simply didn't answer for quite a while. The service certainly would not be rated as 5-star, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “As expected!”
Reviews.Author: samfelix
Reviews.Content: Since this was my 9th visit in a bit over 2 years, my expectations have been tempered but overall another great visit. Prefer the Venetian Casino over the Palazzo, but mainly due to luck as the Palazzo kills me every time I try. The Venetian's been a bit luckier. Rooms at The Palazzo are much newer(a bit over 13 months) and are, by definition, in better shape. We paid a small bit up from our comped room to stay on concierge. Well worth it as the attendants are very good, drinks and food all free. Didn't do any more upscale restaurants, but when I have in the past they've been a bit pricey, but quite good(Carnevino, in particular). Of course we'll be returning this spring/summer, so perhaps more investigation then. Overall, I would highly recommend staying, but as a side trip check out the Hard Rock on friday or saturday nights as well for a more upbeat time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !!!!”
Reviews.Author: JHDawg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo Jan 14-18 2009. From the time we entered to the time we left , we were treated like royalty. The service was extraordinary, the room exquiste and hotel was first class. The "suites " are huge and have every possible amenities available. The only drawback was the slow to non exisistent cocktail service in the casino. However the bar service more than made up for this. Would I return to Palazzo ? Tomorrow if I could !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Come Here - Theft!”
Reviews.Author: Fedessss
Reviews.Content: PLS PLS PLS take a look over reviews regarding theft on this hotel. It seems its a regular issue here. But the worst thing is that the hotel doesnt make themselves responsable for any issue!. MOreover, their customer service regarding an incident like this its just terrific. Someone stole ~700 USD from my bag here. If you must stay here, USE THE SAFE. Federico from Argentina.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Durwoody
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas, The Paris, Luxor, Planet Hollywood, Caesar’s and Mandalay Bay; all very nice. My husband had a conference in Vegas in September that was being held at the Palazzo (an extension of the Venetian hotel). WOW! It was gorgeous! It’s all one large room (like a small apartment) with a step-down living room, 3 flat screen TV’s (one in BR, one in LR and one in bathroom) and gorgeous décor. The bathroom is unbelievable, more beautiful than ours at home. It has a huge shower AND a soaking tub; two separate vanity areas and separate doored toilet with phone. LOL The beds were big and comfy, the LR furniture soft and cozy. Our view was not spectacular – construction. I thought it would be really noisy, but it didn’t bother us at all. The location was nice and close to the mall. We don’t gamble, but we do like to visit Vegas for the shows. Outside the hotel entrance are the casinos and many upscale restaurants, including Mario Battali’s Carne Vino – it was delicious, but expensive. Our bill was about $100, no desert, just entrée and 1 house wine. It was a nice location for the events we planned, seeing the Beatles LOVE and the mall. The Grand Lux Café for breakfast was really good and reasonable with a wide variety of food. The buffet area is really small and always near other people. I would have expected something a little larger for the the number of people and rooms at this hotel. Would I stay again? Without a doubt. Lovely and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Suite deals”
Reviews.Author: ZippoDublin
Reviews.Content: The suites at the Palazzo are the best I've ever stayed in for the price (as little as $150 a night on some websites, way lower than the rack rates the hotel itself offers). The only downside is that there's so much to do in Vegas, you don't get to spend nearly as much time in the room as you'd like to. Each suite has at least three TVs, including one in the bathroom, and a huge range of pay-per-view movies and there is excellent internet service for just $9 a day and a printer/fax in every room. Don't miss the Lavo nightclub - the music is belting house and R'n'B, and the crowd is very stylish and lively. Great casino too. In fact, this hotel has everything and I'd stay there again and again if I was going back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shoppingbag51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 3 nights. Loved the luxury of the suite. The bathroom was awsome. Like the 3 flat screen TV's. My only draw back was the smell that came in through the ventilation system. Sometimes it smelled like bacon cooking. We stayed on the 35th floor and looked out at the airport. Enjoyed the Jersery Boys. The Blueman Group was ok. Hope to go back again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Those Aren't Really Suites - Suites have more than one room.”
Reviews.Author: Canyoncrawler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I tried a Fortuna for three nights. The problem is suites have more than one room. What you get at Palazzo is one generously sized room with a step-down living room. If your partner wants to watch TV, entertain or snore, you are going to be disturbed. There are no newspapers, coffee-makers, turn-down service or other little niceties for "free". If you want to plug in a computer or other device, you'll find no free outlets near the desk. There was a printer but it didn't have enough ink to print a boarding pass. There was a TV in the bathroom but no remote to turn it on or change channels. The housekeepers don't understand the concept of "turn-down" and don't know English. Two Spanish speakers showed up after a conceirge insisted but they wanted to mop, vacuum and change the sheets, instead of closing the curtains, emptying the trash cans, turning down the beds and leaving fresh towels. For $100/day, you can use the Conceirge Lounge, with soft-drinks and coffee served all day, liquor after 5P and breakfast from 6A to 10A. followed by light snacks. There are some newspapers there if you are early enough. The Good News - The location is good. You can get to the Venetian and the Wynn easily. The staff is nice and most are very helpful and friendly. The Venetian is accessible from the second floor and you don't have to walk through a casino to get a great meal at Delmonicos.

Reviews.Title: “Like a palace!”
Reviews.Author: Happyatdisney
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the holiday season. Knowing that we would have brace ourselves for long lines wherever we went, we happily surprised and quite pleased with the service at this hotel. The line for check-in was not long and the staff were very pleasant. We stayed in a Bella Suite....very spacious and beautifully decorated. There is a double door for the bathroom and double sinks. There were 3 televisions in the room because they don't want to walk more than five feet without a first rate viewing of the tv ;) The room was cleaned very well and the toiletries in the bathroom were of good-quality. The casino was beautiful, and did not reek of smoke like some of the other casinos. The mall is gorgeous and connected to the Venetian, another stunner.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms are the best reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: Palazzo serves up a fine and comfortable stay. The generous rooms are done up beautifully, the split-level layout is similar to its sister property The Venetian, though done in a "luxe moderne" style. Bathrooms are sumptuous, and include a small and awkwardly placed 3rd flatscreen TV. The "deluxe view" category is not worth the extra money- my room looked over the TI across the street, and over to the Fashion Show Mall, interesting enough but certainly not a prime Strip view. Serious shoppers will love the place. A small but good Barney's is only an elevator ride (and bit of a walk) away, as well as many other beautiful shops, much less tacky than the adjoining Shops at the Venetian. The Canyon Ranch Spa disappointed me on my last stay at the Venetian. Although it has been renovated, it still does not look or feel like a world-class spa, more like a massage factory. There are many restaurants to choose from- some great, others disappointing. The Grand Lux Cafe is really good and not overly expensive. The Mexican restaurant was so-so, and Carne Vino, a Mario Battali-owned eatery (one of several on the property) was good but very pricey. Service was usually great but can be spotty- my breakfast order was not picked up from the doorknob, and the resulting confusion was unnecessary. The Room Service Operator promised that a Manager would call to apologize, which never happened. Also, rooms are so large, Housekeepers have a tough time cleaning every nook and cranny, especially the mirrors and glass surfaces. Overall, though, this place offers up superb value and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Definitely Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: Mokona
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 4 days over the Christmas holiday. Our room (Palazzo Luxury) is on the 48th floor facing Wynn. There are lots of things we love about the hotel, namely: -- Complimentary daily newspaper (LA times on the weekend, USA today on the weekday) Multifunctional color printer, Wi-Fi and wired network in the room ($10 over 24 hours and you don't have to bring your own cable) Comfortable sofa and bed, very roomy living area and the restroom is gorgeous Bath amenities by Agraria Remote-controlled shades and curtains Speedy and courteous room service. We called for extra toothbrushes and we got it in less than 10 minutes. Safe with AC plugs (so you can charge the laptop and not worry about being stolen) Dinner at Restaurant Charlie (it ain’t cheap but overall very good service and great food) Breakfast at Bouchon (definitely deserve the "Best Breakfast in Las Vegas") Security checks your room key before entering the elevator (I know some people don't like it but I do) -- There are some minor gripes, however: -- There is no coffee maker. When called the front desk, staff said it is because of the state law. Then why would Signature at MGM Grand offers it in every suite? Extra fee for room facing the strip. During check-in, the staff told me it would be $20 extra per night. We understand those rooms are popular but $20 per night seems high. Service at Table 10. We loved the food, but the service is so-so. Our waiter kept asking the other table whether they needed more breads or not, but he didn't ask us. Also our food was not being served to everyone at the same time, but the other table did. -- Are we coming back? Definitely, and next time we would love to check out its Concierge Lounge as we heard so much positive feedbacks about it.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo is stunning”
Reviews.Author: lindagalint
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo over Christmas and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I have stayed in several of the Strip hotels and this one is top of the range. The room (on 37th floor) was beautiful, overlooking TI sep living area, 3TVs remote control for curtains, comfy bed - maid service very thorough. I ate mainly in the Grand Lux and found the food and service excellent. I also used room service and this was also quick and servers were very polite. From Bell service, reception, restaurant, room service, casino staff - all were very friendly and efficient - therefore surprised at the comments from another reviewer. Being a sole female I never felt uncomfortable at all and I would certainly recommend the Palazzo for your next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: protein
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to Las Vegas and this was by far the worst experience we have ever had at a Las Vegas Hotel. There are too many other fine options in this town to put up with the poor service we experienced at the Palazzo: Long lines at check in, room not ready until 7pm, 45 min wait for our luggage to be brought to the room, long waits for the bellman, long waits for the valet parking, no one answers the phone at the front desk, room not stocked with kleenex, toilet paper and towels; poor drainage in the shower, clogged toilet, hole in the wall, stains on the couch and completely unresponsive front desk managers. When you complain to them or their supervisors they refer to everything as "challenges"; "we apologize for the challenges" they are all reading from the same wimpy customer service script but do nothing to rectify the "challenges". We experienced nothing but major inconveniences, failed expectations and failed promises. The management does not care about the guests here. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Again, there are too many other choices in Vegas to have to put up with this crap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rgarick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Palazzo in Vegas...excellent hotel...well located...good service...upgrade to concierge level..very worthwhile...lovely club level service with good breakfast, afternoon tea, snacks, drinks, etc...great service.. The rooms are all suites with a living area, beautiful marble bathroom, 3 flatscreen tvs, comfortable bedding. Many restaurants in the hotel to select from as well--but lots on the strip that are equally good. Only negative about hotel--perfume smell that permeates the entire hotel--appears to be piped in to all areas--if you have allergies, etc. you will find this unpleasant. Great staff--friendly, helpful. Also saw lots of great shows-don't miss David Copperfield, Jersey Boys, and Bette Midler.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller143
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at The Venetian before, so knew what to expect in many ways from The Palazzo, its new sister. I didn't find the scent, smell or stink (depending on the reviewers below) off-putting - yes, it was there but after a couple of minutes became unnoticeable to me, and if it masks cigarette smoke in the casino, then that's fine by me. The suite was very nice and the view over the strip was great from the 34th floor. Ate at Morels restaurant which was very good indeed for steaks and oysters, and also at Sushi Samba which was pretty good but not as memorable as the ones in NYC. Would I go back? Probably, but would also consider the new "Encore" next to the "Wynn" as a brief trip in there was very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SheriffBart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights at the Palazzo, in a Luxury View category room. Check in was prompt, friendly and efficient. It should be noted, however, that we checked in on an off arrival date over the Christmas holiday; when we walked through the lobby the next day we saw approximately 100 people waiting to check in. I guess at a hotel this big you might have to expect this, especially if you are arriving at a peak time. Several photos of the rooms have been posted of the hotel from other reviewers, and they are completely accurate. The room was great, with a super comfy bed (among the best I've slept in) and a great couch (finally a sleeper sofa that is comfortable!), Being that we were in a view room, I expected to be on a higher floor; the view was good but I'm not sure it would be worth paying extra for. Also, I have read in both past reviews and travel publications that the bathroom showers have multiple shower jets; this was not the case in our room. Perhaps they are only in higher category rooms, or are being retrofitted. The "turndown service" consisted only of chocolates on our pillow, it did not appear there was any effort to tidy the room up a bit. I also want to note we did NOT experience the "Palazzo Scent" in our room, but it sure was prevelant in the casino! I like the location of the place; close enough to walk the strip but far enough away from the craziness of the center strip area. My wife used the Canyon Ranch Spa and she said it had the best spa faciilities she has ever been to. We ate breakfast at the Grand Luxe Cafe twice and had two great meals. Overall, this is a great choice that is worthy of its top tier rating of Vegas Hotels. It didn't get 5 stars from me because nothing here really "wowed" me, and when you are staying at a place like this, you invite closer scrutiny. Don't let me stop you from staying here though!

Reviews.Title: “Numerous lapses in service made stay very unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: topaccommodations
Reviews.Content: There were far too many problems with our stay to list them all here but several lapses in service made our stay very unpleasant. We could not wait to leave. The standout issues were as follows: Room: dirty on arrival. During a two-day stay our room was cleaned exactly once - late on the second day of our stay. Loud knocking sound coming from the bathroom plumbing that interrupted our sleep both nights. Called front desk repeatedly and no one ever answered. Casino: we were in the casino both days of our stay for approximately five hours total. Approached once by a server for drinks. Slot machine malfunctioned. Although staff alerted to this issue, waited 15 minutes for someone to assist me and no one ever showed. Club card personnel understaffed. 30 minutes in line to sign up for their casino card program. Spa: Uninterested attendants left us wondering what the spa had to offer. Finally managed to make an appointment after waiting 15 minutes. Spa was a let down and vastly overpriced. Restaurants: Ate at five to six outlets at the hotel. Service was painfully slow, bumbling, didn't always get what we ordered, and all were obviously understaffed even though there was no crush of people at these restaurants. Bell stand: not offered assistance upon departure. The bell staff stand around a lot. When we needed tape for a box, we were told by both the front desk and bell staff that we would have to walk over to the business center at the Venetian with our box to pay for tape for our box. Front desk: It would be nice if they actually picked up the phone when they are called. Upon check-out we informed the front desk of numerous service lapses. They did not adequately address them. In addition, after waiting in line for 20 minutes to check-out we were told that they could not provide an invoice to us because they were in the process of updating their accounting records, which they told us occurred every day at 10:00 am. Received erroneous invoice via email. All in all I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel strives for five star service and our experience was at best a two star one. Stay somewhere else. Even at the Palazzo's discounted rates there are far better places in Las Vegas that actually deliver good service. The Palazzo is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Barnez
Reviews.Content: Never written a review before but had to write one for the Palazzo though, it's a fantastic hotel and well worth staying in if you're looking for a place in Vegas...worth the expense. We stayed for 6 nights and can't fault our hotel suite, it was amazing - clean, luxurious, spacious, very modern and a great location. My only negative about the hotel would be how expensive it is to eat and drink there (although most of the main hotels in Vegas are over-priced!), it costs far too much for even a cup of tea, let alone a meal! There is a particularly good noodle bar in the Palazzo though that is well worth going to and isn't too expensive. The pool area is also great, worth going to one day if you fancy a chilled out day or afternoon. We loved Vegas, would definitely recommend a visit...my one piece of advice is make sure you pick a nice hotel to stay in, ideally one of the main ones on the strip...I believe the hotel you stay in will drastically affect your enjoyment of Vegas...it felt great to be part of the grandeur and glitz, I'd guess that if you stayed in one of the more ecomony hotels then you may not feel quite so excited by it all. You don't need to spend tons of money in the more expensive hotels, you can get good deals on your stay and just eat elsewhere etc. Treasure Island do a great breakfast buffet, great value and fills you up for the day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: jpearlsew
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights to attend a group party--- The overall room was excellent--every amenity you can imagine was there. Fine linens, nice towels, 3 televisions, remote control curtains, robes, nice soaps, ect. It was very clean and the hotel and shops and restaurants were amazing. The prices in the hotel for drinks, shopping and food were on the high side but we knew that when booking. The service was a little lacking for such a fabulous hotel. It appeared as if once you were there, they had you and therefore didn't need to have excellent customer service. When trying to call the concierge, 2 times, I was put on hold for over 10 minutes. When calling the spa, no one answered after 20 rings. We were put in a smoking instead of non-smoking room and were hardly offered an apology. I am usually not very picky--however, when staying at such a fancy and expensive hotel, I would expect the customer service to be great as well. Overall, a great hotel, all amenities, clean, good spot on the strip, excellent food. Our only issue was the not so excellent service. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “NOT what expected!! Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaJurgensen
Reviews.Content: Before I begin with my feedback, let me say that my mother and I both are frequent travelers and we have stayed in world class resorts around the world. Because of flight delays we did not check in until after midnight and all my mother and I wanted to do was shower and go to bed. We could not do that upon check-in because we did not have towels in the room and had to call twice to get them. They did come eventually. The temperature of the entire Palazzo, especially my room, was HOT. I had difficulty sleeping and my mother did too because of the temperature issue. The air conditioning did work in the room and at times the room was comfortable so it was not a maintenance issue. Our main complaint was the unsupervised children in the casino that were under six years of age. There were no parents around that we could see and we did complain on more than one occasion. On Christmas Eve the loud, unsupervised children were actually kicking casino goers ad they walked past, including us. Unruly children in the casino was an issue throughout our stay so we did not gamble in your casino, we went elsewhere where children were not running amok. We are not anti-child, there are just places that we expect to be free of screaming children. I found the service in the Lavo Restaurant to be horrible. On an evening that was not busy I was ignored by the female bar tender when I ordered a drink and after standing there for twenty minutes with her barely acknowledging me, I just left. Ate at Enoteca San Marco in the Venetian and the food was cold and the service was non-existent. The Grand Lux Cafe was excellent. If it wasn't for their wonderful food and service, this would not have been a good trip for us. The beds were very comfortable too, which was important. I was surprised that there was no evening turn down service, or a visit by housekeeping to freshen up the towels in the evening. For the price and the class of the resort, we expected that. Overall our experience was very disappointing and we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and slow”
Reviews.Author: MrsCToronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful but they have a "designer' fragrance pumped in that smells like industrial disinfectant. There is no seating at all in the lobby, nor at the Concierge desk - never seen that before. The room was lovely with sleep inducing beds BUT it was filthy. The windows haven't been cleaned in living memory. The floor was sticky - ewww and the glasses were beyond dirty. THEY DO NOT CLEAN THEM! One had a sticker in the bottom ON THE INSIDE, another had dried on milk stains and the third was gritty and damp - all turned neatly upside down on paper coasters. Makes you wonder what else wasn't clean. We prepaid this visit and arrived after midnight but the room still wasn't ready. The same thing happened to a couple who checked in just as we did. No room at 1am. They told us it would be an hours wait. With so many luxury hotels on the strip we shall go elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but Not as Nice as Wynn”
Reviews.Author: vegas_101Canada
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Venetian earlier this year and were able to get comped for the Palazzo. It is very nice, but the attention to detail isn't overwhelming and it seems a bit more casual. All of the staff we met were very helpful and nice, and some of them went above and beyond, especially at the front desk. The Grand Lux Cafe is marvelous and has a very large menu and fantastic food. We were upgraded to a view room on the 43rd floor at the end of the hallway, which was a long walk, but the view made up for it. Access to the pool is great and the pool(s) are fantastic. They have palm trees and flowers and seven pools (including the ones at the Venetian pool which is connected to the Palazzo pool). The room is very large, but I think that it is a stretch to call it a suite. There was some dust, but that wasn't a big problem. The Palazzo has one of the top five hotel rooms in Vegas. They are fairly modern with three televisions and a pull out couch is a plus. The shopping is nothing special, but it is a fairly nice area. The casino is very open. It is easily accessed, but it is kind of blah compared to the other 5 star casinos in town. Overall, I will probably return because of comps, location, ect, but I do prefer the Wynn properties.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...I'm loving it a bit too much...”
Reviews.Author: lovemusicandart
Reviews.Content: Wow-I loved the entire stay at Palazzo. I almost didn't want to write good review because then people may start going there more, driving the price up. Anyhow, I got pretty good deal staying there this December. I went there with my husband for a romantic gataway. I remember the most horrible trip ever in Vegas with my soon-to be husband 2 years ago (stayed in cheep hotel Riviera, ending up to be kicked out 2nd night after midnight -Riviera forged my husband's signature to be "volunterry check out" we assume that they got some big group coming in and decided to make room for them) Anyhow, so this time I wanted things to be right, and I made a good choice. I had never stayed good hotel in Vegas, but my husband had stayed in basic room in Bellagio, and penthouse suite in Bellagio. We both agree, with the price we paid, I wonder what hotel can beat Palazzo. We loved everything. The basic room which is suites already, is fantastic. I could live there. We got room "without view" but, it actually has a beautiful view of mountain desert with towns, it just is not facing to the strip. We liked it better because it is more relaxing. The other reviewer said that door was too heavy, but I didn't feel that way at all. I thought to have good door for private toilet area in the bathroom was actually great. Bathroom had beautiful double doors opening into a little marble tiled hallway -very spacious. And yes, all the amenities written to be there, is there in the bathroom. double sink, big tub, separate shower, and makeup vanity with cute chair. But what I didn't know was how great this room was in details. Bathrooom had two lights, it could control mood/romantic to more bright setting. The little bar/cabinet in the bedroom had marble tile which can be set to have this beautiful light underneath, adding the romantic feel during the night. closet light automatically comes up when you open, turns of when you close. When you leave/enter the room, you only need to turn off/on master light at near entrance anyway you like it. Hotel itself was very clean, and does have little fragrance in the air, but it was very nice. I don't like fragrance to begin with so it didn't bother me, most people wouldn't. the ventilation was good also, I HATE smoke-but when I'm walking into the Palazzo, I hardly smelled smoke. The decor is modern and classy, not as flashy as Venetian, we loved the relaxing atmosphere of the entire hotel. One of the reason I picked Palazzo was because it has Canyon Ranch Spa Club, with $40 a day(if you purchase $29 resort package you can get same pass with more stuff), you can access all the fitness classes and huge, I mean huge spa area. And yes, there is everything that said to be there is there. Additionally, co-ed conservatory is HUGE ! and there is very nice reading/nap area which is individually separated with curtain in both women, and men's section. I honestly could spend few days without stepping outside of it. My husband is NOT spa kind of guy, but we ended up spending at least 4 hours, and made him want to get massage and stay longer. Also the great surprise was Canyon Ranch Cafe Grill- very healthy selection with great quality food, and tastes great. My husband had owned a restaurant, worked with many cafes, was impressed. He was complaining earlier why he couldn't get even a decent coffee in Vegas, and there it was. The coffee itself pleased him-he said that even has "truffle overtone". We went back the grill for another breakfast-oh it was also VERY reasonably priced as well. Next time I will be in Palazzo, I'm sure at least one meal everyday, we'll have it there. Speaking of restaurant, yes I feel that everything is Vegas is pretty much overpriced, which was same in Palazzo, but compare to Bellagio-it was much better. Also in Palazzo/Venetian has so many many more restaurants, and I was surprised how good these are. We knew many great restaurant from LA area, and many of them were located at Palazzo. We can just try all without driving in LA traffic. great. One meal we tried to have it at Bellagio, more overpriced, and super crowded, not many restaurants were there anyway...we ended up getting crappy food at high cost. Next time I will stick with the restaurant in Palazzo-there were so many of them to begin with and I didn't need to make reservation nor to wait. The services were great except one of the cafe Tintoretto Bakery looked good but everything was bad including coffee. Espressamente Illy was over priced (coffee place, you pay extra to have espresso in ceramic cup, what!?-go Canyon Ranch Cafe Grill for a coffee and freshly baked scone with super tasty peanut butter and yogurt creme on the side). Sushisamba had interesting menu, and for fusion themed sushi place, the suchi WAS good. the sushi set actually contained some interesting fish and in good quality. We ordered fresh grated wasabi for $2 on the side, it was very good although we know it was not grated with shark skin as we usually like it. I recommend shrimp chevice, very creative, and good. Dal Toro Ristorante was ok. just for atmosphere, then I couldn't see cars while eating anyways. Pinot was excellent, wow, but for onion soup $14 ? why ? And oysters were good yet really really tiny... humm.. but I may have to go back because of the quality is really good. After all quality is more important than quantity for me. Endive salad was really really good. I could eat a mountain of it. Woo was just good- we had to wait loong time for just lunch, but food was creative and good. I just didn't understand fried calamari, why do we have cinamon for seafood? After one bite I forgot that I was eating calamari.....it could be anything in there with so much cinamon on it. I wish everything was a tad cheaper. Now I noticed some of the restaurant I mentioned was in Venetian, but it is good thing about Palazzo, is connected to Venetian so seemlessly, You actually have much more choice of food and shopping without much walking. I can keep going on and on...but I should stop here. I'm definately going back to Palazzo soon.

Reviews.Title: “Top Bottom”
Reviews.Author: monamigabi
Reviews.Content: The trip was intended to serve as a birthday present for my girlfriend. Because of the snow in Las Vegas, she was stuck in Los Angelos and I was stuck in Minneapolis (we both took different flights). There goes 1 day of our vacation. I arrived on day 2 at 1pm. The room was just right, except my girlfriend still wasn't there! I somewhat felt mislead by the Reservations team which told me I had credits for things I truly didn't. That was irritating to me since it was partially the reason I booked with Palazzo. i brought this to management attention and was brushed off. My girlfriend eventually landed later that night, but without her luggage (which was still in transit). There goes day 2. Day 3 we awake to start the day with hopes of receving luggage. She stayed in the room ALL day awaiting this delivery, while I went out around the strip. The delivery from Delta came around 2pm on Day 3. The luggage somehow never made it's way up to OUR room. We phoned the bell service several times. We were told, "Oh yeah, your luggage should be in your closet, we delivered it earlier." We looked in the closet and my girlfiend NEVER left the room, so we were pretty sure it never arrived. After several more phone calls with tons of misleading information, we were told the luggage was on its way up. 30 minutes go by and no luggage. Eventually, after another 1 hour of waiting and phone calls that the luggage was lost and deliverd to another room, BUT they didn't know what room!!!!! We spoke with some managers, both of which were helpful, but it still didn't help find the luggage and repair the 3 days we've lost Because my girlfriend was in a tank top and jeans for 3 days straight we truly could not continue our planned Friday night of Dinner at Stack and the Beatles LOVE. It was intended to be an amazing night ([price range of $500+). We had to cancel both dinner and the show. We did end up going to dinner because face it, we had to eat food----luggage or not. Eventually, at 9:15pm the missing luggage was delivered to our room! There goes day 3. The End.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Feel Comfortable at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: TravelSheryl
Reviews.Content: While the Palazzo is beautiful, I was not comfortable in my room. The air condition did not cool evenly throughout the suite. To make the bedroom area cool, the thermostat had to be set so low that the living room area was freezing. All of the doors (presumably for fire prevention purposes) are heavy as lead. I could hardly open the door to the ice machine room. The toilet is behind a heavy door within the bathroom and you could not leave it open. The dresser drawers are hard to open and close. Room service was extremely slow and I was there Christmas week which is a very slow week, especially this year. I would not choose the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “superficial”
Reviews.Author: crispycritterwsm
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be the final luxurious leg on a 3 stop tour which also included The Sheraton Towers, New York and The Holiday Inn, Fishermans Wharf ,San Francisco.We arrived at the hotel at 10am and were told our room was being prepared and wouldn't be available until 3.30pm. Im not quite sure what they were doing in there but it certainly wasnt cleaning or maintaining the fixtures and fittings. When we finally got access to the room we had to play a game of 'how does it all work?' because there was no information at all about anything in the room including the jet engine room air conditioning that never stops and the t.v.'s. Even after repeated requests nothing materialised. Maybe it's a secret. Next up was the magical t.v. cabinet doors which were held on by......... nothing. As a result when i tried to open them to access the safe they fell off. Onto me. And they are heavy. 4 of the lights in the room didnt work and again after phoning down a number of times nothing was done. Is it me, or would you rather have a t.v. in the bathroom and a telephone in the toilet or coffee making facilities? According to the front desk an electric kettle is a fire hazard and therefore 'ILLEGAL in Las Vegas hotels.' Im a firefighter, have been for ten years and ive never put out a kettle. Call me a cynic but i would suggest the last thing they want you to do is make yourself a coffee when you can phone down and order one for 13 dollars. Take your own kettle. Believe me, you will thank me for this. Now, i'm not an expert but i have to say this hotel was a fairly good representation of Vegas. On the surface it looks great but whatever you do, dont give it close inspection. That beautiful Italian furniture is chipboard. And its dirty. Oh, and just in case they dont tell you, because they wont. Dont lift that bottle of wine out of the mini bar to see what year it is because it will be on your bill faster than you can say 'mini bar scam' even if you put it back unopened. What got me down amidst all this was the complete indifference shown by any of the staff. Im sure they are all sweetness and light when your telling them what a nice time your having and they're scouting for a tip but when the chips were down, so to speak, they really couldn't have cared less. I liked Vegas a lot, it was an exciting place but when i come back it wont be to the Palazzo hotel. Your not a guest, your a form of prey. Im sure there are much better places to stay here so i would say go find them and give this place a miss. And as for that smell in the lobby what on earth is that all about?.......

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSkiers
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Quality of furnishing and fittings were lovely. Housekeeping and turn-down service were excellent. Only reception lets down this hotel; we were twice allocated a room already occupied and when we asked to speak with a manager he kept us waiting whilst he 'finished' off something, although we were in full view - hardly good customer service. We were up-graded to a huge suite for our inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Green hotel but annoyingly loud vent”
Reviews.Author: MLBAGENT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and new. All the staff were very courteous, friendly, and respectful. My wife had an issue with the perfume they pump in there and we both were a bit perturbed with the loud air coming through the vent above the closet. I called the front desk and they told me they were a "green" hotel and that was fresh clean air getting pumped in and offered to send someone to see if it was unduly loud but it was bedtime. I'm all for "green" but it sounded like a loud air conditioner that I couldn't turn off and was fairly annoying. When asked at checkout how the stay was, I got the same courteous answer and a shrug after lodging the complaint. The rooms are spacious and beautifully done. The view was great from the 38th floor and no need for valet as you'll have to tip and it will take 10 minutes for your car. I self parked and found spots just a few feet from the entrance. Overall I loved it, but for the clean air vent which, unfortunately, is a game breaker for me when it interferes with the peace and quiet of my room. Will look to explore more serene rooms at other 5 stars on the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Palazzo!!”
Reviews.Author: Spuds92
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo Thanksgiving week. What an amazing hotel! I still can't believe how wonderful it was! We arrived around 10AM on a Sunday and were in our room by 11AM--even though official check-in time isn't until later in the afternoon. Our suite had a wonderful view of the Wynn golf course and waterfall. The mountains were nice to look at as well. We spent most of our time in the Palazzo property--which we had not intended to do. The places to eat were a little more expensive than we had expected, but the food was amazing and well worth it. We dined at Table 10, Morels (twice!), Restaraunt Charlie's, the neighboring food court twice, the gelatto shop, and had dessert at the Double Helix bar. All was wonderful and we wanted to try other places! The rooms are simply amazing. Tons of room to stretch out (which turned out to be a good thing when I injured my foot half way through the trip), THREE TV sets (including one in the bathroom), really comfortable bedding, and very tasteful furnishings. The room was spotless and housekeeping kept everything that way! The turndown service was a nice touch. The spa.....WOW! I spend a few hours every day at the Canyon Ranch Spa. Working out and enjoying the spa facilities. If you have the opportunity to have a massage (it's not cheap) ask for Gaberiel. He found knots and sore muscles I didn't even know I had. Well worth the money!!! Even the casnio was nice to me. I managed to turn $15 in free play into $150 of actual cash money. LOL! The casino felt clean and open. Good variety of machines and table games. Drink serivce was good too. It was amazing and I cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: jslatch
Reviews.Content: We will definitely return to the Palazzo. The room was gorgeous, comfortable, luxurious. Great view (mountains, strip, pool). The only downside to the room was no coffee maker. Friendly, helpful staff. The lobby was beautiful and tasteful, if not confusing - but everything in Vegas is huge and over the top. Somehow, the Palazzo was classier and less smoky/cheesy than the other places. We got a great deal too.

Reviews.Title: “All-around wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: DeskPotato
Reviews.Content: My family and I (5 adults) stayed at the Palazzo for 3 nights before Thanksgiving and spread out into 2 adjacent rooms. Each of us agreed that this is THE best hotel experience we've had in comparison to the dozens of trips to Vegas over the years. Room - My favorite aspect of the hotel is the room configuration and decor. The standard rooms at Palazzo (like Venetian) are huge. Large, well-appointed bathroom with a jet tub, separate shower, enclosed toilet, double vanity and TV. Then there is a sleeping area containing beds, TV and dressser. Lastly, the sunken living space contains a sectional sofa, desk area, TV and mini bar. One roommate could be watching TV without disturbing the sleepers. For me, the new, beautiful decor at Palazzo put this hotel over Venetian which used to be my #1. I enjoyed the balance of the 'hi-tech' features (flat-panel TVs and remote-controlled window coverings) in combination with the modern-classic-luxurious furnishings. Turn-down service and morning newspaper are nice touches. Layout - The hotel is well-laid out. Very spacious everywhere, even in the casino. Parking elevator is right next to the hotel elevators so there's no need to maneuver through crowds or haul luggage a long way to get to your car. We hardly ever waited for an elevator. Coffee bar right at the base of the elevators. Service - Employees were so accommodating, efficient and polite thoughout the hotel - reception, housekeeping, Carnevino restaurant and casino dealers. In nice contrast to our last trip at the Wynn where we experienced some service problems and attitude. Location - Connected to Venetian and close proximity to many other nice hotels. Very walkable. The only downside was that the gym pass was a bit expensive ($40 per day). A couple of dining highlights during my trip (one of my favorite hobbies): - Enjoyed a late supper at Firefly (off the strip) which serves delicious Spanish tapas at very reasonable prices. - Also, loved the burgers at Bradley Ogden (bar/lounge area) in Caesar's Palace. It was pre-fixe and includes a salad and butterscotch pudding for dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious rooms at great rates”
Reviews.Author: LAM2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 3 days before Thanksgiving. The rate was $119/night. A fantastic value . The hotel is new, so everything is still fresh. The experience from check in to your room feels very luxurious. Once in the room you hardly want to leave the bathroom - all in marble, dressing table with make up mirror, large tub, separate shower, 2 sinks, separate WC, and small flat panel TV. Very nice. You'll never get out of bed in the morning they are comfortable. Rooms are large with a separate sitting area, 2 flat panel TV. Appointments, furniture all top notch in Italian classical style with a modern twist. We had the view room facing the strip - gorgeous sweeping view over the vast city to the mountains. Beautiful sunsets. Noise level from street pretty quiet on 45th floor. It only got loud when they were testing a sound system for New Year's or something over at the Mirage. It was very loud and lasted until 11:30pm a couple of nights. I assume this was rare. The last night was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: neurotomas
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms and roomservice - cant say enough. But the hotel put a $622 unauthorized charge on our account that took days to reverse. Terrible service on the floors - dont try to drink and gamble. Zeffarino's (esp.) and Dos Caminos, lackluster service and marginal food. Phantom and Jersey Boys fabulous. May not stay here next time even though the rooms were superb. We are service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room!”
Reviews.Author: Trip1001
