Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay! Everything is nice and comfortable. Love the free slippers provided. The room (they call it Suite) is huge. There are three tvs including one in the bathroom. The bed is comfortable with down comforter and pillows. The only problem I had was with check in. I waited about 10-15 minutes in line. When we finally got to our room, we found out the keys don't work. We had go all the way back to the lobby and were given another set of keys to try. Luckily they worked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - but quite a few problems”
Reviews.Author: RichardLister
Reviews.Content: Their online booking system is rubbish. I found a code for a great deal on the internet, but any sign of the deal disappeared once I continued with the booking - which made me worried if I was getting the extras or not. It took a very long time for the confirmation to arrive and it also didn't mention the extras. I emailed them for confirmation and never heard anything back. Our package included "invited guest checkin" but it wasn't really worth it - main checkin would probably have been faster. We got "upgraded" to a bigger suite, but when we saw the 5th floor room and its view of literally a blank wall about 3 feet from the window, we asked to be downgraded to the suite we'd booked. We ended up in a suite on the 16th floor with a very nice view of the strip. Room was nicely furnished but already had a few stains and chips on furniture. Bathroom was very nice but water pressure was poor, especially in the shower. Other comments here have mentioned problems with the cleaning. We tipped our maid each day and I would say we still only got an average service. Crumbs all over the sofa from previous guests for example. They missed our turn-down a couple of nights also. Had room service one night - was very slow and not great quality. Tried again another night and was told it would be 90 minutes, so I got take-out from the Venetian food hall instead. Ate in the Morels restaurant one night. Very poor food indeed and have just checked credit card statement and found out the server added $30 to our bill. Spoke to manager who apologised and offered a refund of difference and said they'd take up with the server. High speed wireless internet was not badly priced for Vegas at $9.95 - but was included in our rate so they removed at checkout. We were also meant to get a credit for not taking the newspapers, but they couldn't understand this and I didn't want to miss a plane trying to get an extra $8 credit! Their security is like the Ventian - over the top. The guards won't let you in the elevator unless you show a room key. This is annoying as it doesn't really increase security and no other hotel in Vegas seems to bother. Overall quite a nice room in a hotel with a good location and it's not so big that you have to walk miles to your room (like the Venetian). However, the poor cleaning, water pressure and room service means we probably won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “I can't add much to the review by 'amblush'”
Reviews.Author: Roundman436
Reviews.Content: But I found two other big plus items for this property. The first is that it is unnecessary to drive on ‘The Strip’ portion of Las Vegas Blvd (often a "parking lot") to enter/exit the hotel by auto. From the east, drive on Tropicana (or other parallel streets), take a right on Korval to a left on Sands Ave, then a left into the underground parking entrance. If driving from South LV Blvd, take a right at Mandalay Bay and follow the left and right curving main road until it becomes Korval and then on to Sands. From the west and from I-15, use Exit 39 and turn east on Spring Mountain Rd/Vegas Plaza Dr, cross The Strip and it becomes Sands, then right into the parking entrance. If using a taxi from the airport, don't let the driver talk you into the "quickest way", which of course is the 'longest way' (via the tunnel, I-215 and I-15) and will cost ±$25. And don't let them take you via Tropicana all the way to The Strip. Tell the driver to use the Tropicana/Korval route to the hotel. It should be little more than half as much. The second plus is that self-parking is easier and quicker than Valet; and it does not have-to involve walking through the casino. There are two banks of elevators from the parking levels up to the hotel. The western bank requires crossing the casino. The eastern bank is not only ‘around-the-corner’ from the room elevators; but the elevators also go up to both the casino (C) level and also to the 2nd floor. To park near the eastern bank, after entering the parking area keep straight ahead toward the back and to the left.. I hope this helps others..

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, a suite I could live in”
Reviews.Author: TetonEats
Reviews.Content: We only had one night to spend in Vegas and wanted to make that night fun, reasonable and to enjoy the town without a ton of schlepping around. The Palazzo was amazing. The service is tip top notch. From the first valet to greet us, to the dealers, bell hops, front desk, bartenders, servers, housekeeping, every single person was friendly, personable and helpful. The people were 5 star trained, but never stuffy and set the tone for our stay. We tip well. And every tip was appreciated with a sincere thank you. Talk about a room! It was spotless, bright, modern and so comfortable. We could have lived in the bathroom alone. Flat screen that you can watch from the shower?!?!? Over the top. And I liked it. :) The 750sqft was big enough to have spent a week in and work from conveniently. We had dinner at Cavelletto (sp?) in the Venetian's "St. Mark's Square." Again service was friendly and didn't flinch at us sharing. Sitting on the patio at the restaurant felt like being outside at an Italian trattoria after a few glasses of nice Italian wine and with a little imagination. After dinner and a little cruising around, we found Lavo. The room reservation came with free door and VIP priority in line along with $50 in drinks. The lounge looked classy and mellow - in a good way - but we headed up to the club. DJ Reach from NYC spun a high energy mix of party songs and the place was pulsing. With only 18 hours in Vegas, the Palazzo/Venetian combo allowed us to make the most of it. Unlikely Vegas combo of fun AND relaxing all in one.

Reviews.Title: “Not like last time”
Reviews.Author: MickeyInGlenwood
Reviews.Content: Arrived Thanksgiving day at advertised check-in time of 3pm for a three night stay. My reservation was for a Bella Suite with 2 beds, but was told no such rooms were available, but more expensive strip view and concierge levels were available at additional cost of course. We had dinner reservations at 6pm and needed a room but I didn't want to pay more, so I was offered a handicapped suite and told it is "exactly the same except for some rails in the bathtub". I was very displeased but needed the room and accepted this alternative. We arrived at room 31-807 to find that the room is much different than the rooms I had on my two other visits to this hotel. There was no shower in the bathroom just a shower head in the bathtub and no curtain or doors so water goes everwhere when showering. There is also only one sink instead of two, and the living room is not sunken - plus various other changes to make the room accessible. Besides these design elements the room was filthy and full of issues - it was so dusty that I could write the word DUST on every surface, there were hairs and other bits of junk all over, the inside of the window was covered in hand prints, the mirror in the bath was covered in water spots as were the sink fixtures, the little bottle of free lotion had cracked and leaked all over the counter, the carpet was not vacuumed, the wall behind the heating unit had been removed and not repaired correctly, there was a huge chunk of damage near the floor in the entry and worst of all there was an exposed carpet tack in front of the closet that stabbed me in my foot when I had the misfortune to step on it. I called maintenance about the tack but no one ever came to fix it and we finally just put a shoe over that spot in the carpet and went on with our vacation - but I was reminded of the tack with every step for the next three days. My previous two stays at this hotel were so terriffic that I was painfully suprised by the stark contrast of this room. For a five star hotel with five star prices I expect a five star experience, but the problems with this room seem like something I would encounter in a $39 a night room at the 30 year old Imperial Palace, not a $200 a night room at the 1 year old Palazzo. My other two stays at Palazzo were so great that I thought I had found my new home in Las Vegas for my 6+ trips per year but now I will be looking for somewhere new. Please look at my photos to see the problems I have described, and feel free to contact me about my disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Made Las Vegas Special”
Reviews.Author: asianam
Reviews.Content: My 87 year old mother and I stayed at Palazzo Nov.23 and 24 in a room with 2 queen beds. I booked the rooms through the Palazzo's official internet site. Terrific room rate of $162 per nite incl. tax; no additional charges for valet parking. We ate at Grand Luxe and also at the food court in the Venetian; all good meals and reasonable prices. Check-in and check out went quickly. Service throughout the hotel was excellent. We got upgraded to a 33rd floor room facing the strip so there were views of the mountains and the lights at night. My mother enjoyed the short walks within the Palazzo and Venetian Hotels. Great stores and entertainment. I made some major clothing purchases at Barneys NY and Catherine Malandrino stores. The room was so relaxing and wonderful.....we look forward to going back to Las Vegas in large part due to the Palazzo's beautiful suite/room, service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel - Though A Few Problems”
Reviews.Author: griffinm7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in November 2008. Small line at check in and was greeted by name. Immediately offered numerous upgrades, which I declined. I then asked for a high floor room, but was told the highest I could go was the 8th floor. I had a feeling the clerk was trying to push me back into taking an upgrade. I stuck with my room on the 8th floor. Having stayed at the Venezia a few years back, I can say without doubt these are the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. Especially at entry level suite standard. Large, split level, suites Separate shower, tub and toilet areas 3 plasma/LCD televisions Wet bar with additional Snack Center DVD player and Ipod Alarm Clock/Radio Luxurious toiletries Bathrobes and Slippers Wireless Internet with Fax/Copier/Printer Remote control Roman blinds and Drapes Evening turn-down service, with chocolates on pillow, ice bucket refreshed, bins emptied and toiletries and towels refreshed. You will not find larger rooms anywhere on the Strip at this level. Not even at the Wynn or Bellagio. The decor of the Palazzo is classy and understated in comparison to the somewhat excessive detailing of the Venetian. The casino has specific non smoking areas and generally it felt less smokier than the Venetian. I never returned to my room smelling of smoke. Problems: There were 5 ceiling lights throughout the suite that needed replacing. Housekeeping clearly doesn't monitor the lighting within the room and report it. I had to phone down and have the lights replaced myself. Perhaps it's me, but the room feels dark, even with all the lights switched on. I would prefer increased or brighter lighting in the rooms. On the second day of my stay I decided to have some candy from Snack Center. I happily watched TV eating my chocolate, only to glance at the bottom of the box to find a best buy date of October 2008. I immediately called the Refreshment Center to complain that stock inside the Snack Center was not being checked, and that my purchase was out of date. The fact is, if people don't buy these products, they can potentially be there for a very long time. Later that day they replaced all the stock inside my Snack Center and removed the charge for the candy from my bill. On the third day of my stay I returned to my suite at 4pm to discover that it hadn't been cleaned. I had to call down to Housekeeping and have someone sent up. I left the room at 8am and didn't have a 'Privacy' tag on my door. There was no reason or excuse given for the room not being cleaned. On the Fourth day, I returned to my room to discover torn linen on my bed. No big deal, as it was clean, which was the most important thing. However, in a 5 Star resort like the Palazzo, you should not have to see torn linen on your bed. It was clearly visible to me, so Housekeeping should have spotted it. In summary, the Palazzo is a beautiful hotel that aspires to offer the very best on the Strip. The rooms and general decor of the hotel is of an exceptional quality. However, the quality of service in some areas, as well as attention to detail is still lacking. There are definite areas for improvement, as it's the little details that can sometimes make or break a visit. Overall I've very much enjoyed my stay and would gladly return. However, a letter will be sent to management to give constructive feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: reuhl925
Reviews.Content: Wow! This hotel was gorgeous! The staff were very friendly checking in. The room was amazing. You have a bathroom with a make up area (with a conair bright light mirror), bathroom scales, 2 sinks, a shower, a big tub, seperate toilet, bath robes, TV and lots of cool toiletries! Then there is the bedroom, large king bed, large flat screen tv, chairs, wardrobes etc! Then a lounge with table, coffee table, corner sofa, another TV with a DVD player (bring some dvds with you!). We had an awesome stay and would definately stay here again. The curtains were automatic which I thought was very cool, not sure if I am allowed to post links but if you put my username in youtube you will find a video of the curtains in action!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish our stay was longer”
Reviews.Author: cdar
Reviews.Content: Wow! The rooms are beautiful; you do see wear and tear; and who hasn't had something new scratched or damaged in your own home. The smell piped in reminds me of fresh rain and while it did seem a little much at first we got use to it quickly. Something to keep in mind if you have a sensitivity. The rooms have been described well by other reviewers; one surprise to me was the lack of a hairdryer; there's a bathroom scale; lighted make up mirror that you can move to see the back of you. The closet is quite small if you want to hang things and stash your suitcases. Our view on the 36th floor was of the Wynn, golf course and pools which was very relaxing to look at. The location is very convenient to the Fashion Show Mall and I would say it is quieter; didn't notice the loud, drink in hand, fun loving people at this end of the strip. The Jersey Boys were amazing; a very talented cast. We shared the inside gondola ride with another couple; our gondolier was very entertaining and a talented singer as well; not all sing. The inside ride is to going to look the same whether you take it early in the day or late. We had all our meals at the hotel, excellent service everywhere. The prices are high; but this is a very high end hotel. I noticed a small foodcourt in the Venetian side. The Grand Lux had reasonable prices; except for coffee $3.75 seemed high (it was good but not a fancy Starbuck's one). The portions were generous; I was disappointed in the very boring hash browns at breakfast and the lack of fresh fruit on the menu. Our other meals were early suppers in the lounges. At Lavo we had wine ($14 a glass) and pizza; excellent. At Moreles the restaurant did not open until 5pm; so we opted for incredible burgers in the lounge ($16 each). We didn't have time to use the pools but we did go down and pick up a coffee (eek $4.00) and wandered about the pools before we checked out. They looked lovely and the hot tub area was very inviting. The turn down service left chocolates and replaced the used vanity towerls. Both check in and out had no line ups; but I did notice at certain times when we walked by that there were lines. On check out they arranged our boarding passes. When I went to pick up my $25 casino card that came with our package; you do have to sign up for the GRazie club to get it. The women noticed my birthday and presented me with a gift! We are not gamblers; but had great fun at the one cent slots (if you play all the lines at one cent it costs less than .25 for each pull and I played for a couple of hours before I lost my $25). It took some time before the cocktail waitress came by; but she did return quickly on the second round. To be honest I barely heard her ask if anyone wanted drinks; so I may have easily missed her going by earlier. The cab from the airport was $30 to the hotel; and $20 on the return which made me wonder if the first cab took his own way. About $14 each way to the downtown factory outlets. The outlet info center will try to sell you a $5 coupon book; be sure to take a good look, as not all the stores offer savings; or you may have to spend $100 to receive 10%off at some stores. If you need teenaged gifts - Armani Exchange has good prices on t-shirts. I've been spoiled by the Palazzo and might find it hard to stay elsewhere. It had been a toss up between the Bellagio and Palazzo; the Palazzo had amazing rates which is why I initially chose it; I now know I made the right choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay at The Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: amblush
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Palazzo November 17-19th to celebrate our anniversary. We were second in line at check-in when we arrived at about 3:30 pm. We were informed that they no longer had our room type which was a Luxury Suite so we were assigned a Bella Suite instead. A $100 incidentals hold was put on our credit card. You have the choice of either giving a cash deposit of $100 or allowing a credit card hold. The hold was removed upon check-out since we didn't charge anything to our room. We were given a room on the 33rd floor with a view of the Wynn and part of Las Vegas Blvd. (see photos). Our room had a flat screen t.v., two comfortable queen beds and an alarm clock radio in the bedroom area and an iron w/ironing board in the closet. In the lviing room area we had a sectional couch, coffee table, dinette table w/3 chairs, desk w/printer/fax/internet access, mini bar, flat screen t.v. and remote controlled drapes/shade. You may request a mini-refrigerator and one will be delivered to your room shortly after check-in. The bathroom had a glass enclosed shower, large tub, two sinks, a vanity and separate room w/door for the toilet. The toiletries were Lemon Verbena Scented Agraria of San Francisco and included: bath salts, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bath & shower gel, bar soap, facial soap and loofah. Also provided was a small travel kit which included: a sewing kit, hair band, nail file, cuticle pusher, make-up pads and a shower cap.Two plush robes were provided and are available for purchase with The Palazzo logo through guest services. We tipped housekeeping $5/day and were provided with extra towels and toiletries. At night the turn down service puts nice chocolates on the beds. The Palazzo is a beautiful property and it's very convenient to navigate. The casino is very open and has a relaxing decor. Just around the corner from the guest elevators is a coffee shop called The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf. A large latte is about $5. If you go a bit further around the corner from the guest room elevators you'll arrive at the parking garage elevators. Parking is abundant in the garage. The Palazzo and Venetian both pump a fragrance into their casinos to (I assume) mask the smell of cigarette smoke. The fragrance was a little off putting this time but after about 10 minutes we didn't notice it anymore. There was no fragrance at all in our room. Right off of the casino floor is a casual restaurant called The Grand Lux with pretty good food. Dinner entrees ran about $14.99 to $25.99 and cocktails were $11-$14. The Jersey Boys theater is right around the corner from The Grand Lux. We saw Jersey Boys on a Tuesday night and loved it. Be aware that profanity is used in this show quite a bit in the beginning. They call it authentic New Jersey language. We had seats in the mezzanine, section 10, row BB. A railing and handicapped seats blocked my view of the entire right side of the stage. We politely asked to be moved and were given seats in a better area with a perfect view. This show is wonderful and the singing is perfect! To access The Venetian you have three routes to choose from. The first is through the lobby towards the Sands Expo and keep to the right when you get near The Blue Man Group ticket counter. This will take you directly into The Venetian's casino. The second route is through Grand Canal Shoppes. Take the escalator right off of The Palazzo casino floor up to the Grand Canal Shoppes and follow it around. The third is to exit The Palazzo via the lobby onto Las Vegas Blvd and walk down to The Venetian. Pedestrian bridges will lead you across to The Wynn and another crosses from The Wynn over to Fashion Show Mall. To cross over to Treasure Island or The Mirage you can access the pedestrian bridge that is in front of The Venetian. Our stay was very relaxing and enjoyable. The Palazzo is clean and elegant. Every employee that we came into contact with was very polite and accomodating. We have also stayed at The Venetian which was a wonderful experience but we now prefer The Palazzo. I'd be happy to answer any questions reguarding our stay here so please feel free to pm me. I have more photos of the room and view available on my profile.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: rhoosey
Reviews.Content: Had a fab time at the Palazzo. Check-in very smooth and we had a great room on the 45th floor overlooking the Wynn and the golf course. Room was not what I would call clean though, in fact I went around with a towel dusting when I got to the room! corners obviously not cleaned. We only had turndown once during the six nights we were there which I think was pretty bad. But other than that we had no problems with the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: alex_in_chicago
Reviews.Content: Like everything in the world, there are good and bad. Let's get the negatives out of the way. 1. For me, the smell is absolutely UNNECESSARY. It is overwhelming and not charming at all. The fragrance is too strong and permeates everything in the hotel, including all your clothes. 2. Casino floor is dimly lit. Causing me to fall asleep even on a good shoe. The yellow lighting is good for the bedroom, not for a casino floor. Coffee please! 3. No poker room. 4. It seems that for every 2 or 3 really friendly staff you find on the casino floor or the hotel desk, you get 1 that is just a jerk. Maybe it is still a new place and need to weed out those jerks, but definitely not as friendly of a place as the Wynn (all smiles and friendly conversations). Need to up a notch there. Positives: 1. Best room I have ever stayed. 3 plasmas in the suite. 2. Close to Wynn and connected to Venetian. For the same amount of money, you should stay at the Venetian. Yes, you won't get the plasma but you can get a large suite and avoid the "fragrance". The smell is not classy. I would pay money to avoid it. So please, save some money there and stop pumping that crap into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTN
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 night stay, F,S & S - college friends reunion. Got in noon (10 mins. checkin)& rooms not ready, tried to talk us into View upgrade($45), but waited until 3 (recheckin 15 mins.) We were suppose to get connecting & adjoining and rooms weren't, so staff upgraded us to View to get this. I did notice smell. Some areas worst than others, but wasn't overpowered by it. Probable trying to cover up smoke in casino. All staff we encountered were nice. Would have better if coffee pot in room. Great coffee shop at Casino level by room elevators. Enjoyed outdoor bar at Lavo each night. Take advantage of free drink tickets. Grand Lux good food & value. Dos Caminos food & drinks good, but over priced. Overall nice property; rooms, pool & location. It is best to go thru Venetian Casino to get to south Strip. Thru Palazzo to north strip.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously understaffed”
Reviews.Author: TravelgirlWyoming
Reviews.Content: I just came back from 4 nights at the Palazzo Hotel. Granted the rooms, sorry, suites are awesome. Spacious and comfortable. BUT....the service there really lacks. I stayed at the Wynn and the Bellagio on previous visits to Vegas and they got it down. At the Palazzo though there were long lines no matter what you wanted to do or take care of. Check in (25 Minutes), waiting for your car to be pulled up to go to dinner (30 minutes), getting a drink in the casino (30 minutes) getting your luggage picked up for check-out (over an hour!!! They quoted me 20 minutes when I called!) then 20 minutes to check-out and another 20 minutes to pull up my car. Almost 2 hours to check out of the hotel. Worst of all: nobody cared. I was really late to pick up a co-worker from the airport and I asked the valet to please rush my car after waiting for over an hour for a bellman but the guy just couldn't have cared less. And that was the feeling throughout the hotel. A nice touch would have been a coffee maker in the room so you don't have to stand in line at the coffee shops in the casino first thing in the morning. And 2 nights no turn down service. I know that is not the most important service but for $275 a night i would be nice to have some chocolate on your pillow. I expected more!

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you can stand the smell”
Reviews.Author: StanYork
Reviews.Content: Great property except the smell. The Palazzo pumps their "signature fragrance" though the ventilation system throughout the lobby, casino, and shopping areas. The smell was overwhelming to me and my wife to the point where we simply went from our room to the street. We did not gamble, dine, or shop at the hotel because the smell of this pumped-in fragrance. I understand that many of the LV hotels are using fragrance now. It may be that the system at the Palazzo was malfunctioning and putting too much fragrance into to air during our stay. I won't be back until they stop this practice. On the plus side, the rooms were great. The building is world-class. Would have given a 5 star review except for the smell.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: chichiToronto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels like Bellagio, Wynn, Venetian, Palms but there was no place in PALAZZO!!! It was the best hotel experience in my life! I love you Palazzo! and looking forward to going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: MSPtourist
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Stayed in a luxury suite. It was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at in LV. A sunken living room with a sectional sofa, two big flat screen tv's in the living area, another flat screen in the bathroom, remote controlled window coverings, and incredible views from the suites. The hotel has a nice casino, lots of restaurants, a mall and it's connected by an easy walk to the Venetian. Great location, fabulous room and the staff is so friendly and helpful. I won't stay anywhere else next time I'm in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 4 night stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: u2tuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo for four nights with my boyfriend in August, 2008 – this was the fourth time we traveled to Las Vegas. We had stayed in a renovated Venetian room the year before and found the Palazzo rooms were set up basically the same. We enjoyed the size of the room – more than adequate space for two adults – king bed with chair and bench – a step down to the living room area with L-shaped couch, coffee table, desk with chair and round “dining” table with 3 chairs. Our room was on the 9th floor and overlooked the pool complex and directly across from TI. The shower head and water pressure in the shower were fantastic – nothing feels better on your weary muscles after walking the strip and gambling for hours. We ordered room service breakfast every morning and the quality of food and promptness of delivering the order was exceptional. Our room was cleaned adequately each day. Security guards were posted at the guest elevator banks throughout the day and night and required a visual of your room key before granting access. We never had a problem with elevator traffic. The Palazzo casino is much smaller than the Venetian, but we found it was an extremely short walk between the Palazzo and Venetian casinos, so we viewed both as one big casino. We also preferred Venetian pools to the Palazzo pools since we prefer sun while we went to the pool (Palazzo pools were shaded by the building’s shadow during the morning hours). There was a bit of construction in front of the Palazzo/Venetian which required walking under scaffolding to get to the Mirage/TI from street level, but that was a temporary annoyance. We’ll definitely be staying at the Palazzo on our next trip. I hope others enjoy their time there as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo has great suites!”
Reviews.Author: JoeBruin1
Reviews.Content: Even the smallest suite at the Palazzo was great. It is not as open as the rooms in the Wynn Hotel, its next door neighbor. However, the Palazzo suite has its own living room area complete with a sectional couch. There was room for at least 6 people to hang out in the room. The view is not as great as the Wynn, but the room we got was directly in front of the Treasure Island Hotel. The view of the pirate show was cool, but becomes a bit old after the 4th time. It was also great that the room had two HD TVs. Great if you want to hang out at the couch or be a bit lazy and want to watch TV in bed. The bathroom was spacious, but not as large as the Wynn's bathroom (regular rooms). The casino floor seems to have a sent piped in though the ventilation system. It's not very strong, but you will notice it when you enter the casino. Overall the Palazzo is a great hotel, but a bit pricey. I would not suggest it if you are on a budget and just want a place to sleep in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but lots of glitches on our stay”
Reviews.Author: mberg6417
Reviews.Content: Overall, I think the Palazzo is a very nice hotel. We stayed there for six days at the end of October 2008 and we enjoyed much of our stay. We did have a number of problems which were VERY annoying at the beginning of our stay which really set the tone for the rest of it unfortunately. To begin with, we booked the "concierge level" suite, which is advertised as "free breakfast, afternoon hors d'eouvres, and evening cocktails and appetizers every day. More on this in a minute. When you check in for a concierge level suite, you are supposed to go to the 23rd floor and check in so you don't habve to wait in the very long lines in the main lobby. We called ahead with our travel itinerary and were told to go to the 23rd floor until 11pm. We arrived at 10:30 and had to cross a VERY smoky (yet allegedly "smoke-free corridor" across the entie casino floor to get to the guest suite elevators. We were also carying a rather heavy infant car-seat. We went to the 23rd floor which was locked up tight and we called from a house phone to be told to return to the front desk to check in. So we had to backtrack the entir smoky way with our 7-month old infant in a heavy car-seat and then wait in line at the main desk. When we checked in, the clerk asked if we wanted the xcheck left open so we could charge things to the room. We said yes. We ordered a turkey sandwich and botle of water from room service when we got to the room for a grand total of $41 dollars with tip. When we ordered, they said we weren't approved for room charges. So they transferred me to the front desk to clear it up. Then they transferred me back tot he room service people and they took the order. The waiter arrived and he said we had to pay cash since we were not approved. ?!?! What did we just go through then?! The next day we requested a tea-kettle "hot-pot" to boil water. It took them 4 hours and three phone calls to deliver it. We also had a minor spill on the bed duvet so we called housekeeping to have a replacement delivered. They took 6 hours and 4 phone calls to deliver it...even then it was because I caught a housekeeper in the hallway and she found us a new duvet. KEEP IN MIND, this is a "concierge level" suite that is supposed to have the BEST service the Palazzo can offer. We were not impressed..the service was no better, and in fact probably worse, than a typical hotel! All this being said, the rooms are spacious and nice, although as some people have commented, the A/C is quite loud. And for some unknown reason, ours apparently sucked air in from the kitchen vents since our room smelled like whatever meal they were cooking (eggs in the am, onions in the pm). There are a lot of really nice (and expensive) restaurants in the Palazzo. The Grand Lux is one of the more reasonable and keeping with their cheesecak factory roots, has a huge menu. We didn't see any of the Palazzo shows, but the Blue Man group is there and everyone raved about the show. We saw Cirque De Soliel "Ka" at the MGM and it was a spectacular show. There is a burger place across the beneath the Capital Grille that has great food at reasonable prices called "Stripburger". One last thing, the entry and exit from the Palazzo is kind of out of the way and in one case a real pain because you have to go up and down several escalators just to get across the street...which puts you a full block past the Palazzo. Everyone usually goes back through the Venetian hallway to exit at their doors.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo got it right.....”
Reviews.Author: execnova
Reviews.Content: It is a matter of taste, but to me, the Palazzo accomplishes an elegance and intimacy that the Wynn, Venetian and Bellagio do not. Beautiful public areas and easily the most logical floorplan of the above resorts. You just feel at home there! Service was cordial and prompt and housekeeping was excellent. I had a room on the 37th floor with a view of the Wynn pools, golf course and mountains. The room was beautiful (the gold velour does work - adds warmth to the room) and so comfortable - looked exactly as the hotel website displays. I was in Vegas for a wedding which was held at the Bellagio and spent considerable time at the Wynn and Venetian. While they too are magnificent properties, I was ready to go back to the Palazzo. I have no idea what some of the reviewers were talking about re: civet smell. This hotel has the freshest environment and I noticed nothing unusual "in the air". It also must have the most unique location - connected to the Venetian and Wynn and with the Mirage and TI across the street, you are very self contained. The casino was very crowded and the slots were no better or worse than other hotels, but as half the casino is smoke free, a much nicer environment than the others. Pools and spa were wonderful. Since the wedding had an agenda, the only restaurant I experienced was Grand Luxe Cafe and the food was great. I heard several people rave about Cut. If you want over the top, this is not the hotel for you. If you want luxury and comfort in good taste as your home base, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The Amazing Palazzo Hotel/Casino in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: fourseasonsOhio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo for a convention meeting. I've attended many conferences nationwide and the Palazzo definitely ranks as the best experience! I stayed in one of the Luxury suite room. As soon as you open the door to the room, there is the immediate "wow" factor. The picture on the website does not do it any justice. The suite is meticulously decorated. The king size bed is amazingly spacious and comfortable. The 3 LCD television is such a luxurious experience. The room is well equipped with its own fax macine that allowed me to print out my boarding passes in my own room. The sitting area is amazing with its pull out bed (though we never used it). Your partner can work on the computer or watch one of the 3 TV without really interupting the late risers. The bathroom is incredible! With its closed-off toilet, there is a lot of room to get ready. The bathroom is spacious enough to accomodate a vanity table/chair. A separate shower with its glass enclosure and body jets really brings the luxury to high level. The most amazing thing is the remote control blinds. Once closed, the room is pitched black and extremely quiet. This room is really a great price at $270/night because it can easily and comfortably room 4 people. The attached shops have everything for everyone, including restaurants. Attached to the Venetian Casino and shops, there's something to do.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: sooze06
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at Palazzo in a luxury suite. The room was very large- had a king bed area, and then a few steps down, there was a living area. The bathroom was not as luxurious as we anticipated. The water did not drain properly in the shower. We were standing in water while showering. The shower head had no options (ie: no different sprays, no hand held). The mirror had missing parts. The light switch in the bathroom was broken. Having a separate room for the toilet was nice, but the light in there was very dim, and there was no trash can in there. In the living area, the sofa was very stained and the drawers in the desk did not close. The ventilation system was louder than we would have liked and the remotes for the 2 large flat screen TVs were exceedingly slow to go from one channel to the next. This was not what we expected from a billion dollar, less than 1 year old, luxury hotel. The morning after our first night, we brought these issues to the attention of the front desk. They offered to have maintenance look at the shower, or provide us with another room. We had no guarantee that another room's shower would drain any better (that was our major complaint), so we checked out after the first night. Maybe the bugs still have to be worked out. I would not recommend this hotel at this point in time. They do have a great restaurant- The Grand Lux Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “beatiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: banaSydney
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, dont let anyone else tell you differently. The rooms are JUST BEAUTIFUL, loved having the step down loung area, dining table and work desk. 2 Big Flat screen TV's, 1 in front of the bed and one in the lounge area AND THEN if you cant do without TV, also a flat screen in the bathroom. The bed is lovely and the bathroom is lovely. Very clean, all in great working order, cant say a bad word about it. The pools are great, just find one that is not soooo warm. It was great being able to walk through to Venetian as well, love the shops there. The Grand Cafe is great, very good value meals. Had breakfasts some lunches and some dinners there, again, very reasonable. Unlike the healthy cafe, near the pool, quite pricy as opposed to the grand cafe. We were with a friend and all of us just loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Great Room and Great Service at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Soozeequeue
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay in Vegas in nearly 20 years and chose to stay in a a king suite in the Palazzo, with concierge service. We were there for 5 nights. The property and the staff were wonderful. I agree with what most of the other posters have said - we were very warmly welcomed , and the hotel is very tastefully done and understated (understated by Vegas standards, mind you, anywhere else it would be a little over the top!). We paid extra for staying in a concierge room (although we got a reasonably good deal) and really enjoyed all the little extras - limo service to and from the airport, got our coffee and breakfast there every day and brought it back to the room, etc, but especially the service we recieved from their concierge floor staff - no line ups and they booked shows, restaurants, and golf for us and gave us great advice. Although the rooms are billed as suites they are really one big room, with a step-down to a living area with a very comfortable sectional, dining table, desk and large tv. Still, I would like it better if this area was actually divided from the bedroom - For instance two people can't watch two different tv shows as the tvs are just a few meters from one another, or one person can't read or sleep while the other is watching tv without being disturbed. A little fridge space would have been nice as well. Still it was a nice spot for entertaining friends, as we did one afternoon. And yes, the Jersey Boys musak in the elevator does get to you after a while - although we started making jokes about it after the 2nd day. We ate at Delmonico's - Emeril's Steakhouse, which is actually in the Venetian, and it was absolutely terrific and the service was top notch. We found the location to be a very convenient one for us. I liked the proximity to the mall.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious hotel, fine dining and upscale shopping on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: TD60
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas and what a beautiful hotel the Palazzo is! The lobby is gorgeous with indoor access to the hotel’s adjoining sister property - The Venetian. Inside there are two casinos and abundant restaurants, bars, boutiques and the Grand Canal Shoppes. I was expecting a property this size (50 stories and over 3,000 rooms) to be completely impersonal, but the front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff were extremely pleasant and efficient. Room: I was travelling alone on business and booked a Luxury Suite for $119/night + tax for my Tuesday night stay. The suite was approximately 700 square feet with a king-sized bed, sunken living room with dining area, 3 flat-screen LCD TVs, a large marble bathroom with a soaking tub and separate glass shower and nice bath amenities. My room (#24911) overlooked the Wynn Hotel and Casino. I found the atmosphere of the room to be quiet and sumptuous, in stark contrast to the glitz and glitter of the Las Vegas Strip. Dining: There are about 40 restaurants to choose from in the combined Palazzo/Venetian but I only had the opportunity to dine in two of them. I had dinner at B&B Ristorante (one of Chef Mario Batali’s many ventures). I sat at the bar and ordered the traditional tasting menu paired with a house Barbera. The meal was solidly good and the extensive wine list was quite impressive with several pages of Barolo and Barbaresco offered. The next morning I had breakfast at Bouchon (by Chef Thomas Keller of French Laundry and Per Se fame). I ordered the breakfast specials; a fresh crab meat omelet and strawberry croissant with coffee and orange juice. It was a very good and memorable breakfast. Overall, The Palazzo is a very luxurious hotel with fine dining and upscale shopping in a great location on the Las Vegas Strip. The Luxury Suites are an AMAZING value at under $120/night and I’d definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: lms0001
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at the Palazzo Las Vegas. Everything about it was exceptional. Booked the Jersey Boys package and received a decent rate and excellent seats to an outstanding show. The room, facility and service were also superior. I'm normally ready to come home after about a day and a half in Vegas, but not this time.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Lacks Service”
Reviews.Author: Naptown2
Reviews.Content: Very disapponted with the overall service. Restaurants Carnevino and Lavo servers were arrogant, rude, and just bad at their profession. Waited 45 minutes for drinks at pool. Waitress never came to BlackJack table where I was gambling for one hour. Do yourself a favor and stay at another hotel. I am a frequent visitor to Vegas and have never experienced service as bad as at The Palazzo

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ht137
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional addition to the Venetian. It is connected thru an interior corridor that can be quite a trek after a long night. Palazzo is a lot quieter and more refined than Venetian. Heavily traffic areas are smoke-free. 40/40 club (now the palazzo sportsbook) is an upscale must see venue. Casino is more intimate and more laid back than the always busy Venetian. Suites are nearly identical with the slight variation on the decor. Service is 5 star all the way. Lavo (sister club to Tao) recently opened and will definitely be on my list to check out next time. Don't be surprised if you don't want to leave the hotel once you get there. Only negative would be the valet service. Have always waited more than 10 minutes to retrieve my car. Otherwise, excellent throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping a little”
Reviews.Author: VegasfanHouston
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Palazzo. The rooms are great and parking is the most convenient of any strip hotel (under the casino and the garage elevators open near the room elevators). All of Vegas is cutting back and there were signs of it at the Palazzo. In the room, the window sheers, which rise and lower, were stuck in the up position. The bulb was out on a bedside lamp. In the bathroom, the amenities box contained one makeup pad and three Q-tips. The previous guest probably took everything else and it was not checked. These are all minor, but everything was just right on our two prior visits. In the casino, it was common to find a slot machine with a collection of dirty ashtrays and used drinking glasses piled on it as users of neighboring machines moved them over. These stayed in place for hours, which makes me think the staff in the casino has been cut as well. It doesn't seem possible, but I think the slots were even tighter than they used to be. It's a great place to stay and dine (bring lots of money), but not a great place to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “palazzo is faboo!”
Reviews.Author: missacolia
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is so fun, so nice, very cool and worth the little bit extra to stay in. The rooms are EXACTLY like the rooms at the Venetian, so thats nothing new, but the hotel is really fun and pretty. I would definitely stay here again. Also, the pool is awesome! So great! Not too big, lots of chairs and chairs in the water. You can go to the Venetian pool, too. They are connected. Lavo is a fun place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: MarriedinVegas95
Reviews.Content: We felt pampered and appreciated from the moment we arrived at the hotel. Friendly doormen and luggage handlers greeted us and welcomed us to the Palazzo. Arrived at 7:00am on Monday morning and promptly received a room with a veiw of Treasure Island, Mirage, Trump and the mountains, and the beautiful pool. We were in our room by 7:15am. We stayed for 4 nights and could not have been happier with the accomodations. Rooms: The rooms are outstanding. Comfortable beds, plenty of room for our clothes. spacious and well designed. Flat screen TV's at the foot of the bed and downstairs. It took us some time to really take all of the luxurious surrounding in. Two steps down from the bed is a living space. Another flat screen tv, mini bar (the gentleman at the reservation desk warned us that if you remove it you own it), snacks, safe. A business center...desk, phone, wireless, printer, fax machine, copy machine. A Table with 4 chairs and a L shaped couch that pulls out into another queen sized bed. The room was so inviting that we did something we have never done befroe in Vegas. Relaxed IN our room with drinks before heading out to the strip. Remote controlled drapes and roman shade. Floor to ceiling windows that were room width. USA Today newspaper at the door each morning, a simple thing but I love my paper at the pool in the morning. Bathroom: The bathroom was huge... Black marble sinks and counters. Seperate "closet" for the toilet. double sink with all the amentities, soap, shampoo, conditioner, loofa, hand soap, sewing kit. Flat screen TV above the sinks and angled towards the bath. Vanity with a pull out stool and make up mirror. Glass shower with large shower head, and two massage showers on the wall. Large bathtub. Mirrors everywhere. Robes and Slippers at the ready. The slippers are yours to keep, the robes are $85.00. Restaurants: Every morning we ate breakfast at the Grand Lux Cafe. AAAA+++ OUTSTANDING food and service. We had the express breakfast each morning. This is a mini buffet with made to order omlets, waffles, bagels and bread, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, ham and potatoes., cereal, oatmeal, assorted fresh pastries. coffe and juice included for $15.50. I asked for a coffe to go and my wife a juice to go each morning and we were never charged for the to go drinks. I know it is a simple thing, but this is the kind of service that makes you feel appreciated. Plus I love my coffee with my paper at the pool in the morning. This restaurant is a part of the Cheese Cake Factory chain and please do youself a favor and order a piece of cheese cake. WOW> We did not make time to eat elsewhere on the property, but I have heard great reviews for Delmonico Steak House. Pools: Large open pool decks. Has one large pool, and numerous smaller pools. 4 hot tubs spread throughout. The thing we really liked is that the pools were designed so that the loungers could be put right into the water. small side table also. drink service right in the water. How relaxing and wonderful. Staff came around frequently offering drinks, cold towels, cucumbers for your eyes, orange wedges. Once again pampered like never before. Drinks averaged around $12.00 for 16 oz. of your favorite mixed libations. The atmosphere was very relaxing and sophisticated, but not pretentious at all. 40 - 50 something crowd. The ONLY negative is that the sun does not hit the entire pool area until around 11:30am. But there is plenty of sunshine to be had the pool nearest to the walkway to the Venetian pool deck. We talked to a bunch of folks from the Venetian that were over on the Palazzo side, because they said our side was much nicer. You do have access to both properties. Spa: My wife used the Canyon Ranch Spa for a massage and pedicure. She was extremely pleased. Cudos to Shelly D. She was so pleased that she said she would come back here no matter where we stayed on the strip. Casino: Get your players club card. We received our four nights comped. We are not by any stretch of the imagination high rollers. I really like the layout of the casino floor. It is very spacious and has high ceilings, with the machines spread a good distance apart. Lots of room. Great drink service and the machines were kept clean. Friendly floor staff. Wish we could say we got rich, but we played a long time and that's all we ever ask for. We have stayed at numerous properties on the strip. Sorry Mandaly Bay, but we have a new #1 in our opinion. One suggestion I do have and it is my only negative for the property. The small sundries shop by the guest elevators is WAY over priced. $38.00 for a bottle of vodka, $9.00 for a small box of bandaids. I know you pay for convenience but come on. Go across to the fashion mall and go to the Vegas 123 store and the same stuff is half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo NOT an "upscale" experience”
Reviews.Author: wanderingrl
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a room on the concierge level through the hotel website. We have traveled worldwide, and had many upscale experiences. This was NOT one of them! The room itself was nice. It was large, but dark. We arrived after 11 hours of travel at 11:00pm. Our luggage was lost (not the hotel's fault, the airline's - but it added to our frusteration). We were picked up by a private car as had been included with our rate, but were then charged for the ride because the driver said the hotel did not pay him ar have an agreement to do so with him. We asked at the concierge desk in the lobby, and were told to go to the 23rd floor to the concierge check in desk for our room. We trudged through a massive lobby, the casino, and up the elevator to the 23rd floor to find the concierge closed. Apparently it does at 10:00pm, but the lobby concierge did not know this. We returned to the lobby to check in, and were not given even a slight appology. We went to our room , and then wanted to get something to eat. Again, we asked the lobby concierge, and she assured us that several restaurants were available between the Palazzo and the Venetian. We again walked through the casino to the back and to the walkway between the hotels. We checked at each of the restaurants, and they all had their last seating at 10:00pm. We ended up eating apps at a bar in the casino, which turned out to be the highlight of our day. We wouldn't have cared if that was all that was open, but did not appreciate being sent all over the place to find something - COMPLETE LACK OF SERVICE. As far as the casino goes, only ONCE was I asked if I wanted a drink. I played about 3 hours total, but that is outrageous. The next day, our room was NEVER CLEANED!!! We went out for the day, and returned at 5:00pm. The room was still uncleaned. We called the concierge(on the concierge level - 23rd floor), and he assured us he would speak to housekeeping and have it cleaned after we dressed and left for the evening. When we came back at midnight, the room was STILL not clean. Also, the concierge offered to send us to a show in the "hotel's car", but then again the driver charged us for it when it was supposed to be included. The hotel took $75.00 off a SEVERAL hundred dollar bill. The concierge contacted us via email. Nice gesture, but THERE IS NOT ANY WAY I WOULD EVER STAY THERE AGAIN! This hotel does not know what service is. We are not difficult travelers, but there are basics the Palazzo was lacking (like a clean room!). If you pay for a level of service, you expect it. We chose to stay there because of it, and could have stayed elsewhere. Next time we will.

Reviews.Title: “In the camp that loves this property”
Reviews.Author: RamblinHoosier
Reviews.Content: Things I would add to what has already been said: 1) Room is a "suite" but is one long room with seperate bed and sitting areas but no door/wall between them. 2) Only coffee shop I could find open yet was next to Grand Lux - AM line quite long. 3) If you use the master light switch at night have to turn it back on to use bathroom lights in middle of the night and all lights left on come back on - turn lights off individually and don't use master switch at night. 4) Ice machines are readily available. 5) Free AM paper, even on weekend. 6) Pools nicely heated. 7) Ate at Bouchon, Woo and Carnevino and didn't have one dish that wasn't great. Pizza crust at Solaro should have been crispier 8) Constant "Jersey Boys" music in elevators must be stopped before it destroys all civilization as we know it. 9) Would go back in a blink

Reviews.Title: “Not as overwhelming as other hotels...”
Reviews.Author: FeWenInRom
Reviews.Content: I will try to keep this as straight to the point- It is a higher end, beautiful hotel with big, beautiful guest suites. It is not as overwhelming as Caesars or the Venetian. It is smaller and refined when it comes to sculptures and such. Pros: Guest suites are big/new, small enough of a hotel that you will not get lost easily; friendly staff for the most part; easy connections to Fashion Show, Wynn, Venetian. Cons: The pool setup is not the best I have seen. They have a setup similar to Caesars- a large main pool and a few smaller pool areas and whirlpools. The whole pool area, including the pools, are crowded. They place the lounge chairs in the opposite ends of the pools which creates a small area for people to swim. There are no baskets to place your used towels in, not enough Staff for drink orders, no umbrellas and limited trash barrels. The one thing I would advise to the Palazzo folks is to rethink the pool setup. Other then that, it is a great place with fantastic restaraunts/shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, New, Clean Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Lark123
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Palazzo for a conference. Lucky enough to have a king suite with breathtaking views of the mountains and city lights. Room was spacious and well laid out with plenty of desk and working space as well as a large sofa and living area. Was surprised to have a printer right in the room, very handy. Well laid-out and large bathroom, great toiletries. Comfy robes and slippers. The hotel has been open only 10 months and the room was already showing some wear and tear (cracked mirror), but that's typical of Las Vegas. All hotel and casino workers were pleasant and helpful. No problems or delays with checking in. Some parts of the casino are smoke-free, which meant you were not covered in a haze of smoke every time you walked through the casino to get to the room elevators, which was nice. Pool area is absolutely gorgeous, not at all crowded in Oct. but imagine a different story in hotter months (though it was plenty warm to sunbathe and swim while we were there). Two downsides to the room - no coffee maker (fairly miserable to have to wait for coffee until you are ready to go down to the lobby when you're used to waking up to a pot brewing) and scratchy sheets on the bed. Otherwise a great place to stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddyb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only opened this year and it shows. Plenty of fine restaurants, great pool area and very friendly staff all over the hotel/casino. No hesitation in staying here again. Also the home of the best show in town----"The Jersey Boys"

Reviews.Title: “Surprising...Give Wynn a run for his money”
Reviews.Author: astoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on Concierge level. note: check-in for this level is 23rd floor, accessible from all elevator banks. Rooms are better than Wynn resort rooms and even tower rooms. Concierge lounge is huge, 5 large rooms, staff was amzing. Saw Jersey boys....Twice...it is that good. Food. Mainland....not good Table 10...amazing Woo....average Grand Lux...amazing Casino floor is not crowded with slots, you have room to move, good for people in wheelchairs (like MB). Close to Wynn, Mirage and TI...connected to venetian via shops, walkway. until Encore opens, this will be our new "home" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly best hotel I have staed in”
Reviews.Author: Claypole
Reviews.Content: I am lucky enough to have stayed in some lovely hotels across the world but the Palazzo is easily a top contender. My fiance booked this as a surprise for my 30th and I did not know where we were staying until arrival. Coming into the lobby was beautiful and check in was easy and very informative about services offered and included. We had a Deluxe King View Suite with Concierge service - meaning access to the 23rd floor lounge with a varied continental breakfast, afternoon tea, canapes in the evening etc etc and an open bar from 5-9pm. Our room was beautiful, even a TV in the bathroom with subtitles for when showering! Bathrrom also has a separate adjoining toilet. As well as standard clzaning service someone would come in of an evening and leave chocolates on the pillow and turn the radio on for when you arrived back. Nice touch. The concierge deskwas always helpful when we were making restaurant reservations and enquiring about excursions, all the staff very polite and friendly. Our room was suite 716 on the 25th floor and overlooked the strip and the Treasure Island hotel. A fantastic view. The casino, as expected, was always buzzing and the Palazzo shops lead through to the Grand Canal Shoppes in the Venetian. We had a couple of hot days so I made brief use of the pool/s (there are 9 of them). I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Oct 8-12 - just OK”
Reviews.Author: Rishiboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel: The first three nights were comped and I had to pay for our last night - Sat which cost me $250. Over all the place was OK - just no "WOW" factor considering it was so new. We spent a lot of time next door at the Venetian too which I think is still nicer. Our room on the 48Th floor had a nice view of the Wynn and the golf course. Food: Very disappointed at most places at both hotels - why does it seem every hotel restaurant has to have "Wolfgang Puck" name associated with it ? He must be the McDonald's of gourmet cuisine. We ate at Dos Caminos, Tao & The Riva. Basically when the place's is so dark you can't see the plate and music's blasting loud don't expect much from the food. In fact not one server on the whole trip even came by to ask if we were actually enjoying the meal. The highlight for me was the Noodle Asia (Venetian) where the Dim Sum's great and affordable. Shows: Saw Blue Man Group at the Venetian and the Jay Leno at the Mirage - both tickets were bought at the Tickets 4 Tonight. Got a question - how do you really know your saving money from this place ? They don't assign you a seat until you head to the box office and you might get a cheaper seat. Clubs: Went to Tao, Lavo, with only the Sat night being really busy. All the clubs had paid girls in the casino's trying to get single girls in to the club's - not a good sign ... Vegas is feeling the effects of the economy but I still love that place. Closing: Get ready to nickeled and dimed but that's expected at a star ... paid $16 for small pot of tea to the room ($8 + $4 delivery + tax & tip). Go elsewhere to eat. Guess the economy is having a affect - on Wed night took half hour to get a drink and I could tell it was not what I ordred ( double JW black with soda)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo Hotel & Casino Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo hotel is terrific! The rooms are fantastic. They are large and very new and clean. There are three plasma televisions in the room. The service is outstanding. And, the Canyon Ranch Spa is brand new and also fantastic. The spa is very easily accessed from the 3rd floor of the hotel. The spa has everything you can imagine. The only downside to the hotel is that the pool is shaded by the tall buildings most of the day. You are allowed to access the pools at the Venetian though. Great place to stay in Las Vegas. I'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo is great....”
Reviews.Author: milemarker0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo from 9/28 - 10/1. Flight from East Coast was a little early arriving (10:30 am) and we got to the Palazzo by 11:00. Check in was a little crowded, even the invited guest check in, but still wasn;t too bad. I still can;t figure out what people are discussing for so long at the check in desk...it took us about 4 minutes top, and we were still out of there before 3 or 4 other people that were already there when we were waved up. Our room was ready and we were assigned a room on the 36th floor, with a partial view of the strip, and 2 pools from the Venetian. Room was great, nice big King bed, nice couch, TV and desk in the sunken living room. Bathroom was big, and had a shower and tub. Would have liked to have seen them put a bench into the shower, but it's still very nice. The Palazzo is very simple but elegent, the casino is relatively small, and just one big room, but I like it that way. I hate getting lost at every corner of a casino. It really doesn't have a theme which I like, unless you count "lots of marble" as a theme. Ate at the Grand Lux several times, and it was always good. A tip I'd give though is that the hightops in the bar area are first come first served, but the wait was not really that long anyway. Loved the pool areas, although the main pool doesn't get sun until after noon. I love the shallow part of the pools that have the loung chairs in them....very refreshing. The economic times are definitely being felt in LV...no real crowds, and all of the locals I talked to were saying it's been really bad.....maybe they'll stop charging rediculous amounts for drinks and food. Another tip, if you just feel like walking around the casino, but don't want to spend $7.00 for a beer, just pop into the gift shops and grab one there...only $3.50 or so, plus you don't need to tip.

Reviews.Title: “A newer Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Jet007
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Venetian before and this was exactly the same setup as the Venetian but with newer and updated decor. There is nothing wrong with the way both are setup, the only thing I did not like with the rooms were that there was only 1 kind of room that had 2 queen beds, all the other's were king size. Check in was a breeze, the lady that was helping us was great, I asked for some changes to our reservations and she was very accomodating with no problems whatsoever. The room itself was like I said before, the same as the Venetian, large suite and gigantic bathroom, LCD TVs everywhere, great view of the strip and those electronicly controlled (by remote) shades. There was an inroom safe that was easy to use, fridge with the usual overpriced beverages and also a fax machine/printer as well. Casino was okay, nothing to write home about, but at least the elevators to the room were easier to find than in the Venetian, it was a straight shot through the casino from the lobby. The hotel was connected to the Venetian and was beside the Wynn and across TI, nice central location and a short walk away from everywhere else. Overall, I would recommend this over the Venetian since it is a newer property. I would go back again and gladly stay at the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo ...Second to None!”
Reviews.Author: poodah329
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo went beyond my expectations! I took my mother there as a retirement gift. We traveled to both Las Vegas and LA! Since Vegas was the first part of the trip, I wanted some place that had it all -- location, luxury and service -- and a place where we would be treated like royalty. We were not dissapointed with The Palazzo! I booked a Concierge Suite with a View and got it at a wonderful rate. (Just a tip -- check the hotel's website every few weeks to see if they lower their rates for the times you are traveling). The view and staff were amazing! Every need and want was met with thoughtfulness and taste. The staff was always sweet and willing to please. The rooms were luxurious and huge! They were always spotless. The beds were so soft. The bathrooms had a wonderful shower and bathtub. Our view was fantastic! To those critics who complain about the "nickle and diming" of this hotel, it is true this is an expensive place, but it is a five star facility so it costs money to stay there. I think for a splurge this is the perfect hotel, if you want more cost efficient options, then this may not be the place for you. I say give The Palazzo a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Beautuful Hotel, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: buddle1
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Vegas and this was by far the most disappointed I've every been with any hotel/casino in Vegas. Vegas is an absolute blast for anyone who hasn't been, but the Palazzo DOES NOT embody the excitement of Vegas. The first room we were given had a terrible smell of old food, we later found some leftovers in the mini bar fridge that had to have been at least a few days old. We asked for another room...they gave us a smoking room. Meanwhile we received no apologies, and an attitude as if we were bothering them with our petty problems. I have no problem paying a premium for a nice hotel room, but I DO expect some customer service from a hotel like the Palazzo. To top it off, we booked a limo through the hotel back to the airport, they "accidentally" gave the limo to someone else, and again, no apologies. This hotel was NO FUN at all, the only bright spots were the Grand Lux restaurant and the spa at the Venetian. If you want to have fun in Vegas, check out a less "luxurious" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: socal818
Reviews.Content: the Palazzo is a nice hotel, however I would stay at the Venetian as it has a nicer atmosphere. For it being so new, I found the room to be less then neat. There was dust on everything, the chairs had stains on them and a few other minor problems. The view from the window was however quite impressive. I do recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Payno
Reviews.Content: I joined my husband following a convention he was attending, in a Palazzo Bella Room. Given the sunken lounge area, the rooms are fairly spacious and decorated in a dark, opulent style which however makes them feel a little gloomy. Comfy beds, luxury well equipped bathroom. Staff were excellent in every way, particularly at the Front desk. Palazzo is a few minutes walk from the Venetian by a walkway, and if visiting again I would choose this hotel rather than the Venetian, where we also stayed with much less satisfaction. Good selection of restaurants within the hotels, and we breakfasted every day at the Grand Lux Cafe where the buffet was excellent at $15.50 inclusive, with a good selection of breakfast choices and with all you can eat, no need to buy lunch later on. As a treat we dined at the Wolfgang Puck Postrio - rather overpriced - don't order the small plates - they are so small as to be ridiculous - too small to share! We paid over $100 for the four tiny plates of antipasti, a pizza and a small fish stew with no other accompaniments, plus a glass of wine and a beer. Recommend the Palazzo over the Venetian (same chain of hotels but just a better experience).

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas, and through our friends at Priceline got a steal on this hotel. And I was blown away. Yes, it's huge (according to wikipedia, the Palazzo is part of the largest hotel and resort complex in the world. But the good news is: it doesn't show. Staff at the check-in desk were friendly and efficient, and I even got coupons with play credit, discount on food, and that sort of stuff, which I though was pretty cool given that I hadn't booked through the hotel itself. Then the rooms, oh pardon my French: suites! They are h-u-g-e, beds are comfortable and the view was stunning (I looked on the swim deck, but could see a bit of the strip as well). All the furniture is brand-spanking-new, so it just adds to the feeling of sumptuous luxury. Bathroom is very spacious, with a separate toilet. Nice touches are the remote controlled curtains and fancy bathroom amenities. One more thing: I really liked the hallways - they curve a little, and are slightly dark - but lovely carpeting. It makes you feel you're heading into an exclusive night club instead of back to your room. I preferred the Palazzo's casino to that of the Venetian - those scarcely clad ladies there give it a cheap feel. But the table staff at the Palazzo were very nice and welcoming - perhaps caused by the fact that the hotel and casino had just opened, so wasn't as busy as in other big casinos. Food is great as well, you're literally spoiled for choice. The pool deck looked awesome, but I didn't venture in. One slight mishap: I had some amazon stuff delivered to the hotel, and they added 'package delivery charges' to my room, without informing me beforehand. They corrected it when I mentioned it, so it was ok. I went to see the Phantom spectacular at the Venetian, and... well... I know and love the original play, and this version left me breathless, but not in a good way. It really makes you feel as if they want to rush you out into the casino as soon as possible, so they're jogging you through the play. But at 50 bucks for a good ticket through the Tix4tonight stall right across the road, no complaints here. In all, if you can get a good rate, it's definitely worth staying at the Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mabz2008
Reviews.Content: So me and herself, decided eventually on the palazzo! What a hotel. Upon check in at 2am (due to delayed flight hate american airways btw) we were greeted by such a fab staff our jaws were permanantly locked in the drop position. We were upgraded to a free double queen room (due to me smoking! good for something!). the room was fab , something ive never experienced before, spoilt is an understatement. The casino, quieter than alot suiter us perfectly, staff were great (strawberry daiquiries all the way hehe) smoke not an issue for her as the air conditioning is unreal, cleaninless unreal, politeness unreal, food fab, price well drink is free once u sit on a machine, grand lux was fantastic for food, portions were huge something we have to get used to as we are from ireland so order small people! taxi service to the point, conceirge were perfect sorted everything includ trips etc..honestly it was the best trip the best hotel the best price maybe im biased now cuz im in love with vegas but the palazo is somewhere i would most definately go back to, well worth the price. I look at some negative reviews and wonder are people complaining for the sake of it.....cant find one thing out of place. GO here best choice...and u can see it from how much it has jumped from the 25th best hotel to the 18th in the space of 3months!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll stick to the Venetian”
Reviews.Author: JaxAnn
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a lot more from this upscale sister version of The Venetian. There are a lot of similarities -- the entrance and lobby are just as grand as the Venetian. All rooms are also all suites, large and very comfortable. The main difference are the staff and the wide range of stores on the premises of the hotel. I felt the staff was not as welcoming and somewhat snobbish. The check-in/desk staff were polite but the service on the phone and from the bell desk was unacceptable -- it took over an hour for our luggage to be delivered to our room. When I called the bell desk, they were short and not helpful in giving us an estimated time of when our bags would arrive. When our luggage finally came, the bell hop was beyond rude and very short. I understand they are busy and that the hot weather makes their job tough but there is no reason to take it out on the hotel guests. Also, there aren't that many convenient stores in the Palazzo for necessities such as water, snacks, aspirin, etc. The hotel is centrally located and very close to the Wynn but the lack of genuine care for their hotel guests is something I can't forget -- save some extra money and be treated right at the Venetian or the Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: vadreamer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Palazzo 9/27 for 3 nights. Arrived around noon and checked in. Room wasn't immediately available, but we only had to wait about an hour before receiving a call to say our suite was ready. We received a courtesy upgrade at check in and had a fabulous view of the strip. It should be noted that the strip view is limited to Trump Towers, the shopping mall, Treasure Island and a portion of the Mirage. But that's o.k., because we had a beautiful view of those properties and the mountains in the distance. At night it was spectacular to just turn off the lights in the room and look at the twinkling lights of Vegas. Our room was located on the 42nd floor. The room was very clean and everything was in good working order. The only negative to the room is that the AC vent is located on the wall where the sofa is so when you are laying on the sofa and the AC comes on, it is pretty noisy. But that's only a small negative. The sofa itself was wonderfully comfortable. We were able to utilize a small shelf in the mini bar for bottled water (two bottles fit) without consequence of disturbing the sensors. The safe was in the cabinet in the living area under the television. It was a good size and easily accommodated my handbag. The televisions were good quality and we had no problems with the satellite signals. They worked perfectly. The bathroom was to die for. Separate toilet room, double sinks, vanity/makeup area, large shower and large, deep tub. Lovely marble everywhere. Again, everything worked perfectly and we had absolutely no complaints or issues with anything. Never used the two terry robes or slippers that were provided, but it was nice that they were there. We found the dining options to be more than adequate. We visited restaurants in both the Palazzo and Venetian, and all were good. The pool at Palazzo doesn't receive sun until later in the afternoon, but if you want to go to the pool in the morning, you can use the pools at Venetian. We preferred the Palazzo casino, but also enjoyed our time at the Venetian also. It's was very easy to travel from one property to the other. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Palazzo and wouldn't hesitate to visit again if our travels take us back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Second year wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Atzela
Reviews.Content: We liked the Palazzo better than the Venetian b/c getting to your room was easy and quick. If you forget something in your room at the Venetian, good luck with that. However, the Venetian has that amazing "Seduction" room spray floating through their whole resport. I liked walking through the casino to get to the rooms. Rooms were very similar to those at the Venetian. Pools were great and service was fantastic. Even the restaurant by the pool was delicious and creative. The beds, towels, robes and slippers were luxury. Loved Morels (restaurant). They have cheese fondue on their menu and its divine. We were treated beautifully by everyone.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK....”
Reviews.Author: RisingSun33333
Reviews.Content: My expectation was very high since it's one the newest hotels on the street. I avoidid Trump Hotel because I heard it was far away from the stip (kindof diagnoally beyond the Fashion Mall towards where Stardust used to be) and there's a train track next to it (therefore noisey). Just because it was built within a year, everything is new. But , besides that, I didn't see any aspect of Palazzo which I'd like to particularly brag about First of all, this hotel is connected to Venetian, but you have to walk all the way to the back of the casino floor of Venetian or towards the end ot Grand Canal Shop, if you choose toget there through Venetian. To me, it's s little bit of walk.. You can go pass Venetian and try to go through to main entrance of the hotel, but all the cars pass in front of you right and left, in and out of the hotel, and I found it very troublesome. The room is pretty cuch equivalent to the ones of Venetian. Semi-suites, But as is often the case, there's no view to enjoy. From my room on te 26th Floor, all I could see was a cheap show going on at Treasure Island going on down there and some mountains out there blocked by Treasure Island and The Trump. The scneting of Palazzo is almost the same as Venetian, but they seemed to add civet to the floral maglonia scent of Venetian.
