CIvet is a fragrance ingredeient coming from the anal glands of civet cats.When it's used in a small amou, it gives some oriental deepness to fragrances,but if you use it to much, it smells very strong equivalent to cat's bathroom. In combination of the main artificial floral scent and this civet, this hotel, oncde your nose gets used to it, starts to smell like either "bad breath" or "busy public restroom". I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great 5 nights”
Reviews.Author: mojoy_1998
Reviews.Content: clean and very upscale. Worth the price. The room was as mentioned at their website. 3 LCDs. One in the bathroom. Heaven for most men ;-) Very comfortable beds. Big living room area. Very nice bathroom. I stayed there 5 nights and did not want to leave :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice addition to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kikihanklove2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Palazzo for a couple of nights to celebrate my birthday and to just get away. We are from San Diego, so Las Vegas is a great weekend trip. Typically, our choice is the Bellagio hotel; however, we were ready to try something new and not too crowded. The Bellagio has gotten a lot more crowded since adding their spa tower. Well, my husband and I were impressed when we first were dropped off at the Palazzo. It had a similar feel like the Bellagio but more calm and personable. The lobby is amazing. The wait was not long to check in and the walk to the elevators is not too far from the front desk. Our room was amazing. It was just a basic suite with a view of the Wynn's golfcourse, they asked us if we wanted to upgrade to a strip view for $40 more per night and we said no. We didn't care about the view from the window. The room was amazing with a comfy couch and plasmas in both the sitting area and bed area. The bathroom was awesome. It had a seperate tub and shower with a small plasma tv in there so you can watch tv while taking a bath or getting ready. They even have a seperate vanity for the ladies to get ready at with a little vanity chair. The hotel did not seem that busy which was nice so we didn't have to wait forever for dinner and drinks. It is connected to the Venetian and so we wandered over to Tao for drinks. The pool is amazing and the sun does not peak over the hotel until midmorning, the hotel shields the sun so anyone can rest in the warm shade for a couple of hours. The only bummer about the pool is the service. We had one lady come over to us at first and she got us drinks. After that we saw another lady and she only went to one couple and would take their order and then walk away without trying to make eye contact at anyone else. I finally walked over to the bar and got us some drinks. It worked great except it was kinda a far walk. The pool is not just one big pool either, it is a huge area of mini pools and spas and a couple of huge pools. If the service gets better than the place would be perfect. We got room service and it was yummy and quick. We ate at Mario Battalies restaruant Carnevino, it was wondeful. the service is great and the food is to die for. Our trip was awesome without too many complaints except for the pool service. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo is Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum1984
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! This hotel is amazing. We booked The Palazzo Hotel, Las Vegas for our honeymoon and having never visited Las Vegas before we found it difficult to choose which hotel to stay in when we booked. We were recommended The Palazzo Hotel by a tour operator as he had recently visited. We arrived on the Monday and we were both speachless at how increadibly beautiful this hotel is. You cant really call them hotels as they are more like villages. It has an amazing shopping mall, massive casino, nightclubs, restaurants, bars, shows etc. The hotel meets The Venetian Hotel in the middle to make it one huge hotel. The man on reception told us that it is now the biggest hotel in the world. Our suite was stunning. We have 2 large king size beds and a plasma tv in the bedroom area. Downstairs there was an 'L' shaped sofa, dining area and another large plasma tv. The blinds and curtains open by remote control showing the most amazing views of Vegas and the mountains. We spent most of our time during the day around Tao Beach at The Ventian side of the hotel. You have to be 21 or over and show i.d on entrance but my god it is worth it. Massive padded sun lounger beds, jacuzzi pools, complimentary towels, lovely pool bar meals and drinks. This is the only pool in Las Vegas where you can sunbathe topless. Security is brilliant in the hotel as you have to show your room key to access any of the lifts which take you to the rooms and the pool areas. We counted about 17 pools and jacuzzi between The Palazzo and The Venetian. The only time that we struggles to get a sunbed around the pool was on a weekend as that is when Las Vegas gets really busy. During the week is was brilliant. We absolutely loved Las Vegas and want to return back there next year. We saw many hotels in the week that we were there and we would definatley go back to The Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Stay”
Reviews.Author: scubaentdoc
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Las Vegas on a business trip and invited my son to meet me there since we live so far apart and due to work schedules and obligations don"t have enough times when we could just have some father son quality time.The palazzo was chosen for us by my business obligations, but after staying there I can only say wonderful things about our stay.The room was fresh and clean. The housekeeping was very responsive and when I requested special hypoallergenic sheets for our beds, they quickly came to our room to change our linens. There was never any high pressure interventions by anyone on the campus and so my son and I were able to have agood time gambling, trying the various classy restaurants, and seeing the Jersey Boys. This show was excellent and like my experience from a year earlier when I saw Love performed at the Mirage, This show was fantastic! The quality of the show was equal to , if not better then many of the broadway shows which I have seen when I lived in New York.Overall our experience was so great that we have booked another trip to the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Chuck Norris Roundhouse Kick to the Door Needed”
Reviews.Author: lawyergirl07
Reviews.Content: Ok Ok, so the headline is a little much. My girl friend and I drove to Vegas in the middle of the night (Swingers Style), which isn’t too far for us, considering we live in LA. I hadn’t slept in about 30 hours and was exhausted by the time we got into Vegas at 630am. We called the Palazzo to see if we could check in early so that I could get some ZzZz before a long night of drunken, gambling debauchery. Unfortunately, the Palazzo wasn’t able to accommodate our early arrival so we opted to go into Downtown Las Vegas and get a room at Fitzgerald’s(see review), an older Hotel, until we were able to check into the Palazzo at 3pm. Upon Check in at the Palazzo, I was taken over by the beautiful check in area. Absolutely magnificent! We were fortunate enough to be invited guests and able to check in at a special low wait time desk, Awesome! The scenery was pleasant and clean and the fact that the Palazzo is connected to the Venetian with all of its fantastic shopping was great for me, bad for my American Express. Our room was gorgeous with an awesome picturesque window overlooking a golf course with a Mountainous backdrop. Overall the stay was nice. The room was beautiful, very quiet, as we were at the end of a long hallway and everything had a very new feel to it. There were a few small things that could be better. Considering the Hotel and Casino were built in something like 8 months or so, I am sure some things were overlooked: 1. When we got to our room for the first time, my girl friend and I were standing outside of our door for several minutes because the door would not open. The little lock showed that the key worked, however the door was not budging. Lucky for us "Letty," a very friendly person on the housekeeping staff, came over and kicked (and I am dead serious when I say KICKED), the door open for us. That seemed to be an issue for me coming back to the room at 4am, drunk, forgetting that the door was sticky and on top of that waking up my friend with the sounds of my Chuck Norris style roundhouse kick to the door and on one instances my chubby body hurling across the threshold onto the floor. 2. There are no 24 hour restaurants in the Palazzo. We did, however, find great pleasure at the Grand Luxe Cafe in the Venetian at 3am, munching on their FANTASTIC Spinach dip and Arnold Palmers. Yum! 3. On FOUR different occasions while gambling we saw Palazzo Security hassling young ladies that were obviously suspected as hookers. In one instance, there were about 6 security guards surrounding a young lady, hassling her about being in the Casino. This went on for about 20 minutes until she was escorted out of sight. That particular instance put a damper on my "Cops and Donuts" Penny Slot experience. I think it would have been much more advantageous, had they ushered the young ladies to a spot out of patron's view. I have to say that I felt sick to my stomach and had to leave the Casino for a bit after the animalistic way they treated her. I mean, Vegas wouldn’t be Vegas without some hookers here and there. I am kidding. But, there is a good way and a bad way at handling certain things, and this was definitely the wrong way. 4. They forgot our wake-up calls on two separate occasions! I am SO glad that I didn’t have plans on those days! 5. When in Vegas, I chain smoke. Bad, Bad. The Casino is nice in that it isn’t overly Smokey like Vintage Vegas used to be. There are a few areas that are clearly marked as “Non-Smoking Areas,” However, I found that a lot of the cool games were in that area. Boo! 6. On check-out day, there was an hour long wait for a Bellman to come help with luggage. We decided to lug all our stuff downstairs ourselves and considering I somehow ended up with more stuff than I started with (imagine that!) it was a big hassle. We were lucky enough to have bribed a Bellman on the way down to take our luggage and check it so we could grab lunch before leaving. Otherwise, we would have been stuck dragging our luggage through the crowded Casino to the Valet and grabbing McDonalds on the drive home.

Reviews.Title: “...really nice room, less the extras!”
Reviews.Author: maicolengel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Il Palazzo is a really good choice to stay in vegas, the price is high, but the room you will get is huge and with many amenities. We had three flat screen in our suite, and a really nice bathroom, all the space to invite friends and a fanatstic view on the Hotel Treasure Island and the strip itself. The problem with this kind of Hotel is the overprice you have to pay to have some of the normal services that in other places are for free. Like the Internet Connection. It's ridiculous that Ive to pay 12 $ a day for something that in many other less luxurios place is for free. Anyway the room was cleaned the bed was really comfortable, and the Palazzo is really fanatstic to visit, good security around , and a nice casino!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with palazzo”
Reviews.Author: dldorset
Reviews.Content: upgraded me to large suite without extra cost, THE ROOM WAS HUGE! great view of the mountains. recommend staying on the non strip side if you are a light sleeper, great access to Wynn. Arrived the night of LAVO opening with celebrities on their red carpet, but in general the trip was relaxing. Clean, a little stiffer of a bed but work the rate!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GoldenTee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after 3 fantastic nights at the Ritz/Carlton Lake Las Vegas (please look at that review!) We were booked for 4 nights but only stayed the one. I think we were spoilt at the Ritz and, for the money, this hotel just didn't measure up. Too many pretentious clients and hotel seemed to be living on the fact that they were the newest. We were staying in a concierge level suite. I was looking forward to a shower when we arrived as I had just played golf in 100+ degree heat but there was little water pressure and no hot water for 10-15 minutes! My wife also complained at the lack of shower cap. The lounge seemed pretty relaxed but nowhere near the standards of the Ritz. It was the little things that let it down and for $400+ a night I expect to be blown away with service. Maybe worth looking at the Venezia instead as that was fabulous when we stayed there last year. Or for better value, get a suite at the Mirage (see my other review).

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay - Totally Recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Noodle25
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to any negatives about this hotel, some people are far too fussy! It is amazing, the check in is fast and efficient, if you have booked (or get upgraded to) the concierge level there is a private check in on the 23rd floor, this is well worth it as you get breakfast, afternoon tea and an open bar and canapés in the evening all of which were lovely, with amazing views of the strip and the Treasure Island show! The lifts are just past the casino and are very quick and never crowded (probably due to the fact that there are about 20 of them!) They have a security person there all the time and you have to show your key to be able to use the lift. The rooms are amazing, we have a strip view from the 25th floor which was fantastic, I don’t think there is much of a view from the back of the hotel. The bed is very comfortable, the living room is gorgeous with a desk and printer if you are on business, and the bathroom is very big with a separate toilet area and his and hers wash basins. The pool area is very nice with lots of pools, many of which are designed to have sun loungers in as you don’t bake in the desert heat! These were fab! The bars and restaurants are lovely and unlike many of the other hotels are not all located around the casino floor, the shopping area is great with lots of big names, this joins up with the Venetian’s shopping area, which is mainly an outside/inside theme! And the gondola rides are great, but you can get big queues for them at times, so buy your tickets early in the day especially if you want an indoor one. I couldn’t fault anything about the hotel! It is also in an ideal location in the best area of the strip, with Treasure Island opposite, the Wynn Next to and The Mirage next to TI, also the fashion mall is across the street. Make sure you book the Palazzo Hotel for your trip to Vegas as it is bar far the best hotel on the strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: white14u
Reviews.Content: From the staff, to the room, to the experience by far our best stay at any Las Vegas hotel! We are not rich by any means but wanted to make this trip one to remember as were married there and celebrating our anniversary and my husbands 40th! We booked at Bellagio since we stayed there before and felt comfortable. However the service and accomadations we recieved at Palazzo were less expensive and ten times more luxurious! We stayed on the conceirge level which I will explain in a moment. On arrival we had a limo pick us up but the wrong bag was picked up. The guest services manager arranged for the "House Car" to bring me back to the airport at no extra expense. He then escorted me to the car while the driver circled the airport while I retrieved the correct bag. It was amazing and saved hours on the phone with the airline etc. They went above and beyond that my situation was resolved as soon as possible. Now the conceirge level. If you do choose this package please ensure that Armando is your conceirge. He got us in free to every nightclub possible. No cover charge, no wait, no hassle. We even attended a red carpet event filled with celebs, open bar, and room to breathe AT NO COST! (We did however tip the host). We had free breakfast, snacks at lunch, open bar and snacks at dinner!!!!! The room, uh, just perfect! Plush sheets, shower with extra jets, TVs all over the place! For you gamblers, the dealers.....the BEST! Personable and lucky! I could go on and on but I think you get the point. By far one of the best vacations EVER! Call Armando and book your trip today it will be something you will always remember!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Blitzwing85
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 10 nights in the Palazzo Luxury Suite. Firstly, we arrive in the taxi and helped out of the car and into the hotel lobby...which by the way, is lovely! There was a large queue for check-in but i only had to wait 10 minutes. I was booked into my room and giving a suite with a nice view of the strip upon request. (at no charge). The elevators were a short walk from the lobby and there are plenty of them so it doesn't get too crowded. We were up to the 42nd floor in a matter of seconds. Onto the room...the decor is nice, and the raised sleeping area is a nice touch. The L shaped sofa in the lounge area was extremely comformtable, and with remote controlled blinds and curtains it made relaxing with a cocktail from the 24 hour room service by the huge window very enjoyable. The kingsize bed was extremely comfortable as were the numerous pillows. My only problem was the lack of a fridge, but the mini bar was used to store 2 small bottles of water at the top so this didn't bother me. The bathroom was very spacious, with a seperate toilet area. The bath itself was lovely, deep and very enjoyable. The shower was very refreshing, and there was plenty space...even for 2. With 2 sinks, and a seperate make-up mirror, desk and seat it made for plenty room to get ready without getting in each others way. The bathrobes and slippers were comfortable too. Room service was great. I locked my wallet and key in my case and it was sorted within 10 minutes. The maids cleaned the room twice a day if required. (note: it's worth leaving a big tip on the first day to ensure top service...it is vegas afterall). The mini bar is kept topped up all the time. Location wise, it is perfect. Short walking distance from the centre of the strip, without being next to all the tacky parts. IE you are next to the more flash hotels, but in 10-15minutes you can walk as far up as the bellagio. In my opinion the length of strip where the Wynn, Palazzo and Ventian are is the nicest stretch of the strip by far. The hotel has 30 restaurents withing 10 minutes walk and everyone we tried was really nice. The bars were pricey for cocktails, but try a Aquatini in the Aquaknox bar downstairs...i ordered 3 bottles of the main ingredient as soon as i got home!! My biggest problem with this hotel, is that i'm fidning it too hard to pick a hotel for my other holidays because for the £110 a night price i got the Palazzo at, nothing else can come close. Price will go up to Bellagio prices for 2009 but in my opinion, that would stil be worth every penny. Excellent rooms, excellent location, excellent service. Me and my girlfriend had the best 2 weeks of our lives, and 10 nights of that was in the Palazzo...the best 10 nights of the holiday. We also stayed in the Panorama Suite at Planet Hollywood. Much larger, but nowhere near as nice. My parents were going to stay at Bellagio suite next year...having seen my photos of the room..they have now booked the Palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average but not 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Chris500
Reviews.Content: 09/14/08 I just stayed at the Palazzo Hotel this week. The hotel is very nice and the room was great. It was quiet and the bed was very comfortable, with turn down service in the evenings. Trying to rest in the afternoon was tough because the hotel's elevators are undergoing contruction. They were not working properly and many people had to wait longer than expected periods for the car to arrive. Of 8 elevators, only 2 were working during the day. I booked the room through the hotel's website and obtained a daily rate of $237 for each of three days I was there. No other problems were experienced and the staff was friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovekiayah
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with my stay at Palazzo. Words cannot describe the feeling I had throughout my entire stay. I will reccomend that EVERYONE should get the concierge package with their stay. The concierge has an entire floor solely for the concierge package. Just a few perks of the floor...open bar, elegantly designed, hors d'oeuvres, private check in, private elevators...just to name a few of the MANY perks! The room was absolutely stunning...gorgeous view...beautiful plush beds with down bedding...egyptian cotton...top of the line shampoos & soaps, bath salts...robes & slippers, beautiful REAL flowers, spacious closets, remote controlled curtains, big clear TV's, there is much more to name but I must move on to the Canyon Ranch Spa... One word...MAGNIFICENT!!! The whole experience was amazing...one that I will never forget and hope to experience again...SOON! The entire staff was so very professional and friendly. Thank you personally to Jose...in the open bar at the concierge lounge...Thank you for my delicious Curielle's!!! And to Amy in the Canyon Spa...you're facials are the BEST in the world! I will reccomend this hotel everywhere I go. Thank you Palazzo for making my stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The Not So Hotso Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine118
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas many times, I was really looking forward to celebrating my birthday at The Palazzo. We had stayed at The Wynn last year and were overwhelmed by the incredible beauty of that hotel, the service,amenities,etc and were hoping for another great experience at this new hotel. We had heard some mixed reviews, but were willing to give the hotel a chance. When we arrived at the airport, the limosine driver was not there to meet us as expected. (This amenity was included in our package). In fact when we called to confirm the limosine pickup while still at the airport in NY, the concierge apologized for not having initiated the confimation earlier in the week, prior to our pending arrival. When we finally found the limo driver, he was very cordial and friendly, but the limo itself reeked heavily of cigar smoke and that unfortunately made for an unpleasant ride. When we arrived at the lobby to check-in, we were told that we needed to go up to the 23rd floor for check-in on the Concierge level. It was around 9:45 by this time and we were both a little tired from our flight and just wanted to settle in. When we got up to the concierge level, there was no one there to greet us. The halls were empty. Not exactly a welcoming feeling. There were double doors adjacent to the elevators with a sign in front of them which stated that the concierge reception area was closed for the evening and that they would reopen at 6am the following morning. We called down to the front desk, who suggested that we come back down again to the check-in area downstairs. By this time, we were feeling inconvienced and not in the mood to lug our luggage downstairs again . We were paying for the top suite in the hotel and we were definitely not feeling that "luxurious" feeling that had been promised when they booked our suite. It turned out that the concierge check-in area had decided to arbitrarily close their doors early because they were attending to a room transfer of some sort. When they did open the doors for us , the representative at the concierge, gave us a curt and rather insincere apology for the issue with the limo as well as the decision to close the concierge doors early. Wouldn't the concierge have been aware that the limo was picking us up at the airport and be expecting us? Couldn't the front desk downstairs have been able to coordinate more effectively with the concierge or management to make sure we were being taken care of? These glitches in service were disconcerting and really unprofessional. When we finally arrived at the suite, the first thing I did was open the closet doors to start unpacking. In the closet, I found some shopping bags left there by the previous occupants of the room. When I looked inside the bags I found their receipts--with their names,etc This made another really bad impression. And although the suite itself was lovely, there were burnt matches left on the carpet, the bathroom door in one of the bathrooms didn't close, the scale in the other bathroom was broken, etc,etc. We had heard that the palazzo had been built in 8 months and that a lot of details had been rushed, but for a top suite at a supposedly decent hotel, this lack of attention to detail in every regard was disappointing. After the first night's stay there, we were able to leave and go back to The Wynn. There are so many great hotels in Vegas . The Wynn is unbelievable and so is The Bellagio and there are many others to choose from. I would not take a chance with the palazzo until they can train their general staff better and start paying attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent!!”
Reviews.Author: manktripguy
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the Venetian in the past and loved it, so I decided to try out the Palazzo. What a great choice! The rooms (very similar to the Venetian) had a new and wonderful feel to them. Everything in the room was first class. All the staff (and I do mean EVERY SINGLE staff member) was more than curtious and friendly. I felt that I was a true guest at the hotel and not just another "number" that was walking in the front door. A friend of mine went to the spa and couldn't stop talking about how wonderful it was. The pool area is gorgeous and large (you can even access all of the Venetian pools). The food options are endless and the service and quality at the restaurants we ate at was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo lacks cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: dubbsbrother
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 5 day stay at the Palazzo. The rooms are large. They have free self parking that is convenient. That’s about all the nice things I have to say about the hotel. We received house keeping only 2 out of the 5 days we were at the hotel. One of the 2 days I had to go down to the front desk to ask for it because when I called I was stuck on hold for over 5 minutes. The last day my wife had to dry off with a hand towel and we had no toilet paper. I went downstairs to complain to a manager and was told that if you have the do not disturb sign on in the morning then housekeeping just passes you by and won't service your room. I told her I found this hard to believe and that I couldn't imagine that most people in Vegas were out of their rooms by 7 or 8 AM each day. I told her that at an all suite hotel I expect housekeeping. She told me she was sorry I felt that way. I told her we would not come back to this hotel or Venetian and she said that sounded fine to her. We won't be back

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Spent Friday and Saturday night here, arriving at 2pm Friday Sept 5th. I have stayed at almost every property on the strip in the last 10 years since I turned 21 and this is the first time ever that I have nothing negative to report and declare to everyone that I have an official favorite hotel in Las Vegas! The Palazzo was perfect - everything was just terriffic. Every employee from the front desk to the restaurants to the casino to the pool to the bar was pleasant and polite and kind - and even efficient. The property itself is the best laid out of all hotels in Vegas, easily navigated without feeling like you are in a maze or walking eleven miles to get from your room to the strip. The room was beautiful and we had a great view of all the pools, Treasure Island, Trump and the Mirage. Everything in the room was excellent and elegant, and the room itself is spacious - and I must give kudos to the genius who put a master light switch by the front door that turns ALL the lights on and keeps you from having to spend 10 minutes turning lights on or off each time you exit or return. The pool deck is wonderful and I think I counted ten pools of various size and temperature. And the casino is not so huge that you get lost and I noticed it was much quieter than most other casinos, even at the peak of Saturday night business. I just cannot say enough good things about this property - but I think the best thing that I can say on behalf of the Palazzo is that I intend to make it my new home in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: dcaiani
Reviews.Content: What a great place!! I would stay here if I ever return to Las Vegas! The rooms were huge. A bedroom, living room, and very large bathroom. Each room has its own plasma TV, even the bathroom! (the TV should have been placed so that you could see it from the tub). The bathroom had a tub, shower, and seperate toilet room. The shampoo, soap, etc were all top notch stuff (love the lemon smell!!) The plug in the safe was a nice touch (I could charge my laptop and camera while not in my room while knowing that they were safe). The restaurants can be quite expensive, I would suggest the Grand Lux or Wolfgang Puck's POSTRIO. Both are reasonably inexpensive and have great food!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: lambertbunch
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the Palazzo in the last 4 months. I have only positive things to share: VERY clean, well appointed, great restaurant selections, beautiful pool, polite/helpful staff. Suggestion: request a room close to the elevator. Hallways are VERY long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, open feeling casino, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dave9956
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large with an open feel. Beds are comfortable, ventilation control excellent (and quiet). Nice bathroom with excellent products. We would have preferred a divider between the bedroom and living room of the suite, but that is a minor quibble. Note that everything is pretty expensive, so just getting a bottle of water will set you back. The pools at the Palazzo are more for sunbathing than swimming. The adjoining Venetian pools are larger and better for swimming. Neither is as kid friendly as somewhere like Mandalay Bay. The casino is large with an open feel. Smoke is fairly well handled and the dealers are friendly. Table stakes are pretty high, so bring a nice bankroll. We have stayed at the Wynn and Bellagio in the past, we now prefer the Palazzo to either of those properties.

Reviews.Title: “great overall”
Reviews.Author: workbites
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo when I was on business. Great stay! I got an complimentary upgrade to a suite with a view. The suite was a bit smaller than the suite at the Bellagio I stayed at the night before, but it was very well-decorated and comfortable. I especially liked how the lounge/living room area was on a different level that the bedroom. There's some great shoe shopping in the Palazzo Shoppes downstairs. My only complaint is that the valet parking for is all the way at the Venetian, and it's a very long haul. Other than that, excellent and will definitely stay here when I'm in town again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: NickiB032
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Palazzo in Las Vegas. It was incredible. The hotel was gorgeous. The hotels on the strip are truly a step above. We've stayed in several. This room was spacious and looked brand new. We will stay there again in the future. This stay was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Well-oiled Las Vegas Hotel Factory But Lacking True Sense of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: swiss_in_nyc
Reviews.Content: Let's be very clear: the Palazzo is a great property with beautiful rooms and nice amenities. However, plush bathrobes and a lavish pool area don't make a really outstanding hotel. In my view, a great hotel is made by its ability to convey a true sense of hospitality and constantly surprise guests with excellence. The Palazzo just does not get anywhere close to that - in the end it is just another well-oiled Las Vegas hotel factory which is pretty blunt about its main goal: make you spend money beyond what you already paid for your room. One example of this lack of true excellence was an in-room dinning experience I had at the Palazzo during my stay last weekend. I ordered food late afternoon on Friday and was told it would be in my room "under an hour"; after 60 minutes I called back and was told my order is "the next to leave the kitchen"; when the food showed up 20 minutes later the server told me that they would take 15% off the bill for being late. Three problems with that: (1) a one hour wait for a sandwich, some fries and a coke is quite long to start with (2) the offer to take off 15% (which - by the way - is less than the 18% mandatory tip on the bill...) is slightly insulting - as if 30 minutes of my time are only worth a couple of dollars (3) when the food finally arrived it was very cold and "just ok" quality You would think that if a place like this does not deliver the expected service (time or quality), they should take off the charge, no questions asked - there is no "15% wrong" in the league the Palazzo aims to play. Again, a nice hotel, but once you have read all the reviews here you pretty much know exactly what to anticipate and should keep your expectations low as there is little chance the Palazzo will over-deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Better bring photo ID or face security!”
Reviews.Author: lawqueen
Reviews.Content: I was also there for 5 days at a convention over Labor Day weekend. We bought the "pass" for $29.99/day which allows access to the spa without the daily fee and allows a $20 credit at certain restaurants. It took about 10 minutes at check in for them to figure this out and print coupons. Went to the pool, there was absolutely NO service. I went to the bar at the pool and ordered drinks which the very nice bartender carried back to my chaise. He was mobbed on the way by people waving their arms for service. There is no children's pool, big mistake. Yes, chaises in the pool are great, but no one picks up the wet towels, plastic cups, cherries etc. floating in the pool from these. I signed the check to my room at the pool. We went then to Sushi Samba in the hotel for dinner. It was ok, the kobe beef was good, but when I wanted to sign the check to the room, the waiter told me I needed picture ID. I showed him my room key which is just about all I had, coming from the pool. He called the manager over. Very condecending. Told him I was trying to pay my bill but he also insisted on photo ID and blocked my way out of the restaurant after I just put my room number and signature on the check they provided. He then called security, a slew of them, who advised me that it is Nevada law that each person in Nevada carry photo ID at all times. . .so be aware. I ultimately put the charge on my American Express, the SAME American Express given to the front desk at check in. Well, they took it and get this. . .without any ID at all! Bouchon and Morels did not require any ID to sign the check to your room. Two outlets in the bathroom did not work with my hair iron. The hair dryer did not blow any hot air. People in adjacent rooms were smoking so much pot that the entire floor reeked. (I know some may love this). Over 1 hour to get a pot of coffee from room service in the morning. Turn down service was sporadic. There IS express check out but I did not use it since I wanted to review the bill since Sushi Samba did NOT credit my bill with the $20 credit but, alas, I had forgotten that it was on my American Express bill that I will receive shortly and see if it was credited after my complaint to the Palazzo house manager about the scene paying and the lack of common sense. I'd rather stay at the Wynn and walk to the next convention at the Venetian. The staff is nice. . .there is just not enough of them and definitely not enough with any brains for business.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ammts28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo for two nights in August. It was great! The suites are large - the "smallest" suite is 750 sq ft, with a bedroom, living room and very large bathroom. It was so comfortable, and had a great view overlooking the Strip. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the pool was very nice. We were also able to use the facilities at the Venetian, as well as the Tao Beach club, which is a 21+ pool club with a DJ and bar. I will definitely be back at the Palazzo on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: blessings
Reviews.Content: This entire hotel is beautiful! The lobby with marble floors and high ceilings is breath taking. I'm not a gambler, so the walk through the casino to the bank of elevators was about all I did in that area. It was smokey smelling, of course, and I didn't want to linger there. I was in town for market - not to gamble. When I walked into my room, I wanted to giggle. I was so happy to have such a nice room. First, and most important to me, it was spotless. Not a spec of dirt or dust. The bathroom was huge, with 2 sinks, a flat screen tv, a separate "water closet" a very large shower with separate jacuzzi tub. There was also a small table and bench with a lighted make-up mirror for us ladies. The bedroom was equally as nice - very, very large with a separate sitting area. The bed was very comfortable - king size - with a large flat screen tv mounted on the wall opposite the bed. The sitting area was sunken and included an L shaped brown velvet sofa, another flat screen tv (that's 3 total!), a large desk with a printer and, of course, internet access (for 9.50/day). The drapes were operated with a hand held control. My only complaint - and I didn't complain the whole time I was in that room - was the view. My sister was across the hall and her view was beautiful - of the Wynn and the golf course and the mountains in the back ground. Mine was of the roof top of the Sands convention center. I don't think you can go wrong staying in this hotel. Oh, one more thing, they have really nice shops on the second floor and you are actually attached to the Venetian and can easily get there to shop and eat.

Reviews.Title: “The holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Mariem60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are former hoteliers, so it was of particular importance that we choose the right hotel for our first visit to Las Vegas. We have just returned from the most wonderful 10 days in the Palazzo hotel. We reserved a Concierge level suite and found this to have been a great decision as use of the Concierge Lounge was such a huge bonus. We enjoyed a super breakfast each morning in the comfort and luxury of the lounge, with no hustle or bustle, chilled bottles of water and soft drinks were freely available all day and the highlight of our day was cocktail and canape time in the evening. The staff were exceptional and could'nt do enough for us. Overall the staff in the hotel were all very pleasant and efficient and nothing was ever too much trouble. On your next visit to Las Vegas, do see the Jersey Boys - a fabulous show.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a convention at the Palazzo over Labor Day weekend. The hotel is like an updated, hip version of the Venetian hotel next door. There are good restaurant and shopping choices on site and adjacent at Ventetian. The rooms are suites and very plush. The pool was pretty average for Vegas, but it was not over-crowded, which was nice. There were also lounge chairs set up in shallow areas of the pool. Overall, a very nice property. Check-in was easy. Although our room wasn't available early when we arrived, the front desk actually did call w/in the hour to let us know that our room was ready. The only complaints I have about Palazzo could be due entirely to the long weekend crowds. The elevators at check-out time are completely ridiculous. It took us about 25 minutes and some ingenuity to get into an elevator and downstairs to check-out. That leads me to my other gripe, which is that there is no express check-out available. So, just allow for extra time when trying to leave your floor and the hotel itself. The check-out line could have easily been cut in half if express check-out was available. Oh, one more thing - room service is SLOW. I was on hold to place my order for about 10 minutes, and then it took an hour (seriously) for the food to arrive, but it was at least pretty good. Palazzo is a nice upscale property with well done decor.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful hotel room”
Reviews.Author: PipHampshire
Reviews.Content: It's worth a visit to Las Vegas just to stay in one of their hotel suites. We booked a Queen Suite, and were only sorry we couldn't stay longer to enjoy the luxury of the room - absolutely fabulous. The hotel was very busy, so check in was a bit laborious, but all staff were extremely pleasant. Don't stay anywhere else - the suite was fabulous, and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: yungfizzle85
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my bday vacation at the Palazzo in Las Vegas and can I say WOW!. I had booked the hotel through a Palazzo/Venetian promotional email/newsletter about 6 months prior to my arrival. At least once a night I would check the reviews on this website to see pictures and what others have been saying. I was a lil hesitant from some of the negative views but now having to experience it myself, I dont know what the negative reviews are about. Ignore it! Let me lay out my stay for you from beginning till end: Arrival: I was greeted by a bellman who checked my luggage and valet my car. Of course, you have to tip. Check-in: Waited less than 15 minutes for an attendant to check me in. I wish I remembered the gentleman who helped me since he was so nice and did a good job assigning us a room with a view. I did the "sandwich" trick (slip $20 in between Credit Card and Drivers License) to see if I would get a free upgrade. He smiled and said thank you. I had originally booked a Luxury VIew suite (1 king with guaranteed view) and after a nice conversation with him, he gave me a 42nd floor Bella Strip View suite that included 2 queen beds, an amazing view of the side of the Venetian, Venetian pools, and the strip itself that included the Mirage, Ceasars, City Center and Bellagio. All in all the "sandwich" trick worked as I hoped it would since I had 3 other people with me and a 1 king bed room would not be ideal for all 4 of us. Room: The room was amazing. Security is always stationed at the elevators to check room keys. Like I mentioned we had the Bella View suite on the 42nd floor. We had turn down service every night that included fresh new towels, a made up bed and chocolates. YES chocolates. 3 LG flat screen screen tv's. 1 in the sunken living room which was maybe a 27inch screen. 1 in the bed area which was a 32inch screen and a smaller one in the bathroom. Every morning, we got free LA times which I thought was weird because its Nevada. I guess they know which guests stay in California. Again, the room is a WOW. Worth the money as it is the biggest "basic" suite on the strip. Pool: Another WOW factor. You can access both the Palazzo and Venetian pool. I was mostly at the Palazzo pool as it was less crowded. Good crowd mixed with families, adults and younger folks like myself. Since it is summer, the pools are open until 8pm. Went to the pool once towards the vening around 5pm and twice the 2nd day. Perfect time to cool off at night and dip your feet in the water pr get a quick swim from the 100+ weather. Second day, One time in the morning which is great for those who are looking to swim in the shade and sun. Sun doesnt hit ALL of the pool areas until mid day (by 11am). My favorite part of the pool was the lounge chairs that are sunken in the pool itself. Great for staying cool while baking in the sun. Most sun hitting areas are taken by 11 12pm so come out early especially for the sunken lounge chairs in the water. Theirs also a bar at the center of the main pool. Rarely saw attendants taking drink orders. One never came to me as I wanted to order a drink but it wasnt a priority. Casino/Mall: Again another Wow. Though im not a big gambler, noticed the casino floor was just the right size. It didnt feel like vegas which is a good thing as everything was very open. Some casinos on the strip including the fairly ewer ones (Ceasars, Bellation for example) are overcrowded with slots and game tables. Palazzo everything is stretched out. Not too much of everything. Restaurants: Ate at Grand Lux like everybody else. Big portions. A must! From the makers of Cheesecake. Check-out: Easy as 1 2 3. Check out using the tv. Cons: Some minor cons that I experienced in the hotel. Mostly in the room. Light in the foyer/hall of the room was not working. Missing light fixture cover and I believe a frame in the bathroom. A picture frame by the dining room was missing as well. Paint wall and dry wall was coming off and dented by the ac vent which is not noticeable but if you pay attention to detail, you will see it. Pictures frames hung in the bedroom area were scratched. Vanity table was dusty as well. Lastly, big water stain that was not coming off was seen on the marble seperating the bedroom and sunken living room. Cons did not bother me at all but I was just asking myself, didnt this hotel just open in January and the rooms are already semi torn up?

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: Gem030
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo was amazing, i have no idea how anyone could not give this hotel a bad review! I have stayed in many 5 star hotels but this hands down beats them all. Fantastic spacious very clean rooms above average even for a 5 star. Plenty of clean towels, very large bathroom always spotless. The beds were so comfortable i slept like a baby. I would gladly live in this suite! The casino was spacious with high ceilings so that they never smelt or seemed smokey. By far the cleaniest and i think best casino in any of the hotels on the strip (we visited them all). The palazzo shops are fantastic especially if you are looking for a variety, never too busy and there are some great restaurants hidden away. I much preffered the shops here to the Venetian. The plus with this hotel is that you can use all the facilities at the Venetian and everything is within short walking distance. I believe the Palazzo has all the charm of the venetian but it is more classy and quieter, full of charm. The staff could not have been friendlier and helped out very quickly with any requests. The palazzo pool area is spacious and split into a few different pool areas. The main pool does not get the sun until at least midday so we used one of the other pools and always got a space - the sun longers in the pool are a must they made sun bathing alot easier even with a hangover in the 100+ heat! At the weekend the Venetian pool got sooo busy we much preferred the more relaxed palazzo pools, but that just depends what you are looking for. The restaurants were excellent, Woo was great i would highly recommend it to anyone who likes asian food. Grand Luxe Cafe was friendly and served good food with huge portions - cheesecake to die for. Entoca san marco was great for their cured meats and wine selection. Bouchon had excellent steaks and a great oyster bar it was just ashame that our waiter was rude and only interested in the larger tables - bigger tips! but still def worth a visit the decor is very authentic. I dont think you can go wrong with any of the restaurants in the palazzo/venetian we heard good reviews from other guests. If you are looking for a friendly, grand, yet relaxing and special stay with great food excellent casino and wonderful shops(christian louboutin is worth a visit!) then stay at palazzo you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: captain77
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is one of the newest and most luxurious hotels in Las Vegas. Like its sister property, the Venetian, the Palazzo is an all suite hotel. The basic suites have a bedroom, with a sunken living area, with 2 larger flat screen tvs, and an additional flat screen tv in the bathroom. There is a large shopping area with many high end shops, and also high end restaurants. The Palazzo is the only casino that I know of in Vegas that offers a smoke free area. The service is always spectacular, and I will continue to stay at the Palazzo (even if they don't keep offering me complementary suites).

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, but needs some tweaking”
Reviews.Author: newfrog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo as part of an education conference in July. In general I was impressed by the hotel and my room, but there were some issues that need to be resolved. The first problem was at checkout. I was checked in speedily enough and headed up to my room. However, I arrived at my room to find someone else trying to enter it too. It seemed like they had assigned both of us to the same room. However, my key card did not work and his did, so I began to suspect they had just told me the wrong room number. I called down the front desk, and it turns out I was in the room next door and they had just written down the wrong room number. It was a simple mistake, but it was annoying when I had just come from a 15 hour flight from England. The room itself was gorgeous, with beautiful, comfortable beds and expensive fittings. The bathroom was gorgeous, but it was let down by really low quality towels, the sort of threadbare white towels you would see in a cheap motel. I expected plush, nice towels, but these were worse than I would ever buy myself. Internet was reasonably priced, at 10 dollars for 24 hours in your room, and free wireless in the ground floor. Note that the internet at the conference facilities is horrendously overpriced, at about 10 dollars for an hour instead. Having purchased the internet in my room, I was disappointed I could not use the same access code during the conference. There were three TVs in my room, one of which had a DVD player, and two of which were HD. Note that the number of channels is limited to basic cable though, as they don't provide channels such as HBO or Showtime. The view from my room was great too, overlooking half of Vegas from the 39th floor. I ate at some of the hotel's restaurants. I liked the Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast, but disliked Dos Caminos, the strange Mexican restaurant that tried too hard to be fancy. Morel's steakhouse was amazing but expensive, but Carnevino steakhouse was a real letdown, as we got taken there by a company and the set menu did not have any steak (strange for a steakhouse). The only beef on the menu was raw. The pool area at the Palazzo was great, and I really enjoyed it during the hot Vegas summer. In general I was impressed by the facilities at the hotel and in my room, but disappointed as the finishing touches were weak (towels, poor check-in, no offer to take my luggage up to my room for me).

Reviews.Title: “First Visit”
Reviews.Author: eekgad
Reviews.Content: We are seasoned Las Vegas travelers. We have stayed at all major hotels Wynn, Bellagio, Four Seasons, and the Venetian. We enjoyed our stay at Palazzo. Check in was very fast We were able to get our Room 6 hours before check in. Casino small. Enjoyed playing at Poker Room next door at Venetian. Jersey Boys was great. . Enjoyed it more than Four Seasons. Will return for the right price

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS - The only word I could use!”
Reviews.Author: devin5
Reviews.Content: I cannot even begin to describe how perfect our stay at The Palazzo was! I had several different places in mind when booking our stay, needless to say, I'm glad we chose Palazzo!!! To begin our stay, we were greeted by a very nice/polite bellman who assisted us with our bags as soon as we arrived. We ended up checking our luggage/bags until our room was available, as we had an early flight into Vegas (9am.) The room was ready at about 12pm. Check-in couldn't have been more simple and quick. Upon opening the door to our suite, we were so impressed by the room. The bathroom was very spacious, and the sunken living room was a VERY nice feature! We had requested a complimentary upgrade so we would have a nice view of the strip, and we were given one! Our suite was on the 37th floor with a great view of Treasure Island, The Mirage, and more as you looked further down the strip. The TV's (we had 3) were all very nice Samsung HDTV's, and they had very clear pictures at all times. We had an AMFM/CD/MP3 hookup that I was able to hook my iPod into and listen to music as we were getting ready in the evenings. The beds were very comfortable and plush, high thread count sheets forsure. The maids were very great about cleaning our room and seeing that we had plenty of fresh towels, etc. Also, an added bonus, we had remote controlled black-out drapes...which were nice to have. After being so impressed by our room, I knew it could only get better after venturing around the hotel. There were several pools, some of which had lounge chairs partially in the water. It was over 100 degrees each day we were there, so that was a wonderful feature to have! They also had cabana boys bringing around frozen towels, etc. to visitors. The bar seemed to have a nice selection of cocktails, but they come at a price. We had dinner at Dos Caminos one night, which was arguably one of the best meals I've had. The staff at the restaurant were very attentive to our every need, while remaining very polite. The casino inside of the Palazzo was also very nice...and didn't seem to be nearly as smokey as the others. At night it seemed to be a little worse, but through the day I can't say I even noticed a smokey-smell. They had a very nice coffee shop called "The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf" which was nice to grab a bite to eat for breakfast, or to have a nice cup of coffee in the evening. One of my favorite things about the hotel was the scent as you entered into the lobby (main entrance) I asked the bellman on the way out what they were infusing into the air and he told me it was a jasmine/lavender combination. It was so comforting each time we entered into the hotel. To conclude, I will definitely be returning to the Palazzo whenever I am in Las Vegas again. I am hoping it is sooner rather than later, because this place is truly wonderful and so luxurious! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Palazzo--gorgeous pool area!”
Reviews.Author: Tess23
Reviews.Content: Was one of the lucky ones to receive an offer from Venetian/Palazzo for a free room for up to four nights. Our family (including a 16 and 19 year old) have stayed at the Venetian, so made reservations at the Palazzo this trip. We upgraded to the concierge floor at check in for an extra $100 per day. I really like the layout of this hotel. It's easy to get from place to place without walking for miles and the decor is beautiful without being too over the top. The guest elevators are across the smallish casino from check in, and the pool area is just an elevator ride away from the rooms. Our room/suite was gorgeous. Loved the L-shaped couch. Kids got a charge out of the electronic shades and curtains. The bathroom was so well laid out and we appreciated the sit-down vanity. Also enjoyed the three-head shower and small flat screen tv in the bathroom. The concierge floor is huge and takes up the entire 23rd floor. The lounge is broken up into several rooms and/or conversation areas so it has some privacy. Complimentary newspapers (inluding Wall Street Journal, the Las Vegas local and USA Today) are available for guests. I don't think we ate $100 worth of food a day but it was so convenient having coffee, etc. available in a calm, quiet atmosphere every morning and snacks/drinks at night. The ham and cheese croissants served both mornings were delicious. I will say that the quality of food on the concierge level is better at Paris but this was still very nice. I liked having the option of self-serve water bottles at Paris--here you had to ask the bartender if you wanted a bottle. Several times he/she was busy preparing drinks and I didn't want to stand in line just to get a bottle of water so left without. Pretty small complaint though. We loved the pool area and spent most of one day there. Palazzo pools don't get sun until late morning but the Venetian pools are literally steps away and do get morning sun. Servers from the bar come around often and the pool cafe has a to-go window if you prefer to eat around the pool. I will return to the Palazzo for sure. For a new hotel, I was amazed at the level of professionalism and friendliness displayed by staff throughout the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Love it.”
Reviews.Author: cuonghoa
Reviews.Content: Palazzo was awesome. It was breathtaking. i love the vaulted ceilings, allows fresh air to come through. Great for non-smokers. Best part were the italian men who works there...so many!! I recommend the concierge level; service was great, except for my check-in. Just try to check-in on the first floor if there's no waiting.

Reviews.Title: “treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: pjokub
Reviews.Content: Though not a high roller I was comped by Venetian, and they suggested a stay at Palazzo. My sister and I went last week and as we are older women and not very chique (though lots of fun lol) we were hesitant to stay in such a fancy place. I have been to almost every hotel on the strip and have never been treated so well. The hotel is beautiful, drinks fantastic, rooms out of this world. In 3 days I never met one employee who didn't go out of their way for us. Smiles everywhere, there was nothing they wouldn't do for us. Comps here seem much better than the lower priced hotels. Loved every minute and will definately return Recommend if eating at Lux cafe to split a meal no one could eat that much food.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit!”
Reviews.Author: theirmom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from three nights at the Palazzo. Loved it! Lovely rooms, great casino, above and beyond service. They aren't yet as full as the Venetian, so they try a little harder (or, in other words, the Venetian left me waiting on hold for twenty minutes when I called from my room to ask a simple question). The interiors are beautiful to walk through and the retail is high-end (Barneys and up). While connected to the Venetian, the Palazzo doesn’t have the schmaltzy Venetian feel. The Canyon Ranch Spa has also expanded and the Palazzo side is so inviting. I highly recommend the Canyon Ranch Grill for dinner. The salmon with an apple slaw was outstanding and the service was exemplary! They also make these amazing organic drinks with homemade syrups, like ginger ale and cola. You need to try one! If they keep up this level of service we will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the rooms, but too big”
Reviews.Author: nyJt
Reviews.Content: Well I guess I liked some things and others I did not. First to start the trip off wrong we had 10 rooms booked for a convention. We all did not check in together, but half of us had problems. My friend had booked 2 queens and they kept insisting she paid for a king and would not give her the 2 queen beds. She is a ceo of a company and all reservations were made by her manager. All messed up by the hotel. It gave us a real bad first taste and took a couple of days to wear off!! We were suppose to have adjoining rooms even called ahead 2 times. Nope, impossible for them to do! (by the way when another of our party checked later in they had a king bed booked but they offered them the 2 queens for the same price and let them know that was like a privelage!! ) LOL must have ran out of kings. As I stood at front desk listening to other people checking in it became very obvious that these front desk people must have a quatta to meet or get bonuses for upgrading people becuase it was a push push push atmosphere. "Would you like a view room we can upgrade usually 100 a night but today we can do it for 40" and crap like that, over and over and over again. It was gross listening to it. 5 star, nope you just went down big time for that one!! Service: some good some poor. I found front desk staff (some of them ) to be blah not real friendly and just seeming to work on commission or something. Coctail service was far and few between, and I am not a drinker just water or coffee, far and few at the machine areas anyway(i did not play the tables The grand luax was wonderful like many say and good thing since everything else is high priced or too trendy for my taste. I missed having a buffet in my otel too, as tacky as that sounds sometimes its just nice to go somewhere not have to think and have somethign for everyone. But once again grand luax was awesome and I ate there at least once a day for lunch or dinner, huge menu good portions, nice people working all parts, good food, just very nice and open 24/7 which should happen more in vegas since it is vegas! The room was nice I can't complain. it is big, nice tvs etc like most reviews have said. I also like they had a decent amount of tv stations unlike some other casino hotels. Beds were very nice, I would like one at home like it! The view depends on room mine was ok. But with all the tall buildings now etc dont ever expecct to get views the way we did before vegas got so built up! The room was clean not the cleanest I have ever stayed at but good. The phones in room are confusing and we all commented on how if older people are staying there etc. they would go nuts trying to figure them out or read the writing on the etc. Water pressure in my room was great, in my other friends the shower pressure was so poor she actually showered in my room one day. The a/c and everythign else worked very nice. If you are suppose to have turn down service ever night then do it. After reading other reviews I could not wait to see if I got it. Ok I got it 2 out of 5 nights so that rating gets a zero to me. Evidently they are having problems with this. Heres and Idea management. How about when they clean the room whenever they do leave the pice of chocolate on the bed and fill the ice bucket then. Hmmmmmmmmmm couls save some money and everyone would get it toooooo. BRAIN STORM Its not really a big deal anyway, its a tiny piece of choclate etc please just do it when cleaning then you won't have people complaining about not getting it. Casino was nice, I like it better than venitian casino which was packed everytime i went into it It did lack some of the newer games that other casinos had. i did'nt do any better or worse than any other casinos, gambling wise. The pools are gorgeous I thought, probally one of the best in vegas They wre not crowded when I was there except for the venitian pool which you can walk to from pallazzo. i loved the walk they are like seven pools, I could have had my own pool if i wanted to the mornings I went down. Very very nice and you can find shaded ares in the morning too. I liked this very very much. But once again if you are walking around with orange slices or cucumber slices then do it, just don't do it randomly or people feel they did'nt get the srvice that others did. So do it right or don't do it. The parking in the underground garage was great, elevator brings you right into the lobby, thanks whoever wrote that before in another review, it helped me out, easy parking right off sands ave. perfect that i didnt even use valet anymore. Valet was good when used. I don't know if I would stay again. I did like the large rooms but Its kind of big with lots of selections but not really my type. Thank God for the Grand laux for eating. I think it is far from harrahs ballys flamingo etc if you want to walk in 100 plus degrees and fight crowds. So maybe its more of a hotel to kinda of just stay at. For me i like to bop around more. I did go to wynn and thought the areas were lovely I would maybe try it there but not sure. The casino did have a much much much better selection of games than the venitian or pallazo. I did notice though that some of the workers were not always that nice either in my 6 hour stay there. I did get comped a buffet for 2 and 4 or us went. I thought it was good, clean, but it had things more daring than me, like lamb cooked 2 different ways and venicine (ugg). they had regular stuff to so don't worry. i did like the casino it was big but didnt seem as loud as venitians. Now in this review please keep in mind I like the older vegas where they treated you better, things were smaller, and it was easier to get great service since the hotels didnt have 5000 plus rooms, etc So after a long review heres the bottom line service needs training like they do at harrahs properties, yes, thank you, a smile, have a great trip, good luck, etc words go a long way maybe grand laux restaurant could train the pallazzo staff rooms very nice, large and i really nver heard any noise from neighbors which is awesome pools many to pick from , looked clean and very very nice 2 main shows on property phantom and blue man both good Blue man a little weird phantom very nice) le reve at wynn was my favorite though very very good If you are going to be eating upscale on the property plan on getting comped a lot or paying a lot. i like it further down the strip more so even if you stay at the ventitian it is closer to harrahs flamingo etc than the pallazzo is. the pallazzo is on the corner of sand ave, look it up on a map it is a 5 minute walk to the wynn treasure island is across the street which i never made it too (darn it) After the check in nightmare and bad first day, maybe after the 3rd day it started growing on me, tne it was time t go home. I guess I need 7 days rather than 5 2 to get adjusted :) Where ever you stay have fun enjoy If you are looking for off strip I would pick rio, orleans, and even gold cost the last 2 are simple but clean and fun and just easy going and you can get to the strip pretty quick but can get away from the hustle and bustle I am sad to say it is just tooooo big and busy ont he strip now and I liked it like 10 years ago that was the biggest it should have got. I miss the old vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous !!”
Reviews.Author: Tetleyteaman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from 1 Aug to 5 Aug as part of my 40th birthday celebration and the Palazzo was fabulous. We got an upgrade upon checking in to a strip view on the 34th floor, directly overlooking Treasure Island and the Pirates show. The room was big, spotlessly clean, and the bed just swallows you up! 3 plasma TV's, including one in the bathroom, ensure that you do not miss your favourite TV shows. All the staff we met were friendly and polite, very helpful, and check-in was quick and painless for a Friday afternoon. For my birthday we upgraded to Concierge Service and ended up being treated like royalty. My only gripe is that you need to beware of the minibar. Apparently the drinks in there are on sensors so, if you remove them to store your own purchases in, after 5 minutes the hotel charges the drinks to your bill. Overall I would recommend this hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “By far the BEST”
Reviews.Author: nickir777
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this place is awesome! I read every review posted on this site before booking and was extremely happy with the chance we took. We stayed 4 nights on the 31st floor in a King room overlooking the Wynn Pool and Golf Course, much better than looking at the strip in my opinion. From check in to check out service was unparalleled. As soon as we arrived bags were taken from the cab and delivered to the room within 15 minutes of check in. Check out can be done from the room TV which makes things easy. Bag storage is availble after check out which is fantastic for those with afternoon flights. By staying at Palazzo we had use of both Palazzo and Venetian Pools which was nice. Drink service at the pools was great. The Palazzo and Venetian have enough restaurants and amentaties that you really never have to leave the property. Drink waitresses in the casino were very attentive (both at the high limit tables as well as regular tables) and very nicely dressed as well. Overall the experience was second to none. By far my best stay in Vegas to date. We ate at Delmonico Steakhouse (Venetian) which was great, Tao Asian Bistro (Venetian) which was good (great atmosphere, food was good not great), Table 10 (Palazzo) which was good not great (great service), Sushisamba (Palazzo) which was the best Sushi I have ever had which is saying a lot. I have been to Nobu and other world famous sushi restaurants and Sushisamba was better. I also recommend the Palazzo due to location. There is a walking bridge connection the Palazzo to the Wynn. I always go to SW Steakhouse (Wynn) when in vegas and it is always great if not the best meal while there.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Palazzo but Loved the Venezia Tower @ Venetian Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JenniferInTheCity
Reviews.Content: I was given comp rooms at the Venetian Resort Hotel & Casino in Vegas and took full advantage of it. I booked at the Venetian and the Palazzo. And to qualify my review, although I love higher end properties like the Four Seasons, I find the newly remodeled Intercontinental properties, and rooms at the Grand Hyatt, most Hiltons, and W hotels are usually clean and comfortable enough for me. I was disappointed as soon as I walked into my room at the Palazzo. 2 weeks before I had stayed at the Venezia Tower Suites and when I walked into my room at the Venezia, it was elegant, immaculate, and the attention to detail all the way from the lobby of the Venetian, through the corridors, the Venezia lobby, the elevators---everything was beyond my expectations. I felt as if I walked into a Park Avenue apartment worthy of a page in Architectural Digest. There was a mirror and marble ledge in the entry way, mirrored counter on the vanity, mirrored bathroom door, padded walls behind the beds that were covered in what I think was silk, elegant window treatments, molding that created square panels on all the walls, furniture that I wouldn’t doubt was antique—leather topped writing desk, dining chairs were in the same style that a friend paid thousands of dollars for, and tasteful artwork meticulously arranged over the couch in the living area. It was sumptuous but tastefully done. Great lighting—there must have been a dozen light switches in the room! Not a stranger to Vegas hotels over the years, I was used to fixtures and décor that was made to look expensive but usually missed the mark and was either tacky or overdone. In the Venezia, I would lay in bed and marvel at all the details of the room which is why this review is so descriptive. At the Palazzo, the layout of the room is similar but the furnishings and detail do not compare to the Venezia Suites. Even my father who is the one that always gets the comp rooms, and does not usually care about such things even said, the other place was elegant, this place is....let's just say he didn' t like it. First of all, the furnishings at the Palazzo are velvet--in the hot desert??? Even though the property is only a few months old, the velvet was dirty looking, and stained. Even a guy friend said he didn't want to sit on the velvet couch in his room unless he put a towel down. Yeah, gross. The colors, the browns, made the room look dark and the carpet looked dingy. The furnishings and fixtures did not look as nice as at the Venezia. At the Palazzo, the lamps, artwork, and all the furniture with the exception of the bed, were all cheap looking. I am sad because I heard they are remodeling the Venetian in the same weird art deco/70’s style which I think is a terrible mistake. To top off my disappointment in the appearance of the room, housekeeping hadn't even finished cleaning the bathroom when I first walked into my room at 3:30pm. Towels had not all been replaced, the tub had dirt in it, the toilet seat was still up with cleaner in the bowl, and garbage left on the floor. This made me wonder about the cleanliness of the rest of the room. I did not have this concern at the Venezia. The housekeeping staff there was incredibly pleasant and helpful. The Palazzo staff seemed tired and overworked and not as pleasant. Now for the plusses. The Palazzo casino is easier to get to. And they have remote controlled shades which are pretty cool but I could live without it if the room looked cleaner. I loved the casino staff at the craps table at the Palazzo—may have helped that I was winning and throwing down money for the dealers. [Cocktail staff was hard to come by.] The pool at the Venezia tower was smaller but quieter, not as crowded, pretty garden area, with large spa pool and 2 jacuzzis. Beautiful at night. [Didn't go to the Palazzo pool, but could see it from my room. It was huge, & crowded, which didn't appeal to me.] To sum up: I was going to check into the Palazzo again in 2 weeks but after my experience I switched it to the Venetian and hope that I will have a better experience and maybe even be lucky enough to get placed in the Venezia Tower Suites again. Otherwise, I am fine with staying at Paris Hotel, Bally’s, and Ceasar’s. Yes, the size of the rooms are great at the Palazzo but if you feel like you are walking onto a cheesy porno set and don’t want to sit on the furniture, what’s the point? [Only took video of room at Venezia--forgot to take pics! ]

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FloridaWanderer73
Reviews.Content: Love the new property by the Venetian. The Casino is bright and airy, and they have been generous with the comps (and I don't consider myself a high roller). The rooms are wonderful. Big, multi-level suites like the Venetian, but with a more updated look and updated technology (3 LCD HDTVs in the suite). The rooms are very comfortable. Great pool area, love the Grand Lux Cafe. Only negatives I can think of are the crowds due to the size. This is my first and only choice in Las Vegas for now. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “As Good or Better than the Venetian”
Reviews.Author: coloradogirl89
Reviews.Content: July 31 - August 3, 2008 We have stayed at the Venetian in the past in the Venezia Tower and loved it. We were tempted to go back to the Venetian/Venezia on our most recent stay but decided to take a chance on the Palazzo. It was spectacular. The rooms are very large and we had a great view of the strip/pools/Trump tower and the Treasure Island. Our room was spotless and cleaned every day with additional turn down service every evening. The turn down service included filling our ice bucket and chocolates on the bed. The casino is very open and easy to walk around. It seemed less smokey than most. We rented a cabana at the pool and it was unbelievable. It was our own little living room complete with drinks, a flat screen TV, ceiling fan and it was air conditioned. In front we had our own lounge chairs and the misters came on at Noon. Our cabana server (Malcolm) was very attentive. The Grand Lux has the same food/menu as the one in the Venetian and the portions are huge. We ate at R and R Restaurante and it was fabulous. Don't let some of the strange names or ingredients scare you. We are going back again next month and the Palazzo has now become our #1 hotel just in front of the Venetian/Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Palazzo--Hand's Down The Best in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: docdani
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this resort 5 times since it's opening for a reason--it is simply the best Vegas resort I have encountered, period. I go to Vegas about 8 times per year and have stayed all over, including the Wynn and Mandalay Bay. The only notable resorts I haven't been to are Bellagio and the new Trump. Palazzo is immaculately clean and the water features, fountains and sculptures are gorgeous settings for your perfect vacation photo. We even noticed a very beautiful wedding taking place right in the main shopping corridor! I think that is a good example of how inviting and romantic the Palazzo feels if you are willing to use it as a backdrop for one of the biggest moments of your life. As everyone notes, the rooms are simply spectacular. First off they are huge. The sectional couch is big enough to sleep two or seat six adults. His and her sinks and a seperate enclosed toilet area are also touches of 5 star elegance. Also, the beds and linens are very high quality resulting in a great nights sleep. Of note too, the rooms are quiet! I can't tell you how many times I've unfortunately heard "what happens in Vegas" taking place in the next room. Great insulation was used and the usual hallway traffic noise is non existent. On every occasion we have encountered terrific service by friendly professionals eager to serve. On our first visit, partly to my fault, a champagne flute from a vacation in hawaii was broken by the bellman while he was delivering our bags to the room. (I failed to tell him what was in the suitcase.) Promptly a security person was sent to take a damage report. They were very courteous and professional. About a week later we were credited $100. I was very impressed. You can't mention the Palazzo without raving about the pools--there are about a dozen seperate little enclaves that offer sun or shade throughout the day. Attractive servers were always nearby to take our drink orders without having to wait long at all. I was totally shocked when an attendant came by offering cucumber slices for our eyes! Wow. I have never stayed at a Four Seasons property but that is the sort of service I imagine. Gracious touches such as these are what makes the Palazzo shine above and beyond other options in Vegas. You also can't review the Palazzo without taking note of the outstanding collection of restaurants on site. My favorites are Dos Caminos for delicious mexican fare (and killer Sangria) and Table 10 by Emeril Lagasse; our meal here was delicious and surprisingly reasonable by Vegas standards. All in all, Palazzo has it all. The location is prime and there is just a short walk over a bridge that takes you into the Wynn. The Wynn is nice to look at but it is SO expensive and a bit stuffy if you know what I mean. Relax and enjoy your vacation at Palazzo--you will not regret staying here! Feel free to contact me for additional tips or info. Caio Bella.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: JFamily_from_Dublin
Reviews.Content: We had to attend a family wedding in Las Vegas so had to bring our 3 boys aged 11, 6 & 3. It was difficult to find a hotel that was luxurious & family friendly bu the Palazzo did fit the bill. We got a great deal on the room by registering for their email offers and what had started at $599 per night came down to $189-$229 over the weekend, per night in July. We booked the Bella Suite that had two queens and a separate lounge area with a large l-shaped couch. My husband ended up sleeping there and it was comfortable. They had 3 lcd tv's including one in the very large bathroom with own door toilet and separate shower and bath. Disney PPV and kids movies available. The pool area was fantastic.
