They have a main pool that is shaded from the sun until about 1pm and lots of other smaller pools. Lots of shallow areas with chairs in the water. Very manageable with the kids. Avoid €19 sandwiches at poolside. Best food value at the Grand Luxe Cafe. Tip: Instead of room service order take out from the Grand Luxe at half the price. Avoid coffee and water at elevator bank and get from the Grand Luxe Take-out. The Venetian is attached so you can walk through indoors, lots of shopping, restaurants and fun for the kids to see. My 3 year old was a bit freaked by the fake sky though. The Wynn is a really beautiful hotel and is accessed by an outdoor walkway. It has a great ice-cream palour that was suprisingly good value with waterfalls outside on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the middle of mayhem”
Reviews.Author: CJM123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and were very pleased. The disclosure is we had a VIP suite on a concierge level. Separate check in and amenities. The hotel is not as crazy as the Wynn, Venetian, or Bellagio. The suite we had was large and not the usual worn room of other hotes. We did not have any of the problems stated by other members. Showers and bathrooms rocked, extra towels brought in a timely manner, and the hosts downstair took good care of us. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ez369
Reviews.Content: I was considering staying at either Wynn or Palazzo but I'm glad I chose the Palazzo. I'm sure I'd have been very happy at Wynn but I have always been a delighted guest of Venetian and chose to give Palazzo a try. I had my worries since I have seem various negative reports not only on TA but other forums as well and luckily none of them proved true for my trip. The hotel staff used every opportunity to greet me by my name and the bellhop taking my luggage out of the cab was keen enough to read my luggage tags and fill it out with my name and proceed to address me by my name instead of asking me. I had a delightful check-in clerk who previously worked at The Venetian and compared the differences and lamented on her preference of The Palazzo. I checked in around 11am on a Saturday and didn't wait more than 5 minutes and received a 40th floor strip view room. The room was great! The room was noticably larger, had slightly better furnishings, and had higher ceilings than the renovated Venetian room I stayed in 4 months ago. Everything worked in the room without any problems and housekeeping was both courteous and timely. Ordered room service and it took about 40 minutes on a Saturday nite which is expected. The pay-per view movie options were the best I've seen in any hotel. There were lots of options including some hi-def options! Room was quiet, didn't hear any noise like some guests have complained about in their reviews. Elevators moved quickly on the high floors and they have 3 separate elevator banks for low, mid, and high floors. I really enjoyed the wide open casino floor and tall ceilings. Weekday table minimums started at $10 but weekends immediately increased to $25 minimums and were full. Lots of restaurant varieties but I only had the chance to go to Grand Lux and visited Dos Caminos twice. Our group really enjoyed Dos Caminos. The location is great with being able to connect over to Venetian quickly or walk out and skybridge it to Wynn, Fashion Show Mall, or TI. I now prefer Palazzo over Venetian because it doesn't have quite all the hustle and bustle as Venetian. Sure, there are many ppeople walking through and taking pictures of the 2 story waterfall in the Shoppes of Palazzo and of the sculpture in the main lobby but it doesn't have the foot traffic of Venetian or an MGM. I find the experience similar to comparing Mandalay Bay and THEhotel. How THEhotel is a little more reserved and a nice little seclusion of Mandalay. That is sort of how Palazzo is, however I'm sure that will change in time. But for now, I've moved Palazzo into my #1 choice destination on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Geoff659
Reviews.Content: Received a comped room for 3 nights and upgraded to Concierge at check-in for $100. Split a room with a buddy so it was essentially $50/nite each. Well worth it! Decided to try Palazzo as I've stayed at the V 5 or 6 times recently and l've aways enjoyed it(especially if I won at the tables/sports book). Pools were great and could connect to the V pools(they have a better pool bar with misters closer by). Gaming was as expected, but much prefer V casino. The P casino is a bit "mallish" with the soft flooring, much higher ceilings. Dealers are ususlly some of the "friendliest" in Vegas. I've never understood why a dealer would be unsolicitous. I know the job is awful, but making more from tips would be preferable to not. Laughing and joking(even helping with odd blackjack hands) is a faster way into my wallet than standing there stonefaced! Anyway, back to the Palazzo. Concierge at the P level is much larger than that of the V. The entire 23rd floor is dedicated to it and it is very comfortable and the service was excellent. Did not really use the restaurants, but they look great and varied. We plan on returning in Sept for the energy expo(it's at the Hilton, we're certainly staying at The Palazzo). All in all, for anyone who frequents Vegas, it will be hard to top the Palazzo/Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Vegas”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on July 22, 23, and 24. We had booked a Bella Suite about 6 months in advance before staying at this hotel for 3 people at $424 a night. We continually watched the rates and anytime they went down we would call to see if we could get the lower rate. We were very impressed at how courteous the staff was and always honored our request, so we ended up paying only $304 a night in the end and it was well worth every penny. Check In/Out We arrived around 3:30 pm to the hotel and were able to walk right up to check in with no waiting line at all. We asked if it was possible for them to give us a high floor room with a view of the strip, but were told that a view of the strip is an extra $40 per night so we said forget it. We were lucky though because the man checking us in then told us that it turned out the only non smoking Bella suite they had available at that time was on the 22nd floor and had a strip view and that they would give it to us compliments of the hotel. Checkout was quick as well and we only had to wait about 5 minutes. The man at the desk offered to mail the things we needed mailed for us and was very friendly. We had let the valet park our rental car and when we gave them the slip to pick it up, it was returned to us in less than 5 minutes and there was no line at all. Suite The suite was gorgeous and huge and didn't smell of smoke at all. Some of the furniture had scratches and marks on them but nothing major and not a problem at all. Plenty of lighting even with 1 or 2 lights being burned out. The suite was very modern with remote control blinds, a flatscreen tv in the living room, bedroom area, and even in the bathroom. Although you can't see the one in the bathroom from the bathtub which is odd. The view was beautiful, you could see the pools below, Trump, the Treasure Island pirate show clearly, and all the lights at night across the city. Service The service was great, every staff member we ran into was very friendly and seemed like they really enjoyed their job and wanted you to have fun. On our last day we called down to have our remote fixed for the living room tv since it wasn't working (although we really didn't mind that much since there was a tv in the bedroom too). Someone came up about 30 minutes later and when we told them it was probably dead batteries, she told us that the hotel didn't have any screwdrivers to use to open the remote to change the batteries with so she would be back with a new remote. She did come back about another 30 minutes later with the working remote, although we thought that it seems like a waste of money for the hotel to have to buy new remotes every time batteries die instead of buying screwdrivers to replace them... Housekeeping Other reviewers complained about dirty rooms and housekeeping not coming everyday. We didn't find this at all, our room was spotlessly clean and was cleaned daily while we were out in Las Vegas. One afternoon we even returned to find one of the housekeepers cleaning our room a second time and putting ice in the ice bucket and giving us chocolates. Pool The pool area was beautiful with lots of shade from the plants and trees. There's 5 or 6 pools so if one gets full you can use another one. The pool is completely covered in shade though until about 12 and after that its completely sunny and bright so if you don't want to bake in the heat the morning is a great time to go. The whole pool area was clean and staff were constantly walking around picking up towels and garbage. This hotel was overall great and the staff really made us feel welcome. The casino was great too, less smoky than others and had large central walkways to get to places in the hotel instead of having to meander through the entire casino for a mile. The hotel really made us feel safe as well because there were security stationed at each main floor the guest elevators stopped at to make sure you had a room key. If you don't show one you can't go up. When we walked in while a housekeeper was still cleaning she checked our key in the door to make sure we actually belonged in that room and that we weren't trying to steal anything. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if we go to Vegas in the future and get a good rate here.

Reviews.Title: “Mind-blowingly impressive”
Reviews.Author: N_McL
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'll admit that I still don't see the attraction of Las Vegas but if I have to go there again for business I can't imagine staying anywhere better. The hotel is beautiful in an over-the-top sort of way with mind blowing features everywhere. The room was enormous with a great level of luxury and was, after the walk to get to it, suprisngly tastefully decorated. I used the pool daily and it was fantastic. No complaints, highly recommend but I haven't a clue how much it costs.

Reviews.Title: “It really is the height of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: GSDiva
Reviews.Content: When I woke up at home the day after we returned, I thought I had been dreaming. It was that good. Chose Palazzo to celebrate my husband’s birthday. Venetian is his favorite, but thought we’d try the new place. First off, I can’t identify with any of the bad reviews on here. Our experience was among the best ever. Personally I prefer a resort with everything on property, like to wander as an option though. We were in awe when we walked into the lobby, it was bright and tasteful. Lines were not long to check in. They asked if we wanted a high or low floor. We got a room on the 44th floor with a view of the strip; it was breathtaking at night to sit on the windowsill and watch. Not a problem at all with elevators, it was on a weekend and crowded too. I can’t say anything bad about the service. We worked with the concierge and they were great. The room itself is modern, decorated in black/gray, larger than many apts. I lived in. Loved the 3 TVs, the one in the bathroom was viewable while in the tub or shower. Since they give bath salts w. amenities too, I checked that out firsthand. Loved the lemony scent of the toiletries. The bathroom was huge. Lots of marble everywhere. The couch was great, a sectional that could fit 5-6 people. Turndown service was great, housekeeping was prompt. I was content not leaving that room. We spent the majority of 1 day at the spa for a couples massage. Highly recommend this, it was perfect, the steam room has eucalyptus scent, perfect for air conditioning congestion. The elevator goes directly to the spa; walls were removed so V is linked to P. It doesn’t have the huge feeling though, very navigable. Most of the shops were open. Nice selection but limited, compared to Venetian’s shops. Of course the Barney’s is the flagship and it is open late on weekends! They had a nice sale going on. Plus, the Venetian shops are a short walk away. The casino was quiet, V was busier. Loved the Rapid Roulette (it was not there last time we visited). Loved the pool and hot tub. The hot tub is great to watch the sun set. Even thought the water was hot it was a great place to hang out. They had water coolers and cups handy to get water, if you forgot to bring a bottle like I did. The bar was a bit crowded sometimes, but I never waited long. Foodwise, did not have to leave the P/V complex to get all kinds of options. The Illy espresso bar rocked! We had gelato at least once a day. It was also a great place to get a light breakfast. We also liked the poolside pizza place, you can get take-out right there. The Coffee Bean had good coffee but you can’t charge to your room, not a good option if you forget your purse. We ate at Carnevino, loved the fresh pasta and extensive wine list. Also tried Morel’s for brunch, huge portions, very very good and they had homemade beignets. It was cloudy so we ate on the patio. I’ll get around to writing reviews for more details. I think we got exactly what we paid for and then some, and it was worth it. Palazzo (and Venetian too) are perfect places to go and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jarodmom
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Palazzo. We were upgraded to a luxury suite with a patio and it was wonderful. We spent a lot of time relaxing on the patio with a cocktail. The pool area is beautiful and has seperate areas and pools that are a little more private so that it doesn't feel as crowded as some of the other Vegas pools. There are also cabanas for rent. I will say that we did not see a cocktail server until we were ready to go, but there is a bar readily available in the main pool area so you can go and get your own. The service as exceptional and every person who worked there greated you and asked if there was anything else that they could do to ensure you were having a wonderful time. We also saw the Jersey Boys while we were there and it was a great show. Highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back! Only thing that could have been better is if we would have won in the casino! Guess someone has to pay for all the extra touches in this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed suite but services not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: TheScottishwanderers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. This hotel has a lot of potential as it has all the attributes of a deluxe hotel but customer service lets it down badly. The rooms are very well appointed, pool areas are great and there are some fabulous restaurants. The shows in the Palazzo and adjoining Venetiian are very good and are to be recommended. However some elements of service were far from acceptable, and the hotel's responses to the issues we raised were at times inept. The staff/managers we spoke to were of course very sorry to hear of the problems we had, said that they should not have happened, that they wanted to provide the highest service and so on, but their actions did not match the rhetoric.. On the first night of our stay the guests in the next room very very noisy and we experienced a disturbed night. We spoke to the duty manager the next day about this and he found a different room for us. However he did not offer us anything for our inconvenience, even when we moved all our luggage ourselves to the new room. House keeping service was at best variable and at worst very poor. We stayed a week and in that time we were offered a turn down service on only two nights, one of which we declined as we were in the room. Toiletries were never fully stocked or replenished. One of the house coats was missing. Towels were sometimes badly stained. On one occasion we did not feel that we could use any of the towels that were supplied. When we requested that they were replaced it took 3 phone calls and a wait of over one hour for this to happen, even though I had stated that my wife was in the bath waiting for a towel to dry herself with. This is not acceptable service. On that same day we left our room around mid-afternoon. We retuned at 7.30pm to find that the room had not been tidied, the bed changed, or worst of all the bathroom cleaned and fresh towels provided. We contacted concierge to complain and were assured that this would be dealt with as a matter of priority. At 8.30pm we found that the room still had not been touched so again we spoke to concierge services. They had in fact forgotten to call housekeeping!! So we stayed to confirm that an urgent priority request was placed with housekeeping to get the room cleaned. We were assured that it would be ready when we returned from a show at 12.00 mid-night. We returned just after that time to find that the room had still not been cleaned. Only after complaining to the duty manager was it eventually dealt with, but at around 1.00-1.30am. This was a wholly unacceptable level of service and the worst we have experienced anywhere We heard from other guests that if you tip house-keeping at the start of your stay then you will get a good service. We would like to think that for a hotel of the supposed standards it says it looks to provide this is not the case. I expect to tip after receiving a good service and not before. The duty manager that night did at least cut our rate for that night's stay by half. One final point. We wanted to visit the Grand Canyon during our stay. There so many trips to choose from that we asked the hotel for assistance. They booked us a trip with their recommended company, Gray-line tours/coaches. Our experience however was not a good one and we would not recommend this company to anyone. We expected the Palazzo to haved associated themselves with a company that was in line with the high standards they state they want to provide their guests/customers with. However as with housekeeping this was not the case. The coach driver was surly and bad-mannered and only when we were almost back in Vegas did he try to turn on the charm. Was he perhaps looking for a big tip? The coach itself was okay but none of the video screens worked. Indeed this was the second coach as the first one we were on had to be replaced before we had even left Vegas!! The driver told us that our first coach was known not to be fit for the journey, so why were we even put on it in the first place! We therefore had to wait on a replacement which cut into the time available to us on the overall trip, something that the driver told us in no uncertain terms on numerous occasions. He could only drive so many hours that day so if that meant less time at the Canyon then tough, or if anyone was slightly late in returning to the bus at any of the stops then he would leave without them. So based on experiences our recommendation is don't use this company. This was a special trip to Las Vegas to celebrate 25 years of marriage. We had researched well in advance where we wanted to stay and we thought that the Palazzo would provide us with the "enjoyable experience" we were looking for and that the Palazzo says it aims to provide. We are afraid that our overall experience was somewhat tarnished by the poor service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sunihuni
Reviews.Content: The Venetian is my favorite hotel in Vegas so when the Palazzo opened I decided to give it a try. The hotel is beautiful. It is seamlessly connected to the Venetian making it very easy to enjoy both properties. Customer service on all levels throughout my entire stay was outstanding. Great room, spa, and pool. Lot's of choices for food and shopping in the hotel and nearby. One issue - getting served a drink at the pool was almost impossible both days I sat outside - they need more talent in that area - I found it easier to just walk over to the bar. If you stay at the Palazzo or the Venetian I doubt you will be disappointed. I have stayed in every hotel in Vegas and in my opinion they are the best. Bellagio is very nice too but the rooms are much smaller. Wynn is nice but not as much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: Gemelle
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a weekend getaway at The Palazzo. Then we found a better deal at the Venetian. When we arrived Friday night to check in at the Venetian, we waited 45 minutes to be told that we were never booked at the 5-star Venetian, instead we were still booked at the Palazzo. I didn't mind this change of plans since the Palazzo is so close to the Venetian anyway. The Venetian front desk also upgraded us to a view of the Vegas Strip. We were delighted and was expecting a great quality hotel room at the Palazzo. At first glance the room looked great. Then I realized the queen size bed was smaller than what I'm used to at home. It turns out that my 6 foot tall brother had to sleep slanted on his queen size bed because it was too short!!! He spent one night on the sofa instead because it was longer. We also had no bathrobes inside our room, despite a hanger that says that our room might be charged $65 for each bathrobe if we chose to keep it. We called the front desk and they told us they don't have enough to stock all the rooms. What kind of 5-star hotel doesn't order enough bathrobes to stock all their rooms? We also had to pay $9.99 for their Internet for 24 hours. The Internet was slow and glitchy. The Palazzo did offer a color printer/fax but it took 10 minutes to print out a color copy of a map of Vegas we found online. The service wasn't bad and the front desk was courteous, but I was disappointed by the quality. I was expecting 5-star quality but barely felt it was better than a 3-star. ======= Pros: Lots of towels, customer service was good, nice flat screen tvs, lots of security, remote control for opening curtains Cons: Queen size beds are too small for anyone over 6 feet, poor linen quality, no complimentary water, noticeable wear and tear in decor, inconsistent housekeeping hours (housekeeping came into when we watched the Phantom at 7PM~ 9PM. Had we known we would have locked away our laptops and other electronics. But all went well and nothing went missing. But it was still strange to have housekeeping come in at such an odd hour)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: glbarry
Reviews.Content: I was a very nervous to book w/ the hotel because of all of the recent negative reviews, but decided to take a chance. I am SO glad I followed my gut and stayed at The Palazzo! From check in to check out, we were treated amazingly well. We checked in on Friday night and had about a 10 minute wait in the check in line. Our room (Palazzo Luxury) was well appointed, CLEAN and we had a fantastic view of the strip, specifically Treasure Island. On our way into the room we noticed the door next to ours had "Bachelorette Party" streamers and got a bit nervous. Upon entering our room, we could hear everything from the party next door. Rather than get settled and have to deal w/ the front desk or our rowdy neighbors in the middle of the night, we contacted the front desk to request a room change. The first person immediately said, "We are fully committed and cannot change your room. We'll send security up" I didn't want to cause trouble for the ladies next door and felt awful. At the same time, the bellman brought our bags up (only a 20 min. wait) and we told him about the situation. He recommended that we call back and speak to the front desk mgr. We called back and spoke to Margaret, who was amazing! She totally understood and changed our room to a Sienna Suite! The bellman came up w/in 10 minutes to give us new keys and take our luggage to the new room. OMG...1280 square feet, separate living room, bedroom, foyer, powder room AND heavenly bathroom w/ jacuzzi tub!!! Whoa... The view was not as great as the first room, but the shower w/ multiple shower heads/body sprays totally made up for it! We were given turn down service every night. We always had enough towels, etc. Three TVs in the entire suite...very cool...esp. the one in the batrhroom! I had a better time at The Venetian's casino than The Palazzo, but that doesn't justify rating The Palazzo lower. If I had to find one thing wrong, I'd say that the furnishings in the Sienna suite were sparse, but other than that we had an amazing experience. The Grand Lux Cafe is just okay. The location is amazing, being connected to The Wynn by a walkway and to the Venetian by the breezeway was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms - but "issues"”
Reviews.Author: RMillerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers note, the rooms are fantastic.. Lots of amenities. A true first class hotel. But it tends to end there. The luggage service is HORRIBLE. My wife had to wait 2 hrs in our room for the luggage to be delivered, as it got lost.. All the hotel gave us for this was a $ 50 beverage credit.. Big deal, because most bars in the hotel complex itself didn't take Palazzo room charges.. The "sports book" was only a desk downstairs.. It would seem a hotel of this magnitude would do a little better than make you hike over to the Venetian... In general, the staff wasn't all that friendly or helpful.... I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, beautiful building and right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: quindaro
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Palazzo for my first visit to Las Vegas. The lobby is magnificent, with a high domed ceiling and fountain at the center. The effect was a little diminished by the Disney-esque line for check in and check out. There were ropes strung across the front of the registration desk so that those waiting to check in or out crossed back and forth across the length of registration at least three times before arriving in front of the clerk. They found my reservation without any problem and the information was correct. Although check in time is listed at 3:00, I actually had to wait an hour and a half longer to get my key and get into my room. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bath has separate tub and shower, and a nice dressing table with lighted make-up mirror. A flat screen tv is mounted in the corner of the bathroom, one of three in the suite. The Palazzo has pictures of the suites and floorplans on their website if you're interested, and mine looked just like the pictures. Coffee, internet, and fitness facilities are all extra charges at the Palazzo. No coffee maker in the suite, $9.95 a day for wifi, and no fitness facilities except the ones you pay for at the Canyon Ranch Spa on site.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Wondeful!”
Reviews.Author: yes2travel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - beautiful rooms - beautiful pool area! Checked in at 9 am and immediately given my room. The front desk clerk provided top notch service. I stayed at the Venetian in the past and these two hotels are equal to each other in all things! Only one problem occurred.....I did not receive nightly turndown service. The hotel quickly made up for this mistake by providing me a 50$ voucher for breakfast the next morning. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms, But That's About It”
Reviews.Author: i-gots-wanderlust
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas at least 4 times a year and I doubt I'll stay here again. I usually stay at Wynn (sometimes Caesar's Palace), but I thought I'd give the Palazzo a try and in retrospect, I should've stuck with what I liked. The rooms are big, well decorated, and comfortable. No complaints there! There are 3 flat screen TV's and the bathroom is a pretty decent size. But the service at the hotel is seriously lacking. The "to go" menu at the pool is overpriced and very limited AND there is no pooside lunch service (hey...that's a big ammenity for me!), so I spent 30 minutes going down to the lobby to get hamburgers from the Grand Lux Cafe. The "main" pool is small for a hotel this size, although there are a few smaller pools. The lounge chairs were not padded and hard. For some odd reason the phones don't have a "housekeeping" button, so you have to call the Front Desk, who will take your request and forward it. What a waste of time. Furthermore, the elevators didn't always stop parallel to the floor (so watch your step when you're getting in/out) and upon check-out the Front Desk wasn't as accomodating as I expected when I had to leave a package for a friend who was checking out later. Overall, I doubt I would stay here again. Perhaps I'll stay here in the winter when going to the pool is not an option or when Wynn is sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of problems - not a "luxury" hotel”
Reviews.Author: BijouxMimi
Reviews.Content: Pros: Room was lovely without the cleanliness/wear and tear issues mentioned in other reviews. Cons: Room available 3.5 hours after official "check-in" time. Housekeeping sporadic and inconsistent, however always had enough towels every day No coffee in room - this is done even in low-priced motels Everything was expensive - restaurants, shopping, bars Room service didn't do anything they promised (split a bill, have change ready with person bringing up food). Overall - I'd stay somewhere else if given the choice

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious hotel for those with green”
Reviews.Author: Russellicious
Reviews.Content: Palazzo is an Immaculate hotel located at the heart of the strip. I stayed here with my girlfriend for memorial day weekend, 2008. All of the restauarants inside the Palazzo are top notch and extremely expensive. The rooms are all suites and the nicest I've ever stayed in. The hotel is new and the rooms are impeccably clean. I'd recommend this hotel for the well-to-do traveler who's looking for the best and most expensive side of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Bad, and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: MichaelChristine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palazzo, the July 4th weekend. The Good: The rooms are physically very nice and new. Plenty of room to stretch the legs, and access to all the Palazzo and Venetian facilities was very nice. The Bad: Service: The hotel is relatively new. However, as part of the established Venetian, one would expect competent staff. We had numerous issues, which were never resolved by management. Although we received calls from the hotel management, they always apologized, and used July 4th as a constant excuse, rather than resolving the problems. #1 - The shower looked very nice, but the water pressure was terrible. It was never resolved. #2 - The safe was broken and never fixed after several calls. #3 – The room service food was left in our room for two days, until collected. #4 - Housekeeping - We must have received 5 to 6 calls/knocks on the door, during our 3 day stay, asking when we would be out of the room, so it could be cleaned; even though we had the Do Not Disturb Sign displayed. I think housekeeping was more concerned about getting home themselves, versus the well being of paying customers. The Ugly: Tao Restaurant - More Glitz than Substance - Don't bother with this restaurant. The food is terrible, and the staff forgets about the patrons. Our waitress literally went home, and forgot about us, and the restaurant management did nothing. They should stick with bar service only. Management clearly can not run a restaurant. Also, the Canyon Ranch Spa, more Glitz than Substance as well. It is not very good value for the money. We have much better Spas at home.

Reviews.Title: “A nice Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Utopiagirl127
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a family trip. The hotel was above my expectations, there were two flat screen tvs in the room and another one in the bathroom. The room also had a great view of Vegas, which was great. Also I had fun going shopping at the Palazzo shops and at the Venetian which it is connected too. The only problem I had with the place was with security, you have to carry your key card with you before you are allowed to enter the elevators. The security guard will not let you go to the rooms otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience I've ever had....”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo in late June and attended a conference for work at the Venetian, which is connected to the Palazzo. My check-in experience was good, and I was impressed with the rooms and the luxury features (flat panel TV's, comfortable beds, nice bathrooms). During my stay, a camera (Pentax D-SLR Camera...valued at about $800.00) was stolen from my room. I had no guests in my room, so the only people who were in my room were me and Housekeeping. I reported the matter to Security immediately, filled out a report, and was told that it would be reviewed by the Investigations Team. Several weeks go back with no contact from them until I finally called and asked for a status. I was told by their claims department that their investigation was inconclusive and there was nothing further they could do. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was told by him that since I didn't use the in-room safe, there was nothing they could do. I was very upset that they weren't going to do anything for me....for a hotel as nice as the Palazzo is and as much emphasis as they placed on customer service, I would have thought this would have been handled much differently. I would even been happy with them comping my stay, but NOTHING AT ALL! So...I guess the lesson here is don't judge the book by it's cover...the Palazzo is a nice hotel on the outside...but I think there are some deceptive and unethical practices going on inside....and by all means....use the safe that is provided if you plan on leaving any valuables in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: mrfood16
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas four times and have stayed at the MGM, Mandalay Bay, Bellagio, and Venetian. This is the best hotel yet. Check in on a Thursday afternoon was immediate. We got placed on the 34th floor with an amazing view of the golf course. The room is huge, even a little bit bigger than the Venetian which until the Palazzo had the largest room in Vegas. The room must have been more than 700 square feet, with a bedroom, sunken living room, and large bathroom. The furniture is all beautiful, high quality, and not over the top like the Venetian. It was all very comfortable. The shades are controlled by a remote which is a cool touch and nice for when you wake up in the morning and want to open the shades without getting out of bed. There are 3 flat screen TVs. One in the bedroom, one in living room, and a smaller one in the bathroom. The shower is large and nice. I could go on and on, but basically this is the nicest room I have ever stayed in, and I have been to many places. Sheldon Adelson really knows how to make nice rooms. The casino was nicer than the Venetian's in my opinion. It has high ceilings and is less crowded and smoky. The dealers were friendly and it was easy to get around. Elevators to the garage and room were efficient considering how big the place is. Service was good. Room was always cleaned when we were gone. Staff were friendly and helpful. I chatted with a security officer for almost 45 minutes and he raved about Adelson and about the place, and gave me some restaurant tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, needs some tweaking”
Reviews.Author: gringocito
Reviews.Content: Stay and Background: 4 nights at the new Palazzo hotel. I travel to Las Vegas 4-5 times a year from Florida. Fortunately I have stayed in many of the best hotels in Las Vegas on the strip including the Bellagio, the Wynn, the Venetian, etc. In short: The Palazzo, to me, is simply an extension of the Venetian hotel. A seamless transition to "another tower" accessed from the Venetian, which includes many excellent dining choices. Lobby Area: The lobby area is very clean and serene, a bit cooler in color scheme (blues/browns) and feel compared to the rich colored Italian feel (golds/reds) of the Venetian. Rooms: Standard Room, 2 queen Beds, 7th Floor Pros - Very spacious and comfortable, including the bed Cons- a little dark, needed more lighting. A few minor misses such as hole in the wall, bathroom toilet area light bulb out, all of which was fixed within short period of time by courteous staff. Had to call more than once for maidstaff to clean our rooms, hope they get this corrected soon! Restaurants/Dining: Ate at most of the new restaurants, overall: EXCELLENT As is most Las Vegas dining in the upper echelon of resorts, rather expensive, but to me worth it nonetheless. CARNEVINO real nice porterhouse steak for two, huge restaurant, great service. DOS CAMINOS mexican food - excellent fresh guacamole, queso fundido, and lobster ceviche, great service. Would eat here for lunch. THE CUT also nice steaks, more modern decor and feel. MOREL'S (lobby area) very intimate feel and tasty food. Fresh bread to table, be careful save room for your meal! GRAND LUX hard to beat for value and consistent food. Try the Sangria! Yes, that's right...Sangria! DAL TORO (lobby area) - nice break from the expensive dining choices. Solid choice for italian food, more family style with a twist, lamborghini's in view from your table, also views of the strip. Experienced this a few days after opening, just getting the staff situated and kinks out, everyone trying their best and very helpful. 40/40 CLUB - my biggest dissapointment. Although the club is quite amazing and the best place to watch a sports game (was there during the NBA finals as well) the food is AT BEST average. Maybe they will get this one right as time goes on. JADE - another restaurant which needs improvement, not impressed, love Japanese/Asian cuisine just didn't cut it in my view. ESPRESSAMENTE ILLY - best place for espresso or cafe, gelato, or nice morning breakfast sandwiches, fruit, etc. Casino: More open spaces than the Venetian Square in appearance, almost a "big box" with restaurants around the perimeter. Plays music over the speaker system day and night which keeps a nice mood. Feels a little lacking of character, maybe it is just too open, therefore, feeling a bit less intimate. Summary: I really enjoyed the time in the Palazzo. Found myself walking to the Venetian to gamble. Dining was great, room comparable to the Venetian. However, when looking back on my stay, I would not say the Palazzo blew me away on its own merit, rather the Venetian/Palazzo experience in combination hands down has the most entertainment, dining, and shopping available anywhere on the strip. You never have to leave the premises. The Venetian or Palazzo tower to me are one in the same for accomodations. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: caplondon
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a new version of the Venetian. The suites are very similar. Very large and with all the amenities you expect from a luxury hotel. The bed is separate from the living room area, which is nice if you plan on spending some time in your. Gives you space to relax in on the large sofa and watch one of the two 42inch plasma tv's. Just be prepared to pay an arm and a leg for anything in the mini bar. Just moving an item from it's spot and you have to pay. The items are on senors, so do not touch unless your buying!!! The bathrooms are very large and brightly lit. The casino is also lighted well. Good variety of slots and many table games. Most of the restaurants are open now. But most are high end restaurants. The shops on the second are opening every week. Most are open now, but again, these are the high end shops. I have photos of the suite I was in on my blog:http://lasvegasfun.blogspot.com/ The Palazzo and Venetian are both very fine choices and good places to spend your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: dsigner
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews here for the Palazzo and I have to say, I have stayed there twice and thoroughly enjoyed both stays. I'll be going again in August and can't wait. First off, all my stays have been comped. A bonus indeed. The rooms are very large (all are suites) and very well appointed. This last stay in June the man checking us in at the Invited Guest desk gave us a free upgrade to a massive suite for 3 nights since it was my birthday. We called room service upon getting into the room and ordered up ice and several champagne buckets and they were there within 10 minutes. Very prompt. Since we gambled all night the 1st night, they respected our Do Not Disturb and left a card in the key slot to call when we wanted service. We called and left and upon our return, the room was made up. We had turndowns every night. The casino isn't huge but has plenty of tables and isn't crowded which is nice. The air quality in the casino is great! No smoke, high ceilings...a real plus. Food quality and service at the Grand Lux was good. The beignets are fabulous! I can't wait to leave again in 3 weeks for another free stay! I'll go back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A few minor issues, but a great stay nonetheless”
Reviews.Author: vegophile
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Palazzo July 3-5 and 9-11 (went to California in between) and had a great stay. We had an early flight and arrived in Vegas around 9am and went straight to the Palazzo. The second that the cabbie hit the breaks, we had valets opening all three doors, and by the time we stepped out, our luggage was already out of the trunk. I don't know why, but great valet/bell service really impresses me. Anyway, we gave the valet our last name and she informed us that our luggage would be sent to the room promptly after check-in. We headed to the front desk...which is located right inside the front door...I was thankful to not have to trek through a casino looking for it. And by the way - all the doorways have designated doormen - a feature that you won't find anywhere else in Vegas. Anyway, we gave the clerk our name and confirmation number, and she said that even though it was 9am, we could still check-in. She even waived the early check-in fee and upgraded us to a room on the 50th floor with a view of the Wynn golf course! That's service if you ask me. Then, we headed up the the room. And by the way, we didn't have to wait for the elevators. In fact, we never had to wait for the elevators, and never had to stop at more than three floors on the way up. Keep in mind that I was on the 50th floor AND this was 4th of July weekend. Anyway, when we opened the door to our room, we were amazed. You walk into a marble foyer with a HUGE bathroom on the right - complete with a flat screen TV, double sinks, a huge shower, a jacuzzi tub, a vanity area, and a separate room for the toilet. All, of course, done in marble. Past the bathroom was an area with a King size bed, a flat screen tv, a chair, and two nightstands. Then, there is a small half-wall sort of thing. Beyond the half-wall is an area with a sectional couch that can easily seat 6 and pulls out into a bed, a desk, a table with room for 3, and another flat screen tv. The lightning was great, the furniture was all dark wood, and the color pallet was primarily beiges and browns - very tasteful and elegant. The drapes opened with a remote, and every evening housekeeping came in and turned down the bed, dimmed the lights, put on relaxing music, closed the drapes, left chocolates, gave you new towels, and put ice in the ice bucket. The entire property is a lot like the rooms - pure luxury. High ceilings, tons of marble, the works. Not over-the-top like other Vegas resorts though - very classy and tasteful. The casino is really nice - a good size, with high ceilings, and not too smoky. On the floor above the casino, there is shopping area anchored by a massive Barney's New York with upscale stores like Ralph Lauren, Jimmy Choo, Mont Blanc, etc. that is connected to The Venetian's Grand Canal Shoppes. The pool deck is unbelievable - it's composed of about two large pools, one medium pool, two small pools, and 3 (that I counted) hot tubs - all spread out over a huge area with elaborate landscaping and fountains separating them. There's also a huge bar and cocktail service. Oh, and certain areas of the pools have these cool chairs that lay in the water, so you can lay out on the lounge chair and still be in the water. It's very cool. And if that's not enough, the Palazzo pool deck connects to The Venetian pool deck, which has two large pools and TAO Beach. We only ate at two on-site restaurants - Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast, which was good, but a little overpriced, and Wolfgang Puck's Postrio at The Venetian, which was delicious. I do have a few minor issues with the property - these are the only reasons I didn't give the hotel 5 stars. When we first walked into our room, the headboard for the bed was loose on one side - so it was basically hanging from the ceiling on only one side and looked like it was about to fall. I called priority service and they sent someone up to fix it. But, I think that something like that should have been noticed by the housekeeping staff before we even got to the room. Some of the furniture was a little scuffed. One of the nightstands was missing 3 of its handles. The dresser/console unit under the tv by the bed was missing one of its handles. How is this kind of stuff not noticed? The first afternoon that I was there, I called to have a bucket of ice brought up. The operator told me it would be 30-45 minutes. For ice. I asked her if there was somewhere I could get ice, and she said there was an ice machine on every floor. So I searched the entire floor for ice, and couldn't find it. I finally asked a housekeeper that I saw in the hallway, and she led me to a door that looks exactly like the ones for the rooms. It didn't have any indication whatsoever that it housed the ice machine. No sign, no nothing. Just a plain door. At a place like this, I should be able to have ice brought to my room very quickly - and if that's not possible, I shouldn't have to search the entire floor for 15 minutes to try and find the ice machine. At around 10am, I called priority service to have someone sent up to make up the pullout sofa. I wait 20 minutes. I call again, and tell them that no one has come up yet. She was very friendly, and says she will send someone up right away. I wait another 20 minutes. I call again, this time very pissed off, and inform the operator that we've all been trying to get to sleep and that I've had to call three times to try and get someone up to make up the pullout. She's very apologetic, and says that it usually is about a 30-45 minute wait to have the pullout made up. I'm sorry, but that is just ridiculous. The guy finally came to make the thing up - but 45 minutes is a joke. "Priority service?" I understand that combined with The Venetian this is a 7,000 room property - but they obviously are a little understaffed. In review, I had a few minor issues, but I would definitely stay here again. And at $199/night you just can't beat the space/price/luxury quotient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility Ruined by Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: MarkTexas9
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is a new hotel on the strip owned and connected to the Venetian. The nice facility can't make up for poor service, though, and they have a lot of problems. My biggest issue was the lack of turn down service. Yes, I can turn down my own bed. What I needed (since we both showered every evening before dinner and shows) were clean towels. The other thing that is nice to have in your room after coming in at night from the Vegas summer heat is ice in your ice bucket. Both of these services are included in turn down. Turn down service is part of what I was paying for and I expect to receive the services I pay for. Our room was skipped the first night, which I thought was just an oversight. Upon coming in the second night, same story, no evening service. The Palazzo states if you need anything at all, press the "priority service" button on your phone. I did that and it connects you to the hotel operator. I told the operator for the 2nd night in a row, no evening service. No apology and she sounded put out that I was even calling. She did ask if I wanted someone to come up, but it was 10:30pm and I said it was too late. I asked if she could at least make sure we received evening service the next night. She said she would take care of it. Next night, no evening service. I called again. Again no apology for their failures. This night I told them to please go ahead and send up housekeeping. After 45 minutes, I called back and asked for a manager. I told the manager I had been skipped for the third night in a row. No apology. He did have housekeeping there within 10 minutes. A lot of frustration for clean towels. This wasn't the only service problem, just the most annoying. Same complaints as others: huge elevator lines and you end up packed in to an elevator cab. Poor service in the Grand Lux Restaurant. If you bring up a problem, Palazzo employees act irritated that you've even mentioned anything. An apology for the service problems would have gone a long way with me, but none was offered. There are too many choices in Las Vegas now to put up with poor service like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonMack
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great, relaxing couple of days at the Palazzo - July 1-5, 2008. The property is a great place - not as crazy busy as the Venetian in either the casino or lobby (which to us was a bonus), and we found that the Venetian and Palazzo both weren't very smoky casinos. As has been stated many times, the rooms are suites - we had a 42nd floor suite facing the Wynn Golf Course (in 4 days the most we saw was 3 groups on the ENTIRE course....$500/round plus 112F heat will do that I guess!) Beds are great, TVs (all three) worked very well, and even had REAL HD....Bathroom was huge. Closet was pretty good....really we felt spoiled. A 5-star room. Could have used a coffee maker though. I have seen a bunch of reviews about elevators. We had no problems at all - never a wait for more than 1 minute. The pool is in the shade much of the morning, but you get full use of the Venetian pool (a quick stroll), and access to Tao Beach if you are so inclined (we weren't, but apparently it's free - many young kids, of the over 21 variety, heading that way). The Venetian pool is much larger than the Palazzo (main) pool, though the Palazzo has....I want to say 5 smaller (pools). I'd pass on the frozen/slushy drinks in the major heat....for $12 the watery syrup that the drinks (of course) ended up made for some cranky folks. The beer was cold, and....$6 I think (might have been $6.50) Only onsite restaurant we went to was the Wolfgang Puck restaurant on the pool deck (name escapes, but you walk right through it on your way to the pool)...excellent pizza, great to sit in the shade and people watch - reasonable prices. We also had coffees and bagels at the coffee stand at the bottom of the elevators - expensive ($3.50 for a large regular coffee), but when in Rome, eh? There is a small gift shop with booze and very light snacks right across from the coffee joint. Check in/check out, very smooth....all in all, I would certainly stay there again for a similar good deal. We would, however, rank this resort below the Signature (about the same price while we were there) - depends on what you like and what you're after I suppose. Feel free to ask any questions, I'll do my best...

Reviews.Title: “Looks beautiful but it's all for show”
Reviews.Author: psycholemming
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to Vegas and we usually stay on the Strip, so by now we have stayed in the majority of the Strip resorts. We liked the Venetian so we figured we would give their new place a try. What a mistake! The hotel looks beautiful - the decor is lovely and everything is shiny and new. Should you require any basic service, however, you're out of luck. A few examples: -Underaged children running around the hotel and casino at all hours (sorry but Vegas is NOT a family location) -Elevators which never worked and weren't fixed, leading to a wait at all hours -Simultaneously shutting down two of the few remaining elevators for "cleaning" at the busiest time of the night on a holiday weekend -Room was cleaned once in a 3-day stay -Naps/sleeping interrupted by housecleaning multiple times despite "Do Not Disturb" sign up (yes, they called us/knocked on our door to say they would clean our room, but never actually cleaned it) And the incident which really sums up the Palazzo experience: On the first night we arrived, I realized that all 8 of the bedpillows in the room were filled with goose-down, which, like many people, I am allergic to. There was also a huge down-filled duvet, but no blanket on the bed - not very practical in July in Vegas. I called housekeeping (no easy task since there is no housekeeping button on the phone, nor a directory in the room) and requested that they send some non-down pillows and blankets. Two hours later, there was no sign of any pillows or blankets and I called back. The operator said she would send someone and half an hour later a worker showed up with pillows and blankets. When I pulled off their pillowcases, they were *also* down-filled pillows. I was shocked - how stupid were these people? I called housekeeping again. The operator promised to check it out and call me back. A few minutes later she called and informed me that she had talked to the man who brought me pillows, and that he had checked and the pillows were, in fact, foam, not down. Now I had housekeeping calling me a liar at 2am when I had been waiting all night to get some pillows I could sleep on. I insisted that she send him again, with foam pillows this time. Ten minutes later he showed up without any pillows. He informed me that I was wrong and that he had brought me foam pillows previously. I could not even believe it at this point. Not only had I been denied hours of sleep by the incompetents running this hotel, but now they were calling me a liar - and why on earth would I lie about something like that? Not to mention, I know for a fact that many people are allergic to down and this must be a very common request - which they totally failed to fulfill. At 2:15 in the morning, I tossed every pillow in the room out in the hallway and pulled every single one out of its pillowcase to indicate to this jerk hotel worker that I was not lying to him. Sure enough, every single one was filled with feathers. 10 pillows - all down. The worker grudgingly left and came back 20 minutes later with foam pillows. At this point it had been nearly 3 hours since I made a ridiculously simple request, and I was treated horribly the whole time. I've had better service from the $50-a-night motels I stay at when I drive cross-country. In fact, I don't think I've ever been treated so poorly in any Vegas hotel. I will never stay here again and I will encourage all my friends and family to avoid this rat-hole. The entire management should be fired immediately if Shel Adelson hopes to maintain his credibility as a luxury hotelier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms...Ugly Pool Scene....Smoke”
Reviews.Author: ronu2
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice rooms, Well decorated, Defiantly 5 star quality. Great Shows at Venetian. Saw Blue Man Group and Phantom. Cons: Not enough staff to keep out the Riff Raff. Overcrowded pools, smoking allowed everywhere, call girls in the casinos. The major disappointment was that the pools were over crowded to the point that you didn't want to get in the water, and if you walked over to the Venetian Pools it was even worse. It appears that the general population of Las Vegas is allowed to use the pools here. You will notice that the people in the restaurants, the shops, and staying at the hotels, are not the people hanging out at the pools. The pool atmosphere appeared to be something out of an MTV video, especially the closer you get to Tao Beach. I wouldn't be surprised if there was a gang shooting in the future near the Tao Beach pool. Also, if you don't want to be in a "forced to breathe everyone else's smoke environment", you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNestersGA
Reviews.Content: Wife and I escaped to Las Vegas for 4 nights over the Father's Day Weekend. We are fans of the Venetian properties and decided to try the Palazzo. Overall the experience fine. Our overall attitude was that we prefer the Venezia Tower. Rooms were clean.... beds were better than the rest of the resort. Rooms are clean, service is fine, nothing that really created seperation between the other property.

Reviews.Title: “ROBBED”
Reviews.Author: Midwestraveler31
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time. Right up until the time that housekeeping stole my wife's jewelry from her luggage. If you go USE THE ROOM SAFE.

Reviews.Title: “Latest hotel on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo is the newest sister hotel to The Venetian on the Las Vegas strip. It is as luxurious as the Venetian. The pools and hot tubs were amazing! There are enough restaurants to keep you from being hungry. I ate at Panasia in the hotel and at Mainland in the Palazzo shops. The casino is quite big and have different slot machines than the ones at the Venetian. The decor at the Palazzo is quite contemporary from the old world charm of the Venetian. The 2 bed suite that we got was quite lovely and quite luxurious. You can see that the Palazzo is still catching up on finishing up their decor as there were some light fixtures that were missing. One tiny complaint is that housekeeping had to be told to come and clean my suite. Other than that, the service is impeccable!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Beba52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 24 - 28. Loved everything about it. We got there at 7 in the evening and they had no non-smoking rooms left and were not sure when one would become available. Was told that we would receive an up-graded view room that may or may not have been smoked in. If it was too smokey housekeeping would come up with air cleaners and we could move into a non-smoking room next day, We agreed and went to the room, when we stepped off the elevator we were hit by a strong smoke smell and were worried about the room. We got to the room and there was no smoke smell. And the view we had was of TI across the street. The room was nice, beds comfortable, and there was a small fridge that we were able to buy drinks and lunch meat for late night snacks. Housekeeping was great and there was turn down service each night with great chocolates and they would tidy up the room. Had room service one day and it was good and came within a reasonable time. Ate at Grand Lux for breakfast and it was good. MIL had the buffet and she enjoyed it. Also ate at Dos Caminos and it is great. Being Tex-Mex, I am very picky about Mexican food. This was great. Tableside quac was wonderful, and the Margaritas were refreshing on 100 degree days! If you can try to catch Jersey Boys. My husband didn't want to go, but gave in and enjoyed it too.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: filter14
Reviews.Content: There were 3 in our party --mom and 2 daughters--who all decided it was time to try out the new place in town. We loved staying at Venezia so just expected the same level of service. Sadly we didn't receive it. Plusses were bellman on departure was in room within 10 minutes. Staff smiled even if they didn't have an answer. Taxi service was quick. Loved the shops and casino was spacious enough that smoke didn't overwhelm. Minusses were I wanted answers to basic questions such as when concierge was open but got wrong information, who to call for housekeeping since phone wasn't set up for an automatic dial, no welcome book/pamphlet in room(type that has ALL info listed not just restaurants, entertainment and room service), some elevators not working throughout 4 nights, housekeeping being inadequate during daytime as in not stocking room with normal allottment of towels/glasses let alone anything extra(excellent at night but they only came 2 out of 4), children running wild--yes wild--throughout hallways and along hallway to elevators(kids/parents were in town for an IPOP convention). One security guard manning elevator banks being crazed about room keys but not for all people just those who actually bothered to listen (they need 2 on duty for such a condensed area and also have to stop letting people loiter once they get past security which then causes a backup just to get onto elevator) , walls are either very thin or people were extremely loud in adjoining room...every morning, Grand Lux staff while pleasant appeared to be overwhelmed at breakfast, furniture in room already stained/missing buttons on couch, room not prepared for our arrival as far as bedding/sheets/pillows for pullout even though I paid for the 3rd person up front. Room service delivering 3 meals but not giving 3 sets of silverware so after calling back to rectify the situation being given the third degree(as if I was hiding a person when clearly 3 meals were ordered) and then after waiting for silverware still didn't get the cream/milk for tea which got cold. Oddly no glasses of water were included which I've had at all properties in LV when ordering room service without having to request it. Maybe this is a new trend. Video checkout was a bit disturbing when there was a disclaimer that 'other guests may view your information' before you clicked on your info. What? I've never seen that posted at any other hotel and have used video checkout consistently. There were more errors as it just showed a place that either opened too soon, this is the normal working out kinks of new place or Palazzo thinks they can get by with mediocre due to location for conventioneers. Also they were overrun with this 'IPOP' group and may have not expected to be so overwhelmed. If one disregards everything in this report do yourself a favor and at least take this advice---don't ever stay at any property when that group is also there. It was a nightmare. My problem is I paid full price for a room in what I thought would be a higher end property when in fact overall it was just mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “I guess it was alright .....”
Reviews.Author: moo_bear
Reviews.Content: ... if you like this kind of thing! Sorry, I am being grossly unfair - the hotel was lovely - I just do not like Vegas. Check in took a while. Room was on 38th floor, with a view over the Wynn golf course. It was also miles and miles from the elevator! Beds were comfortable and all was quite luxurious. Real orchids (I think!) in the bathroom. Good shower. Separate toilet with flowery wallpaper. Enjoyed playing with the remote for the curtains and blinds! We were only (thankfully) passing through, so only stayed one night and didn't have time or desire to try out the restaurants - but they have a little take-away (sandwiches) place, which was very reasonably priced. We put a few cents in the slots - "Panda Pays" - no he doesn't!! We heard very little by way of tinkling coins or cheers, so if you are into gambling, I would probably advise you to go elsewhere. We sat by the pool for a while in the morning - and it was very nice. EXCEPT, that is, for the blasted music coming out from everywhere, including the plant pots!! Why do they do that? I guess I am an old fogey, but there is absolutely no respite from noise! Would stay here again if ever in Vegas again - but that is unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: 123Vegas
Reviews.Content: Our check-in was less than adequate, we arrived slightly earlier than check-in time which was at 2:15 (the check-in is at 3pm) and our room was not ready so the front desk staffer tried to accomodate us by upgrading and upselling us - I just wanted the room I booked I didn't want to pay extra but she was pretty much pushing an upsell. Finally we got to our room, the room itself was nice (decor etc), but the house keeping was terrible. The soap from the previous guest was still in the shower and on the sink it was pretty gross but the worst part was the bedding was not changed, we had a left over bodily fluid (trying to be polite here) on the bedding. I called down to change rooms and of course to complain but they would not move us (said they were booked up) but did send up the head of housekeeping and a maid fairly quickly. I also filed a security report (suggested by the Manager On Duty) the security guard seemed like the only person who actually cared about our situation the rest of the staff acted like it was no big deal and this happens all the time. Disgusting. The security guard tried to get a room change, also to an answer of being full. No one from the front desk called to follow-up on our stay, or to apologise, they just didn't care. I have stayed at several properties in Las Vegas including The Palazzo's sister property The Venetian and have been happy each time so, I was surprised at the lack of caring on the part of the managers & staff I dealt with. By the time I checked out all the manager I spoke with would do (at first) would take off our meal we had that morning as a gester of goodwill ($28). I thought that was not good enough and told them they needed to do better than that to make me happy. Then, finally after waiting 15minutes they decided to comp one night stay (I still think it is not enough). I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five stars hotel. Terrible elevator service.”
Reviews.Author: stefanotrieste
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Palazzo during my tour of Southwestern United States. I had big expectations for this new pretending-to-be-luxurious property after my flawless stay at the Venetian five years ago, but the overall experience at this hotel was quite negative. The room was ok, very big, with three tvs, and the bed was very comfortable, one of the best I have ever slept in. I stayed on the 27th floor, and the elevator service was a nightmare. Out of eight elevators serving that floor, only four were working, and you had to wait five to ten minutes before you could ride one. Sometimes you had to ride an elevator packed like the New York subway at peak time, and it was not a nice experience, especially for women coming from the pool, who often received some rather rude comments by other people. I would have expected a message of excuse posted on the elevator area by the hotel staff, but no one seemed to care. I tried to call room service for breakfast, and the wait was of over one hour... This is not five stars service. I will never stay again in this hotel. Fortunately I moved over to the Four Seasons for the last three days of my Vegas vacation, and that is were the true luxury really is.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Mpmark
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Palazzo on two separate occasions, for a total of 10 nights in June while my boyfriend played in the World Series of Poker. Our first experience there was disappointing but we thought we'd give it another chance mainly because we love the restaurants, shopping, and huge gym. However, we were disappointed again. We stayed in the Sienna suite which has two different layouts which was surprising. While the suites were spacious, they are poorly designed with furniture that was constantly dusty and there was a vomit stain in the couch that housekeeping could not properly clean up. Here are the problems we experienced: room service in morning was over 30 minutes late and food was very average, while one day the food was very early and was cold by the time we were ready to eat. Windows in both suites had hand prints and water spots on the sill (have they heard of windex! They were never cleaned our entire stay), shower in one suite was stuck on 120 degree temp (it took 4 calls to priority services and over 24 hours to get is fixed). Housekeeping was never consistent and cleaning was spotty (even with tips). However, all the staff were friendly and seemed to want to be helpful. There is no fridge other than the mini bar fridge by the wet bar. You would think that a 1400 sq. ft. suite could at least offer this for their guest but you have to have medication or formula to get a fridge which is silly. Again the suites had different layouts. One suite has the walk in closet in living room and a small closet in master room. The space could have been utilized better by making the bathroom larger. The other Sienna suite was a corner room and had a better layout, but had an empty room about 120 sq. ft that had absolutely nothing in it??? The bonus was the bathroom was much larger and the view was awesome, but again the windows were filthy! The spa area at the Venetian needs some renovating as the Palazzo side is not fully open yet (only the small gym there). The services were okay yet overpriced as usual in vegas. The annoying thing is that they make you pay an additional $15 to use the gym even if you spend $150+ on a service. The casino is not really a good gaming environment if you like to gamble and we found the tables to be pretty cold overall. However, the restaurants we ate at were wonderful; Cut, Carnevino, B & B ristorante, Grand Lux cafe, Canyon Ranch cafe, and Delmonico Steakhouse. The pool area is nice but really crowded right now so I skipped hanging out in the heat. I would not recommend this resort to anyone who is a seasoned traveler or has an eye for detail. There are just too many rooms and guests for anyone to get the service they deserve. This place will drive you nuts.

Reviews.Title: “Rough Sheets”
Reviews.Author: shaqquitta
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms look like a modern version of the Venitian. The bathrooms were very nice and the room was spacious. We got a promotional deal for a little less than 200 dollars a night for a weekend stay. All in all the Palazzo is an ok hotel, not as impressive as venetian or bellagio (lobby and casino speaking). My one major complaint, and complaint of many other friends that were staying in adjecent rooms is that the sheets are very rough. They were overly starched and felt very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mshin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week from 19 June to 26 June.The room was in very good condition,spotlessly maintained by our maid and with a great view over the Strip to the mountains.Check in and out were a breeze,with no wait time for the keys.The porters were good,and in fact all the staff were courteous and helpful. In - room breakfast was a treat,and Leila was the best delivery person we can recall at any hotel anywhere,setting the table for us and even offering to serve us. We can recommend Grand Lux Cafe and Morels,both of which are commensurate with a 5 star hotel experience. The bar staff in the Casino are excellent. On top of all that I actually won too! I really can't understand the negative reviews.We are seasoned travellers and expect to be treated well for the price we pay,and our feeling is that we certainly got value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly positive but...”
Reviews.Author: Storygal
Reviews.Content: June 23-26, 08: My husband and I decided to have one last trip before our baby arrived later this year. We wanted a nice place, as this would be my first trip...and a babymoon. We chose the Palazzo. The check in was fast and easy. The room was really large and luxurious. For a new hotel, there were several things that were not perfect...like a broken mirror piece, a drawer that didn't pull properly, and an embellishment piece that came off. In their defense, I suppose you wouldn't notice those things unless you spent time in there...other than cleaning. The service was very efficient. I requested a body pillow since it's difficult for me to sleep (due to the baby). Palazzo didn't have one, but the Venetian did...so got it sent over. Everything was nice. However.... I decided to take a bath the second night there. As soon as I got in the water, I had a prickly sensation. Thought it was the water...added cold water. Long story short, I didn't stay in the water long...broke out into a rash. Everything I used that day was the same. The only different thing was the bath. Later I asked the manager to find out with what housekeeping cleaned their tubs. She left a message saying that they didn't know. (Shouldn't they know this? Don't they buy things as a corporation to clean their hotel?) After I emphasized a little more that it as still bothering me after a full day, they sent up the EMT. They told me it was a heat rash. We live in Dallas. I KNOW heat rash. We've been back a couple of days...the rash is still there. Going to see a doctor...since I don't want anything to happen to the baby because of this. If anyone has had a reaction like this, I'd like to talk to you. So...hotel=great. The tub & the situation...how that was handled, not quite what I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cambria2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. Loved the room - 27th floor with a great view of the Wynn golf course. The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable - my #1 and #2 requirements. I also loved the bathroom and the amenities. Only negative - paying $9.99 per day for the WiFi connection. I suppose this is how they earn extra revenue from the convention crowd, but it is annoying. We paid the extra $100 per night to have access to the conceirge lounge - definitely worth the money. Breakfast in the a.m., drinks and appetizers in the evening, bottled water whenever we wanted it. Room service was good, food was better than average. Special request (extra hangers) was handled quickly. I liked the Palazzo more than the Venetian (where we have stayed several times in the past). It feels smaller and not quite the same rush of people in the casino & lobby areas. We would definitely stay here again. A big part of any vacation or trip for me is the hotel experience. This one was great!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chuckg2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Mon., June 23 thru Weds., June 25th after making our reservations last February to receive the introductory rate of $219.00 per night for a deluxe suite. I'm not sure what qualifies a hotel to be called a "five star hotel" but this hotel was everything we had hoped it would be. Access to the parking garage was easy thru the Sands Ave. entrance on the side street around the corner from Las Vegas Blvd. It didn't matter which level you parked on (P1, P2, P3 or P4) because elevators to the casino and/or hotel rooms didn't require a lot of walking to get to. Check in was slow due to the number of people who had tried to check in early cutting in line to get their room keys when their rooms became available after the 3:00pm check-in time. The rooms (and hotel) were beautiful. This was definately one of the largest and nicest rooms we have stayed in anywhere. The room, and hotel was nicely decorated, clean and quiet. The bed was so comfortable we accidentaly slept in until after 11:00am. Our only complaint with the room, (#7-922) which was on the seventh floor was the lack of any kind of view of anything. When we opened the drapes all we saw was the back wall of the casino. The casino wasn't anything special. Other reviewers have complained about it being too small, but we didn't feel that way. It was quiet compared to other casinos, but maybe that was because it is a classier hotel. We ate in the Grand Lux Cafe twice. Lunch was priced very reasonable compared to other restaurants and had a very diverse menu to choose from. Breakfast prices were on the high side, though, and other diners were commenting that the buffet at $15.99 per person was actually a better deal (My waffle and orange juice cost more than the buffet). The hotel staff was very friendly. The maid put chocolates on our pillows at night, and even filled our ice bucket with fresh ice. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. I probably wouldn't stay here again, but only because of my personal preference for "fun" hotels with their fake "plastic" built in atmosphere. I like the eiffel towers, venetian gondolas, roller-coasters, and fake cobblestone streets and Hard Rock Casino music playing thru-out the hotel/casino.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Plotzo”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMomBC
Reviews.Content: Point of referrence, we have stayed at Wynn and Venetian on past trips to Las Vegas. We just returned from a 3 nt complementary stay at the Palazzo. We checked in on Sunday. When we arrived there was a long line for the general check-in however we had been directed to go to the "invited guest" check-in when we made our reservations. There was one woman at our check in and the line was terribly slow. The general check-in was much quicker. When we finally got our turn I made an effort to thank her for the hotels offer of 3 nts complementary. I mentioned that we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. I requested a non-smoking room and asked if anything was available for early check-in. She was ever so friendly and kind and told us we would love the room she had available on the 28th floor. We were excited until we opened up the door and a stench of cigarette smoke smacked us in the face. Then I looked out the window at our view of the air conditioning units and the dumpsters. I called the concierge and advised him that this room was unacceptable. He immediately moved us to another suite which had a view of the Wynn hotel and pools and golf course. It was also very close to the elevators which was nice. This room was smoke free and lovely. We unpacked and called our friends who had stayed the weekend at the hotel on the same promo and decided to meet in the lobby/casino area for breakfast at Grand Lux Cafe. After waiting nearly 20 minutes to catch an elevator going down that was not full, we decided to get on one that was going up and then take it back down to the casino level. This whole process took us at least 40 minutes as the elevator stopped at each and every floor on the way down, even though it was completely full of people. Another guest of the hotel mentioned that four of the eight elevators in this wing had not been working for the entire weekend and they were still not in service. We finally met our friends and proceeded to the Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast. We all opted for the buffet which was nothing special, eggs made to order and a nice selection of fresh fruits, bacon, sausage and potatoes. The usual fare. It cost $15.00 per person which was reasonable. Once we finished our meal we decided to head out to the pool. Our friends had already reserved us a few lounge chairs and we sat at the main pool. This pool water was as warm as bath water and there were many children in it. We did not enjoy the temperature. Also, while trying to enter the pool I somehow pulled a muscle in my arm which got worse and worse as the day went on. The following day we sat at a smaller pool that had a wonderful jacuzzi and small waterfall. This smaller pool had cool water and very few children. It was much nicer.
