They had water coolers set up in several areas with a table of plastic cups so you could help yourself. This was a nice touch. We never had to wait for drink service and the servers were polite and friendly. The casino was small but busy for midweek. We also played at the Wynn which is our favorite casino and we went downtown which was fun for a change. Over all, I would say that while the Palazzo is the newest version of the Venetian Group hotels, we prefer the Venetian or the Wynn. Still, for the price we paid (nothing), we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Among the Top Echelon on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Palazzo was great. There were a few annoyances, but overall we left feeling positive about the resort. The hotel's best two features are the standard rooms and the restaurant choices, if you include the Venetian as an extension of the Palazzo. I'd stayed at the Venetian several years ago, and was unimpressed. I much prefer the Palazzo decor, although the room layout is similar. Service is somewhat hit and miss but better than the Venetian had been when I had stayed there in 2002. Housekeeping, concierge, valet, and bell desk all performed relatively quickly and efficiently. Even a call to security at midnight when we couldn't get our safe open was met with a prompt and efficient response. Things didn't start well when our room was not readied for 4 hours after we'd checked in. After several unsuccessful attempts to get our keys to a smoking "bella suite", we finally found an agent who spent about 20 minutes trying to find us something. He eventually offered us a hospitality suite. We checked it out, but my companion didn't care for it. (Great furnished patio with huge outdoor fireplace, but it was 112 degrees, so that didn't make up for the murphy bed and small bathroom.) When we called the front desk to say it wouldn't do, we were advised that our real room was finally ready at 5:30 pm. Our room was a 9th floor 2Q "bella suite" with a pool and TI view. The sunken living room area is much more comfortable and pleasantly appointed than had been the Venetian which had felt crowded and fussy. Bed area was comfortable. Closet and drawer space was barely adequate. Two large TVs on the same wall seems at first like a bit of overkill, but since the seating area was as comfortable as the beds, we did find we used both. There is a desk with accessible outlets to plug in a laptop, phone chargers etc. Also a printer that I didn't use. Wired internet access is $9.95 per day. The bathroom is a bit smaller than those at Bellagio, Red Rock and Wynn, but it features a nice separate shower, a small make-up area, separate water closet, double sink, and a TV. Attention men who design bathrooms--You need to add a step or bench in the shower for ladies to use to shave legs and to place extra toiletries. You can't watch TV from the tub since the back of the tub is on the same wall as the TV which was puzzling. Although the hotel seemed to be full, we never heard any noise from neighboring rooms or in the hallways. The Venetian and Palazzo are connected by an indoor shopping corridor, and casino cards, etc all work at both places. The two hotels also share the Canyon Ranch Spa. Be warned: If you enter CRS from the Palazzo side, you'll walk a mile from the check in area to the locker room. The spa was adequate, but I was disappointed after all I'd heard about it. My massage was average, and the steam room and other amenities were smallish and nothing special when compared to Red Rock, Wynn, Bellagio, Paris or Mandalay spas. We ate at Palazzo's Grand Lux cafe for lunch on day 1 in the dining room and at Grand Lux bar on day 2. We preferred eating at the bar than at the crowded and frenetic dining room. We had a satisfying late breakfast/early lunch at Dos Caminos. Dinner at Table 10 was ok but not memorable. My food was good if somewhat uninteresting, but my companion felt her food was oversalted. A dinner of appetizers at the bar at Carnevino the next night, although about the same price as the Table 10 meal, was much more fun. The menu has many innovative dishes to choose from and all were beautifully presented and impeccably cooked and seasoned. We'd made reservations at our favorite restaurant, B&B at the Venetian, for our last night. The food did not disappoint although we experienced a major glitch in service after we were seated. Once we straightened out who would be our server, everything was fine and we left happy. The morning before we left we had breakfast at Bouchon at the Venetian. If you are a breakfast lover, this is a wonderful treat. Unfortunately they stop serving breakfast at 10:30 on weekdays. Although the Palazzo casino is small and can get somewhat loud, compared to the Venetian zoo, the Palazzo's is a zen garden. I prefer the quieter casinos and so I enjoyed it. We did not use the pool due to the extremely hot weather, but it looked adequate. It is shaded until midafternoon, and then there is no shade in the late afternoon. A couple of minor inconveniences: Neither Canyon Ranch Spa nor the Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf concession near the hotel elevators allow you to charge purchases/services to the room. I've stayed at most of the luxury resorts in Vegas and I look forward to returning to Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kaz_from_Manc
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Vegas. The rooms are very well decorated and really make you feel like you're living in luxury. The view from our room was incredible... you can open the curtains with a remote control from your bed! The bathroom is amazing with a little tv and dimmed lighting! The staff are very helpful, although be prepared to tip. The casino area and shops are very nice, upmarket for Vegas, but you can spend time here without spending too much money. The only thing lacking is the pool area which seems enclosed and cramped, even without many people about.

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect use of the pool or quality customer service.”
Reviews.Author: LadyCFO
Reviews.Content: (THE GOOD) The suites themselves are fabulous- new, modern decor which is well maintained with fabulous lighting, and comfortable, good looking furniture. Truly a step ahead of most all other Vegas resorts in terms of style. My room had only one closet, which was the only negative. (I had a concierge luxury view room) The hallways to the suites are also amazing, they're wide, with dim lights and beautiful carpet and crown moldings. The pictures don't do them justice! The casino and resort itself are clean and neat as well. The valet drop off area is separate from the pick up area which is genius! Makes it easy and hassle free. The casino does stink of some flowery smell, just like the venetian which after a while does get old. If you have a sensitivity to fragrance, you will want to rush in and out of the casino like me! (THE BAD) I booked a luxury view concierge level room. In summary, nice feature that has potential, but currently overpriced for the selection of food and times drinks are offered. I personally didn't feel that I got my moneys worth spending the extra $100+ per night for the Concierge Level. Check in is on floor 23 which is the actual Concierge Lounge, which was refreshing, but be prepared, the concierge checking you may offer several sales pitches for the current palazzo and venetian shows. I don't know about you but after a long drive into vegas, I just want to unwind in my room or at a bar, not at the check in desk with a sales pitch. Each time I went to the Concierge Lounge to book a show or dinner they always tried to push their own shows and restaurants, which gets a bit old after a while. On the positive side, the concierge lounge itself was beautiful, with a nice view looking over Treasure Island, and Trump Towers area. The lounge is a spacious area of 6 or 7 Large rooms to hangout in instead of the casino with all the noise. In terms of value, I personally found the extra $100+ a night for the Concierge Lounge a waste of money as the variety of what was offered was pretty slim and the bar was only open from 5-10pm or so. Breakfast is continental, with cereal, some fruit, bagels and toast. The afternoon presentation was the worst. It was exactly the same from day to day: They offered scones, tea, some fruit and biscuits (in the few days I was there, the afternoon trays of food were always full, as they were hardly even touched). Evening presentation and open bar were okay, nothing like the Ritz Carlton Club Levels. They offered mixed nuts, some fruit, and a couple types of cheese, chocolate truffles, crackers and two hot dishes per night (bacon wrapped scallops, teriyaki chicken sticks, mini quiche pizzas, mini beef burritos, mini vegetable egg rolls...) Sadly, the "hot dishes" were never really that hot, and tasted more like cheap bar food. (THE UGLY) Customer Service at the Palazzo is their weakness.The entire pool deck was closed twice during my 4 day stay due to a private party. Management handled the situation very poorly and lied to guests stating that heavy winds mandated the pool closure, which we discovered was not true when we witnessed party tables and waiters being positioned by the pool. I expected more from the hotel in terms of their customer service and willingness to please their guests, while being courteous and honest. I called the Manager to express my frustration in being lied to and losing the pool twice and he truly could care less. He basically pointed the finger (which a good manager should never do) and said he didn't even know about it till moments before the event. He also explained that the pool is never guaranteed to use anyway as it is an amenity. He suggested that I trek in the 120 degree weather to a different hotels pool instead. Due to the frustration of the situation, I asked for his assistance in obtaining alternate accomodations elsewhere, and he then made it very difficult for me to leave by imposing a hefty early departure fee, although this was 11 AM, which meant I could have checked out regularly. I shared my frustration with the Concierge and they seemed to share they same sentiment of not giving a damn. I will spend my hard earned money at the Wynn next time. Don't be fooled by the "newest" hotel on the block, it still has a lot of issues to resolve, starting from the top down (management).

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Property at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: CarleneK
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at The Palazzo. I had my office computer and blackberry stolen from my suite. Missing these items, I phoned the front desk, where I waited on hold to be tranferred to the security office for over 20 minutes. Frustrated and panicked, I hung up and called again - only to be put on hold for another 10 minutes. I finally gave up on the inadequate response and reported the incident to the front desk, where I was ridiculed for not properly locking my business equipment in the appointed safe. With no evidence of an investigation, I received a dismissive form letter from the hotel claiming they found no proof of "unauthorized" entry and that they will not be processing my claim further. It was extremely unsettling to know that someone had penetrated my locked room and the hotel had no regard for my safety or the security of my personal belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Scratch”
Reviews.Author: CJStirling
Reviews.Content: Thought it would be great but was disappointed. First of all, didn't have room with king bed as requested on check in. Was told would get one next day. Went at 11am next day and was told I would have to give up view for a king bed but couldn't get it until later in the day. Went back at 6.40pm and then waited for 4 hours before luggage was moved. Couldn't move luggage ourselves as they demagnetised our original key! So actually ended up without original room and for a time - without luggage!!! Staff not as friendly as they could have been. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo - Great Experience & Value”
Reviews.Author: TravlinLarry
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a mid-June stay at the Palazzo (my first at this property). My wife says "How could I find anything wrong with it - it was everything I wanted." I can't add too much. I originally chose the Palazzo after hearing the MGM Grand now has bed bugs, Wynn refuses to recognize the economic reality and drop prices, and wanted to stay at a 'newer' property. Checked in was quick, smooth, and polite (mid-week check-in). Parking is a breeze. I normally use Valet, but here, the garage is empty, the garage elevators take you almost adjacent to the room elevators, and the self-park garage security is amazing (real people on every level). Got upgraded without asking at check-in to an astounding suite. Never heard hall noise. Not once. I could hear plumbing sounds from the bathrooms above and below our bathroom when in the bathroom. Walk to Mirage is 10 minutes (lobby to lobby). Ceasar's is 20 minutes. TI and Wynn are across the street. One night we ate at Dos Caminos (the on-property Mexican restaurant). A little loud, but good food. Veggie Quesadillas are better than the Shrimp Quesadillas. Margs are an 8 out of 10 (but I'm spoiled). Personnel were very polite and friendly - to the person. Even dealers lacked the snobbieness typical of other upscale central strip properties. Oh, and the beds are OK - not great. A great bed to me is the new ones by Hampton Inn (and, of course, the Four Seasons properties). The Palazzo beds are a bit hard, lumpy, and the linens are stiff and lack thread count. Still I would not say they were uncomfortable, just not what they could have been. This is where we will stay next time...we typically visit Vegas every 6 months. To help judge this review, we've stayed at MGM Grand, TI, Flamingo, Imperial Palace (yes, even there), and Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “NIce, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: Nola76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 2 nights at $260 a night. Check in lines were long and the Supervisor instead of helping to check people in, stood around. First room we got had a broken minibar door. The door was just hanging loose and anyone who inspected the room could have seen it. Stayed on hold for over 15 minutes, was transfered to 2 different departments. Room move. Was informed to go to new room and wait for someone to come bring keys. After 15 minutes of waiting in the hallway, went to FD, wait in line again. When I asked to speak to a Manager, a was put on the phone with one. New room was nice. On day of check out, we requested a late check out which was granted to 12.30PM. Housekeeping knocked on our door times trying to clean our room. Spa staff was not able to take a reservation, I had to call them since I did not have an ID with me. Service at pools very slow. Overall staff seemed desinterested and was not too friendly. It is a beautiful property, but I was not impressed at all for the price I paid. I am sure everyone is different.

Reviews.Title: “Conference at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: darkmuzik
Reviews.Content: Car valet service was very quick and courteous, as was bag handling. Someone should be around to hold the doors for guests handling their own luggage, though, as going though the doors with large roller bags, is very awkward. Decor was generally impressive and constantly kept up, which is necessary for marble and chrome, to keep the look. After hours there were constantly crews buffing the floors, replacing tiles and light bulbs, etc., and they tried to say out of the way of guest traffic, but that is not always possible. All of the staff were friendly, attentive and geniunely outgoing. Registration was very slow. I was with a convention of about 3500 people, and the desk was fully staffed, but still not handling the onslaught. I would expect a hotel to be better prepared for such volume, given that the conference was taking place in their meeting center, and attendees were arriving over roughly two days. I gathered from the conference organizers that the price for food catering of events was stellar. If they were to break it down it was something like forty bucks for a can of coke. So parts of the conference were not inclusive of food, which was a logistical distraction from conference agenda items. In the cases where food was served (lunch or snacks) there were no tables to speak of- a few small ones that looked like bar-boards, but when you serve full lunch buffet with heavy plates, people need tables, not just bean bag chairs. Unclear whether this was the "hotel" or the "conference organizers" fault. This conference is apparently a multi-year contract with the hotel, so I expect these to improve next year when I am here again. The rooms were among the best appointed I have ever seen, given 20 years of business travel. Electric remote-control draperies on the windows, 3 flat screen TV's (including one in the bathroom, the one I watched the most), large-suite-style layout, very comfortable beds with non-allergenic pillows, and sparkling decor everywhere. Electric drapes are unnecessary and over-the-top (typical Vegas style) but are wasteful of electric power and money, and it takes a half hour to figure out how to use them and find the remote. Which did not always work when I pressed the buttons. Some downsides: room price was about $250, which I don't think matches the reputation of Vegas being an "affordable" place to stay. Were I paying for it myself, I'd find it difficult to justify unless it were a honeymoon or something. The tap water isn't much good, but they charge you $5 for a bottle of water. Given the tap quality, they should GIVE you the bottle for free. It is the desert after all, and only a fool tries to subsist on rum and coke. At least they warn you that the "honor bar" is magnetic and charges you the moment you move anything, even if you put it back. This makes it rather expensive to read labels on items, to decide whether to buy them. Escalators were not operating in several cases. The design of the complex is such that many of those, traverse multiple floors, so non-operating escalators are a barrier to aging Baby Boomers as well as potential safety hazards. the room TVs apparently were not all on the same service feed; I saw something interesting on the bathroom TV and wanted to watch it while I did something elsewhere in the suite, but could not find that same channel on either of the other 2 TVs. There were so many channels that it took half an hour to find out what was on. While the conference was going on, the elevators to the tower, went on the fritz. A group of us had to leave one elevator car and get into another one, because the first wouldn't go anywhere, regardless of what button you pushed. GIve the volume of traffic, this could potentially be a serious problem if many of the attendees needed to get to a common place, quickly. As far as I know, it never happened again, but the elevators did behave a bit strangely sometimes. And there were light bulbs out, in various random places (not too shocking since the place is pretty huge) including my room. One of my customers (also attending the conference) said that he had a complete failure of air-conditioning in his room and got a lot of static from the front desk about putting him in a new room. But that is a second-hand story. I told him I would get involved if the hotel did not do right by him, but I guess he eventually got what he wanted. Air conditioning in the conference meeting rooms was unpredictable. My own presentation room was cold enough that they should have issued us jackets. My impression of the food was that it was good, where we could get it, but I noticed a lot of food services were shut down soon after "breakfast" time, which is a problem for people from different timezones. I went to one sit-down-restaurant, next to the Palazzo tower elevator (one I think owned by the Cheesecake Factory) and the service and food were quite good for the price. Checkout was also very slow; to avoid the line I just left my keys in the room and moved out. I hope to eventually see a folio. There wasn't time to stand in that line, and also cover my conference responsibilities, on the last day I was there. But they did look after my bags, so I could vacate my room on a timely manner, and seemed quite willing to do it for an unspecified length of time- this is better than most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: momzee22
Reviews.Content: I so wanted this stay to live up to my expectations. I spent my honeymoon at the Venetian in 1999 and loved every minute. We checked in and were instantly underwhelmed. The room lacked the grandeur of the Venetian and seemed smaller. The floor looked like it had not been vacuumed and some the furniture had chips in it already (the hottel just opened?). The tub had hairs in it from the previous guests and there was dust everywhere, especially on the canopies over each bed. There were paint spots or something in the tub so we called housekeeping to fix it. They did fix it but it took more than an hour of scrubbing. (I felt bad for the gentleman who made things right.) After that, things did improved greatly. The staff was responsive and friendly. The pool (for the non swimmers we are) was fabulous and did offer the resort/luxury experience we were accustomed to in the Venetian. Overall, it seems like all of the attractions and the ultimate experience are at the Venetian. The Palazzo is an addition and somewhat of an afterthought. The shops are very exclusive though. The extra walking was good for my diet and weight control however. Okay is okay if you are not paying luxury prices. For what we paid (and we received an email promotion), I thought we would have had more. We wanted the luxury experience but the decor, the lack of cleanliness and lack of attractions at the Palazzo were not in line with the superior experience we had at the Venetian when it first opened. We spent three days at at the Orleans a day later and would have to work hard to justify paying for the Palazzo again. Maybe the Venetian is still the top of the line. I will have to find out during my next staff (maybe).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: ecb080
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, our stay was perfect! We were able to check in two hours early with no problems. The room was much better than we ever could have imagined--and believe me--I did my research on this place. I was really impressed--much better than the pictures. Hotel itself was beautiful. Nice (expensive) stores and restaurants. We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast which was great. Also ate at Carnevino and LOVED it!!! Great food and wonderful service!! Overall--we would stay at the Palazzo again-over the Wynn. We stayed at the Wynn 2 years ago and loved it too, but the Palazzo was MUCH better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Beantown Lady
Reviews.Content: We received a comp offer from the Palazzo for three nights - not sure why! We did have a players card from the Venetian, but had played there very little, and had never stayed there - I can't stand the scent that is pumped into the air there. We booked at the Palazzo for four nights - 6/9 thru 6/13 - paid for the last night only. The Palazzo does not have that 'scent'....after doing some research on this forum, decided to try it...so glad we did. DH and I absolutely loved this Hotel/Casino. It is first class all the way, but did not feel 'over the top'. We were always very comfortable. I have seen comments that the Casino was small - didn't think so. It also seemed to be very lively - not quiet as some have stated...maybe it is catching on....I also found the machines to be a little looser than those at Harrahs - maybe I just had a lucky couple of days!.. We arrived around 1:00 pm, and our room was ready - we got exactly as requested. The rooms have already been described here, so I won't repeat all of the ammenities - they were all there. Room was very clean, and the maid service was great. Room was always made up as soon as we left in the morning. We also loved the location. When we wanted to head toward Harrahs, we just cut through the Venetian, and came out by the wax museum. Or, if we wanted to head to Wynn, or the Fashion Show Mall, we used the pedistrian walkways over the strip. I was a little concerned about the location, but it was never a problem. Also, it has not been mentioned very much here, but the two hotels connect on both the casino, and upper level. Most of the signs point you to the upper shop level by going up the escalator...but if you pass the escalator and follow the hallway you come out to Delmonicos, and a couple of other restaurants, and then the Blue Man Group box office....which is right around the corner from the Venetian Grand Lux Cafe, in the corner of the casino...no need to go upstairs at all. Also, if you need to print a boarding pass, you can do it for $1.00 per printed page at the Venetian Business Center, which is just past the Blue Man Group showroom, heading towards the Sands Convention Center. All guests are given a code for 10 free minutes of computer time which is more than enough. There are several computers here. Also, if you choose to check out via the TV, you can have a copy of your billed faxed to the machine in your room....very cool! Loved every minute of the Palazzo, and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Five star rooms, 2 star service”
Reviews.Author: davidr9
Reviews.Content: Really disappointing. They aspire to play with the Wynn and the Bellagio in five diamond territory, but the service is strictly holiday inn. It was all about moving the masses. A 30-60 minute wait for a room ended only when I called them two hours later. 10-15 minutes for luggage to arrive turned into an hour. Jeffrey, the front desk manager apologized a lot, but showed no interest in doing anything to help. They just did not care about my business.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...my new favorite Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: valmaster
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay in Las Vegas at the Palazzo hotel. We loved this hotel. I have stayed in almost every other large hotel in Las Vegas and this is by far my most favorite now. The staff was very prompt and friendly. I loved the decor of the rooms...and the suites are a lot larger than many other Las Vegas properties. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I am going back to Las Vegas in about a month and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge level - made the trip great”
Reviews.Author: laurasmom143
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend the Palazzo Hotel. Every room in this hotel is a suite. They are truly beautiful with flat screen TV's (even in the bathroom). It is like being in a luxurious condo. And the hotel is brand new so everything is in perfect condition. But the best thing we did is upgrade to a Concierge Room. It was about $100 extra per night but it was SO worth it. The Concierge Level is an entire floor of the hotel with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Las Vegas. And it is divided into many large beautiful rooms with high-end couches, chairs, tables, a grand piano, and buffets of breakfast food, afternoon snacks, open bar from 5-9 and hor doevres. And the concierge got us show tickets the day of the event for a play - second row center. The staff is very nice and accomodating. Superior service. We would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else in Las Vegas after this experience. We have always stayed at the Bellagio and always felt it could not be topped in beauty. The Palazzo is the equivalent of the Bellagio...and with the concierge upgrade, it exceeds the Bellagio. (I am not sure if the Bellagio has a concierge level.) The lobby of the Bellagio is more beautiful and tastefully done than the Palazzo, because the Palazzo's lobby is so huge that their is no warmth. But the Palazzo rooms are much higher end. And it is hooked on to the Venetian so you can walk right thru the Palazzo casino and be in the Venetian. The restaurants in the Palazzo (we only tried 2) were good. One is an Asian noodle restaurant. The other is Grand Luxe Cafe - similar to Cheesecake Factory (C.F. owns them).

Reviews.Title: “The GOOD, the BAD, and the WEIRD:”
Reviews.Author: ImpressMeNow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Palazzo for 3 nights. We both go to Las Vegas for the restaurants, so let me start by saying that I can't comment on the casino or gambling here. There is a lot to say about this place, but I tried to keep it brief. GOOD: Dining -There are some great new places to dine with my favorites being Morels and Table 10. There is also a wine shop with a great selection of reasonably prices bottles. Amazing for Vegas! Rooms- wonderfully spacious and nearly identical floor plan to the suites in the Venetian. Modern decor and soft colors made for a relaxing room (of course we were far away from the elevators). The rooms were very clean, and equipped with 3 flat screens, a connection for my iPod on the small stereo, and internet for $10/day. My iphone was able to access the internet, so I was able to skip the internet charge. Getting around- there is a really convenient bridge between the Wynn and the Palazzo. It is easy to float back and forth between the two. It is also very easy to go back and forth between the Palazzo and the Venetian. You can get the best of all three places within a short walk. BAD: Dress Codes- Beware the restaurants that turn "nightclub" in the evening hours. I love to dress up, but my husband is more of a shorts and polo type of person, especially in the hot June temperatures in Vegas. He looked casual, but not sloppy! We were very disappointed that Dos Caminos turned us away because he was wearing shorts! Same story for Dal Toro and 40/40 even though it advertises itself as a casual dining, sports bar. Too bad - we probably spend a lot more on food and drinks than some people spend on gambling. (And yes, he could have gone to our room to change, but it was late and he didn't want the hassle.) Pool - I LOVE pools, especially in Vegas, so I was disappointed with the pools at the Palazzo. Some people like that there are many smaller size pools to choose from. However, I found them all to be murky and dirty and littered with children. There are no "adult only" pools here, so there is no escape from the noise and pool toys. If you actually want to swim, none of the pools are large enough to gain any momentum. There is NO SUN before 11:30 except at only one of the pools. It was really far from the bar and chairs fill up super fast! Then, after noon, there is NO SHADE except for a precious few nooks and corners. The only way to guarantee shade is to rent a cabana. I actually preferred the pools at the Venetian. They seemed cleaner and I could find a shady spot when I was ready to. WEIRD Music- the person in charge of selecting the music piped into the common areas should be locked in a tiny room with nothing but his/her music selection! Ok, eighties type music can be fun and nostalgic, but not for 24 hours a day for 3 days! Old Madonna, Prince, Bruce Springsteen, seemed to be in sharp contrast with he understated,modern and elegant decor of the hotel. The music was really loud by the pool, and I thought I was going to go insane if I had to hear another sappy power ballad from 3 decades ago! My ipod was turned way up and I could still hear it. It was also in all common area, and in CUT steakhouse. The waiter claimed it was coincidental, and that CUT was in charge of its own music. Would you like some "Tainted Love" with your Wagyu steak? Double Helix- this is the wine bar attached to the fabulous wine shop. It's very strange that a wine shop with reasonable bottle prices would have such an overpriced bar! Glass prices started around $16/ glass and went up from there. People who don't get excited by wine won't pay those prices, and people who know about wine, know that the glass prices are insanely high. Buy a bottle to go instead. I suppose it depends on what your priorities are, but I did not fall in love with Palazzo. I believe the Venetian (although older) is a better option. Book a room at the Venetian, and just visit the Palazzo. Treat yourself to a nice dinner with the money you save, and be glad that you won't be subjected to Top Hits of the 80's. :)

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Love-to-travelOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo May 4-8. We have previously stayed at The Venetian and TI. We loved that the Palazzo was smaller than the Venetian. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The service was great, although when we arrived in our room the light bulb in the room with the toilet was burned out and it took 3 phone calls and about 6 hours before it was changed. A minor inconvenience. The restaurants and shopping were great. We had a fabulous meal at Cut. The service was outstanding. We found breakfast out by the pool to be very expensive and quite disappointing. We were much more impressed with the poolside breakfast at the Wynn. We will definitely stay here again. The rooms were great for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Bella!”
Reviews.Author: cajundego
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Palazzo which were spur of the moment [checked out of the Luxor within hours! see that review]. From the moment we stepped into the registration area we felt like we were the only ones staying at the hotel. We were greeted with open arms. Our room was unbelievable. They have heavenly beds, which my husband has not stopped talking about. There were 3 flat screen TV's - 1 in the bath room. A separate toilet area, deep tub & separate shower. There is also an area w/ a lighten mirror for your make-up. Each room comes with 2 fluffy terry robes & 2 sets of slippers. The slippers were so comfortable I walked out of hte room w/ them on & then had to turn back to change. This is the only hotel I have stayed at that had a scale - nice for weighing the luggage! The view was of the Wynn gold course and it's pool area. There is a sunken living area that has a sofa that opens up to a bed. My son stayed on this & said it was very comfortable. We were able to indulge in renting a cabana for the day which was perfect. There are 4 Palazzo pools & just as many Venitian pools which you may use as well. The cabana came w/ a flat screen TV, free WiFi, fridge with water & sodas & a fruit tray. There were plenty of lounge chairs, even some in the water w/ tables which was nice. Good sun location as well. I would definitely look at staying here again & would have this as the top of my list for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Spottyonetwo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Palazzo Hotel in Las Vegas. Beautiful entry and great door service upon arrival. Friendly staff. However check-in was slow, with too few attendants. Had a room on the 34th floor, and it was a beautiful suite. Nice and new with a big bathroom, separate toilet, double basins, vanity area. Turndown service with chocolates on the bed. Nice sitting room area with three tv's. One in the bedroom, one in the living room and one in the bathroom., Extremely comfortable bed with plush duvet. This was an extremely enjoyable experience, and one which we hope to repeat again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is fabulous here”
Reviews.Author: Guppy1310
Reviews.Content: Originally we had reserved rooms at the Luxor (check that hotel for our nightmare story) and at the last minute called the Palazzo for two rooms for two nights. They got us two adjacent rooms with our requirements in a golf course view immediately ready (about 3 pm). The employees were so kind and polite "Yes sir" "Yes Ma'am" the whole deal. Pool- amazing! There are four at the Palazzo and access to the Venetian. All chairs are close to the water and there are very shallow ends that have loungers right in them! Shopping- Excellent selection with Shoppes at Palazzo and The Grand Canal in Venetian Restaurants- Everything you want and more. Rooms- WOW. Very comparable to the Wynn. Beds are so comfortable you don't want to get out. Bathrooms are huge, TV above sinks. Bathtub is super deep, shower has 3 heads. Roman shades and blinds operated by remote control. All the amenities you wish you had at home!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JABPA
Reviews.Content: I returned on 6/14/2008 from a 5 night stay. I was very pleased with every aspect of the hotel-casino. Our room was great; they are the same layout as the Venetian, but updated decor. I have stayed at the Venetian and myself, my husband and our friends all felt the Venetian treated you as if it was you honor to stay there rather than it being their honor to have you. The customer service at the Palazzo was completly the opposite. I am not sure why the 2 hotels are so different, even though they are basically 1 hotel, but the Palazzo's customer service was great. The casino was laid out great, and it was happening day or night. The table limits were not too bad. I have stayed at many Vegas hotels and this is my new favorite overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “We Love this Place!”
Reviews.Author: perezk27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 3 nights (5/23-5/26). This was our second time staying at this Resort/Casino and it will not be the last time. This resort is actually owned by the same company that owns the Venetian. All the room are HUGE suites with a sunk in living room area. The bathroom is marvelous - shower is separate from the tub and the toilet has a separate door for extra privacy. There's a vanity (with a full size magnified and lighted mirror) for us ladies who love the idea of having a separate area for our hair and make-up stuff. There's 3 tv's (including one in the bathroom) and a dvd player so that you can just bring your own movies instead of paying too much for the pay per view stuff that they offer. The beds are so comfortable and they offer free turn down service with free chocolates. Housekeeping generally responds to your request on time (although they were running slow during our last stay because it was during memorial day weekend and the hotel was fully booked). Eventhough it was a little bit cold during our stay (which is so unheard of for this time of year in Vegas), we were able to use their pool. It was nicely heated to about 83% and eventhough it wasn't really crowded they still have enough cocktail waitress walking around to make sure that we stay well hydrated :P One thing that we like about this property is that their parking garage is so convenient. You don't have to leave the premises to actually have access to your vehicle. We didn't have to utilize their valet service for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “The Decline of Rome.....”
Reviews.Author: vjdantone
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Venetian for the past few years, and decided to give the new Palazzo a try, since the last time I stayed at the Venetian, found it somewhat worn. Well, the luster of the Palazzo is just that - luster - for when you scratch the surface, I found a hotel that is far from a 5 star property. Problems with check-in, (granted, it was 3 hrs before "real" check in time, but hard to believe that I had to return to the front desk to find out when it was finally ready - the promised phone call never came), and for a new property (less than 7 months old) the room was worn already (broken handle on nightstand, stains on sofa, scratches on furniture), and don't get me started w/ phone calls to various departments that were NEVER returned. I'm also finding that their Comps are the poorest of any casino on the strip, with the exception of their high-class neighbor, the Wynn. All I know is that in the future, I'm probably going to look at other properties that associates have told me where they have had better treatment and a warmer reception. So ciao, Palazzo/Venetian...all that glitters isn't gold.

Reviews.Title: “Some teething problems in this new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tokalosh
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated my wife's 50th birthday at this new hotel with our kids aged 12 and 15 years. This is the newest addition to the Venetian and is linked to it by a shopping mall. The rooms are large and include a living room area. Beautifully decorated and equipped with every convenience including 2 large flat screen TV's and a Fax/Scanner/printer. Bathroom is large. Accommodations are certainly luxurious. There is a convenience store located close to the room elevators which is very handy. No need to walk forever to buy a bottle of water, coffee etc. The Grand Lux Cafe is located in the hotel and has a Take -out section which is very convenient for snack lunch or breakfast. The pool is expansive and welcoming in the heat typical of this city. So what's the downside?? Our room was not madeup until 7pm each day despite several phone calls to complain. There is no shade at the pool. Apparently their umbrellas have not yet arrived. You can rent a cabana but that will cost you $400 per day ! All in all though I would return because the overall experience was positive. At $499 per night though, I expect some shade at the pool and to have my room made up sooner than 7 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Jewel - Beautiful but Imperfect”
Reviews.Author: life_is_my_vacation
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo certainly raises the standards of luxury and goes up strong against competitors like Wynn and Bellagio, but they still have some kinks to work out. Here is a summary of my experience there. CHECK-IN: There was absolutely no wait to check in, and the front desk agent, Robert, was friendly and helpful. We payed for an upgraded Bella Queen View Suite and received a room on the 46th floor overlooking the strip. However, when we went up to the room, the strip view was pretty disappointing. We were so high that we could only see the strip and hotels from right up against the window. We called the front desk and up came Robert, to show us another room. When we went into that room, it smelled terribly of smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. Robert kindly offered that if we just wanted to stay in our original room, he would knock off the view upgrade charge and even take off an extra $10/nt as an apology for showing us the other room that reeked of smoke. VALET: Complimentary, which is pretty amazing! They were always quick to get the car brought up to us. LUGGAGE SERVICE: The hotel's biggest problem, in my opinion. When we checked in, they told us it would be 20 minutes before our bags arrived, but it actually took longer and kinda ruined our night. Because they were late, we were unable to shower and change for our night of a show and dinner, and we almost missed the show completely because our tickets were in our bags. Then, after we checked out and needed to hit the road to get home, they told us it would be AN HOUR before they could send a bellman. AN HOUR! We needed to hit the road, and what if we had a flight to catch?! We had too many bags to lug ourselves and they had probably already shut off our keys so that we couldn't do it in two or three trips, as necessary. We called and spoke to a front desk agent who offered to give us an hour later to stay in our room. WOW, THANKS! That was unacceptable so we spoke to a manager who had a bellman sent up right away. ROOMS: Incredible - best standard rooms on the strip, IMO. Huge rooms, beautiful furnishings, amazing clarity on the HDTVs, gigantic bathroom. The only problem was that we didn't get very hot water in the sinks and the shower took a long time to heat up. POOL: Nice pool complex, but nothing special compared to Mandalay Bay, Mirage, or even Wynn. There are lots of pools, and the chairs in the water are a GREAT feature for the hot summers, but overall it was a little bland and they played weird music. The service was okay - we had to go fetch our own towels both days, and they almost never came around to offer us drinks, but they did come around with chilled cucumbers for the eyes every once in a while. CASINO: Small, but with high ceilings and lots of natural light coming in from the lobby in one direction and the shops from the other. Not too smoky (yet). DECOR: Classy and beautiful, but a little bit boring, to be honest. Whereas Wynn has a whimsical cozy elegance about it, Palazzo is a colder, more flashy elegance, with crystal chandeliers and such. It was beautiful, not doubt, but just came off a little too bland and cold. RESTAURANTS, SHOPS, ETC.: Dos Caminos was wonderful (see my review)! The upscale Shoppes at Palazzo are very nice and fairly easy to get around. We only walked through 40/40 Club, but it was very cool, dark and modern, with great sound and TONS of TVs. Overall, I would say that the rooms at Palazzo are about as nice as it gets on the strip, but I would take Wynn as a complete hotel. Wynn just feels more like a small, boutique hotel and has so much more character and warmth. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Palazzo again, if I got a great rate, but given the choice, I'd go with Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Horrible Sushi Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: pepprdine
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo was excellent. They took the Venetian and added even more luxury and amenities. The only only negative was the only restaurant that has not opened in the hotel due to poor management. One only has to meet the management at this restaurant to find out how unorganized this place is. Nothing like their NY restaurants. The place isn't even open yet and they already have a horrible name in Las Vegas. Typical New Yorkers who come to Vegas to show US how superior they are. The place was supposed to open in January 08 but to date (this was written June 08) the place still is not open. You know why? Because they thought they had a sweet heart deal with PF Changs. Changs was going to buy into their company but once the executives at Chang's took a look at Sushi Samba's financials and then met their upper management they backed out in a hurry. Of course the owners of Sushi Samba had already spent their new found riches from the PF Chang deal only to now scramble to get the project funded. They have cut back a lot on the project do to them running out of money including the management. They try to strong arm their suppliers when they do not have a clue on how to do business in las Vegas. If anyone is looking for a prime location to open a restaurant, give it a year or two and the space that Sushi samba occupies right now will be available. It is a shame too because their two locations in NY are great. The one on Park Avenue has the most knowledgeable General Manager I have ever met. I think his name was Hayes. Unfortunately, they did not bring him out to Vegas. I know a few people that they hired and all of them are saying the place is a disaster. No one has a clue what is going on and everyone is quick to blame someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: G.I.A.-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:30am and they had our standard suite ($199 per night) available although there was no great view the suite was beautiful w/ mini bar which is really nice but pricey little soda $5, beer $7 etc., the bathroom is huge! We had a non-smoking room and that's just what it was the hallway still had the new carpet smell. We're casual smokers but perfer a non-smoking room and we did not smoke in our room. The hotel is in line with the Bellagio and Wynn, very upscale. I rated 5 stars because I don't believe it's like the 4 star hotels in vegas. I can see how some people would complain about somethings for instance...When we arrived our safe wasn't working, but I have to say I called the front desk and within 20 minutes someone was knocking on our door. One of the drawers on the furniture was missing a knob, a couple of light bulbs were burnt out. The tv in the bathroom really is in a bad spot if you like to take a bath you can't see the tv. when someone is showering in the suite directly above you hear it, which was odd because the water pressure was extremely weak, (we didn't hear any other noise from neighbors). These little problems didn't bother us at all. What I didn't like was that there's no coffee maker in the room which is absolutley ridiculous and the coffee shop is really small. Housekeeping was excellent I suggest leaving housekeeping $5 a day we had so many towels,toiletries, clean robes and slippers and the room was spotless. There's two workout rooms you can use one at Palazzo and one at the Venetian, probably the best gym in any hotel I've been at. If you just want to use the gym it's $20 a day. The gym offer free bottled water after our workout my wife and I took two each and brought them to our room, we're big water drinkers. Restaurants: We ordered room service twice each time they said it would be about an hour and it came in an hour, food was excellent, as was the service. We ate at the grand lux cafe one time, hated the food, it's an upscale diner, service was excellent. I forget the name of the restaurant poolside but it's the only one it was excellent, as was the poolside restaurant at the Venetian both are Wolfgang Puck restaurants, excellent service. Pools: lots of them, very nice a wide variety of music playing throughout. All but one pool doesn't get sun until after 12:00pm at the Palazzo guest have access to the Venetian pools as well. Drinks by the pool range from $8 to $12, pool side service little slow. We didn't shop but they all looked open all construction seems to be complete. Casino is a liitle bit on the smaller side but very nice. Service on the floor and at the casino bars was a liitle slow. Guest seemed to be in their early 30's to late 60's mostly everyone was well dressed and very respectful. The thing I like most about the Palazzo is there really isn't any main attractions that brings unwanted crowds except of coarse for the highend shops. If your 22 and looking to party hard you probably like the Palms better than the Palazzo. Jersey boys is an absolute must the show was spectacular! We loved our vacation in general the Palazzo was a great experience the only real thing I hated, was leaving!! Off the property: SW Steakhouse (at the Wynn) was the best dining experience we had in Las Vegas. If interested make your reservation 1 month in advance and request patio seating (weather permitting) by the lake of dreams. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: charlotteguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Memorial Day weekend. Check-in was sooo easy and the front desk was soooo friendly. Rooms--All rooms are suites. Super bathrooms. Great bed...so nice. If the room had a small kitchen I could have lived in it. So great. Pool--Great pool area...plenty of chairs and great afternoon sun. Entertainment--Saw Jersey Boys and it is amazing. My stay was PERFECT. A great place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “It’s in the Details”
Reviews.Author: acpierce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo May 25-27 during the holiday weekend. We were very impressed with the hotel and the location on the strip. It is definitely more upscale and cleaner at that end of the strip near the Wynn and Fashion Show mall. We had a Luxury King Suite and the nice lady at check in upgraded us to a better view and gave us a suite that was ready earlier than the 3 pm check in time, which was nice. We were on the 41st floor. The Palazzo is very grand and beautiful. It is very tall…I was always impressed with the height of the Venetian, but the Palazzo towers over all the hotels in that area of the strip. We had a wonderful view of the Red Rock Mountains, Treasure Island and could see the pool area if we looked down. At the Palazzo, it is truly about the details…from a sparkly clean room stocked with all the amenities, the prompt service when we called to have our drapes fixed (the roman shade worked but the drapes did not from the remote control), to the level of service at concierge (they will print your boarding passes complementary), to the extremely pleasant and eager to please employees, the turndown service and replacing all our towels and toiletries, even though we hung our towels to dry. The whole experience was fantastic and I was happy that the Palazzo cared about “the details.” The amenities are very nice, like the TVs, the bed and the super soft towels. We didn’t spend much time in the room, but the time we were there, I absolutely loved it. The bathroom is so very nice which a separate shower and large soaking tub. I liked the vanity and all the natural stone in the bathroom…it was very grand. We have stayed in some nice places and I would say this rates near the top of our list. We enjoyed The Phantom of the Opera. We sat in the orchestra section right under the chandelier. We could feel the breeze as it came crashing down, just right above us. Even though we knew it was going to come down, we still screeched anyway! It was a fantastic show and I would see it again. Next time, I would like to sit closer so I could see better. Since we were there only 3 days, we did not see any other shows. I would like to return and see Jersey Boys and Love. Hopefully I have the opportunity. We ate some really good meals. We went to The City Grille in the Fashion Show Mall. We had a wonderful server and the meal was good. My cousin’s girlfriend and I were not very hunger so we ordered salads and an appetizer while our husbands ordered steaks. My cousin and his girlfriend live in Vegas, so it was nice of them to hang out with us and take us to the cool places. My husband and I celebrated our anniversary on Monday and went to Canaletto in the Venetian before Phantom. Then, we met our cousin and girlfriend for the show. It was a great evening. We did a lot of gambling and lost some money. But, a fun time was had and I attribute our good time to the beautiful service at the Palazzo. When we return, we will stay there again, hands

Reviews.Title: “OK Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: l0ve2travelco
Reviews.Content: I was here for a work conference, so didn't get to pick the hotel. They "upgraded" me from a King bed to 2 Queens. The rooms are large, but the furniture was a little run down. None of the "extras" that you might expect from a room that could be so nice. The casino is pretty small, and to get from one point in the hotel to any other point takes forever. I used room service 4 different times, and it was never less than 45 minutes (and one time they got the order wrong). No drinking water in the room (not even a minibar). Everything was clean, but it just seemed to be very basic, even though large.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay !”
Reviews.Author: jssfam4
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Thursday late A.M. - all check-in counters open - no wait. Check-in not until 3 P.M. but had room available not only early but comp upgraded two levels! Huge room with a pool view! Second day of stay I needed extra towels, called concierge and extra towels were delivered in less than 5 min. The entire property from the underground parking to the elevators from parking to casino level through elevators to rooms - very well thought out. Casino floor open/roomy and easy to navigate. Wide aisles, even had somone stationed at the aisle cross in the middle to answer questions and give directions. Any employees that had knowledge of your name would address you by name. Very helpful and courteous. Our stay was very relaxing - looking forward to giong back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At The Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: lagirl1004
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible experience at the Palazzo hotel from the moment we checked-in! The level of customer service at this hotel is dreadful and the front desk staff is rude and less than bright (horrible combination.... i can deal with one or the other but not both at the same time). I took my complaints regarding the reservations that they screwed up to 5 different levels of managers/supervisors only to be confronted with the same ambivalent response. Notwithstanding their booking error, they would not return my deposit (full night's stay) and then "offered" to book me for the current rate which was twice as much as the rate I booked online. After arguing for almost 2 hours with 5 different people, we finally accepted their "generous offer" (which was offered by the second to last person we talked to) to charge us only $100 more than our booked rate as opposed to the $200 more that they originally offered ONLY because we had just driven in from Los Angeles and had an exhausted and crying 11-month old baby with us. As if the check-in process was not horrible enough, the room was not cleaned very well (dust everywhere, water in flower vase not changed, etc., not enough towels), service staff while courteous were very slow and messed up our orders/requests each time, no price list for the mini bar, suite phones did not work, etc. If you are expecting a 5-star hotel and are accustomed to staying at the Wynn, Four Seasons or Bellagio, you will NOT like this hotel. We will definitely not be returning and will choose to stay at the Wynn, Four Seasons or Bellagio! (P.S. - This is the first time I have ever gone out of my way to write a review about anything in my life..... but my experience here was sooo bad that I felt I had to warn the unwary potential customer.... go to the WYNN instead!)

Reviews.Title: “May 15-18”
Reviews.Author: ReedMack
Reviews.Content: had a great time in the palazzo...check in was uneventful...fast line we checked in around 230 on friday the 15th. cocktail service was excellent and we were mostly messin around the slots. rooms were excellent the same as the venetian only a more mordern theme...no complaints at all didnt notice anything that others complained about... will definately stay again loved this place

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderfy”
Reviews.Author: auntdacole
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience. It was my first time to Vegas and the Hotel couldn't have been better. A co-worker and I went for a conference and this was the best enviornment. Each room is a suite and they are beautiful. 3 plasma tv's, comfortable (king size) bed and living room. The Casino itself was clean and everyone working there was friendly and helpful. I still can't believe work sent me here. I only hope to get back soon.

Reviews.Title: “It just doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: catoolguy
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas in mid May for a birthday party. My wife and I have stayed at the Venetian numerous times and love both towers. We decided to try the Palazzo and were not disappointed. As other reviewers have stated, in the suite there was a little bit of construction dust on the horizontal surfaces - not much but a little. The windows also need to be cleaned. Both are minor notes. The staff, dealers, front desk, maids and everyone we came in contact with could not have been any nicer or more helpful. This place is stunning. The color scheme is a bit more modern than the Venetian. The marble throughout the public areas has a really neat green in it. The water falls are spectacular in the lobby area. The pool area just meanders about and it was quite easy to find an area by ourselves. The Venetian pool is connected to the Palazzo pool by a short walkway. The Venetian pool has music just blasting due to Tao Beach. Our group was happy that we could not hear it from the Palazzo pool. Depending on what your after, both pools are great. The other pool at the Veneiza tower is also very nice but small. The trees and shrubs are nice. The only problem is that it is in the shade most of the time. For the life of me, I don't get why the pool area closes at 7:00pm. That makes no sense. We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe and Dos Caminos. Both were great and reasonably priced. The service was excellent and the portions very large. It is true that this place is not cheap. If you are looking to splurge for a special occasion or just go on a road trip, this is the place. It is fantastic. You will not be let down.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: freedom53
Reviews.Content: We returned from a stay at the Palazzo May 14. We had read the reviews posted and noted a lot of negative comments. I must say that according to our experience there doesn't seem to be any basis for these. We had an efficient check in procedure and found our room in excellent condition. The turn down service was hit and miss but for us it wasn't a big deal. One of the girls gave us enough chocolates to satisfy us for our stay and still have some to bring home. The housekeeping staff on our floor were excellent and efficient. The services in the hotel were definitely 5star but some of the design features didn't really appeal to us. Whoever configured the bathroom totally missed the point. There is a flat screen TV that is not visible when soaking in the tub. Either the tub is facing the wrong way or the screen is on the wrong wall. Also, I think the signage is very poor. You really have to be alert when looking for the elevators in the parking garage or the ice machines on the floors. Also, they are lacking in automated doors for the disabled. There are handicapped parking stalls along side the entrance but no button to push to open the doors. The Palazzo has not taken the place of the Wynn for us and given a choice we will always take the Wynn. It will do as a 2nd choice for us but this doesn't mean it doesn't justify a 5star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Still needs work for a 5 diamond hotel”
Reviews.Author: il0vemyhubby
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas approximately 2-5 times a year. We alternate our stays between MGM, NYNY, Mirage, IT, Bellagio and the Venetian. For a 5 diamond hotel, I expected MORE. It just opened in January and I don't think the hotel was prepared to open. The service lacked the level of attention you would expect at a hotel of this calibur. We waited over 2 hours (in the middle of the night, cause we got in late) for housekeeping to deliver extra towels and pillows. We were late to a dinner reservation because the valet "misplaced" our car. As a result, we lost our dinner reservation and had to wait an additional hour to be seated. When I expressed these concerns to an Executive Casino Host, he said that they aren't operating up to 100% because of the lack of staff available in Las Vegas. I personally found that hard to believe. Then he basically told me there was nothing he could do for our inconveniences. Maybe this hotel needs some more training or time to get "up to speed"...but if you are going to spend some money on a suite and get lack lustre service, to me - it's definitely not worth the money. If you are looking for GREAT service and good accomodations - basically more for your dollar...You could stay at a 4* hotel, pay 1/3 of 1/2 the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best!”
Reviews.Author: JakeSD
Reviews.Content: 700+ square foot suite with 3 LCD TVs. Everything about the room, the casino, the pool, the entire property - just first class. Many hotels have hi-def TVs, but they usually don't offer hi-def programming, so what's the point? The Palazzo rooms not only have LCDs, but with tons of hi-def programming to boot. Get yourself into this property now, before word gets out and they start charging $400/night.

Reviews.Title: “7 days in palazzo”
Reviews.Author: hermine56
Reviews.Content: we stayed 6 nights in this hotel...I will try to resume.... i booked the nights on the website, then i receive an offer for "suite life s style" 10$ more expensive, so good deal i accepted, gave my credit card number etc..for me i though everything ok.not easy to contact palazzo by e mail, and not fast. *we arrived at 12..check in quick, for the line..the lady gave me a room number 38th floor.and i asked for my package she said no, because for her nothing in my booking shows a change.i was upset, i lost some times explaining but she didn t want to do a thing.i asked in my booking a smoking room, and i repeat at checked that request, she said ok. *arriving in the room with all bags..not easy very long way. i ve seen no ashtray inside the room.i ve lost my belief in the legit of reservation service.I contact the check in, the man said, in a condescending way, that it s not a smoking room I had to pick up my bag and go back to check in.no apologize, no offer to take care of my bags for free, he wanted me to pay! *according to which floor you are it s not the same elevators * so we bring back our bags to check in level..5pieces 2 people!carpet so hard with wheels! *no waitting line, the lady gave me a new room 29th floor.I was so upset but no urge to shout...i was just repel!she stayed condescending, no matter of whats happen and she has made me understand that I annoyed her more than anything else!i try to explain that problems could happen but an hotel like that had to fix it without annoying guests.she said for the package I had to pay 400$ more if i wanted it!i though it was a joke!i said no *the new room was soooooooo far at the end of the 2 corridors..long walk..but i didn t want to change or say something *after one hour the lady at check in contact me in the room, she had changed her mind (lol) saying that she contact booking reservation not a trace of my mail..I said ok I will go to business center to print it..I appreciate that she called me back.she offers me again to pay for the change 400$...2 days after i spent times to go to business center, print my e mails, i went to check in the lady didn t want to do a thing, but i insisted saying that i have the evidence..she asked the manager and they gave me more then expected...lot of time lost, but they fix it.what a shame to have to do it by myself as it was Their mistake! ************the suite******************************** the suite was beautiful...some dusts but no matter because it was so great to have a big suite with big sofa, 2 big beds..big lavatory with shower and bathtub seperate, wc seperate with door, very good....very good suite, really better then belagio.. *************housekeeping************************** as long as we stayed 6 nights i wanted to give the tip at the end.i understood my mistake, 2 nights we had chocolate waitting for us on the beds, soaps changed each days...but then nothing!exept the last night!!so if you want the maximum, give tips everyday!!!they change towels, make the beds but no rejuvenate during all weeks **************swimings pools**************************** a lot of choice. they are all shadowed before 12 exept one! the last one before venetian..less people, because all guests go to the first one which is big but too many people..the last was is perfect..deckchair in the swiming pool it s so awesome! the drinks prices are reasonable (started at 9$) but no many waittress, very long wait to have a drink, and check your bill because each day there was a mistake for me! ***************spas******************************************** not open in palazzo, should go to venetian the spa access (35$ per day) give access to hammam,fitness center, sauna, jaccuzi, drinks,fruits.small area for lot of women. ***************casino********************************************* smaller then in venetian, less people also, not so noise, but very cold inside.no many waittress to have a drink...but we still in 1cent slot, that s perhaps the explanation..i really prefered venetian casinos..it s more casinos moods.but it s quiet in palazzo so it s a good point for those who want that. ***************breakfast******************************************* to have just a cofee it s a huge line!!better go to th puck coffee at swiming pools, no waitting there.very expensive whereever you go for what you have.... ***************dining*********************************************** we only went to grand luxe cafe in palazzo. reasonable prices, good food, waittress very nice, good memories, they remember all guest!!!i was impressed!!! what you can do for lunch not expensive, is to go to the wallgreen 15min walking direction frontier hotel (closed) and you have the supermarket, take sandwiches for the morrow it s really cheaper!!!quarter less then in hotel! in fashion mall just on the other side of the street you have the food court really cheaper with a lot of choice. ****************parking**********************************************pass by sands avenue..easy to find....you have elevators which arrived next to check in and the others next to guests elevators. ****************garnishment****************************** more impressed in venetian.restrained in palazzo...nothing to compare...the venetian is beautiful, the palazzo has no really garnishment exept the fountain....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: SP_Tampa
Reviews.Content: May 10, 2008 - May 13, 2008 Just got back from 3 night at the Palazzo. They sent an offer for free suite up to 3 nights. Was nervous..since it was free. OMG...it is awesome. The suites are fantastic. The service was impeccable. I would recommend this place to everyone. The fitness equipment in the gym was state of the art! The food, the cleaniness, the atmosphere all were really great. If you get this offer go. Hands down the best in Vegas. I stayed at the Wynn last time and this place blew them away!!!!!! Sue from Tampa

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTraveler78
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. I was in town for a conference and this place is awesome. I was in the basic suite which is far from basic- I had 3 plasma tv's including one in the bathroom. The quality of everything is amazing-- the bed, the furniture, lighting, etc. This is the best room I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed at the Bellagio once. The common areas are clean and the air smells good. Location is good too. Casino seemed a little small but I am not a big gambler so what? It is attached to the Venetian. There doesn't seem to be many restaurants or shops but possibly because it is new. I would LOVE to stay there again. Heck, I'd live in that room!! I asked for a strip view and they wanted $50/night more so I passed on it. Service was good too. They didn't treat you like 2nd class if you weren't a "high roller".

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: mhick
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have been to Vegas and this is by far one of the nicest hotels there. The suites are new and enormous. It has all the amenities that you need. There are many pros to this hotel: New Connected to the Venetian and all the shops Centrally located Really nice pool area-several jacuzzis and pool Pool area is neatly kept Staff is exceptional/helpful Fabulous spa Can use the facilites at the Venetian Medium sized casino The restaurant Tao was delicious (just like the one in nyc) --tip-make reservations at least 2 days prior! Cons The Palazzo/Venetian are so tall that they shade the pools from the sun until about 12:30 Pool closes early in the off season (7pm) Summer season-8 No cushions on the lounge chairs like at the Venetian

Reviews.Title: “Great New Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkhemmer
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for Spring Break and stayed at the Palazzo. The hotel is in a convenient mid strip location. The spa and pool were not open yet but the hotel provided access to the Venetian facilities. The room was spotless and had plenty of space. Our only problem was with the housekeeping staff which daily removed our soap products and forgot to replace them. We felt this was an understandable glitch given the gigantic size of the hotel and the short amount of time it had been open. Each time we called the dront desk the problem was quickly remedied. We were very impressed with the rapid check in process. The public areas of the hotel and adjacent mall are spectacular. After the pool and spa open this hotel should be a viable alternative to Bellagio and the Wynn which is just to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Two Stays at Palazzo in 3 months, Third Stay Soon!”
Reviews.Author: Talldarkhandsomest
Reviews.Content: Put simply, I go to Vegas a ton since I live in LA and it's only a 4 hour drive. I think my upcoming trip over memorial day weekend will be my 5th or 6th trip this year and 2008 isn't even half over! I've stayed at many strip hotels and the only one that trumps the Palazzo as far as glitz and glamour is the Wynn. Please note though, that there are a couple deals to be had at the Palazzo and none that I recognized at Wynn. Dining is probably the one important area that stands out in comparison; you can find a reasonably priced meal with good service and atmosphere at the Palazzo. You will also find great service and atmosphere at the Wynn but will pay through the nose. Put bluntly, if you are here at this site trying to make a choice of which is your best Vegas option and money is not a factor--choose the Wynn. If you are not a multi-millionaire choose the Palazzo. After all, the Wynn is right next door to the north and you can always go walk through it for free!! Rooms: They are terrific in just about every way. Large bathrooms with private enclosed toilet and his and her sinks. Soaking tub and seperate shower are included. Marble is used. Mini bar in every room stocked with goodies but you will pay minibar rates. The regular rooms are in excess of 700sq. ft. making them great for sharing with friends. They all include a "sunken" living area with a couch big enough for 6 people sitting or two sleeping. The flat screen TV's (three total, one in sleeping area, one in living area and one in bathroom) are big enough, but the really cool "5 star" touch is that they are High Definition TV's. And if you are into sports like me you can't go back to watching games in regular broadcast format if you are used to HDTV, Amazing Difference. The beds are comfy with ample pillow supply. Some little cool standouts that are somewhat unique are the remote controlled blinds/shutters and the light up dresser drawers. (there is a little switch on the side that when flicked lights up the glass like you are in a swanky bar. If you have champagne or liquor on the table they have an automatic "back light.") Casino: Manageable, meaning not so huge that you feel overwhelmed. Good layout in that the slots and table games are all in a centralized area just off the main elevators. The Sports Book is downstairs next to the main valet. It is small but Jay Z has a sports themed restaurant/club called the "40/40 club". Tons of TV's, it was never crowded in winter or spring but I've yet to see it during football season (that's in Autumn, Ladies) I imagine it will be packed then. This club has an incredibly huge menu that offers up such delicacies as fried twinkies and fried snickers candybars! There are also single drinks on the menu that cost more than a THOUSAND dollars for those of you who need to show that you aren't used to having money just yet. I enjoyed myself at this place as you can find food and drinks that are good and priced well enough; but I shook my head at a few strange menu choices. Oh well, to each his own. Pools: They don't have great water features like Mirage or Mandalay Bay, or a "European Pool" for that matter, but there are several of them with good drink service and a large central bar with HDTV's. I thought it was layed out well and attractive. Gym/Spa: When I was last there in April the Palazzo's own gym was not yet ready so you have to take this really long underground passage to the Venetian's gym. It is a very nice gym though with tons of free weights and plenty of cardio equipment. Also, there is 50-60ft rock climbing wall for adventure enthusiasts. Every once in a while you would hear loud cheering for someone who was stuck on the wall! I really enjoyed relaxing in the common spa areas even though I didn't get a personalized treatment/massage. There is a package available for a reasonable 20-25 dollar per day fee to use the gym and spa. Dining: Very pleased here with the selection; especially the fact that they have a Grand Lux Cafe that serves up huge portions at a very competitive price. Very much like eating at PF Chang's or Cheesecake Factory. Also, we had a meal at the mexican restaurant--I forget the name but it's just off the main elevators. Great decor and atmosphere and the food and service where excellent. I highly recommend this place because it is not ridiculously expensive. Salsa was great and the sangria was top notch. (I'm in the wine business so I look for good sangria) Mario Batali has a couple of joints at this resort which I look forward to trying over Memorial Day. Shops: Not a shopper but I can recognize good quality when I see it. You have big name brands and more boutique stuff. Pricey, but hey, what did you expect. The shops are very easy to get to as they are just off the main casino floor a hundred yards or so from the elevators to the rooms. This corridor where the shops are (and most of the restaurants for that matter) leads you straight into the Venetian. I much prefer the "set apart" feel of the Palazzo, it really is much more manageable and not nearly as hectic as the Venetian even though the two are connected by this corridor. You have the best of both or just your own little haven. Coffee: Hey, most people think it deserves its own category! Sorry, it's not in the rooms so you will have to saunter bleary eyed and with no makeup downstairs to Esspressomere, not too far from elevators in the shopping corridor. Very good coffee and breakfast pastries not to mention to die for gelato and sorbet for desserts. Right next to the main elevators a Coffee Bean is being constructed but was not ready yet in April. I don't even want to imagine how long the lines will be considering it sits right next to the entrance to the room elevators--Yikes!! Overall: Top notch and no reason exists not to check this place out for yourself. Since we go so much and do the Vegas thing (i.e., gambling, we always stay for free so that should factor into this review. I may be more critical if I had to pay $400-500 per nite.) But even then, this place is aesthetically beautiful and graceful. It is not at all gaudy or tasteless. A few of the main sculptures and water features are pure photo opportunities. I always treat service professionals well and they return the favor. You would really have to be a spoiled person not to enjoy what you see here in my opinion. Have a great trip and feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel with service issues”
Reviews.Author: bakery
Reviews.Content: Service was mediocre in many areas, but the biggest issue we had was trying to get clean towels. We were going out at 7 pm with my husband's business colleagues, and I wanted to shower first. Our room hadn't been serviced as of 5:00, so I called the concierge to get the extension for housekeeping. (There isn't a direct connection to housekeeping from the room phones, which perhaps tells you all you need to know.) The concierge volunteered to call housekeeping on our behalf, so I happily let him do it. Half an hour later, no towels had arrived, so I called back. The first thing that happened was that I got chewed out by housekeeping for not calling them directly! They then promised to send the towels right away. I asked them what "right away" meant and they said "half an hour"!. By 6:00 I still didn't have any towels and I called for a third time.
