I spoke to the supervisor who told me they were very busy, but promised to get me towels right away. I finally got a clean towel at 6:20, delivered sullenly with no apology. The rooms are what I'd call "bland glitzy" -- you could be in any hotel room in any city in the world. They're certainly comfortable, but nothing special. Even forgetting the service issues, I have stayed in far nicer hotel rooms for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: nitromarkkr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Palazzo April 10-13, 2008. We really liked this place. The pool just opened during our stay and there is a walkway over to the Venetian's pools. The only thing disappointing was the Race/Sports Book but you can just walk over to the Venetian for that so not a big deal. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Intro to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rugger64
Reviews.Content: Were a bit leery of Vegas, thinking it might not be our scene. However, though still not huge gambling fans, we ultimately enjoyed our trip to LV... liked the entertainment and dining options and LOVED the Palazzo. Classy, clean, modern (3 Flat-screen TVs in our suite!), spacious, high tech... you name it, the Palazzo has it. We could have spent the entire stay in our room and had a good time - though that would have been silly in Vegas. Not going to get into the rest of the facility much except to note that it also seemed to have everything one could want (top-notch shopping, good restaurants, shows, the casino, etc.). Viewed a friend's room at the Venetian and would highly recommend going with the Palazzo instead, as the P seems to be an updated and improved version of its older sibling V.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo: It's shiny and new but look elsewhere before you book.”
Reviews.Author: FinneusFog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is visually stunning. The rooms are spacious and luxuriously equipped and it all just feels nice, new and clean. This was my first visit and I left underwhelmed - we visit Vegas regularly and for future trips the hotel will be priorirtized third behind Bellagio and Wynn. The rooms boast a strip view - don't be fooled by this. We had a room high up at at the front of the building and the Strip View is limited to Treasure Island and Trump Tower. Plus, what is all that junk that they store on top of the buildings below??? - it's out of view from the people at street level but an eyesore to the folks staying in the hotel. The clock in the room was many hours wrong and there's no easy way to change it. It took four calls for somebody to come and fix it - they corrected the time but set it so the alarm came on at 3.30am. Aaaarrrgghhh. The remote control for the drapes didn't work consistently. There was no mini-bar. Although, to be honest, I don't care about that. No pens or pencils. No turndown service. The plumbing in the toilet means that the water runs all the time. One of the dealers attributed the poor quality of the housekeeping to the nationality of the workers - it was all very racist. I think that the problem is with the management team and not where the workers come from. We had lunch at Morels. We ate at the bar where it looked like the barman really wasn't interetsed in being there. The food was simply dreadful - the food at the airport is better, no kidding! Oh, and why do prospective job applicants have to fill their forms in right in the middle of the bar? He was sitting outside Harrah's later draining a can of beer...I wonder if he got the job? Free advice is worth what you pay for it! My advice is either take the risk and try it for your yourselves or try the Bellagio and Wynn first; my experinece is that they are both way better right now.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: lucysTexas
Reviews.Content: Can't complain terribly, but wasn't impressed with my stay. Hotel's only been open for a few months and staff seemed confused. Check in experience was... interesting. A staff member stood there shouting at all three of us in line to keep a single file line. Very innapropriate. Room was already showing signs of wear and tear. Cigarette burns (in a non-smoking room) and mystery stains on furniture. Sink was missing drain cap. Loose marble and caulking in the bathroom. Housekeeping was a disaster. Walked into the room after checking in to find that the trashbin hadn't been emptied from the previous guest. Bathtub was filthy. The next day, I didn't get service until late in the afternoon, which was strange because the hotel was definitely nowhere near capacity. Had to call the front desk to arrange to have the room cleaned. Very inconvenient. Toiletries were not replaced. Ugh, found a pubic hair in the ice bucket. On a positive note, room service (watch out, 18% tip is already added to your bill) was quick. Skip Woo's try Jade. I wouldn't give it a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo very elegant and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CASandy8
Reviews.Content: Palazzo is the new extension of the Venetian property in Las Vegas. They are connected by their shopping malls. Palazzo has an overall feeling of serenity and elegance. Even the casino is relatively quiet. The colors and decoration are subdued and understated. The rooms, which are all suites in the image of the rooms at Venetian, are beautifully and lavishly decorated in contrast to the public areas, complete with three flat screen t.v.'s. remote controlled drapes and shades, a copy/fax machine and a comfortable sunken lounge area. Every single staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. We ate in the closest thing to a coffee shop they have which is still elegant with classic decor and great service. The food was very plentiful, not artsy little leave-you-hungry portions, and each of our dishes was excellent. It was no more expensive than the coffee shops at Wynn and Treasure Island where we also ate, but the quality and selection were incomperable. The Grand Lux Cafe at Palazzo is a hidden gem. The shops at Palazzo are all very high end. There's nothing tacky or junky in the whole building. Even the hotel gift/convenience store is stocked with nice, non-junky items. For anyone who wants to do more average-price shopping, the Canal Shops at Venetian and all that lovely atmosphere in there are just steps away. The whimsical Wynn property is connected by a pedestrian bridge on the other side. We went to Palazzo for a sixtieth birthday celebration and it lived up to our expectations in every way. It's a refreshing, restful retreat from all the noise and craziness of Las Vegas but still close enough to lots of action and entertainment for anyone's taste.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - This place over books”
Reviews.Author: shanenolan2
Reviews.Content: So when you arrive at 7Pm from an east coast flight, you think just maybe your room that you have reserved and paid a deposit on would be ready. Not ! Having had a similar experience last year with the sister hotel The Venetian , the problem did not surprise me. Now I was not alone as the desk clerk who was dealing with many frustrated arriving guests confided that they were over booked by 118% . It was the old story, check your luggage and we will call you in a few hours. The best answer to this is "DON'T BUDGE FROM THE FRONT DESK" . They will find you a room if for no reason but to get you out of their hair. To the occaissional visitor, many will so say "no big deal" . The Venetian/Palazzo must bet on this reaction as the property continues to take advantage of travelers in this way. From my perspective, its a big signal to take my hotel dollars and go find something more reliable. This is not a cheap hotel and guests deserve better treatment. As for the Palazzo itself, this new sister of the Venetian is aimed at a younger crowd who may not really no what real luxury is. The architecture is more modern than the traditional style of the Venetian Hotel next door ( where you could almost think you were in Italy). The rooms are similar in size to the Venetian but the luxury is quite superficial now. Cheap fittings in the room and the bathrooms. Speaking of bathrooms , guys ...advise your significant other to bring a strong flash light if they plan to apply make up in the bathroom ( or the bedroom). The lighting is non existant. All the light bulbs in the bathroom are the 25w "candlabra type bulbs save a few regular lights in the ceiling. The best lighting is actually in the bath tub area ??? They no doubt do this under the guise of conservation but they have taken it to a rediculous level. Anyway my suggestion if you are looking for a reliable luxury hotel, go up the strip to the Four Seasons where they still think the customer is valuable.

Reviews.Title: “the pallazo was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: stealth1178
Reviews.Content: having just returned from the pallazo i just had to write a review. i go to vegas twice a year and usually stay at mgm or mirage. and i always have problems there but stay because of the comps through the palyers club card. so of course on this trip i had problems with the mirage. so i decided to try the palazzo out. i am so glad i did. in all the times i have been to vegas i have never been treated so good. the room was great and had a great view of the strip. what sets the pallazo apart is how friendly all the staff are. everytime i passed by someone they said hello or asked if i needed any help.the casino area is great and they play great music and you never have to wait for a drink.out of all my trips to vegas this was the best thanks to everyone at the pallazo.i will be going back in august and can not wait. stay at the pallazo you will be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Palazzo especially after NYC hotels”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I was rather impressed with the Palazzo (even though the first few reviewers had voiced their disappointments). This is my first time in Vegas and I must say for the price that I'm paying... the room at the Palazzo is definitely much much better than those in NYC. The room was new and clean. I loved the design of the suites, spacious and modern. I hope the room will be well maintained for the next few years. The only disappointment which I did have was that what the guy had promised me at check-in was different from what the concierge level could provide me. I was promised a late check out at 4pm at the front desk (if the room is available) but was told by the concierge lounge that I will need to pay for that. What inconsistent service! I did upgrade my room to enjoy the view (facing the strip) and the facilities at the concierge lounge. For the additional $100, I thought it was rather value for money. It comes with continental breakfast, afternoon presentation and evening drinks. However, I am rather disappointed to find out that even with the concierge lounge facilities, you still need to pay $35 per day to use the gym and spa! I feel that this is totally absurd! It should be complimentary. Anyway, I really hope that they can improve their offering. For those who just want a clean nice room, I would say Palazzo is quite good. Other than that, don't expect anything more. Finally, I must compliment the service staff at the concierge lounge. They are excellent and always attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: TrippySydney
Reviews.Content: As expected of a newly-opened property, the hotel felt very fresh and new. It certainly isn't as over-the-top or half as busy in the public areas as the other hotels along the strip. Which is a good thing because you don't have to fight to get a seat at the casino tables. I spent an entire night at a table and enjoying the quiet and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “I never thought this would happen to me...”
Reviews.Author: VegasTravelDad
Reviews.Content: Wow. How often can you say that your reality exceeded your expectations? Not very often. At least not for me 29 times out of 30. This was the 1 time out of 30. Back in February I was feeling somewhat blue and decided a trip to Las Vegas was in the cards. I soon found out I wasn't the only one feeling this way. I had a roomful of friends feeling blue too. A trip for 2 soon turned out to be 17. Using the "Name Your Price" feature on Priceline we obtained rooms for $180 per night. Considering this included a Saturday night stay, it was a fantastic deal. Our limousine (that's the way I roll!) had at us at the hotel at 1:00 p.m. There were very few people checking in ahead of us, and much to my surprise our rooms were ready. I found the front desk staff to be helpful and friendly. As described by so many others, the rooms were beautiful. Tastefully decorated and well appointed, not to mention spacious. We had no issues with housekeeping. Our rooms were always made up by the time we returned to them in the afternoons. The swimming pool deck is gorgeous. Next time I plan on spending more than the token 10 minutes I was there. It's that beautiful. It does take awhile for the entire deck to be bathed in sunlight, but there are sunny spots to be found well before noon. The casino staff are friendly and helpful. Table limits during the day were reasonable ($10 blackjack was readily available). Limits were raised late afternoon. If you are looking for lower limit tables, try Treasure Island across the street. $5 blackjack tables were plentiful. I've read some reviews with complaints directed at security staff. C'mon, is it really too much to be asked to show a room key before approaching the elevators? It's a minor inconvenience at most, and a small one at that if it ensures that only registered guests (and friends) make it to the guestroom floor. I would like to report one minor complaint though. I did see one guest playing slots late one night (well, early morning actually) while in her bathrobe! Yo! Security must have been on a shift change at that time! All in all, it was a wonderful trip at a wonderful resort. It was a five star experience all the way.

Reviews.Title: “You can and SHOULD do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: traveller4444
Reviews.Content: Several things help point me to one of the newer hotels on the strip. The few reviews I saw with negatives I thought were attributed to the rush of opening a new mega-resort. But let me share my first hand experiences with you... After three days here, the ONLY two people that offered any resemblance of caring whether you are here of not, was the invited guest check-in guy (MIcheal?) and the other fellow that greets you and points you to the next check-in person. Both, super nice in ever way. After check in, we scurry up to the room to find it a mess in many ways which you likely will not believe, especially given that they have been open for five months. There is a light bulb burnt out, the phone didn't work, there was a MISSING light fixture on the wall, bath robes missing, a flower vase complete with dead flower remnants and soiled vase, missing knobs on some of the wall switches, and a safe that didn't work properly (wouldn't lock). Well, I stayed in Trump in Chicago a couple weeks ago and noticed a little sign that said "feel free to keep the robes and we'll bill them to your account". Pretty standard. But since all we had in Pilazzo were robe hangars, I mentioned it to the staff, hoping not to be billed for it later. They explained there were just out of robes. They did replace the phone. They did not fix the wall fixture, bathroom knobs broken, the toilet running, flower vase, the safe, etc. And let me go on to say this about the staff, in generalization. They don't care. They use the guest elevators even though they have a ton of service elevators....guys with plungers dripping, guards laughing and checking out the ladies for way too long, yelling back and forth to one another...there is MORE professionalism to be found at the public pools in mid-summer! Steve Wynn...buy this place! There seems to be no sense of professional, service-mindedness anywhere. The ash tray in the common areas are VOID of sand for butts. No big deal, but looks like crap. Pour the sand in and emboss it with a big "P"? Take some pride in your property! I'm from Indiana, so I'm not some elite Orange County snob socialite...but I do notice, and appreciate, customer service when its there. You will not find it here, or if you do, only once in a blue moon, on an individual, limited basis only. And I'd bet it wasn't taught to them, they're just the naturals. The old timers that opened Venetian seem cool. The new folks are just waiting for the paycheck. Don't get me wrong o the generalization... had one really SWEET dealer from Chicago! The best! Grand Lux restaurant is all you need for every meal. So good. But the casino is dead. The house keepers simple do not care (won't say hello, for example) security guards are everywhere but lean up against the walls, and literally ogle at the hot chicks (which is fine off duty, right?), and spend time lazing around gossiping with other staffers. In summary it was the attitude of the property that upper management simply doesn't CARE about the place. Its like Sheldon is some "out-of-town-landlord-from-hell" kind of thing going on. Another way to summarize is that it is more like a Motel 8 or Red Roof Inn than a Wynn, Bellagio or Mirage...for example. I hear the same from other folks I have met on the elevator and in the casino. And for the money, I won't be back. I vote with my dollars on things, ya know. I DO hope they here my message and others like it and turn it around. I wish them much luck. But corporate culture is SO hard to change, one ingrained. They just don't care about anything but the almighty dollar, and when the staff knows this, the customers soon will too. Another example, WiFi costs you $10 a day and they don't tell you that on their website or when you make the reservation or when you check in. Sorry this is so negative. I usually look for more good things to say. But honestly, there isn't much more. The pool area is plain, poorly laid out, and the casino is cold and impersonal. The elevators are GREAT...you might have to wait 30 seconds...max. The water stinks and tastes AWFUL...from high chlorine to heavy salt! Low water pressure and little HOT water during the day. So Pilazzo, Venetian (by Sands association only) salute your customers, take pride in your building and I promise, the rewards will be yours.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: HighMaintenanceGal
Reviews.Content: The new Palazzo hotel in Las Vegas is five star all the way!. Our beautiful and comfortable suite (all Palazzo rooms are suites) overlooked the Vegas strip and we could watch the pirate ship show every evening at the Treasure Island hotel across the street (complete with fireworks), from the comfort of our room. Because of our jobs, my husband and I have been fortunate enough to stay in suites at some of the top hotels in the world. When we travel for pleasure to Vegas twice a year we seek out the best of the best. Last year we stayed in the Tower Suites at the Wynn, which has its own separate entrance, elevators, pool and valets, and although there were his and hers luxury bathrooms, the room itself (at three times the price!) just didn't add up to the value we received and the comfort of the suite we had at the Palazzo. The layout of the room, at 720 square feet, was wonderfully thought out. The room is basically divided into thirds. The first third coming in the door is the luxurious bathroom with full soaking tub, large glassed shower, a separate room with the toilet and a dressing table with lighted magnifying mirror and full size hair dryer (not the wall mounted hotel specials you typically find). For anyone who spends time straightening or curling their hair with a hair dryer that is a big plus. The second third of the room is the sleeping area with closet, king-size or two queen beds, plus a sideboard with nine storage drawers and a plasma TV on top. The beds have wonderful, top quality linens and the mattress was very comfortable. The last third of the room was the living room area, which you get to by going down three steps from the bedroom area. There was a l-shaped sectional sofa, a coffee table (with ottoman tucked underneath for additional seating, an armoire with plasma TV, safe and mini-bar. There was also a small table and chairs, plus a desk and printer/fax machine. The layout was not cramped at all. The draperies were controlled by remote control, either roman shades or full black-out drapes. The housekeeping staff were very helpful and they cleaned the room to perfection every day. The front desk staff upon check-in and check-out were very helpful, as was the concierge when we enquired about local events. The pool areas are gorgeous and although all of the pools were not yet open at the time we stayed, there were still more than eight to choose from. You may also use the pools at the Venetian next door, which we preferred to do because of the big cushy lounge chairs. The Palazzo is our new favorite hotel in Las Vegas and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice - but next time I'll stay at The Wynn”
Reviews.Author: Fontaine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights (Thursday - Sunday). The room was very nice, although the linens will improve with 50 washings or so. The room was clean and there was plenty of storage. No slippers as were in my friend's room, but she didn't get a box of bath supplies (shower cap, Qtips, etc.). My room had three shower heads (two halfway down the wall); my friend's room did not. Odd. Ate two meals in the Grand Luxe. Dinner was average, breakfast better. We used the food court in the Venetian for pool lunches (there is no food service at the pool, although there is a small restaurant). The stores are absolutely gorgeous. One of the most beautiful Ralph Laurens I have seen, a Burberry, Ferragamo and other big names. A few complaints: The pool was extremely crowded with 20- somethings in large groups generally creating chaos; for some reason I expected an older, more upscale crowd. Also - a small complaint but the clock in my room was off. It took five calls to get it fixed (it was off by hours and minutes, and you had to unscrew the back to fix it). I wake up a lot during the night and it drove me crazy. No bill under the door at the end of the stay (not sure if that is a Las Vegas thing or not, but the line on Sunday to check out was long so we just left). Also - the valet loaded taxis one at a time despite the huge line. When I suggested that maybe they load more than one at a time, well, that didn't go over. If you need to get anywhere, leave plenty of time for taxi lines. Also, the Sports Book at the hotel is just that - it is not a Racing Book too. So to place a last minute bet on the Kentucky Derby I had to run over to the Wynn - a half hour round trip (there is a Race Book at the Venetian but I was told it was further away). The hotel is attached by a bridge to the Wynn - a short walk away. That hotel was much more to our liking and we gambled and ate there. The casino was more attractive and the folks there all knocked themselves out to be nice to us, even when they heard that we were not staying there. We had two great meals there, and also a buffet that was good (although I saw something resembling a mouse skid across the floor). The Wynn water show at night should not be missed. We will be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed with Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: SomeGuy39
Reviews.Content: I had a two-night stay at Palazzo April 30 and May 1, and they failed to impress me. I have stayed at most of the higher end properties in Las Vegas (Four Seasons, Wynn, Venetian, Bellagio, theHOTEL) and many others as well (MGM, Mandalay, even Tropicana once), and Palazzo still has some work to do in my opinion. My room was on the 36th floor. The good: as others have noted, their rooms are very quiet. I know both rooms on either side were occupied, but I never heard a peep at all. Nice flatscreen TVs. Free wireless (not promoted as such but I was never charged for it). Daily newspaper hung on door. Maids respected the "do not disturb" sign. Deep safe that easily accommodates a laptop. The bad: scratchy linens, cheap and too fluffy pillows. Poor water pressure. Rip-off mini-bar that automatically charges you if you look at a drink. Noticable dust in areas that the maids don't clean very often like the dresser drawers. Grand Lux Cafe breakfast buffet not that great - walk to Wynn in 5 minutes and pay extra $2 for the best breakfast buffet on the planet. The ugly: the pool was closed May 1 for "high winds". While it was somewhat windy that day, I suspect the closure had more to do with the numerous construction workers going in and out of the pool area with ladders, ductwork, etc. They directed us to the Venezia Tower pool, which was open as it is enclosed on all four sides. However, it is very small, half in the shade, and of course there was not an open seat to be found anywhere! Very expensive drink menu too. Side note: had a basic massage at the Canyon Ranch spa, and it was okay, not great. Spa at Four Seasons is much better and about the same price. Overall, not impressed and will return to Four Seasons or Wynn for my next stay. Looking forward to trying Wynn Encore when it is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Addition to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: wjrosie
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Palazzo--the first 5 days for a work conference and the last 2 for rest and relaxation. Overall, i was impressed. The rooms are large like the Venetians' but the decor is more sophisticated and less ornate. My suite (all of the rooms are "suites") had 3 flat screens and a relaxing sitting area. The casino was pleasant and not smokey or dingy--hopefully it will stay that way after it ages. The shops and restaurants are nice, albeit less plentiful than those at the Venetian--although those are in walking distance so not all is lost. The Spa and health facility are extremely nice as are the pools. Note that the you have access to the Venetian and Palazzo pools and the Venetian's get sun the AM this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous suites”
Reviews.Author: Kuch
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay someplace a little nicer for the last 2 nights of our trip (stayed at MGM first 3 nights), so I surprised my wife with the Palazzo. I got a rate of $140 on Priceline. We parked underneath in the garage, and went to the lobby. A host greeted us and walked us to the check-in representative. Check-in was fast, and they gave us a sheet of dining and gaming coupons. There is a security guard near the guest elevators who asks to see your room card on your way up. The room (16-917) was fantastic. 3 HD Flat Panel TV's, wonderful tub and separate shower, separate sinks, amazing bed, sunken living room with a DVD player, large deep safe, printer/fax (that did not cooperate with my laptop), remote control blinds, excellent temperature control...I could go on and on. It just had all the space in the world, and everything was modern and comfortable. For those that hate noise, this was the quietest stay I have ever had. The door is heavy and seals tight, so you will not hear any hall noise or your neighbors. Big difference from a place like MGM where you just expect to hear some noise all night long. The pool is very nice, though most of it does not get sun until noon or later. The casino smells wonderful, and I could not even get a hint of smoke. It is easy to get from Palazzo to Wynn, Venetian, Treasure Island and the Fashion Show Mall. The underground parking is very easy and puts you into the casino in no time. We had no issues with the service or problems with the rooms. The table in the living room had some white spots on it either from painting or a sloppy guest, but any complaints I had would be nit-picking. The casino credit was for $25 in free slot play or match play. You also get $15 in free play for signing up for Club Grazie, so between my wife and I we got $55 in free slot play. Book with confidence - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 1 night (thankfully!) for a conference. I'm not a gambler, so I can't attest to anything to do w/the casino, other than it seemed pretty empty. Not as smokey as others in Las Vegas, but I suspect that has more to do w/the fact that it hasn't been open long enough to get that way. The Shops area also seemed pretty deserted the one time I walked thru, though there were more stores open than I expected. My biggest peeve w/this hotel is the guest room plumbing. Never, in all the hotels I've stayed in over the years, have I been in one where the plumbing in the guest rooms is as loud as it is here. If I have to turn up the volume on the tv in order to hear it over the sound of the shower running in the next room (or 'suite' as they insist on calling them here), as I did, then there is a serious problem. (I apologize to whomever was next door to me & had to listen to my shower running @ 6am) Check-in is a rather convoluted process that requires one to first identify oneself, & the reason for needing to speak w/someone @ the front desk, to a roving hotel staff person. He/she then goes over to a registration person for a brief discussion before allowing you to approach where, of course, you then must re-state your request. The lobby area is huge, w/marble everywhere, & loud music blasting throughout which means all conversations w/anyone in this area must be SHOUTED in order to be heard. Suggestion to hotel mgmt-TURN THE MUSIC DOWN!!!!!!!!!! Be warned, this is a hotel that has rent-a-cops stationed at the guest elevators to harass anyone trying to use them; the first time I tried to go up to my room, not only did I have to show these people my key, they also demanded to know what room I was in! Keys did not work on my first trip up, after having successfully gotten past the rent-a-cops, which meant trekking all the way back down, across the casino, & repeating the above process to once again approach the registration desk for a new set of keys. This also meant dealing w/the rent-a-cops again, as well, even though literally not 10 minutes had passed. When I came back from dinner that night, 1 of the new keys had already deactivated itself & no, it was no where near my cellphone. The decor chosen, as others have pointed out, actually gives the impression of a hotel that is much older, run-down, & dated than it is. They actually managed to dig-up a cordless phone that I would swear is straight out of the 70's! It took me 3 trips up & down the hall to find the room w/the ice machine in it since the wall sign for it was tucked behind a pillar & not well lit. I don't know that all the elevators to the guest rooms are working yet-certainly, in the tower I was in, I ended up in the same elevator every time I went up or down. They are not only incredibly slow, but also very noisy to the point that, as others also remarked at one point, you do wonder whether it's safe to be in them. Like the suites @ the Venetian, the suites here feature a sunken living room. Someone must have decided that a green nightlight was in order for the 2 steps that lead down to the living room. The problem is that I could not see any way to turn it off @ night & that little light gives off an amazing amount of light in what is supposed to be a darkened room! Control for the A/C is wedged into a corner behind a bedside chair which made it difficult to get to. Doors are incredibly heavy & even when holding on to it, when exiting the room, it's nearly impossible to keep the door from slamming. My room overlooked Sands, the Wynn & it's golf course (which is very nice), but unfortunately, also all the A/C units for at least one area of the hotel. Even though I was on the 17th floor & they were quite a few floors below, it was still possible to clearly hear the roaring of the machines all night; same w/planes taking off from the airport. I give them points for actually putting a work desk in the living room area since so many of the LV casinos don't, however, it has a glass top on it & an optical computer mouse doesn't work on those. In addition, there is a rolling cart sitting beside the desk w/a fax machine/printer on, but since it is squeezed in between the desk chair & wall, & in front of the window curtains, there is a overwhelming feeling of being squeezed in when trying to use the desk. Remote control for the tv in the living room was very sluggish in changing the channels-I'm not sure whether it needed batteries or just didn't work well w/the tv in the room. Ice bucket they provided is very small & the glasses in the room don't really fit into it for getting ice out nor did they provide tongs to use instead which left no other option besides one's hands. Bed is a pillow top, but there is no mattress pad on it. In addition, they have put a flat sheet on the bottom which, of course, ends up in a wadded up knot under your back the first time you turn over. Note to hotel mgmt-invest in fitted bottom sheets. Bathroom is quite large, though it took time to figure out how to get the lights turned on in there! Very large & thick bath sheets, along w/large bath towels, but only 2 of each; same w/handtowels & washcloths. Large towel rack over the tub, but the only way to get near it, especially if you want to hang towels on it to dry, is to actually climb into the tub. Door to the 'wc' compartment will not stay open on its own. Double sinks w/granite vanity, but there are already stains around the bottom of the faucets (ick!). Toiletries are from Agraria & are 'lemon verbena'. If, as a little girl reading 'Little House on the Prarie' you ever wondered what Miss Beadle's 'lemon verbena' smelled like, get a can of Pledge furniture polish & you'll know. I think the hotel is trying to be 'green' w/low flow water fixtures; unfortunately, this has translated into very low water pressure & the water temp in the shower fluxuated constantly while in it which was very annoying. The only restaurant I tried @ the Palazzo was the Grand Lux Cafe. As is typical for a single female diner, they tried to seat me at the smallest table they could find initially-it even had only 1 chair! Then I had to send my lunch back as it had been prepared incorrectly. Though the waiter apologized & took responsibility, there was no reduction on the check, of course. Meeting space for the Palazzo is actually the Sands Convention Center which itself is @ the Venetian which translates into another hike to get to it. Those attending our mtg either from the local area or staying elsewhere were not happy to find out, upon arrival @ the Palazzo, they were actually at the wrong place. Meeting rooms are not very well soundproofed-we could clearly hear the group next door to us & I would assume they could clearly hear us, as well. Banquet staff actually bus the tables in the meeting room by dragging around gigantic trash bags vs. using trays, which I found very odd & not very hygenic. Wi-fi in the public areas was difficult to access; multiple attendees had problem getting connected. I give the Palazzo points for actually providing newspaper delivery to my room in the morning; many of the big casinos in Las Vegas don't. However, no copy of the hotel bill slipped under the door & I had to argue w/the staff person who checked me out to see a printed copy of the bill. She tried to fold it up & stick it in an envelope w/o my ever seeing it. When I asked to see it, she said, 'Why? It's just the room & tax & you already paid that', as the woman next to me was arguing w/another staff person about charges on her bill that didn't belong to her! Overall, as my title suggested, I was not impressed. Had I had another option, I certainly would have taken it.

Reviews.Title: “Will never book at the Palazzo again”
Reviews.Author: yenny33
Reviews.Content: I have a comfirmed reservation at the Palazzo for a suite for 3 night and my credit card was charged for 1 night stay.My plane was delayed and I called the hotel and inofrmed them that I will be arriving after 2am the following morning. They said no problem my reservation was comfirmed and they will make a note that I will be arriving late. Imagine my surprise when I showed up at the hotel after a long night at the airport was informed by the check in agent that they donot have a room for me that night and I can stay at the Venetian for the same price over $329 a night . I told them that if I want to stay at the Venetian, I would have booked my room at the Venetian. I asked to speak to the supervisor and the Front desk manager Al Santos came out and said that they are fully booked and a comfirmed reservation does not gurantee me a room at the Palazzo and he was going to do me a favor by letting me stay at the Hospitality suite for the same price that night and will move me the next day. I was told that this suite goes for $1500 a night . Imagine my surprise again when I walked into the suite . I has no bath tub and has a pull down bed and very smelly. I immediately went down stair and asked to speak with Mr. Santos and was told that he was too busy to assist me at this point, Finally the front office manager showed up, by this time I just want my money back so I can just sit in the lobby till daytime since it is almost 4am. She finally offer us a suite at the Venetian w/ $100 off. When I woke up in the morning I noticed that my room was overlooking some parking lot with no view. Wow. I think what makes me so upset about the whole experience is that the manager and front desk staff makes me feel like they are doing me a favor by putting me in the Venetian and couldn't understand why I am upset .

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite 5 Star Yet”
Reviews.Author: teamchiproductions
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend at the Palazzo. Overall, it was a very good experience, but somewhat underwhelmed after all the hype. Compared to the Venetian, I think the Palazzo is unnecessary and indistinguishable from its predecessor. The room was very nice and clean, and huge. The 3 flat screens, and a living room big enough to have a good size party. The best reason to stay at the Palazzo is the room, which is a modernized version of the Venetian room w/flat screens and remote controlled curtains. Some minor quibbles: our first impression was a little disappointing, given that the front entrance is cluttered and obstructed by ongoing construction. Inside the front entrance and lobby just felt like an afterthought, instead of something with a distinct personality or theme. But maybe that's not that important to most people. The shops and restaurants are upscale, but the layout is hard to navigate, and kind of far away from everything else, unlike the Forum Shops at Caesars or even the Venetian. The casino is small, but that wasn't a big deal for us. We would probably stay at the Venetian instead, which is about $50 cheaper per night, and visit the Palazzo shops and restaurants, but not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelersFour
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from staying 5 days at the Palazzo. We have nothing but GREAT things to say about the hotel. The rooms were beautiful, the staff was friendly and helpful, and we didn't have to wait long at check-in or check-out. We stayed on the 32nd floor and overlooked the Wynn pools and golf course -- what a view! The slot machines at the Palazzo were tight, but where aren't they on the strip. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “People need to get a grip”
Reviews.Author: TheGibber
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Palazzo after a 6 night stay. Its a beautiful modern stylish hotel, available at present for a steal (cost us $159 a night - compared to Bellagio / Wynn / Venetian all costing in excess of $300-$350 a night). Rooms are large and well appointed, and much superior to the Bellagios, which are starting to look dated now. The gripe I would have is the entertainment is not up to stratch, Wayne Brady show is ok, and Jersey Boys is pretty standard fare. The number of reviewers moaning about trivial things is laughable. Some people really need to get a grip on themselves and realise that a new hotel open a few months at 50% discounted rates will by definition have teething problems. Once these problems are ironed out it'll cost a hell of a lot more than $159 a night to stay there. Book it and enjoy it now, we had a fantastic time there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: UT-BroncoMan
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews about the Palazzo and being incomplete, I booked it with a little trepidation. However, I arrived 18 April to find the hotel in generally great condition. I saw none of the dirty conditions previously mentioned, except for the outside of the windows on my room. My wife liked it so much she wanted to move in! The casino feels open and welcoming, you can even see daylight from the center aisle! The decor is pleasant and doesn't feel as overly themed as many of the properties do. The only negative I would say was returning to the room one afternoon to find the housekeeper had the glassware in the sink with the water running. Draw your own conclusion. I'm afraid this is probably a far more standard industry practice than we consumers would like to believe. Would this discourage me from returning? Absolutely not! It's a truly beautiful property! I would stay there again my next trip without any hesitation. There were a couple of restaurants under construction, but many other options. All the shops appeared open. The pool area was also really nice.

Reviews.Title: “New, Classy and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: TokyoJoe
Reviews.Content: Reently opened luxurious and classy hotel, Over 3000 rooms, Concierge Floors includes access to their huge Concierge Lounge occupying the entire 24th Floor. Facilities includes private elevator access, continental breakfast, canapes, open cocktail bar between 5pm -9pm, excellent friendly service. Luxury suites 720 sq.ft consists of a lounge area, twin or king size bed. double wash basin in bathroon, seperate bath and shower, remote control blind and curtains, 3 flat screen TV;s with one in bathroom, minibar, fax copier, large L shaped sofa with pull out single bed. To access rooms via the elevators, , one must walk across the gambling hall on the ground floor. Hotel shopping mall shops mainly high end , connects across to the sister hotel, Venetian. ample restuarants to choose from at reasonable prices. Also convenient for those wanting to shop at Macy's, Neiman Marcus and Saks across the road contained in Fashion Show Mall. Ceasars Palace, Treasure Island , Wynns and the new Trump hotel also close by. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo The Las Vegas Strip's Newest Gem”
Reviews.Author: lasvegastravelwriter
Reviews.Content: When we entered our suite it was just breath-taking. The floor plan of the room would make the perfectly condo suite with a bedroom area and step-down to the living room. Add a refrigerator and you'd be set. We decided to experience the Grand Lux Cafe for breakfast and the servers needed training in customer service. We did not get what we ordered and the waitress was leaning on the podium instead of waiting on us. No value in that meal. I had a travel shock when I sat down at one of the bars to play video poker and as soon as I took my money out and placed it in the machine, I was approached by a man. This man came up to my side and took out a ring and said it was a diamond and gold ring and wanted me to buy it. I was i'n shock and said, "Go away." He disappeared as if into thin air and nobody else at the bar knew what happened. This is one of the most scary travel situations I have had because in one split second I could have been robbed and he was so discreet that no one around me knew there was a problem. I realized that big money and expensive places are a magnet for people who might want to take advantage of you. It doesn't matter where you are in the world, you're vulnerable. My greatest shock is that this person could be so brazen in a casino where there are so many cameras watching the gaming floor. When you are taking out your money or putting it away I guess you just have to beware The Shops of the Palazzo were starting to open and some of the most high-end brands in the world will be available soon. Just fabulous if you're ready for shopping. I spent some money at Barney's of New York which just opened. The front desk check in was excellent and all the staff members at the bars were extremely attentive and excellent. We highly recommend either of the bars with video poker machines as great experiences. The pool was under construction and we missed that opportunity. We'll have to come back. There are some wonderful world-class dining opportunities surrounding the Palazzo and so even though we couldn't brag about breakfast, you'll have great food to eat anywhere you select for lunch or dinner. Getting to the spa was not convenient at all and a waste of money for the 1 hour we spent. We suffered with swollen eyes the next day because of either mold or too many chemicals at the end of the day in the steam room and whirlpool spa. We'll have to take a whole day at the spa to give them a fair rating. It's supposed to be a world-class experience.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable 4 nights at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: shads
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from Vegas. We typically stay @ The Venetian but this time we wanted to give The Palazzo a try. We had no problem with check/in or check/out or housekeeping. We did notice how the casino wasn't as exciting or busy for that matter like The Venetian is. We didn't mind it but if you are looking for action & excitement, this isn't your hotel. Our room was great. Clean, brand new & functional! We saw The Jersey Boys one night and would highly recommend it! Excellent show ! Overall we love the location of this hotel and found it very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulBC-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 4 nights (April 17-21) and absolutely loved it! The rooms were beautiful and huge. Immaculately clean. I read other reviews about dust, but I just want to say that the marble and dark wood furniture sometimes gets dusty quickly even though it has been cleaned that morning. With all the construction (which in no way affected us) it can get a bit dusty. However, we did not find any dust or have any housekeeping problems. The bathroom was heavenly. The staff at the whole hotel is fantastic. Very helpful and friendly. The beds were so comfortable and the pool was fantastic. The sun did not hit the full pool area until around 1:00 but you could chase it at the other pools at the Venetian. We were down there everyday around noon and had no problem. The drink service was also excellent. If I had one complaint it would be that there is no coffee maker in the room so you have to go down to the lobby. Normally that might be okay, but the Lux cafe bakery where you get the coffee is mayhem. The line up is out the door and there is no organization. They need to take some lessons from Starbucks. I noticed that there is another coffee place going in closer to the elevators but it wasn't open yet. That may ease some of the pain. The Grand Lux restaurant is excellent. There is a huge menu, the food and service is great, and it was very reasonably priced. The portions are huge though, so my husband and I split meals after the first one. All in all, I would go back to the Palzzo in a heart beat. I had the best stay that I've had in a hotel room

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: Much has already been said about the Palazzo. Why did I like it? It was very quiet. When the shower was being used at midnight next door, you could hear it in the bathroom but not in the living areas. There was no smell of smoke which usually makes it way through the vents no matter which hotel you stay at. Both sides of my room had occupants but I was unable to hear any voices or loud TV's. The bed was not as comfortable as the Westin's, but no complaints here. It's setup is similar to the Venetian, but the Palazzo is one step above. We are definitely going to stay here again. My only complaints: Took forever to get the car from the valet. Alternative is to Self Park, but the parking escalator was often inoperative and we had to climb the stairs. Did not win one coin from any of the Palazzo slots....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uribees
Reviews.Content: I don't know what some of the other reviewers are talking about, this hotel was perfect. From the moment I walked in I was amazed at the ellegant simplicity of the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. I mentioned that it was my birthday and the receptionist gave me a few coupons, one of which was $25 in slot credit that turned into $90 after I was done at the slots. The hotel is still very new and happily lacking that smokey smell that many other older hotels have. They even offer smoke free corridors throughout the hotel. The room was the best part of the hotel. It was huge and extremely beautiful. The housekeeping was excellent as well. The room was made up two times a day, with delicious chocolates waiting for us when we arrived back at night as well as fresh flowers in the bathroom. The dining in the hotel was excellent as well. We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe. It was delicious and reasonably priced. For dinner we ate at Carnevino. It was one of the best meals I have ever had. Mario Batalli is one of my favorite chefs from the food network and I always wanted to dine in one of his restaurants, and he did not disappoint. The food was amazing and the staff was as well. We had two waiters waiting on us at the same time! They were very helpful and recommended some excellent dishes. I recommend getting the small orders of two or more items so you can sample different items for less price. We were also given a few free items that were just excellent. I highly recommend that restaurant for a nice special dinner. The pools had just opened when we arrived there and they were beautiful. The staff and service was excellent and brought us towels and even set up chairs and the towels for us. The only complaint I had was the prices for the drinks at the pool, very overpriced; however, they were delicous and very refreshing. While you are in vegas I highly recommend seeing the Blue Man Group. There tickets are a bit pricey but worth every penny. Thanks to the Palazzo this was by far the best trip I had ever had in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: EJPennStater
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights at the Bellagio and three at Palazzo. Much preferred Palazzo. Found the room at Bellagio utterly ordinary and overpriced. For less money, Palazzo offered perhaps the nicest hotel room we have ever enjoyed and that's saying a lot. Service was impeccable at every level, remarkably personable and eager to please. Although dining was very good (especially the Grand Lux cafe) we were a bit disapointed with Mario Batali's B&B restaurant. We dined here just after it opened on a night when the Chef was in the kitchen and found it extraordinary; we hoped the same high standards would persist in his absence. Alas, this was not the case. Not bad, mind you, but not up to Batali standards, either. In sum, we'd return to Palazzo in a heartbeat, no question about it.

Reviews.Title: “With Help, could be one of the best”
Reviews.Author: realinfo
Reviews.Content: Stayed April 17-20 2008 Thur-Sun. Called ahead to make sure they have me down for a nonsmoking room. Arrived and was put in a smoking room. Had to go back to front desk and get nonsmoking room , couldn't do it from the phone. Room was missing the bathroom robes, which i like to use. While asleep kept receiving calls with people asking if they had reached security. At least 6 calls each on 2 nights. Pool is now open. Palazzo pool doesn't get sun til about 12:30 due to tower set up but you can use the Venetian pool which has sun all day. Pool cocktail waitresses are very slow with service and cocktails run about 18-20$ each. It is vegas. Now the pros. the rooms are great and very comfortable. Casino is easy to navigate. Venetian is minutes away. You can use both Palazzo and Venetian pools they are connected. Join the Club Grazie players club and charge things to your room and and at end of trip check with credit department and see if they can comp some of your meals and then check out. Dining- Grand Luxe is ok once. If you are a steak person I had the best steak ever at Carnevino in the Palazzo bone in Ribeye, they carve it at your table. B&B italian was the best service in Vegas had the Beef cheekbone ravioli. Seafood at Aquanox @ venetian very good. This place has huge potential. Supervisors and Mgmt need to get together. Each one of them give different answers, not on the same page. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Great, Resort So So”
Reviews.Author: Loungesong
Reviews.Content: After two years of repeatedly staying at the Wynn Hotel, we decided to book the Palazzo. We flew down for a a one night weekend in Vegas. I've watched the hotel be built and was amazed at the massiveness of the tower. I stayed at The Venetian years ago and was happy with the room. The non-casino areas of the Palazzo are very nice. The reception atrium is beautiful with amazing flower arrangements and natural light. We had invited guest check in so we did not have to wait, but there was a line of about 20 guest checking in at 2PM on a Saturday. As is common in Casino design these days, after checking in, you have to walk through the entire casino to get the hotel elevators. The Casino is average to below average. There is little detail to the finish work in this area of the hotel. There is no natural "meeting place", bar, etc. in the Casino area. The slot machine volume is cranked up which is opposite to the Wynn hotel where you can barely hear them. However the hotel is so new there is hardly any smoke smell in the Casino area. The elevator banks are very crowded in this hotel as it is so large. Our room was on the 35th floor and we usually had to wait about 2-3 minutes to get a car up or down. The guest room is the best part of the hotel. We had a standard suite facing the Wynn Golf Course. At this point I can care less about views of the strip, not that they are very good from this part of the strip anyway. The window looking out was small-ish compared to new hotel designs and was very dirty. The remote operated roman shades and curtains were very nice and worked well. The room is exteremely functional for las vegas. Probably the best layout of any Vegas hotel. It is almost identical to the Venetian. The bed is in the "upper" area and faces a 42" LCD television. It is extremely comfortable to prop up an watch TV in bed. The halogen lights are great for bedtime lighting as well. The large sectional couch is comfortable and has a huge coffee table which is great for having a drink before heading out. The 37" LCD in that area also is well positioned. I had some problems with the safe which is located in the living area console, but finally got it working. The desk is large and the 4' round table feels very large and sturdy. The bathroom is large, but not as a nice as the Wynn bathroom. The shower does have two auxillarty heads at torso level which is a nice touch. Water pressure was great as was temperature. The only problem with the room (which is very apparent in the bathroom) is the lighting outside of the bed area. It is not well-lit in the bathroom or living room. In fact, the lighthing in the room corridors is too dim as well. It's not a big problem but you definitely notice it. The other detail that was strange was the large square mirrors in the elevator areas. They are convex "fat" mirrors. Which is strange in a city that people really get dressed up in. We ate in Dos Caminos which was delicious. The service was excellent as well. The pool is also lacking. There is absolutely no poolside foodservice at the Palazzo, yet. You literally have to walk almost 1/4 mile to the Venetian to get a bite. You can tell that they didn't have a lot of pool space to work with at this hotel and it shows. The pools feel small compared to the number of chairs and guests. The main pool at the Venetian is much nicer. The pools however were warm and the water clean. My biggest gripe with the hotel is the Casino. It has no character and can only be described as a really really big room. You're not going to get lost in it, but no matter what direction you look, everything looks the same. It reminds me a lot of the Alladin when it first opened. Big and bland. There is no live music to be found anywhere. There is no vibe. At least there are no Card Shuffling Machine blackjack tables or 6-5 single deck games. Most were 8 deck shoe games with about 1.5 decks cut off. There was a 3-2 single deck game available occasionally for $50, but it disappeared or turned to $100 at night. Most games were $25 minimum at night at $15 during the day...pretty typical for the Strip. All and all, the hotel was more than worth the $150 we paid, but it is nowhere on par with Bellagio, Wynn, or even the Venetian. I like this end and side of the strip since the Fashion Show mall is so close and you can avoid walking on the strip to get around. I gave the hotel 3 stars. This is obviously nicer than a 3 star hotel located in an average city, but in Vegas, they standard has become increasingly high. This hotel could be a 4 star which I would give to the Venetian if they upgrade their "free"entertainment and ambiance in the Casino , and finish the rest of their services in the pool area. Otherwise, this is a great option for this end of the strip, especially for under $200. It would also be great if you were attending a show at the Sands Expo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: KENBE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Palazzo. Wonderful overall experience! My girl and I loved it and we were especially impressed with the room. It's huge! We booked a king bed and got that and more. Electric drapes and curtains. The bathroom was large and had a flat screen tv in it. Bed was comfortable and turn down service was nice. We made use of the resort dining 3 times. First night we went to Grand Luxe Cafe and found the food there very tasty and serive was nice. Second night we made reservations for Table 10 and damn! It was great! She ordered the stuffed lobster and I ordered the ribeye. Both we cooked perfectly and the steak may have been the best I've ever had! The last morning we ordered room service breakfast before heading to McCarran. It arrived in exactly the time the said it would. Breakfast was really good and overall, all the dining at the hotel was awesome! Casino is really large and spacious. Very well ventilated. Hotel is in a great location. Next to Venetian and across the street from Wynn, TI, and Fashion Show Mall. Shopping at the hotel was nice as well. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay at the Palazzo again! I loved it and hope to stay there again real soon. The rates were much better than other hotels in its class and the rooms were much larger and nicer than those other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer the Venetian”
Reviews.Author: BillC4
Reviews.Content: The Venetian has been our favorite Las Vegas hotel for the past 4 years. The rooms have been totally remodeled and updated this year. On our last trip we stayed at the Palazzo. It was a good experience. The rooms are almost an exact replica of the remodeled Venetian rooms. The difference is that the Venetian has a fabulous lobby, a beautiful casino and the Grand Canal area upstairs. The Palazzo is another nice Las Vegas hotel and casino with nothing really memorable. It's really just another 3000 room addition to the Venetian with a longer walk to the Venetian's amenities. The convention center is located between the two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but some things can be done better”
Reviews.Author: Coont
Reviews.Content: The good: - Very spacious suites. We were upgraded for free to a Bella Suite (be nice to the check-in clerks!). 720sq ft, 3 LCD HiDef TVs, floor to ceiling windows. - Good location, excellent restaurants. Grand Luxe is fantastic. - The gelato shop by the fountain is amazing. I haven't seen that many choices in Italy even. - A security guard checks people's room keys before you can get into the elevator. Keeps the riff raff out. The bad: - Housekeeping sometimes comes in at 10am, sometimes at 6pm. No idea why. They don't vacuum or mop the floors. A quick dusting is all you get. - The sheets are more like sand paper. I don't know what it was about them, excessive starch or bleach or what but the next morning I was scratchy all over. The bed was very comfortable but the sheets were murder.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: sukie711
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Palazzo for our 16th wedding Anniversary. What a very memorable experience! The rooms are luxurious. The fact that this hotel is connected to the Venetian and nextdoor to Wynn makes it fabulous! A MUST SEE is the Guggenheim Hermitage Museum at the Venetian. We saw original works from Picasso, Cezanne, Van Gogh and more. Sadly, the museum will be closing May 11th due to lack of interest. The only other Guggenheim Museum in the U.S. is in New York. There was no charge to get in, the audio tour is very interesting. Another MUST SEE is the Wynn's huge Waterfall and lighted lake (at night) that displays a musical Hologram. This is amazing!!! We sat and had a mojito while a giant frog on top of the waterfall sang "What a Wonderful World" by Louis Armstrong and the lights & sounds are just SPECTACULAR!!! I would definitely recommend the Palazzo if you're looking for an upscale atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsp1
Reviews.Content: I travel to Las Vegas about 3-4 times per year and have stayed at most major hotels on the Strip (Wynn, Venetian, Mandalay, Hard Rock, Bellagio). This is far and away my favorite hotel on the Strip. The room is huge, with a surprisingly efficient setup for a Vegas hotel. There is a separate living area with 2 sofas, coffee table and TV. This area also has a large desk, with fax/printer. Two items stand out for a Vegas hotel -- effective wireless internet (which, for some reason, the Wynn completely lacks) and plenty of power outlets. The bed area has another TV, drawers, minibar, etc. The bathroom is also large, well appointed (with another large TV). I ordered room service several times and found service efficient and the food excellent. My room was made up twice a day. Note - this is a discrete hotel from the Venetian, with a separate entrance and casino. Restaurant selection and the mall are good. This hotel does NOT have the "perfumy smell" of the original Venetian, (that i suspect they used to cover up smoky smell due to low ceilings) which is nice (i refuse to stay at the Venentian for this reason). I plan to make this my new go-to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Un hotel molto buon”
Reviews.Author: CarolWFairfax_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo April 12-15, 2008. Loved it! Housekeeping was excellent. Everything worked. Beautiful room and bath. 3 flat screen tvs and remote controlled curtains and shades. Robes and slippers. All amenities. The only problem is that the water pressure is too low. Also had great food and service at the Grand Lux cafe. And the Canyon Ranch Spa had two products I desperately needed. I wish I was still there! Too bad I didn't get lucky enough on the slots to pay for an extended visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Great Suites, Pity About the Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: shrop
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many hotels along the strip I have to say that the the Palazzo comes high on the list along with the Bellagio, the Signature and The Hotel as one of the best, well almost, it needs to get some things sorted first. It is in a great location on the strip, handy for the Venetian, The Wynn and the Fashion Show Mall. Checkin was easy and efficient compared to other mega resorts, the accommodation is grand, comfortable and spacious. My complaint along with other reviewers is the housekeeping service, this really does need improving, by 4:30pm no maid service had been and we had to prompt them to service the room as we were seeing the Jersey Boys at 7pm, just not good enough! Also houskeeping is not that good or thorough, on checking in we felt that the carpet in the suite had not been cleaned and a spillage by previous guests on the marble steps between the bed area and the living area was not removed for the entire stay, these things are just not good enough for a 5 star property and the management of the Palazzo need to take notice of it's paying guests or they will loose them. There doesn't appear to be anyone checking that the standards are being met by the maids, this agian is not good enough in a 5 star resort and doesn't seem to happen elsewhere. The pool area had only just opened when we were there and not all services were operational, however, it was nicely done and more spacious that you would have thought. The spa has also now opened and looks to be pretty good (but then most are in Vegas!). There are still a few shops to be opened but all restaurants appear to be available and there is really a good choice, as you are so close to the Wynn and the Venetian the choice is first class. The casino is light and airy with space to walk, the design is excellent and an absolute must is the Jersey Boys, a truly excellent night out! This is a very good hotel with comfortable accommodation in a great location, the only thing that is wrong is the housekeeping service which simply has to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experienc ever.”
Reviews.Author: Courtdogg
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Palazzo around 7pm on a Friday, March 16th. I had booked my reservation through priceline and got a great rate. Check in was a breeze. As we walked to our 1st room it hadn't been cleaned yet and they wouldn't let us in to make a phone call to the front desk. After trying to explain our situation they let us use the phone in our 1st room. They explained to go down the hall and someone would meet us at our second room. 30 minutes later we were greeted by a friendly staff member who we then told we dind't want this room due to some chaos next door. We then were moved to a 3rd room up a few floors. Once in the 3rd room the toliet was broken and the safe wouldn't work. The employee who had helped us move had called to get those things fixed and left us in the room. 1 hour later the man came to fix the toliet. Still waiting on the people to fix the safe, one of them arrived about 10 minute after the toliet was fixed. In turn we had to wait for a second man in case there were valuables in the safe which I understand. Not expecting for the 2nd man to show up 45 mintues later. Once that was all situated I wanted to shower and get down to the tables. We had no tolietries. For a 5 star hotel that is absurd. It took us over an hour to receive the shampoo, conditioner etc... I was unable to get into the shower until midnight. I have never had any issues in Vegas as bad as this. To add to it all we decided to have lunch at the Grand Lux in the hotel. We would have had better service at a Denny's. They messed everything up and we were there for over 3 hours FOR LUNCH. I was given a $100 credit for food and beverage. We used that at Grand Lux and in the room. We then checked out of the hotel and everything was fine on that Sunday. The food and bev. comp covered it all. I received my credit card statement and they in turn charged me the $100 we had spent at the restaurant and in room. It is the worst hotel and casino I have ever stayed at in my life... 5 stars I would have had betters service at Sahara. Never will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: madmand
Reviews.Content: April 3 - 10 '08 What a beautiful hotel. On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the door man and directed through to the check in area which is only a short walk from the main entrance. At checkin there was another gentleman to greet us and ask us if we were checking and and walked us over to the next available clerk. The checkin clerk was most helpful and polite. She asked us if we would like to upgarde from our standard king suite but advised there would be a small charge. We declined. We were given the keys to our suite 30-907 (thirtieth floor) and a map of how to get there. Although you have to walk through the casino again its not too far. At the elevators there is a security guard that we had to show our key to and found them to be there 24hrs always checking peoples keys. Our room was was the 1st one along the corridor next to the elevators which i was worried about as i thought it would be noisy. I was very wrong there was no noise from the elevators themselves or people walking past the room. The suite was large and comfortable and new althoug there were a few minor marks/scratches on furniture from past guests being careless. Despite previous reviews about the poor maid service we never experienced this. Our room was cleaned daily to a very good standard and we also had a nightly turn down service with chocolates on the pillows. The view from the room was fantastic and although we were to the rear/side of the hotel we could see the Wynn and it's swimming pools along with the magnificent golf course and also up the strip to Circus Circus. Would definatly stay there again if we got the right deal otherwise it's slightly over our price range. Ate at the Grand lux cafe for dinner and breakfast excellent food and value for money. Another of the hotels restaurants was 'WOO' a pan asian restaurant it was there first night of openeing and the food and service were the best we have experienced and it was not that expensive either.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl11
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay from 4 - 8 April with friends. Arrived at check-in at 3.30 pm and found no queues. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and gave us adjoining suites on the 12th floor overlooking Wynn golf course. Accommodation was FAB with possibly the most comfortable beds and pillows I've ever experienced in a hotel. Some building work still going on at hotel but this was never heard during our time there. The pool area opened the day after we arrived and it too was immaculate. Any contact we had with guest services was polite and speedy - on arrival there was only 1 robe in our room and a 2nd was delivered within 10 minutes of calling! Used concierge services to book restaurant reservations and this too was handled very swiftly. Would have no reservation in recommending this hotel to others and will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Fabulous Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Momof3Seattle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the Palazzo in two adjoining rooms with queens in each. The hotel is very impressive--just the right mix of opulence and fun. I was a bit worried after reading past reviews, but we had no problems. Any problems were miniscule. We only stay at 5 and 4 star properties like the Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental, so I can attest that the hotel definitely meets that level of expectation. Pool deck opened on April 5, the first day we checked in. Thank goodness, as our 3 small children wouldn't have been very happy with trekking to the Venentian. None of the cabanas were ready, and one pool wasn't yet open, but 4 were, as well as two spas. The kids LOVED the pool area, as did everyone else. Food service and complete bar service not still available, but should be soon. Room layout and decor were lovely and very practical. Great soundproof and lightproof windows. No noise problem at all--we travel with a white noise generator and didn't need it. The computer access was perfect, and the fax/printer was very useful. Great assortment of restaurants--between Palazzo, Venetian, and Wynn, the greatest concentration of top restaurants are at this end of the Strip. We loved Grand Lux (Palazzo), Dos Caminos (Palazzo), Bouchon (Palazzo) on property. Off property, we ate every breakfast at the Wynn Buffet (superb!). We also had the prixe fix dinners at Alex (Wynn, world-class superb!,) Picasso (Bellagio, very good), and Robuchon (MGM Grand, impressive!). The hotel, shopping, and casino are about 85 percent ready. Some slight construction in areas, but nothing too distracting. Check-in wasn't perfect--we checked in at 12 and were told are rooms needed to be cleaned and to return at 3pm. At 3, they were still not ready. I did not accept this as an answer and basically sat at the fountain and called the front desk until I found someone who found us a room. We were upgraded to a better view and in our rooms by 3:30. It helps tremendously to be politely aggressive. Minor annoyance: The perfume that permeates the air at both the Palazzo and the Venetian. Everyone in our family has allergies, and my son has asthma. We had no problem with the scent, it was just annoying. Of course, not nearly as annoying as the odor of smoke which is EVERYWHERE in Las Vegas. It can't be escaped--until you leave Sin City. The wonderful thing about the layout is that you can easily access other parts of the hotel by walking through the shopping concourse instead of the casino. No one tells you this, but it is easy to figure out.... Hope this helped! We enjoyed our stay tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bestgetaways
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the all new Palazzo for 2 nights. It went beyond my expectations; and, as a travel agent that should mean something! The suites are very spacious and everything in them is perfect, including the 3 flat screens. Turndown service each night, a great view, and so much to do you never have to leave the hotel. Oh, except to visit the connecting Venetian. Between the 2 hotels, you have many great restaurants, bars, shows. There are 3 concierge desks as well as a client service desk to help you with anything. I would highly recommend it for those who would choose Ceasars, MGM and the like. You will not be disappointed. Contact me if any questions. Sandi MacKenzie bestgetaways@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Still Some Glitches but Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CindyM64
Reviews.Content: I get to Las Vegas at least 3 times/year, and although I usually stay at the Bellagio or Caesar's, I decided to try the new Palazzo this time, mainly because I found a great rate on Orbitz. It got off to a bit of a rocky start, and I will probably go back to the other side of the street on my next visit, but overall there were more pluses than minuses at this beautiful new property. Check-in was the biggest negative to my stay, because the room they assigned me had a broken thermostat. When I entered the room it was 83 degrees and rising, and it was set at 60, so clearly there was a problem. I called the front desk for help but sat on hold over 5 minutes before giving up and dragging my luggage back to the lobby. That was annoying, but I was doing my best to be patient until the person I explained my dilemma to told me there were no more rooms available and asked me if I wanted to go back to the room to wait for maintenance. I wasn't about to do that, and only after I started to become visibly annoyed with the entire scenario did he find me another room. I honestly expected more from a 5-star property and it is very disappointing to have to lose your cool to get better service. I had to laugh when I got to my 2nd room and the view outside my window consisted of a very high wall about 5 feet outside the glass. If I craned my neck a certain way I could barely see a sliver of blue sky, so I kept the drapes closed the remainder of my stay. If you don't want that view avoid odd-numbered rooms below the 8th floor. At least the room was cool, though, and like everyone else has said, the furnishings are lovely and new. The HD-TVs are great, and there are extensive programming choices. I also loved the robes, bedding, toiletries, and the bathroom. One very weird thing I noticed was that the tap water tasted really, really terrible. Be sure to stop at the souvenier shop just before the elevators and get a couple of bottles of water...it's much cheaper than the mini-bar. I wish I could comment on the pool, but it still wasn't open when I left April 1. Last I heard, it's supposed to open in the middle of April. I did have room service one night (pizza) and it came faster than they said it would...it was also very delicious and reasonably-priced. The only restaurant I ate at on the property was the Lux Cafe, which is operated by the same people who run Cheesecake Factory, and the portions were just as huge. It was good though, and the menu has enough variety to please very diverse tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Close, but not quite...”
Reviews.Author: Dufek
Reviews.Content: After staying at The Wynn the past few years, we decided to try the Palazzo next door this year. With top notch service from The Wynn, we had high expectations. We stayed April 7-10, 2008. Upon arrival, the staff was very friendly and welcomed us. Check in was fast as well. It appeared all the service counters were open and had staff at them. We were given a room on the 42nd floor, strip side. When we got to the room, it really did have a fantastic view. The room was very nice. We enjoyed the lower level sitting area and the impressive flat screen TV's. In other reviews, I read about problems with the room such as cleanliness and such. Sadly, I have to report the same. I definitely don't like to nit pick the small things, but when staying at a resort like the such, top notch room appearance is expected. It looked like the room was rushed to completion. We found several areas of the carpet with noticeable large paint stains on them. Paint was also found on door hinges and knobs. A large section of baseboard trim was missing in the bathroom. The room was not as clean as it should be. The window had a bunch of smudge marks on it. Sticky soda mess was on the table. Dust covered everything... and it did not get cleaned our whole visit. Our toilet decided to keep filling causing a flood in the bathroom. Several hours later, it was finally fixed. We just left since we didn't want to deal with it. I could go on and on with the small things, but I'll move on. Grand Lux Cafe was top notch. Highly recommended for any time of day. Pool and most of the stores were now open when we were there. Very nice. Casino was nice and open with little smoke problems. In summery, the Palazzo really has the potential to be a high class resort... but it is quite a way from there right now. They have a lot of issues to address to get up to par. As for us, back to The Wynn...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ricowilf
Reviews.Content: I was a tad worries about booking the Palazzo as it has only recently opened and a few reviews on this site commented on the scaffolding and work that is still being carried out.
