However, my initial fears vanished as soon as I arrived. Being the first time that I have visited Vegas I did not know what to expect so the simple elegance of the reception area was impressive. I paid $179 for a suite through an email promotion and stayed for 5 nights. I had emailed ahead to inform them that it was our wedding anniversary and also my wife's birthday the week before, so asked if it would be possible to get a room overlooking the strip. I received a response to say that they would add this comment to the reservation but could not guarantee anything. I politely asked when checking in whether a suite with a view was available and the friendly gentleman (Robert) behind the desk was very obliging. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite on the 41st floor overlooking the strip. This is the best room I have ever stayed in and I am a frequesnt traveller to many destinations. Being brand new it was tastefully decorated and came with 3 flat screen TV's, lovely bathrobes and slippers and all the amentities you would expect from a high class resort. The actual casino is relatively small compared to the established names but that was also a bonus as it didn't take a hour to get from the lobby to the suite, navigating our way around was easy and noise level was not excessive. Being joined to the Venetian offered the best of both worlds so serious gamblers can walk from one to the other via the fantastic indoor streets. Our room was cleaned each morning and in the evenings the bed was turned down, a chocolate placed on the pillow and a general tidy up was performed. The staff were all very helpful and friendly in every way. It's true that the pool is not yet open (should be soon though) and a couple of the shops aren't finished but it did not stand out as being incomplete and it did not affect our stay in any way. Compare this to our stay in the Bellagio on the last 2 nights of our holiday and I would say the Palazzo wins hands down. The service was also good at the Bellagio but the rooms don't compare for the price. We couldn't check in until 6.30pm and as such missed a 7pm dinner date with friends, our room wasn't cleaned until after 2pm each day, we were placed at the back of the hotel and it was so much busier and noisier in the general public areas. All in all I loved the Palazzo and would recommend to friends but I would say that once this place gets a good reputation the prices will sort to rise so get in quick.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with a little dust”
Reviews.Author: MGWTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from stay at The Palazzo April 3-April 7 (Moms Gone Wild) Good news - THE POOL IS OPEN! I was worried our group would have to trek over to The Venetian but the pool opened on Saturday. They were still working on the cabanas and the bar was not in full service but it was far better than walking miles to the "sister" hotel. The Good: Great room...three flat screen plasma HD TVs, two comfortable queen size beds, fold out sofabed. Very spacious suite for 6 women. Also very prompt to respond to requests or problems in the room. Someone came within 15 minutes each time. I only ate breakfast at The Grand Luxe Cafe though many in the group had dinner and raved over the food. The BAD: agree with other reviews...not enough washcloths, dusty (nightstand and marble separating living area was very dusty). Also first night we were there, no water between 2am and 4am. Some women in our group were up gambling and had to use the bathroom and were told to go to The Venetian. Also had to pay $4 for a smal bottle of water during this outage. Water should have been comped since it was not available. Palazzo has some kinks to work out but all in all above average stay even with the problems. All the staff I encountered were very friendly. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Visit”
Reviews.Author: VoyageFromNYC
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at the Palazzo. Rooms were both clean and spacious. I ordered room service on one occassion and it was both easy and fast. I arrived early (11am) and was able to get into my room right away. Check-in was pretty fast, with only a few minute wait. I spent the majority of my time in meetings, but everything I utilized was in line with my expectations (except for one extraordinarily long wait at the valet). Some of the shops are still not open, but the majority seem to be up & running. It is also nice to have the connection with the Venetian, as your options double on the restaurant side. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: EllieVa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from five days at The Palazzo and it was fantastic. We had a problem initially with our first room because there was another guest already staying there but the front desk immediately responded by upgrading us to a huge two room suite which was like winning the hotel room lottery. The regular suites are gorgeous but this suite was like the kind you see on TV and wonder how regular ol' people can afford to stay in a place like that. There may be a few kinks to iron out here and there because it is still relatively new and HUGE but everyone we encountered from the bellmen, front desk, housekeeping staff, room service, pool employees, security...couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The pool, make that multiple pools, opened while we were there and it was very nice, plenty of chairs and lots of staff members available to help with seating during peak sun times. We have stayed at almost all of the big hotels on the strip and The Palazzo is our new favorite by far.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo still figuring things out”
Reviews.Author: Pezgallo
Reviews.Content: This newly opened sister property to the Venetian is still having some grand opening problems. For instance: -Our room keys were not working when we arrived. Actually took two new sets to get a working set. WE had to do the legwork between the front desk and the room; not quick. -wireless internet was a no-go despite my computer savvy and their assistance by phone. They finally sent a tech to see what the problem was; after about 20 minutes of sitting with him, he concluded it was THEIR server issue. Called IT and got it fixed. Comped us with free internet for our stay. Normally 9.95 for 24 hours. -guest services book refers to free printing from the combo fax/scanner/copier/printer in the room. Problem was, it actually did NOT have straight printing functions from the computer. Did I mention no paper in it anyway? Window XP recognized the device just fine but it would not print and actually didnt say "printer" anywhere on it; just fax/scanner/copier. -three requests over two days for two more wine glasses in the room were never fulfilled. -took three requests for more bath towels and an extra blanket. -frustrating lack of signage to important things.............like the self-parking entrance. Like where the 40/40 club actually IS on the property. -refused a late checkout on a Sunday.............hmmmm, offering bargain weekends at 179/night and you're too crowded on a Sunday to allow late checkouts????? BS. Personally, we prefer the Venetian's suites to these. The bedrooms are a little more separated from the living room by a layout different than a rectangle. And the hide-a-bed is inadequate for two adults as it is one side of an L-shaped grouping. It's size is somewhere between a twin and a double bed. I simply slept on the other part of the couch. On the good side, the 40/40 club is pretty amazing and has great food. Best sports bar I have ever been in. It even has a large outer patio area WITH HDTV's that fronts on The Strip. REALLY AMAZING POOL COMPLEX!!!! Food at the Jade asian restaurant (on site) was pricey, smallish portions but it was well-prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special / Pricey drinks”
Reviews.Author: 2broadway
Reviews.Content: I fly from the east coast to Vegas several times a year. I decided to stay at the Palazzo for the weekend since I was traveling alone. Check-in was smooth. I was assigned a suite with a view of the strip and the not yet opened Palazzo pools. The floorplan of the suites were the same as the Venetian suites but of course updated. I noticed that the cushions on the sofa appeared to have been haphazardly thrown in place. Now why didn't housekeeping notice the dried, smeared, white stain on the dark brown velvet sofa? It really stood out. Since I heard talking in the hallway, I poked my head out the door to find a HK supervisor. I informed her of the stain. She wrote something down and informed me that they wouldn't be able to get to it today but, that it would be taken care of. The next day it was. I agree with another poster that housekeeping needs to do better. On my second night, I received no wash cloths and dirty glasses were left in the room. On the third day, I returned to the room at 7:15pm to find it not serviced. I once worked in a luxury hotel so I know first hand what some husekeepers have to put up with. That is why I make it a point to leave a really good tip before departing for the day. Unfortunately, I feel that some housekeepers could care less. I should not return to my room and waste my time calling housekeeping for things that are the norm. BTW, Palazzo doesn't have a direct line to housekeeping. You have to call the front desk and whenever they decide to answer the phone, they'll pass along your message. I didn't find anything special about the casino. Several times I got lucky by parking near the elevators that were close to the guest suite elevators. Oh, one major thing, beware of the drink prices at the Helix bar which is located on the second level. A 2oz. glass of champagne costs $16 bucks whereas a 5oz glass costs $35. It's very easy to miss on the menu so, look carefully. BTW, who buys a 2 oz glass of champagne?

Reviews.Title: “plus and cons”
Reviews.Author: kalirose
Reviews.Content: Plus: 1. Love the restroom ; the lighting, the soft and relaxing showers, plasma in RR. 2. Comfortable and spacious rooms 3. Comfortable bed 4. Beatiful hotel and shops Cons: 1. It takes 45 to 30 just to get any services ( coffee, luggage pick up, maintenance etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: elroy74
Reviews.Content: Went out to Las vegas for the second weekend of the NCAA's. The Palazzo offered me a free room for my birthday, part of the players club at the Venetian resorts. I arrived and checked in at the Invited Guest desk. I asked for a room as close to the elevator as possible, which they did for me. Check in was a breeze and I was off to the room. You have to walk through Casino, but it is not that bad a walk. Some hotels in Vegas feel like miles before you get to your room. The room was very nice. Two issues: No robes in the room and the alarm clock was broken. I am not a stickler about the robes, just did not want to get charged if they thought I had removed. Called the issues down and was fixed within an hour. Ordered room service when I got there as well. Food was really good, and took less than a half hour to arrive. All in all, this was a very nice hotel. The fact that it was free made it even better, but I would stay there again. Well designed. Pool was not open. Not a big deal for me, but supposed to be open soon.

Reviews.Title: “Electrician 10: Housekeeping 0”
Reviews.Author: askeme
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the end of March/beginning April 08, hoping for a really pleasant experience. It really was anything but pleasant. Housekeeping was very lax with many missing items (i.e., towels, do not disturb sign, robes and slippers, etc.) upon our arrival. Housekeeping did bring those items after about 8 hours. There obviously was no attention to detail as there were things such as masking tape still in place from prior painting, tape residue on things, a mysterious black sticky substance at the entrance to the bathroom (which the housekeeper and housekeeping supervisor had no idea nor inclination as to how to remove), continued missing towels (somedays had 10 washcloths, no hand towels or no washcloths, 6 bath towels). We had a lightbulb burn out in the separate toilet area. It took over 12 hours to replace a lightbulb thanks to the electrician who arrived at our room at 11:30 PM. He questioned why no one else could have just changed the lightbulb before calling him. We were glad he came, however, as he figured out what the mysterious black substance was that eluded the housekeeping staff. He looked at it, took a razor blade out of his tool kit and scraped the substance off. He said that it was silicone caulk and that being waterproof, it was never going to wash off (which is all that housekeeping did). He was very pleasant, but what he did was definitely not his to do. We received many "I'm sorry" responses from the front desk, but no action. The front desk manager gave us her business card to be able to contact her directly. Nice touch, but we were not able to do so because the hotel operator did not know who she was despite us telling the operator her name and that there is no such thing as voice mail for that person. The operator persisted in "sending us into her voice mail" only to be connected to the front desk who said that there was no voice mail and that the front desk manager was busy. No call back. The good part of the stay was the excellent service by the desk security staff member when we inadvertently left behind a couple of items. He sent a security guard up to the room to retrieve said items. He was very friendly and indeed acted as the information desk for a number of people. If only they could clone him! The casino was great with very attentive staff who are at the ready to help with directions, etc. We highly recommend the Grand Lux Cafe. The food was very good with an extensive menu. The wait staff were outstanding! We ate there four different times and had excellent food and service each time. I would not recommend staying at The Palazzo at this point in time. If both housekeeping and management staff are willing to commit to meeting their customers' needs, it could be a great place. For now, . . . stay at The Wynn. They DO understand those things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Lots of Problems”
Reviews.Author: frobnitz
Reviews.Content: On the nice side: The rooms are nice, the casino area is open and not smoky so it's easy to get through, the restaurants are good and prices reasonable. The evening manager at the hotel was helpful. We had a number of problems: Cleanliness Dirty fingerprints in the bathroom, on doors and light switches. The couch had nasty looking stains on it. The chairs and couch had food crumbs all over them. The room has been in use, yet nobody ever cleaned up things like plaster spatters and dust. Fixtures The worst problem was constantly getting locked out of our room. They kept telling us to be careful with card keys. I was trying to get in to the room at close to midnight and needed security to let me in. Midnight is shift change and nobody showed up, and the people at the frontdesk changed so I had to go through everything all over again with them. After my 6th trip to the front desk in one day, they finally figured out that the door lock was broken. Other people had similar complaints, so the locks breaking isn't an isolated incident. One of the sink faucets sprayed more water horizontally than down into the sink. One of the closet doors was off its hinges and wouldn't close. The couch already had tears and missing trim. Service Our room wasn't made up twice, probably because of the problems with the door lock, yet they didn't report it. We asked for clean towels on evening #1 after the room wasn't cleaned. They didn't show up until I went to the front desk to complain. It took some time to get the door lock fixed. When they said they would on the second day, they came at 1:30AM when we were going to bed. The breakfast restaurant can get backed up, and has lots of new staff who forget to take orders, what order people come in, and generally stretch breakfast into a long drawn out meal. Long front desk lines at certain times of day. This could be a nice hotel, but the housekeeping and basic service is poor. It's not worth the $175 rate we paid to get a dirty room that gets t serviced half the time, and which locks you out several times per day. At least they've got a few good front managers, but they can't compensate for daily problems like these.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of theft!”
Reviews.Author: pres2n
Reviews.Content: I had all of my jewelry stolen from my room (with both my husband and I in it) on Feb. 22. This hotel did not call the police; we had to. They will not take any responsibility for the theft or for the criminal behavior of the housekeeper. I am heartsick. Do not stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: ladybug5
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. Last weekend we drove to Las Vegas from Los Angeles for a 3 day get away. We originally were going to stay ay Belagio, but after one night there checked out and got a room at the Palazzo. For about the same price we went from a smaller dark and dated room to a 720sg.foot suite. This hotel is new and the rooms are so comfortable. The bed was great and there is a large sitting area with a large couch, table and chairs and work area. The bathroom is huge and quite nice even had orchids. There are 3 tvs in the room. THe room also offered alot of light using 75 watt light bulbs instead of the 40 watt that Belagio used. The pools were not open yet, but it was cool so we did not mind. There is no doubt about it this hotel has it all over Belagio and would now be my hotel of choice. The casino is also beautiful and alot larger then Belagio. A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite pure 5 star, but definitely 4.75 stars”
Reviews.Author: bigkat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palazzo March 26-31 of this year. I was very, very impressed with the quality of the rooms and the service. The front desk seamlessly checked me in at 1PM with no quibble, and provided top notch assistance whenever needed. The room itself was first class all the way, with beautiful decor (a subject of opinion, I am sure) and a very comfy bed. Turn down service was provided each night and all interior items worked perfectly. The casino, while a little plain compared to the other large strip casinos, was very easy to get around in and extremely spacious. The bar areas were staffed with top notch professionals, and service at all hours was beyond reproach. The restaurants were very good as well, though I was too busy doing other things (ahem) to take advantage of all of them. Check out was equally smooth, no problems whatsoever, and bellman service was superior. My one fault was a little dust on a shelf, but that was very, very minor and I am being very picky with that. I have stayed at Bellagio and Venetian, and this compares very favorably with both. I recommend this hotel highly-any early reviews with negative connotations may have been a subject of very early growing pains typical of any new and large corporate entity.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: erm621
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for 3 nights. The hotel was elegant and classy. The staff seemed to go out of their way to make you feel welcome and comfortable. Our suite was comparable to the luxury suite at the Venetian however, I did not see big a big difference between this hotel (5 star) and the 4-star Venetian. I would definitely stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo excellent service great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BEM_789
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palazzo March 30th thru April 1. I took my mother and aunt whom I flew in from Atlanta. It was their first time in Las Vegas. It was my mother's birthday. The staff was very friendly! Everyone was very helpful and pleasant. Check went very smooth. The young lady at the counter gave us an upgrade to a strip view for my mother's birthday. She asked if we want to be on low or higher floor. She asked if we wanted to be away or close to the elevators. We got exactly what we requested. She explained the mini bar, it is weighted so even you picked something up to look at it you will be charged. We stayed away from the mini bar. My aunt needed a refrigerator for her insulin. The young lady that checked us in said she would have one sent up, it would take about 10 to 15 mins. The refrigerator came up in the exact time she stated. The room itself was beautifully decorated in soothing tones of brown. We had a bella suite which had two queen beds as well as a pull out couch. Three plasma televisions. The only complaints we had was that the room was dusty. The marble separating the sunken living room and the beds was dusty, the end table in the living room was dusty, and the headboards were dusty. There were no bathrobes in the bathroom. There were slippers in the closet, but no bathrobes. It was not a big deal, I just wanted my mother to have the full experience. The next day when the room was cleaned the maids left plenty of towels since there was three of us registered in the room. The maid however did not leave any wash cloths. It took two calls to get the wash cloths. The maid came to the room the first time and had only towels. She asked that we call downstairs. When we asked if she could call, she insisted that we call ourselves so we did. This time they got it right. They also brought even more towels and the bathrobes . They gave us a bag full of toileteries (very strange, I guess in an effort to make up for the mistake) The pool area is still not open! It was Ok because it was a cool weekend and no one was going to go swimming. I did not notice if all the shops were open or not. We were in awe of the hotel and its beauty. The hotel is centrally located. We able to walk across the street to see the free Siren show at TI. We went to Wynn for the buffet and to see Le Reve. Quick walk across the bridge. The Fashion Square mall is across the street as well. We were very impressed with the hotel. I had the opportunity to go to the 40/40 club owned by Jay-Z. It is a sports bar not a night club. Had a quick drink and left. My mother and aunt had a great time in Vegas and can't wait to go back. We will definitely stay at the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Suite Upgrade- Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: suplada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo Luxury Concierge Suite with View from March 25 thru the 27th. Prior to our trip, we got an email invite to upgrade for an add'l $100/night, and it is definitely worth it!. With the Concierge upgrade, breakfast is included (they have lox, and also good warm ham/cheese croissant, aside from other continental breakfast items). They have afternoon tea with pastries (very good and interesting). Then hors d'oeuvres starting at 5pm, with open bar. The concierge lounge is very spacious and relaxing. The suite was exceptional, as expected, and as described on their website. We didn’t have any problems with check-in, housekeeping, valet, and other services (except the casino took all our gambling money…). Also, we had lunch at Emeril’s Table 10, and it was delish! We consider the Palazzo as our palazzo in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: bracer27
Reviews.Content: Impulsively, I decided to take the last flight to Vegas the night before my reservation at the Palazzo. The plan was to hit up the clubs with some friends who were in town at the time. I was very surprised with the helpfulness of the front desk clerk when I showed up at 6:00am with the intention to check into my room a good nine hours early. The gentleman at the front desk spent nearly twenty minutes searching for a room that was available and clean. In my experience, most hotels would send me off to the craps tables after a few seconds of searching and tell me to return at the appropriate hour. The Palazzo did not. They took the time to accommodate me and even gave me an upgrade for my troubles! Now that was customer service! I've stayed in the other two towers at the Venetian in the past and expected much of the same. The rooms are identical in layout with the exception of the finishes, which are tastefully done. The airiness and openness of the casino and hotel are a pleasant change from the Las Vegas standard. Most of the construction seemed to be completed with the exception of the pool, some stores, and a few other reminders here and there. The room itself was clean, comfy, well appointed, and house keeping came promptly every day. The only problem I experienced was one of the flat panel TVs would not turn on. Oh well, the room had two more as backups.

Reviews.Title: “The Venetian taken to the next level!”
Reviews.Author: NoSleepTillBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our long weekend at the Palazzo. We have stayed at The Venetian a number of times with our last stay in the Venezia tower. I would have to say that I was somewhat disappointed with the Venezia tower because of the maze of hallways and elevators. I guess they heard my concerns, because the Palazzo is incredible. From the time you arrive everything is great. Parking and/or valet are very convenient, check-in is a breeze and is located next to a great fountain, and the rooms are easy to get to through the centrally located elevators. The casino is well laid out with wide walkways, no smoke smell, and a great atmosphere. From the casino there is a great passageway through to the Grand Canal Shops. The resort isn’t quite ready because a number of stores are still under construction and the pool is not open. I was sad to miss the Lamborghini store. I guess I will have to get back soon… The rooms have a similar floor plan to The Venetian with a sunken living room. The easiest way to describe things would be taking The Venetian and bringing in into 2008. They have two plasma TV’s in the living area and bed area along with a smaller LCD screen in the bathroom. They have also added motorized blinds! I think we were the first people to stay in the room because the room looked like it hadn’t had the final “once over”. There was a little plaster on the inside of the window, the lamps next to the bed were missing, and the flowers in the bathroom were missing. Small details that need to be completed. Overall, I would highly recommend the Palazzo to friends. See you there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but”
Reviews.Author: SBMLMK
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Palazzo due to a conference I was attending. Checking in was easy...the guy facilitating the movement of the line was very friendly. The process was simple. My room wasn't ready, so they gave me another. Then, off to the elevators. To get to the elevators...heck, to get anywhere...one had to walk through the casino. My first time in a casino - ick. It was sensory overload, and the smoke was impossible to avoid. The room was quite a long walk from the elevator - and I wasn't at the end. The poor folks with rooms even further! The suite was nice. I had a room away from the Strip - facing the mountains - due East. It was a lovely escape from the rest of the craziness that is Las Vegas. I struggled to find the hair dryer - finally found it in a drawer in the bathroom. No coffee pot. The room service prices were outrageous. I signed a note during check-in that said I understood that the items in the mini-bar were weighted...so if I took something out, even if I didn't use it, I would be charged for it. Which, looking at the price list, would have meant $13 for a soft drink and candy bar. I kept my hands out of the mini-bar, needless to say. The roman shades and curtains were cool to open with the remote control. There were three flat-screen TVs in the room (one was in the bathroom...but the tub was backwards so you couldn't lie in the tub and watch the TV...odd). The motion detector in the middle of the ceiling of the suite was odd. Never could figure that one out. It was quiet in the rooms. Never heard any neighbors. The maid service tried to come in around 9:30 one night...fortunately, I had the door latched. She literally knocked - and opened - the door at the same time. Seems they provide chocolate at night. Being on Eastern time, it wasn't really appreciated. The hotel itself was very nice. I paid an insane $279/night, and I can assure you it was not worth it. They nickeled and dimed you for everything - the internet was $9.95 for each 24 hour period you used it. The separate toilet (WC) was odd - dark, dark, dark. Hated staying in there long. Checkout was fine. It was surprising there were so many people in the casino at 5:00 in the morning, though! If you're going to Vegas and want a really nice room with easy access to the Strip, I guess it's an okay hotel. Just don't expect to get off cheap. I just don't plan on going back because I plan on avoiding Las Vegas for the rest of my life. Ew.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Pizzazz... just the right amount!”
Reviews.Author: junkgalore
Reviews.Content: Smooth check in. Beautiful reception area... very understated elegance. We were on the 34th floor and had a great view of the Venetian's pools. Decor: Think art deco meets 60's vintange. Lots of beautiful brown tones. Lovely automatic shades (up and sideways) and three tvs en suite: bedroom, livivng room and restroom. Furniture was in dark browns and blacks... very well thought out lighting... and unfortunately, the ubiquitous marble in the entrace way and bathroom. But overall, nothing flashy. Just perfect. There is a desk with fax and modem (must be purchased to use). Also, the bar is high tech and charges your room if you move an item. So steer clear of it unless you're planning on eating/drinking it. Toiletries: Very nice selection of lemon verbena. High end... liked it enough that I tipped the maid extra and asked if she could leave a few extra pieces for me to bring home for my guestroom. (the $5 you spend here will go so much farther than anywhere else, I promise). Provided robes and slippers. the towels were a bit under par of what I expected. But at least they left us plenty of washcloths (4 daily). Under the tv in the room, there is a bar top that can be lit. Overall, much thought went into the lighting situation because it's all very flattering, no harsh lights. Well done. Shower was nice... but a bit tight. There is also a long tub...not quite enough room for two, but comfortable for one tall person. I would've liked a larger 2-person shower instead of having the tub. Oh, the hand towels are placed too low... odd. Since things were still underconstruction this weekend, we followed the 'private' corridor to use the pool at the Venetian. This is the lowlight: extremely filthy water and everyone crammed tight in rows like sardines. Not sure how they're getting away with the setup because it seemed both a fire hazard (if you were stuck in the back rows, you could not have an access out) and health code violations (the murkiest and chunkiest water you may ever see). Otherwise, we can't wait to stay here again... especially when the palazzo pool opens. We loved the casino. Clean, no tacky decor and fun, high tech upgrades to games we enjoy (like roulette). Location was also perfect for a jaunt over to the Venetian for their restaurants... will post separate reviews of Postrio and Trevi in Caesar's Palace. Also can't wait to try their restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Canceled before I ever showed up”
Reviews.Author: nikNy
Reviews.Content: I was going to stay here but canceled before I even showed up. The hotel clearly have not worked out the kinks of being a new hotel, and have a long way to go in training their staff. I wanted to book a package deal online. Before booking the reservation online, I called the hotel to ask about the deal. The first woman I spoke with at the hotel had no idea about the package deal and quoted me a price far above what I could have gotten with the package deal. The second woman I spoke with was also not aware of the package deal. Over the phone I had to walk her through the website to find the deal. Once there, she said the hotel policy was one night's room deposit and a 72 hour cancellation policy. So I booked the package online, but when I got the confirmation from the hotel, they had charged the entire package to my credit card. When I called to complain I was told that they were having issues training their staff and they could do nothing to help me out and they suggested I cancel my reservation. So I did. No need to stay at a hotel that is so clueless it recommends guest cancel their reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggScotland
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to the Palazzo for her 40th birthday. I have to say, this is one amazing hotel. Our room was upgraded to the 43rd floor at no extra charge on arrival and when we seen the room.....wow. 720 sq foot of room space with views down the strip. Excellent. Some very good restaurants as well. We ate in the chinese which was very good and also in the Grand Lux cafe which was also excellent. The adjoining hotel, the venetian has the most amazing set of shops, restaurants and even a scaled down grand canal & St Marks square with some excellent italian eateries. The pool areas were clearly not finished yet, but being low season, I am sure they will open for late spring early summer. We joined the club Grazie before ariving (Free) and we were each given $20 on a card to use on the slots. Not being gamblers, we got to learn the machines compliments of the casino with this free gift. Any one who goes here and does not enjoy this resort, needs to ask themselves why......... We have travelled to lots of places and this place has to be amongst the best we have ever been to. We will go back 100%

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: r_villaneda
Reviews.Content: Visited Palazzo 3/24-3/27. Brand new property. Beautiful all around. Friendly staff (including many who are in training). I did notice that the rooms looked a bit run down considering the fact that the hotel is brand new. The rooms are nice, but they don't appear as new as I had expected. The bathroom is large and we all enjoyed the TVs (2 in the room, 1 in the bathroom). The step down living room area has a sofa sleeper. There were 5 of us (3 kids, 2 adults) and we were comfortable. Room has a DVD player, so bring your videos in case you're traveling with kids. Parking was not a problem (we always entered right off of Sand and drove right into parking structure). The location of the property is perfect (you can watch the pirate show at TI on the balcony of Palazzo). You can shop at the mall (across the street). If you are traveling with kids, they might not appreciate hotel just yet. The space of the rooms is great, but the restaurants aren't kid friendly. Really depends on what you're looking for in a hotel. Would stay again if we got another great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BdevilDan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo for a long weekend. Though not all the restaurants and stores are open, the property is very nice. The rooms are quite spacious and well-appointed. We stayed on the 26th floor and the water pressure was excellent! Though there was a small mix-up regarding some of the requests we had about our room, they were quickly fixed and the staff was extremely apologetic! I definately enjoyed our stay and would return. We did eat at Jade and thought that the food was mediocre and we will avoid it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tom2020
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the New Palazzo. March 23-26. Very easy parking if you have rental car. Have been to Vegas several times with rental car the Palazzo has to be the most easy in and out parking on the strip. Take elevator up and your right in the casino area or reception desk to check in. Check in area very impressive yet simple in design. One complaint would be no seating for people in party waiting for you to check in. Casino area is nice but plain in decoration. I guess they saved the budget for the hotel suites which were almost perfect. Still some construction going on, pool and spa not open, and other small areas under construction. Eat at Gran Lux for Breakfast, very large portions and price reasonable for a nice hotel. Most of thene shopping area connected to the Palazzo is open but the stores looked like they were sucking wind for business, all high end stores . Overall had a pleasant stay and would return if rates were under $250 price per night. Higher than that the service is good but to huge of a place to get the extra pampering you expect when your paying in the $300 range. P.S. Lossen the slots up a bit. Did not see many winners or excitment in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is awesome”
Reviews.Author: longtimereader
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great 5 day stay at the Palazzo in Vegas. We just encountered a few clitches due to it being so new. In an email I received from the Palazzo last month confirming our reservations, we were told one price for each night. When we arrived, the price was $50.00 more a night. I showed them the email and they checked it out and they did end up honoring the intial price after some time though. It was a real hassle from the get go. Another problem was not enough wash cloths. For two nights we had to call the front desk for wash cloths because they ran out. Something else to consider is the walk to the pool and spa area. Palazzo guest use the Venetian pool and spa and it is really quite a walk over. The staff was awesome everywhere though. Other than those few things everthing else was great, except for us not hitting it big.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgottfred
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and mother stayed for 4 nights from March 21 to March 25. Unlike some of the earlier reviews we found the hotel and service to be tremendous. There were few signs of construction still going on except for the pool 35 floors below us. They are obviusly in a hurry to finish this as they were working Easter Sunday. The rooms were wonderful with comfortable beds and a great couch. The strip view was beautiful at all times of the day or night. We loved the underground parking as it allows you to walk right into the casino and only a short walk to the room elevators. We parked on the P2 level and were never more than 30 feet from the escalator entrance. This was a blessing for my mother as she is not able to walk very far and is still too proud for a scooter. I would have no trouble recommending this hotel to others as it exceeded our hopes in almost every way. (except for the pool not being ready) Having stayed at The Venetian last year I found the decorating to be nicely understated compared to The Venetian. The TV's were great and did include quite a few HD channels.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: schplinky
Reviews.Content: We had read these reviews and were very nervous but we had a great stay. We booked through Priceline but were still upgraded to a view room that was bigger than our friend's (she checked in separately) and all in all, it was heaven. The amenities were plentiful and the only head-scratch moment was when we realized you couldn't see the tv in the bathroom from the tub, which would have been easy enough to do. You had to use the Venetian pool but the Palazzo one looks like it will be done any day now. They even had water in one or two of them. We ate at David Burke in the Venetian and I would really recommend it. It proves that food can be fun and tasty at the same time. the Palazzo casino is smallish and doesn't have nearly the foot traffic of the Venetian one, so it's actually very pleasant. The shopping is good and the Cafe Luxe offers a great value. We stayed at Palazzo on a splurge but would actually save our pennies and stay there again if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: JerryLosAngeles_Ca_
Reviews.Content: My two kids, husband & I stayed for one night because we flew in from Los Angeles to see the Beatles Love show at the Mirage. We enjoyed our stay at the Palazzo, and when we return to Las Vegas, we'll definitely stay there again. Its location is excellent for shopping if you don't want to spend time in casinos. (across the street from the mall) I would especially recommend this hotel to those who want a place that is a little bit more family friendly. Its less smokey, noisey and crowded than some other hotels. The entire experience (Beatles show & hotel stay) was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jillanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo March 14-16. Every staff member we dealt with was friendly and went above and beyond for us. If you want a guaranteed strip view they will charge extra, I believe $25 a day, I thought it was worth it. We had to call a maintenece man to our room for a incessant ticking which turned out to be something to do with the air conditioner, he was there in 20 minutes. We stayed up quite late one night and never left our room until it was time to leave for the fight at Manadalay Bay and requested a full clean from housekeeping and it was done with a turn down service as well. The pools are no where near done yet, I would think by summer maybe. We noticed some small areas that were already looking worn, the bench at the end of the bed should NOT have been covered in velour, leather yes. A little dusty and you notice it because all the wood is dark. Those glitches to me are minor, service was great would stay again. The gambling downstairs was good and the Grand Luxe cafe was a definite plus for us seeing as we never eat at normal times.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: PoppyG
Reviews.Content: I too approached a stay at the Palazzo with some trepidation having read these reviews but had a marvellous stay. The hotel is beautiful, very elegant and knocks spots off the Venetian. There were some teething problems, not all the facilities are yet open and the staff are still ironing out their 'creases' but on the whole I had an excellent time and was looked after really well. The rooms are a delight, and the location is perfect. I would definitely stay again. My room rate also offered excellent value. I moved from the Pallazo to the Paris (for a convention), which cost more and was terrible. Please try the Palazzo - you'll love it. And if you have any problems, tell the staff and they'll put things right straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ymid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new Palazzo during Easter break. Wonderful hotel still under construction. The room was huge, beautifully decorated and clean. Considering it was a holiday weekend, the hallways were quiet. The concierge could not have been more accomadating making dinner reservations for us. Had a room overlooking the Strip and Treasure Island so we had the lights at night and then in hte daytime the best view of Las Vegas. When we came back into the room at night, there were lights on, chocolates on the pillow, radio softly playing and the curtains were closed (turn down service). The personal service was excellent. Loved it and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: MissKris816
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay at this wonderful hotel. I could not believe the bad reviews regarding hotel staff, either. Everywhere that I turned, employees were going out of their way to say hello and made sure that I was well taken care of. I wasn't staying in the biggest suite either, I was just a regular customer who they treated with much respect. I'm not much of a gambler, so the size of the casino didn't bother me. However, if you want a large casino, it's best to walk over to the Venetian as the casino in The Palazzo is very small. I loved the decor in the halls and in the suites; very impressed! The beds were very soft and comfortable, just the way I like it. I appreciated the automatic shades/curtains which meant I never had to get out of the bed in the mornings/nights to open/close the curtains. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: wwendy481
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews of the Palazzo. However, the price we paid for a 4 night stay (arrived late Friday night and checked out Tuesday morning) was worth the imperfections. The room was a little dusty (appeared as if it was from construction) and the floor was not very clean upon check-in. However, after a call to the front desk, the floors were cleaned Saturday during the regular housekeeping. The rooms are really nice, including the tvs and bathroom. It is convenient because of the location. We did not have a problem with any of the staff during our stay. The only thing I was disappointed about was the lack of refrigerator space. We tried to put a bottle of water in there and must have bumped something and were charged $5 at check out, even though we did not use anything! As others have said, it is a new hotel that has some issues to be worked out. The hotel itself is beautiful. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: x025
Reviews.Content: Considering this was a 5 star hotel, I was expecting alot. I was upset to find the following on check-in: a dirty ice bucket, drapery that didn't work, dead flowers in the bathroom and a broken blow dryer. Other than that, the room was nice with 3 tvs, nice bedding and a comfortable sectional couch. The bedding for the sofa bed wasn't in the room and when we called to ask for it, it took over an hour for them to deliver it. The location is good, just across the street from the Fashion Show mall and Wynn and there's a walkway to both.

Reviews.Title: “The Palazzo was quite Pleasing!”
Reviews.Author: APEIS
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful stay at the Palazzo Hotel and Casino. I am generally very squeamish at hotels because I question the cleanliness of the facilities and tend to be a bit of a "neat freak". I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel and the beautiful hotel suite. The bedding looked crisp and fresh. The bathroom was clean and actually looked sanitary. The furnishings were in wonderful condition and there were no "odd stains and odors" in the room (don't laugh, you would be surprised about what some of those things are). I felt comfortable right away. The room was serviced at least twice a day, which is great to me! If you are a somewhat picky person about where you lay your head at night, as I am, then you'll be a happy camper at the Palazzo Hotel. Hopefully, this will continue to be the standard method of operation and not just a result of this being a new establishment. The hotel is still under construction, but the decor is beautiful and there are wonderful restaurants and lots of shops to visit. I would definitely recommend giving this hotel a try : - )

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: lannymarge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palazzo for 4 nights (March 10th-14th), while we were in Las Vegas for a large convention. We had originally booked at the Venetian, but were moved to the Palazzo. We arrived at 1 PM and were assigned a room at that time, and it was clean and ready for us. It was a 39th floor room overlooking the Wynn Hotel and the golf course. The room was very large and comfortable. Maid service was in the morning each day, and they also came in the evening to check that everything was OK. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. We ate breakfast and lunch at the Grand Lux Cafe- the food was very good and the portions were large.Some of the shops and restaurants were still under construction, but we ate at Emeril Legasse's Table 10 in the Palazzo and Delmonico Steakhouse in the Venetian, and the food and service were excellent.The pool at the Palazzo is still under construction, but my wife visited the pool at the Venetian (you are allowed to share the Venetian's facilities), and she enjoyed the pool area. We were very pleased with our stay, and will definitely go back to the Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and not so huge! Great security!”
Reviews.Author: MDUTravel
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and have seen lots of hotels in Vegas as well as other places, I went with a couple of friends and had the king bed room with the fold out sofa. The sofa bed was not comfortable, but we were lucky to have someone that can sleep anywhere. The rooms are a great size and we liked having the DVD player as well as the TV in the large bathroom, since one of my friends gets insomnia and was able to watch TV in there with out bothering the other 2 of us. I though the tub could have been a little nicer, as far as for the type of hotel that they are, should have sprung for the jacuzzi tubs, but that's just being picky, and wasn't that big of a deal. One thing I was REALLY impressed wth was the security- one of my friends stayed out later than us, and closed the door quietly when she got back in, not knowing it wasn't really shut all the way. The security people called us about an hour later to see if we wanted the door to be shut because they showed it was open and they had a security guard in the hall. Half asleep, I said yes! and moments later I heard it click. We had the inside "chain" on, so we were pretty safe, but that was above and beyond IMO. They also make you show your key to get to the elevators, which is kind of nice. Another thing I liked was how small it is there, you don't have to walk for miles to get to your room like most resorts in Vegas, so that was great. We liked being in that area of the strip as well. Overalla great stay, no problems with anything! I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HATEPALAZZO
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the new Palazzo hotel in Las Vegas, and my experience was TERRIBLE! The prices weren’t bad, but it was the filthiness of the hotel that made my stay despicable. There was blood on the walls, a porn dvd in the dvd player, dirty socks in the closet, bloody boogers on the wall, something really bloody (bloody tissue pieces?) in the sink, the shower fluctuated from hot to cold, dirty blankets, the staff was disgustingly unfriendly, and they publicize that they have soo many good shops, but when you go downstairs, there aren’t any! Everything is under construction. We tried to tell the staff about the filth, but they didn’t even attempt to listen. Even a motel in Vegas would beat the hygiene and staff friendliness of the Palazzo. Any hotel would be better than staying at the Palazzo, and I have stayed at many. I have never felt the need to write a review, but this hotel was so horrible that YOU NEED TO BE WARNED!! STAY AWAY FROM THE PALAZZO HOTEL!! FOR THE LOVE OF GOD!! PLEASE!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: mystiqkal
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a stay at the Palazzo with 9 girls and it was amazing. I got the vegas a few times a year and usually stay at the MGM but decided to try the palazzo since the rates are really cheap right now. the room was huge and perfect. the hotel was lovely and the service was one of the best i've ever gotten. Sure the hotel was still working out the kinks but honestly, there really wasnt anything to complain about. The only thing that was wrong with our room was the fact that the toilet paper holder was broken, but that was nothing. the hotel is a very short walk to the venetian and although they say the hotels are separate, it really just feels like the palazzo is another tower apart of the venetian. i will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo”
Reviews.Author: DollB83
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a surprise for me. My husband picked it out. It is beautiful. Our Room overlooked the Wynn Golf course, which was amazing. We had 3 LG flat panel TVs in our room. The staff were very helpful and polite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmcx2
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to the city, I must say that our 3 day stay at the Palazzo was absolutely fantastic. Yes, the hotel is still under construction, but the majority is well finished and beautiful. The casino itself was not smoky and stuffy like many in Vegas. The staff was quite pleasant and friendly. Housekeeping was prompt and excellent. Concierge was very helpful. Our suite was very brand new looking and the furnishings were top notch and modern. Love the layout and space! It was quiet and peaceful at night. The halls are beautiful, but low dim in lighting. Our view was not the best as we were overlooking some construction, but we had an excellent view of the attached Venetian. The bathrooms are beautiful with a flat screen TV, separate glass shower and garden tub and separate vanity. We also loved the 2 flat screen TVs in our suite. Worked out great since we had children who wanted to watch something different. Amenities in suite were like any other 5 star, are quite expensive. The beds were very comfortable, although I would have preferred a higher thread count on sheets for a smooth feel. I think they were the standard 200 thread count that you would expect at any hotel. Everything else was just grand. Food at the Grand Lux was GREAT! 40/40 Club is open now and more things are supposed to open this Spring. I would definitely stay here again especially to see the finished product!!! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gallaron
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in the Wynn which didn't have any rooms available so was booked into the Palazzo across the road. I was worried about it after reading the early reviews but was very happy with my stay. Had a really large room which overlooked the Wynn and their golf course. Didn't spend much time in the room but it would have been very comfortable space to hang out in. Bathroom was really nice as well. Can recommend the Grande Lux which had a good menu at reasonable prices. Several other dining options to suit bigger wallets! Room was extremely reasonable about $200+tax which was great value. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Palazzo for a stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Gorgeous Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: Wismergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palazzo for one night and we had 2 suites on Floor 43 with strip view. The view was great with the huge window but I don't think such a view is worth $50 extra, since the hotel is at the north end of the Strip. After all, it's not like the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood or Paris that has a stunning fountain view. It might be better if our rooms were facing south or on a lower floor. Ours were too high and we could only see the roofs of different buildings and construction sites. Although the hotel was only 2-month old, there were holes on the wall behind the door and underneath the TV, I guess they haven't finished the touch-up jobs yet. There was also a big scratch on the beautiful round table. Other than these minor problems, the room was gorgeous. The design, the furnishing and the room lay-out (especially the sunken living room) were better than the Bellagio deluxe rooms. The bathroom was very stylish and the toilet behind a closed door was great. The hotel corridors, the beautiful lobby with the waterfalls and the fountains were all very classy. Not sure why so many people had trouble with check-in. Ours was perfect and we got the keys to our 2 suites in less than 5 minutes, around 3 p.m. on a Sunday. There were at least 2 personnels in the lobby to direct guests to any available check-in counters and I felt welcome right at the minute I stepped in the Palazzo. Check-out was also smooth and the bills were all correct. The introductory hotel brochure with the room keys and hotel map neatly tucked in was most impressive. No other hotels in Vegas had such a great souvenir. I would gladly show the brochure to my friends & recommend Palazzo for their future stays in Vegas. Going to the Venetian was easy enough and the corridor was right behind the waterfalls. Elevators to the guest suites were easy to find and there was a security guard there to check your room keys. Parking access was the most convenient in Vegas, parking elevators was in the Casino 10 steps away from the guest elevators. There was also a parking escalator further down. Parking security guards were on patrol all the time. We felt safe staying there! The Casino (though not smoke-free like the corridors) was very spacious and the smell of smoke was minimal. We signed up to join the Players Club on-line and was each offered $15 free slots/table games. I would definitely stay at the Palazzo again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: whjSeattle
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I stayed there for a conference right before the meeting. As expected, there were some teething problems. Let's look at the good and the bad. Good: -The rooms were great. I had a room overlooking the Wynn that was well-designed and quite spacious. I don't know the maximum capacity, but it could have slept 4 comfortably. -The bed was great. As comfortable as a bed should be. -The trimmings throughout the hotel were excellent. The Bad: -Took a bath after a work out. Let the water out...and I can tell you I was not THAT dirty! The bathtub was filthy, as if I was rolling around in a construction site or a coal mine. I know new pipes sometimes have sediment, but please! Work it out. -Wanted into the minibar. It's electronic, and was electronically sealed for all time apparently. -The television was a nice plasma screen, yet there was no HD channels at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but needs some kinks worked out”
Reviews.Author: BabyJaneHudson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Palazzo after staying at their sister hotel for the last few years For four nights March 3 -7, 2008 We were pleasantly surprised to see that they put alot of thought into the design of their newest hotel. Parking was a breeze and the Front Desk was a short elevator ride and walk from rthe garage. An employee was stationed in the lobby to intercept incoming guests and steer them to the next available clerk. A breeze again! Front Desk Clerk was very friendly and competent. Lobby is beautiful but subdued in comparison to The Venetian which is not a bad thing just different. Elevator banks are all in the same general area and a guard is stationed there to check for keys and to keep the hallways safe. We reached our room on the 18t floor to discover difficulty opening the door with the electronic key. After four or five times we were successful. This problem plagued us for our four night stay. Room was decorated in European Contemporay, not one of my favorites but very nice none the less. Room was spotless! Bed was extremely comfortable, air conditioning worked great , motorized window coverings were a very nice touch of luxury especially in the morning when just waking. Flat screen Plasma TVs were perfect as was the smaller one in the bathroom which I had forgotten was in there until I saw the room - nice surprise! Only drawback was that someone using the bathtub would not be able to see the TV. Bathroom was perfectly appointed and luxurious. Movies were easy to order and can be operated much like a regular DVD also a nice touch. 30 or more cable channels, too! Some reviewers complained of noise but I only heard a door slam shut twice. In fact I commented to my partner how quiet the room was! Room safe was easy to operate and larger than usual. Mini-Bar is to be avoided unless you want to spend a fortune. One reviewer complained that if you move any of the items in the bar you will be charged, well - DUH! Of course, you will, it's pressure sensitive. Read the price list first. For the business traveler, the office was well appointed although I did not try the WiFi so can not review. Now, for the few thngs that need some ironing out.. We ordered a fridge for medicine as we were checking in. It did not arrive. We called down to see if they knew why the delay and they did not have the order for one. It seems the Front Desk fields all calls for various depts which ends up with miscommunications between the various departments. This same problem showed up regarding the lock problem. A bit frustrating. Housekeepers each have a large # of rooms to clean and ours was cleaned later in the afternoon. Also frustrating if you want to nap before dinner. On the other hand, the housekeepers and all staff are friendly and try to do all they can for you. The only other thing worth noting is their ventilation system...we were constantly smelling grilled steak when we entered the room (!). Not an unpleasant steak smell but a bit inappropriate for our room. LOL . You quickly adjusted to the smell and do not notice it, though, until you leave and come back. Video check out was not working but this gave us the opportunity to voice our concerns with the various problems to the Front Desk in person. They seemed genuinely concerned and wrote everything down to pass to their manager. But, even with these problems we would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat. They will iron out the kinks in short time, I'm sure. We left feeling refreshed and renewed - ev erything a vacation is supposed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Fantastic Hotel, Beautiful Casino”
Reviews.Author: MikeEsq
Reviews.Content: Wary because of comments and reviews related to the "newness" of the hotel, we considered changing our reservation. I am glad that we did not. Hotel concierge arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport, and the moment I turned on my phone on the airplane he was calling to let us know where to meet. Check in was a breeze and our room was conveniently located to friends of ours who checked in four hours earlier. The room is the reason you stay here. The sunken living room and spacious suite is like a new, crisper version of the Venetian suites. Three TV's and very comfortable furnishings. King size bed was great. And in very Vegas fashion, you can blackout every ray of light and sleep whenever as if it were midnight. The casino was wide open and spacious. Not the place to go for young singles looking to meet and no bachelor parties or the like. It was less smoke-filled and less crowded than the Venetian which was easily accessed. I enjoyed having our home base be a more mellow version of the Venetian. Dos Caminos, the Mexican restaurant from NYC is located in the casino at the base of the guest elevators, and, although expensive, is fantastic for Margaritas, 140 tequilas, and food. The signature guacamole is as good as you hope. Access to the restaurants and shows at the Venetian and Wynn was very easy. The coffee bar, Espressamente Illy, was easy to access, quick with service, and fantastic espresso. I would recommend breakfast at Bouchon, which is on the tenth floor lobby of the Venezia tower of the Venetian and accessible with your Palazzo key card. My wife loved the spa at the Venetian, which you can access via corridor in Palazzo or through the Venetian. Pool and spa at the Palazzo are not complete, but construction never annoyed us on floor 27. No sportsbook yet, atlhough they have a sportsbook counter outside of Jay Z's 40/40 club. Venetian sportsbook is good, not great. Worth watching a game or taking a tour during the day in Jay Z's bar. I did not go back during "clubbing" hours. Check out was a breeze, as well, and they held our bags at departure valet until we left for the airport. When we claimed the bags, they asked about our flight and let us bypass the line for a cab by pulling one off of the cab line. Seems like whatever kinks they had are being worked out. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “top notch rooms”
Reviews.Author: xkaay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the palazzo at the end of february into beginning of march for 4 nights.. the hotel itself is pretty boring compared to other hotels, but the room we stayed in (bella suite) was absolutely top notch. 3 plasma tvs (1 in living room, 1 in sleep area and 1 in bathroom)... the bathrooms don't lock which was strange i thought, but didn't cause too much inconvenience. there was a strange smell on couple of nights of which we couldn't figure out the source of, but it wasn't something that bothered us too much.. and didn't linger. beds are absolutely heavenly. as are the couches!! so comfortable! free copy and printer. fax at a small cost. wirelss at a small cost. Morels steakhouse was superb. higher price, but we were stuffed and content at the end of the night. grand luxe cafe, lower price, HUGE portions. we just peeked into 40/40, very cool! if we had more time we would have stuck around... i would rent a car definitely...so convenient. for all the asian food lvoers, "china town" is literally 3 minutes by car from palazzo. great food there too if you tire of the vegas strip buffets... all in all thumbs up for palazzo! (request room close to elevators.. we had the one at the END of the hallway. it felt like a mile long walk at times. esp when tired)

Reviews.Title: “Service, location, large suite”
Reviews.Author: CheapTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo for one night in late February. Our suite, 15-908, looked over the Venetian and had a side view of the Strip. The suite was massive - the living area had a table with chairs, desk, and sectional sofa. The large bathroom had a double sink, vanity, tv, and tub and shower large enough for two. I would not recommend the average suite for those disabled - the living area was sunken with two steps down. I am certain they have suites for for the disabled - just be sure to mention this at the time of reservation. We ate at a variety of restaurants in the Shoppes at Palazzo and the Grand Canal Shoppes at the Venetian. Palazzo is connected to the Venetian near St. Mark's Square at the Venetian. Most restaurants and shops are over priced, but what isn't in Vegas anymore? The front desk and bell desk were lovely. American lost our luggage and the bell desk delivered it within 5 minutes of their call. I was impressed with the size of the room and bathroom and the professionalism by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “All expectations met...”
Reviews.Author: Sactoresident
Reviews.Content: About 2 years ago, I stayed at the Venetian and loved it. So when Bette Midler came to Las Vegas, it was a chance to try out the new Palazzo. It was wonderful. The hotel lobby looks like a movie set with the all the marble and high, high ceilings. Maid service came twice day. Connection to the Venetian via the Canal shops and the main 1st. floor corridor made it very convenient. Access to the Venetian spa was not included (the Palazzo spa is not yet completed), but the $29 a day charge was offset by a $20 food credit good at most of the Venetian restaurants plus 2 passes to the Guggenheim Mus. and the Wax Museum. The best room rate was on the hotel's web site. Two days before we left, I got an e-mail advertising a room with a view for the same price - I called and got the upgrade. The reservation staff was always very helpful and very polite. My only negative comments are the TV in the bathroom could not be seen while soaking in the tub and none of the lights had dimmers on them - they were either on and bright or off. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost there....”
Reviews.Author: Kitty6761
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo from February 27-March 2 in a Luxury Suite with a view. Overall we were very pleased with the accomodations-comfortable beds, large soaking tub, separate room for the toilet, remote controlled blinds and 3 TV's. A few comments- Check-in was a little slow as we were the woman's first customer. She lacked some of the personality and professionalism of other hotels, but it took less than 10 minutes. Automatic checkout was not available so it required us to go the front desk. Not a huge deal, but it did take a while. We didn't have a remote for the TV in the bathroom making it very difficult to use. Housekeeping was very slow...not getting to clean our room until nearly 4:30pm. At which point we told them we only wanted towels-3 knocks on the door later we had them. Vase in our room was filled with water, but no flowers. There isn't a coffee shop open yet near the rooms. We had to walk to the shoppes...nearly 10 minutes away. That should be resolved soon as I think a coffee shop is being built Grand Lux was wonderful...highly recommend the Cedar Planked BBQ salamon. Overall, we had a very nice stay at the Palazzo. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Standards ??? Loved the Palazzo 18th-22nd Feb 2008”
Reviews.Author: Slainte68
Reviews.Content: Well after reading many of the reviews, just checked my "photos" and bill to confirm it was the Palazzo my fiancee and I spent 4 wonderful nights in last month, on our 1st visit to Las Vegas After 2 nights at another wonderful hotel in Chicago we arrived at the Palazzo about 3pm. Our bags were taken from the taxi and tagged to be sent up to our room and we were escorted to the vast check - in area which was quiet. Robert who checked us in gave us a wonderful room on the 36th floor ( more later) before leaving he gave us so much information about the Palazzo and the Venetian and offered to make dinner reservations if required. We had to walk through the casino to get to the guest lifts both of us thought "wow" can't wait to get back down. Upon entering the room on the 36th floor the first thing to greet us was the view over the top of TI and the mountains in the distance, we both thought the suite was so well laid out with ample space more than a "home from home" ( 3 flat screen tvs added to the experience). bed so so comfortable and loads of room. We slept with the blind and curtains open was so nice to drift off to sleep with the Vegas lights and wake as daylight lit up the city. Pat from guest services arrived soon afterwards with our bags, he also gave us a brief rundown on where to go outside of the hotel, bars resturants etc. We ventured down to the casino and just after we positioned ourselves at the slots we were Approached by a cocktail waiteress to take our drinks order, this was the same throughout our stay whatever machine or table we were playing and both enjoyed a couple of bloody marys each morning before heading out to breakfast !!! We ate in the mexican resturant between both hotels on the 1st evening wonderful meal with wine and tequilas about $80, also had breakfast in the GrandLux ( Palazzo Casino)one morning on way home from an all nighter out at Freemount Street. All staff encountered we found to be very professional and helpful had room service twice breakfast on the 1st morning brought to room within 20 mins of order and a late night snack which came within half an hour.................. Hotel felt a bit more exclusive than the others we walked through during our stay and we will be returning in the future.......... Didn't notice much construction during our stay except on the pool area and grounds which we couldn't avoid looking down on from our wonderful view !!! Don't have doubts book the Palazzo still with in walking distance of the hustle and bustle mid -strip and did enjoy the location with the Wynn beside us and the Fashion Mall directly opposite!!! Viva Las Vegas, Viva the Palazzo

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: j9999
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay March 1-5 I was concerned about booking here after I read the less than stellar reviews on this site but the hotel was great. The hotel is gorgeous. I upgraded to a bigger suite which was amazing. The beds are comfy. The bathroom awesome. The toiletries in the bathroom are 5 star as are the three flat screens in the room. The service was also great. Check in, out, bellmen, maids, casino, room service were all perfect. We did have a small problem with billing on the credit card but it was resolved perfectly. The location of the hotel is great. connected to venetian, the convention center and just a short little walk to the wynn, mirage, treasure island and the fashion show mall. We ate at David Burke and mario batalli in the complex and both were excellent. Now, there are some things that the website won't tell you.. 1. The hotel is not finished. The pool is not done nor is the spa. I did not hear any construction noise but this could be an issue if you are going for this. 2. Jersey Boys is also advertised but does not start unitl later in the year. 3. Many of the shops in the palazzo are also not open yet and it is quite dead around there. HOWEVER, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Blow your money in a casino, not this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ubergirl17
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a luxury hotel where we could enjoy staying when we weren't gambling. We decided on the Palazzo since it had just opened and was supposed to be one of the new great places to stay on the Strip. The suite was large with a comfortable bed and a wall-sized window that let in lots of light. Unfortunately, the couch cushions were already stained (something stayed in Vegas!), the dressing table was falling apart, lightbulbs were burned out, and a mirror in the hallway shattered while we were there. And this in a hotel that has been open less than two months! What really bothered me was the service. After being out of our room for 11 hours on a day trip, we got back to find that housekeeping still hadn't cleaned our room! I can live with rumpled towels and sheets, but for the rate we paid, I expect that housekeeping will have at least knocked on my door sometime before noon. While we were getting ready for dinner, turndown service arrived--presumably to turndown our unmade bed. I complained to the manager who comped us $50 food/beverage, which was nice, but I would have preferred a clean room that wasn't falling apart. If you are looking for a luxury hotel and especially if you are paying up, do not waste your time or money at the Palazzo. Go to the Wynn or Four Seasons. If you are looking for a mid or up scale hotel, you can probably do better on price at any number of other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo--Nothing But Class!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel094
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many different hotels in Vegas over the years--the Palazzo is the "best"--very classy. Donna at the front desk was very courteous and helpful--they really make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: daisydewdrop
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms - lobby, room and maid service very good despite the mammoth size of this hotel. Just the perfect Vegas weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for early risers”
Reviews.Author: bcbiz
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel through priceline, probably because it is brand new. It's actually a new tower/hotel of the Venetian complex. We were in Vegas for a romantic away-from-the-kids weekend and it was perfect for us. The rooms are VERY nice. One of the staff members told us that they are actually the same throughout all three Venetian properties, just with different color schemes. There were three flat screen tv's including one in the bathroom. Since the Palazzo spa is still under construction, guests use Venetian spa, which was great. We had excellent service the entire time, which is amazing. Usually you have one bad event or experience during a stay, but really it was fantastic. The restaurants are wonderful, with one exception. We went to Jay Z's place, club 40/40 which is advertised as a sports bar, but it's really a nightclub. I have no idea why they're open for lunch. We were the only people there, which kind of creeped us out so we left before eating. They really only have bar food. All the other places we ate (Dos Caminos, carne vino, Cafe Lux) were wonderful. We only heard noise from the construction a couple of times and it was quite faint. Unfortunately, one time it was at 7:30am on Saturday morning. It didn't bother us because we were already up getting ready to go workout, but I know that it would have annoyed some people. In fact, they very nice girl at the front desk of the spa noted that she gets a lot of complaints about noise from people staying in the Palazzo tower. (She was surprised that we were so happy.) I didn't hear any noise on Sunday morning and we did sleep in a little later.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness a real issue”
Reviews.Author: mmdawson
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Las Vegas, where I stayed in the new Palazzo hotel. While I thoroughly enjoyed my visit, I found some things that don't normally correlate with a 5 star hotel. I would like to stress that the service was fabulous. Upon check-in, we found the following things: The room was quite dusty, most notable were the wood surfaces. The bathroom sinks were not cleaned, and the mirrors were smudged. There was a spill of some sort on the granite separating the bedroom and the living area. There was a white stain on the chair beside the bed- we have no clue if it is what we thought it might be, but we were not going to touch it. The toilet had a small leak from the intake pipe. There was usually a small puddle in the water closet. The flower vase by the bathroom sink was half full of water with no flower (I really did not care about this, but it seemed odd to have water in a flower vase and no flowers). The light switch in the water closet had no cover to it- just the switch with it's metal components hanging out. The windows were very smudged with fingerprints and face prints. Not until the second night of our stay did we get turndown service. On the second day, it seems as though the cleaning service did dust and clean the granite. Now, mind you, I had a great time at the hotel, and it is very beautiful with a great selection of shops and restaurants. I was just surprised about these details in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo - Great will become Magnificient soon...”
Reviews.Author: kash1121
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights over Valentines Day at the Palazzo, two nights for business and two nights for pleasure with my girlfriend... Overall, it was a great experience... The hotel is beautiful, one of the more striking properties on the strip, with a luxurious lobby and polished atmosphere. The rooms are huge - more than 700 sq ft come standard, and the floorplans are very cool... I walked in to a long room, with a bathroom off the entry way, followed by the bedroom area, followed by a short step-down to a 'living area.'... the bathroom was perfect, classy and clean with separate toilet and bathing areas.. the bed was comfortable... the living space was the best, a long L-shaped couch and a view of the strip below... of course views very, but i think its worth it to ask and/or tip the front desk clerk for a strip view because you have the lights at night, and the mountains by day... we were on the 43rd floor and the view was amazing. This hotel has all the potential to become 'excellent' on these ratings after the early growing pains are worked out...
