While the staff was courteous and hardworking, there were some slip ups and slow downs... mostly with room service (breakfast never showed up one morning) and taxi's/car service... either they need more staff or just need to get the respective systems up and running more efficiently... if you're traveling there in the near future, be prepared for longer than usual waits to call the concierge or inroom dining, but revel in the largest standard rooms (suites) on the strip to get over your anger... I've stayed at the Bellagio, THE Hotel, MGM, and the suites in Luxor, and I'd put Palazzo at the top of the list for accomodations... the size is great, the location is good, and the quality is top notch... Bellagio has a bit better location and it has the fountains outside and the Bellagio-aura... THE Hotel has rooms that are just as cool and big, but feels more like NYC than Vegas, and is a bit too far down the strip for my liking... I recommend this hotel. Looking forward to go back again in a few months. $

Reviews.Title: “Great, but still have things to work out”
Reviews.Author: kalian7
Reviews.Content: I had some troubles dragging my bags up to the lobby and wasn't offered any help; however, I noticed that no one else appeared to have that problem so I'm assuming there is normally someone around. I definitely felt welcomed upon check-in and was impressed with the decor of the hotel. My room was laid out very similar to the Venetian, but I felt the Palazzo rooms were more "plush." I was very impressed to see a "business center" within the room that offered free printing - a definite plus! When I came back to my room the following day I noticed all of my amenities had been straightened and set out nicely on the counter top - it's the little things like that that I really appreciate at hotels. The bed and linens were both great, and I found the couch's to be very comfortable as well. I ate at the Grand Luxe cafe several times and was impressed each time. I also tried the Mexican restaurant that is in the hotel - I highly suggest the guacamole! At check-out the hotel offered to check me into my flight and printed my boarding pass. Definitely a great experience, but the hotel is still new and should value the suggestions of the guests a bit more than I felt they did.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous”
Reviews.Author: perryb6
Reviews.Content: We booked on the concierge level and stayed 4 nights . Our room was very nice and clean but the shower was not working properly it would run hot and cold .One time nearly burning me,I had to jump out so not to get burned .We asked to get it fixed but they never did and we had to put up with cold showers .We also asked for them to finish installing the safety lock on the door ,they never did .My wife left her washed work out gear in a towel to dry and they took it .We asked several times to get it back ,but never did see her clothes again . The lounge was beautiful with amazing views, very good service .The Breakfast and lunch food service was very disappointing and you cannot get any wine or drinks until 5 pm .The evening food service is very good. Now for something outrageous .The lounge is over 10,000 sq ft and has several areas with televisions. We were in a small room watching the Oscars as were other people throughout the lounge .We had been there for a couple of hours when a manager comes in and says we could not watch the Oscars and they were only allowed to let people watch Fox News .She then changed the channel and did the same on every TV. People were outraged ,I asked for the hotel manager but all they could find was a front office manager who backed up the Assistant Manager Angel.I even found the staff laughing about it .For $600 a night I expect more .We were told if we wanted to watch the Oscars go to your room .One couple even checked out of the Hotel. What the hotel gained I have no idea .I left messages for 2 managers and have not heard back from them .This seems to be normal for this hotel according to other reviewers .I for one will not stay here again .There business slogan is “Our Palazzo is your Palazzo” what a joke.

Reviews.Title: “No Star Service”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest999
Reviews.Content: NO STAR SERVICE. Next time I will stay at the Wynn where they know how to run a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, service problems”
Reviews.Author: HillmanDC
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Palazzo. Summary - beautiful hotel, will be great when their service issues are resolved. Sister hotel to the Venetian. I felt like the Palazzo was a nicer version of the Venetian - a bit more upscale, with more attention to design detail. Unusual moment - finding used condoms and a bed obviously used recently for sex upon check-in. Beautiful rooms. The design is great - the living area is sunken two steps down from the bed and bath area. This really makes it feel like separate rooms. Beautifully done - surprisingly tasteful. The casino areas are possibly the nicest in town. Very light and open, beautifully done. Really terrific designs. The only problem was service. I know this is a new hotel. But their website doesn't indicate that some amenity areas aren't done yet. Specifically, the elaborate pool / jacuzzi / wading areas aren't done. True, not an issue in colder weather, but it would have been nice to know that before booking. You can I guess use the facilities at the Venetian, but that's quite a trek. There is only one functioning Palazzo pool, and you must pay $35 to get a spa pass to use that pool. When the pool area is done it will be spectacular. It's on a rooftop a few floors up, and it's going to be astoundingly nice. And many of the shops advertised aren't open yet. Not a huge deal, but it would have been nice if they'd say this on the website. Their WIFI / high speed internet service was dreadful. Paid $10 a day to use, and it was very unreliable. I called to ask for someone to look at it, but was put on hold for about 15 minutes before I gave up. And forget about using their fax / printer (which looks quite nice). Since you can't get a decent internet signal you can't download the variety of drivers and software needed to use the printer / fax. But biggest problem? We reserved a king size bed with a view (the view is an upcharge). When we got there they told us they only had one that was smoking but they assured us it would not smell like smoke. Turns out it did. But even worse was that there were used condoms in the trash can and the bed had obviously recently been used for sex, and hadn't been cleaned afterward. Oddly, parts of the room had been cleaned. I think maybe hotel staff had used the room for a little sexual liason after it had been cleaned maybe the day before. We called the front desk, and they gave us a bit of attitude, as if somehow it was our fault and/or that they didn't believe us. They did swap us out for a room with two queen beds, with a view. So in short we never got exactly the room we had reserved. This was mid-week and the hotel didn't appear that busy, so I highly suspect they make only a certain number of each type room available if you book through Travelocity or such. After our little condom adventure I would have thought they would be willing to be a bit flexible on this, but apparently not. Tip: definitely get the view upgrade - well worth it to be able to see the sunsets over the mountains. Tip: All the restaurants but one in this hotel are expensive fine dining, with an odd overabundance of steak and seafood joints (Morel, in the main lobby, appears to be the best of the bunch, and a bit less pricey). The Grand Lux is more moderately priced, and we had several good meals there. I believe it's owned by the Cheesecake Factory folks (yes, I know, a bit suspect, but it was actually very good and has a very extensive menu). The shrimp scampi was great, with huge shrimp. The spicy bloody mary was very good also. There is another Grand Lux in the Venetian next door. The new one in the Palazzo looks neater, with some really great design details. Very good restaurant service. All in all, if they get their service act together it'll be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “palazzo 2/15-2/19”
Reviews.Author: jeanc1027
Reviews.Content: Was a little on the quiet side and the front lobby is not very grand; however, found the service to be much better/friendlier than Bellagio. Booked a Bella Suite (dble qn) was spacious and there was adequate lighting as compared to Bellagio's standard room which was really dark. Everything worked, rooms were always cleaned and turn down service nightly. Best of all was Emeril's restaurant, Table 10. Food and service was excellent w/o the stuffiness. Had a stuffed lobster dish that was out of this world. One of our entrees was later in coming and the manager came over and comped it! Nice. Saw "O", this time from a higher view (last time was in the front wet row), different perspective, still a good show, awesome stage. Bellagio's buffet was still way better than Paris'. Tried Cathay House, chinese restaurant recommended by others on this site, was ok, would try the another in chinatown next time.

HotelInfo.Name: The Palazzo Resort Hotel Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 3255 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
